name: Rilke-Westhoff, Clara
item_t: Die Bildhauerin Clara Rilke-Westhoff, 1878-1954 : Leben und Werk (mit Oeuvre-Katalog).
author: Sauer, Marina
public_note:
The introductory texts include a biography, an essay on the society of women artists at the turn of the twentieth century, and an analysis of the work.  There are commentaries on problems and the state of the research on the artist.  

There are lists of personal names, images, and abbreviations.

name: Rho, Manlio
item_t: Rho : catalogo generale.
author: Caramel, Luciano
public_note:
After the introduction, there is a catalogue raisonné, followed by sections dealing with textile designs, graphic designs, and projects for interiors, exhibition displays, and architecture. 

The appendix includes writings by the artist and interviews.

name: Ribalta, Francisco
item_t: Ribalta y los ribaltescos : la evolución del estilo barroco en Valencia.
author: Kowal, David M.
public_note:
This is related to the author's 1981 doctoral thesis titled "Francisco Ribalta and his Followers," presented at the University of Michigan (also published in the Garland series "Outstanding Dissertations in the Fine Arts", New York, 1985)  

This revised Spanish version is an updated and greatly expanded edition of the catalogue raisonné.

name: Réquichot, Bernard
item_t: Bernard Réquichot.
author_s:
Barthes, Roland                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Billot, Marcel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pacquement, Alfred
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné follows the introductory texts includes an essay on Réquichot's art, a a discussion of his writings, and documents.  

After the artist's death, an estate stamp was affixed to unsigned works. The authenticity of unsigned and unstamped works was determined by the authors of the catalogue.

name: Révoil, Pierre-Hen
item_t: Fleury Richard et Pierre Révoil : la peinture troubadour.
author: Chaudonneret, Marie-Claude

name: Riley, Bridge
item_t: Bridget Riley : Complete Prints 1962-2012.
author_s:
Hartley, Craig                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            MacRitchie, Lynne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schubert, Karsten
public_note: This is the fourth, expanded edition of the catalogue raisonné of Riley's prints (for the earlier editions, see entries in this database).

name: Riley, Bridge
item_t: Bridget Riley, The Complete Paintings.
author_s:
Kudielka, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tommasini, Alexandra                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Naish, Natalia
imprint: London : Bridget Riley Art Foundation : Thames  & Hudson, 2018.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné traces all of Riley's approximately 650 known paintings from the late 1940s until 2017.  The individual entries include materials, dimensions, provenance, and exhibition history.  Each work is represented with a full page color illustration.

name: Riley, Bridge
item_t: Bridget Riley : Complete Prints 1962-2001
author_s:
Hartley, Craig (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            MacRitchie, Lynn (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schubert, Karsten (c.r.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Arts Council of England; Hayward Gallery
imprint: London : Ridinghouse in collaboration with Hayward Gallery, London, 2002.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition. Further revised editions were published:  the second  in 2005, "Bridget Riley : Silkscreen Prints and Gouaches, 1963-2004" (also on the occasion of an exhibition),  as well as a third in 2010, "Bridget Riley : Complete Prints : 1962-2010").

name: Trumbull, John
item_t: The Works of Colonel John Trumbull : Artist of the American Revolution.

name: Toledo, Juan Antonio

                                                            Kosme de Barañano                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moreno Garcerán, Arturo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Llorens, Tomás
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of paintings executed from 1964-1981, with most works illustrated in color. The publication does not include set designs, which will be the subject of a separate publication. English and Valencian translations of the texts are at the back of the catalogue.

name: Tomaso da Modena
item_t: Tomaso da Modena : Painting in Emilia and the March of Treviso, 1340-80.
author: Gibbs, Robert
imprint: Cambridge ; New York : Cambridge University Press, 1989.
public_note: The catalogue gives information on location, title, medium, dimensions, signature, date, references, provenance, and condition information. There are sections dealing with works closely associated with the artist, rejected works, and Modena's pattern book housed in the Pierpoint Morgan Library.

name: Trumbull, John
item_t: The Works of Colonel John Trumbull, Artist of the American Revolution.
author: Sizer, Theodore
public_note: The catalogue contains appendices regarding the artist's prices, procedure, variations of the American flag, etc.

name: Tsukioka Yoshitosh
item_t: Catalogue Raisonné of the Work of Tsukioka Yoshitoshi (1839-1892).
author_s:
Chiappa, J. Noel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Levine, Jason M.
cronology: The website provides information on the artist's signatures and seals.  It also contains a biography, a list of Yoshitoshi's students, publishers, printers, and carvers.  Most works are illustrated with scalable color images.
ind_entr_cont: Catalogue of the woodblock prints arranged by series (indexed by English and Japanese titles).  A number of entries are listed in draft form.
public_note: check_needed

name: Toledo, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Toledo.
author_s:
Monrroy Valentino, Carlos (coord.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calderón, Cándida Fernández de (ed.)b&w, color                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Coronel Rivera, Juan Rafael

name: Tooker, George
item_t: George Tooker.
author: Garver, Thomas H.
public_note: This is a revised and expanded edition of the author's 1985 monograph on the artist with a The publication includes a biography on Tooker, a discussion of his graphic works, and an essay on his studio and working methods.

name: Zoppo, Marco
item_t: Marco Zoppo
author: Ruhmer, Eberhard
public_note: A monograph with a catalogue raisonné apparatus, illustrating almost all the paintings and drawings. The chronology has been perhaps superceded (v. Lilian Amstrong's dissertation, cited in this database).

name: Zumthor, Pete
item_t: Peter Zumthors : Buildings and Projects.
public_note:
The monograph was published in three separate language editions: English, German, French.  

In addition to the catalogue of works, the publication includes texts by Zumthors, a biography of the architecht, and lists of his collaborators from 1985-2013.

name: Zuloaga, Ignacio
item_t: The Life and Work of Ignacio Zuloaga.
author: Lafuente Ferrari, Enrique
public_note: This is the English translation of the 3rd, augmented edition of Lafuente Ferrari's "La vida y el arte de Ignacio Zuloaga" (1990).  The first edition was published in 1950 (San Sebastián: Editora Internacional).

name: Zuloaga, Ignacio
item_t: La vida y el arte de Ignacio Zuloaga.
author: Lafuente Ferrari, Enrique
public_note: There have been several revised editions issued (1972, 1990) since the 1950 publication (See entries cited in this database).

name: Zoppo, Marco
item_t: The Paintings and Drawings of Marco Zoppo.
author: Armstrong, Lilian
public_note: The catalogue includes paintings, drawings, miniatures, lost works, and rejected attributions. In comparison with Eberhard Ruhmer's earlier monograph (cited in this database), the author has revised some of the attributions for the paintings, has been less inclusive for the drawings, and has revised the chronology.

name: Zuloaga, Ignacio
item_t: La vida y el arte de Ignacio Zuloaga.
author: Lafuente Ferrari, Enrique
public_note: In addition there are signature samples, a few sculptural works, a bibliography, and several indices.

name: Zorn, Ande

author: Delteil, Loys

                                                            Brummer, Hans Henrik (pref.)

author: Asplund, Karl

name: Zorn, Ande

author: Gere, J.A.
public_note: The chronology also includes dates related to Taddeo Zuccaro's brother, the artist Federico Zuccaro.

name: Zuñiga, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Zúñiga : catálogo razonado = Catalogue Raisonné. Vol. IV: Dibujos = Drawings, 1971-1989. v.4
imprint: Mexico : Albedrío : En asociación con Fundación Zúñiga Laborde, 2006.
public_note: Vol. 4 continues the study of the artist's drawings, and also contains errata for vols. 1&2.

name: Zuñiga, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Zúñiga : catálogo razonado = Catalogue Raisonné. Vol. III: Dibujos = Drawings, 1927-1970.
author: Zúñinga, Ariel
imprint: Mexico : Albedrío : En asociación con Fundación Zúñiga Laborde, 2006.
public_note: Volume Three of the four-part catalogue on the artist's work. This volume begins the study of his drawings.

name: Zuñiga, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Zúñiga : catálogo razonado = Catalogue Raisonné. Vol. II: Pinturas al óleo, estampas y reproducciones =  Oil Paintings, Prints and Reproductions, 1927-1986,
imprint: Mexico : Albedrío : En asociación con Fundación Zúñiga Laborde, 2003.
public_note: Vol. Two (Complete paintings, printed works, and reproductions) of the four-part catalogue, covering  the entire oeuvre of the artist. This volume has  a concordance to the first study of the artist's graphic work published by Jerry Brewster in 1984 , v. "Zuñiga the Complete Graphics, 1972-1984", cited in this database.

name: Zuñiga, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Zúñiga : catálogo razonado = Catalogue Raisonné. Vol.I. Escultura = Sculpture 1923-1993.
author: Zúñiga, Ariel
imprint: Mexico : Albedrío : En  asociación con Fundación Zúñiga Laborde, 1999.
public_note: Vol. I (Sculpture), first volume in a four part catalogue, covering the entire oeuvre of the artist.

name: Torres García, Joaquín
item_t: Joaquín Torres-García Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Torres, Cecilia de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Temkin, Susanna V.
cronology: The catalogue is organized chronologically, but can be searched via keyword, medium, location, subject, and other rubrics. Titles are given in a variety of languages (Catalan, English, Spanish, French & Italian) depending on where the work was produced.
ind_entr_cont: Individual catalogue entries contain title,  dimensions, inscription and signature information, provenance, date, references, and links to related works. All works are illustrated with scalable images.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Zuccarelli, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Zuccarelli.
author: Spadotto, Federica

name: Zurbarán, Francisco de

name: Zurbarán, Francisco de
item_t: Zurbarán 1598-1664.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné itself provides basic information on the works: title, dimensions, location, comments, and bibliographic references.
public_note: Bibliog.; Comments

name: Ribalta, Juan
item_t: Ribalta y los ribaltescos : la evolución del estilo barroco en Valencia.
author: Kowal, David M.
public_note:
This is related to the author's 1981 doctoral thesis titled "Francisco Ribalta and his Followers," presented at the University of Michigan (also published in the Garland series "Outstanding Dissertations in the Fine Arts", New York, 1985)  

This revised Spanish version is an updated and greatly expanded edition of the catalogue raisonné.

name: Ribas, Felipe de
item_t: Los Ribas, un taller andaluz de escultura del siglo XVII.
author: Dabrio González, Maria Teresa
imprint: Cordoba : Monte de Piedad y Caja de Ahorros de Córdoba, 1985.
public_note:
Following lengthy introductory materials, including a discussion of the Ribas family of sculptors (Gaspar, Felipe, and Francisco Dionisio), the publication includes separate catalogues raisonnés of Felipe de Ribas and Francisco Dionisio de Ribas.  There is also a bibliography and several indices.

The illustrations are not cross-referenced to the text, which makes the catalogue somewhat difficult to use.

name: Zurbarán, Francisco de

                                                            Wildenstein Institute

public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Zoppo, Agostino
item_t: Agostino Zoppo.
public_note: Published in the series: "Cuius auctor Deus ipse, studi sulla scultura italiana", l.  The catalogue of the sculptures is divided into categories: bronzes, monuments, statues, heads after the antique, and portraits (including monuments with portraits).

name: Zontal, Jorge
item_t: General Idea : Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné : Multiples and Prints, 1967-1993.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 163 graphic works by General Idea.  The publication includes the author's interview with General Idea.

author_s:
Manners, Lady Victoria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Williamson, George Charles
imprint: London : John Lane : The Bodley Head ; New York : John Lane Company, 1920.
public_note: This is essentially a monograph with a list of engravings after Zoffany's original paintings. The publication includes genealogical tables, a copy of Zoffany's last will and testament, a list of pictures and personal effects from his posthumous sale, and other documents related to his life and works.

name: Zobernig, Heimo
item_t: Heimo Zobernig, Books & Posters : Catalogue Raisonné 1980-2015.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published on the occasion of a 2016 exhibition held at Malmö Konsthall in Malmö, Sweden.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes texts by the artist, and name, institution and place indices.

name: Zontal, Jorge
item_t: General Idea : Editions, 1967-1995.
author: Fischer, Barbara (ed.)
imprint: Mississauga, Ont. : Blackwood Gallery, University of Toronto at Mississauga, 2003.

name: Zoff, Alfred

public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Museum Morsbroich, Leverkusen and several other German venues. The catalogue raisonné lists all 234 woodcuts executed from 1985-2000.

item_t: Bernd Zimmer : Bilder auf Leinwand : Werkverzeichnis 1976-2010.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné presents approximately 2,200 paintings by the artist.  The DVD contains digital images of the artist's works.

author: Miquel, Pierre

item_t: Herbert Zangs : Werkmonographie.
public_note: The catalogue was published for an exhibition held at the Skulpturenmuseum Glaskasten Marl and four other venues in 1997.  The book is divided chronologically by decade with texts discussing the objects.  In addition, it includes texts about Zangs written by his contemporaries.

name: Zabaleta, Rafael

author: Guzmán Pérez, María Fuesanta
imprint: Córdoba : Publicaciones del Monte de Pieded y Caja de Ahorros de Córdoba, 1985.

name: Zadkine, Ossip
item_t: Zadkine.
author: Jianu, Ionel

Essentially a monographic study on the artist's work, with an early catalogue of the works. 
See also the later 1994 catalogue raisonné by Sylvain Lecombre cited in this database.

name: Yokoo, Tadano
item_t: Zenhanga = Prints Retrospective : hanga jungle.
public_note: Catalogue published on the occasion of an exhibiton at Machida Shiritsu Kokusai Hanga Bijutsukan and Yokoo Tadanri Gendai Bijutsukan, Kobe, 2017.

name: Zabaleta, Rafael
item_t: Rafael Zabaleta : estudio catalográfico.
author: Guzmán Pérez, María
imprint: Jaén : Diputación de Jaén, Instituto de Estudios Giennenses, 2010.
public_note:
The first and second volumes contain the  catalogue raisonné, listing over 500 paintings by the artist (v.1: oils -- v.2: oils and watercolors).
The final volume discusses the artist's biography, stylistic development, and posthumous reputation. The documents section contains excerpts from contemporary writings and reviews on the artist, as well as excerpts from Zabaleta's daybook.

name: Yang, Haegue
item_t: Haegue Yang -/+ ETA.
author: Dziewior, Yilmaz
imprint: Cologne : Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther König, 2018.
public_note: Published on the occasion of the exhibition "Haegue Yang, ETA 1994-2018" held at the Museum Ludwig Köln.  The catalogue raisonné documents the entire oeuvre of this German-based South Korean artist.

name: Yeats, Jack B.
item_t: The Different Worlds of Jack B. Yeats : His Cartoons and Illustrations.
author: Pyle, Hilary
imprint: Blackrock, Co. Dublin : Irish Academic Press, c1994

name: Yeats, Jack B.
item_t: Jack B. Yeats : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil Paintings.
author: Pyle, Hilary
public_note: The first volume features essays about the artist's life, artistic career and stylistic development.  The catalogue raisonné is in vols. 1-2.  A third volume contains the plates.

name: Yeats, Jack B.
item_t: Jack  B. Yeats : His Watercolours, Drawings and Pastels.
author: Pyle, Hilary
imprint: Blackrock, Co. Dublin : Irish Academic Press, c1993.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné features essays about Yeats' life and career.  There are also lists of the artist's sketchbooks and public collections housing his watercolours.

name: Wyeth, N.C. (Newell Convers)
item_t: N.C. Wyeth : The Collected Paintings, Illustrations and Murals.
author_s:
Allen, Douglas, Jr.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Horgan, Paul (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Layton, Richard (intro.)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 1,200 works by the artist. The publication includes several chapters on Wyeth's illustrative activity from his student period through the mural works.

name: Wyeth, N.C. (Newell Convers)
item_t: Brandywine River Museum N.C. Wyeth Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Brandywine River Museum
cronology: The online resource contains expanded entries for paintings listed in the print edition, as well as  paintings added since the print edition was released. There are also entries for over 	700 drawings and for student and juvenile works executed prior to November 1902.
ind_entr_cont: Individual entries provide scalable images of the works, provenance, exhibitions, references, curatorial comments, alternate titles, and information on labels, signatures, and inscriptions.  Some entries also include digital images of related archival material.  Each work is assigned a unique (NCW) number that correlates to the sequential numbers used in the 2008 print volumes.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Wyeth, N.C. (Newell Convers)
item_t: N.C. Wyeth : Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings.
author_s:
Podmaniczky, Christine B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stoner, Joyce Hill
public_note: Published by the Brandywine River Museum, Chadds Ford, PA, and the Wyeth Foundation for American Art. See also the related website: www.ncwyeth.org cited in this database under "Brandywine River Museum, N.C. Wyeth Catalogue Raisonné".  Christine Podmaniczky is Associate Curator of the N.C. Wyeth collections at the Brandywine River Museum.

name: Wunderlich, Paul
item_t: Paul Wunderlich; Werk-Verzeichnis der Lithographien von 1949-1965.
author: Brusberg, Dieter
public_note:
Subsequent editions of this original catalogue of the artist's lithographs were issued, with updates:
"Paul Wunderlich; Nachtrag 1966 zum Werkverzeichnis der Lithographien" (Hanover, Brusberg, 1966), also reprinted in 1971 under the title: "Paul Wunderlich; Werk-Verzeichnis der Lithographien von 1949-1971" (Berlin, Propylaeen Verlag, 1971).

name: Wunderlich, Paul
item_t: Paul Wunderlich: Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik 1948 bis 1982 : catalogue raisonné.
imprint: Offenbach am Main : Edition Volker Huber, 1983.
public_note:
For Riediger's updating of the artist's printed graphic work from 1983 through 1987, consult the second part of the exhibition catalogue published on the occasion of the artist's 60th Birthday: 
"Paul Wunderlich, Graphik und Multiples, 1948-1987, Katalog der Ausstellung zum 60. Geburtstag…, Bd.2: mit Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik 1983-1987" (Schleswig-Holsteinisches Landesmuseum, 1987).

name: Wunsch, Axel
item_t: Axel Wunsch, Malerei und Grafik 1956-2006, Katalog mit Werkverzeichnis auf CD-Rom
author: Wunsch, Axel
public_note: A small catalogue brochure was published on the occasion of an exhibition: "Axel Wunsch, Malerie und Grafik, 1956-2006" held at the Neue Sächsische Galerie, Chemnitz.   It presented a biography of the artist along with a CD-ROM containing an oeuvre catalogue of the artist's work from 1956 to 2006.

name: Wurm, Erwin

cronology: Individual entries include: paper size, paper type, watermarks, colors, inscriptions, collectors' marks, plate and printing notes, associated works, and different states.  There is also a list of impressions that have been located; most in public collections.
ind_entr_cont:
This is an online catalogue raisonné of Whistler's drypoints, etchings, and mezzotints executed between 1854-1903. The catalogue raisonné is searchable by keyword, title, number, sitters, place, collection, subject, and series.

The catalogue also includes discussions of how to make an etching, as well as Whistler's own etching techniques.

                                                            Ten Harmsel, Larry                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Van Til, Reinder
imprint: Grand Rapids, MI : Wm. B. Eerdmans Publishing, Co., 2015.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Grand Rapids Art Museum in honor of the 100th anniversary of Weidenaar's birth.

name: Weizsäcker, Andreas von
item_t: Andreas von Weizsäcker : Werkmonografie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Hohmann, Sabrina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hirsch, Thomas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ammann, Jean-Christophe
public_note: This is a catalogue of the artist's complete oeuvre. The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Thomas Hirsch and the artist's widow, the artist Sabrina Hohmann.  The catalogue raisonné section includes an introduction, a list of abbreviations, glossary, plus a catalogue of work from 1979 until the artist's death in 2008.

name: Weber, Kira
item_t: Kira Weber : huiles 2009.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Galerie Patrick Cramer in Geneva and the Caroline Freymond et Menus plaisirs Chalet Farb, Saanen. This publication supplements the earlier catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings to include works executed from 2007-2009.  The publication includes a brief note by Sebastian Goeppert, and an updated list of exhibitions.

name: Moillon, Louise
item_t: Louyse Moillon : Paris, vers 1610-1696 : la nature morte au Grand Siècle : catalogue raisonné.
author: Alsina, Dominique
public_note: Bilingual catalogue raisonné is based on the author's doctoral thesis. The catalogue lists 69 authentic works, arranged chronologically. An asterisk denotes works that have been examined by the author in person. The publication also contains separate catalogues of attributed and rejected works.

name: Moirignot, Edmond
item_t: Moirignot : aimer, créer, rêver.
author: Jeancolas, Claude

name: Moirignot, Edmond
item_t: Moirignot : catalogue raisonné.
author: Jeancolas, Claude
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue gives number, title, date, dimensions, edition, patina, foundry, history, and bibliographic references.

name: Mola, Pier Francesco
item_t: Pier Francesco Mola (1612-1666) : materie e colore nella pittura del '600.
author: Petrucci, Francesco
public_note: The publication has an introductory essay, followed by respective sections on the  is also a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is a section of documents, name and place indices, and a bibliography.

name: Molinari, Antonio
item_t: Antonio Molinari.
public_note: The publication contains discussions of the artist's career, influence and legacy, and graphic works. The catalogue raisonné lists all authentic paintings; lost works and paintings known only through documents; and dubious and rejected paintings.

name: Wax, Carol
item_t: Carol Wax : Catalogue Raisonné : Prints 1975-2005.
imprint: Athens : Herkaleidon Museum, Artistic Investments, Inc., 2006
public_note: The artist is a noted authority on mezzotints, and a leading exponent of the medium.

name: Wayne, June
item_t: June Wayne, the Art of Everything : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1936-2006.
author_s:
Conway, Robert P.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Danto, Arthur C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Broksky, Judith K. (preface)
imprint: New Brunswick, NJ ; Rutgers University Press, 2007.
public_note: Published in conjunction with a 2006-2007 exhibition. Catalogue raisonné contains over 475 of the artist's paintings, tapestries, drawings, prints, and videos.  The publication includes writings on June Wayne, as well as interviews, films, writings, and speeches by the artist herself.

name: Watteau, Louis Joseph
item_t: Les Watteau de Lille : Louis Watteau (1731-1798), François Watteau (1758-1823).

name: Weber, Kira
item_t: Kira Weber : huiles 1994-2007.
illustrations: 261 ills., most in color, and 177 plates
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings until 2007. The preface is in French with German and English translations.  The publication includes a chronological list of exhibitions.

name: Watteau, François Louis Joseph
item_t: Les Watteau de Lille : Louis Watteau (1731-1798), François Watteau (1758-1823).

name: Watteau, Antoine
item_t: Catalogue raisonne de l'oeuvre peint, dessine et grave d'Antoine Watteau.
author: Goncourt, Edmond de
public_note: The catalogue of paintings is arranged chronologically and by subject: portraits; history scenes; religious themes; genre & theater, and other scenes.  The second part of the catalogue lists the prints and drawings.

name: Watteau, Antoine
item_t: Antoine Watteau : catalogue complet de son oeuvre dessiné.
public_note:
A complete catalogue of Watteau's drawings in two volumes. Due to the difficulty of dating drawings, the catalogue is organized by subject, in approximate chronological order.  Each section is preceded by comments that provide dating information and interpretation.  

Volume 2 includes a bibliography, a general index, and a geographical index, as well as a list of photo credits and sources.

name: Wasmann, Friedrich
item_t: Friedrich Wasmann, sein Leben und sein Werk; ein Beitrag zur Geschichte der Malerei des neunzehnten Jahrhunderts.
author: Nathan, Peter
public_note: Originally presented as the author's doctoral thesis from the Universität Basel, 1952.  The catalogue lists 288 authentic paintings, arranged by subject, and 258 drawings. Publication contains separate catalogues of 114 lost and unknown works by the artist.

name: Warthmüller, Robe
item_t: Robert Warthmüller (1859-1895) : Werkverzeichnis mit einer Biografie des Künstlers / erarbeitet und herausgegeben von Joachim Behrend.
author: Behrend, Joachim
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biography of the artist and a discussion of his main works.

name: Watkins, Carleton E.
item_t: Carleton Watkins : The Complete Mammoth Photographs.
imprint: Los Angeles : J. Paul Getty Museum, 2011.
public_note: Contributions by Michael Hargraves, Jack von Euw, and Jennifer A. Watts; includes bibliographical references (pp. 548-559) and index; chiefly illustrations and maps.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: Andy Warhol : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Crone, Rainer
public_note: An important early study of Warhol's work up to 1970, compiled in collaboration with the artist.  A German edition was also issued (Stuttgart: Verlag Gerd Hatje, 1970).  A revised edition covering the years 1960-1974 was published by Wasmuth, Berlin, 1976.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: The Andy Warhol Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 5 : Paintings 1976-1978.
public_note: The publication lists 733 paintings, including portraits of Warhol's entourage, self-portraits, those of athletes etc., plus canvases from the "Skull", "Hammer and Sickle", "Torso", "Sex Parts", and "Oxidation" series among others.

name: Warhol, Andy

author_s:
Frei, Georg (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Printz, Neil (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            King-Nero, Sally (ed.)
public_note: Volume 4 lists 607 paintings and one sculpture executed between 1974-1976.  The works include paintings from Warhol's "Ladies and Gentlemen" series of portraits of transvestites, commissioned portraits, animal portraits, etc., and still life paintings.  All works are reproduced in color.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: The Andy Warhol Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 3 : Paintings and Sculptures, 1970-1974.
public_note: The third volume of the catalogue raisonné lists over 700 works created from 1970-1974.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: The Andy Warhol Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 2 (2.A & 2.B) : Paintings and Sculptures 1964-1969.
author_s:
Frei, Georg (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Printz, Neil (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            King-Nero, Sally (ex. ed.)
public_note: The second volume of this catalogue raisonné (published in two parts : vols. 2A & 2B), covering  the first eight years of the artist's serial production, "The Factory Years".  Volume 2 catalogues 23 series, comprising over 1,500 works.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: The Andy Warhol Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 1 : Paintings and Sculpture, 1961-1963.
public_note:
First of a multi-volume project, sponsored by Thomas Ammann Fine Art AG, Zurich and The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., New York, which plans to record all of Warhol's paintings, drawings and sculptures (approximately 15,000 works).

This is the first of two volumes dedicated to Warhol's works of the 1960s. Volume 1 lists 696 works, all reproduced in color.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: Andy Warhol Screen Tests : The Films of Andy Warhol : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Angell, Callie
imprint: New York : H.N. Abrams : Whitney Museum of American Art, 2006.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is undertaken as part of the Andy Warhol Film Project, a joint project of the Whitney Museum and the Museum of Modern Art. The first volume is a complete catalogue of film stills from 472 screen tests.  The second volume, dealing with the rest of Warhol's film work, is currently in preparation (see entry cited in this database).

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: Andy Warhol : The Record Covers, 1949-1987 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Maréchal, Paul
imprint: Montreal, Quebec : Montreal Museum of Fine Arts ; Munich ; London : Prestel, 2008.
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of Warhol's 50 album covers.  The catalogue was published on the occasion of a 2008-2009 exhibition organized with the Montreal Museum of Art and the Andy Warhol Museum, Pittsburgh.

name: Warhol, Andy
item_t: Andy Warhol : The Complete Commissioned Posters, 1964-1987 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Maréchal, Paul
public_note: The catalogue includes detailed notes on each poster Warhol designed.  There is also an essay on "The Art of Brand Imaging".

name: Warhol, Andy

author: Maréchal, Paul

Vilà i Burgos, Miquel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lafontana, Maite                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fontbona, Francesc

name: Vignon, Claude
item_t: Claude Vignon, 1593-1670.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published with the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Musée des beaux-arts, Tours; the Musée des beaux-arts, Arras; and the Musée des Augustins, Toulouse.

name: Vigée LeBrun, Élisabeth Louise
item_t: Vigée-Lebrun, 1755-1842 : Her Life, Works, and Friendships.
author: Helm, William Henry
public_note: A catalogue of Vigée- Lebrun's works arranged chronologically as an index of sitters' portraits. Most works are not illustrated.

name: Vigée LeBrun, Élisabeth Louise
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Vieira da Silva, Maria Helena
item_t: Vieira da Silva.
author_s:
Weelen, Guy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jaegger, Jean-François                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Duval, Virginie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Daval Béran, Diane
public_note: Contains an index of pieces, photographs of the artist and studio, and selected personal writings.  Each entry includes: title, date, medium, and comments.

name: Vien, Joseph-Marie the elde
item_t: Joseph-Marie Vien, peintre du roi (1716-1809).
public_note: The publication includes a biography of Vien by Lugand, an essay on Vien's works by Gaehtgens, followed by   the catalogue raisonné, which was compiled by both authors.

name: Vestier, Antoine
item_t: Antoine Vestier, 1740-1824.
author_s:
Passez, Anne-Marie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Maufus, Christine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baillio, Joseph
imprint: Paris : Fondation Wildenstein : La Bibliothèque des Arts, 1989.
public_note: The chronological catalogue raisonné covers works in oil, pastel, drawing, and minatures. Entries have title, date, medium, signature and date information, condition, provenance, and references.  In some cases of missing works, engravings by other artists illustrate the lost work.

name: Vici, Andrea
item_t: Andrea Vici : architetto e ingegnere idraulico : atlante delle opere.
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist as well as a number of critical texts on Vici's architectural training, architectual practice and theory in Italy, etc. by various authors.

name: Vespignani, Renzo
item_t: Renzo Vespignani : catalogo ragionato dei dipinti 1943-2001.
author_s:
Rivosecchi, Valerio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Falconi, Ilaria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zino, Bruno
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the artist's work includes all painting from 1943-2001, with a separate catalogue for Vespignani's series paintings. This catalogue lists only pictures that have secure information.  There is also a brief biography of the artist.

name: Verrocchio, Andrea del
item_t: The Sculptures of Andrea del Verrocchio.
author: Butterfield, Andrew
public_note: The catalogue is organized in roughly chronological order. There is a separate catalogue of work of "Uncertain Authorship". These only include works previously cited as by Verrocchio in the previous literature on the artist. The catalogue also includes an essay on Verrocchio as a draftsman and teacher.

name: Vieillard, Roge
item_t: Roger Vieillard : catalogue raisonné, oeuvre gravé 1934-1989.
author_s:
Guérin, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rault, Virginie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fumaroli, Marc (preface)
imprint: Paris : A. Guérin : Somogy : Musée de Gravelines, 2003.
public_note: The catalogue is published in cooperation with the Musée du dessin et de l'estampe originale en l'Arsenal de Gravelines.

name: Vernizzi, Renato
item_t: Renato Vernizzi: catalogazione generale del percorseo pittorico.
public_note: The three-volume publication catalogues all 2,836 of the artist's paintings and graphic works. The catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically, and all works are illustrated in color.

name: Veronese, Paolo
item_t: L'opera completa del Veronese.
public_note: Contains a list of attributed and doubtful works.

name: Vernet, Joseph
item_t: Joseph Vernet : peintre de marine, 1714-1789 : étude critique suivi d'un catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre peint.
author: Ingersoll-Smouse, Florence
public_note: The catalogue features over 2,000 works, of which some 1,200 are dated and given to Vernet, with an additional 700 undated and given to Vernet.

name: Veronese, Paolo
item_t: Veronese.
author: Pignatti, Terisio

name: Veronese, Paolo
item_t: Veronese's Drawings : With a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Cocke, Richard
ind_entr_cont: The individual entries include materials, dimensions, inscription information, notes, provenance, literature, and commentary.

name: Veronese, Paolo
item_t: Veronese : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
public_note: The publication includes a short biography of the artist. The catalogue raisonné includes 265 autograph paintings and 85 paintings generally attributed to Veronese. Illustrations are of a poor quality.

name: Veronese, Paolo
item_t: Grace and Grandeur : The Portraiture of Paolo Veronese.
author: Garton, John
public_note: The publication includes an extensive monograph, as well as the catalogue raisonné Veronese's portraits.

name: Veronese, Paolo
item_t: Veronese.
illustrations: b&w; 66 color in v.1, 34 color in v.2
public_note: The publication includes four essays on the development of the artist. In addition to autograph paintings, there is a catalogue of attributed paintings and a catalogue of lost or destroyed paintings.

name: Vernet, Horace
item_t: Horace Vernet : dessinateur lithographe, 1816-1838 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre lithographié.
author: Sanchez, Pierre
public_note: The publication was issued in a limited edition of 100 numbered copies.  Contents cover earlier catalogues by Bruzard and Beraldi, and list principal collections of the artist's work.  The catalogue raisonné lists 237 original lithographs as well as 2 etchings by the artist.

name: Verna, Claudio
item_t: Claudio Verna : catalogo ragionato.
author: Feierabend, Volker
imprint: Cinisello Balsamo : Silvana ; Frankfurt/M : VAF Fondazione, 2010

author: Hale, Philip Leslie

name: Verhelst, Aegid

author: Dietrich, Dagmar
public_note: The publication is based on the author's 1972 doctoral thesis for Munich University.

author: Wohl, Hellmut.
imprint: New York : New York University Press, 1980.
public_note: The catalogue contains a biography of the artist, and essays on the St. Lucy Altarpiece and Veneziano's artistic development.  The appendix includes a selection of documents on the artist's life and work (in Italian).

name: Venini  S.p.A.
item_t: Venini : Catalogue Raisonné 1921-1986.
author_s:
Venini Diaz de Santillana, Anna                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ricke, Helmut                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Terraroli, Valerio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barovier, Rosa
imprint: Milan : Skira Editore ; New York: distributed in North America by Abbeville, 2000.
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonne of the Venini Glassworks, from the date of their foundation to 1986, when the business was sold.  The catalogue raisonne lists approximately 250 works.  The publication inludes a glossary, bibliography, exhibition list, and indexes.

name: Venet, Berna
item_t: The Five Years of Bernar Venet : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Karshan, Donald H.
imprint: New York : New York Cultural Center, 1971.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the New York Cultural Center.  The catalogue includes a biography of the artist and comments by A.R. Anderson.

author: Robinson, M.S.
imprint: Greenwich, London : National Maritime Museum : Distributed by Sotheby's Publications, 1990.
public_note: Published by the Trustees of the National Maritime Museum, Greenwich in association with the Centenary of the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company 1890-1990.  An alternate title is "The Paintings of the Willem Van de Veldes: Catalogue Raisonné."

name: Velde, Willem van de, I
item_t: Van de Velde : A Catalogue of the Paintings of the Elder and the Younger Willem van de Velde.
author: Robinson, M.S.
imprint: Greenwich, London : National Maritime Museum : Distributed by Sotheby's Publications, 1990.
public_note: Published by the Trustees of the National Maritime Museum, Greenwich in association with the Centenary of the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company 1890-1990.  An alternate title is "The Paintings of the Willem Van de Veldes: Catalogue Raisonné."

name: Venini  S.p.A.
item_t: Fulvio Bianconi at Venini.
public_note: This is the fourth publication in a series on artists working with the Venini glassworks firm in Venice.  The catalogue of the complete works is contained in the catalogue of an exhibition held at "Le stanze del vetro", Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice.   In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes essays by various authors on Bianconi's work at the Venini Glassworks in the 1950s; his work as an illustrator; and the reception of Italian glass in America in the early 1950s.

name: Venini  S.p.A.
item_t: Tomaso Buzzi at Venini.

name: Venini  S.p.A.
item_t: Napoleone Martinuzzi : Venini, 1925-1931.

author: Barovier, Marino (ed.)
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at Le Stanze del vetro, Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice, Italy from August - January 2013.

name: Vermeer, Johanne
item_t: Vermeer : The Complete Paintings.
author: Liedtke, Walter
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists 36 authentic paintings by Vermeer. Provenance histories are cited separately. 

The Appendices also contain selected documents relating to Vermeer's life and work.  There are also name and title indices.

name: Vermeer, Johanne

author: Goldscheider, Ludwig

name: Vermeer, Johanne

author: Wheelock, Arthur K., Jr.
public_note: This is a concise edition of the author's earlier study on Vermeer, published in 1981.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biography of the artist with a discussion of his works and painting in Delft.

name: Vermeer, Johanne

author: Wheelock, Arthur
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 35 paintings by Vermeer, all illustrated in color.

name: Vermeer, Johanne
item_t: Vermeer : The Complete Works.
author: Villa, Renzo
public_note: The catalogue was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Scuderie del Quirinale, Rome,

name: Vermeer, Johanne

author: Schütz, Karl

public_note: Volume 4 of the "Aetas aurea" series. The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of paintings, etchings, and drawings. The Appendix contains a genealogical table for the Van de Velde family of artists.

name: Veith, Eduard

author: Freimann, Silvia
public_note: Following a biography of the artist, there are separate essays dealing with Veith's early works, decorative paintings, religious works and portraits, and lost and destroyed monumental works.  The catalogue raisonné lists over 500 of the artist's paintings, watercolors, and graphic works.

name: Veit, Philipp
item_t: Philipp Veit (1793-1877) : Leben und Werk eines Nazareners : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Suhr, Norbert
public_note: This is monograph and catalogue raisonné lists the artist's frescoes, oil paintings, cartoons, graphic works, watercolors, and drawings.  The publication also contains separate catalogues of lost works and doubtful attributions.

name: Vedani, Michele

author_s:

                                                            Baldassini, Paola                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Senarclens, Catherine de
imprint: Lecco : Amici dei musei del territorio lecchese : Amici del Museo delle Grigne onlus, 2013.
public_note: The main texts were prepared by Tiziana Rota. The catalogue raisonné (listing over 400 works organized by subject) was compiled by Catherine de Senarclens.  The publication includes memoirs of the artist by the author and others, and a biography.  There are also discussions of Vedani's main sculptural programs, with an essay by Matteo Crespi on the bronzes.

name: Vazques de Arce y Ceballos, Gregorio

author_s:
Pizano Restrepo, Roberto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Argaez Valenzuela, Pablo
public_note:
Early catalogue raisonné listing 403 paintings by the artist. A second revised edition was published in 1985 (see entry cited in this database). 

The publication includes separate catalogues raisonnés of the works of two of the artist's followers, Gaspar de Figueroa and Baltasar de Figueroa.

name: Velázquez, Diego
item_t: Velázquez : A Catalogue Raisonné of his Oeuvre.
author: Lopez-Rey, José
public_note: The introductory essay in the present publication (but not the catalogue) was enlarged and revised in the author's 1968 monograph, "Velázquez' Work and World".  Other revised editions of the catalogue raisonné were issued in 1979 and 1996 (See entries cited in this database).

name: Velázquez, Diego
item_t: L'opera completa di Velázquez.
public_note: This was also issued in a French edition, Paris, Flammarion, 1969.

name: Velázquez, Diego
item_t: Velázquez : The Artist as a Maker, with a Catalogue Raisonné of His Extant Works.
author: López-Rey, José
public_note: A French edition, "Velázquez: artiste et créateur, avec un catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre intégral" was published by La Bibliothèque des Arts in 1981.  A trilingual edition was published by Taschen in 1996.

name: Velázquez, Diego
item_t: Velazquez : The Complete Paintings.
author: Checa Cremades, Fernando
imprint: Antwerp : Ludion ; London : Thames & Hudson ; New York : Harry N Abrams, 2008
public_note: Different language co-editions were published in Europe and the  USA.  This study includes Pacheco's "Life of Velázquez", an Appendix with provenances of paintings, a bibliography, and indices listing paintings by location. There is also a title list and an index of proper names.

name: Velázquez, Diego
item_t: Velázquez : Catalogue Raisonné.
illustrations: b&w, chiefly color ills. (130 color plates)
public_note: This is a revised edition of Lopez-Rey's earlier catalogues, updated by Odile Delenda.   The full text digitized publication is available on the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's website (see Full Text link on this page).

name: Vaughan, John Keith
item_t: Keith Vaughan : The Mature Oils, 1946-1977 : Commentary and Comprehensive Catalogue.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is organized chronologically by decade, and includes destroyed works. Entries cite title, date, dimensions, provenance, signature information, exhibition history, information regarding illustrations of the work.  Title changes by the artist and re-worked pictures (with dates) are noted.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist

name: Velázquez, Diego
item_t: Velázquez : catálogo completo.
author_s:
Morán Turina, José Miguel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sánchez Quevedo, Isabel

name: Velázquez, Diego

author_s:
López-Rey, José                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Delenda, Odile                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wildenstein Institute
public_note: This is a large format revised edition of the definitive catalogue raisonné originally authored by José Lopez-Rey. (See entries in this database for earlier versions of the title).  The revised catalogue includes several newly attributed works, new photographs of recently restored paintings, a selection of enlarged details, and drawings.

name: Velde, Henry van de
item_t: Textilien = Textiles.

name: Velde, Henry van de
item_t: Metalkunst = Works in Metal.
public_note: The catalogue includes over 830 numbered items, most illustrated in color.  Entries provide title, date, provenance, exhibitions, notes, materials, manufacturer, markings.  Some entries also include preparatory drawings as well as images of the realized object.

author: Mayer, August L.

Original 1956 publication of engravings by van Dyck and after his original paintings.  
A reprint and augmented version was published in 1991 (see entry cited in this database.)

name: Vazques de Arce y Ceballos, Gregorio

author: Pizano Restrepo, Roberto
public_note: This revised edition of Pizano Restrepo's 1926 catalogue. The publication adds 136 works (with associated sketches) and 106 drawings. Appendices include a geneology of the artist's family.

name: Van Dyck, Anthony, S

author: Vey, Horst

name: Valtat, Lou
item_t: Louis Valtat : catalogue de l'oeuvre peint 1869-1952.
author: Valtat, Jean
public_note: Entires include title, date, exhibitions, medium, and signature information.  Most works in the catalogue are illustrated with black & white thumbnail images. There are appendices with a summary biography, principal exhibitions and lists of works in public collections.

name: Vallet, Edouard
item_t: Vallet : catalogue raisonné de l'œuvre peint d'Edouard Vallet.
public_note: Following an introduction, biography and essays, there is a chronological catalogue (with certain regroupments by the author) of the work including the oils, watercolors, and gouaches. There is a listing of museums and foundations housing the artist's works, a catalogue of sales, and a bibliography.

name: Vallotton, Félix
item_t: Félix Vallotton, 1865-1925 : L'oeuvre peint.
imprint: Lausanne : Fondation Félix Vallotton ; Milan : 5 Continents ; Zurich/Lausanne : SIK-ISEA, 2005.
public_note:
Publication is number 22 from the series "Catalogues raisonnés d'artistes suisses." The catalogue contains a biographical essay, and additional texts on Vallotton's style and artistic career.

The publication also includes reproductions of the artist's signatures, and a reproduction of Vallotton's "Livre de raison," the artist's own catalogue of works from 1885 until his death in 1925.

The catalogue raisonné lists 1704 paintings, arranged chronologically.

name: Vallotton, Félix
item_t: Félix Vallotton : The Nabi from Switzerland.
author: Brodskaïa, Nathalia
public_note: A revised edition was published by Parkstone Press in 2013 (see entry in this database).  The first edition has a biographical essay on the artist, with all works illustrated.

name: Vallotton, Félix
item_t: Félix Vallotton : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié.
public_note: Published under the aegis of the 'Cabinet des estampes, Musée de'art et d'histoire, Genève'.

name: Vallayer-Coster, Anne
item_t: Anne Vallayer-Coster, Painter to the Court of Marie-Antoinette.
imprint: Dallas : Dallas Museum of Art ; New Haven : Yale University Press, 2002.
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at the Dallas Museum of Art, it also contains a catalogue raisonné of all 137 extant paintings. All works are illustrated in black and white; works in the exhibition are reproduced in color.

name: Vallayer-Coster, Anne
item_t: Anne Vallayer-Coster, 1744-1818.
author: Roland Michel, Marianne
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné on the artist. The first part of this study presents essays on the artist. Part 2 contains a catalogue of the works preceeded by a table of the works organized stylistically (flower paintings, fruits & vegetables, allegories, portraits, etc) and a chronological index of dated works.  There is supplementary material containing documents, lists of salons, exhibitions, record of the sale: "vente Coster", etc, and a bibliography.

name: Vallotton, Félix
item_t: Félix Vallotton : The Nabi from Switzerland.
author: Brodskaia, Nathalia
public_note: This is a revised edition of the author's 1996 edition (see entry in this database).

name: Valmier, George

author: Basetoux, Denise
public_note: Volume 2 is currently in preparation (see entry cited in this database).

name: Van Dyck, Anthony, S

author: Larsen, Erik

name: Van Dyck, Anthony, S
item_t: L'iconographie d'Antoine van Dyck : catalogue raisonné.
author: Mauquoy-Hendrickx, Marie
public_note: First published in Brussels in 1956, this is a second revised and augmented edition of the fundamental study on the portrait prints, made after works by Van Dyck.

name: Van Dyck, Anthony, S
item_t: L'opera completa di van Dyck, 1613-1626.
author: Larsen, Erik
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication contains the essays on Van Dyck's art and critical fortunes.

                                                            Millar, Oliver
public_note: The catalogue is divided into four sections corresponding to the different periods of the artist's activity. Within each section, the works are arranged thematically and are published along with corresponding drawings and studies.  At the end of each section, replicas and copies are catalogued; these are designated with the letter "A".

public_note: The publication catalogues approximately 4,000 paintings and drawings, organized chronologically. The first volume contains a biography of the artist, as well as an essay by Paolo Campiglio on Vacchi's critical fortunes. Volumes 2 & 3 contain the catalogue raisonné, which is divided into various periods of the artist's career.

public_note: The Appendices contain a critical anthology, biographical notes and a bibliography.  There is also an index of works in public and private collections.

                                                            Poisson, Florence G.
public_note: Includes an index of collectors. Volume 5, published in 1974, is a supplement to the earlier volumes. Works catalogued in this supplement  are numbered in concordance with those in the earlier volumes.

name: Utrillo, Maurice

author: Fabris, Jean
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist with analysis of his works. Contributors include Jean-Pierre Thiollet, Jacques Birr, Catherine Banlin-Lacroix, et al. There is also a catalogue raisonné of the graphic works.   It also includes a discussion of the artist's signatures by Alain Buquet.

                                                            Paillier, Cédric
public_note:
This is the first volume in a new attempt to establish a qualified catalogue of the artist's work. The original titles have been kept, dating is given a two year spread, and sale information is cited if known.  

Illustrations precede the catalogue raisonné section, which covers about 470 works, the so-called "white paintings".

name: Ursula
item_t: Ursula.
author_s:
Weiss, Evelyn                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Althöfer, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Herrmann, Barbara
public_note: Ursula was the public name used by the  20th C. German artist, Ursula Schultze-Bluhm.  The publication includes texts by Barbara Herrmann and Christa Lichtenstern, as well has texts by the artist herself.  The catalogue was compiled by Herrmann.

name: Urteaga, Mario
item_t: Mario Urteaga, 1875-1957 : catálogo razonado.
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held in Trujillo, Peru, commemorating the 30th anniversary of the artist's death.  There is a collection of photographs of the artist's family, selected writings by the artist, a chronology, and examples of the artist's signature.

name: Universal Limited Art Editions (Firm)

public_note: A full catalogue of the ground-breaking print program established under the direction of  Tatyana Grosman and her husband  at 'ULAE'. It includes works  by artists such as Jim Dine, Sam Francis, Frankenthaler, Fuller, Jasper Johns, Marisol, Motherwell, Rauschenberg, Newman, Rivers, Rosenquist, and  Bontecou.

name: Urteaga, Mario

In addition to the introductory essays and the catalogue, the publication lists solo and group exhibitions, writings, interviews, prizes, lists of articles about and quotes from Uncini, and a list of works in public spaces.

There is a separate section of Documentary Appendices, which contain extensive genealogical tables on the artist's family.

name: Tworkov, Jack
item_t: Jack Tworkov : The Works on Canvas - A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Andrew, Jason
cronology: Individual works can be searched by date or title.  Entries includes title, catalogue number, date, medium and support, signature information, provenance, exhibition history, references, and illustrations of related works.  The catalogue entries also include images of Tworkov's inventory cards (and those of his widow).
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné is an on-going project to record all of the artist's paintings and drawings, and prints.  The catalogue currently includes 457 paintings and 160 works on paper.
public_note:
The catalogue will eventually include additional documentation, including audio and visual recordings of the artist.  

Access to the catalogue raisonné is free, but requires login.

name: Twombly, Cy

The Appendices includes a list of etchings by Martha Scudder Twachtman and commentaries on the artist's etchings.  An article by Margery Austen Ryerson, "John H. Twachtman's Etchings," from 'Art in America' from Feb. 8, 1920 is also reproduced.

Entries provide number, title, and date, medium and support, dimensions, signature, date, provenance, exhibitions, references, and notes.

                                                            Nahum, Peter (Foreword)
