item_t: Gerhard Trieb : Zeichnungen.
public_note: Subtitle: "Zum zeichnerischen Werk Gerhard Triebs".  The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's hand-drawn works.

name: Trego, William Thoma
item_t: William T. Trego Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
James A. Michener Art Museum                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Eckhardt, Joseph
cronology: The catalogue raisonné is divided in parts: First Works in Detroit, 1878-1879; Military History Paintings 1880-1887; Paris Paintings, 1887-1890; Works for publisher, George Barrie, 1892-1893; Portraits, 1880-1904; Drawings and Illustrations, 1880-1909; Sculpture; Later Military Works, 1895-1900; Genre Works and Final Paintings, 1895-1908; the Book; Photographs
ind_entr_cont: The publication includes a biography of the artist and lists 138 paintings, drawings, sketches, sculptures, and photographs in the catalogue.  The catalogue raisonné can be searched by medium, subject, year, and genre.

name: Trökes, Heinz
item_t: Heinz Trökes : Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Trökes, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Krause, Markus (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grohmann, Will                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Haftmann, Werner
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of the oil paintings, the publication inlcudes a biography, early writings on the artist by Haftmann and Grohmann, as well as several essays by Trökes himself.

name: Towne, Franc
item_t: A Catalogue Raisonné of Francis Towne (1739-1816).
author: Stephens, Richard
cronology: Individual entries include title, date, medium, provenance, exhibition history, associated people & organizations, references, inscriptions, other versions, and related works.  There are numerous scalable color images, but not all works in the catalogue are illustrated.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné was published by the Paul Mellon Centre.  The catalogue lists 987 authentic oil paintings, watercolors, and sketches.  The catalogue also includes lost works, unidentifable works, and several doubtful attributions. Finally, there is a separate section dealing with works by Towne's pupils and copyists.

name: Tura, Cosmè
item_t: Cosmè Tura : The Life and Art of a Painter in Estense Ferrara.
author: Manca, Joseph
imprint: Oxford : Clarendon Press ; New York : Oxford University Press, 2000.
public_note:
The work is examined with specific regard to the artist's relationship with the artistic milieu of the Veneto in the second half of the '400: painting, book illustrations, and poetry. 
All known source documents relating to the artist's work have been fully transcribed.

name: Trémolières, Pierre Charle
item_t: Pierre-Charles Trémolières; Cholet, 1703-Paris, 1739.
author_s:
Méjanés, Jean-François                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vilain, Jacques                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rosenberg, Pierre (intro.)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibitions of the artist's works held at the Musée de Cholet.

name: Trémois, Pierre-Yve
item_t: Trémois : catalogue raisonné,
author: Brohard, Yvan
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of the artist's entire oeuvre. The catalogue covers paintings and monotypes, graphic works, drawings, sculptures and metalwork, ceramics, tapestries, and other objects.

name: Trevisani, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Trevisani : Eighteenth-century Painter in Rome : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: DiFederico, Frank R.
public_note: The texts include a brief discussion of the artist's life and works, followed by biographies written by critics Nicola Pio, Lione Pascoli and Francesco Moüche.

name: Trevelyan, Julian
item_t: Julian Trevelyan : Catalogue Raisonné of Prints.
author_s:
Turner, Silvie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ackroyd, Norman                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Carey, Frances                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Evans, Patricia Jordan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fedden, Mary (preface)
imprint: Aldershot, England : Scolar Press in association with Bohun Gallery, 1998.
public_note: The publication includes essays on the artist's early etchings, his technique, Trevelyan as a teacher, and biographical notes.  In addition to the catalogue of the printed work, the book contains also lists of printers and publishers, a discussion of editions, Trevelyan's works in other media, and subject matter.

name: Trentanove, Antonio
item_t: Antonio Trentanove e la scultura del Settecento in Romagna.
author_s:
Tumidei, Stefano                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bacchi, Andrea                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Massari, Silvia
imprint: Bologna : Fondazione Federico Zeri, Università di Bologna, 2016.
ind_entr_cont: The Appendices includes a chronology, source documents, a bibliography, name and work indices, and photo references.
public_note: Bibliog.; Comments

name: Töpffer, Adam
item_t: Wolfgang-Adam Töpffer (1766-1847) : catalogue raisonné des peintures.
author_s:
Boissonnas, Lucien                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guimard Feiner, Catherine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cendre, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Meyer, Petra                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mechler, Cornelia
public_note: Parallel texts in French and German.

name: Tower, Jame
item_t: The Ceramic Art of James Tower.
imprint: Farnham, Surrey ; Burlington, VT : Lund Humphries, 2012.
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist  with a discussion of his works. This is followed by the catalogue raisonné, listing all ceramics created from 1978-1986. The publication includes a list of exhibitions, an index and a list of works in public collections.

name: Tovar, Alonso Miguel de
item_t: Alonso Miguel de Tovar : (1678-1752).
author: Quiles, Fernando
imprint: Seville : Diputación de Sevilla, Area de Cultura y Deportes, 2005.
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, medium, collection, dimensions, bibliography, and comments.  Not all works are illustrated.

name: Toulouse-Lautrec, Henri de
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Toulouse-Lautrec, Henri de
item_t: Toulouse-Lautrec et son oeuvre.
author: Dortu, M.G.
public_note: The first volume includes the introductory materials, including a list of exhibitions, iconography, examples of the artist's signatures, and false works. There is also an alphabetical listing of people depicted in the works, lists of collectors and museums, a photo index, and addenda & errata.

name: Toulouse-Lautrec, Henri de
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Toulouse-Lautrec.
public_note: Entries are accompanied by a series of symbols - the key to which is found at the beginning of the catalogue - which act as shorthand notations for certain attributes such as technique, support, location, etc. Provenance information, if any, is noted in the comments.

name: Toulouse-Lautrec, Henri de
item_t: L'opera completa di Toulouse-Lautrec.
public_note: This catalogue raisonné is part of the series: Classici dell'arte.  Introductory material is by Giorgio Caproni, and the catalogue and other apparatus are by Gabriele Sugana.

name: Toulouse-Lautrec, Henri de
item_t: Toulouse-Lautrec : The Complete Prints.
imprint: London : Philip Wilson Publishers Ltd., for Sotheby's;  New York : distributed in USA by Harper & Row, 1985.
public_note: Volume One includes the essays. Volume Two lists 317 lithographs, 9 drypoints, 4 monotypes, and 30 posters.  It also contains concordances and a bibliography.

name: Toulouse, Roger Alphonse Albe
item_t: Roger Toulouse, 1918-1994 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre
author: Perreau, Jean

name: Toepfer, Ern
item_t: Der Maler Ernst Toepfer : Leben und Werk.
public_note: The catalogue was published by the Magistrat der Stadt Idstein.

name: Tocqué, Lou
item_t: Louis Tocqué.
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-arts-édition d'études et de documents, 1929.
public_note: The full text digitized publication is available on the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's webpage (see Full Text link on this page).

name: Tissot, Jame
item_t: James Tissot : Catalogue Raisonné of his Prints.
author_s:
Wentworth, Michael Justin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sachs II, Samuel (Foreword)
public_note: Published on the occasion of exhibitions held at the Minneapolis Insitute of Art, and the Clark Art Institute, 1978.

name: Tischbein, Johann Heinrich, I
item_t: Johann Heinreich Tischbein d.Ä. (1722-1789) als Porträtmaler, mit einem kritischen Werkverzeichnis.
author: Flohr, Anna-Charlotte
public_note: Originally presented as the author's 1996 doctoral dissertation for the Universität Frankfurt am Main.

name: Titian
item_t: Tutta la pittura di Tiziano.
author: Valcanover, Francesco (ed.)
public_note:
Works are arranged chronologically, and the catalogue includes autograph, lost, and attributed paintings. Entries are all in note form and give brief provenance if known.  The publication features an appendix with contemporary and primary-source writings about Titian.

An English edition was also published (New York: Hawthorn Books, 1960).

name: Tirinnanzi, Nino
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Nino Tirinnanzi.
author: Faccenda, Giovanni
imprint: Milan : Editoriale delle opere di Nino Trinnanzi, 2015.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of works, the publication includes an essay on Tirinnanzi's works, a biography, a list of solo exhibitions, and a bibliography.

name: Tintoretto
item_t: L'opera completa del Tintoretto.
public_note: Includes lists of attributed and doubtful works.

name: Tinoco, Juan
item_t: Una cuestión de matices: vida y obra de Juan Tinoco.
author: Rodríguez-Miaja, Fernando E
imprint: Puebla, Mexico : Gobierno del Estado de Puebla, Universidad Iberaamericana Golfo Centro, 1996.

name: Tintoretto
item_t: Tintoretto : l'opera completa.
public_note: First published by Alfieri Edizioni d'Arte, Venice, 1974 (I ritratti) and 1982 (Le opere sacre e profane). Two volumes in three, taken together, the 1990 edition is an analysis of the artist's entire oeuvre: portraits, religious themes, and profane subjects. The catalogue contains approximately 650 authentic works. Doubtful, misattributed, and lost works are also listed.

name: Titian
item_t: The Paintings of Titian : Complete Edition.
author: Wethey, Harold
public_note: The catalogue is organized alphabetically by subject and chronologically within subheadings. Entries include brief notes on composition and subject matter (biographies of sitters in known portraits); lists of inscriptions; condition reports; variants; copies; lost items.  Workshop replicas and copies are grouped in with autograph works by theme.

name: Titian
item_t: Tiziano : corpus dei disengi autografi.
author: Chiari Moretto Wiel, Maria Agnese
public_note: Issued in the series "Le Raccolte di disegni dei grandi pittori".  An English language edition was published in 1990 by Rizzoli, New York.

name: Titian
item_t: Titian and His Drawings : With Reference to Giogione and Some Close Contemporaries.
author: Wethey, Harold E.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 51 authentic drawings, with separate catalogues of drawings by Giorgione and his circle; works by Jacopo Bassano, Paris Bordone and their followers; and drawings by anonymous masters.

name: Titian
item_t: Titian : The Complete Paintings.
author_s:
Pedrocco, Filippo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chiari Moretto Wiel, Maria Agnese
public_note:
The catalogue is arranged in chronological order, and includes a number of essays on Titian's life and works. Entries for Nos. 164-270 were written by Maria Agnese Chiari Moreno.

The first edition was published by RCS Libri S.p.A., Milan, 2000.

name: Titian
item_t: L'opera completa di Tiziano.
public_note: From the series Classici dell'arte. Includes lists of attributed and doubtful works.

name: Titian
item_t: Titian Drawings.
author: Chiari Moretto Wiel, Maria Agnese
public_note: This catalogue is a translation of "Tiziano, corpus dei disgni autografi" which was published by Berenice in Milan (1989).  It contains an introductory essay, "Titian's Career as a Draughtsman," which includes comments on doubtful works.

name: Titian
item_t: Titian : The Complete Paintings.
author: Humfrey, Peter
imprint: Ghent : Ludion ; New York : Harry N. Abrams, 2007.
public_note: The publication presents Titian's works in roughly chronological order.  It discusses problems with workshop assistance in Titian attributions, and includes a brief note on Titian's technique. The catalogue focuses on the origins of works, subject matter, and questions of dating and attribution.   The Appendix includes Vasari's description of Titian's life and works (in English).

name: Thomson, Tom
item_t: Tom Thomson Online Catalogue.
author: Murray, Joan
cronology: The title page presents a key to the entire work under various headings: "About the Project", "The Artist", "Chronology", and "Catalogue". Under the rubric "Catalogue", one can search by medium or year, and further filter the results by other criteria. There are expandable color illustrations.
public_note: Catalogue entries provide title, date, medium and support, dimensions, provenance, and references. A useful link from this point brings one to "Explore Catalogue Entries" for examples of comparative works.  Under "Comments", the author has indicated all titles (including changed titles and variants). The "Advanced Search" field gives other searching options: by collection, exhibition, title (main or variants), or literature.

name: Tosini, Michele
item_t: Michele de Ridolfo del Ghirlandaio (1503-1577) and the Reception of Mannerism in Florence.
author: Hornik, Heidi Josepha
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné presented as the author's dissertation at Pennsylvania State University in 1990. Catalogue raisonné discusses 143 works that historically had been attributed to Michele di Ridolfo del Ghirlandaio (also known as Michele Tosini).

name: Tiffany, Louis Comfo
item_t: Louis Comfort Tiffany : The Paintings.
author_s:
Williams, Gary A                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Littman, Robert R.
imprint: New York : Grey Art Gallery and Study Center, New York Univrsity, 1979.
public_note: While not a definitive study, this exhibition catalogue does serve as a document of the designer's painted work.

name: Tiepolo, Lorenzo
item_t: The Etchings of the Tiepolos.
author: Rizzi, Aldo

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Domenico
item_t: The Etchings of the Tiepolos.
author: Rizzi, Aldo

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: A Complete Catalogue of the Paintings of G.B. Tiepolo, Including Pictures by His Pupils and Followers Wrongly Attributed to Him.
author: Morassi, Antonio
public_note: The catalogue is organized alphabetically by collection location.  The illustrations at the back of the book, however, are arranged by subject (Old & New Testament, the Virgin and Saints, Portraits& Misc. Subjects, History, Allegories, Mythologies, and Addenda).

name: Thrash, Dox
item_t: Dox Thrash : An African American Master Printmaker Rediscovered.
imprint: Philadelphia : Philadelphia Museum of Art, in assoc. wtith the University of Washington Press, 2001.
public_note: The catalogue includes essays by John Ittmann, Kymberly Pinder, Cindy Medley-Buckner, and David Brigham.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: The Etchings of the Tiepolos.
author: Rizzi, Aldo

name: Thoms, Ern
item_t: Ernst Thoms : Werkverzeichnis 1920-1983.
author_s:
Allnoch, Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ommen, Eilert (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sieling, Heinrich (intro.)
public_note: Issued in the series: Schriften des Museums Nienburg, Nr. 35.  The catalogue lists approximately 1,600 works, most illustrated.  The publication includes essays on the artist's biography, stylistic development, and legacy by Christian Fuhrmeister, Paula Schwerdtfeger, Dieter Höfer, Ulrich Krempel, and others.

name: Thursz, Frederic M.
item_t: Frederic M. Thursz, 1930-1992 : Malerei, Text, Lehre = Painting, Text, Teaching.
author_s:
Thursz, Frederic                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heinz, Marianne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kames, Bettina
public_note: This survey presesnts more than 120 works.  It also includes selections of the artist's texts, interviews, journal entries, and a major series of lectures he gave as an instructor at the New York Studio School.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo : A Study and Catalogue Raisonné of the Chalk Drawings.
author: Knox, George
public_note: Catalogue is comprised of 15 sections arranged according to album, provenance for groups of works, and preliminary drawings for specific commissions. There are separate checklists of paintings by Domenico and Giambattista.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Tiepolo.
author_s:
Pallucchini, Anna                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonnefoy, Yves (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Le Foll, Joséphine
public_note: This publication, published in the series "Les Classiques de l'art", is a French translation from the original Italian publication (Rizzoli, Milan, 1968).  The French edition has a new introduction by Yves Bonnefoy.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giambattista Tiepolo : i dipinti, opera completa.
public_note: Each work is re-examined and presented with historic critical  references.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: L'opera completa di Giambattista Tiepolo.
public_note:
This is the most recent edition of "L'opera completa di Giambattista Tiepolo," published by Rizzoli in 1968.  A French edition was published by Flammarion in 1990.

The publication includes examples of the artist's signature, indices of titles and themes, and a geographical index of collections housing Tiepolo's works.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Tiepolo : The Complete Paintings.
author: Pedrocco, Filippo
public_note: Introductory essays are followed by the catalogue raisonné, a bibliography and list of works by location.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Domenico
item_t: Giambattista and Domenico Tiepolo : A Study and Catalogue Raisonné of the Chalk Drawings.
author: Knox, George
public_note: Catalogue is comprised of 15 sections arranged according to album, provenance for groups of works, and preliminary drawings for specific commissions. There are separate checklists of paintings by Domenico and Giambattista.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Domenico
item_t: Giandomenico Tiepolo.
author: Mariuz, Adriano
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes chapters dealing with the artist's early years, his activity in Wurzburg, his return to Italy (the first carnival scenes, villa decorations, etc.), studies for the "Commedia sociale" and the "Pulcinelle series", plus studies of the watercolor and figure drawings.

name: Tiepolo, Giovanni Domenico
item_t: Disegni di Giandomenico Tiepolo.
author: Pedrocco, Filippo

The catalogue entries give edition size, publisher, paper information, printers, and watermarks.

The catalogue was published in conjunction with the Triennale di Milano, Centro studi G. Terragni, and the Centro internazionale di studi de architettura Andrea Palladio.

item_t: Antoni Tàpies : The Complete Works. Vol. IV: 1976-1981.

name: Tal Coat, Pierre

cronology: The catalogue can be searched by various rubrics: keyword, catalogue number, technique, period, illustration, place of creation, etc.  The site also includes a biography, a list of exhibitions and a bibliography.
ind_entr_cont: Individual entries give information on catalogue number, title, date, technique, dimensions, signatures, site locations for works created, collection, provenance, exhibitions, and bibliographic references.

public_note: Only the first volume has appeared to date.

name: Tamarind Workshop
item_t: Tamarind Lithography Workshop, Inc. : Catalogue raisonné,  1960-1970.
imprint: Albuquerque, NM : University of New Mexico Art Museum, 1989.

name: Takal, Pete
item_t: Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints of Peter Takal.
imprint: East Lansing : Kresge Art Museum, Michigan State University, 1986.
public_note: Produced in conjunction with an exhibition of Takal's prints at the Kresge Art Museum, Michigan State University.  The checklist photographs are by Roger Watson.

name: Talbot, William Henry Fox
item_t: The William Henry Fox Talbot Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Scharf, Larry (Project Dir.)
cronology: This project integrates the holdings of over 100 institutions; launched with 1,000 images.  When completed, the database will include approximately 25,000 item records.
ind_entr_cont: Image entries have notes, annotations, essays, and cross referencing to other sources and links.  The records can be searched by photographer, title, collection, provenance, date, genre, location, and keywords. Surviving negatives can be viewed alongside the prints (regardless of  location).

name: Tait, Arthur Fitzwilliam
item_t: Arthur Fitzwilliam Tait: Artist in the Adirondacks.
author_s:
Cadbury, Warder H. (essays)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marsh, Henry F. (Checklist)
imprint: Newark : University of Delaware Press;  Cranberry, NJ: Associated University Presses, 1986.
public_note: The catalogue corresponds to "A.F. Tait Checklist" of 1,557 paintings catalogued by the artist between 1850 and 1904. Supplementing the catalogue are approximately 180 accepted works which have been inserted into the checklist chronologically.  There are separate appendices of works produced in England, lithographs, and American prints after Tait.

name: Tamarind Workshop
item_t: Tamarind : 40 Years.
author_s:
Devon, Marjorie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Acton, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tallman, Susan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Adams, Clinton                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gilmour, Pat
imprint: Albuquerque : University of New Mexico Press, 2000.
public_note:
A reference work covering the period 1960-2000, published on the occasion of the workshop's fortieth anniversary.
A 50th anniversary catalog was also issued under Marjorie Devon's editorship: "Tamarind Touchstones : Fabulous at Fifty..." (University of  New Mexico Press, 2010; isbn 9780826347398). to accompany a traveling exhibition documenting the recent activities of the workshop, illustrated by a selection of 90 lithographs.

name: Szènes, Arpad
item_t: Arpad Szenes : catalogue raisonné des dessins et des peintures.
author: Calzetta Jaeger, Chiara
public_note: From the series "Archives des arts".  The catalogue includes approximately 5,000 paintings, gouaches and drawings executed between 1905 and 1983.

name: Swanevelt, Herman van
item_t: Herman van Swanevelt (um 1603-1655) : Gemälde und Zeichnungen.
author: Steland, Anne Charlotte
public_note:
The first volume includes a biography; listings and discussions of paintings, frescoes, and drawings from Swanevelt's years in Rome and Paris; sources of Swanevelt's style; and his influence on his peers.  

The Appendix includes primary sources on the artist, including a list of Swanevelt's pictures in the inventories of Cardinal Barberini in the Pamphili in Rome from 1644 and the Buen Retiro Palace in Madrid from 1701.

name: Sutherland, Graham
item_t: Graham Sutherland : The Complete Graphic Work.

name: Sweerts, Michael
item_t: Michael Sweerts : Brussels 1618 - Goa 1664.
public_note: There are chapters dedicated to Sweerts' early life, his genre paintings, portrait style, Roman period, Brussels Academy paintings, religious paintings, his Dutch period, and etchings.

name: Svabinsky, Maximilián
item_t: Max Svabinsky : soupis kreslirskeho a malirskeho dila 1879-1916 = Catalogue of Drawings and Paintings 1870-1916.
author_s:
Svabinska, Zusana                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sevcik, Vaclav                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kuna, Martin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Orlikové, Jany (essay)
public_note: The publication is in Czech with a brief English summary. The catalogue is based on the research of Zusana Svabinsky, the artist's adopted daughter.  The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's early paintings and drawings, roughly dating from the time he lived in the village of Kozlov.

name: Sughi, Alberto

author: Parmiggiani, Sandro

author: Hart, Charles Henry
public_note: This is a annotated list of Sully's own register of works, arranged and edited by Hart.  The author notes that Sully's register is incomplete, and includes a separate list of authentic portraits not listed in the register. The catalogue is unillustrated.

name: Sullivan, Louis H.

imprint: Chicago : Richard Nickel Committee : Distributed by the University of Chicago Press, 2010.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue includes collaborative and solo projects.

name: Sully, Thoma
item_t: The Life and Work of Thomas Sully (1783-1872).
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is divided into separate catalogues of the portraits, miniatures, and subject paintings. The authors note that the catalogue is based on Sully's original register of works, but includes works omitted from the artist's list.

name: Stuck, Franz von
item_t: Franz von Stuck 1863-1928: Werkkatalog der Gemälde mit einer Einführung in seinen Symbolismus.
public_note: This was the first volume to be published in the series: "Materialien zur Kunst des 19. Jahrhunderts".

name: Stüler, Friedrich Augu
item_t: Friedrich August Stüler, 1800-1865.

name: Stürmer-Alex, Erika
item_t: Erika Stürmer-Alex : Malerei-Grafik, Plastik, Objekte-Installationen : Werke 1962-2018.
public_note: The DVD is titled "Die figürliche Malerei war mir fremd".  It contains an interview with the artist by Gabriele Muschter and Uwe Warnke, as well as images of Stürmer-Alex's work.

name: Strozzi, Bernardo
item_t: Bernardo Strozzi.
author: Mortari, Luisa
public_note:
This is a new edition of the author's monograph, which was first published in 1966. 

Manzitti's 2013 catalogue raisonné (See entry cited in this database) lists works accepted by Mortari, but are no longer considered to be authentic.

name: Strozzi, Bernardo
item_t: Bernardo Strozzi.
author: Manzitti, Camillo
imprint: Turin ; New York : U. Allemandi & Co., 2013.
public_note:
The introduction addresses the need for a re-examination of some of the attributed works and copies after Strozzi that were included in Mortari's early monograph on the artist (See entry cited in this database).

The catalogue raisonné is divided by theme: subject paintings, still-lifes, portraits, drawings, and addenda.  There is also a discussion of the drawings contained in the so-called "Sagredo Album", a subject index, and a list of works in public collections and historical palaces.

name: Stuart, Gilbe
item_t: The Life and Works of Gilbert Stuart…with Selections from Stuart's Portraits Reproduced on Steel and by Photogravure.
author: Mason, George C.
public_note: The catalogue includes a biography of the artist, copies of letters sent to Stuart.  There are also essays on portraits of Stuart, the 1828 exhibition of his works, and Stuart's portraits of George and Martha Washington and members of their circle.

name: Strindberg, Augu
item_t: Strindbergs måleri.
author: Söderström, Göran

public_note: The catalogue raisonné is included in the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Museum für Moderne Kunst, Frankfurt. The publication has parallel texts in German and English, but the catalogue raisonné is only in English.

name: Stuart, Gilbe

author: Fielding, Mantle
public_note: This publication is extracted from the "Pennsylvania Magazine of History and Biography" (v. 38), 1914.

public_note: The introductory texts include biographies of the members of the Strigel family of artists.

author: Fielding, Mantle

                                                            Dixon, Rob                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Clayton, Tim
imprint: Abingdon : Stipple Publishing Ltd.; London : Distributed by Sotheby's, 1989.
public_note:
The introductory essays include a list of engravers and publishers with whom Stubbs worked, prints after Stubbs, and a discussion of Stubbs as an engraver and publisher. 

The Appendix contains a discussion of the life and works of the artist's son, George Townley Stubbs (1756-1818), with a checklist of his graphic works.  There are also sections dealing with Prints associated with George Stubbs and Portraits of George Stubbs.

name: Stuart, Gilbe
item_t: Gilbert Stuart : An Illustrative Descriptive List of His Works, Compiled by Lawrence Park, with an Account of His Life by John Hill Morgan.

Park, Lawrence                                                            ;&nbsp

public_note: Following Lawrence Park's death, the catalogue raisonné was completed by William Sawitzky, Mrs. E. Hadley Galbreath, John Hill Morgan, and Theodore Bolton.

public_note: Subtitle: "Leids schilder en burgermeester." Catalogue raisonné of 62 works, published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibition at the Stedelijk Museum De Lakenhal, Leiden.

author: Egerton, Judy
imprint: New Haven; London : Yale University Press for the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art, 2007.
public_note: The publication includes a lengthy discussion of Stubbs' life, career and working methods. There is also a complete catalogue of Stubbs's paintings and drawings, with a separate catalogue dealing with paintings "reliably recorded, but now untraced".

item_t: Subreal.
imprint: Bucharest : National Museum of Contemporary Art ; Vienna : Verlag für Moderne Kunst, 2015.
public_note: The catalogue was published following a 2012-2013 exhibition held at the Muzeul National de Arta Contemporana (Bucharest) and SALT Beyogl (Istanbul).

name: Strand, Paul
item_t: Paul Strand in Mexico.
public_note: Appendix to the publication catalogues all of Strand's photographs during his stay in Mexico (1932-1934).  Publication includes a DVD of Strand's 1936 film "Redes" (The Wave).

name: Sterl, Robert Hermann

name: Stenner, Hermann

item_t: Hermann Stenner : Aquarelle und Zeichnungen.

public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Muzeum umeni Olomouc- Arcidiecezni muzeum Kromertz, with collaboration from the Department of the History of Art, Masaryk University, Brno.  The catalogue includes a very brief Summary in English.

name: Steenwijck, Susanna van
item_t: The Steenwyck Family as Masters of Perspective.
author: Howarth, Jeremy
public_note:
From the series "Pictora Nova." This is a catalogue raisonné of the known works of Hendrick van Steenwyck the Elder, Hendrick van Steenwyck the Younger, and the latter's wife, Susanna van Steenwyck (neè Gaspoel).

The catalogue includes autograph works, attributed works, works possibly by the artist, and works produced in collaboration with other artists.

In addition to the catalogue raisonne, the publication includes ten chapters dealing with  the Steenwyck family's artistic production and development, and the socio-economic background in the Netherlands, England, Scotland and elsewhere at the time.

name: Steenwijck, Hendrick van, the younge

public_note:
From the series "Pictora Nova." This is a catalogue raisonné of the known works of Hendrick van Steenwyck the Elder, Hendrick van Steenwyck the Younger, and the latter's wife, Susanna van Steenwyck (neè Gaspoel).

The catalogue includes autograph works, attributed works, works possibly by the artist, and works produced in collaboration with other artists.

In addition to the catalogue raisonne, the publication includes ten chapters dealing with  the Steenwyck family's artistic production and development, and the socio-economic background in the Netherlands, England, Scotland and elsewhere at the time.

The catalogue includes autograph works, attributed works, works possibly by the artist, and works produced in collaboration with other artists.

In addition to the catalogue raisonne, the publication includes ten chapters dealing with  the Steenwyck family's artistic production and development, and the socio-economic background in the Netherlands, England, Scotland and elsewhere at the time.

name: Soutter, Lou

author: Thévoz, Michel
public_note:
Revised from the author's dissertation presented at the Université de Lausanne. The publication is volume 4 from the series "Catalogues raisonnés d'artistes suisses".

The first volume has a biographical and aesthetic study of the artist. The second contains the catalogue raisonné, which is organized by date or theme. Individual entries give number, title, inscriptions, technique and dimensions, with references to the full bibliography found in the first volume. 
Appendicies contain letters and texts by the artist, and a list of principal collections housing his works.

name: Spencer, Stanley

author: Bell, Keith
imprint: New York : Phaidon (in association with Christie's & The Henry Moore Foundation), 1992.

name: Smit, Philippe
item_t: The Complete Works of Philippe Smit.
cronology: Individual entries include color image, title and alternate title, date, related works (if any), signature and inscription information, provenance, exhibitions, references, and comments.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné covers the artists works in all media, including paintings, drawings, watercolors, decorative boxes, and pastels. The project includes a video presentation on how to consult the catalogue raisonné. The catalogue raisonné can be searched by classification, decade, medium, subject, and keyword, and futher sorted by catalogue number, title, date and classification.

name: Smith, David
item_t: The Sculpture of David Smith : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Krauss, Rosalind E.
public_note:
Originally published as the author's 1969 dissertation presented at Harvard University.  The catalogue lists over 700 works, including sculpture, jewelry, and miscellaneous and posthumous works. 
Entries do not provide much critical analysis or comparative information. For that information, the author refers to her critical monograph, "Terminal Ironworks: The Sculpture of David Smith" (MIT Press, 1971).

name: Smith, Matthew Arnold Bracy

author: Gledhill, John
imprint: Farnham, UK : Burlington, VT : Lund Humphries, 2009.
public_note: Based on the author's thesis of the same title, presented at the University of York, 2000. The present publication catalogues 753 oil paintings by the artist from 1905-1957.

name: Soulages, Pierre
item_t: Soulages : l'oeuvre complet, peintures, t. 1 : 1946-1959.
author: Encrevé, Pierre
ind_entr_cont: The entries, in chronological order, cite catalogue number, title, medium and support, signature information, collection, one-man and group exhibitions, provenance, and have bibliographic references when available.

name: Soulages, Pierre
item_t: Soulages : les peintures, 1946-2006.
author: Encrevé, Pierre
public_note:
The present publication is a new single volume edition of the earlier first 3 volumes of the  catalogue raisonné issued by Editions du Seuil, 1994-1998 (cited in this database). 

This volume reproduces the complete original text accompanying 1,174 oil paintings on canvas.  Although many libraries do not call this publication a catalogue raisonné, it is an addition to the oeuvre catalogue, with a new chapter on 130 paintings created between 1997-2006.  It also traces the artist's work with an analysis of the paintings, examines the different techniques he developed, and looks at the critical reception of his work.

name: Soutine, Chaim
item_t: Soutine ; peintre du déchirant.
author: Courthion, Pierre
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the paintings lists 531 works, mostly oil paintings.  The author notes that this number is far below the actual number of paintings that Soutine actually executed.  Consequently, Courthion had planned to publish a supplement to the catalogue, but this project was never realized.

name: Soutine, Chaim
item_t: Soutine, catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre dessinée.
author: Lanthemann, Joseph
public_note: This is a somewhat controversial catalogue raisonné listing a small number of portrait drawings that the author believes are by Soutine.

name: Sluijters, Johannes Carolus Bernardu
item_t: Jan Sluijters : het geschilderde oeuvre.
cronology:
The catalogue raisonné is organized chronologically by decade and then by year.  The catalogue lists approximately 1500 paintings. Some works on paper that relate to the painted works are included.  

All paintings are illustrated with scalable color images, and each has a link to the record in the RKD database, which includes additional information.  Individual entries include title, date, inscriptions, dimensions, current location, and some brief notes.
ind_entr_cont: This is an e-publication from the RKD Monographs series, and housed on the RKD Netherlands Institute for Art History Website.  The catalogue raisonné of the paintings follows the introductory essays on Sluijters' biography and artistic career.
public_note: check_needed

public_note:
The author states that a complete catalogue raisonné of  Sickert's work was impossible due to the artist's habit of often changing his titles, but this as complete a listing as possible of works she accepts, has seen, or knows from photographs.
All 2762 works are fully catalogued with scholarly apparatus; and have been grouped together by different types of subject matter, presented in chronological sequence as much as possible.

                                                            Adams, Clive                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            See-Paynton, Colin (essay)
imprint: Aldershot, Hants, England : Scolar Press; Brookfield, VT : Ashgate Publishing in assocaition with the Glynn Vivian Art Gallery, 1996.

name: Seidler, Louise
item_t: Louise Seidler (1786-1866) : Leben und Werk : mit einem Oeuvreverzeichnis ihrer Ölgemälde, Pastelle und bildmässigen Zeichnungen.
author: Kaufmann, Sylke

name: Seghers, Hercule
item_t: Hercules Segers : The Complete Etchings.
public_note: The publication includes a supplement by Eduard Trautscholdt in German: "Der Katalog der Radierungen [Ruischers]".  The supplement catalogues the etchings of Johannes Ruischers, an imitator of Hercules Segers, who is known as "Jonge Hercules".

name: Seghers, Hercule
item_t: Hercules Segers : Painter, Etcher.
public_note: The catalogue contains essays and entries on every painting and drawing, plus all print impressions attributed to Segers.  The etchings catalogue builds on E. Haverkamp Begemann's earlier catalogue (see entry in this database), adding 2 new works.   The chronological catalogue of the paintings includes 16 works.

name: Scott, William
item_t: William Scott : Catalogue Raisonné of Oil Paintings.
ind_entr_cont: In all four volumes, the catalogue raisonné is chronologically organized. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, signature information, provenance, commentary, exhibition history, literature, and when the work was last examined.
public_note: Volume Four includes an appendix of works, unpublished texts by the artist, and an exhibition list.

name: Schwitters, Ku
item_t: Kurt Schwitters : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Orchard, Karin (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schulz, Isabel (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schwitters, Lola & Bengt                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Krempel, Ulrich
imprint: Ostfildern Ruit : Hatje Cantz ; Hanover : Sprengel Museum ; New York : Distributed in the USA  by D.A.P., 2000-2006.
public_note: This catalogue raisonné is published by the Sprengel Museum on behalf of the Niedersächsische Sparkassenstiftung, the Norddeutsche Landesbank, and the Stadtsparkasse Hannover.

name: Schuffenecker, Claude-Emile
item_t: Claude-Emile Schuffenecker 1851-1934 : Catalogue Raisonné Supplement. v.2
author: Grossvogel, Jill-Elyse
public_note: Supplement adds an additional 205 works to the artist's oeuvre. It also includes approximately 30 previously unpublished documents, plus an initial checklist of Claude-Emile and Amédée Schuffenecker's prescient collection of modern art.

name: Sculpture Micronesia Nukuoro Island
item_t: Nukuoro : Sculptures from Micronesia.
author_s:
Wick, Oliver (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kaufmann, Christian (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grunne, Bernard de
public_note: This is the publication of  the results of a scholars' conference held at the Beyeler Museum in 2009 on the occasion of an exhibition entitled "Visual Encounters" (presenting 15 Nukuoro sculptures).   The study also includes comments translated from earlier sources.

name: Scully, Sean
item_t: Sean Scully Prints : Catalogue Raisonné 1968-1999.
author: Martino, Victoria
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Graphische Sammlung Albertina, Vienna, the Musée du Dessin et de l'Estampe Originale, Gravelines, and the Von der Heydt-Museum, Wuppertal.

name: Scully, Sean
item_t: Sean Scully : Catalogue Raisonné. Volume II: 1980-1989.
author: Price, Marla
public_note: This is the first volume issued in a projected five-volume catalogue raisonné.

name: Schultze, Bernard

author_s:
Diederich, Stephan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hermann, Barbara                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lichtenstern, Christa
public_note: The apparatus for the chronological catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings and objects  includes number, title, dimensions, medium and support, provenance, exhibitions, and bibliography.  Works are cross-referenced with the artist's handwritten work list numbers.

name: Sedlacek, Franz
item_t: Franz Sedlacek : 1891-1945 : Monografie mit Verzeichnis der Gemälde.
author_s:
Spindler, Gabriele                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Strohhammer, Andreas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hintner, Elisabeth (preface)

name: Schuffenecker, Claude-Emile
item_t: Claude-Emile Schuffenecker : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Grossvogel, Jill-Elyse
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 2000.
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of 567 authentic works.

name: Schut, Cornel
item_t: Cornelis Schut (1597-1655) : A Flemish Painter of the High Baroque.
author: Wilmers, Gertrude
public_note: The catalogue of accepted works is arranged chronologically. The publication also includes separate catalogues of works known only by description, copies after Schut, and erroneous attribution, arranged by subject.

name: Schulze, Memph
item_t: Memphis Schulze : Werkverzeichnis 1969-1993 = Catalogue Raisonné 1969-1993.
author_s:
Schulze, Max (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Menne, Katrin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schulze, Phillip
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was compiled by the artist's sons and Katrin Manne.  There are also bilingual texts by Petra Lange-Berndt and Dietmar Rübel.

name: Sebastiano del Piombo
item_t: L'opera completa di Sebastiano del Piombo.
public_note: Part of the "Classici dell'arte" series. The catalogue lists 253 paintings, drawings and frescoes, all illustrated in b&w thumbnails.

name: Scuffi, Marcello
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Marcello Scuffi.
author: Faccenda, Giovanni (ed.)
public_note: This the first volume, containing over 800 works by the artist.  Introductory materials include several essays, as well as a collection of critical reviews of the artist's work.  There are also biographical notes, a list of solo exhibitions, a bibliography.

name: Schöfelder, Baldu
item_t: Baldur Schönfelder Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Schäfer, Siegfried B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Witteveen, Cecilia A.M.
cronology: The catalogue lists 767 examples of the artist's work, documenting sculptural objects (1960-c.2016), reliefs and assemblages (1963-2017), sculpture for architecture (1964-), as well as some graphic works and paintings.   There is also a list of destroyed works.  Individual catalogue entries give information on title, date, dimensions, inscriptions, exhibitions, collection, references, and images when available.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné includes a collection of texts both by and about the artist (texts are in German).  There is also a bibliography, a list of exhibitions, a chronology

name: Schrag, Karl
item_t: Karl Schrag: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Graphic Works
author_s:
Johnson, Una E                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Freundlich, August L                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Iacono, Domenic Joseph
imprint: Syracuse : School of Art ; Syracuse : Syracuse University Art Collection, 1971-1990

name: Schönfeld, Johann Heinrich
item_t: Johann Heinrich Schönfeld: die Gëmalde
author: Pée, Herbert

name: Schoonover, Frank Earle
item_t: Frank E. Schoonover : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Schoonover, John                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schoonover Smith, Louise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dean, LeeAnn
imprint: Newcastle, DE : Oak Knoll Books & Press, 2009.
public_note: The catalogue of the artist's sketches and paintings is organized chronogically, with catalogue numbers corresponding to entries in the artist's daybook. In addition to the catalogue, the Appendices contain information regarding Schoonover's models, exhibitions and students.  The bibliography lists illustrations in serial publications, references, and illustrated works.

name: Schönebeck, Eugen
item_t: Eugen Schönebeck.
author: Hirsch, Thomas
public_note:
The publication has the alternate title "Eugen Schönebeck: Junge Kunst". 

In addition to the introductory essay, there is a detailed chronology and an illustrated catalogue of all of the artist's 39 known oil paintings and 400 drawings.

name: Schönebeck, Eugen
item_t: Eugen Schönebeck, 1957-1967.
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Schirn-Kunsthalle Frankfurt. The publication reproduces all of the artist's surviving canvases as well as approximately 40 works on paper.

name: Schongauer, Martin
item_t: Martin Schongauer als Maler.
author: Buchner, Ernst
public_note: An earlier monograph but a considered an essential reference work on the artist's small painted oeuvre; it was issued in the series: "Denkmäler deutscher Kunst".

name: Schmid, Aldo
item_t: Aldo Schmid : (1935-1978) : catalogo ragionato.
public_note: Published in conjunction with the Museo d'arte moderna e contemporanea di Trento e Rovereto. The author is the artist's widow.

name: Schmidt, Martin Johann
item_t: Das graphische Werk Martin Johann Schmidt's (Kremser Schmidt) 1718-1801.
author: Garzarolli-Thurnlackh, Karl
public_note: The catalogue is divided into drawings and prints.

name: Schlosser, Gérard
item_t: Gérard Schlosser.
author: Jouffroy, Alain
public_note: A monographic study, with a catalogue raisonné of paintings 1964-1992.

name: Schmidt-Rottluff, Karl
item_t: Karl Schmidt-Rottluff : das graphische Werk seit 1923.
author: Rathenau, Ernest
imprint: New York : E. Rathenau, vormals Euphorion Verlag, Berlin, 1964.
public_note: The catalogue was reprinted 1976.  For the artist's earlier works, see: Schapire, Rosa "Karl Schmidt-Rottluffs graphisches Werk bis 1923" (cited in this database).

name: Schmidt-Rottluff, Karl
item_t: Karl Schmidt-Rotluff : Plastik und Kunsthandwerk : Werkverzeichnis.
author: Wietek, Gerhard
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 527 works, including carvings in wood, metal, bone, horn and stone; textile and furniture designs; murals; tablewares; and other decorative objects.

name: Schmidt-Rottluff, Karl
item_t: Karl Schmidt-Rottluffs graphisches Werk bis 1923.
imprint: New York : E. Rathenau vormals Euphorion Verlag Berlin, 1987.
public_note: Reprint of earlier editions published respectively in 1924 (Berlin), 1965 (Hamburg), and 1978 (Berlin, New York).

name: Schilking, Heinrich
item_t: Heinrich Schilking, ein westfälischer Maler der 19. Jahrhunderts : Katalog zur Ausstellung des Dezentralen Stadtmuseums Warendorf vom 8. November 2015 bis zum 24. Januar 2016 im historischen Rathaus Waredorf.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition, the catalogue also includes a catalogue raisonné of the artist 's oeuvre.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : Persönlichkeit und Werk.
public_note: The catalogue is published under Otto Nirenstein, Otto Kallir's former name. Only 500 copies were printed.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : The Complete Works Online.
cronology: The catalogue raisonné can be searched by title, date, subject, number, and keyword.   Entries include title in German and English, provenance, references, inscriptions, date, exhibitions, comments, and links to related works.  For sculptures and print works, the catalogue includes information on foundry marks, edition size, trial proofs, and casts.
ind_entr_cont: The online publication is based on Jane Kallir’s print catalogue "Egon Schiele: The Complete Works", published in 1990, expanded in 1998  (See entries cited in this database).  Works authenticated since the 1990 publication are assigned numbers and letters that place them logically within the original sequence.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : Oeuvre Catalogue of the Paintings.
author_s:
Kallir, Otto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Benesch, Otto (essays)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Messer, Thomas M. (essays)
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue contains a list of paintings in chronological and alphabetical order; examples of Schiele's signature; and documentary materials with photos, letters, and fascimiles from Schiele's notebooks.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries include provenance, exhibition history, comments, signature & inscriptions, and where the painting is illustrated. The second part of the catalogue raisonné lists 51 works known only from documents.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : The Graphic Work.
author: Kallir, Otto

name: Schermuly, Pete
item_t: Schermuly : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Mosebach, Martin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schermuly, Brigitte                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dittmeyer-Hössl, Daria
public_note: The catalogue includes introductory essays on the artist's life and works, including a memoir of Schermuly by the artist Stephen McKenna, and three essays on painting by Schermuly.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings, sketches and murals, compiled by Daria Dittmeyer-Hössel.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : Paintings, Watercolors, Drawings.
author: Leopold, Rudolf
public_note:
This is the translation of the original German language edition published by Residenz Verlag, Salzburg, 1972. A revised edition is currently in preparation by the Egon Schiele Documentation Centre at the Leopold Museum. 

In addition to the introductory texts on Schiele's life and work, the catalogue includes separate discussions of Schiele's patrons, friends and opponents, and the critical reception of his work.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Kallir, Jane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fischer, Wolfgang G. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bachert, Hildegard (collab. on c.r.)
public_note: The catalogue was published in tandem with Leonardo Editore, Milan (ISBN: 8835501024); Meulenhoff/ Landshoff, Amsterdam (ISBN: 9029083379); Julio Ollero Editori, Madrid (ISBN: 8478960015); Thames & Hudson, London (ISBN: 0500092141).

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Kallir, Jane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fischer, Wolfgang G. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bachert, Hildegard (collaborator: cr)
public_note: This is an expanded edition of the 1990 publication (see entry cited in this database). The revised edition includes 200 new catalogue entries and 32 additional pages of text. New illustrations accompany the supplement to the catalogue raisonné and the section on sketchbooks.

name: Schiele, Egon
item_t: Egon Schiele : The Complete Paintings, 1909-1918.
public_note: Catalogue entries include materials, dimensions, signature information, concordances, comments,, exhibitions, provenance, and bibliographical references.

name: Schindler, Emil Jacob
item_t: Emil Jakob Schindler : Zeugnisse eines ungewöhl. Künsterlebens. Werkkatalog.
author: Fuchs, Henrich
public_note: The catalogue raisonné features 912 entries, only some of which are illustrated, arranged chronologically. The publication also includes the artist's biography with notes from his daily journal.

name: Schlesinger, Gil
item_t: Gil Schlesinger : Werke 1961-2016.
author: Tauscher, Sabine
public_note: The publication includes numerous essays on the artist's life, personality and career.  The artist himself contributed several texts, including some "thoughts on painting".  The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Sabine Tauscher and is organized by theme and includes, self portraits, portraits, landscapes, collages, Jewish themes, etc.

name: Schlemmer, Oska
item_t: Oskar Schlemmer ; Zeichnungen und Graphik : Oeuvrekatalog.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's pencil drawings, pen and ink drawings, monotypes, etchings, and lithographs.

name: Schlemmer, Oska
item_t: Oscar Schlemmer: Monographie und Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Maur, Karin von

name: Schlick, Jörg
item_t: Jörg Schlick : Monografie und Werkverzeichnis = Monograph and Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Graz : KM-Künstlerhaus, Halle für Kunst & Medien : Cologne : Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther König, 2018.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Künstlerhaus, Halle für Kunst und Medien, Graz, 2018.  There are parallel texts in German and English.

name: Schoder, Thilo

author_s:
Rüdiger, Ulrike                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brodale, Klaus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schellenberg, Sabine                                                            ;&nbsp

name: Schoenberg, Arnold
item_t: Arnold Schönberg : Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Vienna : Arnold Schönberg Center ; New York : Distributed in North America by Thames & Hudson, 2005.
public_note:
Published in conjunction with the Arnold Schönberg Center Privatstiftung. The catalogue raisonné reproduces all of the artist/composer's paintings and drawings.

The documents section includes critical reviews of Schönberg's work, and excerpts from Schönberg's unpublished writings and correspondence. There are also a list of people portrayed by Schönberg, a list of lost paintings and drawings, and a discussion of Schönberg's materials and artistic technique.

name: Schenck, William
item_t: Bill Schenck : Catalogue Raisonné of Serigraphs, 1971-1996.
public_note: Published on the occasion of exhibitions held in 2010 and 2011 at the Art Museum of Eastern Idaho, and the Tucson Museum of Art.

name: Schenau, Johann Eleaza
item_t: Schenau (1737-1806) : Monografie und Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde, Handzeichnungen und Druckgrafik vonJohann Eleasar Zeizzig, gen. Schenau.
author: Fröhlich-Schauseil, Anke
public_note: Individual entries include title, medium, signature information, notes, references, and provenance.

name: Scheib, Han
item_t: Hans Scheib : Mimesis : Bronzen, 1986-2012 = Bronzes, 1986-2012.
author_s:
Cerny, Angela (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Scheib, Hans                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Laurie, Eileen

name: Schäufelein, Hans, the Elde
item_t: Die Zeichnungen Hans Süss von Kulmbachs und Hans Leonhard Schäufeleins.
author: Winkler, Friedrich
public_note:
This is a monographic study the artists' drawings, with an appendix of copies and falsely attributed works.

Drawings attributed to Hans Süss von Kulmbach are arranged according to type and function of the drawing (ie. Designs for altars etc.). Works by Schäufelein are organized by period.

name: Schäufelein, Hans, the Elde
item_t: Hans Schäufelin als Maler.
author: Metzger, Christof
public_note: Based on the author's doctoral thesis, presented at the Universität Augsburg, 1999.  The catalogue was published in the series: Denkmäler deutscher Kunst.

name: Scheffer von Leonhardshoff, Johan Evangel
item_t: Johann Evangelist Scheffer von Leonhardshoff, detto il Raffaelino, 1795-1822 : ein Beitrag zur Romantik in Wien.
author: Krapf, Michael
public_note: Sometimes called the "little Raphael" (Raffaelino) the artist was a member of the "Lukasbund" in Rome.  Introductory material includes an essay on the history of the artist's critical reception.  The essays deal with Scheffer's paintings on various Rafaelesque themes, his life and work in Vienna and Rome in the early 19th century, and a consideration of the roll of  the "Nazarene" in the Romantic Period.

name: Schalcken, Godfried
item_t: Godfried Schalcken.
author: Beherman, Thierry

name: Scheffler, Thomas Christian
item_t: Christoph Thomas Scheffler (1699-1756) : Visualisierung barocker Frömmigkeit.
author: Hartmann, Simone
public_note: Published in the series "Studien zur christlichen Kunst".   he catalogue was originally presented as the author's doctoral dissertation at the Universität München in 2012.

name: Scharl, Josef
item_t: Josef Scharl : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Firmenich, Andrea (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lukas, Andrea                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bronner, Peter
public_note: The catalogue was published on the occasion of a exhibition: "Josef Scharl, eine Retrospektive"  held at the Kunsthalle in Emden, and other venues.

name: Schatz, Otto Rudolf
item_t: Online Werkverzeichnis Otto Rudolf Schatz.
author_s:
Cabuk, Cornelia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Huemer, Christian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rollig, Stella                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kraft, Dietrich
cronology: Individual entries include title, date, inscription and signature information, references, exhibitions,  provenance, and descriptive comments. All works, wherever possible, are reproduced in color
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue of the artist's total oeuvre lists over 800 works, and can be searched chronologically, by keyword or by medium (paintings, drawing and graphic works).  The online catalogue is supplemented by the print monograph and catalogue raisonné of the paintings, the texts of which are available here online in English (see separate entry in this database).
public_note: check_needed

name: Schatz, Otto Rudolf
item_t: Otto Rudolf Schatz, 1900-1961.
imprint: Weitra : Bibliothek der Provinz, Publication P No. 1, 2010.
public_note: A "preliminary or provisional work catalogue" of the artist's paintings and drawings. There are brief entries with some collection information, but no critical comments.

name: Schadow, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Schadow : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde mit einer Auswahl der dazugehörigen Zeichnungen und Druckgraphiken.
author_s:
Paffrath, Hans                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baumgärtel, Bettina (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grewe, Cordula
imprint: Petersberg : Michael Imhof Verlag ; Dusseldorf : Museum Kunstpalast, 2017.
public_note: Published on the 150th anniversary of the Galerie Paffrath, in cooperation with the Museum Kunstpalast, Dusseldorf.  The  publication includes an introductory essay, the catalogue raisonné, and Appendices with title and name indices, a bibliography, and a list of locations holding works by and after Schadow.

name: Schärer, Han
item_t: Hans Schärer Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Schärer, Gregory                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Graeff, Max Christian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rohrer, Carmen
cronology: Entries include an illustration of the work, title, dimensions, medium and support, and brief descriptive comments.  There are no bibliographical citations, collection, or exhibition information.  Images can be enlarged, but are not scalable.  Users can also browse works arranged in chronological order.
ind_entr_cont: This online database is issued under the auspices of the Swiss Institute of Art Science (SIK-ISEA). The catalogue raisonné is still incomplete, but currently lists over 2,400 works.

name: Schadow, Johann Gottfried
item_t: Johann Gottfried Schadow : die Zeichnungen.
author_s:
Badstübner-Gröger, Sibylle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Czok, Claudia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Simson, Jutta von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hofmann, Werner (essay)
public_note:
The catalogue is organized by subject: nudes, allegories, drawings after the antique, etc.
Individual entries give title, date, medium, dimensions, provenance, archival references, literature, location, and extensive comments.

name: Schad, Christian
item_t: Christian Schad, 1894-1982 : Volume 2 : Photographs.
author: Kaufhold, Enno
public_note: The texts include a biographical essay and a discussion of Schad's use of photography in his work. Vol. 2 has a CD-ROM containing the complete catalogue of  images.  A German edition was also published

name: Schad, Christian
item_t: Christian Schad, 1894-1982 : Volume 1 : Paintings
public_note: The catalogue lists 309 portraits by the artist, divided into the following categories: paintings; color reliefs; formica pictures, reverse glass, and stucco samples; and murals & wall decorations.

name: Schaefler, Fritz
item_t: Fritz Schaefler 1888-1954: im Spannungsfeld des Expressionismus: Malerei und Grafik: eine Ausstellung im Deutschen Klingenmuseum, Solingen.
author: Thiel, Vera
public_note: Catalogue of exhibition at the Klingenmuseum, Solingen [11.24.1996 - 2.2.1997]. This is a large (preliminary) catalogue of the artist's work, that is often used as a reference to his oeuvre. However,  it includes few illustrations.

name: Schafer, Frederick Ferdinand
item_t: Frederick Ferdinand Schafer (1839-1927) : A Preliminary Catalog of his Paintings.
author: Saltzer. Jerome H.
cronology: The catalogue raisonné can be searched by subject, title, date, and medium.  Users can also search for doubtful and attributed works.
public_note: This is an online inventory of paintings by the 19th-century German-born landscape painter of the American West.  The site documents almost 800 oil paintings, watercolors and murals by the artist.  There also is information regarding approximately 140 other incompletely documented works.

name: Schatz, Otto Rudolf
item_t: Otto Rudolf Schatz. Monografie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Rollig, Stella (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kraft, Dietrich                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cabuk, Cornelia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Huemer, Christian (ed.)
public_note: Issued in the series: "Belvedere Werkverzeichnisse", Bd. 7.  There are print and online versions of this publication (for the online edition, see separate entry cited in this database).

name: Scheggi, Paolo
item_t: Paolo Scheggi : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Barbero, Luca Massimo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bignotti, Ilaria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pola, Francesca                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Scheggi, Franca                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Scheggi, Cosima
public_note: Following an introductory essay by the artist's heirs, the publication includes a biography, lists of solo and group exhibitions, an anthology of texts by the artist, and a critical anthology.  There are also documents, writings, photographs and period publications about the artist (many not seen before).

name: Inness, George
item_t: George Inness : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Quick, Michael
imprint: New Brunswick, NJ : Rutgers University Press, in conjunction with the Frank and Katherine Martucci Endowment for the Arts, 2007
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 1,150 paintings and sketches by the artist. Contains a concordance with LeRoy Ireland's 1965 catalogue raisonné (see entry cited in this database).

name: Inness, George
item_t: The Works of George Inness : An Illustrated Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Ireland, LeRoy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goodall, Donald B. (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            McIntyre, Robert G. (foreword)
imprint: Austin, TX : University of Texas Press [1965].
public_note: This catalogue raisonné consists of over 1,500 authentic paintings by the artist.  The second part of the book lists works in alphabetical order without chronological information; these are of unknown date and are not listed in the index.  The author notes that the authenticity of these undated works is unconfirmed.

name: Ipoustéguy, Jean Robe
item_t: Ipoustéguy, l'oeuvre sculpté : catalogue raisonné, 1938-2000.
public_note: Following the catalogue, the publication includes a biography, photobiography, exhibitions list, a list of public collections with the artist's work, bibliography, film, and an alphabetical index of works. The catalogue is interspersed with short statements written by the artist's friends and critics.

name: Scarpitta, Salvatore
item_t: Salvatore Scarpitta : catalogue raisonné.
author: Sansone, Luigi
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue features essays about the artist's life and career.

name: Scacciati, Andrea I

author: Bellesi, Sandro

name: Scarpa, Carlo

name: Savinio, Alberto

author: Vivarelli, Pia

name: Sassu, Alig
item_t: Aligi Sassu : catalogo ragionato dell'opera sacra.
author: Paglione, Alfredo (ed.)
public_note: The publication includes several essays on the artist's religious works as well as a biography.  The catalogue  raisonné is divided by medium: paintings & drawings, prints & illustrations, sculptures & ceramics, and murals & glassworks.  There is also a chronology, a list of exhibitions and a bibliography.

name: Scarpa, Carlo

The catalogue of the complete works is contained in the catalogue of an exhibition held at "Le stanze del vetro", Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice.   In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes essays by various authors on Bianconi's work at the Venini Glassworks in the 1950s; his work as an illustrator; and the reception of Italian glass in America in the early 1950s.

name: Sargent, John Singe

public_note: This is the final volume of the series covering Sargent's mural designs for the Boston Public Library and the Boston Museum of Fine Arts; his work as a war artist in World War I; and his late paintings in New England.

name: Saraceni, Carlo

public_note:

Some entries also include preparatory drawings, as well as related works by other artists in Sargent's circle.

The publication also contains excerpts of Sargent's letters to Claude Monet.

name: Saint-Aubin, Gabriel Jacques de
item_t: Gabriel de Saint-Aubin, peintre, dessinateur et graveur, 1724-1780.
author: Dacier, Emile
public_note:
Dacier did not examine all the art works in person. When he questioned the attribution of an original work he placed an asterisk (*) next to the relevant catalogue number, this was when a work had been previously catalogued as by Saint-Aubin but Dacier doubted the attribution. (For his explanation of this system, see v.2, p. vii). Therefore caution must be exercised when his catalogue numbers are given as pedigree for Saint-Aubin works.

The Bibliothèque nationale in Paris owns Dacier's personal copy of his catalogue, which he continued to update and annotate until shortly before his death. An American scholar, Kim de Beaumont, transcribed these annotations. A copy of her transcriptions is in the Frick Art Reference Library in New York.

imprint: New York : Gagosian Gallery ; Göttingen ; Steidl, 2008.
public_note: Documents 165 paintings from the period 1983-1987.

name: Ruscha, Edward

author_s:

                                                            Wright, Erin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Banham, Reyner
imprint: New York : Gagosian Gallery ; Göttingen : Steidl, 2005.
public_note: Second volume in the catalogue of Ruscha's paintings, containing 178 works completed during the period 1971-1982.

name: Ruscha, Edward
