author_s:
Ruscha, Edward                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Poncey, Pat                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hopps, Walter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bois, Yve-Alain
imprint: New York : Gagosian Gallery ; Göttingen : Steidl, 2003.
public_note: The first in a series of seven projected volumes of the "Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings" of Edward Ruscha. The first volume, edited by Pat Poncey, presents 137 authentic paintings.

name: Ruscha, Edward
item_t: Edward Ruscha : Catalogue Raisonné of the Works on Paper. Volume 2 : 1977-1997.
imprint: New Haven : Gagosian Gallery ; New Haven : Yale University Press, 2019.
public_note: The catalogue covers unique works on paper made between 1977 and 1997, documenting more than 1000 works, may hundreds of which have not been exhibited or seen previously.

name: Ruscha, Edward
item_t: Edward Ruscha : Catalogue Raisonné of the Works on Paper. Volume 1: 1956-1976.
imprint: New York : Gagosian Gallery ; New Haven : Yale University Press, 2014.
ind_entr_cont: Full color images are used whenever possible. Catalogue numbers with a D prefix give year of execution and consecutive number within the year. For most works listed after 1969, the date given reflects the year of completion.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Ruiz Gijón, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Antonio Ruiz Gijón.
author_s:
Dávila-Armero del Arenal, Álvaro                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pérez Morales, José Carlos                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            López-Fe y Figueroa, Carlos María
public_note:
Preliminary material includes a biography of the artist, considerations on the aesthetic nature of his work, and an essay on Gijón in Seville. 

The catalogue raisonné lists documented works and those of secure attribution, it also cites rejected works.  There is a bibliography, plus an appendix with documents.

name: Ruff, Thoma
item_t: Thomas Ruff : Editions 1988-2014.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the editioned works was produced in cooperation with the artist.

name: Ruisdael, Jacob van
item_t: Jacob van Ruisdael : A Complete Catalogue of His Paintings, Drawings and Etchings.
author: Slive, Seymour
public_note:
The catalogues of the paintings and drawings are organized by subject and arranged alphabetically by location. The catalogue of etchings is arranged chronologically. The author lists lost works and works known only from copies in the section of accepted works. 

A separate supplemental section was added  following the appearance of several works on the art market and the discovery of a new drawing by the artist.

name: Rubio Camín, Joaquín
item_t: Joaquin Rubio Camín : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Álvarez Martínez, María Soledad (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mejìa Robledo, Ana Johari
imprint: Madrid : Fundación María Cristina Masaveu Peterson, 2016.
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist written by his daughter.

name: Rude, Franço
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Histoire de P.-P. Rubens, suivie du catalogue général et raisonné de ses tableaux, esquisses, dessins et vignettes, avec l'indication des lieux où ils se trouvent et des artistes qui les ont gravés.
author: Hasselt, André Henri Constant van
imprint: Brussels : Imprimerie de la Societé des Beaux Arts, 1840.
public_note: An early comprehensive, but essentially unillustrated, catalogue of the artist's work.

name: Royle, Stanley
item_t: Stanley Royle : Catalogue of His Works.
public_note: The catalogue was issued in a limited edition of 250 copies.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes essays on the artist's life and work.  The catalogue also includes letters and invitations to exhibitions, lists of the artist's solo and group exhibitions, and a section of selected writings and art criticism.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: L'oeuvre de P.P. Rubens : histoire et description de ses tableaux et dessins.
author: Rooses, Max
public_note: The catalogue is divided into two parts: drawings for engravers, sculptors and architects; and preparatory drawings and studies. There is a separate section of additions and corrections to the previous volumes.

name: Rovisi, Valentino
item_t: Valentino Rovisi nella bottega del grande Tiepolo : "Il metodo di una vera e lodevole imitazione".
author: Felicetti, Chiara (ed.)
imprint: Comunità di Fiemme : Circolo culturale Valentino Rovisi, 2002.
public_note:
Published on the occasion of an exhibition held in Cavalese, Trento, and Cencenighe, 2002-2003.  Introductory material  includes sections on the artist's environment and family, his first stay in Venice, his return home, and subsequent work campaigns in Venice and elsewhere.

There are also appendices which include a chronological table, manuscript sources, references to citations in books and articles, and documents.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens Drawings.
public_note: A monograph issued under the aegis of: "Nationaal Centrum voor de Plastische Kunsten van de XVIde en XVIIde Eeuw", 2.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens : Portraits after Existing Prototypes.
author: Jonckheere, Koenraad

name: Roussel, Théodore
item_t: The Prints of Théodore Roussel : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Hausberg, Margaret Dunwoody
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's etched work.

name: Roux, Constan
item_t: Constant Roux : catalogue raisonné.
author: Noet, Laurent
public_note: The monograph and catalogue raisonné includes a biography of the artist and a catalogue of the paintings, drawings and sculptures.  There is also a section on editions and Roux's reuse of certain works.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens : Copies and Adaptations from Renaissance and Later Artists : Italian Masters. Artists Working in Central Italy and France.
author: Wood, Jeremy
public_note: This is the third (double-volume) section of Part 26 (II) of the Corpus Rubenianum, dealing with Rubens' copies after sixteenth-century Italian artists. This section deals with artists working in Central Italy and France, including Leonardo, Michelangelo and Francesco Primaticcio.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Book Illustration and Title Pages.
author_s:
Judson, J. Richard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Van de Velde, Carl
imprint: London : Harvey Miller ; Philadelphia : Heydon & Son, 1978.
public_note: These volumes are available in their entirety through the Corpus Rubenianum Website as downloadable and searchable pdf files (Click 'Full Text' link to the right).

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens : Copies and Adaptations from Renaissance and Later Artists : Italian Artists. Titian and North-Italian Artists.
author: Wood, Jeremy
public_note: The second of three (double volume) publications covering copies and adaptations made by Rubens after Italian art.  This section covers artists active in Venice and Northern Italy, particularly Titian and his contemporaries, but also other Northern Italian masters such as Mantegna, Correggio and Parmigianino.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens : Works in Collaboration : Jan Brueghel I & II.
author: Mulders, Christine van
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is organized by subject matter. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, provenance, exhibition history, literature, copy information, and commenatry.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: L'oeuvre de P.P. Rubens : histoire et description de ses tableaux et dessins.
author: Rooses, Max
public_note: Volume 4 continues Rubens' secular history paintings,  secular allegories, portraits, genre paintings, landscapes, and animal paintings.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens : Copies and Adaptations from Renaissance and Later Artists : Italian Artists. Raphael and His School.
author: Wood, Jeremy
public_note: This is the first of the three separate (double-volume) publications covering Rubens' copies after sixteenth-century Italian artists, this section deals with Raphael and his school. The second will cover copies after Titian and North Italian artists, and the third will deal with copies after artists working in Central Italy and France.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Rubens : Copies and Adaptations from Renaissance and Later Artists : German and Netherlandish Artists.
author: Belkin, Kristin Lohse
public_note:
The present publication catalogues Rubens' copies after German and Netherlandish prints, drawings, and paintings.  

Volume 1 includes the catalogue raisonné of 147 accepted works, as well as rejected attributions. The second volume contains the indices of collections, subjects, names and places, and titles of other works by Rubens mentioned in the text.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: Architecture and Sculpture : Rubens, Palazzi di Genova : Architectural Drawings and Engravings.

Rott, Herbert W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baudouin, Frans (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Balis, Arnout (ed.)
imprint: London : Harvey Miller (Imprint of Brepols Publishers, Turnhout), 2002.
public_note: This volume is the first part of five in the series covering  Ruben's "Architecture and Architectural Sculpture" (XXII, 1-- XXII, 5).

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: The Costume Book.
author: Belkin, Kristin Lohse
public_note: This was originally presented as the author's doctoral thesis at the University of Washington, Seatlle (1976).

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: L'oeuvre de P.P. Rubens : histoire et description de ses tableaux et dessins.
author: Rooses, Max
public_note: The third volume covers fables and secular history paintings, including the Marie de Medici Cycle and the Entry of Cardinal Infante Ferdinand into Antwerp.

author: Rooses, Max
public_note: Volume 1 contains the religious paintings organized by theme: Religious series (Jesuit Church at Antwerp, Apostles, and Triumph of the Eucharist); Angels; Old Testament; and New Testament (infancy of Christ).

author: Merle du Bourg, Alexis

author: Freedberg, David

imprint: London : Harvey Miller ; New York : Oxford University Press 1989.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is organized according to the  biblical sequence: Genesis, Exodus, etc.  Old Testament themes that were treated in other volumes of the Corpus, such as the Expulsion of Adam and Eve, are not included here.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul
item_t: The Life of Christ Before the Passion. The Youth of Christ.
public_note: Volume I contains the catalogue raisonné. The second volume includes the illustrations, including related drawings and engravings.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul

author: Poorter, Nora de
imprint: London : Harvey Miller ; Philadelphia : Heydon & Son, 1978.
public_note: Volume 1 contains the catalogue raisonné of Rubens' bozzetti, modelli and cartoons, as well as the extant tapestries.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul

author: Martin, John Rupert
public_note: Entries cite title, date, provenance, exhibition history, references, extensive comments with information on the original lost paintings for which the sketches were made.

name: Rubens, Peter Paul

author: Jaffé, Michael

illustrations: v. 1: 71 b&w; v. 2: 504 b&w, 25 color plates
public_note: The publication includes esssays on the function of Rubens' oil sketches and a glossary of terms and a discussion of collecting and appreciation of the sketches.

public_note: Catalogue of exhibition held at the Kunsthalle Bremen (Sept. 26-Nov. 21, 1965) that includes the catalogue raisonné of Roussel's prints.

imprint: New Haven : Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art, Yale University Press, 1995.
public_note: The last section includes the catalogue raisonné of the known monuments.  Each entry includes information  regarding the commission, contemporary documentation, inscriptions, construction, location, signature and inscription information, provenance, literature, commentary, and related models.

name: Roubaud, Franz

Introductory texts are in Russian and English, but individual catalogue entries are in English.
The preface is also in German. 

The catalogue was published on the occasion of the 200th anniversary of the Russian liberation and the reopening of the "Battle of the Borodino" Museum in Moscow.

In the series "Classique de l'art", this was first published in Italian by Rizzoli, 1969. 
A revised and updated edition was also issued by the author under the same imprint, in 1982.

name: Rothko, Mark

author_s:

                                                            Anfam, David
imprint: New Haven, London : Yale University Press ; Washington, D.C. : National Gallery of Art, 1998.
illustrations: 116 b&w and color ills., 834 color ills. in catalogue
public_note: Entries also contain a concordance with the Rothko Estate Numbers. The essay, "Chronology: Inventory, Dates, Inscriptions and Titles" discusses Rothko's own 1968-1969 inventory of works.

name: Rothe, G.H.
item_t: G.H. Rothe, Master of the Mezzotint.
author: Restany, Pierre

name: Roth, Diete
item_t: Dieter Roth Graphic Works : Catalogue Raisonné, 1947-1998.
author: Dobke, Dirk
public_note: The catalogue includes the introductions to "Collected Works" v. 20 in English & v. 40 in German and English. There is also a section discussing Roth's collaborations with other artists.

name: Rottmann, Carl
item_t: Carl Rottmann.
author: Decker, Hugo
public_note:
The study examines the painter's characteristic techniques and the critical fortunes of his landscape cycles painted in Italy and Greece.

The catalogue is followed by a chronological list of works, excerpts from letters, plus an appendix, a bibliography, and separate indexes of collections and proper names.

name: Roth, Diete
item_t: Dieter Roth : Books + Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: London : Hansjörg Mayer; New York : Thames & Hudson, distributor in  United States & Canada, 2004.
public_note: The publication principally deals with Roth's books and illustrations of them, with essays on the books by Dirk Dobke and Stefan Ripplinger. There are also chapters on Roth's music, posters, rings and furniture, and films and videos. The enclosed CD, entitled "Dieter Roth: Musik," has recordings of ten of Roth's performances with his various collaborators, 1973-1991.

name: Rosso Fiorentino
item_t: Rosso Fiorentino : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
public_note: The present study contains an introduction, a catalogue of the paintings, a biography, topographical index, and a chronological bibliography.  There are also cross references to earlier monographs on the artist.

name: Rosso, Medardo
item_t: Medardo Rosso : catalogo ragionato della scultura.
public_note:
This publication includes a catalogue of the documented sculptures, followed by a catalogue of undocumented works and two sections on cast works. There is also biography, appendices, sources, bibliography, and an index of names.

There is a separate section dealing with collaborative works done with his son Francesco Rossi and with Mario Vianello-Chiodo.

name: Rost, Otto

The entries include: title (presented in italics when named by the artist himself), date, brief comments such as "variant" etc, medium, and "atelier de Georges Rouault" when applicable.  Collectors names are not given, except when works are in public collections.  
There are short lists of Rouault's works in stained glass and enamel, as well as the tapistries.

Arte, 1989) -- supplément no. 2 ( Tokyo: Bunkazai Kenkyujo ; Paris: Bibliothèque des arts, 1990) -- supplément no. 3 (Tokyo: Bunkazai Kenkyujo ; Paris: Bibliothèque des arts, 1993) -- supplément no. 4: (Paris: Bibiothèque des arts, 1993).

public_note: Catalogue published on the occasion of the circulating exhibition "Gerhard Richter" (1993-1994). Catalogue of all of the artist's paintings up until 'Abstraktes Bild' 1993 (CR 794-3).

name: Ricco
item_t: Ricco Wassmer, 1915-1972 : Catalogue Raisonné der Gemälde und Objekte.
author: Wasmer, Marc-Joachim
imprint: Bern : Kunstmuseum Bern ; Zurich : Scheidegger & Spiess, 2015.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition in honor of Ricco's 100th birthday, held at Kunstmuseum Bern.

name: Rice, Brian
item_t: Brian Rice : Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Drawings, Collages and Studies, 1952-2016.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is chronologically organized. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, signature information, verso information, provenance, and artist's remarks and notes.
public_note: The appendix includes an exhibiton list.

name: Ricci, Marco
item_t: Marco Ricci.
author: Scarpa Sonino, Annalisa
public_note:
This is essentially a corpus of Marco Ricci's production, excluding some early works and those done in collaboration with Sebastiano Ricci. Works known only from engravings will be included in a future publication.

There are separate catalogues of the oil and tempera paintings sorted by location. This is  followed by a catalogue of works of uncertain attribution.

name: Ricchetti, Luciano
item_t: Luciano Ricchetti.
author_s:
Arisi, Ferdinando                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fugazza, Stefano                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rebora, Sergio
public_note:
Published to acccompany an exhibition held on the centennary of the artist's birth, Palazzo Gotico, Piacenza.  The introductory material includes essays on the artist's work by chronological period. 

There are separate schedules for oil paintings and works in tempera. Sculptures, frescoes, and works done for the press, including designs, illustrations and political caricatures, are also covered in the catalogue.

name: Ricci, Sebastiano
item_t: Sebastiano Ricci.
author: Daniels, Jeffrey
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the paintings is organized by the painting's location at the time of publication.

name: Ricard, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Ricard ; sa vie et son oeuvre (1823-1873).
public_note:
The book was issued in a numbered edition of 330 copies.  The study includes texts dealing with the artist's family and his voyages, and artistic career the salons, and awards.  

The publication includes various documents, including obituaries, a list of retrospective exhibitions, commentaries on Ricard's technique, and a list of authentic and misattributed works.

name: Ricci, Sebastiano
item_t: L'opera completa di Sebastiano Ricci.
author: Daniels, Jeffrey
public_note:
Preliminary texts include discussions on Ricci and his patrons, the artist's critical fortunes, and an analysis of his works.  

The publication also includes a bibliography and source documents. There are also title, iconographical, and topographical indices.

name: Ricci, Sebastiano
item_t: Sebastiano Ricci.
author: Scarpa, Annalisa
public_note:
The study includes essays on the artist and his career, a critical anthology, a complete catalogue of the works, a list of lost paintings, and a bibliography.

Because facts concering the artist's early career are obscure, the catalogue raisonné lists only works that have been authenticated. Except for works in series, the catalogue raisonné is arranged in alphabetical order by location.  The photographic apparatus, however, follows the chronological succession of the corpus.

name: Richards, Ce
item_t: The Graphic Works of Ceri Richards.
author: Sanesi, Roberto

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter 1998.
public_note: This is the catalogue of exhibition held at Anthony d'Offay Gallery with a catalogue raisonné of Richter’s work from 1993-1998.  The catalogue is an illustrated checklist of all paintings from "Abstraktes Bild" 1993 (CR 795) until "Seestück" 1998 (CR 852-2).

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter, Drawings 1964-1999 : Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Winterthur : Kunstmuseum Winterthur; Dusseldorf : Richter Verlag, 2000.
public_note: Catalogue of all of the artist's drawings in pencil, pen and india ink on both paper and canvas, to date of publication. All drawings reproduced in thumbnail illustrations.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter, Editions 1965-2004 : Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Ostfildern-Ruit : Hatje Cantz ; New York : D.A.P., 2004.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné covers Richter's multiples, including artist's books, editions in oil, and photographic editions created between 1965-2004. The catalogue was published to accompany an exhibition held at the Dallas Museum of Art. 

The catalogue was printed in German to accompany an exhibition held in Bern (ISBN: 3775714308).

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter : Catalogue Raisonné 1993-2004.
imprint: Dusseldorf : K20K21 Kunstsammlung Nordrhein-Westfalen ; Richter Verlag, 2005.
public_note:
This catalogue accompanies the exhibition "Deutschland in Japan 2005/2006," and contains an illustrated checklist of all paintings executed between 1993-2004 (cat. nos. 795 to 891-2). 

The publication continues and overlaps with the 1998 exhibition catalogue "Gerhard Richter" at Anthony D'Offay Gallery in London (cat. no. 795 to 852-2). That catalogue was itself a continuation of the 1993 catalogue raisonné (ending with cat. no. 794-3) that accompanied the exhibition "Gerhard Richter." See entries cited in this database.

A new 5-volume catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings and sculptures currently in preparation by the Gerhard Richter Archive.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 4: 1988-1994.
author: Elger, Dietmar
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, dimensions, provenance, bibliography, and exhibitions. Some entries also include comments, Richter's handwritten notes, and comparative images.  The fourth volume covers Numbers 652-1 to 805-6 of the artist's works.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 3: 1976-1987.
author: Elger, Dietmar
public_note: Individual entries include technical details, inscriptions, provenance, exhibition history, literature, comparative images, and comments.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 2: 1968-1976.
author: Elger, Dietmar
ind_entr_cont: Many works are illustrated with full page images, and entries include full technical details, providing  information from the artist's notes.  Entries also include provenance, bibliography, and exhibition information, comments, quotes, and comparative images.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 1: 1962-1968.
author: Elger, Dietmar (ed.)
public_note: Volume 1 covers Numbers 1-198 of the artist's works.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter : Editions 1965-2013.
author_s:
Gronert, Stefan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Butin, Hubertus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Obricht, Thomas
public_note: Following a foreword and essays on the artist's work, imagery and technique, there is a catalogue raisonné of editioned work.

name: Richter, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Richter : Atlas / Konzept.
author: Richter, Gerhard
imprint: Munich : Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus : Cologne : Walther König, 2015.
public_note: Issued in a limited edition of 800 copies. "Atlas" was designed by the artist himself as an "artist's book" (a 50-year archival project and Gesamtkunstwerk), with over 5,000 images (photos, news clippings, drawings, plans, collages, drafts for paintings, etc.) compiled by the artist.

name: Richter, Hans Theo
item_t: Hans Theo Richter: das Graphische Werk.
author: Schmidt, Werner (Editor)
imprint: Berlin : Akademie der Künste Deutschen Demokratischen Republik; Dresden : Staatl.Kunstsammlungen Dresden, Kupferstich-Kabinett, 1974.

name: Ribera, José de
item_t: Jusepe de Ribera : Prints and Drawings.
author: Brown, Jonathan
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of Ribera's prints and drawings published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Princeton University Art Museum and the Fogg Art Museum.

name: Ribas, Francisco Dionisio de
item_t: Los Ribas, un taller andaluz de escultura del siglo XVII.
author: Dabrio González, Maria Teresa
imprint: Cordoba : Monte de Piedad y Caja de Ahorros de Córdoba, 1985.
public_note:
Following lengthy introductory materials, including a discussion of the Ribas family of sculptors (Gaspar, Felipe, and Francisco Dionisio), the publication includes separate catalogues raisonnés of Felipe de Ribas and Francisco Dionisio de Ribas.  There is also a bibliography and several indices.

The illustrations are not cross-referenced to the text, which makes the catalogue somewhat difficult to use.

name: Ribera, José de
item_t: L'opera completa del Ribera.
author_s:
Spinosa, Nicola                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pérez Sánchez, Alfonso E. (intro)
public_note: Following an introduction and essays on the artist's development and critical fortunes, there are separate catalogue of Ribera's autograph works, copies presumed to be after the original, and a list of rejected works.

name: Ribera, José de
item_t: Jusepe de Ribera : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Felton, Craig McFayden
imprint: Ann Arbor, MI : University Microfilms International, 1983.
public_note: Each work includes the provenance, bibliography, exhibition history, variants and copies, and comments.

name: Rée, Anita
item_t: Anita Rée : Leben und Werk einer Hamburger Malerin, 1885-1933.
author: Bruhns, Maika
public_note: Issued under the aegis of the "Veröffentlichungen des Vereins für Hamburgerische Geschichte : Bd. 29.

name: Rée, Anita
item_t: Anita Rée : das Werk.
author_s:
Bruhns, Maike                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schick, Karin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Colditz, Sophia
imprint: Hamburg : Hermann Reemtsma Stiftung ; Munich : Prestel, 2018.
public_note: The catalogue was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Hamburger Kunsthalle.

name: Reynolds, Joshua
item_t: The Engraved Works of Sir Joshua Reynolds : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Engravings Made after his Paintings from 1755-1820; to Which is Added a Short Biographical Sketch of Each Engraver.
author: Hamilton, Edward
public_note: The catalogue is divided into Male Portraits, Female Portraits and Miscellaneous Subjects.  The catalogue includes a biographical sketch of the sitter, engravers, and descriptive comments.

name: Reynolds, Joshua
item_t: The Engraved Works of Sir Joshua Reynolds : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Engraved Works of Sir Joshua Reynolds : P.R.A. from 1755 to 1822.
author: Hamilton, Edward
imprint: London : P. & D. Colnaghi and Co., 1884.
public_note: This is the revised and enlarged edition of the original 1874 publication, which only included engravings up until 1820.

name: Restout, Jean-Bernard
item_t: Jean-Bernard Restout : 1732-1796 : peintre du roi et révolutionnaire.
author: Willk-Brocard, Nicole
public_note: This is a complete catalogue of the works of Jean-Bernard Restout, son of the painter, Jean Restout.  The publication includes a chronology, a discussion of iconography, a genealogy of the Restout family,, and a section on the artist's critical fortunes.   Other apparatus includes correspondence and documents classed by themes:  political, the "affaire du Garde-Meuble", last testament, and inventories.

name: Reynolds, Joshua
item_t: Sir Joshua Reynolds : A Complete Catalogue of His Paintings.
imprint: New Haven ; London : Yale University Press, 2000.
public_note: Published for the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art at Yale University.  The catalogue raisonné lists over 2,000 paintings, most illustrated.  The portraits were catalogued by David Mannings; Martin Postle compiled the catalogue of the history and fancy pictures.

name: Repton, George Stanley
item_t: George Repton's Pavilion Notebook : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Temple, Nigel
imprint: Aldershot, Hants, England : Scolar Press ; Brookfield, VT USA : Ashgate Pub. Co., 1993.
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of Repton's Pavilion Notebook (housed at the Royal Pavilion Art Gallery and Museum, Brighton).  Preliminary material includes an introductory essay, the notebooks, a catalogue with cross references to The Royal Institute of British Architects' Notebooks (RIBANB), and reproductions from the Pavilion Notebook.

name: Reuter, Erich F.
item_t: Erich F. Reuter : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Karpen, Andreas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schauer, Lucie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schmidt, Philip Peter
public_note:
The introductory texts and a brief biography of the artist are followed by the catalogue raisonné. The catalogue is arranged by subject and type, including portraits, sculptures with landscape themes, and other works.  

There are also lists of works in museums and other public places, as well as name and place indices.

name: Restout, Jean, the younge
item_t: Jean Restout, 1692-1768 : peintre d'histoire à Paris.
author: Gouzi, Christine
public_note: Catalogue entries provide provenance, references, exhibitions, known versions and variants, related works, and extensive comments.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Les lithographies de Renoir.
author: Roger-Marx, Claude
public_note: The publication includes an introductory essay, a catalogue of 31 works, and a checklist of works at the back of the publication.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Auguste Renoir : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Daulte, François                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Renoir, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Durand-Ruel, Charles (preface)
public_note:
This was the only volume of the catalogue raisonné on the artist's paintings to be published by Daulte. Volume 1 contains 646 portraits and figural studies by Renoir.

For more current studies on the artist, see the two new catalogues in preparation, one by the Daubervilles (2 v. of 4 v. published to date) and the other by the Wildenstein Institute, both projects are cited in this database.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: L'opera completa di Renoir nel periodo impressionista, 1869-1883.
author: Fezzi, Elda
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists only those works created during Renoir's "Impressionist" phase. The publication lists 770 authentic works executed between 1869-1883.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Pierre-Auguste Renoir : Paintings, Pastels and Drawings : tableaux, pastels et dessins.
author: Vollard, Ambroise
public_note: First published by Vollard in Paris, 1918 (2 v.) this is a revised one-volume edition, with new English translations.  An index is given at the back with titles of the works.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: The Graphic Work of Renoir : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Stella, Joseph G.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bolge, George S. (foreword)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes 25 etchings and 35 lithographs. The publication also contains a checklist of works.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Renoir's Atelier = L'atelier de Renoir.
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1989.
public_note: A catalogue of the work left in Renoir's studio after his death.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Pierre Auguste Renoir : l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié ; The Etchings and Lithographs : Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1999.
public_note:
This is a revised edition of the volume dealing with Renoir's etchings and lithographs, first published in 1923 by Loys Delteil, as part of his study: "Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles)."
This new volume includes new information and three lithographs unknown to Delteil.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Renoir : catalogue raisonné des tableaux, pastels, dessins et aquarelles ; Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Pastels, Drawings and Watercolors. (Tome 5: 1911-1919 & 1er supplément)
author_s:
Dauberville, Guy-Patrice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dauberville, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Frémontier-Murphy, Camille
public_note:
The front matter is also in English. This is the fifth and final volume of the catalogue raisonné, and contains the first supplement to the first four volumes. 

Volume 5 lists over 900 authentic works by Renoir executed 1911-1919, and 89 new works in the first supplement.  All works are illustrated.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Renoir : catalogue raisonné des tableaux, pastels, dessins et aquarelles ; Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Pastels, Drawings, and Watercolors. (Tome 4: 1903-1910)
public_note: The catalogue lists 948 works (#s 2664-3591), arranged by medium, then chronologically by subject.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Renoir : catalogue raisonné des tableaux, pastels, dessins et aquarelles ; Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Pastels, Drawings and Watercolors. (Tome 3: 1895-1902)
public_note: The third volume lists 1,030 authentic works by Renoir, arranged chronologically and by subject. The catalogue raisonné is only in French and lists works 1667-2663.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Renoir : catalogue raisonné des tableaux, pastels, dessins et aquarelles ; Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Pastels, Drawings and Watercolors. Tome 2: 1882-1894.
public_note: The catalogue lists 993 autograph works (nos. 684-1666), organized chronologically and by subject. This volume covers 703 paintings, 54 pastels, 165 drawings and 48 watercolors. It also includes 7 works not included in the first volume.

name: Renoir, Pierre-Auguste
item_t: Renoir : catalogue raisonné des tableaux, pastels, dessins et aquarelles ; Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Pastels, Drawings and Watercolors. Tome I: 1858-1881.
author_s:
Dauberville, Guy-Patrice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dauberville, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Frémontier-Murphy, Camille                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Renoir, Jacques (preface)
public_note:
The texts are bilingual, but the catalogue raisonné is only in French. The catalogue raisonné lists 684 works, organized by medium and theme. 

In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes excerpts from the artist's correspondence, a list of exhibitions of Renoir's works at Bernheim-Jeune, a glossary, and title, place, and subject indices.

name: Repin, Ilja
item_t: Ilja Repin, Malerei, Graphik.
public_note: There was also an edition published in French.

name: Réattu, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Réattu, arelatensis 1760-1833 : un rêve d'artiste.
author: Rouvier, Daniel

name: Réattu, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Réattu, 1760-1833 : peintre de la révolution française.
author: Simons, Katrin
public_note: Catalogue entries include number, title, medium and support, date, location, references, location, and comments.

name: Régnier, Nicola
item_t: Nicolas Régnier (alias Niccolò Renieri) ca. 1588-1667 : peintre, collectionneur et marchand d'art.
public_note: The mostly chronological catalogue raisonné is divided into the Roman and Venetian periods.  There is a section of rejected works. Lost paintings known by engravings or copies are  mentioned, as well as studio works and copies.

name: Ribera, José de
item_t: Jusepe de Ribera, grabador, 1591-1652.
author: Ribera, José de
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Fundación Caja de Pensiones (Valencia), and at the Calcografia Nacional, Real Academia de Bellas Artes de San Fernando, Alcalá, Madrid.

name: Ribera, José de
item_t: Ribera.
author: Spinosa, Nicola
public_note:
This is a revised and expanded edition of the original 2003 publication. 

The catalogue raisonné lists 338 autograph paintings, with separate catalogues of copies after lost originals, questionable attributions, and rejected works.

name: Ribera, José de
item_t: Jusepe de Ribera : The Drawings : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Finaldi, Gabriele                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cenalor, Elena                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Payne, Edward
imprint: Madrid : Museo del Prado ; Seville : Fundación Focus : Dalls : Meadows Museum, SMU, 2016.
public_note: The catalogue entries are by the three contributing authors, and are organized by date in broad chronological sections.  There are entries on 157 autograph works, 5 sheets attributed to Ribera and 31 rejected drawings (entered by city or place location).  The catalogue is followed by a general bibliography, indices, appendices, and a list of works displayed in both exhibitions.

name: Reni, Guido
item_t: Guido Reni.
public_note: This study is based on an exhibition held in Bologna in 1954.  The preliminary material and essay are by Gnudi. The chronology of the artist's life and works, catalogue raisonné, critical anthology, and bibliography were all compiled by Cavalli.

name: Reni, Guido
item_t: Guido Reni : l'opera completa.
author: Pepper, Stephen

name: Reni, Guido
item_t: Guido Reni : A Complete Catalogue of His Works.
author: Pepper, D. Stephen
imprint: New York  : New York University Press,  1984.
public_note: N.b. see also the later Italian 1988 edition of this catalogue :

name: Rendic, Ivan
item_t: Ivan Rendic : zivot i djetlo.
imprint: Supetar : Skupstina opcine Brac, Savjet za prosvjetu i kulturu, 1969.

name: Remington, Frederic
item_t: Frederic Remington : A Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Watercolors and Drawings.
author_s:
Hassrick, Peter H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Webster, Melissa J.
imprint: Cody, Wyoming : Buffalo Bill Historical Center in association with University of Washington Press, 1996.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Buffalo Bill Historical Center and other venues. The essays by Peter Hassrick are revised and reprinted from a 1991 Remington exhibition catalogue (Gerald Peters Gallery, Santa Fe). 
The publication comes with a CD-ROM containing the catalogue raisonné.

name: Remington, Frederic
item_t: Frederic Remington : A Catalogue Raisonné II.
author_s:
Hassrick, Peter H. (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Boehme, Sarah                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buhler, Doyle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fry, Laura                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tyler, Ron                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Eldredge, Bruce (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Speidel, Melissa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Price, B. Byron
imprint: Norman : University of Oklahoma Press in cooperation with the Buffalo Bill Center of the West, 2016.
illustrations: 150 b&w and color ills., over 100 color plates
public_note: Catalogue entries include title, date, medium, references, signature and inscription information, provenance, exhibitions, and comments.

name: Renau, José
item_t: Josep Renau : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Forment, Albert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            García, Manuel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Llorens, Tomás                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barañano, Kosme de
imprint: Valencia, Spain : IVAM Insitut Valencia d'Art Modern, 2003.
public_note: A Catalan only edition was published simultaneously.

name: Reims-Deux, Cécile
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Fred Deux gravé par Cécile Deux de 1970 à 1996.
author_s:
Deux, Cécile                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chave, Pierre (catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chave, Madeleine (catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pernoud, Emmanuel
imprint: Issoudun : Musée de l'Hospice Saint Roch ; Vence : Pierre Chave, 1996.
public_note: Prints engraved by Cécile Reims-Deux after drawings by Fred Deux.

name: Reiter, Roland
item_t: Go Go Go Old Gold Reiter Go.
author_s:
Präauer, Teresa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schuh, Franz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schu, ManfreDu
public_note: A comprehensive overview of the artist's sculptures and installations from 2001 to 2016.

name: Reichert, Josua
item_t: Josua Reichert, Werkverzeichnis, 1959-1995: mit Anmerkungen des Künstlers zu seinen Werkgruppen.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's posters, prints and collages, all reproduced in color.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings : Volume 5 : Small-Scale History Paintings.
author_s:
Wetering, Ernst van de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bruyn, Josua                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Franken, Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Groen, Karin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Veen, Jaap van der                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Winker, Marieke de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Oomen, Margaret                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Binkhorst, Lideke Peese

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings : Volume 6 : Rembrandt's Paintings Revisited - A Complete Survey.
author_s:
Wetering, Ernst van de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nes, Carin van
illustrations: 750 b&w and color ills.; 430 color plates
public_note: The sixth and final volume of the 'Corpus' provides a complete and revised overview of the entire painted oeuvre (with a change in order of working and methodology not present in earlier volumes of the Corpus).   The texts include "What is a Rembrant? A Personal Account" detailing the author's long engagement with the Rembrandt Research Project. The second chapter discusses "What is a non-Rembrandt?"  There are iconographical, lists of locations of the artists works, and a bibliography.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings : Volume 4 : Self-Portraits.
author_s:
Wetering, Ernst van de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Groen, Karin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Klein, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Veen, Jaap van der                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Winkel, Marieke de
public_note: Individual entries provide provenance, documents and sources, comments, and copies and prints after the original. The authors also provide technical information regarding x-rays, radiographs, grounds, and signatures.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings : Volume 3 : 1635-1642.
author_s:
Bruyn, J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wetering, Ernst van de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Haak, B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Levie, S.H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thiel, P.J.J. van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Peese Binkhorst-Hoffscholte, L.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vis, J.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings : Volume 2 : 1631-1634.
author_s:
Bruyn, J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Haak, B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Levie, S.H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thiel, P.J.J. van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wetering, Ernst van de

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings : Volume 1 : 1625-1631.
author_s:
Bruyn, J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Haak, B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Levie, S.H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thiel, P.J.J. van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wetering, Ernst van de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Binkhorst-Hoffscholte, Lideke Peese
public_note: A free digital version of this volume is available. See instructions and "Terms of Use".

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: L'oeuvre gravé de Rembrandt. Supplément.
public_note: This is the supplement to the Rovinksi 1890 catalogue raisonné (see listing in this database).

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Catalogue of Rembrandt's Etchings Chronologically Arranged and Completely Illustrated.
author: Hind, Arthur M.
public_note: This is the second revised edition of the original 1912 publication.  A reprint edition was also issued by Da Capo Press, New York, 1967.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Die Radierungen Rembrandts : mit einem kritischen Verzeichnis und Abbildung sämtlicher Radierungen.
author: Seidlitz, Woldemar von
public_note: An earlier edition was published in 1895 under the title: "Kritisches Verzeichnis der Radierungen Rembrandts".

author_s:
Gersaint, Edme-François                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Helle, P.C.A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Glomy, Jean-Baptiste
public_note: A first early critical catalogue of Rembrandt's work, the full title of which is: "Catalogue raisonné de toutes les pieces qui forment l'oeuvre de Rembrandt/ composé par feu M. Gersaint, & mis au jour, avec les augmentations nécessaires, par les sieurs  Helle & Glomy : dédie aux amateurs des beaux arts".

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Dutch and Flemish Etchings, Engravings, and Woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700.
author: Hollstein, F.W.H.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt's Etchings, Reproductions of the Whole Original Etched Work.
author: Münz, Ludwig (Ed.)

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: L'oeuvre complet de Rembrandt : catalogue raisonné de toutes les eaux-fortes du maître et de ses peintures…"
author: Blanc, Charles
public_note: Various editions of this early catalogue raisonné have been issued, including one illustrated with a selection of photographs.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Rembrandt.
illustrations: numerous b&w thumbnails, some color plates
public_note:
This is the translation of "L'opera pittorica di Rembrandt".  The publication includes excerpts from early writings on Rembrandt, a documentary chronology of his life, and examples of his signature style.  A separate documents section includes Rembrandt's inventory and correspondence.

The appendix also lists Rembrandt's pupils with a brief biography of each. Finally, there are indices of subjects, titles, and locations of Rembrandt's paintings.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt's Etchings : Reproductions of the Whole Original Etched Work.
author: Münz, Ludwig

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt Paintings.
public_note: English language translation of "Rembrandt Gemälde", with inclusive editing by Gary Schartz.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt : The Complete Edition of the Paintings.
public_note:
This is an English language translation of his  "Rembrandt schilderijen" which was published by Bredius in the mid-1930s. Since then there have been subsequent reprintings, issued at various dates under varying imprints, including a a third edition, with Gerson's revisions, published by Phaidon in 1969. 

This edition is the fourth, also revised by H. Gerson.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt, His Life, His Work, His Time.
author: Haak, Bob
public_note: The introductory material includes a foreword, an introduction, an essay on Rembrandt's life, work and times, a select bibliography, and index.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: L'oeuvre gravé de Rembrandt : reproduction des planches originales dans tous leurs états successifs. 1000 phototypes sans retouches / avec un catalogue raisonné par Dmitri Rovinksi.
author: Rovinski, Dmitri
imprint: Saint-Petersburg : Impr. de l'Académie Impériale des Sciences, 1890.
public_note: These volumes document 395 entries, including doubtful and rejected works. There are illustrations of every state, locations are indicated, and the works are numbered.  Individual catalogue entries include title, inscriptions, states, medium, dimensions, and comments.  There is also a concordance to C. Middleton (1878) and the Illustrated Bartsch.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: A Descriptive Catalogue of the Etched Work of Rembrandt van Rhyn.
author: Middleton, Charles Henry
public_note: The publication includes a biography, a genealogy, concordance (Gersaint, Bartsch, Blanc, etc.), and a chronological table of the etched work. There is also an appendix, a bibliography and an index.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: The Illustrated Bartsch.
author_s:
Bartsch, Adam von et al.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Strauss, Walter L. (ed.)
public_note:
Projected in over 164 volumes, the late Walter Strauss began this landmark project in order to illustrate and update the classic, but unillustrated, study of European painter-printmakers by Adam von Bartsch. 
In addition to the  new illustrated volumes published in  "The Illustated Bartsch"  (called Picture Atlas volumes), new critical information, not in the original edition, is published in the Supplementary and Commentary volumes; not all projected additional commentary volumes have been published to date, authors vary. An essential reference tool, sets may be located in major institutional and art museum reference libraries. 
ARTstor also offers now some 50,000 images of the "Illustrated Bartsch Collection", via its subscription service on the Internet. These are available to the public through selected academic, reference, and museum libraries. Eventually, ARTstor intends to offer the accompanying texts as well.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt's Landscapes.
author: Schneider, Cynthia

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Slatkes, Leonard J.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt's Paintings Revisited - A Complete Survey : A Reprint of Rembrandt's Paintings V I.
author_s:
Wetering, Ernst van de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nes, Carin van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pearson, Murray (ed.)
public_note: This has a revised, chronological survey of the artist's entire body of 336 paintings.  The author has reattributed a number of works to Rembrandt (after early rejection by the Rembrandt Research Project).  These entries in particular include extensive commentary and new research.  All catalogue entries include notes with technical information, images of x-rays and radiographs, signatures and inscriptions, provenance, references, and exhibitions.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: Rembrandt : The Complete Paintings.[XXL].
author_s:
Manuth, Volker                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Winkel, Marieke de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Leeuwen, Rudie van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Beier, Brigitte (ed.)
public_note: Published in tandem with a retrospective exhibition of unprecedented scale at the Rijksmuseum,Amsterdam (February to June 2019) commemorating the 350th anniversary of the artist's death.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn
item_t: The Drawings of Rembrandt.
public_note: First published as a series, 1954-1957. Enlarged edition was revised by Eva Benesch, and contains Otto Benesch's additions, made from 1957 until his death in 1964.  The publication contains separate catalogues of drawings by other masters reworked by Rembrandt, drawings by pupils corrected by Rembrandt, copies after unknown originals, and questionable attributions.

name: Reni, Guido
item_t: L'opera completa di Guido Reni.
public_note: This was issued in Rizzoli's "Classici dell'arte" series, n. 31.

name: Rego, Paula
item_t: Paula Rego : The Complete Graphic Work.
author: Rosenthal, T.G.
public_note:
Monograph on the artist's graphic work. The publication discusses and illustrates all of the artist's etchings and lithographs created from 1954-2003.

An expanded second edition was published in 2012, which includes 635 color and tritone illustrations. The revised edition also includes chapters on five new series, works done out of series since 2004, etc, with new images and additional entries; there are also revisons to the chronology, exhibition list and bibliography (isbn 9780500093689).

name: Regner, Alfred-George
item_t: Alfred-Georges Regner : peintre-graveur, 1902-1987 : catalogue raisonné.
author: Regner, Alfred-Georges
imprint: Paris : Somogy ; Courbevoie : Association des amis d'Alfred-Georges Regner, 2002.
public_note: The publication provides a detailed biography of the artist and a complete catalogue of his works.  The catalogue includes examples of the artist's signatures.

name: Regoyos, Dario de
item_t: Dario de Regoyos : catálogo razonado = Catalogue Raisonné.
author: San Nicolás Santamaría, Juan
imprint: Asturias : Museo de Belles Artes de Asturias : Madrid : Fundación Azcona, 2014
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 767 works by the artist.

name: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn

author_s:
Bode, Wilhelm von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hofstede de Groot, C.
public_note:
This is the English numbered edition of Bode's comprehensive study which was first published in a German language edition (Paris, 1897-1905).
Sedelmeyer also issued a French language numbered edition (Paris, 1897-1906).

name: Rebull, Joan
item_t: Joan Rebull : catálogo razonado de esculturas.
author_s:
Corredor-Matheos, José (ed., intr.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mercadé, Albert (c.r. & historical background essays)
public_note: The text is organized chronologically, covering works from Rebull's very early career to the pre-War years in Barcelona, Paris, and post-War periods spent in France, England, and Barcelona.

name: Rebull, Joan

author: Corredor Matheos, José
public_note: See also: "Joan Rebull : catàlogo razonado de sculturas" (Barcelona, Fundación Arte y Mecenazgo, 2010) cited in this database.

author_s:

public_note: The first volume is based on the artist's personal inventory of works.  Raza included information on stock numbers, titles, year, medium and dimensions of approximately 800 works executed from 1958-1971.  The publication illustrates approximately 270 of them.  The Foundation notes that Raza did not inventory every work he produced during this period, and their research is ongoing.

author: Simson, Jutta von
public_note:
The preliminary sections cover the sculptor's career by period and location, followed by essays on his skill as a master sculptor, and remarks on his personality and character.

There is supplementary material on his career as a conservator and restorer of antique sculpture, plus a listing of members of his school.
Additional material includes a chronology, an alphabetical index of the works, bibliographical and archival citations, plus a general index.

An updated French edition was published under the title: "Tout l'oeuvre peint de Raphaël" (Paris, Flammarion, 1982).

The introductory material is followed by three sections with documents, the catalogue raisonné, a genealogy of the artist's famiy, and an index.  

The artist's correspondence (Sept. 2, 1939 - Aug. 30, 1942) is the basis for much of the book's text. The letters are numbered, include indications of names to whom they were sent, and are dated whenever possible.

A further revised edition was later published in America: "Odilon Redon: les Estampes : The Graphic Work: Catalogue Raisonné" (San Francisco, Alan Wofsy, 2001), which is thoroughly illustrated, with French and English texts.

public_note: The individual entries include dimensions, materials, provenance, exhibition history, copy information, literature, and commentary.

name: Reggiani, Mauro
item_t: Reggiani : catalogo generale della pittura.
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there are essays and various appendices dealing with frescoes, mosaics, stained glass, decorative designs for rugs, tapestries, ceramics, etc.

The catalogue contains all works which could  be traced (with the exception of works on paper).  Lost works known only from documentation are listed.

author: Raine, Sanky
cronology: The bibliography of Raine's writings, letters and writings about the artist contains links to selected texts.
ind_entr_cont: Online catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings, sculptures, drawings, and prints, arranged chronologically by medium.
public_note: The print section gives full informationon with date, c.r. number, medium and print runs, dimensions, inscriptions and information on numbers of artist's proofs, etc., collection details, notes, exhibition, and series information.

name: Ramos, Mel

author_s:
Kuspit, Donald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Meisel, Louis K.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ramos, Mel (foreword)
public_note: The catalogue is divided in two parts: Oil paintings on canvas are arranged by theme: Heroes & Heroines; Peek-a-Boo & Wolf Calls; Consumer Pin Ups; Fashion Plates; Beauties & Beasts; Art on Art; In the Studio; and the "Lost" Paintings.  The second part of the catalogue contains the watercolors. All works are illustrated in color.

name: Ramos, Mel

The first part contains a biography of the artist and other introductory texts. The second part contains the catalogue raisonné, arranged chronologically by medium: paintings in oil, paintings in tempera, watercolors, etchings and lithographs, and drawings.

Individuals with information regarding unlocated or uncatalogued works are encouraged to contact the author at therabinovitzproject@gmail.com.

author: Harwood, Laurie B.

name: Pyle, Howard
item_t: Howard Pyle : His Life -- His Work : A Comprehensive Bibliography and Pictorial Record of Howard Pyle : Illustrator, Author, Teacher : Father of American Illustration, America's Foremost Illustrator.
author_s:
Davis, Paul Preston                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bruni, Stephen T. (preface)
Brokaw, Howard Pyle (forew.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brokaw, Howard Pyle (foreword)
imprint: New Castle, DE : Oak Knoll Press : Wilmington, DE : Delaware Art Museum, 2004.
public_note:
Volume 1 contains the complete bibliography of Pyle's works, including: bookplates, periodicals, books, etchings, ephemera, as well as various indices to the bibliography. There is also a list of Pyle's writings published in books and articles, writings about Pyle, and the publication records of his portraits.

Volume II includes a picture record of all known works. There are also indices of titles and alternate titles, titles listed in chronological sequence, and the publication and exhibition history of his works.

name: Puy, Jean
imprint: Roanne : Les Amis de Jean Puy, 2000.

name: Quadrone, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Quadrone : la vita, i documenti, le opere : catalogo ragionato.
author: Marini, Giuseppe Luigi
public_note:
Published in the series: "Archivi dell'Ottocento".  The catalogue raisonné lists 936 authentic works by the artist.

The first volume includes a biography of the artist, Quadrone's letters and documents, and a critical anthology. Volume 2 includes the catalogue raisonné, and the third volume contains the illustrations.

name: Pushman, Hovsep
item_t: Catalogue Raisonné for the Complete Works of Hovsep Pushman.
cronology: The catalogue can be searched by title, description, size, subject, and date.  Catalogue entries list number, title, date, medium, size, provenance.  The comments include information on  signatures and the artist's original inventory number.  All works are illustrated in color.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné was undertaken in conjunction with the Pushman estate, and it is continuously updated. New submissions that are accepted by the catalogue raisonné committee will be added to the catalogue.  The website also includes a biography of the artist.
public_note: check_needed

name: Quinte, Lotha
item_t: Lothar Quinte : Opus : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde 1950-2000.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Gert Reising, and lists over 700 authentic paintings by the artist. The publication also includes an interview between Lothar Quinte and Peter Iden.

name: Radziwill, Franz
item_t: Franz Radziwill, 1895 bis 1983: Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:

                                                            Schulze, Rainer W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gerster, Ulrich                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reinhardt, Brigitte et al.

name: Radziwill, Franz
item_t: Franz Radziwill (1895-1983) : Werkverzeichnis der Aquarelle, Zeichnungen und bemalten Postkarten.
public_note:
Issued under the aegis of the Franz Radziwill Gesellschaft e. V.

The catalogue raisonné is organized by media, and includes undated works as well.
There is a concordance, biographical data, notes, and a bibliography.

name: Putman, Andrée
item_t: Andrée Putman: Complete Works
public_note:
The catalogue is arranged by project type:
--Home: hotels, residences
--Public: stores, restaurants, installations
--Work: offices 
--Objects: product design

name: Putz, Leo

author: Pütz, Helmut
public_note: This catalogue raisonné, written by the artist's son, lists over 2,700 works, all illustrated with black and white thumbnail images. Vol. 1 contains a biography of Putz and a chronology of selected works. Volume 2 includes an index of all of the works known to the author, organized by subject.

name: Pugin, Augustus Welby Northmore

Volumes 2-4 were published by Birkäuser, Boston, Berlin. 

The catalogue presents number, title, date, materials, and comments. Some entries also contain cross references to photos of associated architectural details and related drawings. The notes to the catalogue raisonné section contain the bibliographical references.

author: Neilson, Nancy Ward

name: Proesch, Gilbe
item_t: The Postcard Art of Gilbert & George, 1972-1989 : The Urethra Postcard Art of Gilbert & George.
public_note:
Vol. 1 lists approximately 470 postcard sculptures, organized by year and illustrated with full page color plates. Vol. 2 contains 564 new postcard pictures, the so-called Urethra postcard works.  

Each volume is preceded by an essay by Michael Bracewell.

name: Purrmann, Han

public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 1,350 paintings by the artist, with titles given in German and English. Entries contain useful critical apparatus: technique, provenance, and exhibition information is given when known, and there are references to the literature.

After the introductory essays dealing with the history, character and style of Pratt's works, there is a chronology, autobiographical notes, general notes, advertisements of and about the artist.  Unlocated works; errnoneous and doubtful attributions; an index and plates.

There is also a selection of posters Power designed with Sybil Andrews for the London Underground (color illustrations only).

author: Berra, Laura (coord.)
cronology: Sculptures are listed chronologically up to 2003 (nos. 1-1057); works after that date start with number 1058.
public_note: Appendices include a biography, lists of solo and group exhibitions, and a comprehensive bibliography.

name: Pordenone
item_t: Il Pordenone.
author: Furlan, Caterina
public_note:
Following sections on the life and art of the artist, there is a catalogue raisonné of the paintings and drawings. 

The catalogue is divided by sections: autograph and attributed paintings, autograph and attributed drawings, and lost works.

name: Porcellis, Juliu
item_t: Jan and Julius Porcellis :  Dutch Marine Painters.
author: Walsh, John Joseph Jr.
public_note: Based on the author's 1971 doctoral dissertation at Columbia University.

name: Porcellis, Jan
item_t: Jan and Julius Porcellis :  Dutch Marine Painters.
author: Walsh, John Joseph Jr.
public_note: Based on the author's 1971 doctoral dissertation at Columbia University.

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: Jacopo Carucci da Pontormo : His Life and Work.
author_s:
Clapp, Frederick Mortimer                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mather, Frank Jewett, Jr. (foreword)
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 1916.
public_note: This is the English translation of the author's 1914 "Les dessins de Pontormo; catalogue raisonné, précédé d'une étude" (Paris: É. Champion). There have been several reprintings, including the 1972 edition published by Junius Press, distributed in North America by Abner Schram.

name: Ponti, Gio
item_t: Gio Ponti : The Complete Work, 1923-1978.
public_note:
This is the English translation of "Gio Ponti: l'opera" (Milan: Leonardo, 1990). The publication presents all of Ponti's architectural works, interior and industrial designs, and decorative arts pieces.

The author is the architect's daughter and the curator of the Ponti Archives.

name: Pomodoro, Arnaldo
item_t: Arnaldo Pomodoro : catalogo ragionato della scultura.
author: Gualdoni, Flaminio
public_note: Catalogue of sculptures created between 1953-2003. All works are reproduced in black and white thumbnail illustrations. The texts are bilingual, but the catalogue is only in Italian.

name: Pompon, Franço
item_t: François Pompon : 1855-1933.
author_s:
Chevillot, Catherine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Colas, Liliane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pingeot, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Margerie, Laure de
imprint: Paris : Gallimard/Electa : Réunion des musées nationaux, 1994.
public_note: Pulbished in conjunction with a circulating exhibition held at the Musée des Beaux-arts de Dijon,1994, and elsewhere.

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: The Drawings of Pontormo.
author: Cox-Rearick, Janet
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the accepted drawings, there is separate a list of doubtful attributions.  The publication an includes an English translation of Pontormo's diary.

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: Pontormo. Monographie mit kritischem Katalog.
author: Forster, Kurt

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: The Drawings of Pontormo : A Catalogue Raisonné with Notes on the Paintings.
author: Cox-Rearick, Janet
public_note: This is a revised and expanded edition of the original 1964 publication (see entry in this database).  The new edition includes 91 new illustrations; these include additions to the corpus, as well as drawings not illustrated in the original publication.

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: L'opera completa del Pontormo.
author: Berti, ,Luciano
public_note: Published in the series "Classici dell'arte", n. 34.

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: Pontormo : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
public_note: This is the French edition; an Italian edition was issued by Electa, Milan in the same year (ISBN 8843547666).

name: Pontormo, Jacopo Carucc
item_t: Pontormo.
public_note: The introductory texts discuss Pontormo's personality and artistic development.

name: Pomarancio
item_t: Cristoforo Roncalli detto il Pomarancio.
author: Chiappini Di Sorio, Ileana
