                                                            Silva, Raquel Henriques da                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Waldberg, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pomar, Rosa
public_note:
Texts are in French only, but the catalogue raisonné apparatus is given in French, English and Portuguese.

The second volume lists 405 works, illustrated with color thumbnails. Entries include title, media, dimensions, collection, provenance, signature information, and notes.

name: Pomar, Júlio
item_t: Júlio Pomar, catalogue raisonné. Volume 1 : 1942-1968.
author_s:
Pomar, Alexandre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vital, Natalía                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pleynet, Marcelin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pomar, Rosa
public_note:
The catalogue includes a photo biography of the artist.  All texts are in French only, but the catalogue raisonné apparatus is given in French, English and Portuguese,

The catalogue raisonné lists 411 works, illustrated with color thumbnails. Entries include title, media, dimensions, collection, provenance, signature information, and notes.

name: Poma, Alessandro
item_t: Alessandro Poma (1874-1960) : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Reviglio della Veneria, Maria Luisa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berardi, Lodovico

name: Pollock, Jackson
item_t: Jackson Pollock : A Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Drawings, and Other Works. Supplement Number One.
author_s:
O'Connor, Francis V. (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pollock-Krasner Authentication Board, Inc.
public_note: The supplement also includes a separate catalogue of works defined as Problems for Study.  These works are further divided into "Authentic but Minor Works" and "Unresolved Attributions".

name: Pollini, Gino
item_t: Luigi Figini, Gino Pollini : opera completa.
public_note: All material is based on records in the Figini and Pollini Archives, copies of which are on deposit since 1991 in the Museum of Modern and Contemporaery Art of Trento & Rovereto (Archivio del' 900, Fondo Figini e Pollini).

name: Pollaiuolo, Antonio
item_t: Antonio and Piero Pollaiuolo : Complete Edition with a Critical Catalogue.
author: Ettinger, Leopold D.
public_note:
Following the introductory texts on the artists' works, the catalogue raisonné considers extant, lost, and rejected attributions. 

The Appendix includes a register of documents, bibliography, and indices of persons, places, and works.

name: Pollock, Jackson
item_t: Jackson Pollock : A Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Drawings and Other Works.
author_s:
O'Connor, Francis V. (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thaw, Eugene V. (ed.)
public_note:
The catalogue was published in a 4-volume slipcased set. In addition to the co-editors, the catalogue raisonné committee included Pollock's widow, Lee Krasner, William S. Lieberman, and Donald McKinney.  

See also the Supplement (1995) listed in this database.

name: Pollaiuolo, Piero
item_t: Antonio and Piero Pollaiuolo : Complete Edition with a Critical Catalogue.
author: Ettinger, Leopold D.
public_note:
Following the introductory texts on the artists' works, the catalogue raisonné considers extant, lost, and rejected attributions. 

The Appendix includes a register of documents, bibliography, and indices of persons, places, and works.

name: Polidoro da Caravaggio
item_t: Polidoro da Caravaggio : l'opera completa.
author: Leone De Castris, Pierluigi
public_note:
Following an introduction and essays there is a catalogue of drawings arranged by location, as well as a separate catalogue of the artist's façades and decorative designs for Roman palaces.

There is also a bibliography, a name index, and an index of locations and titles.

name: Polke, Sigma
item_t: Sigmar Polke : The Editioned Works, 1963-2000 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Becker, Jürgen (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            von der Osten, Claus (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hentschel, Martin (essay)
public_note: A German language edition was also published in 2000.  The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's approximately 140 editioned works in all media.  The publication also includes a bibliography and a list of Polke's solo exhibitions.

name: Poliakoff, Serge
item_t: Serge Poliakoff: Werkverzeichnis der Graphik = catalogue raisonné des estampes = catalogue raisonné of the prints.
author_s:
Poliakoff, Alexis                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schneider, Gérard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gautherie-Kampka, Annette

name: Poli, Giuseppe
item_t: Gherardo e Giuseppe Poli : La pittura di capriccio nella Toscana di prima Settecento.
author: Canepa, Franco
public_note: The catalogue has a section dedicated to non-autograph paintings, and for works noted in the literature as by the hand of the Poli, but which could not be examined directly or by photograph.

name: Poliakoff, Serge
item_t: Serge Poliakoff : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Poliakoff, Alexis
public_note: The final volume includes a separate section dealing with Poliakoff's frescoes, works in porcelain, etc. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, collection information, provenance, exhibiton history, and signature information.

name: Poli, Gherardo
item_t: Gherardo e Giuseppe Poli : La pittura di capriccio nella Toscana di prima Settecento.
author: Canepa, Franco
public_note: The catalogue has a section dedicated to non-autograph paintings, and for works noted in the literature as by the hand of the Poli, but which could not be examined directly or by photograph.

name: Poliakoff, Serge
item_t: Serge Poliakoff : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Poliakoff, Alexis
public_note: The catalogue lists 791 works by the artist.  The individual entries provide materials, dimensions, provenance, exhibition history, and signature information.

name: Plüddemann, Hermann Freihold
item_t: Hermann Freihold Plüddemann : Maler und Illustrator zwischen Spätromantik und Historismus (1809-1869) : ein Werkverzeichnis.
author: Mai, Ekkehard
public_note:
Following the introductory texts, the publication includes a biography of the artist and essays on his work as a history painter, portraitist, and draughtsman. The catalogue raisonné covers paintings, drawings and graphic works.

There is a bibliography, a list of plates, and an index.

name: Plessi, Fabrizio
item_t: Fabrizio Plessi : Opus Video Sculpture : Werkverzeichnis der Video-Skulturen und-Installationen 1976-1998 = Catalogue Raisonné of the Video Sculptures and Installations 1976-1998 = Opera complete delle sculture e installationi di video 1976-1998.
author_s:
Klotz, Heinrich                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Koelen, Dorothea van der
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the artist's video sculptures and installations from 1979-1998 was published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Guggenheim Museum, Soho and the Museum of Contemporary Art, San Diego.

name: Poelenburch, Cornelis van
item_t: Cornelis van Poelenburch, 1595/5-1667 : The Paintings.
author: Sluijter-Seijffert, Nicolette Cathérine
ind_entr_cont: Each entry contains: title, location, measurements, provenance, literature, replicas, prints, drawings, and comments.
public_note: Provenance; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Pokhitonov, Ivan
item_t: Ivan Pokhitonov : Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvreIvan Pokhitonov : Katalog-rezone proizvedenii = Ivan Pokhitonov : Catalogue Raisonné. Volume 1
author: Bertrand, Olivier
public_note: The first published in a series of three projected volumes, this one focusing on interiors, etc.,  Volume 2 will cover European landscapes and townscapes, and Volume 3 will deal with Russian country-scapes, portraits, and works formerly found in Gatchina Palace.

name: Plavinksy, Dm
item_t: Dmitri Plavinksy.
author_s:
Bowlt, John E.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jakimovich, Alexander                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Plavinskaya-Mikhailova, Elizaveta
public_note: The publication covers the artist's paintings, graphic art, objects and installations from 1958 to 2000.  There are essays dealing with the artist's career by  John Bowlt and Alexandeer Jakimovich. Elizaveta Plavinskaya-Mikhailova discusses the themes and techniques of Plavinsky's graphic art.  It also includes a text by  Plavinsky discussing his reflections on art and culture.

name: Platzer, Johann Georg
item_t: Johann Georg Platzer : der Farbenzauberer des Barock, 1704-1761.
author: Krapf, Michael
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of the South Tyrolean painter.  The catalogue is organized alphabetically by location. In addition to the catalogue of work, the publication includes documents related to the artist's life and a bibliography.

name: Plattemontagne, Nicolas de
item_t: Trois maîtres du dessin. Philippe de Champaigne (1602-1674), Jean-Baptiste de Champaigne (1631-1681), Nicolas de Plattemontagne (1631-1706).
imprint: Paris : Éditions de la Réunion des musées nationaux, 2009.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Musée national de Port-Royal-des-Champes. The publication includes a list of rejected works.

name: Pjettursson, Tikkil

author: Torm, Erik
public_note: This is the English/French translation of "Tikkili Pjettursson Kalaaleq Qalipakkanik oqaluttuartartoq Uummannamut asannittoq En grønlandsk billedfortæller med hjertet i Uummannaq."

item_t: Camille Pissarro : son art--son oeuvre.
public_note: This is an early comprehensive critical study of Pissarro's oeuvre. For a later edition of the book, with an updated bibliography, see the 1989 catalogue published by Wofsy (cited in this database).

name: Poliakoff, Serge
item_t: Serge Poliakoff : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Poliakoff, Alexis
public_note: The catalogue lists 758 works by the artist.  Entries list materials, dimensions, collection information, provenance, exhibition history, and signature information.

name: Piranesi, Giovanni Battista

author: Poliakoff, Alexis

author: Levinson, Orde

name: Poliakoff, Serge
item_t: Serge Poliakoff : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The text of the catalogue raisonné is in French, with a bilingual introduction and some critical apparatus (there are lists of collectors and personal names, exhibitions, and a general bibliography).

name: Pollaiuolo, Piero
item_t: I Pollaiolo.
author: Pons, Nicoletta
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes an introductory essay, an index, and a bibliography.

name: Piper, John

author: Levinson, Orde
public_note: A third revised and expanded edition was published by Lund Humphries in 2010 (isbn 9781848220638); this edition includes a critical essay by David Fraser Jenkins on Piper's prints of the 1960s.

name: Pollaiuolo, Antonio
item_t: I Pollaiolo.
author: Pons, Nicoletta
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes an introductory essay, an index, and a bibliography.

name: Piola, Pellegro
item_t: Pellegro Piola.
author: Zanolla, Virgilio
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the paintings and drawings, the publication includes a biography of the artist and a critical discussion of his work. It also contains a genealogy of Piola's family, selected documents, and location and title indices.

name: Piola, Domenico, I
item_t: Domenico Piola e i pittori della sua "casa".

author: Babelon, Jean
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-arts: éditions d'études et de documents, 1927.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries give number, title (upper case for authentic works - lower case for those not seen by the author and without firm documentation), date, medium, dimensions, comments, references, and collection if known.

name: Pippal, Hans Robe
item_t: Hans Robert Pippal : Wien 1915-Wien 1998 : zwischen Innovation und Tradtion : Werkkatalog der Ölbilder.
author_s:
Pippal, Martina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rychlik, Otmar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Voggeneder, Elisabeth
public_note:
The is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Kunsthistorisches Museum, Palais Harrach, Vienna, 2003.

In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes essays on the artist's life and career in Vienna and his exhibition in the Wiener Secession of May 1954. There is also an essay by Martina Pippal with recollections of her father.

name: Pino, Marco
item_t: Marco Pino : opera completa.
author: Zezza, Andrea
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes sections outlining the artist's career, organized by place and date. The publication also includes a register of documents in Italian and Latin, an anthology of critical writings on the artist, a bibliography, and indices of names, locations, and works.

name: Piranesi, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Piranesi : Early Architectural Fantasies, a Catalogue Raisonné of the Etchings.
author: Robison, Andrew
imprint: Washington : National Gallery of Art ; Chicago : University of Chicago Press, 1986.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is a short biography and a chapter on watermarks.

name: Pippin, Horace
item_t: I Tell My Heart : The Art of Horace Pippin.
author_s:
Stein, Judith E.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            West, Cornel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wilson, Judith                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Powell, Richard J., et al.
imprint: Philadelphia : Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts in association with Universe Publishing, 1993.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition organized by the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts and held at the Art Institute of Chicago; Baltimore Museum of Art; Cincinnati Art Museum, and Metropolitan Museum of Art.  The catalogue raisonné includes an illustrated list of all known works by the artist.

name: Piranesi, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovanni Battista Piranesi : The Complete Etchings.
author: Ficacci, Luigi

name: Piranesi, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovanni Battista Piranesi : The Complete Etchings.
author: Wilton-Ely, John
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1994.
public_note: This is the first illustrated edition, listing 1,018 etchings.  The publication includes concordances to Focillon, Hind and Robison (see entries cited in this database).

name: Pisanello
item_t: L'opera completa del Pisanello.
public_note:
Published in the series: "Classici dell'arte", n. 56.  The critical apparatus was compiled by Renzo Chiarelli.

The introductory materials include a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes, the place of color in his art, a list of the painted works, and an essential biography. The catalogue raisonné covers the authentic drawings, lost works, further attributed works. There are indices of titles and themes, and places.

name: Pisanello
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Pisanello.
public_note:
Published in the French series "Les classiques de l'art", this is a translation of  "L'opera completa del Pisanello". The publication includes research by Renzo Chiarelli.

In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is a brief biography of the artist with a discussion of his critical fortunes. There is also a chronology and a discussion of the iconography of all the paintings, drawings, and medals by or attributed to Pisanello.

name: Pissarro, Camille
item_t: Camille Pissarro: L'oeuvre gravé et lithographié. The Etchings and Lithographs : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Delteil, Loys                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hyman, Alan (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cailac, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pissarro, Ludovic Rodo
imprint: San Francisco: Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1999.
public_note: Originally published in 1923, this is a fully illustrated, revised edition, with new annotations in English.

name: Pisano, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Pisano : His Life and Work.
author: Venturi, Adolfo
public_note: This study presents a chronological record of the artist's career, essays on his work, and a list of the works. The bibliography is also organized chronologically.

name: Pissarro, Camille
item_t: Pissarro : Critical Catalogue of Paintings.
author_s:
Pissarro, Joachim                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Durand-Ruel Snollaerts, Claire                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wildenstein, Guy (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brettell, Richard R. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            de Buffévent, Alexia (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Champié, Annie (collaborator)
imprint: Milan : Skira ; Paris : Wildenstein Institute; New York : Rizzoli (U.S. distributor), 2005.
public_note: The catalogue describes 1,528 paintings, the majority illustrated in color, and 213 of them new or rediscovered.

name: Pissarro, Lucien
item_t: A Catalogue of the Oil Paintings of Lucien Pissarro.
author_s:
Thorold, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lloyd, Christopher (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bensusan-Butt, John (intro.)
public_note: The catalogue is based on the artist's studio book from 1914 to his death, much of which was set down from memory, aided by John Bensusan-Butt.  It is also based on information found in old exhibition catalogues, reviews, correspondence, and literary references.  Although the author planned to produce a supplement covering the remaining untraced early works, none was published.

name: Pissarro, Lucien
item_t: The Wood-engravings of Lucien Pissarro with a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Fern, Alan Maxwell
public_note: The author's Ph.D. Thesis, University of Chicago, 1960.

name: Piffaretti, Bernard

author_s:
Asthoff, Jens                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Muracciole, Marie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Galvez, Paul
public_note: Published under the aegis of the Museé d'art moderne et contemporain, Geneva.  This monographic study also presents a "reasonable catalogue raisonné"  of the artist's painted oeuvre.

name: Pietro de Saliba
item_t: Antonello da Messina and his Workshop.
author: Skorupa, Thomas
public_note: Short listings of each painter's work have catalogue  number, title, provenance, scholarship, dating and condition, and related works.  The more extensive entries give inscriptions, descriptions, provenance, dates, related works, technical documents and references.

name: Pietro della Vecchia
item_t: Pietro della Vecchia and the Heritage of the Renaissance in Venice.
author: Aikema, Bernard
imprint: Florence : Istituto universitario olandese di storia dell'arte, 1990.
public_note:
This is the translation of the author's doctoral thesis, "Schilder Pietro della Vecchia en de erfenis van de renaissance in Venetië," presented at the Universiteit van Amsterdam in 1986.

In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a foreword and biography, plus several sections considering the artist's oeuvre and career.

name: Pierre, Jean Baptiste Marie
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Marie Pierre, 1714-1789 : premier peintre du roi.
author_s:
Lesur, Nicholas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Aaron, Olivier                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bailey, Colin B. (preface)
public_note: The catalogue also contains a detailed geneaology/family tree, critical reviews of Pierre's work, inventory of Pierre estate at the National Archives and portraits of the artist.

name: Piero, di Cosimo
item_t: L'opera completa di Piero di Cosimo
author: Bacci, Mina

name: Piero, della Francesca
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Piero della Francesca.
public_note: Full color images for all entries with additional black and white photographs.  The Appendix includes an essay on Piero's draftsmanship and treatises.  There are also title and topographical indices, and a chronology.

name: Pichot, Ramón
item_t: Ramon Pichot.
author: Borràs,  Maria Lluïsa

author_s:
Camfield, William A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calté, Beverly                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Pierre, Arnauld                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calté, Pierre
public_note: The chronological catalogue raisonné prints in uppercase those titles assigned by the artist; titles not given by the artist but are in common use are in lower case. All other entries are untitled.  Dates not assigned by the artist are given in a date range based on style or historical details; when photos of different versions are available, each receives a separate number. The catalogue entries include signature, inscriptions on recto and verso…, brief comments, provenance, exhibitions, and references.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso Peintre-Graveur. Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié et des monotypes, 1899-1931. Volume I.
public_note:
Revised and updated edition by Brigitte Baer, of Geiser's first catalogue originally  published in 1933 (and reprinted in 1955). 
This new edition has new found states, corrected datings, and also lists some works formerly overlooked by the artist himself. It is printed from new plates.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso Peintre-Graveur. Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et des monotypes 1932-1934. Volume II
author_s:
Geiser, Bernhard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Scheidegger, Alfred                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baer, Brigitte
public_note:
This is a revised edition of the original second volume in the "Picasso peintre-graveur" series, which was issued in 1968 (subsequent reprintings) by Bernhard Geiser, with Alfred Scheidegger's collaboration.
Updated here by Brigitte Baer, contains errata for v.1-3-4-5.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso Lithographe. IV

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso Lithographe. III

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso Lithographe. II.
illustrations: 105 b&w and color pl., 2 original lithographs

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso Lithographe. I
illustrations: b&w and color, plus 2 original lithographs
public_note:
Picasso designed original lithographs for all four volumes of  the original French edition.
An English language single volume edition, enitltled "Picasso Lithographs", translated. by Jean Didry, was also published by Boston Book and Art Co., Boston, 1970.

Alan Wofsy has also published a revised edition Mourlot's four-v.catalogue in a 2 v.edition, San Francisco, 2009, listed in this database under the series: "Picasso Project"

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso : The Blue and Rose Period ; a Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings, 1900-1906.
author_s:
Daix, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Boudaille, Georges                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rosselet, Joan (catalogue)
imprint: Greenwich, CT : New York Graphic Society, [1967].
public_note:
This is a translation of "Picasso 1900-1906 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint 1900, 1901, 1906 / Pierre Daix ; 1902 à 1905 Georges Boudaille" (1966). A later revised 1988 reprint of the original French edition is also cited in this database.

See also Daix's companion volume: "Le cubisme de Picasso…" (cited in this database).

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso : Catalogue of the Printed Graphic Work and Catalogue of the Printed Ceramics. Volume IV: 1970-1972 and Supplement to Volumes I and II.
author: Bloch, Georges
public_note:
This is the fourth and final volume in Bloch's series on Picasso's printed graphics; it also contains supplements to the first and second volumes.
See also: "Picasso Project" [v. 17], which is a revised edition Bloch v. IV published in 2005, cited in this database.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso : Catalogue of the Printed Graphic Work and Catalogue of the Printed Ceramics. Volume III: Catalogue of the Printed Ceramics, 1949-1971.
author: Bloch, Georges
public_note: This, the third volume, covers the ceramic work, 1949-1971.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso : Catalogue of the Printed Graphic Work and Catalogue of the Printed Ceramics. Volume I: 1904-1967.
author: Bloch, Georges
public_note:
"Catalogue de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié, 1904-1967". Captions are in French.
Originally published on the occasion of an exhibition held in Zurich, 1968. This is a revised edition of the first volume of Georges Bloch's four volume study on Picasso's graphic work and ceramics. Editions Kornfeld also issued a new edition in 1999.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso's Posters.
author: Czwiklitzer, Christopher
public_note:
The French edition of this book was issued under the title: "Les affiches de Picasso", Paris, 1970.

The author also published a later study on Picasso's posters: "Picasso, Plakate 1923-1973 : Werkverzeichnis" (Munich ; Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag, 1981).

The publication includes chronological and geographical indices.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Céramique de Picasso.
author: Ramié, Georges
public_note: Documents the 20 some year period when Picasso made original and editioned ceramics at Ramié's Atelier Madoura in the ancient pottery region of Vallauris, in southern France.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso : Catalogue of the Printed Graphic Work and Catalogue of the Printed Ceramics. Volume II: 1966-1969.
author: Bloch, Georges
public_note:
Catalogue de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié., 1966-1969.
Originally published in 1971, this is the third edition of the second volume of Georges Bloch's four volume study on Picasso's graphic work and ceramics.
See also: "Picasso Project" [v. 16] which is a revised edition of Bloch v.II published in 2005,  cited in this database.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Le Cubisme de Picasso : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, 1907-1916.
public_note:
An English edition entitled "Picasso, the Cubist Years, 1907-1916: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings and Related Works," was published by Thames and Hudson, London, 1979; an American edition was also published by the New York Graphic Society, Boston in the same year. Dorothy S. Blair translated the French edition into English.

See also Daix's earlier volume: "Picasso: The Blue and Rose Period: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings, 1900-1906" (published in French as "Picasso 1900-1906: catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint" (1966); and the reprint ed. (1998), all cited in this database.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso, the Early Years, 1881-1907.
author: Palau i Fabre, Josep
public_note: An almost complete catalogue of paintings and drawings from 1881 - 1907.  More than 1500 paintings and drawings included.  Originally published as "Picasso vivent 1881-1907. Infantesa I primera joventut d'un demiurg" (Barcelona: Ediciones Poligrafa, 1980).

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso : The Illustrated Books: Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Goeppert, Sebastian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goeppert-Frank, Herma                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cramer, Patrick
public_note: A catalogue of 156 books and publications containing original graphic designs by the artist, fully illustrated and described.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Je suis le cahier : The Sketchbooks of Pablo Picasso.
author_s:
Glimcher, Arne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Glimcher, Marc                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Krauss, Rosalind et al.
imprint: Boston : Atlantic Monthly Press; New York : Pace Gallery, 1986.
public_note:
Published in conjunction with an exhibition at Pace Gallery, NY, this is a catalogue raisonné of the artist's previously unpublished 175 private sketchbooks. 

The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Matthew Marks. Additional contributors include: Sam Hunter, Gert Schiff, Françoise Gilot, and Claude Picasso.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso 1900-1906 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint : 1900, 1901, 1906, Pierre Daix ; 1902 à 1905, Georges Boudaille ; catalogue établi avec la collaboration de Joan Rosselet
author_s:
Daix, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Boudaille, Georges                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rosselet, Joan
public_note:
A revised reprint with a new introduction of the original  l966 French edition (which was published in English as "Picasso; The Blue and Rose Period…", cited in this database).
See as well  the author's companion study: "Le cubisme de Picasso…, 1979", also cited in this database.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Carnets : Catalogue des dessins du Musée Picasso.
illustrations: v.1: 1840, including 16 color; v.2: 1391, including 16 color
public_note: A catalogue of the drawings within the important holdings of the Musée nationale Picasso, Paris

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: On-line Picasso Project.
author: Mallen, Enrique
cronology: Individual entries include title (in French), date, medium, provenance, references, exhibitions, dimensions, and scalable color images.
ind_entr_cont: The project is an academic research project supported by Sam Houston University in Texas.  Access to the online catalogue raisonné is free, but users must contact the project to request a login.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso : The Lithographs.
author_s:
Reusse, Felix                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Deschamps, Henri                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Franz, Erich                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gauss, Ulrike
imprint: Ostfildern-Ruit : Hatje Cantz Verlag ; New York : distributed in the US by DAP, 2000.
public_note:
The publication includes works mostly from the Huizinga Collection in the Graphikmuseum Pablo Picasso, Münster. 

The catalogue presents the entire lithographic oeuvre (855 items) with many rare, unique, or unpublished examples (some of the lithographs are originally from the Mourlot collection). Every printed sheet is listed individually.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Picasso : The Art of the Poster = die Plakatkunst = l'art de l'affiche : From the Collection of the Kunstmuseum Heidenheim.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Versicherungskammer Bayern, Munich, 2000.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso, the Sculptures.
public_note: The individual entries include title, signature and date, materials, dimensions, edition information, illustration information, and concordances.

name: Picasso, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Picasso / by Christian Zervos [new English ed., 2013].
author: Zervos, Christian
public_note:
This is a limited re-edition of the original catalogue (33 v. in 34 v., published from 1932-1978).  
The set is now offered in two separate numbered language editions (for the first time in English, as well as the original French).  
The new series is essentially a re-publication of the original (issued with the approval of the Picasso estate) by the reconstituted publisher "Cahiers d'art", under the direction of its new owner Staffan Ahrenberg.

name: Piero, della Francesca
item_t: Piero della Francesca : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Paolucci, Antonio
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 20 paintings by the artist, and includes lost works. There is also a geographical index of collections housing Piero's works.

name: Piero, della Francesca
item_t: Piero della Francesca.
public_note:
The second edition revises and expands the author's original 1971 publication (Milan: Istituto Editoriale Italiano).

The appendices include excerpts of documents related to Piero's life and a discussion of the conservation and restoration of his paintings.

name: Piero, della Francesca
item_t: Piero della Francesca.
author: Bertelli, Carlo
public_note: The publication of the catalogue coincided with the 500th anniversary of Piero's death. The catalogue is divided into two parts. The first contains a biography of the artist and a discussion of his scientific and mathematical treatises. The second part includes the catalogue raisonné, which lists 20 authentic paintings.

name: Piano, Renzo
item_t: Renzo Piano Building Workshop : Complete Works. Vol. 5.
author: Buchanan, Peter
public_note: Fifth volume of the catalogue raisonné. Complete catalogue of Piano's building projects and technical designs from 2000 to the date of publication.

name: Piano, Renzo
item_t: Renzo Piano Building Workshop : Complete Works. Vol. 4.
author: Buchanan, Peter

name: Piano, Renzo
item_t: Renzo Piano Building Workshop : Complete Works. Vol. 1.
author: Buchanan, Peter

name: Piazzetta, Giovanni Battista
item_t: L'opera completa del Piazzetta.
public_note: Volume 108 of the "Classici dell'arte" series. Catalogue of over 300 accepted paintings and 83 drawings by Piazzetta. Also contains lists of lost works, works known only through engravings, and a catalogue of paintings previously attributed to Piazzetta.

name: Piano, Renzo
item_t: Renzo Piano Building Workshop : Complete Works. Vol. 3.
author: Buchanan, Peter
public_note: Covers Renzo's projects from the early 1990s.

name: Pflug, Johann Bap

author: Degreif, Uwe (ed.)
imprint: Lindenberg i. Allgäu : Kunstverlag Josef Fink, 2016.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhition at Museum Biberach, 29 Oct. 2016 - 19 Mar. 2017.

name: Pérez Villaamil, Genaro
item_t: El paisajista romántico Jenaro Pérez Villaamil.
author: Arias Anglés, Enrique
imprint: Madrid : Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Científicas, Centro de Estudios Históricos, Departamento de H[istori]a del Arte "Diego Velázquez", 1986.
public_note: This study contains a prologue, biography and study of the work, plus a series of chronological chapters on the artist's career and life. There is also a separate section with excerpts of documents.

name: Pèquignot, Jean-Pierre

public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the paintings and drawings, the publication  includes a biography, an index of sales, and excerpts of documents from Peyron's life.

name: Pevsner, Antoine

public_note:
The Introductory texts include a discussion of the "Realistic Manifesto",  published by Pevsner and his brother, Naum Gabo.

Appendices include a biography, a concordance with Pierre Peissi's "Antoine Pevsner: Tribute by a Friend" (Editions du Griffon, 1961), and a concordance table.

name: Pettenkofen, August Xaver Karl, Ritter von

author: Weixlgärtner, Arpad
public_note: The second volume contains the catalogue raisonné of the artist's lithographs, dated and undated paintings, and drawings.  The catalogue also includes examples of the artist's handwriting and signatures.

name: Petitot, Ennemond Alexandre
item_t: Ennemond Alexandre Petitot : Lyon 1727 -1801 Parma.
author: Cirillo, Giuseppe
imprint: Parma : Fondazione Cassa di risparmio di Parma : Monte di credito su pegno di Busseto, 2002.
public_note:
The publication is organized chronologically, and discusses individual buildings and projects from 1744-1801 by year. Not all works are illustrated. There is also a separate catalogue of Petitot's drawings and designs.  

Further apparatus includes a listing of manuscript sources, a bibliography, and indices.

name: Peters, Herbe
item_t: Herbert Peters : Plastiken und Skulpturen : Werkverzeichnis.
public_note: Much of the documentation for the catalogue (up to entry number 173) was based on the unpublished dissertation of Barbara Bergdolt (Heidelberg, 1987).

                                                            Sundheimer, Florian (ed.)
imprint: Nuremberg : Verlag für Moderne Kunst Nürnberg, 2007.
public_note: This is considered the second part of a catalogue of the artist's work; the title on the spine is " Herbert Peters Band II".

name: Pettibon, Raymond
item_t: Raymond Pettibon : The Books 1978-1998.
public_note:
Originally published in a German ed. (Cologne:  Walther Ko¨nig).

The publication contains numerous published books and pamphlets by the artist, 30 of which are reprinted in their entirety and in their original formats. It also includes complete reprints of 2 previously unpublished books ("Poloriods" and "Tripping Corpse 12") from the artist's archive.

name: Petersen, Christian
item_t: Christian Petersen, Sculptor.
author_s:
DeLong, Lea Rosson                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Pohlman, Lynette
imprint: Ames : Iowa State University Press, in assoc. Brunnier Art Museum, Iowa State University, Ames, 2000.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Brunnier Art Museum, Iowa State University.  The catalogue raisonné, which was compiled by Dana Michels, Lea Rosson DeLong and Lynette Pohlman, records over 1,000 works by the sculptor.  Introductory material includes several sections dealing with the artist's life and work, a chronology, an index, and the exhibition checklist.

name: Pettenkofen, August Xaver Karl, Ritter von
item_t: August Pettenkofen, 1822-1889. Vol. 1
author: Weixlgärtner, Arpad
public_note: The first volume contains a biography of the artist and a discussion of his artistic career. Volume 1 contains the illustrations of works listed in the catalogue.

name: Peterdi, Gabo
item_t: Gabor Peterdi : Twenty-five Years of his Prints, 1934-1959.
author: Johnson, Una E
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at the Brooklyn Museu (Oct. 26-Jan. 4, 1960), with a (mostly unillustrated) catalogue raisonné.

name: Pesne, Antoine
item_t: Antoine Pesne.
public_note: Issued under the aegis of the Staatlichen Schlösser und Gärten Berlin in Verbindung mit dem Deutschen Verein für Kunstwissenschaft.

name: Perugino

author: Williamson, George C.

name: Perronneau, Jean-Baptiste

public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

author: Dotal, Christiane
public_note:
After an introduction describing the stylistic approach of the catalogue, there is a list of abbreviations, followed by a catalogue raisonné of the sculpture.

The publication includes an extensive bibliography of published and archival sources, and separate indices of titles, locations, and names.

name: Pergay, Maria
item_t: Maria Pergay : Complete Works, 1957-2010.
public_note: Includes a biographical essay by Adam Lindemann. The catalogue raisonné lists 87 decorative objects and 174 furniture designs, arranged in approximate chronological order.

imprint: Paris : Archives Charlotte Perriand : Editions Norma, 2017.
public_note: This volume traces the designer's activity in creating the Galerie Steph Simon, new editions of furniture: "Le Corbusier, Jeanneret, Perriand", editions for Heidi Weber and Cassina, travel agencies designed for Air France, various projects in Geneva and Brazil, and Japanese government commisions in Paris from 1956-1969.

name: Pennell, Joseph

Wuerth, Louis A. (compiled by)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pennell, Elizabeth Robins (Introduction)

name: Pencz, Georg

author: Röttinger, Heinrich

name: Pencz, Georg

author:

public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biographical essay and a topographical index.

author: Wiseman, Carter
public_note:
This was the first full-scale catalogue of the architect's buildings and projects.  A revised edition was published by Thames & Hudson in 2001, and it includes a chapter on Pei's projects since 1990.

In addition to the catalogue, the present publication includes an introduction and discussions of Pei's life and career.

name: Pei, I.M.

author_s:
Pasqualucci, Grace Watenphul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pasqualucci, Alessandra                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Degenhart, Bernhard (foreword)
public_note:
The first volume has a biography, texts of letters and other writings, and the critical apparatus for the catalogue raisonné of  paintings and watercolors.  It also includes numerous appendices on the literature, exhibitions, letters and writings.

The second volume contains the catalogue of the drawings and the graphic works. It also contains a supplement to v. 1, as well as sections on enamels, textiles, and photographs.

public_note: Unless noted otherwise, works are the property of the artist; dates are estimated and not all works or locations have been ascertained. The work includes silver smithing, sculpture, installations and objects, plus drawings, and works issued in printed editions (listed with edition numbers, publisher and date)..

item_t: Clara Peeters (1594 - ca. 1640) and the Development of Still-life Painting in Northern Europe.
author: Decoteau, Pamela Hibbs

name: Perriand, Charlottte

public_note: The second volume covers Perriand's years in Japan (1940-1942) and Indochina (1942-1946), her return to France, designs for Knoll, work on l'Unité de'habitation in Marseilles, further commissions for private and public buildings, collaboration with Jean Prouvé, work with Tange and her influence on Japanese design.

name: Perceval, John
item_t: John Perceval.
author: Allen, Traudi
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné includes a biography of the artist with a discussion of his works by decade. The catalogue raisonné of the paintings lists works from 1936-1981. 

The author notes that paintings executed from 1984-1991 have been excluded, as have certain paintings from the 1970s that do not "sit appropriately" with the body of his work.

The Appendix includes a catalogue of ceramics and drawings referred to in the text.

name: Patinir, Joachim

author: Vergara, Alejandro
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of all 29 paintings by the artist. The catalogue was published in conjunction with exhibition "Joachim Patinir and the Invention of Landscape" at the Prado Museum.

The first volume was originally published in 1939 as "The Artist of the Revolution; the Early Life of Charles Willson Peale."

name: Parmigianino

author: Freedberg, Sydney J.
public_note:
The catalogue was reprinted in 1971 (Westport, CT: Greenwood Press).  The current publication was originally presented as the author's doctoral thesis at Harvard University in 1940.

The catalogue is divided into three parts: the first two dealing with  discussions of Parmigianino's religious and mythological paintings, portraits, and artistic milieu. The catalogue raisonné lists authentic works, attributed paintings, and lost works.  Preparatory drawings are listed in an addendum to the catalogue.

name: Parrish, Stephen
item_t: Stephen Parrish The Etchings :  A Catalogue Raisonné.

name: Paolini, Pietro

public_note: Following the introductory essay, the catalogue raisonné covers Paresce's paintings and works on paper from 1904-1936.   The appendices include a biography, bibliography, a register of Paresce's writings and articles, and a list of exhibitions.

name: Pancheri, Gino
item_t: Gino Pancheri : opere 1925-1943.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all of Pancheri's easel paintings and murals from 1925 to 1943. There is also a biography, a list of exhibitions, and a bibliography.

name: Palmer, Walter Laun
item_t: Walter Launt Palmer, Poetic Reality.
imprint: Exton, PA : Schiffer Publishing, Ltd. ; Jupiter, FL : Distributed by ALM Associates, 1984.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 1,070 paintings. Publication contains a checklist of exhibited paintings, and a list of sketchbooks in the Albany Insitute of the History of Art.

name: Paret y Alcázar, Lu
item_t: Dibujos de Luis Paret y Alcázar (1746-1799) : catalógo razonado.
author: Martinez, Alejandro
imprint: Madrid : Gobierno de España, Ministerio de Educación, Cultura y Deporte, Biblioteca Nacional de España ; Centro de Estudios Europa Hispánica, 2018.
public_note: It also includes an appendix with a reconstruction of the artist's library, as well as a list of autograph prints and missing works that are known only from the prints.

name: Palmer, Samuel
item_t: Samuel Palmer and His Etchings.
author: Lister, Raymond
public_note: See also the author's 1988 "A Complete Catalogue Raisonné of the Works of Samuel Palmer" (cited in this database).

name: Palmer, Samuel
item_t: Samuel Palmer, 1805-1881 : Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings and Drawings and a Selection of the Prints in the Ashmolean Museum.
author: Brown, David Blayney
public_note: This is followed by a selection of graphic works housed at the Ashmolean Museum.  The catalogue of prints also includes information on states.

name: Pan, Yuliang

author_s:

name: Palmer, Samuel
item_t: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Works of Samuel Palmer.
author: Lister, Raymond
imprint: Cambridge ; New York : Cambridge University Press, 1988.
ind_entr_cont: Individual entries include information about inscriptions, exhibitions, provenance, bibliographical references, and notes about the work.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

                                                            Pankok, Otto                                                            ;&nbsp

name: Pantoja de la Cruz, Juan
item_t: Juan Pantoja de la Cruz.
author: Kusche, Maria
public_note: A German edition was issued by the publishers in the same year.  A revised and expanded Spanish language edition was published in 2007, which  also includes sections on the artist's three most prominent followers (see entry in this database).

name: Panton, Verne
item_t: Verner Panton : das Gesamtwerk.
imprint: Weil am Rhein : Vitra Design Museum, 2000.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is drawn on the extensive holdings (objects and archives) of the Vitra Museum in Weil am Rhein, and is associated with circulating exhibitions held at the Vitra Design Museums in Weil am Rhein and Berlin, plus later exhibitions in Europe and the Far East.  Different editions seem to have been issued for some of the later venues.

name: Pantoja de la Cruz, Juan
item_t: Juan Pantoja de la Cruz y sus seguidores : B. González, R. de Villandrando y A. López Polanco.
author: Kusche, Maria
public_note: This is an enlarged and updated edition of the study originally published in 1964 by Castalia (see entry in this database).

name: ltdorfer, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Altdorfer, die Gemälde : Tafelbilder, Miniaturen, Wandbilder, Bildhauerarbeiten, Werkstatt und Umkreis.
author: Winzinger, Franz
imprint: Munich : Hirmer ; Munich, Zurich : R. Piper, 1975.
public_note:
This is a catalogue raisonné of Altdorfer's paintings, including altarpieces, miniatures, and wall paintings. The publication also considers his sculpture, works by his studio, and works by other members of the artist's circle.
This study, with Winzinger's two other publications on the drawings and the graphic works (listed in this database) constitute a catalogue of the artist's complete work.

name: ltdorfer, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Altdorfer : Graphik, Holzschnitte, Kuperstiche, Radierungen, Gesamtausgabe.
author: Winzinger, Franz
public_note: A catalogue of Altdorfer's graphic work, it includes the watermarks. This, with the two other publications by Winzinger dealing with the paintings and drawings (listed in this database) constitute a catalogue of the artist's work.

name: lten, Mathias Joseph
item_t: Mathias J. Alten : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Straub, James A.
ind_entr_cont: On-line catalogue of over 1,700 of the artist's 3,800 known paintings in oil, gouache, and watercolor. The catalogue does not include works on paper. The author is still reviewing paintings for inclusion in the catalogue raisonné.
public_note: check_needed

name: ltenbourg, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Altenbourg : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Janda, Annegret                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heining, Willi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Penndorf, Jutta
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists over 2400 authentic works, arranged chronologically. The publication also contains documents and excerpts from the artist's correspondence.

name: ltenkirch, Otto
item_t: Otto Altenkirch : 1875-1945 : Leben und Werk.
author: Petrasch, Maria von
imprint: Nossen : Staatliche Schlösser , Burgen und Gärten Sachsen , Schloss Nossen , Klosterpark Altzella , 2005.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings. The publication is a companion the  artist's 2005 retrospective exhibition held at the Schloss Nossen. The catalogue lists approximately 2400 paintings,with a separate catalogue of the artist's stage sets. Not all works are illustrated.

name: Palmer, Erastus Dow
item_t: Erastus D. Palmer.
author: Webster, J. Carson

name: bdessemed, Adel
item_t: Adel Abdessemed : Works 1988-2015.
public_note: This is a comprehensive overview of the artist's elaborate body of work, illustrated with over 1300 images.

name: Palma, Jacopo, il vecchio
item_t: Palma il Vecchio, l'opera completa.
author: Rylands, Philip

name: Palma, Jacopo, il vecchio
item_t: Palma Vecchio.
author: Rylands, Philip
imprint: Cambridge ; New York : Cambridge University Press, 1992.
public_note:
Originally presented as the author's doctoral thesis at King's College, Cambridge in 1981.  This is the English edition of "Palma Il Vecchio: L'opera completa" (Arnoldo Mondadori Editore, 1988).

Following the introductory texts (critical legacy, documents and documented paintings excluding altarpiecs, altarpieces, sacra conversazione, and portraits), the catalogue raisonné is divided into sections covering authentic paintings, authentic drawings, attributed works, and lost paintings.

There is a register of documents, a genealogy of the artist's family, name and place indices, and bibliography.

name: Palma, Jacopo, il vecchio
item_t: Palma il Vecchio.
author: Mariacher, Giovanni
public_note: From the series "Antichi pittori italiani; collana di studi mongrafici".  In addition to the catalogue of authentic works, there are sections dealing with doubtful and collaborative works, and lost or untraced works.  There are also indices for names, locations, and titles.

name: Palma, Jacopo, il vecchio
item_t: Palma il Vecchio, l'opera completa.
author: Mason Rinaldi, Stefania
public_note:
The introductory essays include a biography of the artist and a discussion of his critical fortunes.

The catalogue has separate sections on the autograph works, preparatory drawings, mosaics, uncertain or dubious works, and lost pieces. There are also name and location indices and documentary appendices,

name: bbati, Giuseppe
item_t: Giuseppe Abbati : l'opera completa.
author: Dini, Piero

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: The Palazzo da Porto Festa in Vicenza.
author: Forssmann, Erik
imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press, 1973.

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: The Villa Badoer at Fratta Polesine.
author: Puppi, Lionello
imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press [1975].

name: Palma, Jacopo, il giovane
item_t: Palma il Giovane : l'opera completa.
author: Mason Rinaldi, Stefania
public_note:
Part of the series : "Profili e saggi di arte veneta".  Following introductory essays, there is a summary of the artist's critical fortunes, and a section on documents. 

The catalogue raisonné comprises separate sections dealing with autograph paintings, preparatory drawings, and mosaics. This is  followed by listings of uncertain attributions, dubious works, and lost works.  There are also  indices of names, locations, and iconographic subjects.

name: Paladino, Mimmo
item_t: Paladino : Sculpture 1980-2008.
public_note:
This volume includes over 400 sculptures by the artist. The catalogue divides the works into sections: individual sculptures, installations, relationship between sculpture and architecture, and projects in urban spaces. Catalogue includes a discussion of the artist's foundries.

An Italian edition is published under the same imprint.

name: Pajetta, Guido Paolo
item_t: Guido Pajetta : catalogo generale ragionato dei dipinti.
author_s:
Crispolti, Enrico                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ferrari, Silvia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pajetta, Giorgio

name: Palazuelo, Pablo

author: Torre, Alfonso de la
imprint: Madrid : Fundación Azcona : Fundación Pablo Palazuelo, 2015.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries contain title, year, medium, dimensions, collection, inscriptions, signature, and notes.

name: Pajou, Jacques-Augustin-Catherine
item_t: Jacques-Augustin-Catherine Pajou, 1766-1828, peintre d'histoire et de portrait.
public_note: The book has a biography and catalogue raisonné of the painting and drawings.  Appendices contain a chronology, examples of the artist's signature, lists of salons & sales, and other works by Pajou family members.  There is also a bibliography and indices of works, artists' names and locations.

name: Padrón, Antonio
item_t: El pintor Antonio Padrón.
author: Padrón Martinon, María Victoria
imprint: La Palmas : Cabildo Insular de Gran Canaria, 1986.
public_note: The first volume includes a biography, essays on the artist's character and influences, his pictorial evolution, etc. The second volume contains the catalogue raisonné, covering oil paintings, drawings, engravings, linocuts, sculptural works, decorative objects, ceramics, and theatre designs. There is also a documentary appendix.

name: Palermo, Blinky
item_t: Blinky Palermo : Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:

                                                            Schrenk, Klaus                                                            ;&nbsp

Scotucci, Walter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pierangelini, Paola                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ferriani, Daniela (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zampetti, Piedtro (foreword)
public_note: The introductory essays include a general outline of painting in the Marches; the artist's society and familial environment, and a discussion of Pagai's life and stylistic development.  This is followed by the chronological catalogue raisonné. The catalogue first lists authentic works, followed by attributed examples, works of problematical nature, workshop pieces, uncertain attributions (due to lack of critical literature), and lost works. Finally, there is also a list of rejected attributions.

name: Palladio, Andrea

imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press, [1972].

name: Page, William

author: Taylor, Joshua Charles
public_note: This publication is based on the author's 1956 dissertation presented at Princeton University.

name: Paalen, Wolfgang
item_t: Wolfgang Paalen : im Inneren des Wals : Monografie, Schriften, Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Neufert, Andreas
public_note:
The present publication is based on the author's 1997 doctoral thesis, "Dynaton, Versuch einer intellektuellen Biografie des melancholischen Malers Wolfgang Paalen." The catalogue raisonné covers paintings, sculptures and other objects executed between 1920 and 1959.

This present study is based mainly on original photographs, taken, archived and annotated by the artist (preserved by his sister-in-law). Research was also based on the archival records of the artist's widow and of Gordon Onslow Ford, as well as the author's own collection of reproductions from various sources: museums, collection catalogues, and other the literature (including altered works and later versions).

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: The Loggia del Capitaniato.
imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press, 1971.

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: The Chiesa del Redentore.

imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press, 1971.

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: The Basilica of Andrea Palladio.
author: Barbieri. Franco
imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press, 1970.

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: The Rotonda of Andrea Palladio.
author: Semenzato, Camillo
imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press [1968].
illustrations: ca. 130, 3 in color, includes sections & plans
public_note: An updated edition of this was published by Electa, Milan, in 1988, for the Centro Internazionale di Studi di Architettura "Andrea Palladio" di Vicenza, under the rubric "Novum Corpus Palladianum".

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: Andrea Palladio : The Complete Works.
author: Puppi, Lionello
public_note:
This is a reprint of "Andrea Pallado" (Boston : New York Graphic Society, 1975, c1973).

The catalogue raisonné following several introductory essays on Palladio's early, mature and late work.

name: Palladio, Andrea
item_t: Palladio : corpus dei disegni al Museo civico di Vicenza.
public_note: While this is a catalogue of the holdings of the Vicenza Museum, and not a catalogue raisonné per se, it is a comprehensive survey of the architect's working studies with detailed concordances to the Accademia in Vicenza and studies by Puppi, Zorzi (1959) and Spielman (1966).

name: Owens, Laura
item_t: Laura Owens.
author_s:
Ruf, Beatrix                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mengham, Rod                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sutton, Gloria
illustrations: b&w and color plates, numerous b&w thumbnails
public_note:
This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Kunsthalle Zürich and other venues in 2006-2007. The publication lists all of the artist's known paintings from 1994-2006. All works are illustrated in black and white thumbnail images. 

The publication also includes the artist's conversations with Alex Katz, Elizabeth Peyton, Christian Scheidemann, Mary Heilmann, Tomma Abts, and Scott Rothkopf.

name: Ozenfant, Amédée
item_t: Amédée Ozenfant, 1886-1966 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.

                                                            Guénégan, Margaret                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Larock, Marc (preface)

name: Ozenfant, Amédée
item_t: Amédée Ozenfant : catalogue raisonné des oeuvres sur papier = Annotated Catalogue.
author: Guénégan, Pierre
public_note: The publication features a biographical timeline and several essays on Ozenfant's works and artistic development.

name: Ovens, Jürgen

author: Köster, Constanze
public_note: Presented as the author's Ph.D. dissertation for the Christian Albrechts-Universität in 2016.  There is an extensive biography of the artist, a separate section for source materials, a bibliography with  primary and secondary sources, and serveral indices.

name: Oudry, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Jean-Baptiste Oudry, peintre du roi (1686-1755).
author: Locquin, Jean
public_note: This is the first catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings, drawings, and prints. It also includes a studio inventory taken at the artist's death. The publication was reprinted in 1968 (Paris: F. de Nobele).

name: Oud, Jacobus Johannes Piete

                                                            Wagenaar, Cor                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vletter, Martien de
public_note: Published in connection with an exhibition of the same name held at the Netherlands Architecture Institute (NAJ) in Rotterdam. The catalogue covers architectural works including: houses and projects, factories, furnishing and other designs, and interiors.

name: Oudry, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Oudry.
author: Opperman, Hal
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was presented as the author's dissertation, University of Chicago in 1972 as "Jean Baptiste de Oudry, 1686-1755 with a Sketch for a Catalogue Raisonné of His Paintings, Drawings and Prints."

name: Outerbridge, Paul Everard

author_s:

                                                            Blanco, Lourdes                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guevara, Ernesto J.
public_note: Introductory essays discuss the artist's  "color rhythms" and a need for the catalogue raisonné. There are also texts on works and themes emanating from the investigation.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné, a section on Otero's sketches, a biography of the artist, an exhibition list, biblibiography, and a list of works.

name: Ostade, Isack van
item_t: Adriaen van Ostade, Isack van Ostade : Zeichnungen und Aquarelle : Gesamtdarstellung mit Werkkatalogen.
author: Schnackenburg, Bernhard
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of the paintings and drawings. Based on the author's doctoral thesis presented at Ludwig-Maximilians Universität in Munich.

name: Oteiza, Jorge de
item_t: Oteiza : catálgo razonado de escultura.
author: Badiola, Txomin
imprint: Alzuza (Navarra) : Fundación Museo Oteiza Fundazio Museoa ; Donostia : Editorial Nerea, S.A. [2015].
public_note: The first volume catalogues the artist's early figural works; sculptures from 1951-1955 including his works for the Santuario Arantzazu in Oñati, Spain; and later works from 1966-1988, which includes some sculptures for Arantzasu, as well as  potratits and medals.

name: Orley, Richard van
item_t: Richard van Orley (Bruxelles 1663-Bruxelles 1732).
author: Jacobs, Alain
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Chapelle de Nassau, Bibliothèque royale de Belgique, which also contains a catalogue raisonné of the artist's works.

name: Orozco, José Clemente
item_t: José Clemente Orozco : Graphic Work.
author: Orozco, Clemente
imprint: Austin, TX : University of Texas Press, 2004.
public_note: The author is the author's son and the President of the Fundación José Clemente in Guadalajara. The catalogue raisonné lists 30 lithographs and 17 etchings, as well as unfinished prints.

name: Orant, Marthe
item_t: Marthe Orant, 1874-1957 : l'amour passioné de la peinture.
author: Sassi, Etienne
public_note: This is listed as Tome 1: Catalogue Raisonné  but no sign of a second volume has been found to date.

name: Orso, Francesco

author: Daninos, Andrea
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of all of Orso's known wax portrait sculptures.  The publication also includes excerpts of documents in Italian and French related to the artist's career.

author_s:
Curiger, Bice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ammann, Jean-Christophe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bürgi, Dominique
public_note: This catalogue is an in-depth study into the life of the artist; it features Man Ray's photographs of the artist, poems by Meret Oppenheim, and 7 essays about the artist, including one by Oppenheim herself.  The catalogue is in German, but summaries of Curiger's essay and a brief biography of the artist are in French and English.

name: Oppenheim, Mere
item_t: Meret Oppenheim : Defiance in the Face of Freedom.
author_s:
Curiger, Bice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ammann, Jean-Christophe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bürgi, Dominique                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Oppenheim, Meret
imprint: Zurich ; New York : Parkett Publishers; Cambridge, MA : MIT Press, 1989.
public_note: Catalogue entries include titles in German and English, dimensions, collection, and date.  Annotations by the artist are given in footnotes.

item_t: Printed Stuff : Prints, Posters and Ephemera by Claes Oldenburg : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1958-1996.
author_s:
Axsom, Richard H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Platzker, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fleischman, Stephen (Foreword)
imprint: New York : Hudson Hills Press, in association with Madison (Wisconsin)  Art Center, 1997.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with the exhibition "Claes Oldenburg, Printed Stuff" held at the Madison Art Center, the Columbus Museum of Art and the Detroit Institute of Arts.

name: O'Kelly, Aloysiu
item_t: Aloysius O'Kelly : Art, Nation, Empire.
author: O'Sullivan, Niamh
imprint: Dublin : Field Day Publications ; Notre Dame : University of Notre Dame, 2010.
public_note: This study includes essays, an appendix of recorded works, plus the wood engravings, there is a select bibliography. followed by the catalogue, and an index.

name: Ohnsorge, Paul
item_t: Der Maler Paul Ohnsorge : Leben und Werk.
author: Homann, Klaus
public_note:
The publication is divided into two sections. The first part has a foreword, a study of the artist's life, references to works illustrated by plates, and a complete list of the artist's exhibitions. There is a list of paintings, watercolors, pastels, and drawings; examples of the artist's signature; and a supplementary list of projects for glass windows and wall decorations. 

The second section includes illustrations, a bibliography, and the complete list of works.

name: Olsen, John
item_t: Teeming with Life  : His Complete Graphics 1955-2011.
author_s:
McGregor
McGregor, Ken                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Makin, Jeffrey                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Olsen, John
imprint: South Yarra, Vic. : Macmillan Art Publ., 2011.

name: O'Conor, Roderic
item_t: Roderic O'Conor : A Biography, with a Catalogue Raisonné of His Work.
author: Benington, Jonathan
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is chronological, with separate sections for the oils, drawings, watercolors, and prints. Not all works are illustrated.

name: O'Conor, Roderic
item_t: Roderic O'Conor : 1870-1940 : catalogue de l'oeuvre gravé : The Prints of Roderic O'Conor.
author: Johnston, Roy
public_note: Catalogue raisonné published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Musée de Pont-Aven.

name: Odefey, Ern
item_t: Ernst Odefey 1881-1964 : Leben und Werk des Hamburger Malers und Grafikers : Ausstellung in der Bibliothek der Helmut-Schmidt-Universität.
public_note: Published as a catalogue to an exhibition at the Bibliothek der Helmut-Schmidt Universität in 2016.  This publication is accompanied by a DVD-ROM, which contains the images for the catalogue of the oil paintings.

name: Odenbach, Marcel
item_t: Marcel Odenbach : Werkverzeichnis der Papierarbeiten = Catalogue Raisonné Works on Paper.
author_s:
Berg, Stephan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schreier, Christoph                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Czerlitzki, Anna                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fischer, Stefanie
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the works on paper was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Kunstmuseum Bonn.  The publication lists all of Odenbach's collages, drawings, cut-paper works, and designs for video installations.

name: Odermatt, Josef Maria
item_t: Josef Maria Odermatt : Werkkatalog der Eisenplastiken 1962-2007.
author: Staiger, Brigit
public_note: The catalogue was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Kunstmuseum Bern, 2009. The publication contains an introduction, essays, a list of exhibitions, bibliography, illustrations, and a catalogue raisonné.

name: Ochtervelt, Jacob
item_t: The Paintings of Jacob Ochtervelt, 1634-1682 : With a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Kuretsky, Susan Donahue
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 106 authentic paintings, and 30 disputed paintings, including copies after lost originals. All paintings, including disputed works, are illustrated in black and white.

name: Núnez de Villavicencio, Pedro
item_t: Pedro Núnez de Villavicencio : Caballero pintor.
author: González Ramos, Roberto
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 15 authentic paintings, all illustrated. Contains separate catalogues of lost and unknown works, and doubtful attributions.

name: Ocampo, Andrés de
item_t: Andrés de Ocampo (1555?-1623).
author: Hernández, José Díaz
imprint: Seville : Excma. Diputación Provincial de Sevilla, 1987.
public_note: This is a small monograph and a catalogue raisonné of the artist's processional sculptures, altarpieces, and decorative sculptures. The biographical essay includes the post mortem inventory of the artist's house, studio, and the contents of his library.

name: Occari, Carolina Marisa
item_t: Carolina Marisa Occari : Catalogo generale, 1946-2013.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was compiled by the artist's daughter, Licia.  The publication includes a biography of the artist, bibliography, individual and group exhibitions, and a list of works is public collections. The catalogue raisonné covers Occari's works in all media: engravings, drawings, oil paintings, watercolors, and pastels.

name: Oberhuber, Oswald
item_t: Oswald Oberhuber : Skulpturen, Plastiken, Objekte, Verformungen, Assemblagen, Mobel, Mode, Raumkonzepte : Werke 1945-2012 = Sculptures, Plastics, Objects, Re-shapings, Assemblages, Furniture, Fashion, Spatial Concepts : Works 1945-2012.

name: Oberhuber, Oswald
item_t: Oswald Oberhuber : Plakate Plakate Plakate : Werkverzeichnis…Oswald Oberhuber : Posters Posters Posters : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Ettl, Stephan (ed.)
public_note:
This publication includes a foreword, essays, and sections on the graphic designer's posters divided by commissions including solo exhibitions for artists, group shows, theatrical performances, events, etc.

The publication includes a biography and Oberhuber's conversation with Martin Adel. There is a also biography, lists solo and group exhibitions, plus a discussion of Oberhuber's designs and organization of exhibitions.

name: Ogisu, Takano
item_t: Oguiss : Lithographies et tapisseries, 1967-86.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the lithographs and tapestries by Takanori Ogisu, a Japanese artist who resided in Paris.

name: Ohm, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Ohm, ein expressiver Realist 1905-1965 : Werkverzeichnis aller bisher bekannten Pastelle.
author: Götting, Birgit

name: Olsen, John
item_t: Teeming with Life : John Olsen : His Complete Graphics, 1957-2005.
author_s:
McGregor, Ken                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Makin, Jeffrey                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Olsen, John
imprint: South Yarra, Vic. : Macmillan Art Publishers, 2005.
public_note: A second revised edition was released in 2011 (See entry in this database).

name: Nuvolone, Panfilo
item_t: Nuvolone : una familglia di pittori nella Milano del '600.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné contains separate catalogues of the paintings of Panfilo Nuvolone; Carlo Francesco Nuvolone; Giuseppe Nuvolone; and collaborations between Carlo Francesco and Giuseppe Nuvolone.

It also includes sections for lost and unlocated paintings, and graphic works.

name: Nuvolone, Giuseppe
item_t: Nuvolone : una familglia di pittori nella Milano del '600.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné contains separate catalogues of the paintings of Panfilo Nuvolone; Carlo Francesco Nuvolone; Giuseppe Nuvolone; and collaborations between Carlo Francesco and Giuseppe Nuvolone.

It also includes sections for lost and unlocated paintings, and graphic works.

name: Nuvolone, Carlo Francesco
item_t: Nuvolone : una familglia di pittori nella Milano del '600.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné contains separate catalogues of the paintings of Panfilo Nuvolone; Carlo Francesco Nuvolone; Giuseppe Nuvolone; and collaborations between Carlo Francesco and Giuseppe Nuvolone.

It also includes sections for lost and unlocated paintings, and graphic works.

name: Nussbaum, Jakob
item_t: Jakob Nussbaum, 1873-1936 : ein Frankfurter Maler im Spannungsfeld der Stilrichtungen.
author: Müller, Claudia C.
imprint: Frankfurt am Main : Verlag Waldemar Kramer, 2002.
public_note:
Following a biography of the artist, the publication includes an unillustrated catalogue of the paintings, drawings, and printed works.

The publication also includes lists of exhibitions, signature information, portfolios, a bibliography, and an index of illustrations.

name: Nussbaum, Félix
item_t: Felix Nussbaum : Leben und Werk.
author_s:
Junk, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zimmer, Wendelin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Meinz, Manfred
public_note: Monograph and preliminary catalogue raisonné of the artist's work. The catalogue lists over 300 works by the artist. See also the Nussbaum Foundation's on-line catalogue raisonné cited in this database.

name: Nussbaum, Félix
item_t: Felix Nussbaum : Werkverzeichnis : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Felix Nussbaum Foundation                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jaehner, Inge                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schwetter, Anne Sibylle
ind_entr_cont: This on-line catalogue raisonné updates Junk and Zimmer's 1982 catalogue (see entry in this database), and adds more than 150 paintings and graphic works to the artist's oeuvre. The database lists lost works, but works known only from documents are not included. All works are illustrated in color.
public_note: check_needed

name: Nørgaard, Bjørn
item_t: Bjørn Nørgaard, objekt, skulptur, tableau.
author_s:
Gottlieb, Lennart                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sørensen, Jens Erik                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mortensen, Ellen Tange
imprint: Århus : Aarhus kunstmuseum i samrbejde med Eks-Skolen, 1986.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné included in catalogue of the 1986 exhibition at the Aarhus kunstmuseum.

name: Novelli, Gastone
item_t: Gastone Novelli : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Bonani, Paola                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rinaldi, Marco                                                            ;&nbsp
