                                                            Tiddia, Alessandra
public_note: The first volume covers paintings and sculpture for the period 1948-1968.  After the introductory texts, the illustrated catalogue raisonné provides information on number, title, date, medium and support (or material for sculpture), dimensions, provenance, exhibition information, auctions, and references.

name: Nourse, Elizabeth
item_t: Elizabeth Nourse, 1859-1938 : A Salon Career.
author_s:
Burke, Mary Alice Heekin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fink, Lois Marie
imprint: Washington, D.C. : National Museum of American Art by Doc., U.S. G.P.O., 1983.
public_note: Catalogue entries give title, date, dimensions, some references, signature information,  provenance, and  exhibitions.

name: Nordfeldt, Bror Julius Olsson
item_t: The Woodblock Prints of B.J.O. Nordfeldt : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Donovan, Fiona                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brown, Susan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            King, Lyndel (foreword)
imprint: Minneapolis : University Art Museum, University of Minnesota, 1991.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibition held at the University of Minnesota Art Museum.

name: Noort, Joan van
item_t: Jan van Noordt : Painter of History and Portraits in Amsterdam.
author: De Witt, David
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné covers the all of the artist's paintings, drawings and graphic works. The paintings catalogue is organized by subject (history paintings, genre scenes, portraits).  

There are also separate catalogues devoted to works known through reproductions, works known only from literary references, doubtful attributions, and rejected paintings. There are also separate sections dealing with lost and rejected drawings and prints. 

The Appendix includes documents relating to van Noordt's life.

name: Noguchi, Isamu
item_t: The Sculpture of Isamu Noguchi, 1924-1979.
author_s:
Grove, Nancy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Botnick, Diane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Noguchi, Isamu (foreword)
public_note: From the series "Garland Reference Library of the Humanities." The catalogue generally is organized in chronological order, then alphabetically within each year. There is a separate catalogue of manufactured items.

name: Nomé, Franço
item_t: François De Nomé e Didier Barra : l'enigma Monsù Desiderio.
author: Nappi, Maria Rosaria
public_note: Individual entries contain: provenance, bibliog. and comments

name: Nono, Luig
item_t: Il pittore Luigi Nono (1850-1918) : catalogo ragionato dei dipinti e del disegni.
author: Serafini, Paolo
public_note:
In addition to being a definitive catalogue of the artist's paintings and drawings, the publication includes a detailed biography tracing his career, activities as connoisseur and collector, studies on photography, and role as a preservationist of cultural properties in the Veneto.

Volume 2 contains a catalogue of all of the known autograph paintings and drawings, as well as unidentified paintings from documented sources. Individual entries cite number, title, medium and support, dimensions, location, provenance, inscriptions, and comments.
Appendices include documents, exhibitions , bibliography, and index of names found in v.1-v.2

name: Nolde, Emil
item_t: Emil Nolde : das graphische Werk.
author_s:
Schiefler, Gustave                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mosel, Christel (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Urban, Martin (foreword)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the Nolde's etchings, woodcuts, lithographs, and "hectographs." This edition, technically the third, reprints Schiefler's two earlier catalogues, published in Berlin in 1911 and 1927, plus Christel Mosel's revisions to Schiefler's corpus published (Cologne, 1966-67).

name: Nolde, Emil
item_t: Emil Nolde : Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil Paintings.
author: Urban, Martin
imprint: London : Philip Wilson for Sotheby's; New York : Harper & Row, 1987-90.
public_note: The catalogue entries include technical details, exhibitions, bibliography, references to the work in the documentation, and provenance. All works are illustrated, where possible.

name: Noflaner, Franz Josef
item_t: Franz Josef Noflaner.
author_s:
Klammer, Markus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Locher, Elmar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zankl, Verena                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Landert, Markus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moling, Katharina
imprint: St. marin in Thurn : Istitut Ladin Micura de Rü ; Innsbruck : Haymon Verlag, 2016.
public_note: Volume 1 is dedicated to Noflaner's writings and covers his works in prose, poetry and letters. The second volume focuses on his pictorial works, and includes the catalogue of his paintings and drawings.

name: Noble, John A.
item_t: Hulls and Hulks in the Tide of Time : The Life and Work of John A. Noble.
author: Urban, Erin
imprint: Staten Island, NY : John Noble and Allan A. Noble in Association with the John A. Noble Collection, 1993.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of all 79 of Noble's lithographs, arranged chronologically according to the artist's records. The publication includes a biographical essay.  There is a concordance with the author's earlier publication "John A. Noble: The Complete Lithographs, Ames Catalogue Raisonné" (Staten Island: Wallin Enterprises, 1984).

name: Nittis, Giuseppe de
item_t: De Nittis.
public_note: The critical comments on the artist's work are by Mary Pittaluga, and Enrico Piceni prepared the catalogue.

name: Nicholson, William, S
item_t: William Nicholson : The Graphic Work.
author: Campbell, Colin
public_note: A catalogue of the artist's prints, only partially illustrated.

name: Nicholson, William, S
item_t: William Nicholson.
author: Browse, Lillian
public_note:
The first catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings.
See also the new catalogue published by Patricia Reed (2011) listed in this database.

name: Niess, Rudolf
item_t: Exlibris von Rudolf Niess : kleine Galerie der Individualitäten.
author: Wedemeyer, Manfred
public_note: Bookplates by the architect and graphic artist.

name: Németh, Josef
item_t: Josef Németh 1940-1998.
public_note:
A long introductory essay on this artist and his work by Stefan Neuner refers to several specific works.  There are also several notices in homage from fellow artists and associates. Annotations and notes cover the period 1973 - 1996; several key word phrases are numbered as "works by the artist", and dates for these are given in a following section.

In addition to bibliographical references, there is a discography of the artist, who was also a jazz musician.

name: Nicholson, Ben
item_t: Ben Nicholson : Work Since 1947.
author: Herbert, Read
public_note: The catalogue covers works executed 1947-1956.

name: Newman, Barne
item_t: Barnett Newman : The Complete Drawings, 1945-1969.
author: Richardson, Brenda
public_note: Exhibition catalogue and catalogue raisonné, published on the occasion of a travelling exhibition in 1981. The catalogue raisonné includes missing drawings, as well as miscellaneous works on paper.

name: Newman, Barne
item_t: Barnett Newman : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Colsman-Freyberger, Heidi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mancusi-Ungaro, Carol C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Shiff, Richard
imprint: New Haven : Yale University Press; New York : Barnett Newman Foundation, 2004.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers Newman's entire oeuvre: paintings, drawings, sculpture, graphic works, and architectural models.  There are separate sections dealing with unindentified works, unfinished paintings and ephemera.

name: Niccolò da Foligno
item_t: Niccolò Alunno e la sua bottega.
illustrations: some color ills., 5 fold-out color plates
public_note:
Other artists treated in this publication include Pietro di Mazzaforte, Maestro delle Storie del Battista, Niccolò di Liberatore, Maestro di Cola della Casse, Maestro della Crocifissione di Bevagna, and Lattanzio di Niccolò. 

The publication contains essays and a chronological register of the respective artists. It also includes separate indices of artists, with titles, locations of works, and names.

name: Nicholson, William, S
item_t: William Nicholson : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil Paintings.
author_s:
Reed, Patricia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baron, Wendy (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            James, Merlin (essay)
public_note: This is the first fully illustrated catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings. The catalogue includes over 900 works, arranged chronologically. Two extensive essays discuss the artist in the context of his time, with an analysis of his painting technique.

name: Ney, Elisabeth
item_t: Die Bildhauerin Elisabet Ney : Leben, Werk und Wirken.
author: Johann, Saskia
public_note: This catalogue raisonné of Ney's sculptures originated as the author's 2014 doctoral thesis for the Universität Münster.   It includes an introduction with sources and methods, an essay dealing with Ney's life and artistic career, and an analysis of her works, artistic technique and her effect on the arts during a second career in Texas.

name: Nicholson, Ben
item_t: Ben Nicholson : Paintings, Reliefs, Drawings.
author: Herbert, Read
public_note: The First edition was printed in 1948, and reprinted in 1955. Vol. 1 has a resumé in French; vol. 2, in English and French.

name: Nigro, Mario
item_t: Mario Nigro : catalogo ragionato.
author: Celant, Germano

name: Nittis, Giuseppe de
item_t: Giuseppe De Nittis : Barletta, Palazzo Della Marra : catalogo generale.
author: Farese-Sperken, Christine (ed.)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers only the artist's works held in the Palazzo Della Marra, arranged chronologically and by theme.  The catalogue has separate sections dealing with portraits, bozzetti and unfinished paintings, watercolors, and the monument to Vittorio Emanuele II.

name: New, Keith
item_t: Keith New : British Modernist in Stained Glass.

name: Nevinson, Christophe
item_t: C.R.W. Nevinson : The Complete Prints.
author: Black, Jonathan
imprint: Farnham, Surrey ; Burlington : Lund Humphries in association with Osborne Samuel, 2014.
public_note: The texts trace the artist's career from the First World War to the inter-War period in Paris.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné of all 148 prints.

name: Neubauer, Friederich
item_t: Werkverzeichnis Friederich Neubauer = Catalogue of Works Friederich Neubauer.
author_s:
Schweizer, Claudia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rauschert, Birgit                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Killen, Renate (Engl. transl.)
public_note: Alternate title: "Friedrich Neubuaer, 1912-2004 : Architeckt, Maler, Grafiker = Architect, Painter, Graphic Artist".

name: Netscher, Caspa
item_t: Caspar Netscher and Late Seventeenth-Century Dutch Painting.
author: Wieseman, Marjorie E .
illustrations: 33 color, 219 b&w plates, plus comparative ills.
public_note:
Based on the author's 3-volume doctoral dissertation of the same title (Columbia University, 1991), the publication catalogues 219 accepted works, 44 problematic attributions, and 470 studio productions and rejected attributions.  There are extensive indices, including collections and previous owners.  
Within the series "Aetas aurea," no.16.

name: Neutra, Richard
item_t: Richard Neutra : Complete Works.
public_note: The publication also features original plans (where available) redrawn to scale, a comprehensive list of the works giving date, names of houses and projects, and an index.

name: Neto, Ernesto
item_t: Ernrsto Neto : The Edges of the World
author_s:
Neto, Ernesto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lauson, Cliff                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Anjos, Moacir dos                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ursprung, Phillip
public_note: This publication includes a series of essays and a catalogue of works from 1988 to 2009.  The publication includes Ralph Rugoff's interview with the artist. There is also a list of public collections housing the artist's works.

name: Nesch, Rolf
item_t: Rolf Nesch : The Complete Graphic Works.
imprint: Milan : Skira; Oslo : Najonalmuseet for kunst, arkitektur og design, 2009.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 860 prints. Publication also includes a catalogue of unidentified prints, examples of the artist's signature, and a glossary.

name: Nery, Edouardo
item_t: Eduardo Nery, 1956-1996.
author: Nery, Eduardo
public_note:
The catalogue was published in conjunction with the exhibition "Arte pública/Public Art: obras em espaços arquitectónicos e urbanos= Works in Architectural and Urban Spaces."

Following introductory material with two essays
there are selectively illustrated catalogues of exhibitions of the designer's studio art and his public art.

name: Nespoli, Nino
item_t: Nino Nespoli.
author: Ravelli, Lanfranco
public_note: Each entry contains: title, year, medium, size, location, sketches, studies, underdrawings for selected pieces, provenance information, signature, verso and extensive comments.

name: Neroccio di Bartolommeo de' Land
item_t: Neroccio de' Landi, 1447-1500.
author: Coor, Gertrude Marianne
public_note: Preliminary material includes a foreword, biography, essays on the work and sources, plus information concerning the works and an evaluation of them.  The catalogue is divided into separate sections: the first includes documents, the second consists of the catalogue of the paintings and sculptures, and the third contains additional material related to Neroccio and his workshop, including works not currently identified.

name: Nenci, Enzo
item_t: Enzo Nenci, 1903-1972 : quaderno delle opere.
public_note:
Entries provide information on dimensions, dates of exhibitions, and references by name of scholar to publications found in the bibliography. Versions in other materials are listed. 

There is also a short list of dispersed works and works only known from photographs or documents.  A second section covers destroyed works.

name: Nemours, Aurélie
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre d'Aurélie Nemours : Pastels sur papiers Demeures, 1948-1960.
author_s:
Mountaudoüin, Evelyne de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lemoine, Prof. Serge (advisor)
imprint: Paris : Université Paris-Sorbonne, UFR Art et Archélogie, 2000.
public_note: The author's dissertation presented at the Université Sorbonne, Paris (Mémoire de DEA ; Histoire de l'art : Paris 4: 2000).

name: Neiman, LeRoy
item_t: The Prints of LeRoy Neiman, 1991-2000 : A Catalogue Raisonné of Serigraphs and Etchings.
public_note:
This book catalogues 82 serigraphs and 5 etchings created since the publication of the two previous publications describing Neiman's printed oeuvre  (Knoedler, 1980 and 1991, described in this database).
This, the third volume in the series, includes a comprehensive, illustrated compilation of all Neiman's prints, including those catalogued in the earlier volumes of 1980 and 1991.
With an essay by Jan Avgikos entitled "Neimanland" and 27 photographs showing  the artist in the company of individuals he portrayed in his prints.
See also the "Leroy Neiman Website," updating all earlier cataloguing of Neiman's prints.

name: Neer, Eglon Hendrik van de
item_t: Eglon van der Neer (1635/36-1703) : His Life and His Work.
author: Schavemaker, Eddy
public_note:
From the 'Aetas aurea' series. includes a list of color plates; list of illustrations in the catalogue; ten chapters on the artist's life and artistic development.

In addition to a general index, there are indexes organized by location and former owners. The appendices include: a genealogy, documents, printed sources, and a catalogue of the works of van der Neer's pupil, Adriaen van der Werff, up to 1680.

name: Neillot, Lou
item_t: Louis Neillot : catalogue raisonné.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné was compiled by the artist's daughters. The preface appears in both French and English.  
A small 16-page Supplement to the original edition was issued in 2002.

name: Neer, Aert van de
item_t: Aert van der Neer (1604-1677) : Life and Work, with a Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings and Drawings.
public_note:
Published in the series "Aetas aurea: monographs on Dutch and Flemish Painting"; the text has been translated into English from the German.

The catalogue has essays on the artist's life and artistic development, excerpts of critical writings on the artist (1799-1995), and genealogical tables. The catalogue raisonné is organized by subject: winter landscapes, landscapes, landscapes with a fire, varia, and drawings,

name: Nazareth, Herman van
item_t: Herman van Nazareth.
imprint: Oostkamp : Stichting Kunstboek ; Woodbridge : ACC Distribution, 2013.
public_note: Texts are bilingual. The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's entire output including, paintings, sculptures, and wall textiles.

name: Neiman, LeRoy
item_t: The Prints of LeRoy Neiman : A Catalogue Raisonné of Serigraphs and Etchings, 1980-1990.
author_s:
Leibovitz, Maury P.  (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Halle, David (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mirrer, Louise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            McAllister, Lynn Thorpe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lynch, Richard
public_note:
The second of three similarly titled volumes catalogues (1980, 1991, and 2000, all published by Knoedler) describing Neiman's prints by date, medium, edition size and measurements. See also the Leroy Neiman Website, updating all earlier volumes. All these resources are described in this database.
The present volume of 1991 catalogues 97 serigraphs and 10 etchings, and includes includes two essays about Neiman's oeuvre plus a chronology of his life and work.

name: Neiman, LeRoy
item_t: The Prints of LeRoy Neiman : A Catalogue Raisonné of Serigraphs, Lithographs and Etchings.
author_s:
Leibovitz, Maury P. (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Frankenstein, Alfred (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Graham, Lanier
public_note:
Catalogues the artist's printed production up to 1980. 
See also the similarly titled subsequent publications issued in 1991 and 2000, plus the Leroy Neiman Website (all described in this database).

name: Nemours, Aurélie
item_t: Aurélie Nemours : estampes.
author: Le Saux, Marie-Françoise
imprint: Paris : Réunion des Musées Nationaux ; Vannes : Musée de la Cohue, 2001.
public_note: This catalogue was co-published by the Réunion des Musées Nationaux and the Musée de la Cohue, based on a 2001 exhibition organized in Vannes.

name: Nemours, Aurélie
item_t: Aurélie Nemours : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: The catalogue documents paintings (n 1-1363), plus  public commissions and multiples (beginning with n. 1364).  Entries cite number, title (in French & English), date, medium and support, dimensions, location, bibliography, and comments.

name: Nay, E. W. (Ernst Wilhelm)
item_t: Ernst Wilhelm Nay : die Druckgraphik, 1923-1968 : unveröffentlichte Aufzeichnungen des Künstlers.
author_s:
Gabler, Karlheinz (introduction & catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heise, Carl Georg (foreward)

name: Nay, E. W. (Ernst Wilhelm)
item_t: Ernst Wilhelm Nay : Werkverzeichnis der Ölgemälde.
public_note: Catalogue of Nay's oil paintings, published under the aegis of the Ludwig Museum, Cologne.

name: Navarro, Miquel
item_t: Miquel Navarro : catálogo razonado : esculturas, dibujos, pinturas y fotografías, 1964-2000.
author_s:
Blasco Carrascosa, Juan Angel (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cortés, José Miguel (preface)
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of the complete works, the publication includes essays on Navarro's artistic development, his works in public spaces, and a biography.

name: Nay, E. W. (Ernst Wilhelm)
item_t: Ernst Wilhelm Nay : Werkverzeichnis : Aquarelle, Gouachen, Zeichnungen.
public_note: The catalogue entries include title, date, dimensions, medium, references, collection information, and exhibitions.  Almost all works are illustrated in the catalogue, many in color.

name: Nay, E. W. (Ernst Wilhelm)
item_t: Ernst Wilhelm Nay : Werkverzeichnis : Aquarelle, Gouachen, Zeichnungen.
public_note: All works are illustrated with b&w and color thumbnail images. For forthcoming volumes, see in-process entry cited in this database.

name: Nauman, Bruce
item_t: Bruce Nauman Prints, 1970-89 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Cordes, Christopher (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Taylor, Debbie (assistant)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Yau, John (essay)
imprint: New York  : Castelli Graphics : Lorence-Monk Gallery ; Chicago : Donald Young Gallery, 1989.
public_note: Describes 69 prints from 1970-1989, and includes an interview with the artist. Published on the occasion of exhibitions at Castelli Graphics and the Lawrence-Monk Gallery in New York and the Donald Young Gallery in Chicago.

name: Nauman, Bruce
item_t: Bruce Nauman : Exhibition Catalogue and Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Benezra, Neal                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Halbreich, Kathy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schimmel, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Storr, Robert
imprint: Minneapolis : Walker Art Center; New York : Distributed Art Publishers, 1994.
public_note:
This is a catalogue of a travelling exhibition organized at the Walker Art Center in association with the Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden.

The catalogue raisonné lists 480 works covering the period 1956-1993; there is a section on destroyed works. The current catalogue includes photographs and artist's books, but not prints (see "Bruce Nauman Prints, 1970-89", cited in this database).

name: Nauman, Bruce
item_t: Bruce Nauman Drawings, 1965-1986.
author_s:
Bruggen, Coosje van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Koepplin, Dieter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Meyer, Franz
public_note: Catalogue raisonné published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Museum für Gegenwartskunst and other venues.  The catalogue raisonné entries include references and some brief comments; most works are illustrated in black and white.

name: Nattier, Jean-Marc
item_t: Jean-Marc Nattier (1685-1766) : un artiste parisien à la cour de Louis XV.
author: Renard, Philippe
public_note:
Not a catalogue raisonné, but a highly detailed biographical study based on original documents: including appendices with documents, genealogy, chronology, lists of works exhibited at the Salon du Louvre, 1737-63, and works in museum collections. The sale catalogue of the artist's library, auctioned 27 June 1763, is reproduced. There also are examples of the artist's signatures.

A catalogue raisonné is currently in preparation (see in-process entry cited in this database).

name: Nasmyth, Alexande
item_t: Alexander Nasmyth, 1758-1840 : A Man of the Scottish Renaissance.
author: Cooksey, J. C. B
imprint: Haddington : P. Harris at Whittingehame House, 1991.
public_note:
The publication is divided into two parts, the first contains a biographical essay, followed by critical chapters addressing different genres and periods within Nasmyth's work. The essays are illustrated, with references to catalogue numbers printed in the margins. 

Appendices include exhibition histories, relevant correspondence, a list of portraits of Nasmyth (unillustrated), a family tree, and documents. The catalogue also includes information from unpublished documentation from the archives at St. Andrews University Library. 

The second part contains a list of titles and catalogue numbers. The author notes that some works of questionable attribution were excluded. The catalogue is followed by a bibilography, including notes on Nasmyth's descendants.

name: Nathe, Christoph
item_t: Christoph Nathe : 1755-1806 : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis der Handzeichnungen und Druckgraphik.
author: Frölich, Anke
ind_entr_cont: Appendices include a short biography, a bibliography, and a list of sources including letters, lexicons and material from other references. There are also listings of exhibitions, public and private collections housing the artist's works, plus indices of collections, persons, and locations, Polish and Czech place names are provided, and a list of abbreviations.
public_note: Provenance

name: Natoire, Charles-Joseph
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Charles Natoire.
public_note:
From the series Archives de l'art français, nouv. periode, t. 21.  Ferdinand Boyer's catalogue raisonné of Natoire is bound in with Weigert's "Le testament de Charles le Brun [et] inventaire des tapisseries de Charles-Maurice Le Tellier."

In the introduction Boyer notes that the catalogue is "probably not complete."  Despite the difficulty in producing a catalogue at the end of WW II, however, he succeeded in tracking down a large portion of the artist's oeuvre.

name: Nash, John
item_t: John Nash : A Complete Catalogue.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists over 300 projects by Nash. The publication also includes photographs of demolished buildings, sketches of designs that were never executed, and lists of Nash's clients and patrons.  

An American edition was published by Rizzoli, New York, 1991 (ISBN 0847813088).

name: Nara, Yoshitomo
item_t: Yoshitomo Nara : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Nara, Yoshitomo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Yoshitomo, Banana                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Miyamura, Noriko (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Suzuki, Shinko (ed.)
public_note: A Japanese edition was published simultaneously by Bijutsu Shuppan-Sha Co., Ltd in Japan.  The publication includes an essay by the artist, and lists over 4,500 artworks in all media executed from 1984-2010.

name: Nash, Paul
item_t: The Complete Graphic Work of Paul Nash.
author: Postan, Alexander
public_note: Chiefly illustrations.

name: Nanni di Banco
item_t: The Sculpture of Nanni di Banco.
author: Bergstein, Mary
public_note: Based on the author's doctoral dissertation of the same title, Columbia University, 1987.

name: Nagel, Paul
item_t: Ornatus ecclesiae : Paul Nagel, Werke 1949-2005 : Dokumentation anlässlich der Ausstellung vom 2. April bis 3. Mail 2005 in Wesseling.
author_s:
Nagel, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nagel, Gisela                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nagel, Tobias (ed.)
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held in Wesseling, Germany. Following several essays on Nagel's work, the second part of the publication includes a speech the artist delivered at the opening of an exhibition in 1969.  The third part contains the catalogue raisonné, which covers all of Nagel's church ornaments, designs, and metalwork pieces.

name: Nagasawa, Hidetosh
item_t: Nagasawa : tra cielo e terra : catalogo ragionato delle opere dal 1968 al 1996.
author: Niccolini, Caterina
public_note: The catalogue presents the artist's works through December 1996, with the exception of those that were either lost or not sufficently documented; also not included are sketches, projects, and preparatory drawings.

name: Nanteuil, Robe
item_t: Robert Nanteuil, ca. 1623-1678.

name: Nadelman, Elie
item_t: Elie Nadelman.
author: Kirstein, Lincoln
public_note:
This catalogue won the 1975 George Wittenborn Award presented by ARLIS/NA. 

Essentially a monograph, the publication contains a "draft catalogue raisonné" of Nadelman's sculptures, drawings and prints, arranged by medium and subject. The current publication lists works in public institutions and some private collections, but, with one exception, works from foreign collections are not included. The author intended to produce a complete catalogue raisonné in conjunction with Athena Spear, but this project never materialized.

name: Nash, Paul
item_t: The Wood-Engravings of Paul Nash.
author: Greenwood, Jeremy
public_note: Also see the later catalogue by Greenwood and Brett published in 1997, also cited in this database.

name: Nash, Paul
item_t: The Wood-Engravings of Paul Nash : A Catalogue of the Wood-Engravings, Pattern Papers, Etchings and an Engraving on Copper.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is organized by subject matter and medium. The individual entries include dimensions, inscription information, exhibition history, commentary, and information regarding printing, editions, and blocks.
public_note: Exhib. Hist; Comments

name: Natoire, Charles-Joseph
item_t: Charles-Joseph Natoire, 1700-1777.
public_note: Entries include catalogue number, title, medium and support, location, notes, bibliographical references, exhibition information, and related works.

name: Nattier, Jean-Marc
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Müller vom Siel, Georg Bernhard
item_t: Georg Müller vom Siel, 1865-1939.
author: Kurz, Herbert
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Augusteum des Landesmuseums Oldenburg.  The publication contains a catalogue raisonné of the etchings.

name: Müller, Johann Gotthard von
item_t: Johann Gotthard Müller (1747-1830) und das Stuttgarter Kupferstecherei-Institut : mit einem Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik von Johann Gotthard Müller (1747-1830) und Johann Friedrich Wilhelm Müller (1782-1816).
author: Rümelin, Christian
public_note: This is based on the author's 1996 doctoral dissertation presented at the Universität Bern.

name: Münstermann, Ludwig
item_t: Ludwig Münstermann, der Meiser, die Werkstatt, die Nachfolger : Bildhauerkunst der Manierismus im Dienste lutherischer Glaubenslehre in Kirchen der Grafschaft Oldenburg.
imprint: Regensburg : Schnell & Steiner ; Oldenbrug : Isensee Verlag, 2016.
public_note: The publication includes a monograph on the artist's life and career, as well The catalogue lists all of the artist's sculpted works in all media: wood, stone, and alabaster.  It also catalogues the works Münstermann's studio and his major followers.

name: Müller-Kaempff, Else
item_t: Else Müller-Kaempff, Paul Müller-Kaempff : Werkkatalog.
author: Mahlfeld, Konrad
public_note: Published in the series: "Edition Fischerhuder Kunstbuch".

name: Müller-Scheessel, Ern
item_t: Ernst Müller-Scheessel, 1863-1936 : die Gemälde, Aquarelle und Gouachen : ein Werkverzeichnis.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's paintings, watercolors and gouaches.

name: Müller, Alfredo
item_t: Alfredo Müller : 1869-1939 : sur papier : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre graphique = su carta : catalogo ragionato dell'opera grafica : on paper: complete catalogue of the graphic work.
author: Koehl, Hélène (ed.)

name: Müller, Alfredo
item_t: Alfredo Müller, 1869-1939 : peintures : catalogue raisonné = dipinti : catalogo ragionato = paintings : complete catalogue.
author: Koehl, Hélène
public_note: The texts include an interview with Giovanna Conti Bacci di Capaci, an essay on his landscapes by Alain Bartmann, and recollections of the artist by Elisabetta Matucci.

name: Müller, Johann Georg
item_t: Johann Georg Müller, 1913-1986 : Verzeichnis der Arbeiten auf Papier.
public_note: This volume catalogues approximately 2,400 colored paintings, watercolors, and drawings on paper. Each work is illustrated with a colored thumbnail image.  The publication also includes catalogues of the artist's architectural decorations and paintings over photographs "Fotoübermalungen".

name: Müller, Gerhard Ku
item_t: Gerhard Kurt Müller Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology: Entries give title, date, medium and support, dimensions, signature and inscription information, sources, provenance, exhibitions, and  bibliographic references.  All works are illustrated with scalable color images, when available.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue covers 361 works: drawings (many from the artist's suite based on Henri Barbuse's "Le Feu"), paintings dating from 1951 to 2015, and sculpture from 1973 to 2013.  The catalogue can be searched by title, medium, date, and theme.

name: Müller, Albe
item_t: Albert Müller : das graphische Werk.
author: Kornfeld, Marlies
public_note: Introductory material includes a foreword, a biography of Müller and a section on the "Gruppe Rot-Blau".  The catalogue covers 59 woodcuts, plus 69 etchings and drypoints.  There is also a reproduction of print stamps, and a title index.

name: Müller, Albe
item_t: Albert Müller (1897-1926) und die Basler Künstlergruppe Rot-Blau : mit einem kritischen Katalog der Gemälde, Glasscheiben und Skulpturen.
author: Stutzer, Beat
public_note: Number 9 from the series "Oeuvrekataloge Schweizer Künstler". The catalogue covers the artist's paintings, works in stained glass and sculptures.

name: Music, Zoran
item_t: Music : l'oeuvre imprimé.
author: Frélaut, Denise
imprint: Venice : Archives Music ; Crocetta del Montebello : Terra Ferma, 2010.
public_note: Two earlier catalogues on the artist's graphic work were published by Galerie Schmücking: "Music Graphische Werk: 1947-1981" in 1986, and "Das grapische Werk 1947 bis 1962" in 1966,  in limited editions of 500 and 1000 copies respectively.

name: Murphy, Catherine
item_t: Catherine Murphy.
imprint: New York : Skira Rizzoli,  in assoc. with Peter Freeman, Inc., 2016.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists over 100 paintings and drawings by the artist. Texts by John Yau discuss the artist's work by decade.  There is also a biography of the artist, a select exhibition history (solo and group) and a bibliography.

name: Muziano, Girolamo
item_t: Girolamo Muziano 1532-1592 : dalla maniera all natura.
author: Tosini, Patrizia
public_note: The texts include chapters dealing with the artist's life,  his early formation in Padova and Venice, and his long career in Rome, Orvieto and elsewhere.  There is also a discussion of Muziano's followers and his artistic legacy.

name: Müller, Johann Georg
item_t: Johann Georg Müller, 1913-1986 : Verzeichnis der Maleri und Druckgraphik.
public_note:
Following a biographical essay, the publication includes separate catalogues of the paintings and graphic works, organized chronologically. The publication also includes a list of solo and group exhibitions.  

An expanded edition was published in 2009 (Droste).

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Velázquez and Murillo : A Descriptive and Historical Catalogue of the Works of Don Diego de Silva Velázquez and Bartolomé Estéban Murillo.
author: Curtis, Charles Boyd
imprint: London : Sampson Low, Marston, Searle and Rivington ; New York : J.W. Bouton, 1883.
public_note: One of the earliest catalogues raisonnés on the artists, and still a point of reference for many of the later studies.

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Murillo and His Drawings.
author: Brown, Jonathan
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of Murillo's drawings was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Art Museum, Princeton University.

name: Muraji, Yoneko
item_t: Le monde de Yoneko Muraji IV : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre dessiné et peint 1970-2013.
author: Muraji, Yoneko

name: Muniz, Vik
item_t: Vik Muniz : obra completa 1987-2009 = catalogue raisonné 1987-2009.
author_s:
Muniz, Vik                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lago, Pedro Correa do
public_note: The publication is not organized in the traditional format of a catalogue raisonné. The first sections cover literature, chronology, listings of solo and group exhibitions, published texts, academic enterprises, films/video, and holdings in public collections.

name: Munger, Gilbe
item_t: The Gilbert Munger Website.
author: Schroeder, Michael D.
cronology: The Website consists of a catalogue or "List of Pictures" arranged by locale depicted, then by height & width in inches. There is also an index of pictures organized by Picture ID#.
ind_entr_cont: The accompanying "Chronological Documentation Archive" is a chronological guide to historical information that has appeared in periodicals and elsewhere; new information continues to be added (such as auction prices).   A "List of Sources" gives the full reference for the sources of the information cited in the Archive. Some direct links are provided.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Muniz, Vik
item_t: Vik Muniz : Catalogue Raisonné, 1987-2015 = Everything So Far = Tudo até agora.
author_s:
Lago, Pedro Correa do (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Muniz, Vik
public_note: The main body of the work is divided by period and series: 1987-2991 "early erotic" works -- portraits --, with exhibition information, references and basic background information given.

name: Mulready, William
item_t: William Mulready.
author: Heleniak, Kathryn Moore
imprint: New Haven : Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art : Yale University Press, 1980.
public_note: This publication, a revision of the author's doctoral thesis for New York University, includes the first complete catalogue of Mulready's paintings.  The catalogue includes an extensive visual biography of the artist, separated into five sections: landscape, scenes of childhood, courtship and literary themes, nudes, and patrons, pupils and portraits.

name: Munch, Edvard
item_t: Edvard Munchs Raderinger.
public_note: Part of series 'Oslo kommunes kunstsamlinger. Munch-museet. Skrifter. 2'.  Titles of Munch's works are translated into English.

name: Muller-Kaempff, Paul
item_t: Else Müller-Kaempff, Paul Müller-Kaempff : Werkkatalog.
author: Mahlfeld, Konrad
public_note: Published in the series: "Edition Fischerhuder Kunstbuch".

name: Mulier, Pieter, the younge
item_t: Cavalier Pietro Tempesta and His Time.
author: Roethlisberger-Bianco, Marcel
public_note: This is a monography and catalogue raisonné of the works, mainly paintings. The publication includes a biography of the artist In addition to the authentic works, the catalogue lists works known only through documentation.

name: Munch, Edvard
item_t: Verzeichnis der graphischen Werks Edvard Munchs.
author: Schiefler, Gustav
public_note:
The first volume: "Verzeichnis des graphischen Werks Edward Munchs bis 1906" was originally published in Berlin by E. Cassirer, 1907. The second volume: "Edvard Munch, das graphische Werk, 1906-1926" was published in 1928 (Berlin: Euphorion Verlag). 

Schiefler's rare original catalogues were then reproduced in this 1974 edition, with new supplementary illustrations.

name: Munch, Edvard
item_t: Edvard Munch : The Complete Graphic Works.
author: Woll, Gerd
imprint: London : Philip Wilson in association with The Munch-Museet ; New York : Harry Abrams, Inc., 2001.
public_note: The author, senior curator of prints and drawings at the Munch-Museet, identified 748 separate works from the thousands of sheets and impressions Munch left to the city of Oslo, now housed in the museum.  A revised edition was published by Philip Wilson in 2012 (see entry cited in this database).

name: Munch, Edvard
item_t: Edvard Munch : Werkverzeichnis der Skizzenbücher.
author: Presler, Gerd
imprint: Oslo : The Munch-Museet : The Munch-Ellingsen Group; Bonn : VG Bild-Kunst, 2004.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné focuses on Munch's 159 sketchbooks, mostly housed at the Munch-museet in Oslo. In addition to cataloguing each sketchbook and its contents, the author transcribed the artist's handwritten notes in both German and Norwegian. Other helpful images are included in the introduction, such as exhibition posters, correspondence, and signature examples.

name: Munch, Edvard
item_t: Edvard Munch : Complete Paintings, Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Woll, Gerd
public_note: This is a comprehensive catalogue raisonné of the artist's painted oeuvre. Each volume includes critical essays by leading art historians on Munch, plus indices, bibliographies, and exhibition listings.

name: Munch, Edvard
item_t: Edvard Munch : The Complete Graphic Works.
author: Woll, Gerd
public_note: This is a revised edition of the catalogue issued in 2001 (cited in this database) co-published by Orfeus Publishing, Oslo and Philip Wilson, London and New York (distributed in USA & Canada by Palgrave Macmillan).

name: Munster, Jan van
item_t: Jan van Munster : Die Energie des Bildhauers : Werzveerzeichnis 1960-2000.

name: Muraji, Yoneko
item_t: Le monde de Yoneko Muraji III : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, 1998-2013.
author: Muraji, Yoneko

name: Muraji, Yoneko
item_t: Le monde de Yoneko Muraji II : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre dessiné 1969-2012.
author: Muraji, Yoneko

name: Muraji, Yoneko
item_t: Le monde de Yoneko Muraji I : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint 1970-2012.
public_note: Preliminary material includes thoughts by the artist and descriptions of the paintings, which range from catalogue number 100 to 1538.  There is also a biography, travel accounts, and an index in French of the works listed in the catalogue raisonné.

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: L'opera completa di Murillo.
author: Gaya Nuño, Juan Antonio
public_note: A French language edition was also published by Flammarion, Paris, 1980 (see entry cited in this database).  The publication includes excerpts from early writings on Murillo and a documentary chronology of his life.  There are also thematic and topographical indices.

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Murillo.
author_s:
Gaya Nuño, Juan Antonio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Esteban, Claude (intr.)
public_note: This is the French translation of "Opera completa di Murillo" (cited in this database).

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Murillo.
author: Angulo Iñíguez, Diego

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Murillo : catálogo razonado de pinturas.
author: Valdivieso, Enrique
public_note: The catalogue entries provide title, date, medium and support, dimensions, location, inscriptions, provenance, exhibitions, and bibliographic references.

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Murillo : Virtuoso Draftsman.
author: Brown, Jonathan
public_note: Revised and updated edition of the author's 1976 publication "Murillo & His Drawings" (see entry cited in this database).  The new catalogue adds 20 new drawings to the artist's oeuvre.

name: Murillo, Bartolomé Esteban
item_t: Bartolomé Esteban Murillo (1617-1682) : dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Mena Marqués, Manuela                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Albarrán Martín, Virginia
public_note: Following the introductory essay on "Murillo and the Art of Drawing" is the catalogue raisonné of 87 authentic drawings, organized chronologically by period.

name: Mueller, Otto
item_t: Otto Mueller.
author_s:
Lüttichau, Mario-Andreas von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hohenzollern, Georg Prinz von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brade, Johanna
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at the Kunsthalle der Hypo-Kulturstiftung Munich.  The catalogue raisonné is on the accompanying CD-ROM.  A complete catalogue of the drawings and paintings is currently in preparation by the authors (see in-process entry cited in this database).

name: Mueck, Ron
item_t: Ron Mueck.
author: Hurlston, David
imprint: Melbourne : National Gallery of Victoria ; New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 2011.
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the the National Gallery of Victoria in Melbourne, and other venues. The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of the artist's sculptures up to the date of publication, as well as numerous essays.

name: Mueller, Otto
item_t: Otto Mueller : Leben und Werk : mit einem Werkverzeichnis der Graphik Otto Mullers von Florian Karsch.
public_note: A reprint edition was issued by the same publisher in 1993 (ISBN 376591052X).

name: Mueck, Ron
item_t: Ron Mueck.
author_s:
Pelletier, Adeline (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Paton, Justin (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Storr, Robert (essay)
imprint: Paris : Foundation Cartier pour l'Art Contemporain, 2013.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Fondation Cartier pour l'Art Contemporain, Paris, 2013.

name: Mucha, Alphonse Marie
item_t: Alphonse Mucha, the Complete Graphic Works.
author_s:
Bridges, Ann (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mucha, Jiri (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Henderson, Marina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dvorák, Anna
public_note: The texts include an essay on Alphonse Mucha's career and artistic inspirations, with a discussion of his illustrations for books and periodicals.  There is also an addenda to the catalogue of works, as well as a select bibliography and an index to the graphic works.

name: Muafangejo, John
item_t: I was Lonelyness : The Complete Graphic Works of John Muafangejo : A Catalogue Raisonné 1968-1987.
author_s:
Levinson, Orde                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tutu, Archbishop Desmond (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gilmour, Pat                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lucie-Smith, Edward
public_note: Entries also include medium, size, printer and publishers, paper type and size, edition, signature, other copies, registration (as administered by the artist's estate), comments, reproductions, and notice of public collections.

name: Mucha, Alphonse Marie
item_t: Alphonse Mucha : toutes les cartes postales = All the Postcards = alle Postkarten.
author: Weill, Alain

name: Mucha, Alphonse Marie
item_t: Alphonse Mucha : The Complete Posters and Panels.
public_note: The publication includes a brief preface by the artist's son, Jiri Mucha. The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's posters, panels and calendars.  The appendices contain information on 13 works not included in the main catalogue raisonné.

name: Moura, Eduardo Souto de
item_t: Eduardo Souto De Moura : tutte le opere.
author_s:
Esposito, Antonio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Leoni, Giovanni                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Daniele, Monica                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Maddaluno, Raffaella                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ferreira Alves, Luís
public_note: The current publication revises and expands the 2003 monograph on the artist "Souto De Moura: Works and Projects" (Milan: Electaarchittetura; London: Phaidon).  The catalogue includes a complete list of projects executed from 2003 until 2012.

name: Mount, Shepard Alonzo
item_t: Listing of Known Paintings by Shepard Alonzo Mount.
author: Johnson, Deborah J.
imprint: Stony Brook, NY : The Museums at Stony Brook, 1988.
public_note: This is a photocopy of a typescript edition.  The publication includes a brief text on Shepard Alonzo Mount's life and art.

name: Mount, William Sidney
item_t: William Sidney Mount.
author: Frankenstein, Alfred
imprint: New York, NY : Harry N. Abrams, Inc., 1975.
public_note: This is a standard monograph on the artist, used in lieu of a complete catalogue raisonné of his oeuvre. It contains extensive documentation on the artist, including Mount's diary entries, estate papers, and selections from his exhaustive correspondence.

name: Motz, Raine
item_t: Heiter bis makaber : die Bilderwelt des Heidelberger Malers Rainer Motz, genannt Munke.
public_note: Issued in the series : "Schriftenreihe des Heimatmuseum Heidelberg-Rohrbach", Bd. 17.  The publication includes an obituary of the artist by Karl Günther

name: Motherwell, Robe
item_t: Robert Motherwell, the Complete Prints 1940-1991. A Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Minneapolis : Walker Art Center; New York: distributed by Hudson Hills Press, 2003.
public_note:
This new study covers more than 500 prints in every medium, with new research and commentary.  It also contains a concordance to the Terenzio/Belknap catalogue published in 1991.

The publication illustrates Motherwell's signature styles from 1941-1991, as well as chop marks found on his prints.

name: Motherwell, Robe
item_t: The Prints of Robert Motherwell : With a Catalogue Raisonné, 1943-1990.
imprint: New York : Hudson Hills Press n association with American Federation of Arts, 1991.
public_note: The catalogue is chronologically organized. Entries include materials, dimensions, signature information, publication history, brief commentary, and information regarding edition and printer.

name: Motesiczky, Marie-Louise
item_t: Marie-Louise von Motesiczky, 1906-1996 : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings ; with a Selection of Drawings.
author: Schlenker, Ines
imprint: London : Marie-Louise von Motesiczky Charitable Trust in Association with Hudson Hills Press, 2009.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 300 paintings and several hundred drawings.

name: Moser, Kolo
item_t: Koloman Moser-Online-Werkkataloge-Belvedere.
cronology: The catalogue of the graphic works was compiled by Stefan Üner, and lists 887 entries.  Works are arranged chronologically by format: newspapers, books, portfolios, calendars, postcards, and banknotes.  Entries cite title, dimensions, date, medium, signature, Belvedere & inventory numbers, bibliography, exhibitions, and related works.
public_note: The paintings catalogue was compiled by Gerd Pichler, and includes 208 items.  Entries provide information on date, medium, inscriptions, dimensions, exhibitions, bibliography, description, and provenance.

name: Motherwell, Robe
item_t: Robert Motherwell Paintings and Collages : A Catalogue Raisonné 1941-1991.
author_s:
Flam, Jack                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rogers, Katy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Clifford, Tim
illustrations: v.1: 111 b&w, 112 color; v.2: 1,210 color; v.3: 1,620 color
public_note: Catalogue raisonné entries (v.2- v.3) cite number, title, alternative titles, date, medium and support, dimensions, inscriptions by the artist's hand (but not labels or writings on the verso of works), studio numbers, provenance, exhibitions, and references.

name: Moucheron, Isaac de
item_t: Isaac de Moucheron (1667-1744) : His Life and Works with a Catalogue Raisonné of His Drawings, Watercolors, Paintings and Etchings.
imprint: Frankfurt am Main ; New York : Peter Lang Publishing, 1996.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of paintings, drawings, watercolors, and decorative commissions. The appendicies contain documents from the artist's life, including Moucheron's last will and testament and information on the 1744 sale of his collection.

name: Mosca, Giammaria (Padovano)
item_t: Giammaria Mosca called Padovano : A Renaissance Sculptor in Italy and Poland.
author: Schulz, Anne Markham
imprint: University Park : Pennsylvania State University Press, 1998.
public_note: The publication presents photographs of all of the artist's sculptures. Volume 1 is divided into two parts: Italy and Poland. The Appendices include all known documents relating to the artist in full text and in their original language.

name: Mossa, Gustave Adolphe
item_t: Gustave Adolphe Mossa : catalogue raisonné des oeuvres symbolistes.
public_note: The texts are in French with a summary in English. The catalogue raisonné of the artist's watercolors, oil paintings, pastels, drawings, and prints.

name: Moses, Anna Mary Robertson "Grandma"
item_t: Grandma Moses.
author: Kallir, Otto
illustrations: 245 b&w, some color; over 1,600 b&w thumbnails in catalogue
public_note: An abridged version of the 1973 edition was published by Abrams in 1975. The author was Grandma Moses' longtime dealer and friend.

name: Morris, Robe
item_t: Robert Morris : Object Sculpture, 1960-1965.
imprint: New Haven : Yale University Press ; New York : In association with Castelli Gallery, 2013.
public_note: The present publication catalogues approximately 100 of Morris' small "object sculptures" or "process type objects," executed between 1960 and 1965.   The catalogue was prepared in collaboration with the artist and his studio, and it includes the authors' interview with Robert Morris.

name: Morris, Desmond
item_t: Desmond Morris : Analytical Catalogue Raisonné, 2000-2012.
author: Levy, Silvano
public_note: The catalogue raisonné inlcudes biographical and thematic analyses, exhibition list, and poetic writings.

name: Moroni, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovan Battista Moroni : tutte le opere.
author: Gregori, Mina

name: Moriyama, Daido
item_t: Moriyama Daido : zen sakuhinshu = Kaido Moriyama : The Complete Works.
author: Moriyama, Daido
public_note:
The text is in Japanese, followed by a translated English language section. There are interviews and essays about Moriyama Daido. The publication catalogues over 5,000 photographs. 

Photographs are listed with catalogue number, title, medium, date when first published, and when a work was reproduced in a subsequent edition.

name: Morisot, Berthe
item_t: Berthe Morisot, 1841-1895 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Clairet, Alain                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Montalant, Delphine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rouart, Yves                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hopkins, Waring                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thomas, Alain
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 423 paintings, almost all illustrated in b&w, plus 22 color plates. There is a detailed biography of Morisot that contains frequent references to (and some reproductions of) her correspondence.  The publication also includes exhibition lists, a chronology of public sales, indices of titles and subjects, and a genealogy.  Texts are bilingual.

name: Morin, Jean
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé de Jean Morin (env. 1605- 1650).
public_note: The catalogue includes genealogical tables.

name: Morisot, Berthe
item_t: Berthe Morisot : catalogue des peintures, pastels et aquarelles.
author_s:
Bataille, Mary-Louise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wildenstein, Georges (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rouart, Denis (intro.)
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-Arts : Éditions d'études et des documents, 1961.
public_note: The catalogue lists 416 paintings, 191 pastels and 238 watercolors. The preface notes that the catalogue was begun by Ambroise Vollard during the First World War.

name: Morellet, Franço
item_t: François Morellet, Installations: Catalogue raisonné seiner Installationen = Catalogue raisonné des ses installations.
public_note: The publication includes texts written by the artist.

name: Morgner, Michael
item_t: Michael Morgner : Bilder 1985-2008 = Paintings 1985-2008.
imprint: Bielefeld : Kerber Verlag ; New York : D.A.P. [Distributor] 2011.
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition in Chemnitz, 2011.

name: Moreni, Mattia
item_t: Mattia Moreni : catalogo ragionato delle opere : dipinti, 1934-1999 = Catalogue Raisonné of the Works : Paintings, 1934-1999.
author: Crispolti, Enrico
public_note: The catalogue is organized in separate chronological sections, with critical texts by Ballo, Grohmann, Marchiori, Calvino, Carluccio, etc. These are followed by a bio-bibliography.  Texts are bilingual, but the catalogue entries are only in Italian.

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Morandi disegni.
author_s:
Valsecchi, Marco                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ruggeri, Giorgio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tavoni, Efrem (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Argan, G.C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Basile, Franco
public_note:
This is considered the first and second volume of the catalogue of Morandi's drawings issued under the aegis of Efrem Tavoni with the imprint of La casa dell'arte di Sasso Marconi. 

The third volume ("Morandi disegni : catalogo generale / riconoscimento dell'autenticità delle opere", Electa, 1994) is also listed in this database.

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Catalogue Raisonné.
author: The Henry Moore Foundation
cronology: Individual entries include title, date, illustration, exhibitions, inscriptions and signature information, related works, collection, and some comments.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's work in all media, including sculptures, textiles, drawings, tapestries, and graphic works.  The first installment of the catalogue is available online, cataloguing over 1,500 works from 1914-1930.

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: L'opera grafica di Giorgio Morandi
author: Vitali, Lamberto
public_note: First published in 1957 (Einaudi, Turin), there have subsequent  reprintings (1964, 1968 rev.) , this is the revised and enlarged (fourth) edition.

name: Moran, Pete
item_t: Domestic and Wild : Peter Moran's Images of America.
author: Wright, David Gilmore
imprint: Baltimore : Creo Press ; Philadelphia ; Distributed by The Philadelphia Sketch Club, 2010.
public_note:
The first volume includes essays by Thomas P. Bruhn and Michael J. McCue.  Appendices contain publisher and dealer inventories, an inventory of his students' works with biographies, and auction list.

The catalogue raisonné includes a key to the artist's inventory, signature examples, print inventory, print list, and title and name indexes.  

Individual entries include comments, exhibitions, collections, alternative titles, remarques, and copyright information.

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Morandi dipinti : catalogo generale.
author: Vitali, Lamberto
public_note: Each entry includes a diagram showing the work drawn to scale.  This is then traced over a base quadrant, thus permitting a more complete understanding of the work's format in relationship to others of the artist's oeuvre. Entries include information about date, technique, dimensions, signature, provenance, background history, exhibitions, and references.

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Morandi incisioni : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Cordaro, Michele                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Filippetto, Giuseppe Trassari                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ficacci, Luigi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Renzitti, Antonella
public_note: Reprints material from the author's 1990 exhibition catalogue "Morandi, l'opera grafica, rispondenze e variazioni".  In addition to the catalogue, the publication contains the artist's letters and communications

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Complete Sculpture. Volume VI: 1980-1986.
author: Bowness, Alan
public_note:
Since the first edition of this volume was published in 1988, new information has come to light, which is  included in this new revised edition. The new edition also contains addenda for v.1 &  v.4. 

The list of exhibitions and bibliography are fully updated.

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Complete Sculpture. Volume V: 1974-1980.
author: Bowness, Alan
public_note:
This is a revised printing of the original 1983 edition. 

The publication includes 10 works from the period 1974-1980, which were cast after the 1983 edition was published. These works were originally included as an addendum to v. 6.

name: Monticelli, Adolphe
item_t: Monticelli : sa vie et son oeuvre.
author: Ripert, Pierre
public_note: Introductory essays deal with different phases of Monticelli's career, his paintings relating to Balzac's "La Comédie humaine', and a discussion of copies. The Appendices include documents relating to the artist's life and  posthumous reputation. The publication also includes a glossary and a table of color plates.

name: Monticelli, Adolphe
item_t: Les faux Monticellis : complément du catalogue de l'oeuvre raisonné.
author: Stammégna, Sauveur
public_note: The bilingual French-English text presents discourses on rejected attributions, but there is no catalogue list of the rejected works.

name: Motherwell, Robe
item_t: The Painter and the Printer. Robert Motherwell's Graphics - 1943-1980.
imprint: New York : The American Federation of Arts, 1980.
public_note: Subsequent catalogues raisonnés of Motherwell's graphic work were published (see catalogues cited in this database).

name: Monticelli, Adolphe
item_t: Monticelli : catalogue des oeuvres de Monticelli.
author: Stammégna, Sauveur

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Complete Sculpture. Volume IV: 1965-1973.
author: Bowness, Alan
public_note:
This is a reprint of the fourth volume of the complete sculpture.

All works are illustrated. The publication also includes an addendum of 28 sculptures from the mid 1950s that have been cast only recently.

name: Monticelli, Adolphe
item_t: Monticelli : catalogue des oeuvres de Monticelli.
author: Stammégna, Sauveur
public_note: French text, followed by English and Japanese translations.

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Complete Sculpture. Volume III: 1955-1964.
public_note:
First published in 1965, this is a second revised edition, which was updated with the help of David Mitchinson. Almost very work is illustrated, with the addition of many new photographs and a revised layout of the plates.

The original introduction by Sir Herbert Read and other source material prepared by Alan Bowness are maintained from the earlier edition.

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Complete Sculpture. Volume II: 1949-1954.
author: Bowness, Alan
public_note:
Originally published in 1955, the third revised edition updates information received  since publication of the second edition, 1965.

Almost every entry is illustrated, and the plates have been revised. Other information includes an introduction by Sir Herbert Read, biographical notes, and the artist's own writings, which appear as in the original edition.

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore Complete Sculpture. Volume I: 1921-1948.
author_s:
Bowness, Alan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sylvester, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Read, Sir Herbert
public_note:
This volume which covers work from Moore's earlier career, was originally published in 1944. Both text and illustrations were heavily revised at the time of the 4th ed., (1957, repr. 1969) with a concordance to earlier editions' illustrations numbers.

This, the 5th ed., omits only the drawings previously included. For these, see "Henry Moore Complete Drawings", v.1-v.7, cited in this database. The introduction by Sir Herbert Read (1944, 1948) remains unchanged (publisher's catalogue).

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 7: 1984-1986. Addenda and Index 1916-1986.
author: Garrould, Ann
public_note: The seventh, and final volume, in this series provides "a consolidated version of all the reference apparatus contained in each of the other volumes, enabling the user to track down any particular drawing from any period or volume by means of its title, Henry Moore Foundation,  or Anne Garrould number" (from the publisher's catalogue).

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Catalogue of  Graphic Work.  Volume IV: 1980-1984.
author_s:
Cramer, Patrick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grant, Alistair                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mitchinson, David

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Catalogue of  Graphic Work. Volume II: 1973-1975
author_s:
Cramer, Gérald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grant, Alistair                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mitchinson, David

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 6: 1982-1983.
author: Garrould, Ann

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Catalogue of Graphic Work. Volume I: 1931-1972.
author_s:
Cramer, Gérald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grant, Alistair                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mitchinson, David

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Catalogue of Graphic Work.  Volume III: 1976-1979.
author_s:
Cramer, Patrick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grant, Alistair                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mitchinson, David

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 5: 1977-1981.
author: Garrould, Ann

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 4: 1950-1976.
author: Garrould, Ann

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 3: 1940-1949.
author: Garrould, Ann

name: Morach, Otto
item_t: Otto Morach (1887-1973) : mit einem kritischen Katalog der Staffeleibilder.
author: Schaller, Marie-Louise
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of the artist's easel paintings.

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 2: 1930-1939
author: Garrould, Ann

name: Moore, Henry
item_t: Henry Moore : Complete Drawings. Volume 1, 1916-1929.
author: Garrould, Ann

name: Morales, Armando
item_t: Armando Morales : monographie = Monograph : Catalogue Raisonné, 1974-2004.
author_s:
Leower, Catherine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonafoux, Pascal                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Arellano, Jorge Eduardo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                             Xuriguera, Gérard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Caprile, Luciano                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tibol, Raquel
imprint: Vaumarcus : ArtAcatos ; Paris : Diffusion Belles Lettres, 2010
public_note: Each entry includes year, title, medium, size, signature, notes, exhibitions, bibliography, auctions, and provenance.  There are English translations of the notes in the catalogue entries.

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Morandi acquerelli : catalogo generale.
author: Pasquali, Marilena

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Morandi disegni : catalogo generale / riconoscimento dell'autenticità delle opere.
author_s:
Tavoni, Efrem                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Morandi, Maria Teresa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guidi, Iliana                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pasquali, Marilena                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Selleri, Lorenza
public_note:
This is considered the third volume in the series of Morandi's drawings issued under the aegis of Efrem Tavoni. 

The first volume was published in 1981 and the second in 1984, with the imprint of Casa dell'arte Sasso Marconi (See entry in this database).

name: Moran, Thoma
item_t: Thomas Moran : Watercolors of the American West.
author: Clark, Carol
imprint: Austin : Amon Carter Museum of Western Art : University of Texas Press, 1980.

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Giorgio Morandi, 1890-1964 : Gemälde, Aquarelle, Zeichnungen, das druckgraphische Werk : Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik.
imprint: Schleswig : Schleswig-Holsteinisches Landesmuseum, Schloss Gottorf ; Milan : Mazzotta, 1998.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Schleswig-Holsteinisches Landesmuseum, the catalogue raisonné includes concordances to Cordaro and Vitali's catalogues of Morandi's graphic works. (See entries in this database)

name: Morandi, Giorgio
item_t: Giorgio Morandi : catalogo generale : opere catalogate tra il 1985 e il 2016.
author: Pasquali, Marilena (ed.)
public_note: The second part is the publication of 272 works authenticated from 1985 until the date of publication. The catalogue gives number, title, dimensions, medium and support, signature, date, provenance, references, auction and exhibition information, and date of authentication given by the Morandi Committee.

name: Moreau, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Moreau : sa vie, son oeuvre : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre achevé.
author: Mathieu, Pierre-Louis
public_note:
An English language edition titled "Gustave Moreau, with a Catalogue of the Finished Paintings, Watercolors and Drawings" was also published by Phaidon (London) and The New York Graphic Society (Boston) in 1976 (ISBN 0821207016).

A revised updated edition was published in 1998, and a Supplement in 2006 (See entries cited in this database).

name: Moreau, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Moreau : monographie et nouveau catalogue de l'oeuvre achevé.
author: Mathieu, Pierre-Louis
public_note: Entries contain title, medium and support, date, dimensions, signature and inscriptions, exhibition history, provenance, bibliography, and comments.

name: Moreau, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Moreau : supplément au nouveau catalogue de l'oeuvre achevé.
public_note:
This supplement updates and revises the earlier edition of the catalogue raisonné (cited in this database). 

The current publication lists 30 new works in all media, including oil paintings, watercolors & drawings.

name: Moreau, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Moreau. Catalogue sommaire des dessins. Musée Gustave Moreau.
author_s:
Forest, Marie-Cécile                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Caron, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Patry, Sylvie
imprint: Paris : Musée Gustave Moreau : Réunion des musées nationaux, 2009
public_note:
A catalogue of the drawings in the Musée Gustave Moreau (housed in the artist's former family home, Paris, which is the largest repository of his works). 

The catalogue includes 4,830 drawings, organized by theme (figures, historical, mythological, religious subjects, landscapes, etc.).  In addition to the printed catalogue, the catalogue raisonné is also available online at www.dessins-musee-moreau.fr

name: Moreau, Louis Gabriel
item_t: Un peintre de paysage au XVIIIe siècle : Louis Moreau.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-arts, Edition d'etudes et de documents,1923.
public_note: Introductory essays include information on the history of landscape painting, the tradition of landscape in French art, and on the work of Moreau in particular. 252 paintings are arranged by subject, followed by a separate list of 8 etchings.

name: Morlotti, Ennio
item_t: Ennio Morlotti : catalogo ragionato dei dipinti.
author_s:
Bruno, Gianfranco                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Biasin, Donatella                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Castagnoli, Pier Giovanni

name: Morland, George
item_t: George Morland, His Life and Works.
public_note:
N.B., this is a catalogue of prints made after Morland's paintings & sketches.  The publication contains a lengthy biography of the artist and a discussion of some of the most prominent engravers after Morland's works.  

There is also a list of Morland's paintings sold by Christie's with prices, arranged by year of sale.  The appendices lists engravings after Morland and works exhibited at The National Academy.

name: Montesinos, Franc
item_t: Francis Montesinos : catalogo razonado, 1972-2003.
author: Plaza, José Vicente

name: Montandon, Pascale
item_t: PascALEjandro : l'androgyne alchimique.
author: Grau, Donatien (ed.)
imprint: Arles : Actes Sud ; Paris : Association Azzedine Alaïa, 2017.

name: Monfreid, Daniel de
item_t: George-Daniel de Monfreid, 1856-1929 : le confident de Gauguin.
imprint: Paris : Somogy ; Communauté urbaine d'Alençon : Musée des beaux-arts et de la dentelle ; Ville de Narbonne : Musées de Narbonne, 2003.
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Musée des beaux-arts et de la dentelle, Alençon and at the Musée d'art et d'histoire, Narbonne. The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of all 180 paintings by the artist, all illustrated with color thumbnail images.

name: Monory, Jacque
item_t: Monory.
author: Tilman, Pierre
public_note: The publication includes several critical essays, lists of exhibitions, a list of films about the artist, and a bibliography.

name: Montaguti, Silverio
item_t: Silverio Montaguti (1870-1947).
public_note: Issued in the series "Scultori bolognesi dell' 800 e del '900".  The publication includes a biography of the artist, a catalogue of his works in Bologna, and an index of names.

name: Monet, Claude
item_t: Monet. Volume V : supplément aux peintures, dessins, pastels, index.
author: Wildenstein, Daniel
public_note: The publication contains documents, information on Monet's collection, indexes, archival sources, and a bibliography. There are also lists of proper names, as well as addenda and errata to the Biography found in Volume 1.

name: Mondino, Aldo
