item_t: Aldo Mondino : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Mondino, Antonio (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonacossa, Ilaria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dehò, Valerio
public_note: The catalogue is undertaken under the aegis of the Archivio Aldo Mondino.  Antonio Mondino is the artist's son.  Volume 2 is currently in preparation.

name: Molyn, Piete
item_t: Pieter Molyn : Katalog der Handzeichnungen.
author: Beck, Hans-Ulrich

name: Momper, Josse de, the Younge
item_t: Josse de Momper der Jüngere (1564-1635) : die Gemälde mit kritischen Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Ertz, Klaus
public_note: Individual entries include title (in English and German), exhibitions, date, provenance, collaborating artist (if any), and references.

name: Moering, Christa
item_t: Christa Moering : Werkkatalog (1929-2012) und Edition Tagebuch (1944-1956).
author_s:
Moering, Christa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Breitenbach, Petra von (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zimmermann, Reinhard (ed.)
public_note: Issued in the series: "Kunstgeschichte Wiesbaden Band".  The publication includes the artist's diary, with entries ranging from 1944-1956.  There are also several indices, a list of collectors, a biography of the artist, and a bibliography.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: I dipinti di Modigliani.
public_note: Classici dell'arte series, n. 40. A French language edition was also published by Flammarion in 1972.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Modigliani et son oeuvre. Étude critique et catalogue raisonné.
author: Pfannstiel, Arthur
public_note: The author wrote one of the earlier catalogue raisonnés on the artist, a "catalogue présumé",  first published  in Paris in 1929.  Neither the 1929 edition nor the subsequent 1956 publication were extensively illustrated, but they are still used as reference sources.

name: Moholy-Nagy, László
item_t: László Moholy-Nagy : The Photograms : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Heyne, Renate                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Neusüss, Floris M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moholy-Nagy, Hattula                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Molderings, Herbert
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of almost 450 photograms, arranged in chronological order from 1922-1943.  Comments provide technical data for each work catalogued.

name: Modersohn-Becker, Paula
item_t: Paula Modersohn-Becker, 1876-1907 : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde : im Auftrag der Paula Modersohn-Becker Stiftung.
author_s:
Busch, Günter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Werner, Wolfgang                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schicketanz, Milena                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pauli, Gustav et al.
public_note:
The present publication includes a concordance to Gustav Pauli's 1919 monograph catalogue of the artist's works. 

The catalogue raisonné lists approx. 740 works, all ilustrated. The publication contains a biography and essays on the artist's technique and the fate of Modersohn-Becker's works during the Third Reich.

name: Mintrop, Theodo
item_t: Theodor Mintrop : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Zangs, Gabriele
public_note: The publication includes a biography, a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes, and an analysis of his writings.

name: Milne, David Brown
item_t: David B. Milne : Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings.
author_s:
Silcox, David P.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Milne, David Jr.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Driver, Elizabeth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wylie, Liz
imprint: Toronto ; Buffalo : University of Toronto Press, 1998.
public_note:
This catalogue won the Melva J. Dwyer Award from the ARLIS/Canada chapter of the Art Libraries Society of North America, which honors "exceptional reference or research tools relating to Canadian art and architecture."

The catalogue is chronological with a breakdown of geography/location of the artist, and uses a broad range of sources including the artist's diary.

Volume 1 traces the artist's early work. Vol. 2 contains sections on his commercial work, New York City drawings, other works, and paintings attributed to Milne.

name: Milton, Pete
item_t: The Primacy of Touch : The Drawings of Peter Milton : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The text of the catalogue is written by the artist himself. There is no separate catalogue section; all works are discussed in the essay.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Miró Lithographs.
author_s:
Leiris, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mourlot, Fernand                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Queneau, Raymond                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Teixidor, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cramer, Patrick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calas, Nicolas and Elena
imprint: New York : Tudor Publishing Company; New York : Leon Amiel Publisher Inc., 1972-1975; Paris : Maeght, 1975-1992.
illustrations: ca.900 color, including several original lithographs
public_note: Individual entries include: title, dimensions, comments, information on states, and publishers.

name: Milton, Pete
item_t: Peter Milton Complete Prints 1960-1996 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: An earlier study by Kneeland McNulty: "Peter Milton, Complete Etchings, 1960-1976" was also published by Impressions Workshop, Boston, 1977.

name: Mirande, Raymond
item_t: Raymond Mirande : les émaux : catalogue raisonné.
public_note:
A catalogue raisonné and a study on the life and work of the late French enamalist amd stained-glass artist.
The CD seems to have the critical texts.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Miró's Posters.
public_note: A Spanish language edition titled "Los carteles de Miró" was published by Poligrafa, Barcelona, 1980.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Miró Sculptures (1930-1972).
public_note:
A subsequent edition was also published by Maeght in 1980 that includes works through 1980.
Also see the recent publication cited in this database: "Joan Miró: Sculptures: Catalogue Raisonné" by E. Fernández Miró and P. Ortega Capel, published by Daniel Lelong and Successió Miró: Paris, 2006.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Miró Graveur.
public_note:
American editions of the respective volumes were published under varying imprints (including Rizzoli, NY) with the title "Miró Engraver/ Miró Engravings".  

Individual entries cite the publisher, place and date of publication, size, a description, publication details, edition with signature information, typographer, and printer.  The  publication also includes corrigenda & addenda; indexes of the works are organized by chronological order, alphabetically by title, and by medium.  There are no bibliographical or biographical references. 

The illustrations, found in the front part of the books, are mainly in color.  Some volumes contain original woodcuts especially designed by the artist.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Sculptures : Catalogue Raisonné, 1928-1982.
author_s:
Fernández Miró, Emilio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ortega Chapel, Pilar
ind_entr_cont: Individual catalogue entries include title, date, exhibitions, provenance, references, inscriptions and marks, and images.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró, the Illustrated Books : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: Translated from the French version ("Joan Miró, catalogue des livres illustrés) by the same publisher. Includes information on edition size, paper type, printer and publisher. Facsimiles from the colophons of the copies are also described.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Paintings.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 2,050 paintings in oil, acrylic, and mixed media, on canvas, masonite and other hard supports. The publication contains a list of supplementary information and/or corrections to paintings catalogued in previous volumes, and a title index.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró, Josep Llorens Artigas : Ceramics : Catalogue Raisonné 1941-1981.
author_s:
Punyet Miró, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gardy Artigas, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calero Fernández, Cristina
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of 441 ceramic works made by the artist between 1941 and 1981.  The catalogue includes an essay by the ceramist Joan Gardy Artigas, son of  Josep Llorens Artigas.  The ceramics catalogue raisonné is a sequel to the four-volume catalogue of his prints, the six volumes of paintings, and the volume of his sculpture.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings : 1977.
public_note: Catalogue entries include title, date, technique, dimensions, signature and inscriptions, collection, provenance, important exhibition and publication information.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings : 1978-1981.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings : 1973-1976.
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, dimensions, medium, current location, provenance, exhibitions, and references. Most artworks are illustrated in color.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings : 1960-1972.
public_note: The Successió Miró has created a database of some, but not all, of the images listed in the catalogue raisonné.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings : 1938-1959.
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, provenance, exhibitions, references, signature and inscription information, technique, and dimensions.  All works are reproduced in color.

name: Miró, Joan
item_t: Joan Miró : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings : 1901-1937.
ind_entr_cont: Catalogue entries include title, date, technique, dimensions, signature and inscriptions, collection, provenance, important exhibition and publication information.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Mondrian, Pie
item_t: Piet Mondrian : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Visser, Evelien de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Coppes, Wietse                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hoekema, Samantha                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Geerts, Ton
cronology: The online catalogue follows the numbering of the 1998 catalogue, but the classifications vary somewhat.  Almost all works are illustrated in scalable color images.  Catalogue entry information can be accessed by clicking on the image and selecting the button "Toon in RKD Database".
ind_entr_cont: Also, not all references found in the print publication have been maintained in the digitized version, for these, one should consult the original edition.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Mondrian, Pie
item_t: Piet Mondrian : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: An American edition was also published by Harry N. Abrams, New York, 1998 (ISBN 0810942879). Each volume contains a separate catalogue of unindentified works. These are works that are by Mondrian, but which can't be identified with known extant examples.

name: Mondrian, Pie
item_t: Complete Mondrian.
author: Bax, Marty
public_note: This is a condensed single volume catalogue raisonné of all of the artist's paintings, drawings, prints and sculptures arranged chronologically.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Amedeo Modigliani, dessins et sculptures avec suite du catalogue illustré des peintres
author: Ceroni, Ambrogio
public_note: This volume covers the drawings, sculptures, and a "suite" to the illustrated catalogue of the paintings. Illustrations are located at the end of the book.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Amedeo Modigliani, peintre.
public_note:
This catalogue Includes previously unpublished "souvenirs" by Lunia Czechowska, who was an intimate friend of the artist and his circle.
See also the author's companion volume "Amadeo Modigliani, dessins et scuptures avec suite du catalogue illustré des peintres" published by Edizioni del Milione, 1965, as well as his later catalogue "Modigliani. Presentazione di Leone Piccioni. Appparati critici e filologici di Ambrogio Ceroni" (Classici dell'arte, 40), both cited in this database.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Modigliani, 1884-1920 : catalogue raisonné : sa vie, son oeuvre complet, son art.
author: Lanthemann, J.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Modigliani : catalogue raisonné.
author: Parisot, Christian
public_note:
As the French title  ("Témoignages") states, volume 4 consists of photographs and other material documenting the artist's life and work. 

As such, it is independent from the other four volumes, which constitute the catalogue of works (v.1-2, v.3, v.5).

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Modigliani : catalogue raisonné.
author: Parisot, Christian
public_note: This volume is divided into sections on the sculptures, drawings, and paintings, followed by studies and documentation on the works, and a bibliography.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Modigliani : catalogue raisonné.
public_note:
The format follows that of the first two volumes. The entries include work (drawings, watercolors) not catalogued in the first two volumes; they carry numbers that refer to the files preserved in the Modigliani Legal Archives in Livorno (Archives Légales Amedo Modigliani).
This information is available to qualified persons upon written request.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Modigliani : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Parisot, Christian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guastalla, Giorgio & Guido (Editors)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Modigliani, Jeanne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Venturi, Fulvio
public_note:
The entries carry specific numbers that refer to the files preserved in the Modigliani Legal Archives in Livorno (Archives Légales Amedeo Modigliani). This information is available to qualified persons upon written request.

In the catalogue itself, the illustrations (without captions) are followed by basic descriptive texts which give number, title, medium, date, inscription, collection, provenance information, etc.

Works illustrated in the first volume have catalogue number only (the critical information appears in the section following). The paintings are listed with fuller critical information, including auction sales.  All works carry a specific number refering to the files preserved in A.L.A.M.

name: Modigliani, Amedeo
item_t: Amedeo Modigliani : catalogo generale.
author: Patani, Osvaldo
public_note: The catalogue cites number, title, date, medium, dimensions, location, provenance, exhibitions, and bibliography.  There are no comments accompanying the respective entries, however.

name: Monet, Claude
item_t: Monet. Volume III: 1887-1898, peintures.
author: Wildenstein, Daniel
public_note: The full text digitized publication is available on the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's website (see Full Text Link on this page).

name: Monet, Claude
item_t: Monet. Volume IV: 1899-1926, peintures.
author: Wildenstein,Daniel
public_note: In this volume, there is a biography, as well as a section on the "Grands decorations".

name: Monet, Claude
item_t: Monet. Volume II: 1882-1886, peintures.
author: Wildenstein, Daniel
public_note: The publication also includes a biography of the artist, documents, indices, and maps.

name: Monet, Claude
item_t: Monet. Volume I: 1840-1881, peintures.
author: Wildenstein, Daniel
public_note: This volume also contains a preface, biography, documents, abbreviations, indices, and maps.

name: Monet, Claude
item_t: Monet.
author: Wildenstein, Daniel
imprint: Cologne : Taschen, in conjunction with the Wildenstein Institute, 1996.
public_note: An updated and expanded version of the earlier five-volume, 1974-1991 catalogue "Claude Monet: biographie et catalogue raisonné" (see entry cited in this database). Vols. 2-4 comprise the catalogue raisonné. Catalogue entries are in English, German and French.

name: Millet, Jean-Franço
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Miller, Alfred Jacob
item_t: Alfred Jacob Miller : Artist on the Oregon Trail.
author_s:
Tyler, Ron (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dewees Reynolds, Karen                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Johnston, William R.
public_note: The catalogue lists 910 works (sketchbook pages, multiples, etc. are not numbered individually).  It covers works in all media-paintings, watercolors, drawings, and graphic works- and includes unlocated works.  Individual entries cite title, medium, dimensions, signature and inscriptions, provenance, references, and exhibitions.  There is little commentary, except for those works included in the exhibition, and not all works in the catalogue are illustrated.

name: Micó, Fidel
item_t: The Fidel Micó Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Buxadó, José A.
cronology: Individual entries include brief comments, references, exhibitions, provenance, and signature information.  Entries indicate when a work was examined in person.  Artworks are illustrated in color thumbnails and some color plates.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné is available at the above web address as a free downloadable pdf. The project will continue to be expanded and revised until 2020.  The catalogue was issued with cooperation of the artist and members of his family.

name: Millares, Manolo
item_t: Manolo Millares : pinturas : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Torre, Alfonso de la                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonet, Juan Manuel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fernández Santiago, Miriam
imprint: Madrid : Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofia, 2004.
public_note: The present publication is the culmination of a catalogue begun soon after the artist's death in 1972 by Juan Manuel Bonet and Miriam Fernández Santiago.  The current publication was completed under the direction of Alfonso de la Torre.  The catalogue was compiled with the close cooperation of the artist's widow, Elvireta Escobio.

name: Miklos, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Miklos.
author_s:
Cichocka, Danuta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bastin, Etienne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Renoux, Jacques                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Christatos, Marie-Hélène                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Patkaï, Christiane
illustrations: v. 1: 540;  v. 2: approx. 500 b&w, color ills.
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of the artist's complete oeuvre: paintings, sculptures, decorative arts, graphic works, book arts, and other media.  In addition to the catalogue, the texts include a biography of the artist and stylistic analysis of his works.

name: Millares, Manolo
item_t: Manolo Millares : obra gráfica, 1959-1972 : catálogo razonado
author: Torre, Alfonso de la
imprint: Marbella : MGEC, Fundación Museo del Grabado Español Contemporáneo, 2016.

name: Mignon, Abraham
item_t: Abraham Mignon, 1640-1979 : catalogue raisonné.
author: Kraemer-Noble, Magdalena
public_note:
The author also published an earlier study on the artist, published by F. Lewis, Leigh-on-Sea, 1973.

The catalogue includes a biography with a discussion of Mignon's artistic influences.  All texts are translated into English. There is a genealogy of Mignon's family and a discussion of comparative average prices for Dutch still life paintings.

name: Mihaltianu, Dan
item_t: Subreal.
imprint: Bucharest : National Museum of Contemporary Art ; Vienna : Verlag für Moderne Kunst, 2015.
public_note: The catalogue was published following a 2012-2013 exhibition held at the Muzeul National de Arta Contemporana (Bucharest) and SALT Beyogl (Istanbul).

name: Mieris, Frans van
item_t: Frans van Mieris (1635-1681) the Elder.
author: Naumann, Otto
public_note:
The first volume has numerous sections on the artist's training, career and subject matter, followed by several appendices including documents, a geneology, comparative works, bibliographical information, accepted works of unknown location, and other critical apparatus.

The catalogue raisonné is divided according to the following order: accepted works (in chronological sequence, with replicas and prints of lost works), works with problematic attributions, and rejected and unidentified works.
Entries include the following information: catalogue number, title, location, support, dimensions, signature and comments, provenance, exhibition and literary references.

name: Michetti, Francesco Paolo
item_t: Francesco Paolo Michetti : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Benzi, Fabio (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berardi, Gianluca (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sacchi Lodispoto, Teresa (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Spinazzè, Sabrina (ed.)
public_note: The texts include a discussion of the engraved work by Francisoco Parisi.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné, a biography of the artist, a bibliography, and a list of exhibitions.  All works have been viewed in person, except those marked: "of unknown location".

name: Millecamps, Yve
item_t: Millecamps : tapisseries 1956-1975.
public_note:
The publication contains an essay and an interview with the artist, as well as a catalogue of 17 of the woven works.  

The Appendix also includes a biography, a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes, a bibliography, exhibition list, and index.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Die Handzeichnungen Michelagniolos Buonarroti.
author: Frey, Karl
public_note: A supplement was published, "Nachtrag, Erster Teil (I) by Fritz Knapp (Berlin: J. Bard, 1925).  No other supplements appeared.

name: Michaux, Hen
item_t: Henri Michaux : les estampes 1948-1984 : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Mason, Rainer Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cherix, Christophe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gheerbrant, Bernard (text)
imprint: Geneva : Cabinet des estampes du Musée d'Art et d'Histoire : Patrick Cramer, 1997.
public_note: The publication catalogues all of the artist's lithographs, illustrated books, and prints created between 1948 and 1984.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Tutta la pittura di Michelangelo.
author: Carli, Enzo
public_note: Issued in the series: Biblioteca d'arte Rizzoli:", no. 1.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Die Zeichnungen des Michelangelo : kritischer Katalog.
author: Dussler, Luitfold

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangelo.
author: De Tolnay, Charles
imprint: Princeton, NJ : Princeton University Press; London, 1943-1960.
public_note: Though not all scholars agree with all of the author's  premises, this is an extensive (mostly chronological) overview of the artist's career, with exemplary photographs of the oeuvre.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangiolo architetto.
author_s:
Argan, Guilio Carlo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barbieri, Franco

                                                            Puppi, Lionello                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zevi, Bruno (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Portoghesi, Paolo (ed.)
public_note: The massive volume also includes numerous facsimiles, plans and plates (some in color).

name: Michelangelo Buonarro

author_s:
Salmi, Mario                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tolnary, Charles de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baldini, Umberto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Salvini, Roberto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            .                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Garin, E.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangelo Drawings.
author: Hartt, Frederick
ind_entr_cont: The individual entries include materials, dimensions, and descriptive and historical commnetary.

name: Mène, Pierre-Jule
item_t: Pierre-Jules Mene, 1810-1879 : catalogue raisonné.

name: Meynier, Charle
item_t: Charles Meynier, 1763-1832.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is organized chronologically, with references to the correspondence of Vivant-Denon (1999 ed.) appearing in brackets. The comments accompanying the entries are good and comprehensive.

name: Méryon, Charle
item_t: Catalogue Raisonné of the Etchings of Charles Meryon.
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1989.
public_note: The original publication (Truesdale, New York, 1924) was followed by a  revised edition with addenda and errata information provided by Winifred Porter Truesdell, 1925.

name: Méryon, Charle
item_t: The Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints of Charles Meryon.
author_s:
Schneiderman, Richard S.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Raysor, Frank W.
imprint: London : Garton & Co. in association with Scolar Press, 1990.
public_note: The publication includes a concordance to the catalogues published by Delteil and Wright (see entry cited in this database).

name: Meucci, Vincenzo
item_t: Vincenzo Meucci (1694-1766).
author: Lenzi Iacomelli, Carlotta
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes 87 paintings and frescoes as well as 35 drawings and 50 lost works.

name: Meuron, Pierre de
item_t: Herzog & de Meuron 2005-2007.
author: Mack, Gerhard
public_note: Issued as the sixth volume in the series: "Herzog & de Meuron: das Gesamtwerk = The Complete Works".

name: Meuron, Pierre de
item_t: Herzog & de Meuron 1997-2001.
author: Mack, Gerhard
public_note: The fourth volume in the series: :"Herzog  & de Meuron ; das Gesamtwerk = The Complete

name: Meuron, Pierre de
item_t: Herzog & de Meuron 1992-1996.
author: Mack, Gerhard
public_note: N.B. this is an updated new edition (40 additional pages plus 80 color ill.) of Vol. 3 in the series "Herzog & de Meuron : das Gesamtwerk = The Complete Works".

name: Meuron, Pierre de
item_t: Herzog & de Meuron 1989-1991.
author: Mack, Gerhard
public_note: This is the second edition of  Vol.2,  published in the series "Herzog & de Meuron : das Gesamtwork = The Complete Works".

name: Meuron, Pierre de
item_t: Herzog & de Meuron 1978-1988.
author: Mack, Gerhard
public_note: The first volume published in the series on the Swiss architectural firm:  "Herzog & de Meuron : das Gesamtwerk = The Complete Works".

name: Metsu, Gabriel
item_t: Gabriel Metsu : Life and Work - A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Waiboer, Adriaan
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 2012.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 133 authentic paintings; 21 possibly authentic paintings; 293 paintings known only from descriptions (up to 1800); 45 rejected paintings; and a checklist of 2 drawings.

name: Ménageot, François-Guillaume
item_t: François-Guillaume Ménageot (1744-1816). Peintre d'histoire. Directeur de l'Academie de France à Rome.
author: Willk-Brocard, Nicole
public_note: The catalogue was originally published as the author's thesis in 1976.  In addition to the catalogue of works and a biographical essay, the volume includes a number of primary documents, including the artist's post mortem inventory.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: L'opera completa di Michelangelo pittore.
public_note: Issued in the series "Classici dell'Arte", n. 1.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Corpus dei disegni di Michelangelo.
public_note: At head of title: Ente della Casa Buonarroti.  This thorough presentation of Michelangelo's drawings is designated as a "Corpus" (not a catalogue raisonné). Oit is nonetheless an extremely extensive compilation, the result of a life-long study of the artist's work by the author.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: L'opera completa di Michelangelo pittore.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: The Architecture of Michelangelo.
public_note: The monograph and catalogue raisonné was issued in 1970 by Penguin Books.  This is the second revised edition, which includes new material and updated information.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangiolo : tutta la scultura.
author: Baldini, Umberto
public_note: Catalogue is volume 3 in the "La Scheda d'arte" series.  In addition to the catalogue of the sculpture, there is a biographical essay, a bibliography, and a list of works.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: L'opera completa di Michelangelo scultore.
author: Baldini, Umberto
public_note: Published in the series "Classici dell'arte", N.S. 13.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangelo scultore.
author: Acidini Luchinat, Cristina
public_note: N.B. A later English language (reduced) edition and a German language edition were also published in 2010. New photography was specifically commissioned from Aurelio Amendola for this publication, and they are an  integral part of the study.

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangelo pittore.
author: Acidini Luchinat, Cristina

name: Michelangelo Buonarro
item_t: Michelangelo : 1475-1564 : Complete Works.
author_s:
Zöllner, Frank                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thoenes, Christof                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pöpper, Thomas
illustrations: numerous ills. and plates, chiefly color
public_note: A critical essay on the artist's life and work is followed by an analytical inventory of the works divided into four parts: paintings, sculpture, architecture, and drawings.

name: Mestre de Vielha
item_t: Mestre de Vielha : un pintor del tardogòtic entre Catalunya i Aragó.
author: Velasco Gonzáles, Alberto
imprint: Lleida : Edicions de la Universitat de Lleida, 2006
public_note: The catalogue is followed by a conclusion, a bibliography, andan  index of illustrations.  While this publication is not listed as a catalogue raisonné by some libraries, it is an in-depth attempt to identify and catalogue the work of a little-documented late Gothic artist.

name: Mesdag, Hendrik Willem
item_t: Hendrik Willem Mesdag, 1831-1915 : oeuvrecatalogus.
author: Poort, Johan
public_note: An addendum to this catalogue was issued by the same author and publishers in 1997: "Hendrik Willem Mesdag, 1831-1915: oeuvrecatalogues: supplement" (ISBN 9074192114).

name: Mesdag, Hendrik Willem
item_t: Hendrik Willem Mesdag, 1831-1915 : De schetsen : oeuvrecatalogus.
author: Poort, Johan
public_note: Catalogue of the drawings.

name: Mercier, Claude
item_t: Claude Mercier : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: This study of the sculptor's works  is organized by medium: sculpture (1949- 2017), jewelry and applied arts.  The publication also includes a biography and texts related to Mercier's artistic vision and his work with metals.

name: Merian, Matthäus, the elde
item_t: Matthäus Merian d.Ä. : die Handzeichnungen.
public_note: The current publication greatly expands and revises the author's 1963 monograph "Die Handzeichnungen von Matthaeus Merian d. Ae. Unter Berücksichtigung der fraglichen und falschen Zuschreibungen sowie der Gemälde" (Basel: Bärenreiter).

name: Mesdag, Hendrik Willem
item_t: Hendrik Willem Mesdag, 1831-1915 : oeuvrecatalogus : supplement.
author: Poort, Johan
public_note: This supplement to the author's 1989 catalogue (see entry cited in this database) includes a list of errata from the earlier publication.

name: Menzel, Adolph
item_t: Adolph von Menzel : das graphische Werk.
author_s:
Ebertshäuser, Heidi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jensen, Jens Christian (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Liebermann, Max (essay)

name: Menzel, Adolph
item_t: Adolf von Menzel ; Abbildungen seiner Gemälde und Studien auf Grund der von Kgl. Nationalgalerie im Frühjahr 1905…
author_s:
Tschudi, Hugo von (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schwedeler-Meyer, F.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kern, J.
public_note: An early study on the artist, based on a retrospective exhibition held at the (former Royal) National Gallery, Berlin, 1905.  The catalogue raisonné covers Menzel's  oil paintings, sketches, watercolors, gouaches, and pastels.

name: Meneses Osorio, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Meneses Osorio, discípulo de Murillo.
author: Serra Giráldez, Sofia

name: Mena, Pedro de
item_t: Pedro de Mena, Seventeenth-Century Spanish Sculptor.
author: Anderson, Janet A.
public_note: Based on the author's dissertation, "Pedro de Mena : Spanish Sculptor, 1628-1688".  The catalogue is part of the series "Studies in Art and Religious Interpretation".

name: Mendelsohn, Erich
item_t: Erich Mendelsohn : Complete Works of the Architect : Sketches, Designs, Buildings.
author: Mendelsohn, Erich
public_note:
The first edition of this work was published in 1930 by Rudolf Mosse Buchverlag, Berlin as  "Erich Mendelsohn: das Gesamtschaffen des Architeken : Skizzen, Entwürfe, Bauten". A German language reprint of the original edition was also published in 1988 (Braunschweig; Wiesbaden: Friedrich Vieweg & Sohn).

In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes: two articles on New Architecture; two lectures from 1919 and 1923; sketches and photographs of the architect's projects; and a biref listing of exhibitions and publications.

name: Memling, Han
item_t: L'opera completa di Memling.
public_note:
Issued in the series "Classici dell'arte", n. 27.
A later French language edition of this study was also published in France in 1973 (See entry in this database).

The catalogue includes biographical essay, a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes, and an analysis of the painted oeuvre. There is also a documents section and title and place indices.

name: Memling, Han
item_t: Hans Memling : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Vos, Dirk De                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Janssens de Bisthoven, Aquilin (Preface)
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with "Memling Year" celebrations of the 500th anniversary of the artist's death. It also was published by Ludion Press, Ghent, and distributed in an American edition by Harry N. Abrams, New York, 1994. 

The catalogue raisonné includes: authentic works; problematic works; copies of lost works; and rejected attributions. In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes a biography and chapters on Memling's techniques and artistic production.

name: Mengs, Anton Raphael
item_t: Oeuvres complètes d'Antoine-Raphaël Mengs…contenant différens traités sur la théorie de la peinture.
author_s:
Mengs, Anton Raphael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Azara, José Nicolás de, marqués de Nibbiano
public_note: This is a very early catalogue of the artist's complete writings and artworks, translated from the Italian.  The publication includes a biography of the artist, as well as Mengs' treatises on art and reflections on the art of the Old Masters.  It also includes Mengs' correspondence and other documents, and a checklist of his works, divided by location.

name: Mendelsohn, Erich
item_t: Erich Mendelsohn : The Complete Works.
author: Zevi, Bruno
public_note: The publication includes the artist's notebooks, sketchbooks, and architectural plans.

name: Mengs, Anton Raphael
item_t: Anton Raphael Mengs 1728-1779.
author: Roettgen, Steffi
illustrations: Bd. 1: 659 b&w and color ills., 17 color plates; Bd. 2: 60 color plates
public_note: A monograph and first scholarly catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings and drawings.  The first volume contains the catalogue, arranged by subject.

name: Mengs, Anton Raphael
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Menzel, Adolph
item_t: Adolph Menzel : Zeichnungen, Druckgraphik und illustriere Buecher ; ein Bestandskatalog der Nationalgalerie, des Kuperstichkabinetts unde der Kunstbibliothek Staatliche Museeum Preussicher Kulturbesitz Berlin.
public_note: An exhibition (June-August 1984 Bonn) on the works of Menzel as draughtsman, print maker, and book illustrator, from the collections held by the Print Collection and Art Library of the Berlin state museums.

name: Menzel, Adolph
item_t: Adolph Menzel : Verzeichnis seines graphischen Werkes : Catalogue of His Graphic Work.
author: Bock, Elfried
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1991.
public_note: The original German edition was published by Amsler & Ruthardt, Berlin in 1923.

name: Merano, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovanni Battista Merano.
public_note: The text is in Italian, with a biographical essay by Mary Newcome-Schleier in English. The catalogue includes 98 paintings and frescoes, 28 drawings, 4 graphic works by the artist. The publication also contains separate catalogues of lost works, doubtful and rejected attributions, as well as 7 works reattributed to Merano's student, Giovanni Battista Resoaggi.

name: Messerschmidt, Franz Xave
item_t: Franz Xaver Messerschmidt, 1736-1783.
author_s:
Pötzl-Malikova, Maria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lechner, Georg (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Husslein-Arco, Agnes
public_note: The monograph and catalogue raisonné was published in the series "Belvedere Werkverzeichnisse", Bd. 4.  The texts have parallel translations in German and English, but the catalogue is only in German.

name: Melville, Arthu
item_t: Arthur Melville : Scottish Impressionist (1855-1904).
author: Mackay, Agnes Ethel
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a list of plates and a biography of the artist. Not all works listed in the catalogue raisonné are illustrated.

name: Mellan, Claude
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Claude Mellan d'Abbevillë.
public_note:
For further information on the artist's prints, one can also consult the catalogues issued under the aegis of the Bibliothèque nationale de France: "Inventaire du fonds français, graveurs du XVIIe siècle", t. 17 (by Maxime Préaud); and 
"Catalogues de la collection d'estampes de Jean V, roi de Portugal" , v.3 & index (by P-J Mariette, J. Thuillier, M. Préaud et al.)

name: Meléndez, Lu
item_t: Luis Meléndez : Eighteenth-Century Master of the Spanish Still Life : With a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Tufts, Eleanor
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists 94 authentic paintings, 8 copies after Melendez, and 56 questionable attributions, arranged in alphabetical order and by location. 

The appendix reproduces the artist's correspondence, declarations of poverty by Meléndez and his widow, and the artist's death certificate. All documents are in Spanish.

name: Meléndez, Lu
item_t: Luis Meléndez : Still-life Painter.
author: Cherry, Peter
imprint: [Madrid] Fundación de Apoyo a la Historia del Arte Hispánico, [2006].
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 135 still-life paintings by the artist, all illustrated in color. An extensive documents section, compiled by María Cruz de Carlos and Lucía Varela, reproduces the artist's correspondence, contracts, inventories, and other estate papers.  All documents are in Spanish, but brief descriptions of the contents are given in English.

name: Meissonier, Jean Louis Erne
item_t: Exposition Meissonier.

name: Meier, Richard
item_t: Richard Meier : Architect. Volume 6/2009-2013
public_note:
This volume contains a preface by the architect, and lists approximately 30 some residential, commercial, and civic projects executed from 2009 to 2013.  It also includes a biographical chronology, documents and images from the Richard Meier & Partners Model Archives, and lists of collaborators and consultants.

The publication was designed by the late Massimo Vignelli.

name: Meier, Richard
item_t: Richard Meier : Architect. Volume 5/2004-2009
author_s:
Meier, Richard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goldberger, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Frampton, Kenneth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stella, Frank (afterword)
public_note: The fifth volume catalogue approximately 30 projects.

name: Meidner, Ludwig
item_t: Ludwig Meidner : Werkverzeichnis der Skizzenbücher = Catalogue Raisonne of His Sketchbooks.
imprint: Frankfurt am Main : Jüdisches Museum ; Munich : Prestel, 2013.
public_note:
The catalogue was organized by the Auftrag des Magistrats der Stadt Frankfurt, Dezernat für Kulture und Wissenschaft, the Jüdischen Museum der Stadt Frankfurt am Main; and in cooperation with the Stadtarchiv der Wissenschaftsstadt Darmstadt.

The present publication reproduces and catalogues all 51 of the artist's known sketchbooks. The catalogue includes translations of sketchbook texts, a biography of the artist, and a name index.

author: Cramer, Patrick
public_note:
This is the supplement to Cramer's 1990 catalogue raisonné (cited in this database). It includes a bibliography and a list of Meckseper exhibitions from 1990-1995.

Though not quoted in this database, one can also consult the three other catalogues of Meckseper's prints issued earlier by the artist's dealer Galerie Schmücking (Braunschweig, 1969, 1975, 1981).

Entries provide code no., title (in English and Italian), date, medium, dimensions, and edition information.  All works are illustrated with scalable color images.

                                                            Vignelli, Massimo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Campo Baeza, Alberto (intro.)
public_note: This is a trilingual catalogue raisonné of the architect's projects up until 2008.  The publicatoin includes a biography and a chronology of works.

name: Meissonnier, Juste-Aurèle
item_t: Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier : un génie du rococo, 1695-1750.
author: Führing, Peter
public_note:
Due to the difficulty in tracing long lost or forgotten decorative art pieces, the author warns this monograph may not be a complete catalogue raisonné.  It does, however, provide as thorough an overview of Meissonnier's work as possible, with extensive critical apparatus.
 
In addition to the catalogue, other chapters deal with the supporting scholarly evidence including a profile of the artist's family, biographies, chronological listings of source documents, inventories, and critical commentary by authors of the 18th & 19th centuries. There in an essay on "Rocaille", a table of the structure and departments of the royal household in which the artist served, and appendices containing biographies, a bibliography, and name index.

name: Melotti, Fausto
item_t: Melotti : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Celant, Germano                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gianelli, Ida                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Soldaini, Antonella                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Melotti, Marta (archives)
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné gives date, number, title, dimensions, medium and support, location and collection, code number, provenance, exhibition history, and references.  

The code number is a composite of the number in the Melotti Archive and other information about the work (such as dating, edition or copies, format, etc.).

public_note: The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Denise Ferran.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes lists of solo and group exhibitions, and works in selected public collections.

public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes drawings, metal sculptures (divided by type of metal), stone sculptures, terracotta masks and sculptures, embroidery and fabric works, and glass art.  This first volume does not include multiples such as graphic works or works of applied art. This volume features an essay by the President and Director of the Mastroianni Foundation and photos of the artist.

The publication lists 66 authentic works, as well as 7 lost documented paintings, and 7 doubtful attributions. The appendicies also list Massys's portrait medallions and tapestry designs.

name: Mataré, Ewald

In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes essays by various authors on Bianconi's work at the Venini Glassworks in the 1950s; his work as an illustrator; and the reception of Italian glass in America in the early 1950s.
