item_t: Carlo Scarpa : Venini, 1932-1947 : catalogo generale.
author: Barovier, Marino (ed.)
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at Le Stanze del vetro, Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice, Italy from August - January 2013.

name: Masaccio
item_t: Masaccio and Masolino : A Complete Catalogue.
author: Joannides, Paul
imprint: London : Phaidon Press ; New York : distributed in North America by H. N. Abrams,  1993
public_note: The publication includes chapters on Florentine art between 1400 and 1420; a discussion of the artists' collaborative and individual works; Masaccio's and Masolino's artistic following; and a historiography.

name: Masaccio
item_t: Masaccio.
author: Spike, John T.
public_note:
Following the introductory essay, the catalogue raisonné lists all of Masaccio's known easel paintings and frescoes, as well as some works of uncertain attribution.

The book also includes documentary sources on the artist's life.

name: Masereel, Fran
item_t: Frans Masereel : Bibliography and Catalogue.
author_s:
Avermaete, Roger                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vorms, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gabelentz, Hanns-Conon von der                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Naessens, Maurice (Preface)
imprint: Antwerp : Fonds Mercator ; New York : Rizzoli, 1976.
public_note: A catalogue raisonné listing over 800 of the artist's prints and book illustrations.

name: Marsy, Balthaza
item_t: The Sculpture of Gaspard and Balthazar Marsy : Art and Patronage in the Early Reign of Louis XIV, with a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Hedin, Thomas F.
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes Guillet de Saint-Georges' contemporary biography of the artists (in French).  

The appendices include additional information on the artists' lives and work.

name: Martin, Agne
item_t: Agnes Martin Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bell, Tiffany (ed.)
cronology: The catalogue can be searched using various filters, chronologically, by medium, etc.  Catalogue entries include exhibition and literature histories, provenance, descriptive notes, signature and inscription information, and related works.  All works are illustrated with scalable color images.
ind_entr_cont: A multimedia archive includes content exclusive to the catalogue. There is a bibliography for the artist's published writing and interviews, an illustrated chronology, and lists of exhibitions.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Marini, Marino
item_t: Marino Marini : Catalogue Raisonné of the Sculptures.
public_note: The Italian language edition: "Marino Marini: catalogo generale delle sculture" was also published by Skira. The current publication updates information found in earlier catalogues published by San Lazzaro and Pirovano, and includes updates from the Archives of the Marino Marini Fondazione in Pistoia. The bibliography also has been extensively updated with new data.

name: Marini, Marino
item_t: Marino Marini :  Complete Works.
author_s:
Waldberg, Patrick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            San Lazzaro, G. di                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Read, Herbert
public_note: There are separate catalogues of paintings, sculptures, lithographs, and engravings, all arranged chronologically. Most works are illustrated in black and white.

name: Marini, Antonio Maria
item_t: Antonio Marini : pittore (1668-1725) : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Muti, Laura                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            De Sarno Prignano, Daniele                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zampetti, Pietro (foreword)
public_note:
The publication contains a lengthy essay on the artist's work, a brief biography, and some critical reviews.  The catalogue raisonné lists the artist's authentic works.  The addenda includes joint collaborative works, works mentioned in documents, and rejected attributions. 

There are general and topographical indices.

name: Marquet, Albe
item_t: Marquet : L'Afrique du Nord : catalogue de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Martinet, Jean-Claude                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wildenstein, Guy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Paret, Michèle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Castais, Nicole
public_note: The first volume focuses on Marquet's work in Tunisia, Algeria, Morocco & Egypt. Jean-Claude Martinet, who is the nephew of Marquet’s wife, co-authored the first volume.

name: Marini, Marino
item_t: Marino Marini : Catalogue Raisonné of the Graphic Works (Engravings and Lithographs), 1919-1980.
author_s:
Guastalla, Giorgio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guastalla, Guido                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            De Micheli, Mario (preface)
imprint: Livorno : Leslie J. Sacks Editions : Graphis arte editions, 1993.
public_note:
An Italian edition, "Marino Marini catalogo ragionato dell'opera grafica (incisioni e litografie) 1919-1980" was published in 1990 by Edizioni Graphis Arte, Livorno. The present publication includes an English translation of the original Italian text.

This catalogue updates "Marino Marini opera grafica completa, 1914-1975," published in 1976 by Haus der Kunst, Munich to accompany an exhibition organized by Erich Steingräber.

name: Marieschi, Michele
item_t: Michiel Marieschi, catalogo ragionato dell'opera incisa

name: Marin, John
item_t: The Complete Etchings of John Marin.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of 180 etchings was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, entitled 'John Marin: Etchings and Related Works'.  Individual entries include the location of the original plate, when known.

name: Martini, Simone
item_t: Simone Martini : Complete Edition.
author: Martindale, Andrew
public_note: An American edition was also published by New York University Press, 1988.  The catalogue includes a separate section on lost works.

name: Mariani, Pompeo
item_t: Pompeo Mariani : catalogo ragionato.
author_s:
Di Giovanni Madruzza, Marilisa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ranzi, Anna
public_note: The catalogue raisonné contains 1,366 entries, all works are illustrated with thumbnail b&w images. There are appendices presenting a critical anthology, exhibitions, bibliography, and indices.

name: Marieschi, Michele
item_t: Michele Marieschi : la vita, l'ambiente, l'opera.
author_s:
Montecuccoli degli Erri, Federico                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pedrocco, Filippo
public_note: The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of Marieschi's paintings and engravings.

name: Marieschi, Michele
item_t: Michele Marieschi : l'opera completa.
author: Toledano, Ralph

name: Marieschi, Michele
item_t: Michele Marieschi : catalogo ragionato.
author: Toledano, Ralph
public_note: This is the revised and augmented edition of the author's original 1988 catalogue raisonné (see entry cited in this database).

name: Marées, Hans von
item_t: Hans von Marées : sein Leben and sein Werk.
author: Meier-Graefe, Julius
public_note: See also "Hans von Marées: Katalog seiner Gemälde" by U. Gerlach-Laxner, 1980, cited in this database.

name: Marcoussis, Lou
item_t: Marcoussis : sa vie, son oeuvre : catalogue complet des peintures, fixés sur verre, aquarelles, dessins, gravures.
author_s:
Lafranchis, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cassou, Jean (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tzara, Tristan
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné begins with the oil paintings, followed by reverse (underglass) paintings and objects, gouaches, watercolors, and drawings; some engravings are listed, but information is not complete (See catalogue of prints cited in this database). 

Introductory chapters deal with the artist's work and life in chronological sequence. These are followed by a section on documents, including lists of exhibitions and public sales, museum and private collections, and a bibliography and index.

name: Marcks, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Marcks : das plastische Werk.
public_note: See also: "Gerhard Marcks: das plastische Werk, 1973-1981" (cited in this database), which covers the last years of the artist's activity.  Martina Rudloff compiled the catalogue raisonné.

name: Marcoussis, Lou
item_t: Louis Marcoussis 1878-1941 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé .

name: Marcks, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Marcks : das plastische Werk, 1973-1981.
public_note: This publication catalogues only the last years of the artist's production. For the main catalogue raisonné on the sculpture and related works, see: "Gerhard Marcks: das plastische Werk" by Guenter Busch et al, 1977 (cited in this database). The current catalogue includes a concordance to the 1977 edition.

name: Marcks, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Marcks : das druckgraphische Werk.
author: Lammek, Kurt
public_note: Issued under the aegis of the Gerhard Marcks-Stiftung Bremen. The catalogue includes woodcuts, illustrated books, linocuts, etchings, and lithographs. There are supplements with examples of the artist's signature, a short biography, select bibliographic references, and indices.

name: Marden, Brice
item_t: Brice Marden : Prints 1961-1991 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
illustrations: 43 b&w ills., 15 b&w and color plates
public_note:
An exhibition catalogue that includes the first catalogue raisonné of Marden's prints.
Published for the Marden circulating retrospective held at: the Tate, the Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris, and The Baltimore Museum of Art.

name: Marées, Hans von
item_t: Hans von Marées : Katalog seiner Gemälde.
author: Gerlach-Laxner, Uta
public_note: This is a critical catalogue of the paintings, plus listings of destroyed works, missing works, copies made by the artist of other paintings, doubtful pieces, and rejected works.

name: Marieschi, Michele
item_t: Michele Marieschi : opera completa.
author: Succi, Dario
public_note: The texts deal with Marieschi's place between Canaletto and Guardi; his biography; and discussions of important patrons and collectors of Marieschi's works.

name: Marin, Enrique
item_t: Enrique Marin : catalogue de l'oeuvre gravé 1963-1988.
author: Morane, Daniel

name: Marin, John
item_t: John Marin.
author: Reich, Sheldon
public_note:
The catalogue covers the 2,978 watercolor and oil paintings for which there were known locations in 1968. The catalogue is arranged chronologically, and all works are illustrated as thumbnails. 

Appendicies include a chronological list of  paintings known only through the records of the American Art Research Council, which had partially compiled an unpublished catalogue raisonné of Marin's work.

name: Marini, Antonio Maria
item_t: Antonio Maria Marini : L'opera completa.
public_note:
Texts and catalogue entries are bilingual. The catalogue raisonné is arranged by theme: landscapes, storm scenes, and battle scenes. The catalogue cites related works, and all paintings are illustrated.  

The appendix includes a biographical chronology with excerpts of documents from the artist's life cited in Italian and English.

name: Marinot, Maurice
item_t: Maurice Marinot (1882-1960) artisan verrier : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de verre.
public_note: The catalogue lists approximately 3,000 works, arranged chronologically based on Marinot's own classification system.  Almost all of the works are  illustrated with color thumbnail images.

name: Marchesini, Nella
item_t: Nella Marchesini : catalogo generale : i dipinti (1920-1953).
public_note: The chronological catalogue raisonné was compiled by Alessandro Botta.  There are also several essays  on his art, biography, and the iconography of his works.

name: Marca-Relli, Conrad
item_t: Conrad Marca-Relli.
author_s:
Piraina, Domenico                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sileo, Diego                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marca-Relli, Conrad
public_note:
This bilingual catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with the 2008 exhibition, "Conrad Marca-Relli, Protagonista dell'Espressionismo Astratto Americano" held at the Rotonda di via Besana, Milan. The book contains an unabridged, unpublished autobiographical essay written by the artist between the 1950s and the mid-1980s.

The catalogue is an illustrated checklist of the artist's paintings, drawings, collages and sculptures from 1939 to 1997.

name: Marchesi, Girolamo
item_t: Girolamo Marchesi da Cotignola : pittore : catalogo generale.
author: Zama, Raffaella
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of authentic paintings, the publication includes separate sections on doubtful attributions, lost works and rejected attributions.

name: Manzoni, Piero
item_t: Piero Manzoni : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note:
The catalogue is based on the morphology of Manzoni's work. This approach allows the reader to compare how works relate to each other stylistically and materially. 

The entries are in English and Italian. Only materially existing items have been classified, starting with those in series (only partly illustrated), followed by single works. Information is drawn from gallery and family archives.

name: Manzoni, Piero
item_t: Piero Manzoni, catalogo generale.
author: Celant, Germano
public_note: The catalogue lists 1,229 artworks by the artist.  Entries give number, title, date, medium and support, bibliographic references.  Note is made of works being considered for attribution, and/or being studied.

name: Manzù, Giacomo
item_t: Giacomo Manzù : catalogo delle opere grafiche (incisioni e litographie) 1929-1968.
author: Ciranna, Alfonso

name: Man Ray
item_t: Man Ray, opera grafica.
imprint: Turin : L. Anselmino, 1973 (v.1) ; Milan : Studio Marconi, 1984 (v.2)
public_note: Following Anselmino's death, Bianca Maria Pilat undertook the second volume as a complement to the first; especially since many of Man Ray's later works are variations after (or refer to) earlier engravings and lithographs found in Volume 1.

name: Manship, Paul
item_t: Paul Manship.

name: Mapplethorpe, Robe
item_t: Robert Mapplethorpe [Windows version]: Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Mapplethorpe, Robert
pages: 1 computer laser optical disk + user manual
public_note: N.B., there are specific system requirements needed in order to play the disc.

name: Mantegna, Andrea
item_t: Mantegna : Paintings, Drawings, Engravings.
author: Tietze-Conrat, Erika
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is organized alphabetically by location. In addition to the introductory texts on Mategna's career, the publication includes a fascimile of a letter.

name: Man Ray
item_t: Man Ray objects de mon affection.
author_s:
Hermann, Brigitte                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Martin, Jean-Hubert (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Krauss, Rosalind
public_note: While not a catalogue raisonné in the strict sense, this is an inventory, mostly prepared by the artist himself, of the "found" or "made objects" he kept in his studio.

name: Mankes, Jan
item_t: Jan Mankes, 1889-1920.
public_note: Published on the occasion of exhibition ("Het Mankes Perspectief")  held respectively at the Drents Museum te Assen, the Scheringa Museum voor Realisms te Spanbroek, and the Museum voor Moderne Kunst Arnhem, 2007-2008.

name: Mangold, Sylvia Plimack
item_t: Sylvia Plimack Mangold : Works on Paper 1968-1991 : With a Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints.
imprint: Middletown, CT : Davison Art Center, Wesleyan University; Ann Arbor, MI : University of Michigan Museum of Art; distributed by the University of Washington Press, 1992.
public_note: Catalogue of a circulating exhibition held at: Univ of Michigan; Minneapolis Institute of Arts; and elsewhere. It includes a small catalogue raisonné of the prints.

name: Manguin, Hen
item_t: Henri Manguin : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Sainsaulieu, Marie-Caroline                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Manguin,Lucille & Claude                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Manguin, Jean-Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cabanne, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lassaigne, Jacques (preface)
public_note: The edition was also distributed in France by La Bibliothèque des arts, Paris, 1980. Catalogue lists 1291 authentic works by the artist. Contains a separate checklist of 177 lost and unknown works mentioned in Manguin's notebook of sold works, organized by subject.  A supplement is currently in perparation.

name: Manfredi, Bartolomeo
item_t: Bartolomeo Manfredi (1582-1622) : ein Nachfolger Caravaggios und seine europäische Wirkung : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Hartje-Grave, Nicole
public_note: The current publication revises the author's dissertation presented at the Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität Bonn in 2000.

name: Manet, Edouard
item_t: Manet : histoire catalographique.
author: Tabarant, Adolphe
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 419 paintings, 85 pastels and 114 watercolors. The catalogue is divided into sections: Paintings after the Masters, Original Works and Pastels.

name: Manet, Edouard
item_t: Manet.
author_s:
Jamot, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wildenstein, Georges                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bataille, Marie-Louise
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-Arts, éditions d'études et de documents, 1932.
public_note: The appendix contains the 1883 inventory of Manet's studio, a geneaology of the artist's family, and excerpts from writings about Manet by his contemporaries.

name: Manet, Edouard
item_t: L'oeuvre gravé de Manet.
author: Guérin, Marcel
public_note: This edition was reprinted as "L'oeuvre gravé de Manet, avec un supplément nouvellement ajouté" (NY: Da Capo Press, 1969).

name: Manet, Edouard
item_t: Edouard Manet : Graphic Works. A Definitive Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Harris, Jean C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Smith, Joel M. (ed.)
public_note: The original edition was published by Collectors Editions Ltd., New York, 1970. Entries contain information on various states and editions of Manet's prints.

name: Manet, Edouard
item_t: Edouard Manet : catalogue raisonné.
illustrations: v.1: 430 b&w, 6 color; v.2: 692 b&w, 4 color
public_note:
The second edition lists 430 paintings.  Unlike the earlier catalogue, it also includes a catalogue of nearly 679 watercolors and drawings by the artist.  Works of doubtful attribution are excluded.   

The appendix contains Manet's family tree, the artist's will and post mortem inventory, and excerpts of writings about Manet by his contemporaries.

name: Manet, Edouard
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Manet.
public_note: From the series "Classics of the World's Great Art". First published in Italian under the title "L'opera pittorica di Edouard Manet". The catalogue was reprinted by Penguin Books in 1985.

name: Mané-Katz
item_t: Mané-Katz, 1894-1962 : The Complete Works.

name: Manfredi, Bartolomeo
item_t: Bartolomeo Manfredi.
author: Papi, Gianni
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the paintings, there is an essay on Manfredi's style and new information on members of his circle.  The chronology contains excerpts of documents related to Manfredi's life.

name: Mangiarotti, Angelo
item_t: Angelo Mangiarotti : opera completa = Complete Works.
author: Burkhardt, François (ed.)

name: Mangold, Robe
item_t: Robert Mangold : schilderijen 1964-1982 = Robert Mangold, Paintings 1964-1982.
public_note:
The catalogue was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Stedelijk Museum.

In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes a brief introductory text and a list of solo exhibitions.

name: Mangold, Robe
item_t: Robert Mangold : Prints 1968-1998.
public_note: This was a limited edition of 250 copies, designed and executed (letterpress and hand set type) by Carol Sturm.

name: Manolo
item_t: Manolo.
author: Blanch, Montserrat
public_note:
The study covers the artist's designs for jewelry, drawings, paintings, and other works. 
It has a biography and chapters on  the artist's work (1916-1945) organized by period and place (Barcelona, Paris, Ceret, Barcelona, Caldas de Montbuy).

name: Manser, Josef
item_t: Mölpis Werkverzeichnis : Bauernmaler Josef Manser.
imprint: Appenzell : Stiftung Josef und Lena Manser-Hautle, 2011.

name: Mantegna, Andrea
item_t: Mantegna : With a Complete Catalogue of the Paintings, Drawings and Prints.
author: Lightbown, R. W.
public_note:
An American edition was also published by the University of California Press, Berkeley, 1986. 

In addition to the catalogue of authentic paintings, there are separate sections dealing with: partly autograph and studio works; paintings after Mantegna; attributed juvenile works; authentic drawings; lost drawings; authentic engravings; and engravings after Mantegna's designs.

The Appendix includes a discussion of the artist's engraving techniques.

name: Mantegna, Andrea
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Mantegna.
public_note: Originally published in Italian as "L'opera completa del Mantegna." The catalogue raisonné lists 112 authentic paintings, with a separate catalogue of works known only through documentation.

name: Marc, Franz
item_t: Franz Marc : sein Leben und seine Kunst.
author: Lankheit, Klaus
public_note: The author also wrote earlier standard reference works on Marc; this study considers works that are oil on linen (unless otherwise indicated).

name: Marc, Franz
item_t: Franz Marc : The Complete Works. V. III : Sketchbooks and Prints.
imprint: London : Philip Wilson, distributed in USA by Palgrave, Macmillan, 2011.

name: Marc, Franz
item_t: Franz Marc : The Complete Works. V. II: Works on Paper, Postcards, Decorative Arts and Sculpture.
imprint: London : Philip Wilson, distributed in USA by Palgrave, Macmillan, 2005.
public_note: This second volume of the catalogue raisonné covers watercolors, works on paper, sculpture, and decorative arts.

name: Marc, Franz
item_t: Franz Marc : The Complete Works. V. I: The Oil Paintings.
imprint: London : Philip Wilson, distributed in the USA by Palgrave Macmillan, 2004.
public_note: This is the English language edition of the first volume in a new exhaustive catalogue raisonné published in Germany by C.H. Beck.  The current publication augments Klaus Lankkeit's earlier pioneering studies with c. 780 new documents, providing updated exhibition, research and reconstructed provenance information.

name: Mandin, Richard
item_t: Richard Mandin, le dernier peintre.
public_note:
In addition to the introductory texts, there are  critical commentaries and testimonials from the artist's wife, Germaine Mandin, and several others. 

The publication also includes a selection of documents related to the artist's life and work.

name: Mancini, Antonio
item_t: Antonio Mancini : catalogo ragionato dell'opera.
author: Virno, Cinzia
public_note: v.II: Repertori.

name: Malhoa, José
item_t: José Malhoa, 1855-1933 : catálogo raisonné.
author: Saldanha, Nuno
public_note: This is a complete catalogue of Malhoa's paintings (nos. 1-959) and drawings (nos. 960-1219).

name: Mallet-Stevens, Robe
item_t: Robert Mallet-Stevens : l'oeuvre complète.
author: Cinqualbre, Olivier

name: Malevich, Kasimir Severinovich
item_t: Malevich (Catalogue Raisonné of the Berlin Exhibition 1927, Including the Collection in the Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam).
author: de Wilde, E.
public_note:
While not a catalogue of the artist's oeuvre, this is a useful reference to the works brought by the artist to Berlin for exhibition, and subsequently left in the West, when he was summoned to return to the Soviet Union. 
In the last decade, a number of these works have been restituted to the artist's heirs.

name: Malfatti, Anita
item_t: Anita Malfatti : no tempo e no espaço.
author: Batista, Marta Rossetti

name: Malevich, Kasimir Severinovich
item_t: Malevich. The Graphic Work : 1913-1930. A Print Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné published on the occasion of an exhibition organized in collaboration with the Stedelijk Museum, the Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris, and the Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus, Munich.

name: Malevich, Kasimir Severinovich
item_t: Kazimir Malewicz : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Nakov, Andréi
public_note: This is a single volume in a projected three-volume set. It was the only one published (the two other unpublished volumes were to contain a monograph, bibliography, and the color plates).

name: Maler, Han
item_t: Der Maler Hans von Schwaz.
author: Mackowitz, Heinz von
public_note: Published for the author's post-doctoral qualification, this was issued as no. 193 in the series "Schlern-Schriften".   Introductory texts cover previous research on the artist; a discussion of Maler's portraits of Kaisers Maximilian and Ferdinand and Anne of Hungary; portraits; altarpieces; and his work as a fresco painter.  These sections are followed by a chronological catalogue of the work, a bibliography, and indices.

name: Manalt, Anton
item_t: Antoni Viladomat i Manalt, 1678-1755 : vida i obra.
author: Miralpeix i Vilamala, Francesc
public_note: There is separate sections devoted to 135 rejected attributions and to lost works.

name: Makart, Han
item_t: Hans Makart : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
illustrations: approx. 600 b&w ills; 105 b&w, color plates
public_note: The publication includes an essay on the artist's life and works followed by a catalogue raisonné of 675 paintings and drawings. Not all works are illustrated.

name: Mahringer, Anton
item_t: Anton Mahringer.
public_note: This study contains essays on the artist, excerpts of letters from 1930-1962, a catalogue, a biography of the artist, and a list of exhibitions.

name: Maillol, Aristide
item_t: The Woodcuts of Aristide Maillol : A Complete Catalogue with 176 Illustrations.
author: Rewald, John
public_note: The first edition was printed by Pantheon Books in 1943.  The catalogue lists 162 authentic woodcuts, not all illustrated.

name: Maillol, Aristide
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié de Aristide Maillol.
author_s:
Guérin, Marcel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dunoyer de Segonzac, André

name: Magritte, René
item_t: The Graphic Work of René Magritte.

name: Magritte, René
item_t: René Magritte : Newly Discovered Works. Oil Paintings, Gouaches, Drawings.
imprint: Houston : Menil Foundation ; London : Philip Wilson ; New York : Distrib. in USA & Canada by Rizzoli, 1992-
public_note: This volume includes illustrations of 130 previously unpublished or unknown works, and which were authenticated between 2000 and 2010. The text entries describe the circumstances of the works discovery.  The catalogue contains excerpts from the artist's correspondence in the original language.

name: Magritte, René
item_t: René Magritte Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Sylvester, David (Editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Whitfield, Sarah                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Raeburn, Michael
imprint: Houston, TX : Menil Foundation ; London : Philip Wilson ; New York : Distributed in the USA and Canada by Rizzoli International, 1992-
public_note:
Destroyed or untraced works that could be validated are included. Recorded works that don't meet stated qualifications are catalogued in an appendix.

The sixth volume, covering newly discovered works authenticated by the committee between 2000-2010,  is scheduled to appear in 2012.

name: Magritte, René
item_t: René Magritte Catalogue Raisonné : Gouaches, Temperas, Watercolours and Papiers Collés 1918-1967.
imprint: Houston, TX : Menil Foundation : London : Philip Wilson ; New York : Distributed in the USA and Canada by Rizzoli International, 1992-

name: Magritte, René
item_t: René Magritte Catalogue Raisonné : Oil Paintings, Objects and Sculpture 1949-1967
author_s:
Sylvester, David (Editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Whitfield, Sarah                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Raeburn, Michael
imprint: Houston, TX : Menil Foundation ; London : Philip Wilson ; New York : Distributeed in the USA and Canada by Rizzoli International, 1992-

name: Magritte, René
item_t: René Magritte Catalogue Raisonné : Oil Paintings and Objects 1931-1948.
imprint: Houston, TX : Menil Foundation ; London : Philip Wilson ; New York : Distributed in the USA and Canada by Rizzoli International, 1992-.

name: Magritte, René
item_t: René Magritte Catalogue Raisonné : Oil Paintings 1916-1930.
imprint: Houston, TX : Menil Foundation ;  London: Philip Wilson; New York : Distributed in the USA and Canada by Rizzoli International, 1992-
public_note:
The first of a 5-volume catalogue issued under the aegis of the Menil Foundation. A continental edition was also published by Mercatorfonds, Antwerp.
This major study, in the author's own words, offers interpretations and evaluations of the works and investigates the long-term development of the artist's images and preoccupations.

The detailed chronology covers the artist's career, including the oils, objects, sculpture and works on paper (excluding prints). It is a repository of information to which the catalogue entries constantly refer. 

While the catalogue itself does not include much provenance (selective information about that is given in the history section) the entries do cite exhibitions; at the author's decision, mention is less inclusive of other publications illustrating the artist's works.

name: Makart, Han
item_t: Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde : Hans Makart.
imprint: Vienna : Belvedere ; Weitra : Verlag Bibliothek der Provinz, 2013.
public_note:
Published in the series "Oesterreichische Galerie Belvedere: Belvedere-Werkverzeichnis", 
the present publication thoroughly revises and expands the author's 1974 monograph and catalogue raisonné on Makart (see entry cited in this database).

name: Malangatana
item_t: Malangatana Valente Ngwenya.
author: Navarro, Júlio
imprint: Dar es Salaam, Tanzania : Mkuki na Nyota Publishers, 2003.
public_note: The catalogue includes a biography of the artist and a critical essay on his work.

name: Maldonado, Tomá
item_t: Tomás Maldonado : Itinerario de un intelectual técnico = The Intinerary of a Technical Intellectual.
author: Escot, Laura

name: Mammen, Jeanne
item_t: Jeanne Mammen, 1890-1976. Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Merkert, Jörn, editor                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Döpping, Marga                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Klünner, Lothar et al.
public_note: A corpus of the artist's oeuvre in paintings, sculpture, drawings, gouaches, and watercolors.

name: Malevich, Kasimir Severinovich
item_t: Kazimir Malewicz … le peintre absolu.
author: Nakov, Andréi
public_note: While not a continuation of the catalogue raisonné (v. Nakov, 2002, listed in this database), this work acts as a supplement to that publication. The fourth volume contains an addendum to the catalogue raisonné, bibliographic references, and indices.

name: Magnum Photo
item_t: Magnum Photobook : The Catalogue Raisonné.

name: Magnasco, Alessandro
item_t: Alessandro Magnasco.

Muti, Laura                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            De Sarno Prignano, Daniele                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Martini, Egidio

name: Magnasco, Stefano
item_t: Stefano Magnasco : e la cerchia di Valerio Castello.
public_note:
The texts include an essay on the circle of Valerio Castello, a biographical profile of Magnasco with an analysis of the painted works, and essays on the different phases of his career. 

The appendices include a bibliography and index of artists.

name: Magnelli, Alberto
item_t: Alberto Magnelli : l'oeuvre peint : catalogue raisonné.
author: Maisonnier, Anne
public_note: There is a general documentary section that cites exhibition information, writings about the artist, a section on his illustrated books containing original graphics, references to illustrations of his work, and literature that mention his work.

name: Magistris, Simone de
item_t: Simone de Magistris : "picturam et sculturam faciebat" (1538/43-notizie 1611).
author: Amato, Pietro
imprint: Macerata : Fondazione Cassa di risparmio della Provincia di Macerata ; Campobasso : Lampo, 1996.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's paintings and sculptues, with separate catalogues for lost works, rejected attributions, and unlocated works. 

There is also a corpus of inscriptions, excerpts from documents related to the artist's life and work, a chronology of popes and bishops, notation of churches concerned with the artist,  and an iconographic repertory.

name: Magnelli, Alberto
item_t: Alberto Magnelli : les ardoises peintes : catalogue raisonné.
author: Maisonnier, Anne
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of Magnelli's paintings on slate.

name: Maffei, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Maffei.
author: Rossi, Paola

name: Maetzel-Johannsen, Dorothea
item_t: Dorothea Maetzel-Johnnsen : Leben und Werk.
author_s:
Zitzewitz, Doris von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buchholz, Jan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buchholz, Ruth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Flemming, Hanns Theodor                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ahlers-Hestermann, Friedrich                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bruhns, Maike (foreword)
public_note: The publication provides a mongraph of the artist written in cooperation with her grandson, Jan Buchholz. The catalogue also includes a complete list of her oil paintings.

name: Maggiolini, Giuseppe
item_t: Giuseppe Maggiolini : catalogo ragionato dei disegni.

name: Madrazo y Agudo, José de
item_t: José de Madrazo, 1781-1859.
author: Díez, José Luis
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Fundación Marcelino Botín in Santander and the Museo Municipal, Madrid.

The prologue is followed by various essays including a biography, and studies on the artist as a painter, draughtsman and engraver, and an essay on Madrazo and collecting.

The bibliography has a list of abbreviations ulitized for cited publications and periodicals.
The artist's original inventory of 1835 is reproduced, along with a genealogy of Madrazo's family.

name: Maggioni, Piero
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Piero Maggioni [Terzo volume, 1950-1995].

name: Maes, Nicolae
item_t: Studien zu den datierten Gemälden des Nicolaes Maes (1634-1693).
author: Krempel, León
public_note: Originally Presented as the author's dissertation Universität Bonn, 1998. Catalogue raisonné lists 354 authentic works, and with separate catalogues of doubtful and rejected attributions. Publication also reproduces examples of the artist's signatures.

name: Maele, Martin van
item_t: Martin Van Maele (1863-1926), ou, Le diable se cache dans les détails.
public_note: This is the catalogue of the artist's entire erotic work.  It includes all known etchings, his contributions to popular and bibliophile editions, and stand-alone pieces.

name: MacNair, Herbe
item_t: Doves and Dreams : The Art of Frances Macdonald and J. Herbert McNair.
author: Robertson, Pamela
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné is included in the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Hunterian Art Gallery at the University of Glasgow and the Walker Art Gallery in Liverpool.  

Additional essays by Annette Carruthers, Janice Holland, Juliet Kinchin and Joseph Sharples survey the contributions of Macdonald and McNair. Pamela Robertson compiled the catalogue raisonné.

name: Maddock, Bea
item_t: Bea Maddock : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery
imprint: Launcester, Tasmania : Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery, 2011-
public_note: The first volume of the multi-volume catalogue raisonné lists all 918 paintings executed between 1951-1983. The images are available on the accompanying CD-ROM.

name: Maella, Mariano Salvador de
item_t: Mariano Salvador Maella : vida y obra.
author: Morales y Marín, José Luis
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 208 paintings and 186 drawings by Maella, as well as 135 engravings after his works. The catalogue does not include drawings housed in the National Palace in Madrid, however.

name: Maella, Mariano Salvador de
item_t: Mariano Salvador Maella : poder e imagen en la España de la Ilustración.
author_s:
Mano, José Manuel de la                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fernández de Córdoba Maldonado, Isabel
public_note: Follwing an introduction, there are essays on the artist's cultural background and artistic training, plus studies covering his obligations as a court painter in "Enlightenment Spain", including allegorical frescoes, religious paintings, court portraits, and works for the royal tapestry factory.

name: Maggioni, Piero
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Piero Maggioni : [Primo volume].
author: Levi, Paolo
public_note:
Texts are in Italian with parallel English translations.  Preliminary essays, including a biographical note, are followed by a chronological catalogue of the work. 

There is also a critical anthology, a bibliography, exhibitions, a list of  collections housing the artist's works, a list of prizes, and a filmography.

name: Maggioni, Piero
item_t: Piero Maggioni : raccolta dei disegni.
author: Seveso, Giorgio
public_note:
The publication includes a discussion of Maggioni's drawings, a brief biography, exhibition lists, a filmography, bibliography, prizes, index of works and a critical anthology. 

The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's drawings from 1950-1995.

name: Maggioni, Piero
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Piero Maggioni : [Secondo volume].
author: Montalto, Domenico
public_note: Texts are in Italian with accompanying English translations.

name: Maella, Mariano Salvador de
item_t: Mariano Salvador Maella (1739-1819) : dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author: Mano, José Manuel de la
public_note: Texts are in Spanish and English, but the catalogue is only in Spanish. The catalogue is arranged by theme and lists over 400 authentic drawings, all illustrated in color.

name: Magini, Carlo
item_t: Carlo Magini.
author_s:
Zampetti, Pietro                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cleri, Bonita                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Battistini, Rodolfo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cucco, Giuseppe
public_note: In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes a biography of the artist, a bibliography, name index, and a chronology.  The catalogue raisonné of the portraits and religious paintings was compiled by Bontia Cleri; Giuseppe Cucco compiled the still life paintings.

name: Magnelli, Alberto
item_t: Magnelli collages : catalogue raisonné.

name: Magnelli, Alberto

author: Maisonnier-Lochard, Anne
public_note: This study was presented as the author's doctoral thesis at the Université Panthéon-Sorbonne.

name: Magnelli, Alberto
item_t: Magnelli : les estampes : catalogue raisonné.
author: Abadie, Daniel
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artists' approximately 100 prints, executed from 1934 until his death in 1971.  All works are illustrated in color.

name: MacMonnies, Frederick William
item_t: A Flight with Fame : The Life and Art of Frederick MacMonnies (1863-1937)…with a Catalogue Raisonné of Sculpture and a Checklist of Paintings by E. Adina Gordon.
author_s:
Smart, Mary                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gordon, E. Adina                                                            ;&nbsp

public_note: Adina Gordon, co-author of this study,  also wrote her Ph.D. thesis on the artist: "The Sculpture of Frederick William MacMonnies: A Critical Catalogue", New York University, 1998. A photocopy edition of this dissertation is available through U.M.I., Ann Arbor, MI (see entry in this database).

name: Mackennal, Bertram

public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Art Gallery of New South Wales and the National Gallery of Victoria, Melbourne, 2007-2008.

name: Mackintosh, Charles Rennie
item_t: Charles Rennie Mackintosh : The Complete Furniture, Furniture Drawings and Interior Designs.
author: Billcliffe, Roger
imprint: New York : Abrams in association with Cameron & Hollis, 2010.
public_note:
This is a complete catalogue of every surviving piece of Mackintosh furniture and all known drawings. The first edition of the work was printed in 1979 (Guilford: Lutterworth Press; New York: Taplinger). The fourth edition revises and updates the earlier editions of the catalogue.

In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes an introduction with a stylistic and biographical chronology, and essays on Mackintosh's job books and reproduction furniture.

name: Maclet, Elisée

name: Mack, Heinz
item_t: Mack : Skulpturen, 1953-1986.
author: Honisch, Dieter
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biography, and separate sections on the "Licht ist nicht Licht" series and the "Sahara" project.  

The catalogue also lists solo exhibitions, exhibitions with Zero Group, collaborative projects, and works in public collections.

For the  later work, see "Mack: Skulpturen 1986-2003" (cited in this database).

item_t: Benedetto Luti : l'ultimo maestro.
public_note: The catalogue gives title (or subject), date, technique, dimensions, location, inscriptions, provenance, exhibition and abbreviated bibliographical references, and long commentaries. Models or sketches are discussed in the corpus of the works to which they relate.

public_note: A catalogue raisonné of textiles and tapestries designed by Lurçat. The publication includes excerpts from the artist's writings and also references films.

name: Luttichuys, Simon

name: Luttichuys, Issac

name: Mack, Heinz
item_t: Mack : Skulpturen 1986-2003 = Sculptures 1986-2003.
author_s:
Mack, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rüth, Uwe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mack, Ute
public_note:
The publication is subtitled "Skulpturen im Raum von Licht und Zeit." The chronological catalogue raisonné is organized by theme: stelae, organic forms, geometric shapes, mirror/glass, and art in public spaces. The categories are further subdivided into groups: light, water, overall designs, funerary monuments, and works commissioned by road and highway authorities. 

There is a list of works arranged chronologically and alphabetically by title. The publication also contains lists of solos exhibitions since 1986, exhibitions of Group Zero from 1986, a bibliography of works published since 1986, and a list of works in public collections.

Works not included in the present catalogue (multiples, ceramic sculptures, etc.) will be the subject of a future publication.

name: Mack, Heinz
item_t: Ars Urbana : Public-Space Art, 1952-2008 / Heinz Mack.
author: Mack, Heinz
public_note:
This is a survey of over 50 years of the artist's work, listing over 100 projects for public spaces.  The catalogue includes monumental sculptures, mosaics, murals, reliefs and glass windows. Most of the photographs and all of the texts are by artist himself.

There is also biographical and bibliographical information, interview with Heinz Mack and an interview by Heinz Mack. The publication includes a supplement, documenting works not included in the two earlier catalogues raisonnés of the sculptures (see entries cited in this database).

name: Mack, Heinz
item_t: Heinz Mack : ZERO Malerei = ZERO Painting : Catalogue Raisonné 1956-1968.
author_s:
Fleck, Robert (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kletke, Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Derom, Edouard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weland, Bettina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Knop, Andrea                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mack, Heinz
imprint: Munich : Hirmer : Düsseldorf : Beck & Eggeling, International Fine Art, 2017.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné has parallel texts in German and English.  This monograph and catalogue covers only the early painted work of the artist's "ZERO" period from 1956-1968, which nonetheless serves as a vital key to his entire oeuvre.

name: Macdonald, France
item_t: Doves and Dreams : The Art of Frances Macdonald and J. Herbert McNair.
author: Robertson, Pamela
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné is included in the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Hunterian Art Gallery at the University of Glasgow and the Walker Art Gallery in Liverpool.  

Additional essays by Annette Carruthers, Janice Holland, Juliet Kinchin and Joseph Sharples survey the contributions of Macdonald and McNair. Pamela Robertson compiled the catalogue raisonné.

name: Macke, Augu
item_t: August Macke, die Skizzenbücher.
author: Heiderich, Ursula
public_note: The sketchbooks contain over 3,000 of Macke's drawings, which rarely have been exhibited or seen by the general public. The catalogue of the artist's sketchbooks contains biographical comments as well as an indication of where and when each sketchbook was used.

name: Macke, Augu
item_t: August Macke : Aquarelle Werkverzeichnis.
author: Heiderich , Ursula
public_note:
This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Westfälisches Landesmuseum für Kunst und Kulturgeschichte, Münster.

The catalogue raisonné lists 569 authentic watercolors and gouaches, most illustrated in b&w.

There is a concordance to Vriesen (1957), plus an appendix, concordance, and supplement to Heiderich's 1993 catalogue raisonné of the drawings: "August Macke Zeichnungen 
Werkverzeichnis," as well as a concordance to her earlier study on the Sketchbooks: "August Macke, die Skizzenbuecher" (1987).  

See also the 2008 publication: "August Macke: Werkverzeichnisse: Nachtrag…" (cited in this database), which further supplements this and other catalogues by the author.

name: Macke, Augu
item_t: August Macke, Zeichnungen : Werkverzeichnis.
author: Heiderich, Ursula
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue gives number, title, medium, dimensions, marks, date, location, exhibition and auction sale information, bibliographical references, and current location when known.  There are also some brief notes.
public_note: Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Macke, Augu
item_t: August Macke, Gemälde : Werkverzeichnis.
author: Heiderich, Ursula
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 594 paintings executed from 1906 to 1913.  The introductory material includes essays on the artist's life and carreer from his childhood and youth through the summer of 1914. This is followed by section with documentation, the catalogue raisonné, a concordance, a bibliography, lists of exhibitions and auction sales, and name indices.

name: Macke, Augu
item_t: August Macke : Werkverzeichnisse : Nachtrag zu den Werkverzeichnissen, August Macke, Die Skizzenbücher, Bd. I und II, Stuttgart 1987, August Macke Zeichnungen, Stuttgart 1993, August Macke, Aquarelle, Ostfildern 1997.
author: Heiderich, Ursula
public_note: This is a supplement to the author's earlier catalogues raisonnés on the drawings and watercolors (see entries cited in this database), and her study of the artist's sketchbooks: "Die Skizzenbücher," Bd. I & Bd. II, Stuttgart, 1986, which the present work also updates.

name: MacMonnies, Frederick William
item_t: The Sculpture of Frederick William MacMonnies : A Critical Catalogue.
author:
Gordon, 
Gordon, E. Adina
public_note:
From the author's Ph.D. Thesis, New York University, 1998.
N.B. Since hard copies of this study are photocopies reproduced from the original microfilm of the author's dissertation, the collation varies.

name: Luginbühl, Bernhard
item_t: Bernhard Luginbühl : Werkkatalog der Plastiken 1947-2002.
author_s:
Hesse, Jochen                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schweizerisches Institut für Kunstwissenschaft
public_note: From the series "Oeuvrekataloge Schweizer Künstler". The catalogue raisonné lists over 1,300 works, arranged by subject.

name: Lucas van Leyden
item_t: Pieter Brueghel the Elder and Lucas van Leyden : The Complete Engravings, Etchings, and Woodcuts.
author: Lavalleye, Jacques
public_note:
Other editions exist in German, French, Italian. The catalogue raisonné lists and illustrates 318 prints by van Leyden and 173 works by Pieter Brueghel the Elder. All engravings and woodcuts are reproduced in their exact dimensions, except those prints that are larger than the book itself. 
There is little critical apparatus with the illustrated catalogue of the individual prints, but there is a checklist of titles in the back.

name: Lucas van Leyden
item_t: The Paintings of Lucas van Leyden : A New Appraisal, with Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Smith, Elise Lawton
imprint: Columbia, MO : University of Missouri Press, 1992.
public_note:
Among the biographical issues addressed in the catalogue are the artist's disputed birth date and  his travels to the Southern Netherlands, where he encountered Albrecht Dürer and Jan Gossaert. The texts are supplement with exhaustive footnotes. The Appendix includes a discussion of Lucas van Leyden's appearance.

The catalogue raisonné lists 17 authentic works by van Leyden; now-lost works known only from the documentation; 16th-17th c. copies after van Leyen, which have been included with extant originals; and rejected works. The catalogue raisonné is organized by subject: Old Testament, New Testament, Saints, Portraits, History painting, and Allegorical genre painting; but the illustrations are arranged chronologically.

name: Lucas, Sarah
item_t: Sarah Lucas : Exhibitions and Catalogue Raisonné, 1989-2005.
author_s:
Dziewior, Yilmaz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ruf, Beatrix                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Coles, Sadie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Daly, Pauline
public_note:
The catalogue was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Kunsthalle Zürich, the Kunstverein in Hamburg, and the Tate Gallery Liverpool in 2005.  A German language edition was published concurrently.  

In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes various essays, a biography, and an interview with Sarah Lucas by Beatrix Ruf.

name: Lucas, Wilhelm
item_t: Willy Lucas, 1884 bis 1918 : Nachtragsband zum Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
author: Wandschneider, Andrea

name: López y Portaña, Vicente
item_t: Vicente López (1772-1850).
author_s:
Díaz, José Luis                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pérez Sánchez, Alfonso E.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of paintings, frescoes, miniatures, pastels, drawings and engravings, organized by subject. Catalogue includes lost, destroyed and rejected works.

name: Lösener, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Lösener : "-zu den ich-fernen Quellen…"
author: Hirner, Roswitha
public_note: Volume one includes early works, drawings, commentary, and an index. Volume two includes prints, essays on Albrecht Lösener, and texts written by the artist.

name: Lozowick, Lou
item_t: The Prints of Louis Lozowick : A Catalogue Raisonné.

name: Louis, Mo
item_t: Morris Louis (1912-1962) Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Estate of Morris Louis
cronology:
The paintings and drawings catalogues are in chronological order, but as Louis kept no records of his paintings, some works are ordered according to stylistic analysis.  A separate section reproduces 17 experimental works that Louis had ordered destroyed (and consequently are not considered part of his official oeuvre), but were preserved for study purposes. There is also a list of works known only through documentation. 

The scholarly apparatus of the catalogue includes title, date, catalogue (DU) number, Morris Louis Estate number, copyright, references, medium, exhibitions, provenance, comments, and inscriptions.  All works are reproduced with scalable color images. 

The search function of the database is extremely thorough, with various query fields allowing for great flexibility in identifying and locating works within the catalogue.  

The publication also includes a title list with number concordance, a biography, sections considering the paintings and drawings, exhibition history, bibliography, and a list of public collections housing the artist's work. 
This information is followed by material dealing with the archives, the conservation foundation, and a documentary film clip on the life and art of Morris Louis.
ind_entr_cont: Launched in 2014, this is the artist's official website and catalogue raisonné, developed and authorized by The Estate of Morris Louis, The Marcella Brenner Revocable Trust, The Morris Louis Art Trust, The Estate of Marcella Brenner, and Diane Upright Fine Arts.  The Maryland Institute College of Art (MICA), Louis' alma mater, is the administrator of the website, which will be continually updated. The website is free.

name: López Polanco, André

name: Lucas, Wilhelm
item_t: Willy Lucas, 1884 bis 1918 ; Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the paintings was published on the occasion of a retrospective exhibition held in Paderborn at the Städtische Galerie Am Abdinghof, the Museum für Stadtgeschichte, and the Städtische Galerie in der Reithalle.  The catalogue raisonné also  includes texts by Paul Imhof, Silke Köhn, Barbara Link, and Markus Runte.

name: Luce, Maximilien

                                                            Bazetoux, Denise                                                            ;&nbsp

public_note: This catalogues mostly the artist's oils and gouaches, plus some information on the ceramic work. There also is a section on attributed works. The catalogue includes a genealogy of the Luce-Bouin family. Volumes 1 and 2 are in French and English; vol. 3 (2005) is in French only. author: Upright, Diane
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists more than 650 extant paintings by the artist. The publication includes extensive commentary on the development of Morris' materials and techniques, as well as problems of dating and the correct orientation of his works.

name: Lotto, Lorenzo
item_t: L'opera completa del Lotto.
author_s:
Palluchini, Rodolfo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Canova, Giordana Mariani Canova

name: Lorrain, Claude
item_t: Claude Lorrain : The Drawings.
author: Roethlisberger, Marcel
imprint: Berkeley, CA : University of California Press, 1968.
public_note:
The introductory texts discuss Claude's stylistic development, with a separate discussion of his drawings in albums. 

The chronological catalogue raisonné includes 1,129 authentic drawings, 44 questionable attributions, and numerous drawings by other masters.

name: Lorrain, Claude
item_t: Claude Lorrain : The Paintings.
author: Roethlisberger, Marcel
public_note:
This is a revised edition of the 1961 catalogue published by Yale University Press. The current publication includes a preface and "Further paintings by Claude discovered after 1961".
The catalogue covers frescoes, oil paintings cited in the Liber Veritatis, and accepted works  not included in the Liber, etc. There is also a concordance with Smith's 1837 catalogue of works.

name: Lorrain, Claude
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Claude Lorrain.
author: Roethlisberger, Claude
public_note: The text of this catalogue raisonné has been completely revised and updated from the 1977 edition (which in turn was a translation from an earlier Italian language edition published as "Opera completa di Claude Lorrain).

name: Lorck, Melchio
item_t: Melchior Lorck.
author_s:
Fischer, Erik                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bencard, Ernst Jonas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rasmussen, Makael Bøgh                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Iuliano, Marco
imprint: Copenhagen : The Royal Library ; Vandkunsten Publishers, 2009-
public_note:
Project to be completed in five volumes, of which only the first four have been published to date.
Volume 5: Catalogue raisonné, part two, will contain the catalogue of paintings, drawings, graphic work, and architecture (see entry cited in this database).

name: Loo, Jacob van
item_t: Jacob van Loo : 1614-1670.
public_note: This study documents 150 acknowledged works by the artist.  The catalogue also includes drawings with convincing attributions, which are an important addition to the study of the artist's oeuvre.

name: Loos, Adolf
item_t: Adolf Loos, Leben und Werk.
public_note: This is a second revised edition of the author's 1982 publication (see entry in this database).

name: Loos, Adolf
item_t: Adolf Loos : Leben und Werk.

name: Loos, Adolf
item_t: Adolf Loos : opera completa.
public_note: This is essentially a comprehensive guide to Loos' work. The publication also includes statements by the architect.

name: Longoni, Emilio
item_t: Emilio Longoni : catalogo ragionato.
author: Ginex, Giovanna

name: Longueil, Joseph de
item_t: Joseph de Longueil, graveur du roi (1730-1792) : sa vie, son oeuvre.
author: Panhard, Félix
public_note: An additional subtitle reads, "Illustrée d'un portrait par P. Adolphe Varin et d'une suite de reproductions de gravures."

name: Lorenzetti, Pietro
item_t: Pietro Lorenzetti.
author_s:
Volpe, Carlo                                                            ;&nbsp

author: Eisenberg, Marvin

name: Lorrain, Claude
item_t: The Etchings of Claude Lorrain.
author: Mannocci, Lino
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 1988.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes multiple essays dealing with the artist's life, his graphic works and copperplates.  There is also a  discussion of Lorrain's famous series "Feux d'artifice" ("Fireworks").   The Appendix includes information on watermarks.

name: Lotti, Betto
item_t: Betto Lotti, 1894-1977: l'opera completa.
author: Longatti, Alberto

name: Longhi, Pietro

item_t: Roberto De Longe.
author: Arisi, Ferdinando (ed.)
imprint: Piacenza : Fondazione di Piacenza e Vigevanao, 2012.
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist with documents related to his life. This is followed by a series of texts by various authors dedicated to different aspects of De Longe's career, his students and followers, his works in Piacenza, and critical fortunes.  This is followed by a catalogue of works as well as technical notes on painting by Roberto De Longe.

name: Longhi, Pietro
item_t: Disegni di Pietro Longhi.
author: Pignatti, Terisio

                                                            Dowson, Sir Philip (foreword)
imprint: London : Cygnus Arts ; Cranbury, NJ : Fairleigh Dickinson University Press, 1998.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of 280 finished paintings, including unlocated works, arranged chronologically. Not all works are illustrated. 

The catalogue does not include oil studies unless related to specific oil paintings, nor does it include "domestic scale" paintings that the artist produced for the commercial market.

name: Lomi, Aurelio
item_t: Aurelio Lomi : maniera e innovazione.
author_s:
Ciardi, Roberto Paolo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Galassi, Maria Clelia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Carofano, Pierluigi
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is organized chronologically, but lost, untraceable, and erronously attributed works are catalogued by place.  This is followed by a section with documents, a bibliography, indices of color and b&w illustrations, and a name index.

name: Longaretti, Trento
item_t: Longaretti : catalogo generale della pittura.
author: Pirovano, Carlo (ed.)

name: Lomi, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Lomi : le trasparenze del Novecento.

name: Lojen, Gerhard
item_t: Gerhard Lojen : Werke, 1955-2000.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Neue Galerie am Landesmuseum Joanneum Graz.  The publication also contains works by Lojen's students.

item_t: Richard Paul Lohse : Drucke : Dokumentation + Werkverzeichnis = Prints : Documentation + Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Richard Paul Lohse-Stiftung                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lohse James, Johanna                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weidler, Felix

Richard Paul Lohse-Stiftung                                                            ;&nbsp

name: Lombardi, Pietro

author: Luciani, Roberto

name: Liu, Ye
item_t: Liu Ye - Catalogue Raisonné 1991-2015.
author: Noe, Christoph (ed.)
public_note: The publication also contains a conspectus which contains: year, title, date, medium, size, Chinese translation, provenance, exhibitions, literature, and comments.

name: Loir, Luig
item_t: Luigi Loir, 1845-1916 : peintre de la Belle Époque à la publicité.
author: Willer, Noé
imprint: Carmel, CA : Classic Art Gallery, Nebojsa Calic, 2004-
public_note: This catalogue includes a biographical essay. All information is in French and English. The publication contains sections on Loir's art in advertising, his World's Fair participation in 1900, literary illustrations, and chromolithography.

name: Loewensberg, Verena
item_t: Verena Loewensberg, Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik 1941-1986.
imprint: Zurich : Graphische Sammlung der ETH Zürich, 2009.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the graphic works was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Graphische Sammlung der ETH Zurich.

name: Loewensberg, Verena

author_s:
Coray Loewensberg, Henriette                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Holliger, Renate
public_note: Published in conjunction with the Schweizerisches Institut für Kunstwissenschaft (SIK).  The catalogue lists more than 630 paintings by the artist.

name: Llorens Artigas, Josep
item_t: Llorens Artigas : catalogue de l'oeuvre personnel et créations avec Dufy, Marquet, Miró.
author_s:
Miralles, Francesc                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Llorens Gardy, Mariette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Salgado, Gabriela
imprint: Barcelona : Fondation Llorens Artigas ; Paris : Cercle d'art, 1993.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 1,000 of the artist's ceramics executed 1927-1972.

name: Ljuba
item_t: Ljuba (Popvic) : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Tronche, Anne
public_note: The text is translated from the French.

name: Liss, Johan
item_t: Johann Liss : A Monograph and Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Klessmann, R?diger
public_note: Translated from the German.

name: Lissitzky, El
item_t: El Lissitzky : The Jewish Period.
author_s:
Kantsedikas, Alexander                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Drutt, Matthew (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gruber, Yeshayahu (ed.)
public_note: Much of the Russian modernist's mature art is known, but little has appeared about his early work devoted to Jewish subjects (1905-1923).

name: Lipshitz, Lippy
item_t: Lippy Lipshitz ; a Biographical Commentary, Documentation of the Years 1903-1968 with a Catalogue Raisonné of Sculptures.
author: Arnott, Bruce Murray

name: Lippi, Lorenzo
item_t: Lorenzo Lippi.
public_note: The book is divided into five chapters which chart Lippi's life and artistic development.  The texts are followed by a catalogue raisonné of paintings and drawings. The book also contains a list of documented but untraced works, primary source documents, and a bibliography.

name: Lippi, Filippo
item_t: Fra Filippo Lippi : Life and Work, with a Complete Catalogue.
author: Ruda, Jeffrey
imprint: London : Phaidon Press ; New York : Abrams, North American distributor, 1993.
public_note:
Following the main critical text, there is an appendix dealing with the drawings and draughtmanship.  

The catalogue raisonné lists the paintings (including uncertain attributions), illustrated in b&w. There is also an illustrated  catalogue of the drawings; a section of source documents (some in translation) which also includes two facsimile reproductions; a bibliography; and indices of works and locations.

name: Lippi, Filippino
item_t: Filippino Lippi.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the authentic works, the publication includes Vasari's biography of the artist and a separate catalogue of lost works.

name: Lippi, Filippo
item_t: Filippo Lippi : catalogo completo.
public_note: From the series "Biblioteca d'arte". This study includes essays, a modern critical history of the artist's work. The catalogue raisonné mentions attributed works.

name: Lingner, Max
item_t: Max Lingner : Werkverzeichnis 1898 bis 1931/2.
author_s:
Sent, Eleonore                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Freundeskreis Max Lingner                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Galerie der Stadt Kornwestheim
public_note: The publication accompanied an exhibition of the artist's work titled "Max Lingner - Frühzeit und Frankreich" at the Museum im Kleihues-Bau.

name: Lindemann-Frommel, Karl
item_t: Karl Lindemann-Frommel (1819-1891) : ein Malerleben in Rom : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis seines graphischen und malerischen Schaffens.
author: Freude, Peter K.W.
imprint: Murnau am Staffelsee : Verlag P. Freude, 1997.

name: Lindtmayer, Daniel, II
item_t: Daniel Lindtmayer, 1552-1606/07. Die Schaffhauser Künstlerfamilie Lindtmayer.
author: Thöne, Friedrich
public_note: Volume 2 from the series "Oeuvrekataloge Schweizer Künstler". The catalogue is divided into three sections: the first part deals with autograph, lost, copied, and misattributed works; the second part contains the remaining works including paintings, stained glass, woodcuts and engravings; the third covers work by the artis'ts forebears and other family members.

name: Liotard, Jean-Étienne
item_t: L'opera completa di Liotard.

name: Lindner, Richard
item_t: Richard Lindner : Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings, Watercolors and Drawings.
public_note: he catalogue raisonné is chronological, and then further divided by thematic and iconographical criteria.  The appendices contain lists of early works.

name: Lilloni, Umberto
item_t: Umberto Lilloni : catalogo ragionato dei dipinti e dei disegni.
author: Lilloni, Renata
public_note:
The author is the artist's daughter. The catalogue includes a biography of the artist by Renata Lilloni and an essay by Rossana Bossaglia.

The catalogue of paintings and drawings is chronological by year, within that time frame works are organized by theme: figures, landscapes, still-lifes, and abstract compositions.

name: Llorens Artigas, Josep
item_t: Joan Miró, Josep Llorens Artigas : Ceramics : Catalogue Raisonné 1941-1981.
author_s:
Punyet Miró, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gardy Artigas, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calero Fernández, Cristina
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of 441 ceramic works made by the artist between 1941 and 1981.  The catalogue includes an essay by the ceramist Joan Gardy Artigas, son of  Josep Llorens Artigas.  The ceramics catalogue raisonné is a sequel to the four-volume catalogue of his prints, the six volumes of paintings, and the volume of his sculpture.

name: Linard, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Linard, 1597-1645 : catalogue de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Nusbaumer, Philippe
public_note: The catalogue of the paintings includes dated works, paintings signed but not dated, paintings neither signed nor dated, uncertain attributions, paintings mentioned in inventories and sales catalogues, and works close to the artist [in style].

name: Lobo, Baltasa
item_t: Lobo. Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre sculpté.
public_note: The catalogue was established with the close collaboration of the artist.

name: Ligabue, Antonio
item_t: Ligabue : catalogo generale dei dipinti.
public_note: The book includes four essays, a catalogue of works, and a biography of the artist. The texts have been translated into English. The catalogue raisonné of the paintings is organized chronologically from 1928 to 1962.

name: Lievensz., Jan
item_t: Jan Lievens : Friend and Rival of the Young Rembrandt : With a Catalogue Raisonné of His Early Leiden Work 1623-1632.
author: Schnackenburg, Bernhard
public_note: This monograph and catalogue raisonné lists Lievens' paintings, drawings and etchings from his early years in Leiden.  In addition to the 245 catalogued works, the publication includes examples of Jan Lievens' works after 1632, a separate catalogue of works by Dirk Lievens, and a section on rejected works.

name: Ligabue, Antonio
item_t: Tutto Ligabue (Zurigo 1899-Gualtieri 1965) : catalogo ragionato dei diptini/catalogazione ufficiale a cura di Augusto Agosta Tota e Marizio Dell'Acqua; prefazione de Vittorio Sgarbi.
author_s:
Agosta Tota, Augusto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dall' Acqua, Marzio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sgarbi, Vittorio (preface)
public_note: The catalogue is published under the auspices of the Comune di Gualtieri, the Museo documentario Antonio Ligabue, and the Centro studi & archivio Antonio Ligabue di Parma.

name: Liotard, Jean-Étienne
item_t: Dessins de Liotard : suivi du catalogue de l'oeuvre dessiné.
author: Herdt, Anne de
imprint: Paris : Réunion des musées nationaux : Geneva : Musée d'art et d'histoire, 1992.
public_note: Published on in conjunction with exhibitions held at the Musée d'art et d'histoire, Geneva and Musée du Louvre, Paris 1992.

name: Liotard, Jean-Étienne
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

imprint: Bilbao : BBK, Fundación Bilbao Bizkaia Kutxa, 2009.
public_note: The publication catalogues 406 plaster casts created between 1911-1973. The present volume complements and completes Alan G. Wilkinson's 2 volume publication, "The Sculpture of Jacques Lipchitz. A Catalogue Raisonné" (London: Thames and Hudson, 1996).

name: Lione, Andrea d
item_t: Andrea de Leone : (Napoli 1610-1685) : dipinti - disegni.
author: Di Penta, Miriam
public_note: The publication includes separate catalogues raisonnés of the drawings and prints.   There is also a documentary chronology, a bibliography, and name and place indices.

name: Liotard, Jean-Étienne

author_s:

                                                            Hofstetter, Bodo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Boeckh, Hans
public_note: Catalogue entries list related works, engravings after original works, provenance, and comments.

public_note: Published on the occasion of a retrospective traveling exhibition of the prints, posters and illustrations at the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C. See also the revised and updated edition covering Lichtenstein's work through 1997 (New York: Hudson Hills Press, 2002) cited in this database.

name: Lichtenstein, Roy

author_s:
Corlett, Mary Lee                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fine, Ruth E. (introduction)
imprint: New York : Hudson Hills Press, in association with the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C., 2002.
public_note: Second revised edition of the 1994 catalogue of Lichtenstein's prints created 1948-1997. The revised and expanded edition includes 350 prints by the artist, all illustrated in color.

author_s:

Libera, Adalberto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Trento, Museo provinciale d'arte.

                                                            Morris, Mary (chronology)

public_note: The chronological catalogue raisonné lists works by title, with date, medium, edition information, and information on works in public collections. There is no critical commentary.

name: Lépicié, Nicolas Bernard

public_note: Each section includes an additional list of uncertain/doubtful attributions. Only a handful of the works are illustrated.

                                                            Thuillier, Jacques (preface)

name: Lépine, Stanisla
item_t: Stanislas Lépine, 1835-1892 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 810 authentic paintings by the artist, of which 671 are illustrated.

name: Liebermann, Max
item_t: Max Lieberman : sein graphische Werke = The Graphic Work, 1876-1923.
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsky Fine Arts, 1991.
public_note: Reprint of the 1934 German edition, with corrections and some titles and terms translated into English by Marion Doebeling, plus some new illustrations.

name: Leyster, Judith
item_t: Judith Leyster : A Woman Painter in Holland's Golden Age.
author: Hofrichter, Frima Fox
public_note: Based on the author's dissertation, Rutgers University, 1979.  The catalogue raisonné lists 48 authentic works. There are also separate catalogues of problem works, lost works, and misattributed paintings. The appendix includes the 1668 inventory of Jan Miense Molenaer, Leyster's husband, in Dutch and English.

name: Léger, Fernand
item_t: Fernand Léger : The Complete Graphic Work.
imprint: Yorktown Heights, NY : Blue Moon Press, 1978.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 142 authentic prints.

name: LeWitt, Sol
item_t: Sol LeWitt Prints Catalogue Raisonné, 1947-2006.
cronology: Individual entries include title, paper type, date, paper and image dimensions, media, edition size, signature and inscription information, publisher, and printer.  All works are illustrated with scalable (mostly color) images.
public_note: It can be searched chronologically, by subject, medium, publisher, dimensions, title, and keyword.

name: Légaré, Joseph

author_s:
