                                                            Cloutier, Nicole                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Trudel, Jean
public_note: Catalogue raisonné includes catalogue of an exhibition held by the National Gallery of Canada. Translation of the French edition.

name: Lewis, Wyndham
item_t: Wyndham Lewis : Paintings and Drawings.
public_note:
The catalogues raisonnés of the paintings and the drawings and watercolors are arranged chronologically. There are also separate catalogues of pictures of unknown medium and addenda. The catalogue lists 127 authentic paintings and 1219 drawings by the artist. 

The appendix contain a list of exhibitions with a list of the works shown, with reprints of essays from the exhibition catalogues.  Documents include lists of works and notes by the artist, and information on Lewis' works sold from the Crossland Collection in 1956.

name: Léandre, Charle
item_t: Charles Léandre (1862-1934).
imprint: Montreuil-Bellay : Edition Buron : Musée Léandre, 1990 (1996 printing).
public_note: The catalogue also bears the title "Charles Léandre : sa vie, son oeuvre."

author: Delteil, Loys

name: LeWitt, Sol
item_t: Sol LeWitt Wall Drawings Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology: The catalogue raisonné documents over 1,351 wall drawings, comprising 1,785 distinct artworks and approximately 3,500 installations.  Nearly every first installation of each wall drawing is illustrated by an archival photograph and additional photographs of subsequent installations.
ind_entr_cont: Catalogue entries have full captions for each drawing and diagrams for those that have them.  Information includes exhibition history, bibliography, current collection, installation history, notes, medium, and wall drawing number, as well as current and previous titles.
public_note: Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

public_note: This volume contains a list of paintings by location, which includes the recently attributed paintings.  It also contains a list of solo exhibitions, a bibliography of exhibition catalogues, a title index, and a list of public collections housing Léger's works.

name: Liebermann, Max
item_t: Max Liebermann, 1847-1935 : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde und Ölstudien.
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue, the book provides extensive bibliographical information, writings by the artist, biographical literature, and press listings. There is a chronological index of exhibitions and an alphabetical register of the works by title and motif.  Examples of the artist's signatures are provided, arranged chronologically.

The catalogue raisonné gives number, title, date, medium and support, signature information, collection, provenance, exhibition information when available, and references. The notes provide information regarding comparative works and references to works in other media.

name: Levin, Julo
item_t: Julo Levin 1901-1943 : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Baumeister, Annette

name: Lewis, Martin
item_t: Martin Lewis : The Graphic Work.
author: McCarron, Paul
public_note:
McCarron's first catalogue raisonné of the artist's prints, published in conjunction with a retrospective exhibition at the Kennedy Galleries (April 11-28, 1973). 

The catalogue raisonné includes 142 prints, only a small number of which are illustrated. See also the 1995 revised and expanded publication cited in this database.

name: Lewis, Martin
item_t: The Prints of Martin Lewis : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: McCarron, Paul
public_note: Revised and augmented edition of McCarron's first catalogue raisonné, with a concordance to the 1973 catalogue (cited in this database).  Appendices concern eight unidentified plates attributed to Lewis, the artist's test plates, plus his two essays on printmaking techniques.

name: Levis, Giuseppe de
item_t: Joseph de Levis & Company : Renaissance Bronze-founders in Verona.
author: Avery, Charles
imprint: London ; New York : Philip Wilson Publishers, an imprint of I.B. Tauris & Co., Ltd., 2016.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the bronzes, the publication includes a biography, as well as chapters on aspects of bell casting, imagery, and collaborations with Angelo de Rossi.  There is also a discussion of the family's critical fortunes.

name: Levieux, Reynaud
item_t: Reynaud Levieux et la peinture classique en Provence : Nimes,1613-Rome, 1699.
imprint: La Calade, Aix en Provence: Edisud, 1990.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the book contains an essay on the artist's life and critical fortunes and a discussion of Levieux's contemporaries.  There is also a section on documents, a genealogy and a note on the artist's signatures.

name: Lermite
item_t: Lermite, 1920-1977 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint et de l'oeuvre graphique.
author_s:
Vay, Marie-Claire                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vay, Pier-Angelo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bouhéret, Roland (preface, foreword)
imprint: Hauterive, Switzerland : Fondation Lermite : Gilles Attinger, 1987.
illustrations: 80 b&w and color plates, ca. 1594 b&w ills. within the catalogue
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes almost all of the drawings and paintings that could be inventoried and photographed, but the catalogue raisonné does not claim to be exhaustive. Certain early (small format) works that were lost or have changed title are not included. Cartoons for stained glass and studies for engraving also are not included.

name: Le Sidaner, Hen
item_t: Le Sidaner : l'oeuvre peint et gravé.
author_s:
Farinaux-Le Sidaner, Yann                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Le Sidaner, Rémy (preface)
illustrations: 1,282 b&w and color within the catalogue
public_note:
A new monograph": "Henri Le Sidaner, paysages intimes"  by the same author was published by Monelle Hayot Editions, 2013.
While not a revised c.r., readers may want to consult the new publication for further information and unpublished documents discovered since publication of the original catalogue.

name: Lepic, Ludovic Napoleon
item_t: Ludovic Napoleon Lepic (1839-1889) : Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre et biographie.
author: Zimmer, Thierry
public_note: This monograph and catalogue was presented as the author's unpublished doctoral thesis at the Sorbonne in Paris (written under the direction of Bruno Foucart).

name: Lesage, Augustin
item_t: Augustin Lesage : 1876-1954.
public_note: The catalogue was issued in conjunction with an exhibition held in Arras, Béthune, Lausanne, Florence, and Cairo. In addition to the thematic essays and the catalogue raisonné, there is a chronology and a thorough bibliography.

name: Le Scouëzec, Maurice
item_t: L'Oeuvre dessiné, peint et gravé de Maurice Le Scouëzec, 1881-1940.
author: Le Scouëzec, Gwenc'hlan
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was written by the artist's son.

name: Le Sueur, Eustache
item_t: Nouvelles recherches sur la vie et les ouvrages d'Eustache Le Sueur / avec un catalogue des dessins de Le Sueur.
public_note: There are also separate sections dealing with drawings and engravings.  The latter include engravings after Le Sueur's paintings and those executed after this death.  The catalogue raisonné of drawings was compiled by Montaiglon.

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: All the Paintings of Leonardo da Vinci.
author: Baroni, Constantino
public_note: The catalogue includes a brief biography and a separate catalogue of lost works and paintings attributed to Leonardo. The publication also includes a genealogy and a section on "Selected Criticism".

name: Le Sueur, Eustache
item_t: Eustache Le Sueur : 1616-1655.
author: Mérot, Alain
public_note: This is the first edition of the catalogue raisonné.  A revised and expanded edition was published in 2000 (see entry cited in this database).

name: Lenbach, Franz Seraph von
item_t: Franz von Lenbach : Leben und Werk.
author: Baranow, Sonja von
public_note: Essentially a monographic study that reproduces all of Lenbach's known paintings. The publication includes an essay on the artist's life, as well as a discussion of his artistic development, materials and techique.

name: Le Nain, Mathieu
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint des Le Nain.
author: Rosenberg, Pierre

name: Le Nain, Lou
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint des Le Nain.
author: Rosenberg, Pierre

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Leonardo da Vinci.
author_s:
Ettlinger, L.D. (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ottino Della Chiesa, Angela
public_note: A translation of "L'opera completa di Leonardo pittore" (Rizzoli, c1967), with an introduction by Mario Pomilio.

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: L'opera completa di Leonardo pittore.
author_s:
Pomilio, Mario (pres.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ottino Della Chiesa, Angela (c.r)
public_note: This book is reissued as part of the series "Classici dell'arte: nuova serie".

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Marani, Pietro C.
public_note:
The author's citation of dates and documents relies almost exclusively on those in Beltrami's  "Documenti e memorie riguardanti la vita e le opere di Leonardo da Vinci" (Milan: Fratelli  Treves, 1919).  

See also Marani's larger publication from 2000 "Leonardo da Vinci: The Complete Paintings"  (cited in this database). The catalogue was also reprinted in 2003 (New York: H.N. Abrams).

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo : tutta la pittura.
author: Béguin, Sylvie
public_note:
Individual works are discussed throughout the text by different contributors. The catalogue lists 21 paintings by the artist, all illustrated in color. 

The publication also includes a list of important biographical dates for the artist and a complete bibliography.

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo da Vinci : The Complete Paintings.
public_note: English translation from the Italian, "Leonardo, una carriera di pittore."  The catalogue discusses 34 paintings, and there is a lengthy catalogue dedicated to Leonardo's drawings  There is a checklist of paintings at the end of the book that includes provenance, bibliography and commentary.

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo da Vinci.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers Leonardo's paintings, drawings, manuscripts and "collections". The publication is subtitled "Artist, Scientist, Inventor".

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo da Vinci Painter : The Complete Works.
author: Villa, Giovanni Carlo Federico

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo da Vinci, 1452-1519 : The Complete Paintings and Drawings.
illustrations: numerous b&w, color ills., some color plates
public_note: This new edition of Zöllner's earlier published studies on Leonardo's work contains a new preface.  The 2015 edition was issued in a smaller format than the 2007 publication (see entry in this database).

name: Leonardo da Vinc
item_t: Leonardo da Vinci, 1452-1519 : The Complete Paintings and Drawings.
illustrations: numerous b&w and color ills, some color plates
public_note: There is also an extensive section of the catalogue dedicated to Leonardo's drawings, organized by theme.

name: Leonelli, Luca
item_t: Luca Leonelli : catalogo ragionato dell'opera grafica.
author_s:
Parmiggiani, Sandro                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Leonelli, Luca                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bertelli, Carlo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fanelli, Franco
public_note: The texts are bilingual, but the catalogue is in Italian.  The catalogue includes several essays by the artist:

name: Leoni, Ottavio
item_t: Ottavio Leoni (1578-1630) : eccellente miniator di ritratti : catalogo ragionato.
author: Primarosa, Yuri
public_note: This is the first catalogue to fully study the artist's entire oeuvre.  Many of the subjects have been identified due to documents newly discovered in the Roman archives.

name: Lepcke, Ferdinand
item_t: Ferdinand Lepcke (1866-1909) : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Heise, Nancy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kähler, Susanne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weschenfelder, Klaus
imprint: Coburg : Coburger Landesstiftung ; Kunstsammlungen der Veste Coburg, 2012.
public_note: This is the catalogue of the exhibition "Ferdinand Lepcke (1866-1909)- Weiblicher Akt und Körperideal" held at the Kunstsammlungen der Veste Coburg and the Kunstgussmuseum Lauchhammer (Coburg).

name: Leonilson, José
item_t: Leonilson, catalógo raisonné = Leonilson, Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Dias, Ana Lenice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Clemente, Gabriela Dias
public_note: This chronological catalogue has 3,400 records documenting the artist's work in all media (drawings, paintings, embroideries, preparatory studies, scenarios, costume designs, installations, projects, etc.). Works are illustrated with color thumbnail images.

name: Lepère, Auguste Lou
item_t: Catalogue Raisonné de l'Ouevre Gravé de Auguste Lepère.
author_s:
Lotz-Brissonneau, A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Texier-Bernier, G.M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Letheve, J.
imprint: Dijon : Editions de l'Echelle de Jacob, 2002.

name: Le Sueur, Eustache
item_t: Eustache Le Sueur : 1616-1655.
author: Mérot, Alain
public_note: Individual entries provide number, title, related works, comments, information on sources and iconography, provenance, bibliography, and exhibitions.

name: Leutze, Emanuel
item_t: Emanuel Leutze, 1816-1868 : Freedom is the Only King.
author_s:
Groseclose, Barbara S.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Taylor, Joshua C. (Introduction)
imprint: Washington, D.C. :  Smithsonian Institution Press, for the National Collection of Fine Arts, 1975.
public_note: An appendix includes a list of American painters working in Düsseldorf in chronological order of their arrival.

name: Leutze, Emanuel
item_t: The Life and Works of Emanuel Leutze.
author: Stehle, Raymond L.
public_note: This is an expanded edition of the author's 1972 manuscript of the same title.  Although not strictly a catalogue raisonné, this is a copy of author's typscript text, sourced mainly from docments and archives in the Library of Congress.

name: Lempicka, Tamara de
item_t: Tamara Lempicka Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Blondel, Alain
cronology: Individual entries list title, date, dimensions, inscriptions and artists' marks, comments, provenance, auction history (if applicable), and  sitter information.
ind_entr_cont:
The catalogue raisonné updates the author's earlier publication (see entry cited in this database).  There is a brief biography of the artist in English and Italian. 

The catalogue includes all paintings and works on paper by the artist arranged chronologically. The author also lists and illustrates 45 "unidentified" paintings and drawings, but provides no critical apparatus for those works.
public_note: check_needed

name: Le Nain, Antoine
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint des Le Nain.
author: Rosenberg, Pierre

name: Lempicka, Tamara de
item_t: Tamara de Lempicka : catalogue raisonné, 1921-1979.
author: Blondel, Alain
public_note: Documents 520 paintings and 220 drawings and watercolors by the artist. A CD-ROM accompanies the catalogue.  There is a documentary chronology, a glossary of names cited in the text with some biographical information, and a list of themes found in Lempicka's works.  The appendix also includes the artist's former addresses, all with references to relevant documents and related works of art.

name: Lemoyne, Jean-Lou
item_t: Une dynastie de sculpteurs au XVIIIe siècle. Les Lemoyne, par Louis Réau. Biographie et catalogue critiques, l'oeuvre de l'artiste.
author: Réau, Louis
public_note: Entries include: title, material, signature and date, salon, engravings, provenance, exhibitions and sales, and comments.

name: Lemoyne, Jean-Baptiste, the Younge
item_t: Une dynastie de sculpteurs au XVIIIe siècle. Les Lemoyne, par Louis Réau. Biographie et catalogue critiques, l'oeuvre de l'artiste.
author: Réau, Louis
public_note: Entries include: title, material, signature and date, salon, engravings, provenance, exhibitions and sales, and comments.

name: Lemmen, George
item_t: Georges Lemmen (1865-1916) : monographie générale suivie du catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé.
author: Cardon, Roger
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's lithographs, posters and other prints. The publication includes a genealogy of Lemmen's family. There also is a bibliography, name index, and list of illustrations.

name: Lemoyne, Jean-Baptiste, the Elde
item_t: Une dynastie de sculpteurs au XVIIIe siècle. Les Lemoyne, par Louis Réau. Biographie et catalogue critiques, l'oeuvre de l'artiste.
author: Réau, Louis
public_note: Entries include: title, material, signature and date, salon, engravings, provenance, exhibitions and sales, and comments.

name: Lemoine, Jacques Antoine Marie
item_t: Jacques-Antoine-Marie Lemoine (1751-1824).
author: Jeffares, Neil
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published as an entire issue of the "Gazette des beaux-arts", Feb., vol. CXXXV, no. 1561, pp. 61-136.  The article is in English, but the abstract is in French.

name: Le Moyne, Franço
item_t: François Le Moyne and His Generation, 1688-1737.
author: Bordeaux, Jean-Luc
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné includes a biography of the artist, an essays on Le Moyne's career and critical reception. The publication contains separate catalogues of paintings and drawings.  The catalogue of paintings includes lost works, tentative attributions, and rejected works. The catalogue of drawings includes lost works, tentative attributions, doubtful attributions, and rejected drawings.  

The book also includes a chronology, bibliography, exhibition list, and illustrates examples of Le Moyne's signatures.

name: Le Marchand, David
item_t: David Le Marchand 1674-1726 : An Ingenius Man for Carving in Ivory.
author: Avery, Charles
illustrations: 101 b&w, plus 16 plates in b&w and color
public_note: Published on occasion of an exhibition held at the National Gallery of Scotland, the British Museum, and the Leeds City Art Gallery.

name: Le Lorrain, Robe
item_t: Robert Le Lorrain (1666-1743).
author: Beaulieu, Michèle
public_note: Although a monograph, this is the most extensive study on the artist's works to date, containing a chronology of events of the artist's life and a sequence of works.

name: Lehmphul, Hans-Reinhard
item_t: Hans-Reinhard Lehmphul : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis der Gemalde.
author: Ohnesorge, Birk
public_note:
The publication includes texts on the artist's art and life by Hans-Wolf Jäger and Guido Boulboullé, and a critical essay by Marion Thielebein.  

The catalogue raisonné of the paintings was compiled by Birk Ohnesorge and Sabine Schellhorn.

name: Leheutre, Gustave
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Lehmann, Léon
item_t: Léon Lehmann, 1873-1953 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Gevin, Yves
public_note: The publication includes a biography and text by the artist. There are also selected texts on Lehmann and his art by his contemporaries, including artists Georges Rouault and Jean Puy, and art critics Georges Besson and Louis Vauxcelles.

name: Lehmbruck, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Lehmbruck : Gemälde und grossformatige Zeichnungen.
author: Lahusen, Margarita C.
illustrations: ca. 250 b&w, ca. 76 b&w and color plates
public_note: The present publication is a revision of the author's doctoral dissertation for the Universität Bonn, 1989.

name: Lehmann, Hen
item_t: Henri Lehmann, 1814-1882 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
author: Aubrun, Marie-Madeleine
imprint: Paris : Association les Amis de Henri Lehmann, 1984.
public_note: Published "avec le concours du Centre national des Lettres."  Dated paintings are listed first, then undated works, decorative works and preparatory studies, followed by dated and undated drawings, and drawn portraits. The catalogue raisonné gives number, title, size, location, history, exhibitions, references, and cross references to related works. There also is a list of museums and public collections housing the artist's work.

name: Legueult, Raymond Jean
item_t: Raymond Legueult : 1898-1971 : catalogue raisonné biographique.
author: Leviel-Legueult, Christian
public_note: N.B. in 2018 "Les amis de Raymond Legueult" also launced an online website in French for the artist, with a section for a catalogue raisonné. It is classified by chronlogical periods (roughly decades) and has apparatus, however, there are no indices or search aides, readers may access this via the web : www.legueult.com.

name: Legrand, Lou
item_t: Louis Legrand : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: This catalogue raisonné of the graphic works was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Félicien Rops Provincial Museum, Namur.

name: Legnani, Stefano Maria
item_t: Stefano Maria Legnani "Il Legnanino".
author: Dell'Omo, Marina
public_note: This is a catalogue of the artist's paintings, with a discussion of the graphic works.  In addition to the catalogue of authentic paintings, the publication lists  lost or unidentified works.  There is also a chronological register of the work, appendices, a bibliography, and name and place indices.

name: Lehmbruck, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Lehmbruck : Catalogue raisonné der Skulpturen, 1898-1919.
author: Schubert, Dietrich
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers only sculptures in tinted plaster, tinted stone castings, stucco, terracotta, and bronze that were produced during the artist's lifetime.

name: Lehmbruck, Wilhelm
item_t: Die Druckgraphik von Wilhelm Lehmbruck : Verzeichnis.
author: Petermann, Erwin
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 200 etchings and lithographs by the artist.

name: Le Gac, Jean
item_t: Et le peintre : tout l'oeuvre roman, 1968-2003.
author: Le Gac, Jean
public_note:
The publication is an imaginative monograph and catalogue raisonné by the artist himself. 

Written in the style of a journal, the artist includes handwritten notes describing the creative thinking that went into individual works. The book is illustrated with hand painted watercolors by the artist himself.

name: Lederer, Jörg
item_t: Jörg Lederer, ein Allgäuer Bildschnitzer der Spätgotik.
author_s:
Dussler, P. Hildebrand                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Müller, Theodor                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schädler, Alfred
illustrations: some color ills.; 8 leaves of plates, map
public_note: A second revised edition was published in 1982.

name: Lecuona Echániz, Antonio María de
item_t: Antonio María Lecuona (1831-1907) : pionero del costumbrismo vasco.
author: Lecuona, Antonio María
imprint: Bilbao : Bilboko Arte Ederren Museoa - Museo de Bellas Artes de Bilbao, 2015.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Museo de Bellas Artes de Bilbao.  The catalogue is in Spanish, but the introduction is also in Basque.

name: Le Corbusie
item_t: Oeuvre lithographique : Le Corbusier.
author: Weber, Heidi (ed.)
imprint: Zurich : Centre Le Corbusier, Heidi Weber, 1966
public_note: This catalogue was also reprinted  in second and third editions, in 1972 and 1976 respectively.

name: Lega, Silvestro
item_t: Lega : l'opera completa.
public_note:
This publication includes an introduction, critical essay, and profile of the artist's life and career.
The second volume contains the complete chronological catalogue of the works, including works whose location in unknown.

name: Le Corbusie
item_t: Oeuvre complète : Le Corbusier.
author_s:
Boesiger, Willy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stonorov, Oscar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bill, Max                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Le Corbusier                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jeanneret, Pierre
public_note:
A fundamental reference for architects. This is a chronological account of Le Corbusier's buildings, projects, and sketchbooks, plus writings. 

Numerous editions of this catalogue have been published under varying imprints, with many of the respective volumes being reissued at various dates.

name: Lebourg, Albe
item_t: Albert Lebourg.
imprint: Paris : Editions des Galeries G. Petit, 1923.
public_note: The catalogue is followed by sections with indices listing names of collectors, lists of paintings, watercolors and drawings, as well as a list of prints.

name: Le Corbusie
item_t: Le Corbusier, oeuvre tissé.
author_s:
Mathias, Martine (text & catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mathey, François (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Davy, d'Annick (introduction)
public_note:
Catalogue of Corbusier's wall hangings and tapestries. The catalogue gives signature and edition information, dates, dimensions, identifies the studio or weaver (which can differ) and names of the sponsors, and lists if a later weaving was done with relevant dates.
There are some comments when available.

name: Le Corbusie
item_t: Le Corbusier : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically, and all works are illustrated in color. The supplement includes works known only from the documentation. Individual entries also list auction sales.

name: Lebasque, Hen
item_t: Henri Lebasque : catalogue raisonné.
author: Bazetoux, Denise
public_note: A second volume is currently in preparation (see entry cited in this database).

name: Leblanc, Walte
item_t: Walter Leblanc : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Leblanc, Nicole                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Everarts De Velp-Seynaeve, Danielle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bussche, Willy Van den
public_note: Texts are written in French, Dutch, German, and Spanish, but the catalogue is in French.  Instructions to the catalogue are also given in English.

name: Leblanc, Walte
item_t: Walter Leblanc : Addenda au catalogue 1.
author_s:
Leblanc, Nicole                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Everarts De Velo-Seynaeve, Danielle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chafik, Géraldine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Michiels, Baudouin
imprint: Antwerp : Ludion ; Brussels : Fondation Walter et Nicole Leblanc, 2011.
public_note: This is the first addendum to the 1997 catalogue raisonné, which includes works missing from the first volume of the catalogue.   There is also an updated bibliography and Appendix.

name: Lawrence, Thoma
item_t: Sir Thomas Lawrence : A Complete Catalogue of the Oil Paintings.
author: Garlick, Kenneth
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of approx. 900 works, mostly portraits, arranged alphabetically by sitter.  All works are illustrated with a black and white thumbnail.

name: Leal Audirac, Fernando
item_t: Fernando Leal Audirac: obra de 1975 a 1993.
author_s:
Fernando Leal Audirac                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Arturo Gonzales Coslo
imprint: Mexico City: Espejo de Obsidiana Ediciones, 1993.
public_note: Text in Spanish and English and illustrated with drawings. Texts by Richard Brettell, Juan Acha, Jorge Juanes, Ernesto de la Peña, Alberto Hjar, Arturo Gonzalez Coslo.

name: Lawrence, Jacob
item_t: Jacob Lawrence : The Complete Prints (1963-2000) : A Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Seattle, WA : Francien Seders Gallery, in association with the University of Washington Press, 2005.
public_note:
This is a revision and expansion of the 1993 exhibition catalogue "Jacob Lawrence : Thirty Years of Prints (1963-1993)" by the same authors and publishers (1994, isbn 0295973579, Bellevue Art Museum, Washington).

This updated edition adds numerous prints not included in the earlier publication.

name: La Villéon, Emmanuel de
item_t: Emmanuel de la Villéon, 1858-1944 : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
La Villéon, Emmanuel de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cointat, Michel (preface)
public_note:
There is an introduction with biography, but the publication is chiefly illustrations, which give number, title, date, dimension and collection information and refer to the repertory (Nomenclaure des tableaux repértoriés) that appears in the first part of the volume. 
Some exhibition information is provided, but no critical comments nor bibliographical references are given.

name: Lawrence, Thoma
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Laxeiro
item_t: Laxeiro: José Otero Abeledo (1908-1996).
author: Caruncho, Luis María
imprint: A Coruña, Spain : Fundación Pedro Barrié de la Maza, 2008.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné published in conjunction with the exhibition,"Laxeiro. La lógica de lo irraciona," Vigo, Coruña, Fundación Pedro Barrié de la Maza. The catalogue is organized chronologically and is chiefly illustrations. The book is accompanied by a CD-ROM.

name: Lazzaro, Walte
item_t: Catalogo generale dell opere di Walter Lazzaro.
author_s:
Levi, Paolo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Corsi, Adriano                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grassi, Gabriele
public_note: Each volume begins with a biography of the artist followed by the catalogue of works listed in chronological order. Volume 1 covers paintings from 1925-1989 and includes a chapter with testimonies and quotes about the artist. Volume 2 includes paintings that were not published in Vol. 1, and includes drawings, watercolors and sketches executed 1931-1988. Volume 3 covers all remaining unpublished works in all media executed 1921-1989.

name: Lawrence, Jacob
item_t: The Complete Jacob Lawrence.
author_s:
Nesbett, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            DuBois, Michelle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ellis-Smith, Stephanie
imprint: Seattle : University of Washington Press, in association with Jacob Lawrence Catalogue Raisonné Project, 2000.
public_note: The catalogue entries include title, date, medium and support, dimensions, signature information, provenance, exhibition history, comments, and references. All works are illustrated.

name: Le Brun, Charle
item_t: Charles Le Brun : premier peintre du roi Louis XIV.
author_s:
Gareau, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Beauvais, Lydia (with assistance of)
public_note: An English language edition "Charles Le Brun: First Painter to King Louis XIV" was also published by Harry N. Abrams, New York, 1992 (translation by Katrin Sermat, ISBN 0810935678). The format of this study is more in the nature of a monograph (see in-process entry cited in this database).

name: Le Corbusie
item_t: Le Corbusier : Furniture and Interiors 1905-1965.
imprint: Paris : Fondation Le Corbusier ; Zurich ; Scheidegger & Spiess, 2012.
public_note:
This catalogue encompasses all of Le Corbusier's design elements, decorative works, and interiors, which were excluded from the eight-volume catalogue raisonné.  Also excluded are Le Corbusier's "objets-types," which are addressed in the catalogue essays. French and German language editions were published simultaneously.

The catalogue is arranged chronologically by periods of partnerships, covering Le Corbusier's early designs, collaborative design projects with Pierre Jeanneret and Charlotte Perriand; and later works from 1940 to his death in 1965.

name: Le Clerc, Sébastien
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Sebastien le Clerc.
author: Jombert, Charles Antoine
public_note: The title continues, "Chevalier romain, dessinateur et graveur du Cabinet du Roi, disposé par ordre historique, suivant l'année où chaque piece a été gravée, depuis 1650 jusqu'en 1714.  Avec la vie de ce celebre artiste."

name: Lee, Sydney
item_t: Sydney Lee : Prints : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Meyrick, Robert
public_note: The texts include a preface, foreword, and an introduction on the artist, followed by a catalogue raisonné.

name: Lavier, Bertrand Bégnine
item_t: Bertrand Lavier : photographie : tentative de catalogue raisonné 1969-2016.
public_note: This is a "proto-catalogue raisonné" of all of the artist's photographic works.   The catalogue includes an interview of the artist by Hans Ulrich Obrist, Curator and co-Director of the Serpentine Gallery, London.

name: Lauvray, Louis-Alphonse-Abel
item_t: Catalogue raisonné du peintre Abel Lauvray (1870-1950).
author_s:
Jaubert,  Yves                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jaubert, Lionel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hoog, Michel (preface)
imprint: Paris : Les Amis du peintre Abel Lauvray : Éditions de l'Amateur, distributor, [1991].
public_note: The catalogue includes a bilingual essay (French and English).  The catalogue lists 749 paintings, all illustrated in black and white.  Some works are also reproduced in color.

name: Laurencin, Marie
item_t: Marie Laurencin : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé.
author: Marchesseau, Daniel
public_note: Texts are in Japanese, but the list of the artist's prints, including book illustrations are in French.

name: Laurana, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Laurana : ein Bildhauer der Frührenaissance.
author: Kruft, Hanno-Walter
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication provides an in-depth biography of the artist, and documents related to the artist's life and work (presented in the original language).

name: Lausen, Uwe
item_t: Uwe Lausen : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde 1961-1969.
author_s:
Lausen, Uwe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Niggl, Selima                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Harzer, Jens
public_note: Published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibition held at various German venues. The sound disc "Hier und jetzt 1968" contains a collection of aphorisms by the artist.

name: Lauer, Nikolau
item_t: Der Pastellmaler Nikolaus Lauer 1753-1824 : Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Wiercinski, Thomas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dreesen, Josef                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lagerwaard, Cornelieke
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Museum St. Wendel, Mia-Münster Haus, Germany. The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Thomas Wiercinski follows a brief biography of the artist and other texts.

name: Laurencin, Marie
item_t: Marie Laurencin, 1883-1956 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Marchesseau, Daniel
imprint: Nagano-ken, Japan : Éditions du Musée Marie Laurencin, 1986-1999.
illustrations: v.1: 1334 b&w; 28 color; v.2: 1667 b&w, 16 color
public_note: Entries include signature, dimensions, media, provenance, collection, exhibition, and references. There are no critical comments.

name: La Tour, Georges du Mesnil de
item_t: Georges de La Tour.
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the texts include a brief biography of the artist and a stylistic analysis of his paintings. The catalogue
also has essays on La Tour's signature style, copies after La Tour, and misattributed works.

There are also excerpts from the critical writings on Georges de la Tour from the 17th to the early 20th centuries, and a list of documents related to his life and work.

name: Lastman, Piete
item_t: Pieter Lastman : sein Leben und seine Kunst : ein Beitrag zur Geschichte der hollandische Malerei im XVII. Jahrhundert.
author: Freise, Kurt
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the paintings and drawings is arranged by genre, chronologically, and by location.  There is a separate section of copies after originals by Pieter Lastman.

name: Lastman, Piete
item_t: Pieter Lastman : Studien zu Leben und Werk mit einem kritischen Verzeichnis der Werke mit Themen aus der antiken Mythologie und Historie.
author: Seifert, Christian Tico
public_note:
This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of Pieter Lastman's mythology and history paintings. The catalogue raisonné is divided into authentic works; attributed works; copies after lost works; and works known only from documents.

The Appendix includes Lastman's inventory, a list of his books, and references to Lastman and his artworks in contemporarary sources.

name: La Tour, Georges du Mesnil de
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Georges de la Tour.
author: Thuillier, Jacques
public_note: This is a new updated edition of  "L'opera completa di Georges de la Tour", first published in Italian in 1973 (a German language edition was also published in the same year).

name: Lasne, Jean
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Jean Lasne.
author_s:
Henry, Françoise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lasne, Collette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dorival, Bernard (preface)
public_note: This is a comprehensive catalogue of Lasne's works in all media, including paintings, sculptures, and works on paper. Introductory notes and a poem by Gabriel Begin, a poet and childhood friend of Lasne, are followed by a brief chronology. Appendices include a bibliography, an exhibition list, a list of catalogues, a short essay by Lasne entitled "Jeunes peintres," and a reproduction of a newspaper review of Lasne's work.

name: La Tour, Georges du Mesnil de
item_t: Georges de La Tour : catalogo completo dei dipinti.

name: Largillierre, Nicolas de
item_t: Largillierre.
imprint: Paris : les Beaux-Arts, Édition d'études et de documents, 1928.
public_note: Individual entries include title, dimensions, some exhibitions, signature information, and collection.  Most works are not illustrated.

name: Lapicque, Charle
item_t: Charles Lapicque : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint et de la sculpture.

name: Lanyon, Pete
item_t: Peter Lanyon : Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil Paintings and Three-dimensional Works.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 613 works, nearly all illustrated in color.

name: Lapicque, Charle
item_t: Charles Lapicque : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre complet des lithographies, eaux fortes et gravures.
author_s:
Balanci, Bernard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Auger, Elmina (text)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Blache, Georges (preface)

name: Laroon, Marcellus, the younge
item_t: Marcellus Laroon.
author: Raines, Robert
imprint: London : Paul Mellon Foundation for British Art, in association with Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1967.
public_note: Includes a "Catalogue of paintings and drawings by Marcellus Laroon".

name: Larsson, Carl
item_t: Carl Larsson : grafiska verk, en komplett katalog = Graphic Works, a Complete Catalogue = graphische Werke, ein kompletter Katalog = oeuvres graphiques, un catalogue complet.
author_s:
Brummer, Hans Henrik (preface )                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hjert, Bertil                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hjert, Gunnel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hjert, Svenolof
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the etchings and lithographs. Texts are given in Swedish, English, German, and French. The publication includes an original etching by the artist.

name: La Tour, Georges du Mesnil de
item_t: Georges de la Tour.
author: Thuillier, Jacques
public_note: The publication includes various essays and introductory texts, documents, and a chronological catalogue of the complete oeuvre.  This French language edition was also issued in a revised printing in 1997.

name: La Tour, Maurice Quentin de
item_t: La Tour : la vie et l'oeuvre de l'artiste.
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-Arts, édition d'études et de documents, [1928].
public_note: Individual catalogue entries cite number, title (given in upper case if authentic, lower case if doubtful or not seen by the author), dimensions, notes, bibliographical references, exhibitions, and collection information.

name: La Tour, Maurice Quentin de
item_t: Maurice-Quentin de La Tour : prince des pastellistes.
public_note: The most complete compilation to date of Quentin de la Tour's artistic production, although not a catalogue raisonné per se.

name: Laub, Heinz-Otto
item_t: Heinz-Otto Laub : wirklich - phantastisch : Gemälde und Graphiken 1958 bis 2012.
author: Körner, Carl (foreword)

name: La Tour, Maurice Quentin de
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Laubser, Maggie
item_t: Catalogue Raisonné of Maggie Laubser's Work, 1900-1924.
author: Delmont, Elizabeth Cherly
illustrations: numerous b&w ills., some color plates
public_note: This was the author's master's thesis for Witwatersrand University, Johannesburg.  A pdf of the full text is available (see link on this page).

name: Lane, Fitz Henry
item_t: Fitz Henry Lane.
author: Cape Ann Museum
cronology: The catalogue raisonné can be searched through a variety of different rubrics. Users can filter searches by medium, decade, Cape Ann locales, vessel type, vessel activities (in distress, wrecks, etc), subject, Maine locales, and seasons/weather.
public_note: Catalogue entries are illustrated with scalable color images.  The critical apparatus includes title, inventory number, date, inscriptions, comments, provenance, exhibitions and references.  Entries also include marks, labels, inscriptions, supplementary and related works, as well as related historical materials.

name: Laubser, Maggie
item_t: Maggie Laubser : Her Paintings, Drawings and Graphics.
author: Marais, Dalene
public_note: This study is essentially divided into two sections. The first part features a chronological account of the artist's life.  The second part is a catalogue raisonné of all works that have been traced (with the exception of sketchbooks and some loose sketches).  There is also a list of exhibitions 1909-1980.

name: Lange, Reinhard
item_t: Der Ergänzungsband Reinhard Lange. Druckgraphik 1958-1998.
public_note: This is a supplement to the first volume, "Werke 1952-2004."

name: Lange, Reinhard
item_t: Störungen : Werke 1952-2004.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with the Landschaftsverband Hameln-Pyrmont e.V.

name: Langetti, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovanni Battista Langetti : il principe dei tenebrosi.
author: Mantovanelli, Marina Stefani
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes a biography of Langetti and analysis of his style. The catalogue raisonné of authentic works is chronological, with a separate section on collaborative works.  There is also a catalogue of works known only from documentation, lost paintings, and doubtful works.

The index lists works by location, and the appendices contain documents related to the artist's life and career.

name: Landerer, Albe
item_t: Bilder Basler Bändelherren : der Historienmaler Albert Landerer (1816-1893) und seine Auftraggeber.
author_s:
Gaier, Martin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Catania, Laura                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dössegger, Myriam

name: belenda Zapata, Manuel
item_t: Manuel Abelenda : (1889-1957).
author: Adolfo de Abel Vilela
imprint: Fundacio´n Pedro Barrie de la Maza

name: Lampugnani, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovan Francesco e Giovan Battista Lampugnani : devozione e classicismo nell'arte lombarda del Seicento.
author_s:
Palamidese, Vannina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Olivari, Mariolina (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Alberti, Alessia (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Morganti, Carol (essay)
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné is divided into separate sections covering authentic works (signed and/or documented), attributed works, and rejected works. The drawings and graphic works sections also include engravings after works by Giovan Francesco and Giovan Battista Lampugnani; lost and unlocated works are also listed.

The appendices include a discussion of the Lampugnani family and an essay on the contributions of Mastro Giacomo, plus bibliographic information and sources.

name: Lam, Wifredo
item_t: Wifredo Lam : oeuvre gravé et lithographié : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition organized by the Musée du dessin et de l'estampe en l'Arsenal de Gravelines.

name: Lam, Wifredo
item_t: Wifredo Lam : Catalogue Raisonné of the Painted Work.
author_s:
Laurin-Lam, Lou                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lam, Eskil (co-author, v.2)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Borràs, Maria-Lluisa (Cat. rais)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dumas, Roland et al.
public_note: Individual entries cite reference number, year, title, medium and support, dimensions, signature information, date, provenance, exhibitions, references, and comments.

name: Lam, Wifredo
item_t: Wifredo Lam : Catalogue Raisonné ; Prints = estampes = gráfica= ban hua.
author_s:
Lam, Eskil                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tonneau-Ryckelynck, Dominique                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dolega-Ritter, Dorota
public_note: The chronological catalogue lists 402 works (prints, etchings, lithographs, and silkscreens), all reproduced in color.  Each entry includes number, title (in brackets if chosen by someone other than the artist), date, medium, dimensions, and impressions (trial and state proofs are indicated).  It also includes respective editions, print runs within each edition, printer, publisher, date, and collection.

name: Lalique, René
item_t: René Lalique, 1860-1945, maître-verrier : analyse de l'oeuvre et catalogue raisonné.
author: Marcilhac, Félix
public_note:
This catalogue of Lalique's glasswork published in 1989 has been updated and expanded in subsequent editions (1994, 2004, 2011). The third edition, issued in 2004 (1,064 pp., ISBN 2859174028), catalogues and illustrates some 4,000 works.

The 4th updated edition is in English, titled "René Lalique, 1860-1945: Master Glassmaker: Analysis and Catalog Raisonné of the Work on Glass" (ISBN 9782859175108, 2011).

name: Lancret, Nicola
item_t: Lancret : biographie et catalogue critiques.
imprint: Paris : les Beaux-Arts, Édition d'études et de documents, 1924.
public_note: The catalogue gives number, title, (references to illustrations), and critical information if the work is a pendant, etc.  It also provides some production information, provenance, exhibitions, sale information, and bibliographical references.

name: Lalique, Suzanne
item_t: Suzanne Lalique-Haviland : le décor réinventé : 1892-1989.
author: Ferrer, Jean-Marc
public_note:
The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Musée des Beaux-Arts, Limoges and the Museé Lalique, Wingen-sur-Moder. 

The artist is the daughter of glass artist, René Lalique, and the present catalogue raisonné covers her early drawings for René Lalique's glass designs, her designs for Theodore Haviland's porcelains, as well as her own paintings.  The publication contains discussions of Lalique's interior decoration, textile designs, paintings, decorations at the Comédie française, plus scenographic designs for the theater and the opera.

name: Lairesse, Gérard de
item_t: Gérard de Lairesse (1640-1711).
public_note: The catalogue is arranged according to medium. The appendix lists attributed works, paintings mentioned known only from the literature, and rejected works.

name: Laloy, Yve
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre d'Yves Laloy.
public_note: The DVD-ROM contains all illustrations of works as listed in the hardcover book, in chronological order. There are 394 files describing the paintings, drawings, and objects (disc not seen by IFAR).

name: Lajoüe, Jacques de, II
item_t: Lajoüe et l'art rocaille.
public_note: The present publication is based on the author's doctoral thesis.  The catalogue includes a biography of the artist, a study of  his milieu and artistic career, and a discussion of La Joüe's place French art during the first third of the 18th century.  Additional information is supplied regarding patrons and Lajoüe's  rapport with the amateur scientific community of the society of artists.   There are indices, but cross references to the illustrations are poor and not comprehensive.

name: Landeck, Armin
item_t: Armin Landeck : The Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints.
public_note:
This is the second, revised and enlarged edition of the catalogue. The publication lists 164 prints and states, with a list of awards and honors received by Landeck. 

The first edition, dated 1977 and bearing the same title (Bethlehem, CT : June 1 Gallery), presented Landeck's essay, "Handling the Burin and the Needle," and listed only 127 prints and states.

name: Lampugnani, Giovanni Francesco
item_t: Giovan Francesco e Giovan Battista Lampugnani : devozione e classicismo nell'arte lombarda del Seicento.
author_s:
Palamidese, Vannina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Olivari, Mariolina (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Alberti, Alessia (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Morganti, Carol (essay)
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné is divided into separate sections covering authentic works (signed and/or documented), attributed works, and rejected works. The drawings and graphic works sections also include engravings after works by Giovan Francesco and Giovan Battista Lampugnani; lost and unlocated works are also listed.

The appendices include a discussion of the Lampugnani family and an essay on the contributions of Mastro Giacomo, plus bibliographic information and sources.

name: dam, Jame
item_t: The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam.
author: King, David
imprint: Oxford ; Boston : Butterworth-Heinmann, in Association with the University of Stirling, 1991.
public_note:
Entries include drawings, plans and photographs. The catalogue is organized by type of project. A revised and expanded edition was published in 2001 (see entry cited in this database). 

Alternate titles are 'The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam: Built and Unbuilt' and 'The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam and Unbuilt Adam.'

name: dam, Jame
item_t: The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam & Unbuilt Adam.
author: King, David N.
imprint: Oxford ; Boston : Architectural Press; Published in Association with the University of Stirling, 2001.
public_note:
Revised and expanded edition of the 1991 catalogue raisonné. Catalogue is organized by type of building project. The publication also includes plans and photos for over 100 of the architects' unbuilt works. 

Published under the alternate title, "The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam: Built and Unbuilt."

name: dam, Robe
item_t: The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam.
author: King, David
imprint: Oxford ; Boston : Butterworth-Heinmann, in Association with the University of Stirling, 1991.
public_note:
Entries include drawings, plans and photographs. The catalogue is organized by type of project. A revised and expanded edition was published in 2001 (see entry cited in this database). 

Alternate titles are 'The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam: Built and Unbuilt' and 'The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam and Unbuilt Adam.'

name: Lance, George
item_t: George Lance : Victorian Master of Still Life.
imprint: London : Philip Wilson Publishers, an imprint of I.B. Tauris & Co., Tld., 2016.
ind_entr_cont: The works are dispersed throughout the essays. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, exhibiton history, and minimal commentary.
public_note: Exhib. Hist; Comments

name: dams, Clinton
item_t: A Meticulous Serenity : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints of Clinton Adams, 1948-1997.
imprint: Albuquerque : University of New Mexico Press, 2012.
public_note: The catalogue is published in cooperation with the University of New Mexico Art Museum and the Clinton Adams Fund.

name: Laganne, Jeanne
item_t: Laganne : catalogue raisonné.
author: Gautier, J.F.
public_note:
The book is available as an ebook or in print version. The catalogue includes the artist's paintings, graphic works, drawings, and posters. 

The publication includes examples of the artist's signature, exhibitions, bibliography, and a list of her writings.

name: dam, Robe
item_t: The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam & Unbuilt Adam.
author: King, David N.
imprint: Oxford ; Boston : Architectural Press; Published in Association with the University of Stirling, 2001.
public_note:
Revised and expanded edition of the 1991 catalogue raisonné. Catalogue is organized by type of building project. The publication also includes plans and photos for over 100 of the architects' unbuilt works. 

Published under the alternate title, "The Complete Works of Robert and James Adam: Built and Unbuilt."

name: Laing, Gerald
item_t: Gerald Laing : Prints & Multiples, a Catalogue Raisonné.

name: Laing, Gerald
item_t: Gerald Laing : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Knight, David (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Findlay, Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Livingstone, Marco                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ingram, Lyndsey
imprint: London : Estate of Gerald Laing in assoc. with Lund Humphries, 2017.
public_note: A complete a catalogue of the artist's paintings and sculptures, covering all respective periods of his work.  Separate Appendices cover the Pre-Pop Paintings, Commercial Designs, Kinkell Castle (the artist's home), Mobile Paintings, Prints, and Tapestries.  It is fully illustrated with complete apparatus including a chronology, an exhibition list, and a list of public collections.

name: Lafrérey, Antoine
item_t: Ant. Lafreri Formis Romae : der Verleger Antonio Lafreri und seine Druckgraphikproduktion.
author: Rubach, Birte
public_note: Appendices include a chronology, indexes of prints, themes, sources, a bibliography, and genealogy of the artist.

name: La Fresnaye, Roger de
item_t: Roger de La Fresnaye.
author: Seligman, Germain
public_note:
The original edition was published by Ides et Calendes in Switzerland, 1969. 
In addition to the introductory essays, biographical notes, and a small section on drawings, there is an appendix that includes the artist's 1913 essays, "On Imitation in Painting and Sculpture" and "Paul Cézanne".
The text of the catalogue raisonné is in French, it is arranged chronologically, the critical comments are brief.

name: Lack, Richard F.
item_t: Richard F. Lack Catalogue Raisonné Website.
cronology: The catalogue documents works from 1943 to 1998, divided into sections by category (early years, landscapes, portraits, outdoor genre, etc.)  or by chronology.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné is available, although it is still in preparation.

name: Lafrensen, Niclas, the younge
item_t: [Lavreince] Les gravures françaises du XVIIIe siècle, ou catalogue raisonné des estampes, eaux-fortes, pièces en couleur, au bistre et au lavis, de 1700 à 1800 : Fasc.1: Nicolas Lavreince.
author: Bocher, Emmanuel
imprint: Paris : Librairie des bibliophiles et D. Morgand et C. Fatout, 1875-
public_note: Catalogue of graphic work of the Swedish born artist active in Paris in the later part of the 18th C. (the other fasicules  covering the work of Chardin, Lancret, Saint-Aubin, Moreau le jeune are not listed here).

name: Lafrensen, Niclas, the younge
item_t: Lavreince.
author: Lespinasse, Pierre
public_note: An early attempt at a catalogue raisonné of the artist's works.  The catalogue raisonné is organized alphabetically, and is divided into three parts: paintings, gouaches, watercolors, and drawings; miniatures of various subjects; and portrait miniatures.

name: Lada-Maciagowa, Malgorzata
item_t: Malgorzata Lada-Maciagowa, 1881-1969.
author: Michalec, Danuta
public_note: This study has Polish text and a small essay in English. It states that is is not a complete collection catalogue, but does list the most valuable works, covering paintings, drawings, sketches, glass windows, and designs.

name: Lacombe, George
item_t: Georges Lacombe, 1868-1916 : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is biography of the artist and a list of exhibitions. The catalogue also illustrates examples of the artist's signature.

name: Lack, Richard F.
item_t: Richard F. Lack : Catalogue Raisonné 1943-1998.
author_s:
Christensen, Gary B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gjertson, Stephen A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weisberg, Gabriel F.
public_note: An influential teacher and originator of the genre "Classical Realism", the artist produced over 1,300 works in his lifetime, including paintings, studies, drawings, watercolors, etchings, and woodcuts (most of which are reproduced in this catalogue).  The catalogue was compiled by Gary Christensen.

name: Lacaze, Germaine
item_t: Germaine Lacaze.

name: Labille-Guiard, Adélaïde
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Laboureur, Jean Emile
item_t: Catalogue complet de l'oeuvre de Jean-Émile Laboureur.
author: Laboureur, Sylvain
imprint: Neuchâtel, Switzerland : Éditions Ides et Calendes, 1989-1991.
public_note: The publication includes articles written by Laboureur.

name: Labille-Guiard, Adélaïde
item_t: Adélaide Labille-Guiard, 1749-1803 : biographie et catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre.
author: Passez, Anne-Marie
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 150 paintings in oil, pastels, miniatures, and drawings; not all works are illustrated. There is a separate catalogue listing 32 unlocated works cited in public sales and 6 rejected works housed in public collections.

name: Labisse, Félix
item_t: Labisse : catalogue de l'oeuvre peint, 1927-1979.
public_note: The catalogue lists 766 paintings, nearly all illustrated. Includes lists of illustrated books, sets and costumes (including designs never used), plus a filmography. Introduced by photos of his notable acquaintances, including other artists, directors and actresses.

Grützmacher, Curt                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Spielmann, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kirsch, Sarah
public_note: The study includes essays, an autobiography, exhibitions, bibliography, and a catalogue of the work.

name: Kühl, Ingo

author_s:
Ku¨hl, 	Ingo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Spielmann, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ernst, Rainer W.                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Smith, Nanci
public_note: Limited edition of 300 copies.

name: Laage, Wilhelm

author: Hagenlocher, Alfred
public_note: Part of series "Hans-Thoma Gesellschaft."

name: Kuwasseg, Joseph

author: Celedin, Gertrude
public_note: The introductory material includes a foreword, essays, printed work done for Kuwasseg's publisher, early landscapes, notes, color plates, biographical data, and bibliographical references.

name: Kusama, Yayo

Davis, Richard A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kuniyoshi, Sara M.
