public_note: Comments

name: Kane, John
item_t: John Kane, Painter.
public_note: "Skyhooks: The Autobiography of John Kane, as Told to Marie McSwigan."

name: Kane, Paul
item_t: Paul Kane's Frontier; Including Wanderings of an Artist Among the Indians of North America, by Paul Kane.
author: Harper, J. Russell
imprint: Austin : Published for the Amon Carter Museum, Fort Worth, and The National Gallery of Canada, by the University of Texas Press, 1971.
public_note: Edited with a biographical introduction and a catalogue raisonné by J. Russell Harper.

name: Kanoldt, Alexande
item_t: Alexander Kanoldt, 1881-1939 : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
author: Koch, Michael
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist, a bibliography, an exhibition list, and name and title indices.

name: Kaminski, Max G.
item_t: Max Kaminski.
author: Hergott, Fabrice

name: Kameke, Egon von
item_t: Egon von Kameke 1881-1955 : Werkverzeichnis.
author: Bergerhoff, Renate
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is an introductory essay, biographical data, a listing of one man and group exhibitions, and a list of plates.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Wassily Kandinsky : Life and Work.
author: Grohmann, Will
public_note: While not the definitive catalogue raisonné, this monograph remains a standard reference work, with a catalogue of the artist's oil paintings.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Kandinsky : das graphische Werk.
author: Roethel, Hans Konrad

name: Kalaizis,
item_t: Making Sky : eine Monografie mit Werkverzeichnis 1995-2009 = A Monograph with Catalogue Raisonné 1995-2009.
author_s:
Huhn, Tom                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Keller, Christoph                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lorenzen, Max                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Strickland, Carol
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Maerzgalerie, Leipzig in 2009.  The publication has a biography of the artist, a selected exhibition list, lists of awards and scholarships, and a bibliography.

name: Juvara, Filippo
item_t: Juvarra : l'architettura.
author: Gritella, Gianfranco
public_note: This study begins with an introduction, essays, and biographical notes. The apparatus includes listings of abbreviations for sources, bibliographical references, as well as a list of general terms.

name: Kallmorgen, Werne
item_t: "Raummassagen" : der Architekt Werner Kallmorgen 1902-1979.
author: Comehl, Ulrich

name: Jungnickel, Ludwig Heinrich
item_t: Ludwig Heinrich Jungnickel, Wunsiedel 1881-1965 Wien : ein Leben für die Kunst : mit einem Werkkatalog der Druckgraphik.
author: Spielvogel-Bodo, Ilse
public_note: The catalogue covers the artist's work as painter, printmaker, draughtsman, and designer in various media (textiles, bronze décor, postcards, embroideries, wall paintings, and exlibris), covering all of his unique artworks as well as his serial and commercial production.

name: Kalaizis,
item_t: Aris Kalaizis : Sottorealism : A Monograph with Catalogue Raisonné 1994-2014 =eine Monografie mit Werkverzeichnis 1994-2014 =een Monografie met Oeuvrecatalogus 1994-2014.
imprint: Petersberg : Michael Imhof Verlag : Leipzig : Eudora-Verlag, 2014.
public_note: The publication includes texts by Paul-Henri Campbell, Harry Tupan, Peter Assmann, August Häuser, and Aris Kalaizia.

name: Kalide, Theodo
item_t: Theodore Kalide : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis des Berliner Bildhauers (1801-1863).
author: Nagler, Justine
public_note: Presented as the author's doctoral disseration, Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg, 2017.  The publication presents a monograph and catalogue of the complete sculptures.

name: Kahlo, Frida
item_t: Frida Kahlo : das Gesamtwerk.
author_s:
Prignitz-Poda, Helga                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grimberg, Salomon                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kettenmann, Andrea
imprint: Frankfurt am Main : Verlag Neue Kritik, 1988.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné includes oil paintings, watercolors, graphic works, works on paper, sketchbooks and other objects. The publication also lists several doubtful attributions and rejected works.  

The texts and catalogue raisonné are in German, with titles also given in Spanish and English.

name: Kahlo, Frida
item_t: Frida Kahlo : The Still Lifes.
public_note: A critical study of all Kahlo's still life paintings, approximately 40 of which are known. While lacking the critical apparatus of a traditional catalogue raisonné, the author provides detailed interpretative comments on each work.

name: Judd, Donald
item_t: Donald Judd.
author_s:
National Gallery of Canada, Ottawa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Smith, Brydon
public_note: Subtitled "A Catalogue of the Exhibition at the National Gallery of Canada, Ottawa (24 May-6 July 1975) A Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings, Objects, and Wood-blocks, 1960-1974."

name: Juel, Jen
item_t: Jens Juel.
author: Poulsen, Ellen
public_note: Catalogue entries are in Danish, accompanying essays are in English and Danish.

name: Julià, Asen
item_t: Asensi Julià : el deixeble de Goya.
author: Gil, Rafael
imprint: Valencia : Edicions Alfons el Magnànim, Institució Valenciana d'Estudis i Investigació, 1990.
public_note:
Following the introduction, there is a biographical essay dealing with the academic formation of the artist and his artistic activities. The catalogue raisonné covers securely attributed works, works lacking full documentation, and, finally, attributed and rejected works.

There is a bibliography, plus various indices, including catalogued works, terms, plates, and a general index.

name: Kabakov, Il'ya Iosifovich
item_t: Ilya Kabakov : Installations. Catalogue Raisonné 1983-2000.
author_s:
Stoos, Toni (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Groys, Boris                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bätschmann, Oskar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mengham, Rod                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Storr, Robert
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Kunstmuseum Bern, 2000. Works include installations (many not permanent) which are listed by the date of completion, illustrated with drawings, sketches, designs and photographs. To a large extent, the choice of illustrations, text, and design was done by the artist himself.

name: Kabakov, Il'ya Iosifovich
item_t: Ilya Kabakov : Paintings 1957-2008 : Catalogue Raisonné; Gemälde 1957-2008.
author_s:
Petzinger, Renate                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kabakov, Emilia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Storr, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Groys, Boris
public_note:
The artist considers this to be an original work of art, an "artist's book" designed by himself.
It catalogues 619 known works from 1959 until 2008 (plus 6 authorized copies), usually in chronological order. There are differences with earlier publications for some of the works' titles.

name: Kahn, Louis Isidore
item_t: Louis I. Kahn : Complete Works, 1935-1974.
author_s:
Ronner, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jhaveri, Sharad                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vasella, Alessandro
public_note: This work was published under the aegis of the Institute for the History and Theory of Architecture, and grew out of an earlier 1969 exhibition held at The Federal Insitute of Technology (ETH) in Zurich.

name: Kahn, Louis Isidore
item_t: The Louis I. Kahn Archive : Personal Drawings : The Completely Illustrated Catalogue of the Drawings in the Louis I. Kahn Collection, University of Pennsylvania and Pennsylvania Historical and Museum Commission.
author: Kahn, Louis I.
public_note:
This corpus of drawings came from the architect's personal collection and the contents of his office, following his sudden demise. 
The vast trove includes correspondence, project files, models, etc. The catalogue raisonné includes Kahn's catalogue number, unbuilt projects, clients, landscape drawings, earliest dated renderings, and working drawings.

The catalogue is in chronological order by date when a building or project was begun, with the information divided into four parts: factural material based on research of Kahn's collection and staff (for the personal and office correspondence), catalogue information, transcriptions, and the repertory of drawings.

Entries cite stage of realization, aspect treatment, drawing medium, print medium, dimensions, support, and date if known.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Kandinsky Watercolors : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Barnett, Vivian Endicott                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Katz, Katharena                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wackernagel, Rudolf H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Luckow, Dirck
public_note: The titles are given in German, French and English, alternate titles are cited, the artist's Handlist is quoted, and bibliographical references are given if available. Some comments give critical comparisons. The author has reviewed the large majority of watercolors, gouaches, and temperas included in the catalogue, and has checked the original sources, excepting for a few omitted works that couldn't be seen and judged.

name: Kahn, Louis Isidore
item_t: The Paintings and Sketches of Louis I. Kahn.
public_note:
This study is based on the author's doctoral thesis. The catalogue covers paintings, drawings and sketches. The author states that the dating of sketches was determined by subject matter, affinity in style, as well as geographical references. 

The catalogue raisonné gives plate number, location or place of execution, date, medium and size, exhibition information, present location, and commentary if applicable.

name: Kaindl, Franz
item_t: Franz Kaindl : Werkverzeichnis der Ölgemälde.
author_s:
Pallauf, Karl                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jungnickel, Oliver                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Madritsch, Renate                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hofmann, Johann
public_note: The publication includes a biography, a discussion of his style, and a text by the artist.  The texts are followed by the catalogue of the oil paintings from 1952 to 2015.

name: Kabakov, Il'ya Iosifovich
item_t: Ilya Kabakov : Artist Books 1958-2009 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Haldemann, Matthias (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Obrist, Marco                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Seeberger, Nicole
public_note:
This catalogue of the artist's books is both a reference tool and an artist's book in itself (the artist does not distinguish between artistic practice and discourse).  
The book has always assumed a major role in the artist's visual work, and serves a dual purpose by presenting new projects and then documenting the works after they have been realized.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Kandinsky : Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil-Paintings.
author_s:
Roethel, Hans Konrad                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Benjamin, Jean K.
public_note: A not strictly chronologically ordered catalogue of the paintings and oil sketches (including the Hinterglasbilder), based on the artist's own "Handlists".  See also: Vivian Barnett et al: "Kandinsky Watercolors : Catalogue Raisonné", 1992-, which includes a later addendum of 34 additional works to this catalogue.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Wassily Kandinsky - Catalogue Raisonné Addendum.
imprint: Munich : Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus und Kunstbau, 2015.
public_note: A primary appendix features seven works included but not illustrated in the previous catalogue raisonné of Kandinsky's watercolors.  A second appendix lists all works included as addenda in each of the previously published Kandinsky catalogues raisonnés.  There are also lists of illustrations and explanatory notes and abbreviations, and colophon.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Kandinsky Drawings : Catalogue Raisonné : Individual Drawings.
author: Barnett, Vivian Endicott
imprint: London : Philip Wilson; [Munich] : C. H. Beck; New York : distributed in USA by Palgrave Macmillan, 2006.
public_note: International co-editions of this title were issued, including one in German published by C.H. Beck.

name: Kandinsky, Wassily
item_t: Kandinsky Drawings : Catalogue Raisonné : Sketchbooks.
author: Barnett, Vivian Endicott
public_note: International co-editions of this book were issued, including one in Germany published by C. H. Beck.

name: Jouvenet, Jean
item_t: Jean Jouvenet, 1644-1717 et la peinture d'histoire à Paris.
public_note: Updated edition of Schnapper's original 1974 catalogue raisonné, revised by Christine Gouzi.

name: Juárez, José
item_t: José Juárez : recursos y discursos del arte de pintar.
author: Juárez, José
imprint: Mexico City : Museo Nacional de Arte : Banamex : Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México : Instituto de Investigaciones Estéticas : CONACULTA, INBA, 2002.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Museo Nacional de Arte, Mexico, 2002.

name: Jou Francisco, Pere
item_t: L'escultor Pere Jou (1891- 1964) : forma i matèria.
author: Doménech, Ignasi

name: Jouett, Matthew Ha
item_t: Catalogue of All Known Paintings by Matthew Harris Jouett.
author: Martin, Mary

name: Jordaens, Jacob, the elde
item_t: Jacob Jordaens y España.
author: Díaz Padrón, María
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of Jordaens' paintings and tapestry designs executed for the Spanish monarchs in Spain and Belgium.  Volume 1 includes discussions of his major commissions, patrons, influence on art in Spain, and his critical fortunes.  This is followed by the catalogue of 61 paintings, organized by subject: religious works, mythology & history, portraits, and genre.

name: Jongkind, Johan Barthold
item_t: Jongkind : sa vie, son oeuvre, son époque.
author: Hefting, Victorine

name: Jordaens, Jacob, the elde
item_t: Jacob Jordaens : Designs for Tapestry.
author: Nelson, Kristi
ind_entr_cont: The individual entries include provenance, references, exhibition history, border information, materials, and dimensions.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Jordaens, Jacob, the elde
item_t: Jordaens Drawings.
author: Hulst, Roger Adolf d'
public_note: The author also published two supplements to his catalogue in the journal "Master Drawings", under the title: 'Jordaens Drawings: Supplement I' (XVIII, 4, 1980) and 'Supplement II' (XXVIII, 2, 1990).

name: Jonghelinck, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Jonghelinck : sculpteur, médailleur et graveur de sceaux (1530-1606).
author: Smolderen, Luc
imprint: Louvain-la-Neuve : Dép. d'archéologie et d'histoire de l'art, Séminaire de numismatique Marcel Hoc, 1996.
public_note: Published under the series: Publications d'histoire de l'art et d'archéologie de l'Université catholique de Louvain; 90. Numismatica Lovaniensia; 15.

name: Jongkind, Johan Barthold
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Jones, John Llewelyn
item_t: John Llewelyn Jones : Australia's Forgotten Painter.
imprint: Edgecliff, N.S.W. : Corbally Stourton Contemporary Art [1998].

name: Jongkind, Johan Barthold
item_t: Jongkind, 1819-1891 : catalogue critique de l'oeuvre.
author_s:
Lorenceau, François                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brame, Sylvie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stein, Adolphe
public_note:
A supplement is currently in preparation. See in-process entry cited in this database.

The catalogue raisonné gives number, title, medium and support, dimensions, provenance, bibliographical and exhibition references, and some comments.
Appendices list principal public auctions, exhibitions, a bibliography, an alphabetical list of works, and an index of collections, galleries and museums holding the artist's work.

name: Johnson, Eastman
item_t: An American Genre Painter : Eastman Johnson, 1824-1906.
author: Baur, John
imprint: Brooklyn, NY : Brooklyn Museum ; Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences, [1940].
public_note: This catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Brooklyn Museum in 1940. This is not a full catalogue raisonné, but, in the absence of one, provides useful information. A catalogue raisonné is currently in preparation (see in-process entry cited in this database).

name: Johnson, Ray
item_t: Ray Johnson : Taoist Pop Heart School.
author: Johnson, Ray
public_note: The subtitle on the cover is "Ray Johnson: Catalogue Raisonné".  This is a catalogue of the artist's drawings, paintings, collages, interventions, from his estate.  Chiefly illustrations.

name: Jiménez, Max
item_t: Max Jiménez : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Jiménez, Max                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barrionuevo Ch-A, Floria A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guardia Y., María Enriqueta
imprint: San José, Costa Rica : Editorial de la Universidad de Costa Rica, 1999.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's complete works, including his sculptures, drawings, paintings, and etchings.

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Johns Prints, 1970-1977.
author: Field, Richard S.
public_note: Richard Field's second volume cataloguing Johns's prints, published on the occasion of the exhibition of the artist's prints held at Wesleyan University in Spring 1978 and other institutions thereafter. This work extends the chronology set out in Field's earlier catalogue describing Johns's prints dating 1960-1970 (cited in this database), published by the Philadelphia Museum of Art in 1970.

name: Jodorowsky, Alejandro
item_t: PascALEjandro : l'androgyne alchimique.
author: Grau, Donatien (ed.)
imprint: Arles : Actes Sud ; Paris : Association Azzedine Alaïa, 2017.

name: John, Gwen
item_t: Gwen John : With a Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings and a Selection of the Drawings.
author: Langdale, Cecily
public_note: A monograph and catalogue raisonné.  The publication lists all 158 paintings, but only 159 of the thousands of drawings Johns is known to have executed.  In addition to the authentic paintings, the author lists 20 lost works, for which there is sufficient descriptive information.

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Johns Prints, 1960-1970.
author_s:
Field, Richard S.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Turner, Evan H. (preface)
imprint: Philadelphia : Philadelphia Museum of Art, in association with Praeger, New York, 1970.
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Philadelphia Museum of Art in spring 1970. See the same author's publication of 1978 (cited in this database), which extends the chronology of this book.

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Johns Prints, 1977-1981.
author: Goldman, Judith
public_note: Catalogue for an exhibition held at the Thomas Segal Gallery, Newbury Street, Boston, dovetailing with the chronology of Johns's prints covered earlier by Richard Field's exhibition catalogues (see entries cited in this database).

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: The Prints of Jasper Johns, 1960-1993 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Field, Richard S.
imprint: West Islip, NY : Universal Limited Art Editions, 1994.
public_note:
Richard Field's summary catalogue for Johns' p
rints to 1993; see the same author's two earlier exhibition catalogues for the artist's prints (entry cited in this database). Universal Limited Art Editions, generally known as "U.L.A.E.," is an important publisher of Johns' prints.

name: Joli, Antonio
item_t: Antonio Joli : Modena 1700-1777.
author: Toledano, Ralph
public_note: Catalogue raisonné is organized by subject.

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Johns : Catalogue Raisonné of Monotypes.
imprint: New York : Matthew Marks Gallery ; New Haven : Yale University Press, 2017.
public_note: The catalogue is the based on extensive new scholarship and interviews with the artist.  The catalogue raisonné lists all 143 monotypes, executed between 1954 and June 2015.

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Johns : Catalogue Raisonné of Painting and Sculpture.
author_s:
Zinn, Betsy Stepina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Colsman-Freyberger, Heidi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sweeney, Caitlin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bernstein, Roberta
imprint: New York : Wildenstein Plattner Institute ; New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 2017.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Jones, Allen
item_t: Allen Jones Prints.
author_s:
Lloyd, Richard (catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Livingstone, Marco (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rosenthal, Norman (foreword)
public_note: Published to coincide with an exhibition at the Barbican Art Gallery, London.  The catalogue lists 113 prints with variants; all works are reproduced in black and white thumbnails.

name: Jones, Inigo
item_t: Inigo Jones : Complete Architectural Drawings.
author_s:
Harris, John                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Higgott, Gordon                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Beck, Martha (foreword)
imprint: London : A. Zwemmer ; New York : The Drawing Center, 1989.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held in 1989 at The Drawing Center, New York, and The Frick Art Museum, Pittsburgh. Drawings not shown in the exhibition are catalogued in the Appendix in chronological order.

name: Johns, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Johns Catalogue Raisonné of Drawing.
imprint: New Haven : Yale University Press, for the Menil Collection, 2018.
ind_entr_cont: all listed drawings have been confirmed by the Jasper Johns studio.  Works prior to 1954 and a few dated after 1954 which Johns did not rank as part of  his oeuvre, are not included here.  Likewise, the catalogue omits documentary or sketchbook drawings, as well as preparatory drawings for prints.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Asger Jorn : Werkverzeichnis der Skizzenbücher : Vaerkfortegneise : Catalogue Raisonné
author: Presler, Gerd
public_note: Texts are trilingual; catalogue in German only. Individual entries also contain information on the materials and physical characteristics of the sketchbooks.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Asger Jorn : Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik= Catalogue Raisionné of Prints.
imprint: Munich : Galerie van de Loo ; Silkeborg Kunstmuseum, 2009.
public_note: This is an updated and expanded edition of the "Asger Jorn : Werkverzeichnis, Druckgrafik Galerie van de Loo" (Munich : Galerie van de Loo, 1976). The current catalogue lists 520 graphic works, all illustrated in color. All texts are bilingual.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Asger Jorn : Revised Supplement to the Oeuvre Catalogue of His Paintings from 1930 to 1973.
public_note: The first supplement to the catalogue raisonné of Jorn's paintings was published in 1986.  This revised supplement [v.5] adds another 123 oils, all researched as to provenance and history.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Asger Jorn, the Final Years, 1965-1973 : A Study of Asger Jorn's Artistic Development from 1965 to 1973 and a Catalogue of his Paintings from that Period.
author_s:
Atkins, Guy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Andersen, Troels                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Whitford, Frank                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lehmann-Brockhaus, Ursula
public_note:
Part of a five-volume series of catalogues on Jorn that together loosely comprise a catalogue raisonné of his works.

The appendix to the catalogue raisonné lists numerous recently discovered works. And one painting that had been listed in the third volume of the catalogue raisonné was removed from the canon of the artist's works.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Asger Jorn, the Crucial Years, 1954-1964 : A Study of Asger Jorn's Artistic Development from 1954 to 1964 and a Catalogue of His Oil Paintings from that Period.
imprint: London : Lund Humphries ; New York : Wittenborn Art Books, 1977.
public_note: This volume is a continuation of  "Jorn in Scandanavia," published in 1968, and is part of a five-volume series of catalogues on Jorn that together loosely comprise a catalogue raisonné of his works.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Asger Jorn : Supplement to the Oeuvre Catalogue of His Paintings from 1930-1973.
imprint: London : Asger Jorn Foundation, in association with Lund Humphries, 1986.
public_note: Part of the five-volume series of catalogues on Jorn that together loosely comprise a catalogue raisonné of his works. The supplement includes all entries from appendicies from the three previous volumes, arranged chronologically. The addenda to volume 4 also lists 3 previously unknown paintings.

name: Jorn, Asge
item_t: Jorn in Scandinavia, 1930-1953 : A Study of Asger Jorn's Artistic Development from 1930 to 1953 and a Catalogue of His Oil Paintings from that Period.
public_note: Part of five-volume series of catalogues on Jorn, described herein, which together loosely comprise a catalogue raisonné of his works. The catalogue raisonné includes 855 works arranged chronologically and by place of execution. The appendix to the catalogue contains 26 additional works.

name: Jiménez, María Paz
item_t: Maria Paz Jiménez (1908-1975).
author: Jiménez, Maria Paz
imprint: [San Sebastián] : Sociedad Guipuzcoana de Ediciones y Publicaciones : Obra Cultura de la Caja de Ahorros Municipal de San Sebastián, 1989
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition at the Museo de San Telmo, San Sebastián, Spain.

name: Jiang, Tiefeng
item_t: Jiang : Catalogue Raisonné, 1984-1989.
illustrations: b/w photo of the artist; some color
public_note:
This small catalogue includes an article on the artist by Richard Thompson in English and Japanese. The catalogue raisonné is divided into two sections: "The Print Editions" and "The Bronze Editions." 

This is essentially an illustrated catalogue with captions and Chinese subtitles, but without bibliographical references or any other critical apparatus.

name: Jiang, Tiefeng
item_t: Jiang : Catalogue Raisonné, 1990-93.
author: Jiang, Tiefeng

name: Jettel, Eugen
item_t: Eugen Jettel.
author: Fuchs, Heinrich
public_note: An Austrian landscape painter, born in Moravia, painting in the Barbizon circle.

name: Jesdinksy, Bertram
item_t: Bertram Jesdinsky : Düsseldorf, Kunstmuseum Düsseldorf im Ehrenhof…(Ausstellung und Katalog)
public_note: Catalogue of a circulating exhibition Dusseldorf, Duren, and Freiburg, 1996-1998.

name: Jansen, Franz Mathia
item_t: Franz M. Jansen : das graphische Werk, 1910-1956.
author: Merholz, Ulrike
public_note: 1020 works are described. Includes three original woodcuts by the artist.

name: Jaraba Jiménez, Enrique
item_t: Enrique Jaraba Jiménez : un pintor empresario en la Málaga de principios del siglo XX.
author: Fabre Escamilla, Eduardo

name: Jauss, Anne Marie
item_t: Anne Marie Jauss 1902-1991 : Magischer Realismus auf zwei Kontinenten : Biografie der Malerin und Illustratorin = Magic Realism on Two Continentents : Biography of the Painter and Illustrator.
author: Jauss, Johanna
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist, excerpts of conversations with Jauss about her works, a discussion of her art critics.  There is also an index of names, an exhibition list, a chronology, and a list of books authored/illustrated by A.M. Jauss.

name: Jarvis, John Wesley
item_t: John Wesley Jarvis : American Painter, 1780-1840, with a Checklist of his Works.
author: Dickson, Harold E.
public_note: The introductory chapters cover aspects of the artist's life and career. This is followed by a checklist of 412  works the author accepts as authentic.  He notes that the list is not complete, however, and that works in Southern collections have not been fully researched.

name: Jahns, Rudolf
item_t: Rudolf Jahns : Werkverzeichnis 1917-1981.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné was compiled with the assistance of the artist's daughter, and includes paintings, collages, drawings, prints, and other objects. 

There are also texts by Ulrich Kempel, Joachim Bücher, and Walter Vitt, with additional research by Oktavia Christ.

name: Jansem, Jean Léon
item_t: Jansem Lithographe, 1954-1983.
public_note: Introduction and catalogue of prints are trilingual (French, English, Japanese). Three original color lithographs included.

name: Jacquette, Yvonne
item_t: Aerial Muse : The Art of Yvonne Jacquette, Including a Catalogue Raisonné of Prints.
author_s:
Faberman, Hilarie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berkson, Bill (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Katz, Vincent (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fraise, Jeanne W. (contributions)
imprint: New York : Hudson Hills Press, in association with the Iris & B. Gerald Cantor Center for Visual Arts (Stanford, CA), 2002.
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held in 2002-2003 at the Iris & B. Gerald Cantor Center for Visual Arts at Stanford University and several other American museums.  The catalogue raisonné was compiled with the assistance of the artist.

name: Jacobson, Mark Anthony
item_t: Mark Anthony Jacobson Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Jacobson, Mark Anthony
cronology: Individual entries include color photo, title, date, provenance, method of acquisition (purchase, gift of the artist), dimensions, inscriptions, exhibitions, references, and comments by the artist.
public_note: check_needed

name: Jacoulet, Paul
item_t: The Prints of Paul Jacoulet : A Complete Illustrated Catalogue.
imprint: London : Robert G. Sawers, in association with the Pacific Asia Museum, Pasadena, 1982.
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Pacific Asia Museum, 1982. The catalogue includes a glossary of printing terms and a section illustrating the artist's various seals.

name: Jamesone, George
item_t: The Life and Art of George Jamesone.
author: Thomson, Duncan
public_note: The earliest-known Scottish portrait painter. The publication is based on the author's 1969 doctoral thesis presented at the University of Edinburgh.  It is part of the Oxford series "Studies in  the History of Art."

name: Jackson, Billy Morrow
item_t: Billy Morrow Jackson - Prints 1949-1991.
author: Haslem, Jane
cronology: The entries provide title, date, printer, medium, edition information, dimensions, collection, and some comments.  All works are illustrated
public_note: check_needed

name: Jacopo, della Quercia
item_t: Jacopo della Quercia.
author: Beck, James H.
public_note:
The first volume includes a biography of the artist, a discussion of his artistic style, and the catalogue raisonné.  

The second volume includes Vasari's biography of Jacopo della Quercia, and transcriptions and/or summaries of all known original documentation from the artist's life.  Documents are reproduced in their original language, but are accommpanied by commentary by the author in English.

name: Jackson, Billy Morrow
item_t: Billy Morrow Jackson - Paintings 1949-2006 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author:
Haslem, Jane
 Jane
cronology: The catalogue is organized roughly by decade from the late 1940s until 2006.  Entries provide title, medium & support, and dimensions, but no other critical apparatus.  All works are illustrated in color, but images are not scalable.
public_note: check_needed

name: Iturrino, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Iturrinoren grafizko artelaren bilduma-liburua : Catálogo de la obra gráfica de Francisco Iturrino.
author_s:
Barañano, Kosme Ma.de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            González e Durana, Javier
imprint: Vitoria-Gasteiz : Servicio Central de Publicaciones del Gobierno Vasco, 1988

name: Jacobello d'Antonio
item_t: Antonello da Messina and his Workshop.
author: Skorupa, Thomas
public_note: Short listings of each painter's work have catalogue  number, title, provenance, scholarship, dating and condition, and related works.  The more extensive entries give inscriptions, descriptions, provenance, dates, related works, technical documents and references.

name: Jeanne-Claude
item_t: Christo and Jeanne-Claude : Prints and Objects, 1963-1995 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Munich ; New York : Edition Schellmann;  Munich : Schirmer Mosel,  1995.
public_note: With the German title, "Christo und Jeanne Claude: Druckgraphik und Objekte, 1963-95, Werkverzeichnis." Text appears in English and German.

name: Jawlensky, Alexej von
item_t: Alexej Jawlensky.
author: Weiler, Clemens
public_note: First catalogue raisonné of the paintings of  this Russian-born artist, active in Germany and a founder of the "Blue Four" in Wiesbaden (1924).

name: Jagnocco, Gabriele
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Gabriele Jagnocco.
public_note: Originally intended as a multi-volume series, only the first volume has been published to date.

name: Jeanne-Claude
item_t: Christo and Jeanne-Claude : Prints and Objects : Catalogue Raisonné 1963-2013.
public_note: The original third edition in German was published by Hatje Cantz, Ostfildern in 2013.  The current publication expands and revises earlier editions and catalogues all of the artists' editioned works, including prints, collages and objects.  There is also a survey of themes and projects in the artists' oeuvre.

name: Jawlensky, Alexej von
item_t: Alexej von Jawlensky : Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil Paintings.
author_s:
Jawlensky, Alexej von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jawlensky, Maria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jawlensky Bianconi, Angelica                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pieroni-Jawlensky, Lucia

name: Indiana, Robe
item_t: Robert Indiana Prints : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1951-1991.
author_s:
Sheehan, Susan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Orchier, Poppy Gandler                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mennenga, Catherine
public_note: With an introduction by Poppy Gandler Orchier and her interview of Indiana.

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Immendorff, Jörg
item_t: Jörg Immendorff : Zeichnungen / Drawings, 1964-1993.
author: Kort, Pamela
public_note: Texts are in German and English. Edited by Michael E. Werner. The catalogue lists approximately 200 of the artist's drawings, gouaches, and sketchbooks, arranged in four chronological groups and related series.

name: Inimá
item_t: Inimá : obras catalogadas.
author: Leite, José Roberto Teixeira
imprint: Belo Horizonte, MG : Fundacão Inimá de Paula, 2002.
public_note: This is the first volume of a projected 3 volume series on the artist's work. Vol. 1 lists over 1,458 authentic works.  The publication also includes a chronology and excerpts of documents related to the artist's life and art.

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: Ingres.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. This is the second revised edition; the first dates from 1954.  The catalogue raisonné lists 325 works, all illustrated.  The digitized full text publication is available at the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's website (see Full Text link on this page).

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: Ingres, sa vie, ses travaux, sa doctrine.
author: Delaborde, Henri
public_note: This is one among the earliest critical studies of  Ingres' work, it is based on the artist's own manuscript notes and letters.

name: Hüpfner, Ku
item_t: Kurt Hüpfner : Online Werkkataloge.
author_s:
Hundsdorfer, Alice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Huemer, Christian (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rollig, Stella (ed.)
cronology: Individual entries include title, collection, date, inventory number, comments, references, exhibitions, signature & inscriptions, dimensions, and related works.  All works are illustrated with scalable color images.
ind_entr_cont: Published in the series Belvedere Werkkataloge, No. 8. The texts include a biography of the artist.  The catalogue raisonné lists over 3,100 of the artist's works in all media, including paintings, drawings, collages, graphic works, and sculpture. The catalogue can be searched chronologically or by medium, as well as by subject and other tagged terms.
public_note: check_needed

name: Illiers, Gaston d'
item_t: Gaston d'Illiers : 1876-1932 : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Labretoigne, Guy de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Villèle, Ludovic de
public_note: The catalogue contains a biographical essay and a discussion of the artist's works. The documents section contains lists of d'Illiers' teachers, students, editors, foundries, exhibitions, examples of his signatures and monograms, and a subject index.

name: Icart, Lou
item_t: Louis Icart : The Complete Etchings.
author_s:
Holland, William R.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Catania, Clifford P.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Isen, Nathan D.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 502 etchings by the artist. Miles Phillip Burton and Richard Perozzi also contributed to this publication. Several later, revised editions exist, the fourth dated 2002.

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: Die Bildniszeichnungen von J.-A. Ingres.
author: Naef, Hans
public_note: Comprehensive catalogue of Ingres' portrait drawings.

name: Ibbetson, Julius Caesa
item_t: Julius Caesar Ibbetson (1759-1817) : "The Berchem of England."
public_note:
This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at John Mitchell & Son, with an illustrated checklist of Ibbetson's paintings. Christopher Wright compiled the reference materials and wrote the preface to the catalogue raisonné.

The present catalogue lists oil paintings by or attributed to Ibbetson housed in public collections in the United Kingdom. 
The authors state that the current checklist of works is meant as a preliminary compilation for Mitchell's forthcoming catalogue raisonné of the complete works (not published to date).

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: L'opera completa di Ingres.

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: Ingres : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Zanni, Annalisa

name: Huysum, Jan van
item_t: Jan van Huysum, 1682-1749, Including a Catalogue Raisonné of the Artist's Fruit & Flower Paintings.
author: Grant, Maurice Harold
public_note:
This catalogue was published to supplement Hofstede de Groot's 1928 catalogue raisonné of van Huysum's work.

The book is divided into three sections. The first part is comprised of pictures traced and identified with those in Hofstede de Groot's catalogue; pictures traced which do not appear in de Groot or which cannot be identified with his numbers; and pictures catalogued by de Groot for which the present whereabouts are unknown.

Part II contains corrections to former attributions and Part III lists the artist's drawings.

name: Hummel, Berta
item_t: Berta Hummel : Catalogue Raisonné, 1927-1931 : Student Days in Munich.
author_s:
Berta Hummel Museum                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hummel, Alfred (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nitz, Genoveva                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Erler, M. Witgard
imprint: Munich ; New York ; Berlin ; London : Prestel, 2002.
public_note: This catalogue, which examines Hummel's works on paper produced during her four years as a student at the Academy of Applied Arts in Munich, was published in conjunction with the Berta-Hummel-Museum im Hummelhaus, Massing, and includes a foreword by the Museum Director, Alfred Hummel. The publication includes a biography and an index of Hummel's works. There is also a essay and an interview with the artist's sister, Centa.

name: Hundertwasser, Friedensreich
item_t: Friedensreich Hundertwasser : das vollständige druckgraphische Werk, 1951-1986.
public_note: An English language edition of this catalogue was also published: "Friedensreich Hundertwasser : The Complete Graphic Work, 1951-1986" by  Rizzoli (New York, 1986) as well as a French edition by Bibliothèque des Arts (Paris, 1986).

name: Hundertwasser, Friedensreich
item_t: Hundertwasser, 1928-2000 : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: This is the English edition of the book also issued in German by Taschen. In the present publication, Schmied's text (vol. 1) appears in English translation; Furst's catalogue raisonné (vol. 2) is in both English and German. Includes a color etching.

name: Hunt, William Holman
item_t: William Holman Hunt : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bronkhurst, Judith
public_note: Published by Yale University Press for the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art. In addition to the oil paintings and works on paper, appendices provide information on other aspects of the artist's oeuvre, including his illustrations, sculpture, and furniture designs. The catalogue also includes a glossary of frame terms compiled by Lynn Roberts.

name: Hutty, Alfred Hebe
item_t: The Life and Art of Alfred Hutty : Woodstock to Charleston.
author_s:
Hoffius, Sara C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hoffius, Stephen G.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Howle, Edith (catalogue raisonné)
imprint: Columbia, S.C. : University of South Carolina Press : Published in Cooperation with the Gibbes Museum of Art/Carolina Art Association, 2012.
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Gibbes Museum of Art, The Morris Museum of Art, and the Greenville County Museum of Art. The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of all 231 of the artist's etchings, lithographs, and drypoints, arranged chronologically, and then alphabetically by title within each year.

name: Ingres, Jean-Auguste-Dominique
item_t: Dessins d'Ingres : catalogue raisonné des dessins du Musée de Montauban.
author: Vigne, Georges
imprint: Paris : Gallimard ; Réunion de musées nationaux, 1995.
public_note: Catalogues over 4,000 drawings, basically the contents of the artist's studio bequeathed to his native city of Montauban.

name: Humblot, Robe
item_t: Humblot : 1907-1962
author_s:
Harambourg, Lydia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Humblot, Brigitte                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bréon, Emmanuel (preface)
public_note: The publication includes a biography & reminiscences of the artist by his daughter, and a discussion of the paintings.  There are also lists of solo and group exhibitions, a list of museums  housing the artist's work, a bibliography, and selected critical reviews.

name: Hugues, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Hugues : un sculpteur sous la IIIe République : catalogue raisonné.
author: Noet, Laurent
public_note: The first part of the catalogue includes texts on the artist's life and career. The appendices include a lists of prizes, salons in which Hugues participated, and exhibitions of his works.

name: Huene, Stephan von
item_t: Stephan von Huene : The Song of the Line : The Drawings 1950-1999.
author_s:
Kipphoff von Huene, Petra                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gassner, Hubertus
public_note: Published on the occasion of a circulating exhibition held at the Hamburger Kunsthalle, Liebermann Haus, Berlin, and Center for Art and Media, Karlsruhe.

name: Huet, Paul
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Huber, Wolfgang
item_t: Wolf Huber : das Gesamtwerk.
author: Winzinger, Franz

name: Hughes, Arthu
item_t: Arthur Hughes : His Life and Works.
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings, watercolors, drawings and illustrations. The introduction by Stephen Wildman reviews the artist's biography.

name: Huber, Marl
item_t: Marlis Huber : 1932-2012.
author_s:
Hochleitner, Martin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schaffer, Nikolaus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Huber-Hering, Vita (ed.)
public_note: Preliminary material contains essays, plus sections covering the oil paintings (city and landscapes, portraits), works in mixed techniques, watercolors and drawings, and a biography.  There is no index or other cross references.

name: Hrdlicka, Alfred
item_t: Alfred Hrdlicka, das Gesamtwerk.
author: Lewin, Michael
imprint: Vienna : Europaverlag in Zusammenarbeit mit der Galerie Hilger Wien, 1987.

name: Hörbiger, Alfred
item_t: Alfred Hörbiger 1891-1945.
author: Kaindl, Franz

name: Hsieh, Tehching
item_t: Out of Now : The Lifeworks of Tehching Hsieh.
author: Heathfield, Adrian
imprint: London : Live Art Development Agency : Cambridge : MIT Press, 2009.

name: Hörmann, Theodor von
item_t: Theodor von Hörmann, 1840-1895 : Monographie mit Verzeichnis der Gemälde.
author_s:
Hussl-Hörmann, Marianne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rauchensteiner, Manfried                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rauchensteiner, Marianne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Boeckl, Matthias
public_note: The publication includes essays dealing with the artist's life and career, followed by the catalogue of oil paintings compiled by Marianne Hussl-Hörmann.

name: Houdon, Jean-Antoine
item_t: Le Statuaire Jean-Antoine Houdon et son époque (1741-1828).
author: Giacometti, Georges
public_note:
The publication provides detailed information about Houdon's technique and materials, and also includes a detailed description of each work. 

Volume 1 includes a discussion of Houdon's technique and gives examples of authentic and false Houdon signatures and workshop stamps.

name: Houdon, Jean-Antoine
item_t: La vie et l'oeuvre de Houdon.
public_note: The beginning chapters present the work in chronological order, followed by studies on Houdon's techniques and works produced at the end of his career. There is a listing of Salons.

name: Houdon, Jean-Antoine
item_t: Houdon : sa vie et son oeuvre.
author: Réau, Louis
public_note: Subtitled "Ouvrage posthume suivi d'un catalogue systématique, publié avec le concours du Centre national de la recherche scientifique."

name: Hoppner, John
item_t: John Hoppner, R.A.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is organized by subject: Identified Portraits, Groups and Anonymous Subjects, and "Fancy" Paintings. Addenda to the catalogue raisonné are included at the end of the book.

name: Hoppner, John
item_t: Supplement and Index to John Hoppner, R.A.
imprint: London ; New York : John Lane, The Bodley Head, 1914.
public_note: This is the supplement to the authors' 1909 publication (see entry cited in this database).

name: Hosmer, Harrie
item_t: Harriet Hosmer : Lost and Found.
author_s:
Cronin, Patricia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reilly, Maura (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gerdts, William H.
public_note: This is an exhibition catalogue for the show "Lost and Found" at the Brooklyn Museum in 2009-2010.

name: Houssin, Édouard
item_t: La vie et l'oeuvre du sculpteur Edouard Houssin (1847-1919) : catalogue raisonné.
author: Debève, Arnaud
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists 150 sculptures by the artist, all illustrated.

name: Hoyte, J. C.
item_t: J. C. Hoyte.
author: Platts, Una
public_note: An exhibition catalogue with a brief biography for this New Zealand landscape painter born in England.  There is a lists of works exhibited in New Zealand and Australia.  The digitized catalogue is available as a free pdf at the Auckland Art Gallery- see full text link.

name: Hoppé, Emil Otto
item_t: E. O. Hoppé : The German Work, 1925-1938.
author: Prodger, Phillip
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of Hoppé's German photographs from 1925-1938.  The publication includes the photos published in Hoppé's 1930 book "Deutsche Arbeit" as well as previously unpublished images.

name: Hopkins, Edna Boie
item_t: Edna Boies Hopkins : Strong in Character, Colorful in Expression.
author: Vasseur, Dominique H.
imprint: Athens, Ohio : Ohio University Press ; In Association with the Columbus Museum of Art, 2007.
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at the Columbus Museum of Art, the Springfield Museum of Art, and the Provincetown Art Association. There is a biographical essay on the artist, with a discussion of her technique. The catalogue raisonné of 73 woodblock prints is arranged by subject (landscape, florals, and figural scenes), and then alphabetically within each section.

name: Hopper, Edward
item_t: Edward Hopper, The Complete Prints.
author: Levin, Gail
imprint: New York : Norton in association with the Whitney Museum of American Art, 1979.
public_note: This study was published to accompany a circulating exhibition held at the Whitney Museum and five other venues.  The publication, which catalogues prints and a number of preparatory drawings, was based on Zigrosser's earlier catalogues which were prepared with the help of the artist and his wife, but which did not include prints donated subsequently to the Whitney.

name: Hopper, Edward
item_t: The Complete Graphic Work of Edward Hopper :  In Fifty-two Subjects and One Hundred and Fifteen Variant and Final States Owned by the Philadelphia Museum of Art and Exhibited in their Galleries, October-November 1962.
author_s:
Zigrosser, Carl                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Philadelphia Museum of Art
public_note:
This small publication accompanied an exhibition at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, which was also shown in 1963 at  the Worcester Art Museum, the catalogue raisonné was written by Carl Zigrosser, 
There were separate printings (with differing selection of illustrations) of Zigrosser's text including this by the Print Council, the text was excerpted from his book on "Prints..."  (1962, 1963 publishers vary).

name: Hopper, Edward
item_t: Edward Hopper : A Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: New York : Whitney Museum of American Art, in association with W.W. Norton, 1995.
public_note: Volume 2 was reissued as a monograph under the title: "The Complete Watercolors of Edward Hopper" (New York: Whitney Museum of American Art and W.W. Norton, isbn 0393049957, 2001).

name: Hooch, Pieter de
item_t: Pieter de Hooch : Complete Edition.
author: Sutton, Peter

name: Honert, Martin

imprint: New York : Matthew Marks Gallery; Cologne : Walther König, 2004.
illustrations: numerous color ills. in catalogue, 41 color plates
public_note: The catalogue accompanies an exhibition held at the Matthew Marks Gallery, NY.   The catalogue raisonné contains all 46 of the artist's works executed after 1982.

name: Honthorst, Gerrit van

author_s:
Judson, J. Richard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ekkart, Rudolf E.O.
public_note: This is a revised edition of Judson's earlier work published in 1959, which is still an important reference to the artist's oeuvre. The introductory material, including essays by the two authors, is followed by the catalogue raisonné.

name: Honthorst, Gerrit van
item_t: Gherardo delle notti : Gerrit Honthorst in Italia.
author: Papi, Gianni
public_note: The catalogue raisonné follows the introductory essays on Honthorst's activities in Italy.

name: Holloway, Edga
item_t: The Etchings and Engravings of Edgar Holloway : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Meyrick, Robert
imprint: Aldershot, Hants, England : Scolar Press; Brookfield, VT : Ashgate, 1996.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 270 engravings and etchings by Holloway.  The publication was compiled with the cooperation of the artist.

name: Hollar, Wenceslau
item_t: Wenceslaus Hollar.
imprint: Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel : Sound & Vision Publishers with the British Museum, 2009-2011.
public_note:
Published in the series: New Hollstein German Engravings, Etchings, and Woodcuts, 1400-1700.

This publication is organized chronologically by year. Portraits are listed alphabetically, book illustrations are entered as single sheets or for projects by year of publication, and undated works follow earlier Parthey/Pennington numbers. There is a concordance at the end of each volume with references to the P/P numbers.

name: Holl, Elia
item_t: Der Augsburger Stadtwerkmeister Elias Holl (1573-1646) : Werkverzeichnis.
author: Haberstock, Eva
public_note: Published in the series : "Beiträge zur Geschichte der Stadt Augsburg", Bd. 7.

name: Holloway, Edga

author: Meyrick, Robert
imprint: Aberystwyth : School of Art Press, University of Wales, 2004.
public_note: This is a supplement to the author's 1996 catalogue raisonné (see entry cited in this database).  The supplement was published in conjunction with the exhibition "Edgar Holloway at 90" held at the School of Art Galleries.

name: Holbein, Ambrosiu
item_t: Die Malerbrüder Ambrosius und Hans d.j. Holbein : Werkverzeichnis, Gemälde und Miniaturen.
public_note: Following the introductory texts on Ambrosius and Hans Holbein (II), the publication includes a catalogue raisonné of authentic works. There is also a list of lost works.

name: Hoover. Nan
item_t: Nan Hoover : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Leach, Dawn
cronology: The first volume  presents Hoover's work in all media (painting, drawing, objects, sculpture, collage and montage, video and film, photography, performance, installations and environments).
ind_entr_cont: The chronological catalogue raisonné lists 988 individual entries, citing catalogue number, title and date, catalogue/size or time length, documentation, signature, title and date information, edition number or size, provenance, object number, equipment, material, space, exhibition information, bibliographical references, related works, digital files, work materials, and notes.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Holabird & Roche

author: Bruegmann, Robert
imprint: New York ; London : Garland Publishing, Inc., 1991.
public_note: The catalogue was published in cooperation with the Chicago Historical Society.

name: Holbein, Hans, the younge

author: Rowlands, John
ind_entr_cont: Individual entries include title, current collection, medium, size, signature and date information, provenance, literature and brief notes.

name: Holbein, Hans, the younge

public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all known paintings by Holbein, as well as paintings generally attributed to him.

name: Homer, Winslow

public_note:
Vol. 1 contains extensive documentation, a listing of 600 public exhibitions held during the artist's lifetime, plus 200 posthumous exhibitions of his work. Volumes 2-5 continue the history of Homer's work. 
A "Summary Biography", which includes extensive new information on the artist, accompanies each volume.

name: Hogarth, William

public_note:
The publication includes an extensive biographical essay on Hoffmann's life and works. The catalogue raisonné lists over 500 known works by the architect with a large portion of the text dedicated to biographical essays.  

The Appendices include selections from Hoffmann's correspondence in English translation, untranslated fascimile letters, autobiographical essays, and other documents.

public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of all of the artistic works of the writer, painter, and composer, E.T.A Hoffmann. The catalogue is organized chronologically, and includes works known only from the documentation or from later copies.  There are indices of names, places, titles,

name: Hogarth, William

imprint: New Haven : Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art by Yale University Press, 2016.
public_note: This is a complete catalogue of Hogarth's paintings.  It includes four appendices: works attributed to Hogarth, notes on Hogarth's family background, Hogarth's list of 1731, and Mrs. Hogarth's sale of 24 April, 1790.

name: Hiquily, Philippe

public_note:
This two-volume catalogue includes parallel text in French and English. The first volume constitutes a monographic study of the artist, as well as the complete catalogue of his sculpture. The second volume consists of a catalogue of his furniture, drawings, and jewelry. 

Appendices include interviews on Hiquily conducted by Alexandra Marini with various artists.

author: Bowness, Alan (editor)

author: McCausland, Elizabeth
imprint: Albany : The University of the State of New York, 1945.
public_note: Published in the series: "Bulletin - New York State Museum" : 1945), no. 339.  The publication includes "A catalogue of the work of E.L. Henry, 1858-1911", and an Appendix to the "A Memorial Sketch: E.L. Henry, N.A., his Life and his Work" by Frances Livingston Welles Henry.

name: Hepworth, Barbara
item_t: Barbara Hepworth.
imprint: Neuchâtel, Switzerland : Editions du Griffon; London : Lund Humphries, 1961.
public_note: N.B. The two parts of the catalogue raisonné of Hepworth's sculptures cited in this database are currently being revised and updated, and will include works from 1970-1975.

name: Hepworth, Barbara
item_t: Barbara Hepworth : The Plasters : The Gift to Wakefield.
author: Bowness, Sophie (ed.)
imprint: Farnham, Surrey : Lund Humphries; Wakefield, Yorkshire : Hepworth Wakefield, 2011.
public_note: While not strictly a catalogue raisonné, this fully illustrated study of the donation to the Wakefield Art Gallery can be seen as a companion volume to the two previously published catalogues of the artist's sculptures (See entry in this database).

name: Hennequin, Philippe Auguste
item_t: Philippe-Auguste Hennequin, 1762-1833.
author: Benoit, Jérémie
public_note:
In addition to the introductory texts, the publication contains a chronology, a list of Hennequin's principal students, a genealogy of the artist's family, and documents related to his life and work.  

There are also lists of salons Hennequin participated in, significant sales of his works, and an exhibition list.

name: Henner, Jean Jacque
item_t: Musée national Jean-Jacques Henner : catalogue des peintures.
public_note: This is the revised and expanded edition of the original 1990 catalogue. Although the publication is a collection catalogue and not a catalogue of the artist per se, the Musée national Jean-Jacques Henner houses one of the largest and most important collections of his paintings.

name: Hendee, Stephen
item_t: Stephen Hendee : Ascension.
author_s:
Moos, David, ed.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Griffin, Tim                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Phillips, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Treschel, Gail
imprint: Birmingham, AL : Birmingham Museum of Art ; New York : Distributed Art Publishers, 2003.
public_note: This is the catalogue for an exhibition entitled "Perspectives 7: Stephen Hendee" held at the Birmingham Museum of Art. The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of the artist's built sculptures and constructed environments.  The publication includes a biography of Hendee, lists of solo and group exhibitions, and a list of public collections housing the artist's works.

name: Henner, Jean Jacque
item_t: J. J. Henner : catalogue raisonné.
author: Lannoy, Isabelle de
ind_entr_cont:
Volume 2 ("Maturité, "Hors catalouge H.C.1 - H.C. 42")  lists works from 1881 until 1905.  

The appendices include a discussion of Henner's signatures (not illustrated); as well as listing "fantasy" head studies and  portraits, engravings, works in museums, museums holding the artist's works, and exhibitions.
public_note: The publication also has exhibitions citations, plus a bibliography and index.

name: Henkel, Friedrich B.
item_t: Friedrich B. Henkel : Plastik und Graphik aus den Jahren 1956-1980.
public_note: From the series "Künstlerpodium der Winckelmann-Gesellschaft".

public_note: D. Burmeister Kaaring wrote an "Addenda to the Works of Herman van der Hem" which appeared in "Delineavit et Sculpsit" (July 2009, n.32, pp. 23-36), a journal published by Vrienden van het Prentenkabintet der Rijksuniversiteit te Leiden.

name: Helmer, Roland

public_note:
The catalogue raisonné of the sculptural works is included in the catalogue of the exhibition "Bernhard Heiliger 1915-1995: Kosmos eines Bildhauers," held at the Martin-Gropius-Bau, Berlin and the Museum Würth, Künzelsau. 

The publication, which was produced in association with the Bernhard Heiliger Foundation, includes texts by Rolf Wedewer, Marc Wellmann, and Lothar Romain.

This study is based on two earlier monographs published by Hanns Theodor Flemming in 1962 and Siegried Saltzmann, et al in 1989.

public_note: Chiefly illustrations. Volumes 1 & 2 reproduce the original 1964 and 1965 editions; volume 3 is a new supplement covering Heckel's works from 1963-1968.   The catalogue raisonné lists 465 woodcuts, 400 lithographs and 375 etchings by the artist.

name: Hawkinson, Tim
item_t: Tim Hawkinson Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Barton, Hannah (ed.)
cronology:
Individual entries include title, date, medium, dimensions, exhibitions, references, edition information (in the case of multiples), and some notes. Some entries also provide links to related works.

Provenance information currently is not included in the public catalogue, as this research is still ongoing.
ind_entr_cont:
The online catalogue raisonné by Artifex Press covers the artist's work in all media, including sculptures, paintings, drawings, collages, textiles, and installations.  The catalogue can be searched chronologically, or by medium, motif, or materials.  All works are reproduced with high resolution scalable color images.

The catalogue raisonné lists solo and group exhibitions, and includes a video archive and a bibliography. 

Access to the digital catalogue is available by subscription.
public_note: check_needed

Introductory materials include an essay, an examination of the artist's critical fortunes, a selection of writings on Hayez, a section on color, and an analysis of pictorial issues in Hayez's work. 

In addition to the catalogue of works, there is a section of documents regarding his life and career, and citations of other disbursed and lost paintings, and an Appendix of graphic works.

author: Cortissoz, Royal

name: Hartung, Han
item_t: Hans Hartung : Les estampes - Die Druckgraphik - The Prints.
author: Mason, Rainer Michael
cronology:
Over 600 prints (with respective states) are illustrated. Most images are reproduced in color and are scalable.  In the interactive database, full descriptive notes provide technical information, number, date, medium and support, dimensions, edition size, comparative works, printers, exhibitions, and biographical information.  
Notwithstanding the very comprehensive quality of the  information provided, the author states that this is a work in progress and the site will continue to be expanded.
ind_entr_cont: An online catalogue raisonné based on the collection in Antibes of the Fondation Hans Hartung & Anna-Eva Bergman. The initiative for the catalogue was begun under François Hirs, Director of the Fondation, and is based on Hartung's numbering system plus the catalogue raisonné established by R.M. Mason.  It also includes the work of many collaborators directly associated with the artist during his lifetime.
public_note: check_needed

                                                            Uro, Jean-Luc
public_note: Individual entries give number, title, date, medium and support, dimensions, signatures, archive number, provenance and location information.  Some entries also include exhibitions, bibliographic references, documentary photos, and related works.  Most works are illustrated, but images are not scalable.

author: Schmücking, Rolf

author_s:
Wolfe, Tom (commentary)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brown, J. Carter (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cooper, James F. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goode, James M. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Hoyle, Pamela (catalogue)
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of 110 sculpted works in stone, bronze, plaster and acrylic resin executed from 1968 through 1994. The catalogue lists 8 works still in preparation at the time of publication. 

The catalogue contains numerous essays and a brief biography of the artist.

name: Hart, Frederick
item_t: Frederick Hart : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Turner, Frederick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kuspit, Donald B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hart, Lindy Lain                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hart, Lain                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chase, Robert (preface)
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné includes 204 sculptures by the artist. The publication does not include drawings, sketch models in plaster, or preliminary casts. 

The critical apparatus for the catalogue is provided at the end.  For editioned works, dates for the clay model and for the editions are given.

name: Harrison, Pete
item_t: The Buildings of Peter Harrison : Cataloguing the Work of the First Global Architect, 1716-1775.
author: Millar, John Fitzhugh
imprint: Jefferson, NC : McFarland & Company, Inc., Publishers, 2014.
public_note:
Critical essays about Harrison's work serve as a survey of his career with chapters organized by geographical location. Essays are accompanied by simple line drawings of façades as well as in situ photographs of his buildings. 

The publication also includes a chapter on Harrison's furniture, notes about his training and education, a catalogue of Harrison's personal library of architectural pattern books, and an illustrated glossary of architectural terms.

name: Haring, Keith
item_t: Keith Haring, Editions on Paper, 1982-1990 : das druckgraphische Werk : The Complete Printed Works : l'oeuvre imprimé complet.
author: Littmann, Klaus (editor)
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. Trilingual, with essays in German, English and French. Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Galerie Klaus Littmann, Basel.

name: Haring, Keith

author: Gundel, Marc
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Versicherungskammer Bayern in Munich.  The catalogue contains a checklist of 85 posters by the artist, several of which are illustrated with color thumbnail images.

public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists over 1,600 paintings and collages by the artist by subject: still lifes, landscapes of Algeria and Paris, civic compositions, portraits, nudes, and  'concrete abstractions'.  This publication features four essays on the artist, one written by his daughter, Sylvie Harburger. There is also an index of the artist's distinctions and honors.

The 2001 edition of the catalogue (Hatje Cantz) was titled "Duane Hanson: More than Reality," and accompanied an exhibition organized by the Institut fur Kulturaustausch, Tubingen.

The present catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Arken Museum for Moderne Kunst, Copenhagen and other Scandinavian venues.

The catalogue raisonné covers prints, drawings and watercolors.

public_note: The catalogue was compiled by Montagni.  A French language edition was published by Flammarion in 1976.

name: Hals, Fran
item_t: Frans Hals : The Complete Work.
author: Grimm, Claus
public_note: The somewhat cursory catalogue raisonné lists only 145 authentic, far fewer than Slive's 3 vol. catalogue (see entry in this database).

public_note: This is a definitive study listing 222 authentic paintings, as well as lost works and rejected attributions. The second volume of plates illustrates all paintings catalogued as authentic, in roughly chronological order; lost or dispusted items are by listed chronologically by subject.

name: Hallé, Claude-Guy

author: Chassey, Eric de
imprint: Genève : Musée d'art moderne et contemporain, 2010.
public_note:
The catalogue covers approximately 210 paintings and 255 works on paper (drawings, serigraphs) completed during the artist's decade in Rome. All works are illustrated, they are classified by color, with dimensions given for higth width and depth. Collection information, and bibliographic notes are provided when known.
Missing and destroyed works were redrawn for the catalogue by the artist from her notes.

name: Hagemeister, Karl
item_t: Karl Hagemeister : in Reflexion der Stille : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
author: Warmt, Hendrikje
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist, texts on his artistic development, exhibitions, excerpts from his daybook, and reproduces Hagemeister's short autobiography.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné of the paintings.

name: Hadid, Zaha
item_t: Zaha Hadid : Complete Works.
author: Betsky, Aaron
public_note: This is a revised and expanded edition of "Zaha Hadid : The Complete Buildings and Projects" 1998 (London: Thames & Hudson). The catalogue includes both built and unbuilt plans.

name: Haese, Reinhoud d'
item_t: Reinhoud : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Haese, Reinhoud d'                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Haese, Nicole d'
public_note: The catalogue entries cite number, title, medium, dimensions, collection, exhibitions, and  bibliographic references.

name: Hadid, Zaha
item_t: Zaha Hadid : Complete Works, 1979-2013.
author: Jodidio, Philip
public_note:
This is a revised and more accessible trade edition of "Zaha Hadid: Complete Works, 1979-2009." 

The new edition updates the original  monograph and includes all structures completed in the last decade, plus recent projects. In addition to the buildings themselves, the publication covers furniture and interior designs (with critical texts), as well as the architect's drawings.

name: Haden, Seymou
item_t: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints of Sir Francis Seymour Haden.
author: Schneiderman, Richard S.
public_note: The most recent catalogue of prints by Haden, the founder of the Royal Society of Painter-Etchers (1880). The publication was reprinted by Garton & Co. in 1997. The second edition contains an insert of addenda & errata to the 1983 edition.

name: Hackert, Jacob Philipp
item_t: Jakob Philipp Hackert, 1737-1807 : Verzeichnis seiner Werke.
public_note: Within the series "Acta humaniora." Catalogue raisonné of over 600 of the artist's paintings and drawings, all illustrated in black and white. The catalogue is divided into dated paintings, undated paintings, dated drawings and undated drawings. There is a separate catalogue of rejected works.

name: Hadid, Zaha
item_t: The Complete Zaha Hadid.
author: Betsky, Aaron (intro.)
public_note:
This is the revised and expanded third edition of the 2009 publication (see entry cited in this database). 

The current edition lists over 200 projects, organized chronologically. The publication was produced in collaboration with the architect's office.

name: Haese, Günte

author: Thiel, Pieter J. J. van
public_note: Part 13 from the series "Aetas aurea". The catalogue raisonné lists over 300 autograph paintings; prints after his paintings; oil paintings on paper; and drawings, all organized chronologically by subject. The catalogue also contains a list of lost works mentioned in the documentation, as well as a list of rejected and doubtful attributions.

name: Gutiérrez Solana, José
item_t: José Gutiérrez Solana (1886-1945) : dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author: Salazar, Maria José
public_note:
The author has extensively researched and identified the artist's drawings, notebooks, and other works on paper.  English translations of the texts are provided at the end of the book.

The author has studied and identified the artist's drawings, notebooks, and other works on paper that were exhibited in public, or cited in inventories established after the artist's death by his brother, and others. He also has relied upon related drawings and works (including paintings, drawings, and prints) to correlate dates.  The publication also has a bibliography, which includes writings by Solana, solo and group exhibitions, and examples of the artist's signature.

name: Guttuso, Renato
item_t: Catalogo ragionato generale dei dipinti di Renato Guttuso.
author: Crispolti, Enrico
public_note: The catalogue is organized chronologically, then by theme. There are brief notes with references to related works, explanations of the subject matter, and corrections in dating. The catalogue also includes destroyed works.

name: Guston, Philip

author: Semff, Michael
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was issued in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Staatliche Graphische Sammlung in der Pinakothek der Moderne, Munich.

It is organized chronologically, and is further divided into sections: original works and works of uncertain date; unexamined but possible original works; untraced original works documented by copies or engravings; works by artist's brother, P. A. Guercino; works done close to the artist's circle or replicas; and  attributed works that are doubtful, rejected, or unlocated.

This updated catalogue is based on DVfK publication of  Max J. Friedlaender's seminal 1927 study, the first complete catalogue of Grünewald's drawings documented at the time.

This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Busch Reisinger Museum, Cambridge; the Baushaus-Archiv, Berlin; and the Deutsches Architekturmuseum, Frankfurt/Main.  The catalogue was also published in cooperation with the Architektursammlung der Technischen Universität München.

There is a bibliography, translations, and a name index.

The publication also includes catalogues of sculptures, theater designs, and lost works, as well as an illustrated section on false paintings and drawings.  Texts are in French, but the titles are given in French and English.

The publication was reprinted as a bilingual edition by Wofsy Fine Arts in 2014 (see entry cited in this database)
