author: Wethey, Harold E.
public_note:
A Spanish edition was published in 1967 (Madrid: Guadarrama). The publication contains an essay with illustrations of El Greco's signature, a biography of El Greco's son, Jorge Manuel, and an essay on the artist's workshop. 

Catalogue raisonné lists 287 authentic works, arranged chronologically. It also contains a separate catalogue of 466 copies and wrongful attributions, arranged alphabetically by subject.

name: Greco, El
item_t: L'opera completa del Greco.
public_note: The catalogue was first published in 1969 by Rizzoli in the series "Classici dell'arte", n. 35.   It was re-isssued in the new series of "Classici dell'arte", n.35 in 1978.

name: Greco, El
item_t: El Greco : estudio y catálogo.
author: Álvarez Lopera, José
imprint: Madrid : Fundación de Apoyo a la Historia del Arte Hispánico, 2005-
public_note:
Individual entries include: title, inscriptions, date, collection, provenance, references, and previous catalogues raisonnés that have included the work.  

The chronology in v.1 includes various documents from the artist's life, including the post-mortem inventories of El Greco and Jorge Manuel. There is also a section on texts, including euologistic dedications, published on El Greco (1588-1814).

name: Grcic, Konstantin
item_t: Konstantin Grcic : Panorama.
imprint: Weil am Rhein : Vitra Design Museum, 2014.
public_note: Published on the occasion of a circulating exhibition at the Vitra Design Museum (Weil am Rhein), Z33 (Hasselt, Belgium), and elsewhere, 2014-2016.  In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes essays by Richard Sennett, Peter Sloterdijk, Paola Antonelli, and Mario Carpo.

name: Greenaway, Kate
item_t: Printed Kate Greenaway : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Schuster, Thomas E.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                             Engen, Rodney K.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's book illustrations, greeting cards, and other published works. Also includes a list of posthumous illustrated books.

name: Green, Anthony
item_t: Anthony Green : Painting Life.
imprint: London : Royal Academy of the Arts , New York : ARTBOOK/D.A.P., 2017.
ind_entr_cont: The individual entries feature commentary by the artist.
public_note: Comments

name: Greuter, Matthäu
item_t: The Greuter Family.
imprint: Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel : Sound & Vision Publishers, 2016.
public_note: Issued in the series: :"New Hollstein German Engravings, Etchings and Woodcuts, 1400-1700".  This study on the Greuter family workshop of engravers and print publishers contains a catalogue raisonné of the work of Matthäus Greuter.

name: Greuze, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Oeuvre de J.-B. Greuze : catalogue raisonné.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné, organized by subject, includes paintings and drawings by Greuze as well as engravings and lithographs after Greuze's works by other artists. 

The publication also offers a listing of 18th and 19th-century catalogues noting sales of the artist's work.

name: Groebli, René
item_t: Werkverzeichnis = Catalogue Raisonné : A Personal Selection.
public_note: The pioneering Swiss photographer selected the works himself, which range from his early works, his self-published books, work done in London and Paris, portraits, nudes, and color photographs of 2001- 2002.

name: Greuze, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Greuze.
author_s:
Mauclair, Camille                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marcel, Henry (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Martin, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Masson, Charles
public_note: This study is organized by subject and includes painted works, drawings, and engravings made after the works. There is an introductory section with essays on Greuze's art, life and career.

name: Grard, George
item_t: George Grard : monographie, catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Jole, Marcel van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gheeraert, Marie-Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bentein-Stoelen, Marie-Rose                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            De Keyser, Eugénie
public_note: Bilingual text in Dutch and French; introduction in Dutch, English, French and German.

name: Grandio, Tino
item_t: Tino Grandio (1924-1977).
author: Caruncho, Luis María
imprint: La Coruña [Spain] : Fundación Pedro Barrié de la Maza, 1996.
public_note: The publication includes several preliminary essays about the artist, a biography, and a bibliography. There is a prologue by José Fernando Filgueira Valverde.

name: Graham, Rodney
item_t: Rodney Graham : Works from 1976 to 1994.
author_s:
Graham, Rodney                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            van Balberghe, Emile                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gevaert, Yves                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wall, Jeff
imprint: Toronto : Art Gallery of York University ; Brussels : Y. Gevaert ; Chicago : Renaissance Society of the University of Chicago, 1994.
public_note: Catalogue of a widely circulated exhibition held in the USA, Canada and Italy, 1994-1996.

name: Gramatté, Walte
item_t: Walter Gramatté 1897-1929 : Werkverzeichnis der Ölgemälde= Catalogue Raisonné of the Oil Paintings.

name: Graham, Dan
item_t: Dan Graham : Works, 1965-2000.
author: Brouwer, Marianne
public_note: Published on occasion of the 2001 travelling exhibition organized by the Museu de Arte Contemporanea de Serralves, Porto. This exhibition catalogue also contains a chronological catalogue of the artist's works and writings from 1965-2000. The catalogue was also printed in several foreign language editions.

name: Graham, Robe
item_t: Robert Graham : Works, 1963-1969.
author: König, Walter
imprint: Cologne : Buchhandlung Walther König ; New York : distributed by Wittenenborn & Co., 1970.

name: Graeser, Camille
item_t: Camille Graeser Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Schwarz, Dieter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Paradowski, Stefan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Koella, Rudolf
public_note: Volume 15 from the series "Oeuvrekataloge schweizer Künstler". Volume 3 was published by Offizin Verlag.

name: Gramatica, Antiveduto
item_t: Antiveduto Gramatica.
author: Papi, Gianni
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 97 authentic paintings by the artist. The publication contains separate catalogues of paintings by the artist's followers, as well as lost and unlocated paintings.

name: Götz, Karl-Otto
item_t: K.O. Götz : Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Stroher, Ina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zuschlag, Christoph (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hansmann, Doris                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gehlen, Saskia
public_note: The catalogue was published on the occasion of the artist's 100th birthday. It lists approximately 1,000 authentic paintings, covering works executed from 1937 to 2012.

name: Gómez Campuzano, Ricardo
item_t: Catálogo razonado Ricardo Gómez Campuzano.
author_s:
Gómez de Moreno, Beatriz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guerrero, María Teresa
public_note: The author is the artist's daughter. The catalogue includes examples of the artist's signature.

name: Goyen, Jan van
item_t: Jan van Goyen, 1596-1656 : ein Oeuvreverzeichnis.
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gendt & Co; Doornspijk, The Netherlands : Davaco, 1972-1992.
public_note: Comprehensive catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings and drawings. Volume 4 contains preliminary catalogues of approximately 60 artists in van Goyen's circle. The appendix of vol. 1 includes information on watermarks found on the artist's drawings.

name: Gozzoli, Benozzo
item_t: Benozzo Gozzoli : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Padoa Rizzo, Anna
public_note: From the series "Gigli dell' arte".

name: Goubau, Antoon
item_t: Anton Goubau (1616-1698).
author: Tieze, Agnes
public_note: Originally presented as the author's doctoral dissertation at the Rheinische Freidrich-Wilhelms-Universität Bonn.

name: Gómez Alarcón, Juan Angel
item_t: Juan Angel Gómez Alarcón : un pintor albaceteño en Borja : vida y obra.
author_s:
Martínez Calahorra, Juan Carlos                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gracia Rivas, Manuel (intro.)
imprint: Borja : Centro de Estudios Borjanos, Institución "Fernando el Católico", 2012.
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist and a list of his exhibitions.  This is followed by the catalogue rasionné of Alarcón's paintings and drawings in colored pencil.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya, sa biographie, les fresques, les toitles, les tapisseries, les eaux-fortes et le catalogue de l'oeuvre…".
author: Yriarte, Charles
public_note: There is an index of the engraved illustrations.

name: Gotsch, Friedrich Karl
item_t: Friedrich Karl Gotsch, 1900-1984 : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
public_note: Catalogue sponsored by the F.K. Gotsch Stiftung at the Schleswig-Holsteinisches Landesmuseum.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Goya : étude biographique et critique suivie de l'essai d'un catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre gravé et lithographié.
author: Lefort, Paul
public_note: The texts include a biography of Goya and an essay on his graphic works. The catalogue is divided into two parts: the etchings and the lithographs.  It is not illustrated.

name: Gossaert, Jan
item_t: Man, Myth, and Sensual Pleasures : Jan Gossart's Renaissance : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Ainsworth, Maryan Wynn                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Alsteens, Stijn                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Campbell, Lorne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Orenstein, Nadine M.
imprint: New York : Metropolitan Museum of Art, 2010.
public_note:
Much of the archival documentation has been re-considered or recently discovered.  The catalogue of paintings is arranged by subject matter, there is a list of previous attributions not accepted by the author, copies are covered in the endnotes of the associated entries. Drawings are organized by subject ,with several additions to the oeuvre. Prints (by, after, or said to be after the artist), are given with title, date, medium, impression illustration and locations, with extended essays and comparative illustrations.  

There is an appendix with lists of the works in the exhibition, and a bibliography, index, and photo credits.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya.
author: Lafond, Paul
imprint: Paris : Librarie de l'art ancien et moderne, 1902.
public_note: There is a separate catalogue of the graphic works, which provides titles in Spanish and French, descriptive comments and dimensions.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Francisco de Goya.
author: Loga, Valerian von
public_note: This is the first edition of Loga's study on Goya;  it presents a list of his work, and includes a small bibliography.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Francisco de Goya ; Katalog seines graphischen Werkes.
author: Hofmann, Julius
public_note: Folllowing the introduction, the catalogue of the corpus of Goya's graphic work is presented by series: Caprichos, Tauromaquia, the Proverbs, Disasters of War, original engravings, sheets done after Velzáquez, and lithographs. There is also a section on watermarks.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Francisco de Goya.
author: Mayer, August L.
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, medium, dimensions, collection, comments, and where the work is illustrated.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Tapices de Goya. Advertencia preliminar de Narciso José de Linan y Heredia.
author_s:
Sambricio López, Valentin de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Liñan y Heredia, Narciso José (foreword)
imprint: Madrid : Patrimonio Nacional, Archivo General de Palacio, 1946.
public_note: The publication includes essays on Goya's artistic development; the Royal Tapestry Factory of Sta. Barbara in Madrid; and the representation of Spanish national types or "casticismo" in Goya's tapestry cartoons.  In addition to the catalogue of the tapestry designs, there is an extensive Appendix with documents relating to the history of the Royal Tapestry Factory, commissions, presentations of honors and awards, and correspondence.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Francisco de Goya.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's paintings organized by subject: religious works, history and mythology, portraits, genre, etc.  There are also separate catalogue of Goya's drawings, sketchbooks and graphic works.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: L'oeuvre peint de Goya : catalogue raisonné.
author: Desparmet Fitz-Gerald, Xavière
public_note: Full title: "L'oeuvre peint de Goya: catalogue raisonné, illustré de 447 reproductions, suivies de 34 dessins inédits / ouvrage posthume publié avec un supplément par Mlle Xavière Desparmet Fitz-Gerald".

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Los dibujos de Goya.
author: Sánchez-Cantón, F.J.
public_note: There seem to be additional printings of this title, including one issued by the Prado, with a 1964 imprint.  The full title states that the drawings are reproduced in their original color and size.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya : His Complete Etchings, Aquatints, and Lithographs.
author: Lafuente Ferrari, Enrique
public_note: Catalogue contains a brief biographical sketch of the artist. All plates are illustrated in their original size, except where indicated.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya Engravings and Lithographs.
public_note:
This comprehensive catalogue of Goya's graphic works is based on the work of two earlier catalogues, the first issued in the later 19th C. by Lefort and Delteil's 1922 study.    
This edition also was reprinted under the title: "Goya. Engravings and Lithographs. Complete Illustrated Catalogue" (Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1983).

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Life and Complete Work of Francisco Goya : With a Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings, Drawings & Engravings.
author_s:
Bareau, Juliet Wilson                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lachenal, François (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gassier, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lafuente Ferrari, Enrique (preface)
imprint: New York : Reynal & Co. in assoc. with  William Morrow & Co., Inc., 1971.
public_note: This is a revised English language edition of the original 1970 French publication.  The chronological catalogue raisonné lists 1,870 authentic paintings, drawings, and graphic works.  Each work is illustrated with a b&w thumbnail image.  The publication also lists several lost works known only from prints.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Goya Drawings : The Complete Albums.
public_note: The catalogue is categorized into different stages of Goya's career.  The individual entries include dimensions, materials, technique, inscription information, provenance, watermark information, collector's marks, and concordance.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya, 1746-1828 : Biography, Analytical Study and Catalogue of His Paintings.
author: Gudiol, José
public_note: The catalogue lists 786 paintings. Entries include extensive commentary and bibliography, but do not list detailed provenance or exhibition history. Some entries also include a discussion of the painting's condition. The three volumes of images, divided chronologically, include related illustrations alongside the reproductions of catalogued works.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: The Drawings of Goya : The Sketches, Studies, and Individual Drawings.
author: Gassier, Pierre
public_note: This is the British edition, translated from the original French; a North American edition by Harper & Row was also published in 1975.  The catalogue is divided into three parts: Preliminary Drawings for Paintings, Drawings for Prints and Miscellaneous Drawings.  There is a bibliography and a glossary of Spanish terms.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya, pintor religioso.
author: Morales y Marin, José Luis
imprint: Zaragoza : Diputactión General de Aragón. Departamento de Cultura y Educatión, 1990
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of Goya's religious paintings.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Goya.
author_s:
Guinard, Paul (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Angelis, Rita de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gassier, Pierre (ed.)
public_note: This is a new updated edition of the authors' original 1976 publication.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes essays on Goya and France and on Goya's critical fortunes.  The chronology includes documents related to the artist's life, including his post mortem inventory.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Fran. de Goya.
author: Camón Aznar, José
illustrations: v.1: 49 color, 123 b&w ; v.2: 46 color, 105 b&w; v.3: 64 color, 112 b&w; v.4: 73 color, 106 b&w
public_note: This ia a chronological catalogue raisonné of Goya's paintings, drawings, sketchbooks, and prints.  The publication also contains the artist's testament and correspondence.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Catálogo online de obra de Francisco de Goya.
author_s:
Borrás Gualis, Gonzalo M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calvo Ruata, José Ignacio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lozano López, Juan Carlos                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gallego Garcia, Raquel
public_note: Individual catalogue entries include provenance, comments, exhibition history, bibliographical references, and related works.  There are also links to museums & other organizations housing the work, and hyperlinks to biographical and historical information regarding the sitter or subject depicted.  All works are illustrated in color (if available).

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya : The Complete Etchings and Lithographs.
public_note:
This informative catalogue raisonné of the graphic work is arranged by subject and series.  It is an English language edition of a catalogue published to accompany an exhibition "Goya, grabador" at the Fundación Juan March, Madrid.
Generally following the groupings of Tomás Harris' definitive catalogue raisonné (in this database), this publication, which does not supplant Harris, it is intended for a more general audience.
The extensive commentaries provide good analytical, historical, and stylistic analysis on all the known prints, in one volume.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya : catálogo de la pintura.
author: Morales y Marín, José Luis
imprint: Zaragoza : Real Academia de Nobles y Bellas Artes de San Luis, 1994
illustrations: numerous b&w ills., some color plates
public_note: An English edition was published in 1997 (see entry cited in this database).

name: Goulden, Jean
item_t: Jean Goulden.

name: Goya, Francisco
item_t: Goya : A Catalogue of His Paintings.
author: Morales y Marín, José Luís
imprint: Zaragoza : Real Academia de Nobles y Bellas Artes de San Luis, 1997.
public_note: This is the English translation of the 1994 edition (see entry in the database).   The catalogue was published to coincide with the 250th anniversary of the artist's birth.

name: Gouthière, Pierre
item_t: Pierre Gouthière : Virtuoso Gilder of the French Court.
imprint: New York : The Frick Collection ; London : in assoc. with D. Giles, Ltd., 2016.

name: Graat, Baren
item_t: Barend Graat (1628-1709) : zijn leven en werk.
author: Hut, Margreet van der
public_note: This publication is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of Graat's complete oeuvre.  The texts cover the artist's life and career, as well as a discussion of his critical reception and his artistic patrons. The appendices include documents related to the artist's life.

name: Gordine, Dora
item_t: Dora Gordine : Sculptor, Artist, Designer.

name: Gorin, Jean
item_t: L'oeuvre de Jean Gorin = The Works of Jean Gorin = Das Werk von Jean Gorin.
author: Le Pommeré, Marianne
public_note: This tri-lingual study of the artist's complete oeuvre covers paintings, reliefs, constructions, and architecture.

name: Gorky, Arshile
item_t: The Paintings of Arshile Gorky, a Critical Catalogue.
imprint: New York : New York University Press, 1982.
public_note: The authors' critical essays preface the catalogue raisonné.  There is also an Appendix with a list of exhibitions held during the artist's lifetime.

name: González Velázquez, Zacaría
item_t: Zacarías González Velázquez, 1763-1834.
author: Núñez, Bertha
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the complete paintings and drawings. The catalogue lists 386 paintings (including those lost or destroyed) that are securely in the artist's oeuvre; 25 works that are attributed to him; and 44 rejected attributions. The catalogue also lists 28 authentic drawings, 8 rejected drawings, and 14 graphic works.

name: Gordigiani, Michele
item_t: Michele Gordigiani.
author: Borselino, Gaspare
public_note: After introductory essays and the color plates, there is a catalogue with illustrations of the paintings, details of which are presented in a separate chronological list.  The publication also includes an appendix with listings of exhibitions, auction and gallery sales, bibliography, and a list of public and private collections housing the artist's works.

name: González-Torres, Félix
item_t: Félix Gonzáles-Torres.
author: Elger, Dietmar
imprint: Ostfildern-Ruit : Cantz Verlag; New York :  distributed by DAP, 1997.
public_note: Catalogue of exhibition at: Sprengel Hannover ; Kunstverein St. Gallen Kunstmuseum; Museum Moderner Kunst Stiftung Ludwig Wien.

name: Gonet, Jean de
item_t: Jean de Gonet, catalogue raisonné : 1971-1982.
author_s:
Le Bars, Fabienne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gonet, Jean de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vrain, Jean-Claude

name: Goncharova, Natalia
item_t: Natalia Gontcharova : son oeuvre, entre tradition et modernité
author: Bazetoux, Denise
public_note:
To be completed in 3 volumes. See in-process entry for information on forthcoming volumes. 

The catalogue discusses the artist's works with particular attention to her role in the evolution of pictorial expression towards Modernism, and examines how she worked between traditional and avant-garde modes including Cubism, Futurism, and Abstraction. The author cites new scientific techniques and major estate gifts to the Pompidou Museum as a basis for authentication.

name: Gonzalès, Eva
item_t: Eva Gonzalès, 1849-1883 : étude critique et catalogue raisonné.
public_note: Catalogue of the artist's paintings, drawings, and pastels. Reproduces notes on her retrospective exhibition of 1885, and the sale of her atelier (including photographs of the paintings for sale). Indexes private collectors and museums holding her works.

name: Goltzius, Hendrick
item_t: Hendrick Goltzius : Drawings Rediscovered, 1962-1992 : Supplement to "Die Zeichnungen von Hendrick Goltzius" (1961).
author: Reznicek, Emil Karel Josef
imprint: New York : Master Drawings Association ; Boston : Ars Libri, 1993.
public_note: The first part of the supplement deals with drawings organized by subject matter (Biblical themes, profane allegories, Roman studies, portraits, landscapes, etc.).  The second part covers drawings of doubtful attribution, and the third has a few corrigenda to the original 1961 catalogue, followed by an index. There is a key to abbreviations used in the bibliographic references.

name: Goltzius, Hendrick
item_t: Die Zeichnungen von Hendrick Goltzius. Mit einem beschreibenden Katalog.
author: Reznicek, E. K. J.
public_note: The publication includes 449 drawings, listed by subject matter (biblical themes, classical and antique, Roman studies, portraits, etc.). The plates are presented  in chronological order, however.   In addition to the catalogue of authentic drawings, the publication includes 14 doubtful works, 86 unlocated drawings, 19 misattributed drawings from older sales catalogues, and over 100 rejected attributions.  Detailed entries include number, title, date, size, medium, signature, information found on the verso, bibliographic and exhibition references, and notes.

name: Goldsworthy, Andy
item_t: The Andy Goldsworthy Project.
imprint: New York : Thames & Hudson ; Washington : In Association with National Gallery of Art, 2010.
public_note: The catalogue includes essays by Martin Kemp and Carolyn Forche, as well as an essay titled "Government Island: Photographic Suite and Washington Diary" by Andy Goldsworthy.

name: Goldstein, Zv
item_t: The Limits of My Knowledge : Works 1969-2014.
author_s:
Goldstein, Zvi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schmidt, Johannes (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Meyer-Hermann, Eva (ed.)
public_note: The publication was issued in conjunction with the Israel Museum, Jerusalem.  The bilingual catalogue raisonné lists approximately 230 conceptual artworks the artist created between 1969 and 2014, all illustrated.  The texts include a series of conversations with Goldstein on his working methods.

name: Goltzius, Hendrick
item_t: The Paintings of Hendrick Goltzius : (1558-1617) : A Monograph and Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Nichols, Lawrence W.
illustrations: 207 plates, of which 145 are in color
public_note:
The publication includes a biography of the artist with a discussion of his artistic style. The catalogue raisonné includes 59 paintings by Goltzius, organized by subject. The catalogue also lists 160 paintings known only from documents and 38 rejected works. 

The appendix includes numerous documents relating to Goltzius' life and work reproduced in their original language.

name: Goltzius, Hendrick
item_t: [Goltzius] The New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish Etchings, Engravings and Woodcuts 1450-1700 : Henrick Goltzius.
imprint: Sound & Vision Publishers : Ouderkerk aan den IJssel ; Amsterdam : Rijksprentenkabinett, Rijksmuseum, 2012.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: L'oeuvre de Vincent van Gogh : catalogue raisonné.
author: Faille, J.-B. de la
public_note: The original catalogue raisonné by de la Faille. See also other updated and subsequent catalogues on the artist, listed in this database.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh.
author_s:
Faille, J.B. de la                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Terrasse, Charles (foreword)
public_note: This is a revised edition of the author's 1928 catalogue raisonné (see entry cited in this database). French and German language editions were issued simultaneously (Paris: Hyperion).

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: The Works of Vincent van Gogh : His Paintings and Drawings.
author_s:
Faille, J.-B. de la                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hammacher, A.M.
imprint: New York : Reynal & Company, in association. with Morrow, 1970.
public_note:
The catalogue was published in 1928 under the title: "L'œuvre de Vincent van Gogh, catalogue raisonné" (cited in this database). A second English edition was published by Hyperion in 1939.  

De la Faille had been working on updating his catalogue at the time of his death in 1959, after which an editorial board was established in 1961 to continue work on a revised, augmented and annotated edition by a committee under A.M. Hammacher (published in 1970).  De la Faille also published a work specifically devoted to fakes, "Les faux van Gogh" (Paris: G. van Ouest, 1930).

name: Goetz, Henri Bernard
item_t: Henri Goetz : catalogue raisonné : peintures, oeuvres sur papier.
author_s:
Nocera, Frederic                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goetz, Henri                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Picabia, Francis
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 783 paintings and works on paper, all illustrated with thumbnail images.

name: Godwin, Edward William
item_t: The Secular Furniture of E .W. Godwin with a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Soros, Susan Weber
imprint: New Haven : Yale University Press for The Bard Graduate Center, 1999.
public_note: The five sections of the catalogue raisonné are arranged chronologically.  This catalogues all known examples of Godwin's secular furniture designs by furniture type: Chairs, Tables, Cabinets, and Miscellaneous Pieces.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh : Samtliche Gemälde.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: L'opera pittorica completa di van Gogh e i suoi nessi grafici.
author: Lecaldano, Paolo
public_note: From the series "Classici dell'arte". Catalogue of the paintings and drawings, all illustrated in black and white thumbnails. Contains excerpts from the artist's correspondence (in Italian).

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh Drawings. Volume 4 (pt. 1 - pt. 2) : Arles, Saint-Rémy and Auvers-sur-Oise.
author_s:
Vellekoop, Marije                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zwikker, Roelie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hageman, Monique
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gogh Museum ; London ; Burlington, VT : Lund Humprhies, 2007
public_note:
This is the fourth and final volume of the drawings catalogue. Part 1 of the catalogue raisonné covers catalogue numbers 323-395; part 2 covers nos. 396-496.   The catalogue is organized by location where executed (Arles, Saint-Remy and Auvers-sur-Oise), and then by subject.  The Appendix discusses doubtful works, changed datings, and new acquisitions.  

The fourth volume contains a comprehensive indices of titles, names, and concordances with vols. 1-4.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh Drawings. Volume 3 : Antwerp & Paris, 1885-1888.
author_s:
Van Heugten, Sjraar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vellekoop, Marije                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hageman, Monique                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zwikker, Roelie
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gogh Museum; London : Lund Humphries, 2001.
public_note: The catalogue include all 116 drawings that Van Gogh executed in Antwerp and Paris, all illustrated.  Entries include title, date, references, exhibitions, technical information, and comments.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh Drawings. Volume 2 : Nuenen 1883-85.
author: Heughten, Sjraar
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gogh Museum ; London : Lund Humphries, 1997.
public_note: Catalogue entries include title, date, provenance, exhibitions, literature, concordance, signature, media, and extensive comments.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: The Vincent van Gogh Gallery.
author: Brooks, David
imprint:
English                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            French                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dutch                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            German                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Italian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Spanish
cronology: Entries include comments, provenance, exhibition history, and hyperlinked references to related works and letters.  A complete list of those works for which there are extensive entries can be found under the "InSites" heading.
ind_entr_cont: This pioneering online catalogue raisonné was released in 1996. The comprehensive site includes Van Gogh's paintings, drawings, letters, letter sketches, and graphic works, building a virtually complete inventory of over 4,300 documents pertaining to the artist's work.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh Drawings. Volume 1: The Early Years 1880-83.
author: Heughten, Sjraar van
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gogh Museum ; London : Lund Humphries ; Wappinger Falls, NY : Distributed in USA by Antique Collectors Club, 1996-
public_note: The publication is a comprehensive catalogue of all drawings by Van Gogh in the Rijksmuseum Vincent van Gogh in Amsterdam.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh Paintings. Volume 2 : Antwerp and Paris, 1885-1888.
imprint: Farnham, Surrey ; Burlington, VT : Lund Humphries ; Amsterdam : Van Gogh Museum, 2011.
public_note: The catalogue contains essays on Van Gogh's working practice; a discussion of his paints and pigments; paper and primed canvas supports; canvas sizes; a conservation history of the collection; and an essay on reused pictures.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh Paintings. Volume 1: Dutch Period 1881-1885.
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gogh Museum ; London : Lund Humphries, 1999.
public_note: Rijksmuseum Vincent van Gogh, Amsterdam, collection catalogue to be completed in 7 v.: Drawings 4 v.-- Paintings 3 v.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: The New Complete Van Gogh : Paintings, Drawings, Sketches.
author: Hulsker, Jan
imprint: Amsterdam : J.M. Meulenhoff;  Philadelphia : John Benjamins Publishing Co., 1996.
public_note:
A revised and enlarged reworking of Hulsker's earlier catalogue raisonné: "The Complete Van Gogh," first published in  English by Harry N. Abrams, NY, 1980. 
This book includes a concordance with J.-B. de la Faille's catalogue raisonné.  

The publication excludes 30 works listed in de la Faille's catalogue that the author did not believe to be authentic. Several other doubtful attributions are also omitted. Individual entries are discussed within the text.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Vincent van Gogh : The Years in France : Complete Paintings 1886-1890.
author: Feilchenfeldt, Walter
public_note: The catalogue presents all of Van Gogh's paintings (approx. 580) executed in France.  The author notes that 21 small paintings from the French period housed in the Van Gogh Museum are not included in this catalogue, but can be found in Vol. 2 of the catalogue by the Van Gogh Museum.

name: González, Bartolomé
item_t: Juan Pantoja de la Cruz y sus seguidores : B. González, R. de Villandrando y A. López Polanco.
author: Kusche, Maria
public_note: This is an enlarged and updated edition of the study originally published in 1964 by Castalia (see entry in this database).

name: González, Beatriz
item_t: Catálogo razonado de Beatriz González.
author_s:
González, Beatriz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Banco de Archivos de Artes en Colombia (BADAC)
cronology: Catalogue entries include: title, file number, dimensions, medium, citation, exhibitions, and bibliographic information.  Many entries also include references source images, and related works.
ind_entr_cont: An online catalogue issued under the aegis of the Universidad de los Andes (Colombia), 2018.

name: González, Beatriz
item_t: Beatriz González : una pintora de provincia.
author_s:
Caldrón, Marta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ponce de León, Carolina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Traba, Marta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mareno-Durán, R.H.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's paintings, sculptures, works on paper, prints, and mixed media from 1962-1988.

name: Gogh, Vincent van
item_t: Van Gogh : The Complete Paintings.
public_note: Issued within the series Bibliotheca Universalis. This is the most recent English edition of the authors' original 2-volume 1989 German language publication (see entry cited in this database).  Previous English editions were published in 1993, 2001, 2006, and 2010.

name: González, Daniel
item_t: El escultor Daniel González.
public_note: Following the introduction and other essays, there is a small chronological catalogue raisonné section, divided between sculpture, drawings, and a few paintings.

name: González, Julio
item_t: Julio González : catalogue raisonné des sculptures.
author_s:
Merkert, Jörn                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Llorens, Thomas (Preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rowell, Margit (Introduction)

name: González, Julio
item_t: Julio González : catálogo general razonado de las pinturas, esculturas y dibujos. v. 3: 1920-1929.
author: Llorens Serra, Tomás
imprint: Madrid : Fundación Azcona ; Valencia : IVAM, Institut d'Art Modern, 2013.
public_note: The third volume lists approximately 300 works by the artist.

name: González, Julio
item_t: Julio González, dessins.
author: Gibert, Josette
public_note: For each work, basic title, medium, support, dimensions, inscriptions, signature and date information is provided when known, however, there are no bibliographic references.

name: González, Julio
item_t: Julio González : catálogo general razonado de las pinturas, esculturas y dibujos. v.2: 1912-1923.
author: Llorens Serra, Tomás
imprint: Madrid : Fundación Azcona ; Valencia : IVAM, Institut d'Art Modern, 2010.
public_note:
An introductory section gives brief biographical and historical information concerning the artist's production. In addition, some pieces receive detailed commentaries, making this not only a catalogue raisonné, but a critical and considered account of the artist's work. 

The catalogue includes 733 works, all reproduced in color

name: González, Julio
item_t: Julio González : catálogo general razonado de las pinturas, esculturas y dibujos. v.1: 1900-1918.
author: Llorens Serra, Tomás
imprint: Madrid : Fundación Azcona ; Valencia : IVAM, Institut Valencia d'Art Modern, 2007-
public_note:
The first of 7 projected volumes cataloging  González's complete oeuvre of approximately 4,000  artworks.

The first volume catalogues 508 drawings, sculptures and paintings, arranged chronologically. The titles are given in French with Spanish and English translations.

name: Godward, John William
item_t: John William Godward : The Eclipse of Classicism.
author: Swanson, Vern G.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists 565 watercolors and paintings in oil, organized by year. Underscored titles indicate that there is a known reproduction of the work.

name: Glankoff, Sam
item_t: Sam Glankoff Online Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Glankoff, Sam
cronology: The catalogue raisonné is listed under the category "Artwork".  The catalogue is organized chronologically, then by medium and subject.
public_note: Individual entries give title, date, medium and support, inventory number, dimensions, and collection information. All works are illustrated in color.

name: Glöckner, Hermann
item_t: Glöckner : Gemälde und Zeichnungen, 1904-1945 : Werkverzeichnis…
author_s:
Dittrich, Christian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schmidt, Werner                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heise, Bernd                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schmidt, Sebastian
public_note:
This is a catalogue of an exhibition held at the Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staatliche Kunstsammlungen Dresden, 2010.  The catalogue was published in conjunction with the Kupferstich-Kabinett der Staatlichen Kunstsammlungen Dresden and the Nachlass Hermann Glöckner. 

The catalogue raisonné of the paintings and drawings is by Christian Dittrich; Werner Schmidt compiled the catalogue of the photographs.

name: Gleizes, Albe
item_t: Albert Gleizes : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Georgel, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Roche-Gleizes, Juliette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Varichon, Anne (edited by)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Robbins, Daniel (begun by)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 2,500 works, all illustrated in mostly color thumbnails. The publication contains an essay on authentication problems in Gleizes's work, with a discussion of his workshop.

name: Gober, Robe
item_t: Robert Gober Sculptures and Installations, 1979-2007.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Schaulager Basel (ISBN: 96783952296752).

name: Gleyre, Charle
item_t: Charles Gleyre, 1806-1874.
author: Hauptman, William
imprint: Zurich : Swiss Institute for Art Research ; Princeton : Princeton University Press ; Basel : Wiese Publishing, Ltd., 1996.
public_note:
The chronological catalogue raisonné lists over 1,100 paintings, drawings, and watercolors.  The 

The Appendix cotains brief biographies of Gleyre's students.

name: Glajcar, Angela
item_t: Angela Glajcar.
public_note: When the work is part of a series, the number is used for more precise information (for recent work the number follows the series name as part of the title).

name: Girtin, Thoma
item_t: The Art of Thomas Girtin : with a Catalogue and 109 Illustrations.
public_note: The texts were written by Loshak and are based on his Master's thesis, presented at New York University in 1950.  The catalogue raisonné is based on Thomas Girtin's own record of paintings.

name: Girardon, Franço
item_t: Girardon : biographie et catalogue critiques, l'oeuvre complète de l'artiste.
author: Francastel, Pierre
imprint: Paris : Les beaux- arts, Édition d'etudes et de documents, 1928.
public_note: A biography and catalogue raisonné.  The full text digitized catalogue is available on the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's website (see Full Text link on this page).

name: Girardon, Franço
item_t: François Giradon (1623-1715) : le sculpteur de Louis XIV.
author_s:
Maral, Alexandre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            de La Moureyre, Françoise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pégard, Catherine (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bresc-Bautier, Geneviève (preface)
public_note: Dated or datable sculptures and undated works -- sketches and preparatory models, both dated or datable and undated -- antique sculptures (or reputed as such) which were completed by Giradon -- bronzes executed or presumed to have been done after the artist's models or under his direction, both dated or datable and undated -- ephemeral works.

name: Giotto
item_t: Giotto : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Bandera Bistoletti, Sandrina
public_note: From the series "Gigli dell'arte", n.2.

name: Girolamo da Treviso the Younge
item_t: Girolamo da Treviso.
public_note: The crititcal texts include a biographical essay, and discussions of the Treviso's artistic development and critical fortunes.  The catalogue raisonné is divided into separate catalogues: authentic paintings; authentic drawings; doubtful attributions; and rejected works.  There is also a bibliography and indices of places and names.

name: Girard, Alexander Hayden
item_t: Alexander Girard : A Designer's Universe.
imprint: Weil am Rhein : Vitra Design Museum, 2016.

name: Giorgione
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Giorgione.
public_note: The catalogue lists 85 authentic paintings by Giorgione, and includes works mentioned in historical documents. The publication also includes a brief essay on Giorgione's followers.

name: Giotto
item_t: L'opera completa di Giotto.
public_note: This title (copyright 1966) was issued in Rizzoli's "Classici dell'arte" series.  There have been numerous reprintings of the title over the years, most editions appear to have the same information.

name: Gilot, Françoise
item_t: Stone Echoes : Original Prints by Françoise Gilot : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Yoakum, Mel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tremper Barnes, Lisa (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mourlot, Jacques (foreword)
imprint: Collegeville, PA : Philip and Muriel Berman Museum at Ursinus College, 1995.
public_note: Published in conjunction with a traveling exhibition held at the Philip and Muriel Berman Museum of Art; the Jean Paul Slusser Gallery; and the Muskegon Museum of Art. Includes a glossary of printing terms.

name: Gimmi, Wilhelm
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre lithographié de Wilhelm Gimmi.
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. Catalogue raisonné of the lithographs and engravings. The publication also contains a brief study of Gimmi's paintings written by Georges Peillex.

name: Gilot, Françoise
item_t: Françoise Gilot : oeuvres, 1984-2010.
author_s:
Gilot, Françcoise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Engel, Aurélia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Haskell, Barabara

name: Giordano, Luca
item_t: Luca Giordano : nuove richerche e inediti.
public_note: This supplements the author's earlier catalogue raisonné with new and previously unpublished research.

name: Gionima, Simone
item_t: Simone Gionima, 1655-1731.
author: Zapletalová, Jana
public_note: The texts of the catalogue raisonné are in Italian with English and Czech summaries.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné of Simone Gionima, there is a separate section dedicated to the works of Jan and Francesco Gionima.  The catalogue includes a genealogical table.

name: Gimmi, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Gimmi : catalogue raisonné des peintures.
author: Peillex, Georges
public_note: Chiefly illustrations with a brief biography of the artist. The catalogue raisonné lists approx. 1,320 paintings by the artist, all illustrated in black and white.  Publication includes a page with examples of the artist's signature.

name: Giorgione
item_t: Giorgione : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Torrini, Annalisa
public_note: From the series "I Gigli dell'arte". The catalogue raisonné lists 26 authentic paintings by Giorgione. It also contains separate lists of  doubtful attributions and rejected works.

name: Giordano, Luca
item_t: Luca Giordano.
public_note: This is a revised edition of Ferrari's seminal study on the artist's work, originally published in 1966. This new catalogue, the index of which has doubled since the first publication, includes sections on the artist's critical fortunes, his circle and further material from newly examined sources (a reprint of the new edition was also issued c. 2000).

name: Giorgione
item_t: Giorgione : The Painter of "Poetic Brevity" : Including a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Mellor, Barbara  (index)
public_note: Originally published in Paris by Editions de la Lagune, 1996.  The publicaiton includes catalogues of authentic works; controversial attributions; copies and engravings after Giorgione; and rejected attributions.

name: Giorgione
item_t: Giorgione : Mystery Unveiled : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Eller, Wolfgang L.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pendl, Ingeborg Elizabeth
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 27 paintings and 13 drawings by the artist, as well as 7 paintings executed in collaboration with Giorgione. The publication also contains separate catalogues of  works known only through copies and rejected attributions.

name: Giotto
item_t: Giotto.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes essays on Giotto's life and works, Vasari's "Life of Giotto" (in Italian), an anthology of the artist's critical fortunes, and Giotto's poem "Canzone sopra la povertà".

name: Gironcoli, Bruno
item_t: Bruno Gironcoli, die Skulpturen : 1956-2008.
public_note:
This is an overview of 50 years of the artist's work. It contains a preface, a biography, and various other essays. The publication also includes the artist's writings, as well as previously unpublished interviews from 1994-1995.

The bilingual catalogue raisonné lists all of Gironcoli's sculptures, as well as mixed media pieces and environments, small works, some prints, multiples, and fragments.

name: Gill, Eric
item_t: Eric Gill : The Engravings.
author: Shelton, Christopher (editor)
public_note: Mainly illustrations. Based on an earlier limited edition "The Engravings of Eric Gill", 1983. Also contains checklist of books containing his engravings.

name: Gill, Eric
item_t: Eric Gill : The Sculpture.
author: Collins, Judith
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 300 sculptures by the artist, all illustrated. Individual entries also include the names of Gill's apprentices; preparatory drawings where known; and inscriptions (translated into English). The catalogue excludes floral or decorative relief sculptures, including heraldic shields.

name: Gille, Sighard
item_t: Sighard Gille : ruhelos : Werkverzeichnis der Malerei.
author_s:
Schmidt, Hans-Werner (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bussmann, Frédéric (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schneede, Uwe M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Arrieta, Katrin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goderecci, Valeria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gilla, Ina
imprint: Leipzig : Museum der bildenden Künste Leipzig : e.A. Seemann, in der Seemann Henschle Gmbh &Co. KG, 2016.
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at the Museum der bildenden Künste Leipzig in 2017.  The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Ina Gilla.

name: Gille, Sighard
item_t: Sighard Gille : Druckgrafik : Werkverzeichnis 1966-2010.

name: Gil de Castro, José

Majluf, Natalia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Acuña, Constanza                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Amigo Cerisola, Roberto
imprint: Lima : Asociación Museo de Arte de Lima, MALI, 2014.

name: Gildor, Jacob
item_t: Ya'kov Gildor.

Ahronson, Meir                                                            ;&nbsp
