                                                            Gildor, Jacob                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Muzeon le-omanut Yisreelit
public_note:
Title not viewed, but according to the entry in the BnF catalogue général (Paris) the verso of the title page states: "Exhibition for the occasion of the publication of the books in the Israeli Art Museum, Gamat-Gan, Israel, September 2009-January 2010".

The publication is credited as follows:
London [UK]; San Rafael (CA) : Gilden's Arts, 2009.

name: Gifford, Robert Swain
item_t: R. Swain Gifford : A Catalogue of Etchings, 1865-1891.
author: Wright, David G.
imprint: New Bedford, MA : New Bedford Whaling Museum, 2002.
public_note: The publication contains an inventory of etchings, a list of undated or not fully identified plates, and examples of Gifford's signature. There is also a list of major art exhibitions from 1868-1892 that included Gifford's etchings and a list of publications with illustrations by the artist.

name: Gilbert and George
item_t: Gilbert & George : The Complete Pictures, 1971-2005.
public_note: Co-edition with Aperature Foundation, New York. The catalogue is chiefly illustrations.

name: Gilbert and George
item_t: Gilbert & George : Art Titles 1969-2010 in Alphabetical Order.
author_s:
Obrist, Hans Ulrich, ed.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Philbrick, Inigo, ed.
imprint: Cologne : Walter König ; New York : D.A.P., 2011.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the titles of the artists' works, including performance pieces, books, pictures, and postcards, from the 1970s until the present. The titles are presented alphabetically as a continuous poetical index.

name: Giebel, Heinrich
item_t: Heinrich Giebel, 1865-1951.

name: Gifford, Sanford Robinson
item_t: A Memorial Catalogue of the Paintings of Sanford Robinson Gifford, N.A., with a Biographical and Critical Essay…"
author: Weir, John F.
imprint: New York : Press of F. Hart & Co., 1881.
public_note: Numbers in brackets refer to number in the catalogue of the second Loan Exhibition of 160 of Gifford's works held at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in 1881.

name: Gilbert and George
item_t: The Postcard Art of Gilbert & George, 1972-1989 : The Urethra Postcard Art of Gilbert & George.
public_note:
Vol. 1 lists approximately 470 postcard sculptures, organized by year and illustrated with full page color plates. Vol. 2 contains 564 new postcard pictures, the so-called Urethra postcard works.  

Each volume is preceded by an essay by Michael Bracewell.

name: Giacometti, Diego
item_t: Diego Giacometti.
imprint: New York : H.N. Abrams ; Paris : Hermann, 1987.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the bronzes and plasters was begun in 1984 with the artist's collaboration. The publication omits Diego and Alberto Giacometti's joint projects from the years prior to World War II. There is a brief discussion of Diego Giacometti's signatures and monograms.

name: Gignous, Eugenio
item_t: Eugenio Gignous.
author: Colombo, Nicoletta
public_note: An introductory section covers the historical period and a discussion of the artist's career. This is followed by an illustrated catalogue raisonné.  Appendices include a biography of the artist, a list of exhibited works from 1870 to 1984, a list of works held in public collections, and bibliographic references.

name: Giani, Felice
item_t: Felice Giani (1758-1823) e la cultura di fine secolo.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings, pictorical cycles, and drawings. The catalogues of the pictorial cycles and drawings are arranged by location; the catalogue of 68 paintings arranged chronologically.

name: Giacometti, Alberto
item_t: Giacometti : The Complete Graphics and 15 Drawings.
author_s:
Lust, Herbert C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Taylor, John Lloyd (intro.)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition organized by the Milwaukee Art Center. The catalogue lists all known lithographs; etchings; illustrated books, including all 150 plates from the book "Paris sans fin"; and 15 drawings.

name: Giacometti, Alberto
item_t: Alberto Giacometti : catalogue raisonné des estampes.
author_s:
Kornfeld, Eberhard W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stauffer, Christine E.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lecuyer-Maille´, Matilde (intro.)
imprint: Paris : Fondation Giacometti ; Bern : Editions Galerie Kornfeld, 2016-

name: Giacometti, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Giacometti : 1868-1933.
author_s:
Schwarz, Dieter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Giacometti, Bruno (Intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Müller, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Radlach-Kreis, Viola
public_note:
Number 16 from the series "Oeuvrekataloge Schweizer Künstler". Volume 1 is by Dieter Schwarz. The second volume, in two parts, is by Paul Müller and Viola Radlach-Kreis.

The catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically. There is a separate catalogue of undated works, and a register of works known only through Giacometti's sketches. The publication also illustrates examples of the artist's signature, and includes a technical essay on Giacometti's painting technique and materials by Danièle Gros.

name: Giacometti, Alberto
item_t: Giacometti : The Complete Graphics.
author_s:
Lust, Herbert C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Taylor, John Lloyd (Intro.)
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1991.
public_note:
A revised edition of the 1970 catalogue raisonné, with a supplement by Alan Wofsy.
This covers the lithographs, etchings, portfolios, illustrated books, and miscellaneous graphic works.

name: Giacometti, Bruno
item_t: Bruno Giacometti erinnert sich : Gespräche mit Felix Baumann mit einem Werkverzeichnis von Roland Firschknecht.
public_note:
Publication contains an interview of Bruno Giacometti by Felix Baumann, President of the Alberto Giacometti Stiftung in Zurich.

The catalogue includes a list of Giacometti's building projects, as well as a list of all of the works donated to Swiss museums by Bruno and Odette Giacometti.

name: Giacometti, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Giacometti : das graphische Werk.
author: Stauffer, Christine E.
public_note: Catalogue includes examples of the artist's signature.

name: Giambologna
item_t: Giambologna, the Complete Sculpture.
author: Avery, Charles
public_note:
Comprehensive monograph with a summary catalogue raisonné of all of the artist's works.  The catalogue includes sculptures in bronze, marble, and wood; relief sculptures; drawings and models, arranged by chronologically by media.

Many of the photographs were especially commissioned for this edition, from David Finn, a renowned photographer of sculpture.

name: Gianquinto, Alberto
item_t: Alberto Gianquinto : catalogo generale dei diptini dal 1947 al 2003.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication contains a brief biography of Alberto Gianquinto with a discussion of his critical fortunes.

name: Giambono
item_t: Michele Giambono, a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Land, Norman Earl, Jr.
public_note: Individual entries include inscriptions, condition information, dimensions, and materials.  Many of the entries also include extensive descriptive and historical commentary.

name: Giaquinto, Corrado
item_t: Corrado Giaquinto : noto per il suo valore nella pittura.
author: Amato, Pietro
imprint: Molfetta : Centro molfettese di studi e documentazione Corrado Giaquinto, 2002.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists Giaquinto's early works in Molfetta. The catalogue includes 26 authentic paintings, most illustrated with color plates.  The Appendices list lost paintings, attributed works, and rejected attributions, most illustrated with black and white thumbnail images.

The publication also inludes a genealogical table of the artist's family, documents related to  Giaquinto's life, and critical commentary on his work.

name: Ghisolfi, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Ghisolfi, 1623-168 3: un pittore milanese di rovine romane.

name: Ghirlandaio, Domenico
item_t: Domenico Ghirlandaio : Art and Artisan.
author: Cadogan, Jean K.
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 2000.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné of 114 frescoes, panel paintings, drawings, and several minor arts by Domenico Ghirlandaio. There is a separate catalogue of lost paintings; copies after Ghirlandaio; and erroneously attributed drawings. 

The publication also contains a separate catalogue raisonné of 13 works by Davide Ghirlandaio with an essay on connosseurship issues in drawings attributed to Davide.

name: Ghisi, Giorgio
item_t: The Engravings of Giorgio Ghisi.
author_s:
Boorsch, Suzanne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lewis, Michal                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lewis, R.E.
imprint: New York : The Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1984.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of authentic works, there are catalogues of attributed and rejected works.  There is a separate section dealing with watermarks found on Ghisi's engravings.  The Appendix includes summaries Ghisi's correspondence, a list of his publishers, and an essay on the French Royal Privilege for printed works. The publication also contains a concordance with Bartsch.

name: Ghirlandaio, Domenico
item_t: Domenico Ghirlandaio.
author: Kecks, Ronald G.
public_note: Complete catalogue raisonné of the artist's painted works.  The fresco projects and cycles are listed as one entry.

name: Gheyn III, Jacques de
item_t: Jacques de Gheyn, Three Generations.
author: Regteren Altena, I. Quirijn van
imprint: The Hague ; Boston : N. Nijhoff Publishers; Hingham, MA : Distributors for US and Canada, Kluwer, Boston, 1983
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné covers works by all three de Gheyns, but the major portion covers over 1000 works by Jacques de Gheyn II, grouped by subject matter. The plates volume is presented in chronological order (and includes the addenda).

The reader is advised to carefully read the author's Explanatory Note to fully understand how "this somewhat complicated book" is organized.  The critical apparatus has good, sometimes extensive, comments, and there are numerous references to sales, old collections and the literature.

name: Gheyn I, Jacques de
item_t: Jacques de Gheyn, Three Generations.
author: Regteren Altena, I. Quirijn van
imprint: The Hague ; Boston : N. Nijhoff Publishers; Hingham, MA : Distributors for US and Canada, Kluwer, Boston, 1983
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné covers works by all three de Gheyns, but the major portion covers over 1000 works by Jacques de Gheyn II, grouped by subject matter. The plates volume is presented in chronological order (and includes the addenda).

The reader is advised to carefully read the author's Explanatory Note to fully understand how "this somewhat complicated book" is organized.  The critical apparatus has good, sometimes extensive, comments, and there are numerous references to sales, old collections and the literature.

name: Gheyn II, Jacques de
item_t: Jacques de Gheyn, Three Generations.
author: Regteren Altena, I. Quirijn van
imprint: The Hague ; Boston : N. Nijhoff Publishers; Hingham, MA : Distributors for US and Canada, Kluwer, Boston, 1983
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné covers works by all three de Gheyns, but the major portion covers over 1000 works by Jacques de Gheyn II, grouped by subject matter. The plates volume is presented in chronological order (and includes the addenda).

The reader is advised to carefully read the author's Explanatory Note to fully understand how "this somewhat complicated book" is organized.  The critical apparatus has good, sometimes extensive, comments, and there are numerous references to sales, old collections and the literature.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Géricault : etude biographique et critique, avec le catalogue raisonné l'oeuvre du maitre.
author: Clément, Charles
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist with a separate discussion of his sculptures and lithographs.

name: Genzken, Isa
item_t: Isa Genzken : 1992-2003 ; Ausstellungen, Arbeiten, Werkverzeichnis = Exhibitions, Works, Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held the Kunsthalle Zürich and Städtisches Museum Abteiberg, Mönchengladbach, Germany. In addition to the catalogue, there is a biography, followed by a list of exhibitions, and a bibliography.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Gerstl, Richard
item_t: Richard Gerstl (1883-1908) : Beiträge zur Dokumentation seines Lebens und Werkes.
author: Kallir, Otto
public_note: The author was the pioneering Viennese/New York art dealer, who mounted the posthumous first exhibition of Gerstl's work at his Neue Galerie, Vienna, 1931.

name: Gérard, Marguerite
item_t: Marguerite Gérard : 1761-1837.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the paintings, the publication incudes  a biography of the artist, a discussion of her career and artistic milieu. The publishers also issued an English edition.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Géricault : étude biographique et critique, avec le catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre du maître.
public_note: This is a revised and augmented edition of Charles Clément's 1868 study of the artist's work (see entry cited in this database).  The revised edition includes  a supplement by Lorenz Eitner and 30 plates (the earlier edition was not illustrated).

name: Gentileschi, Orazio
item_t: Orazio Gentileschi and the Poetic Tradition in Caravaggesque Painting.
author: Bissell, R. Ward
imprint: University Park, PA : Pennsylvania State University, 1981.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of 70 authentic paintings by the artist.  In the preface to the catalogue, the author notes that he included 4 works whose attribution to Orazio seems debatable, but which he is not prepared to reject.

The publication also contains separate catalogues of questionable works, lost paintings and rejected attributions.

name: Gentilini, Franco
item_t: Gentilini : catalogo generale dei dipinti, 1923-1981.
author_s:
Appella, Giuseppe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Manno, Margherita                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Turco Liveri, Laura                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gentilini, Luciana (archives)
public_note: The publication includes an introduction, and texts dealing with the artist's life, work, and critical fortunes.

name: Gerz, Jochen
item_t: Jochen Gerz : Werkverzeichnis = Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: Includes 900 entries on works by the artist.

name: Gerz, Jochen
item_t: Jochen Gerz : Werkverzeichnis : Catalogue Raisonné. Band 3.
public_note: Volume 4 is currently in preparation. See in-process entry cited in this database.

name: Gerz, Jochen
item_t: Jochen Gerz : Werkverzeichnis : Catalogue Raisonné. Band 2
public_note: Texts in German and English.

name: Gerz, Jochen
item_t: Jochen Gerz : Werkverzeichnis : Catalogue Raisonné. Band 1
public_note: Texts are in German, English and French. There is good critical apparatus giving titles, photographic support, date, duration, notes, exhibition information, and literature. There is a fully translated appendix and documents concerning the realization of the projects, with some references to provenance in the text.

name: Gérard, François-Pascal-Simon, baron
item_t: Oeuvre du baron François Gérard, 1789-1836 : gravures à l'eau forte.
author: Gérard, François-Pascal-Simon, baron
public_note: The third volume includes oil sketches, drawings, half length and bust length portraits.  The publication also includes a list of all sitters for portraits or drawings by the artist; a list of engravers and lithographers of works after Gérard's originals.

name: Gérard, François-Pascal-Simon, baron
item_t: Oeuvre du baron François Gérard, 1789-1836 : gravures à l'eau forte.
author: Gérard, François-Pascal-Simon, baron
public_note: The second volume includes allegories, scenes from French history, scenes from classical history, and religious subjects.

name: Gérard, François-Pascal-Simon, baron
item_t: Oeuvre du baron François Gérard, 1789-1836 : gravures à l'eau forte.
author: Gérard, François-Pascal-Simon, baron
public_note: The first volume includes 83 portrait engravings executed from 1791-1836. The catalogue is mostly illustrations, and entries include name of the sitter, date, signature information, and engraver.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Regard social et politique: le séjour anglais et les heures de souffrance -- Annexes aux volumes du catalogue.
ind_entr_cont: Catalogue entries include title, date, provenance, references, exhibitions, and comments.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Génie et folie, Le Radeau de la Méduse et les Monomanes.
ind_entr_cont: Entries all have relevant scholarly apparatus.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Le retour à Paris : synthése d'experience plastiques.
author: Bazin, Germain

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: L'opera completa di Théodore Gericault.
public_note: From the series "Classici dell' arte".  Also issued under the title "Tout l'oeuvre Peint de Géricault" in the "Les classiques de l'art" series (Paris: Flammarion, 1978). Catalogue raisonné of paintings, sculptures, and engravings, arranged chronologically.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Le voyage en Italie.
author: Bazin, Germain
public_note: Individual catalogue entries include number, title, medium and support, and all other scholarly apparatus. All works are illustrated with black and white thumbnail images.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: La gloire de l'Empire et la Première Restauration : étude critique et catalogue raisonné.
author: Bazin, Germain
public_note: Catalogue entries give number, title, medium and support, provenance, exhibitions, bibliography, references to the critical study, and location.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: L'oeuvre : période de formation : étude critique et catalogue raisonné.
author: Bazin, Germain
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue entries give number, title, medium and support, dimensions, notes, provenance, bibliographic citations and refer to the critical study section of the volume, as well as indicating location.
public_note: Authentic works are listed in bold face type (without the artist's name); for full listings of the exhibitions mentioned, reference the date in the "Documents.." section for the complete citation.

name: Ghezzi, Pier Leone
item_t: Pier Leone Ghezzi, pittore.
author: Lo Bianco, Anna
public_note: The catalogue raisonné follows the introductory texts on the artist's stylistic development, and a discussion of the chronology of his work. The catalogue raisonné lists authentic works, doubtful attributions and rejected works.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: L'homme : biographie, témoignages et documents.
author: Bazin, Germain
public_note: The first in a catalogue raisonné of seven volumes.

name: Géricault, Théodore
item_t: Théodore Géricault : The Graphic Work = l'oeuvre gravé : A Catalogue Raisonné / Loys Delteil…Charles Clément catalogue ed. by A. Hyman.
public_note:
This is a first English translation of Delteil's 1924 catalogue, listing works by the artist and those done in collaboration with others. There is a list of cited works, names of collectors, printers, and collaborators.  Many entries are in French and English, with at least one full page illustration for each lithograph. 

This new publication includes the addition of Charles Clément's 1879 catalogue raisonné (the 3rd & final edition), edited by Alan Hyman. It also presents an appendix by Clément of questionable works. There are additional contributions by Paul Joannides and James Cuno.

name: Gentileschi, Artemisia
item_t: Artemisia Gentileschi and the Authority of Art : Critical Reading and Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bissell, R. Ward
imprint: University Park, PA : Pennsylvania State University Press, 1999.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné includes 53 authentic paintings; 42 rejected attributions; and 108 lost works.

name: Gentile da Fabriano
item_t: Tutta la pittura di Gentile da Fabriano.
author: Grassi.Luigi
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the introductory texts includes essays on the artist and his work.  All of the artist's known authentic works are illustrated, most with multiple detail views. There are also a separate sections of attributed and lost works.

name: Gentile da Fabriano
item_t: L'opera completa di Gentile da Fabriano.
author: Gentile, da Fabriano

name: Gelder, Aert de
item_t: Arent de Gelder : Dordrecht 1645-1727.
author_s:
Moltke, Joachim Wolfgang, Graf von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Belkin, Kristin Lohse (ed.)
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Moltke.  The publication also contains chapters by Alan Chong and Christian Tümpel. The documents section (in Dutch) includes the artist's inventory, and was compiled by Gabriël Pastoor. 

The catalogue raisonné is divided into separate sections: authentic paintings (106), doubtful paintings (23), works known only from documents (308), and rejected attributions (113). Each section is divided by subject: Old Testament, New Testament, History, Allegory, Genre, and Portraits.

name: General Idea
item_t: General Idea : Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné : Multiples and Prints, 1967-1993.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 163 graphic works by General Idea.  The publication includes the author's interview with General Idea.

name: Geitlinger, Ern
item_t: Ernst Geitlinger : Werkverzeichnis 1924-1972 : Gemälde und Arbeiten auf Papier.
author_s:
Ness, Roswitha                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Koderer, Heinz (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wiensch, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mengden, Lida v.
public_note: Issued under the aegis of the Ernst Geitlinger Gesellschaft, München.  The publication includes a foreword, a biography, and essays preceding the catalogue raisonné.   The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Roswitha Ness, and covers paintings (1927-1972) and works on paper (1924-1972).  There is also a supplemental section on the sketches and studies, and an index of sketch books.   Appendices include a bibliography, a list of exhibitions, and a list of plates.

name: Geiger, Rupprech
item_t: Rupprecht Geiger : Werkverzeichnis 1942-2002 : Gemälde und Objekte : architekturbezogne Kunst.
author_s:
Geiger, Julia (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dornacker, Pia (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Friedel, Helmut (foreword)
public_note: Issued under the aegis of the Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus München.

name: Gehry, Frank O.
item_t: Frank O. Gehry : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Dal Co, Francesco                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Forster, Kurt W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Arnold, Hadley
imprint: Milan : Electaarchitecture : [London] : (New York) : Phaidon Press Distributor, 2003.
public_note:
There have been a number of printings and reimpressions of this catalogue of Gehry's work; various editions (in English and Italian) were issued by Electa and Electaarchitecture (an imprint of Mondadori Electa), as well as co-editions with Phaidon and Monacelli Press.
The edition listed here is a reprint of that first published in the USA in 1998.

name: General Idea
item_t: General Idea : Editions, 1967-1995.
author: Fischer, Barbara (ed.)
imprint: Mississauga, Ont. : Blackwood Gallery, University of Toronto at Mississauga, 2003.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of General Idea's editioned works from 1967-1995 was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at Blackwood Gallery at the University of Toronto Mississauga.

name: Geiger, Rupprech
item_t: Rupprecht Geiger : Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik 1948-2007.
author: Geiger, Julia
public_note:
This catalogue was issued under the aegis of  the Rupprecht-Geiger-Gesellschaft, Städtische Galerie im Lenbachhaus München.
Earlier catalogues of the artist's graphic works were also published by Rolf Schümcking (Galerie Schmücking, Braunschweig, 1964, covering years 1948-1964)) and Monika Geiger (Art Press Verlag, Dusseldorf, 1972, covering years 1948-1972).

name: Gaussen-Salmon, Jacqueline
item_t: Jacqueline Gaussen Salmon : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Gaussen, Frédéric
public_note: The publication continues a preliminary catalogue raisonné begun by the artist's husband, Ivan Gaussen, here completed by her son.

name: Gautier d'Agoty, Pierre Edouard
item_t: Pierre-Edouard Dagoty, 1775-1871, et la miniature bordelaise au XIX siecle. Biographie critique et catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
author_s:
Du Pasquier, Jacqueline                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pariset, F. G. (preface)
illustrations: numerous ills., coats of arms, some color
public_note: An introductory essay is followed by a catalogue of the portraits, organized by: family, identified portraits, family groups, and anonymous subjects. There is a section on sources and a bibliography, and indices of artists cited and names of subject portraits.

name: Gaul, Winfred
item_t: Winfred Gaul : Werkverzeichnis.
public_note: Volume 1 contains and excerpt in French.

name: Gaudier-Brzeska, Hen
item_t: Gaudier-Brzeska: Life and Art.
imprint: New York : Thames and Hudson, Ltd., 1996.
public_note: Monograph on the artist with a catalogue raisonné of the sculpture.

name: Gaulli, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Baciccio : Giovan Battista Gauli 1639-1709.
author: Petrucci, Francesco
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes some 300 works and follows the same organization divided by category, giving  illustrations, title, catalogue number (following the respective categories,  i.e. A1, etc.),date, medium and support, collection, exhibition information and bibliographical references..

name: Gaul, Winfred
item_t: Winfred Gaul : Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphiken und Objekte.
public_note: The secondary title is "Werkkatalog der Kunsthalle zu Kiel und des Schleswig-Holsteinischen Kunstvereins." Chiefly illustrations.

name: Gaudí, Anton
item_t: Gaudi : obra completa.
public_note: Sections include an introductory essay, biography, built works, unrealized projects, and furnishings, etc., plus a chronology and bibliography.

name: Gaudí, Anton
item_t: Gaudí, 1852-1926 : Antoni Gaudí i Cornet : A Life Devoted to Architecture.
author: Zerbst, Rainer
public_note: This is the second English edition of the catalogue, which was originally published by Taschen in 1985.  Numerous subsequent editions have appeared in English, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Hebrew, and French.

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: Gauguin.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
public_note: There is also a table of comparative information prepared by Gauguin of work from 1888-1889, plus indices of museums and collectors, titles, and photographs.

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: Gauguin's Ceramics : A Study in the Development of His Art.
author: Bodelsen, Merete
imprint: London : Faber and Faber Ltd. in association with Nordisk sprog og kultur forlag, 1964.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné; most works are illustrated in the text.

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Gauguin.
author: Sugana, G.M.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically, then iconographically and by location.  The documents section includes excerpts from Gauguin's letters and some contemporary critical commentary.  There is also a section on works attributed to Gauguin.

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: L'oeuvre gravé de Gauguin.
author: Guérin, Marcel
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980.
public_note: Revised reprint of the 1927 edition, originally published by H. Floury, Paris.

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: Paul Gauguin, Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints.
author_s:
Mongan, Elizabeth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kornfeld, Eberhard W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Joachim, Harold

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: Catalogo completo dell'opera grafica di Paul Gauguin.

name: Gauguin, Paul
item_t: Gauguin : A Savage in the Making : Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings (1873-1888).
author_s:
Wildenstein, Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Crussard, Sylvie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heudron, Martine
public_note: The catalogue includes an index of unknown works; concordances to the 1964 and 2001 catalogues; a genealogy of the artist's family; and a map illustrating Gauguin's voyages between 1848 and 1888.

name: Gaul, Augu
item_t: August Gaul : das Werkverzeichnis der Skulpturen.
author: Gabler, Josephine

name: Gág, Wanda
item_t: Wanda Gág : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints.
author_s:
Winnan, Audur H.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kiehl, David W. (foreword)
public_note: Catalogue includes excerpts from the artist's writings and correspondence, and a glossary of terms.

name: Gavarni, Paul
item_t: Gavarni : Catalogue Raisonné of the Graphic Work.
author_s:
Mahérault, Marie Joseph François                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bocher, Emmanuel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Armelhault, J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wickenden, Robert J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ray, Gordon Norton
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 2004.
public_note: This catalogue is called  a revision of the original 1873 publication, with texts in French and accompanying essays in English.

name: Gatti, Annibale
item_t: Annibale Gatti, pittore di Firenze capitale.
imprint: Rome, DeLuca : Cassa di Risparmio di San Miniato, 1985.
public_note: From the series "I Professori del disegno". The catalogue lists 101 paintings and 34 drawings by the artist. Publication also contains separate catalogues of lost works and works known only through citations in sales and exhibition catalogues.

name: Garzoni, Giovanna
item_t: Giovanna Garzoni, "insigne miniatrice", 1600-1670

name: Garofalo
item_t: Il Garofalo : Benvenuto Tisi, pittore (c.1476-1559) : catalogo generale.
author: Fioraventi Baraldi, Anna Maria
public_note: The catalogue features 193 paintings and frescoes as well as 19 drawings by Garofalo.

name: Gargallo, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Gargallo.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the sculptures was compiled by Pierrette Anguera-Gargallo, the artist's daughter.  There is a chronology, list of exhibitions, and a bibliography.

name: Garnier, Pierre
item_t: Pierre Garnier : 1726/27- 1806.
author_s:
Huchet de Quénetain, Christophe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bailey, Colin B. (pref.)
imprint: Paris : Perrin & fils antiquaires : Editions de l'Amateur, 2003.

name: Gardner, Alexande
item_t: Alexander Gardner : The Western Photographs, 1867-1868.
author_s:
Aspinall, Jane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Davis, Keith (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zugazagoitia, Julián (foreword)
imprint: Kansas City, MO : Hall Family Foundation : Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, 2014.
public_note: This is the catalogue of a 2015 exhibition held at the Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art in Kansas City, Missouri.  The publication includes a complete catalogue of Gardner's two series of Western photographs: "Across the Continent on the Kansas Pacific Railway" and "Scenes in the Indian County".

name: Gappmayr, Heinz
item_t: OPUS Heinz Gappmayr.
author_s:
Koelen, Dorothea van der                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gappmayr, Heinz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weiermair, Peter
imprint: Mainz : D. van der Koelen Verlag, 1993-

name: Garber, Daniel
item_t: Daniel Garber : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of over 1,450 works by the artist: 885 paintings, 13 pastels, 458 drawings (including sketchbooks and diaries), 61 etchings, 30 decorative art items, and 6 sculptures. The catalogue is organized by date or is based on stylistic analysis, then by title; undated works are found at the end of each section. 

The entries give title, date, medium and support, size, signatures, alternate titles, and current ownership if known. Entries may contain material documented from the artist's records, with information concerning exhibition, publication, and provenance, there are some critical comments.

name: Ganzer, Leopold
item_t: Werkverzeichnis Leopold Ganzer. Öl und Acrylbilder.
author: Ganzer, Lovis
cronology: Individual entries include title, date, dimensions, media, signature and inscription information. Some entries include exhibition information and brief comments.  All known works are illustrated with scalable color images.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné, written and organized by the artist's son, lists approximately 1,390 paintings in oil and acrylic from 1948-2007.  The catalogue raisonné can be searched by year, subject or keyword.  The site also includes a brief biography of the artist.
public_note: check_needed

name: Gargallo, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Gargallo : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: Written in collaboration with Cécile Anguera, Martine Anguera, Jean Anguera, and Rafael Ordóñez Fernandez. The publication includes list of fondeurs with whom the artist worked.

name: Gargallo, Pablo
item_t: Pablo Gargallo (1881-1934) : dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Salazar, María José                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gargallo, Jean Anguera
public_note: Texts are in Spanish, but the introduction and chronology are in English.

name: Garibaldi, Joseph
item_t: Joseph Garibaldi : le Midi paisible : catalogue raisonné.
author: Murat, Pierre
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Palais des Arts à Marseille, the catalogue includes a catalogue raisonné of the artist's works.

name: Gander, Ryan
item_t: Ryan Gander : Catalogue Raisonnable. Vol. 1.
imprint: Zurich : JRP Ringier ; New York : Thea Westreich/Ethan Wagner Publications, 2010.
public_note:
The catalogue is published in conjunction with the exhibition "Approach it Slowly from the Left" held at the Haus Konstruktiv, Zurich.

The catalogue raisonné will include over 500 conceptual works, organized in a nonlinear sequence. The first part of the publication includes the catalogue and index. Part two contains transcriptions, conversations, and other materials related to the catalogued works.

name: Ganso, Emil
item_t: The Prints of Emil Ganso.
author: Smith, Donald E.
imprint: Madison,  NJ : Fairleigh Dickenson University Press; London : Associated University Presses, 1997.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of all known graphic works by the artist.

name: Gallizio, Pino
item_t: Pinot Gallizio : catalogo generale delle opere 1953-1964.
author_s:
Roberto, Maria Teresa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Comisso, Francesca                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bertolino, Giorgina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fondazione Ferrero
public_note: The chronological order has been established from information from the archives, the authors, and critical analysis of his stylistic development. The entries include number, small illustrations, title, date, medium and support, dimensions, signatures and inscriptions, inventory numbers, provenance, exhibitions, and bibliographical references.

name: Galizia, Fede
item_t: Fede Galizia.
author: Caroli, Flavio
public_note: The catalogue contains 35 autograph paintings, 27 attributed works and 24 lost works.

name: Gandolfi, Gaetano
item_t: Gaetano Gandolfi.
author: Biagi Maino, Donatella
imprint: Turin : U. Allemandi ; Milan : Distributore eclusivo alle librerie, Messaggerie libri, 1995.

name: Galien Laloue, Eugène
item_t: Eugène Galien Laloue 1854-1941. Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Willer, Noé
imprint: New York : Alexander Kahan Fine Arts, 1999.
public_note:
The first volume is subtitled 'Le triomphe de Paris.' The catalogue raisonné of over 300 oil paintings is organized by subject (Paris, countryside, marine paintings, military subjects, and other cities). 
The second volume is currently in preparation.

name: Galli, Giovanni Antonio
item_t: Spadarino.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of 41 authentic works contains a separate section dealing with lost and unidentified works. The Appendix contains documents relating to the artist's life and career compiled by Federica Zalabra. There is also a topographical index of works.

name: Galli, Federica
item_t: Federica Galli : catalogo generale : 1954- 2003.
author: Fragonara, Marco
public_note: All works by the artist are illustrated in the catalogue raisonné.

name: Gandolfi, Ubaldo
item_t: Ubaldo Gandolfi.
author: Biagi Maino, Donatella
public_note: There are several introductory sections covering  the historical, critical and cultural background of the artist's milieu. There are also detailed discussions of individual works including drawings and sketches, frescoes, room paintings, and collectors of the artist's works.

name: Galeotti, Sebastiano
item_t: Sebastiano Galeotti, Firenze 1675 - Mondavi 1741.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists 64 authentic frescoes and paintings on canvas, and 121 drawings. There are also separate catalogues of lost or unlocated works (arranged by location), and works of doubtful or rejected attribution (organized by medium).

The publication also includes excerpts of documents relating to the artist's life and indices of names and places.

name: Gaddi, Taddeo
item_t: Taddeo Gaddi : Critical Reappraisal and Catalogue Raisonne´.
author: Ladis, Andrew

name: Gagnère, Olivie
item_t: Olivier Gagnère.
author_s:
Champenois, Michèle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Flory, Matthieu                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Powis, Eileen
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Musée Magnelli, Musée de la Céramique, Vallauris-Golfe-Juan.  This is a catalogue raisonné of all of Gagnère's designs, including his works in ceramic, leather, bronze, glass, furniture design, etc…

name: Gabo, Naum

author_s:

                                                            Sanderson, Colin                                                            ;&nbsp

name: Gainsborough, Thoma
item_t: Gainsborough.
author: Waterhouse, Ellis
public_note: Comprehensive catalogue of all of Gainsborough's oil paintings known to the author. Much of this catalogue was previously included in Waterhouse's article, "A Preliminary Checklist of Portraits by Thomas Gainsborough" in vol. 33 of 'The Walpole Society' (1953).

name: Furness, Frank

author_s:

                                                            Cohen, Jeffrey A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lewis, Michael J.

name: Fuseli, Henry

name: Funke, Helene

author: Funke, Peter

name: Fuseli, Henry
item_t: L'opera completa di Füssli.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 318 autograph paintings and 122 drawings by the artist. The catalogue is organized chronologically, and most works are illustrated with black and white thumbnail images. The publication also includes an anthology of critical writings about the artist, as well as excerpts from Fuseli's own writings.

name: Fullaondo Errazu, Daniel
item_t: Juan Daniel Fullaondo, arquitecto.
author_s:
Fullaondo, Juan Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Dalmau, Paloma Buigas de

McIntyre, Allan J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kielsmeier, Wayne B.
imprint: Tucson : Covington Fine Arts Gallery, Inc., 2006.
public_note: First edition published in 750 copies. Catalogue of 180 prints, lithographs, woodblocks and serigraphs.

name: Fruhtrunk, Günthe
item_t: Günter Fruhtrunk : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis : Möglichkeiten und Grenzen ded konkreten Bildes.

                                                            Hohmann, Frank (intro.)
public_note:
The publication lists 155 sculptures, all illustrated with color thumbnails. Texts include a biography of the artist, an essay on Frishmuth and her foundries, and an introduction to cast comparisons.

The appendices include a list of models, exhibition history, assembly dates of metal patterns, and destruction dates of plasters.

name: Frost, Terry

author_s:
Kemp, Dominic                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hoyland, John                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Faine, Brad                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Booth-Clibborn, Charles
public_note: The publication contains selected exhibition literature, a list of public collections, selected bibliography, and separate indices of publishers and prints.  The catalogue also reproduces examples of the artist's signature.

name: Fruhtrunk, Günthe
item_t: Günter Fruhtrunk Serigraphien.

name: Fruhtrunk, Günthe
item_t: Günter Fruhtrunk : Werkverzeichnis der Bilder : Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings, 1952-1982.

                                                            Metzger, Stephanie

item_t: Prints and Engraved Illustrations by and after Henry Fuseli : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Weinglass, David H.
imprint: Aldershot, Hants : Scolar Press; Brookfield, VT : Ashgate, 1994.
public_note: Includes separate indices of engravers; books containing engraved illustrations; imprints and publishers; titles and subjects; and locations.

name: Funi, Achille
item_t: Achille Funi.
author: Colombo, Nicoletta
public_note: Volume 1 contains an introduction, essays, recollections, writings by the artist, and unpublished letters.   There is also a catalogue of his preparatory drawings, listing title, date, medium and support, collections, exhibitions, and references.

name: Gainsborough, Thoma
item_t: The Drawings of Thomas Gainsborough.
imprint: New Haven : Published for the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art (London) by Yale University Press, 1971.
public_note: The publication contains a list of drawings attributed to Gainsborough in public collections.

name: Füger, Heinrich Friedrich
item_t: Heinrich Friedrich Füger (1751-1818) : nur wenigen ist es vergönnt das Licht der Wahrheit zu sehen.
author: Keil, Robert
public_note: This is a comprehensive monograph on the artist with a catalogue raisonné of Füger's complete oeuvre.

name: Gainsborough, Thoma
item_t: Thomas Gainsborough : The Portraits, Fancy Pictures and Copies after Old Masters.
author: Belsey, Hugh
imprint: ew Haven : Published for the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art by Yale University Press, 2019.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes approximately 1,100 paintings.  The publication also includes bibliographical references and an index.

name: Gainsborough, Thoma
item_t: The Landscape Paintings of Thomas Gainsborough : A Critical Text and Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Hayes, John T.
public_note: The Appendicies deal with the work of Gainsborough's nephew, Gainsborough Dupont, and as well as other copyists and followers.

name: Friesz, Achille-Emile-Othon
item_t: Émile Othon Friesz : l'oeuvre peint I.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné lists over 780 paintings, all illustrated in thumbnails. The catalogue is arranged by subject: port scenes, landscapes, landscapes with figures, nudes, portraits, and still lifes. 

The second volume describing Friesz's works in private collections has not appeared to date.

name: Frink, Elisabeth
item_t: Elisabeth Frink : Sculpture Since 1984 and Drawings.
author: Lucie-Smith, Edward
public_note: This continues the catalogue of Frink's sculptures since 1984, plus a catalogue raisonné of her drawings with some color images.  It includes a list of sculptures in public spaces, the artist's exhibtions and awards, and a select bibliography.

name: Frink, Elisabeth
item_t: Elisabeth Frink Sculpture : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Frink, Elisabeth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Shaffer, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Robertson, Bryan (intro)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kent, Sarah                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Phelan, Brian (afterword)
public_note: This is a reprint of the 1984 edition.  The publication includes an interview with the artist.  There is a list of public collections housing Frink's works, a list of exhibitions, index, and bibliography.

name: Fries, Ern
item_t: Ernst Fries (1801-1833) : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Wechssler, Sigrid
public_note:
The monograph section of the book traces the artist's career by place and location, with a list of his travels. The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's known paintings, drawings, and watercolors.

There is also a bibliography, index, plus a record of the public sale of 1859.

name: Friedrich, Caspar David
item_t: Caspar David Friedrich : Gemälde, Druckgraphik und bildmässige Zeichnungen.
public_note: This study covers paintings and graphic works (woodcuts, etchings), as well as those watercolors and drawings that relate to the painted works.

name: Frélaut, Jean
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Frey, Johann Jakob, I
item_t: Jakob Frey (1681-1752) : Kupferstecher und Verleger in Rom.
author: Bätschmann, Marie Therese
public_note: The author's doctoral dissertation, University of Basel, 1990.

name: Frélaut, Jean
item_t: Jean Frélaut, 1879-1954 : l'oeuvre peint.
public_note: Contains a checklist of lost and unlocated paintings, and a table of works known to have been destroyed by the artist. Essay, "Jean Fréault, the Painter" in English.

name: Friedrich, Caspar David
item_t: L'opera completa di Friedrich.
author: Börsch-Supan, Helmut
public_note: The publication includes a brief biography, a documentary chronology of the artist's life and work, and a critical anthology of writings about Friedrich (in Italian).

name: Freeman, Don
item_t: The Prints of Don Freeman : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: McCulloch, Edith
imprint: Charlottesville, VA : University Press of Virginia, 1988.
public_note: Published for the University of Virginia Art Museum. Contains an essay by Marjorie P. Balge and memoirs concerning the artist by John Beaufort and Al Hirschfeld.

name: Freud, Lucian
item_t: The Etchings of Lucian Freud : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1946-1995.
author: Hartley, Craig
imprint: Bergamo : Galerie Ceribelli; London : Marlborough Graphics, 1995.
public_note:
A revised version of the Italian catalogue for the exhibition of Freud's etchings held in Barolo, 1994.
N.B. An earlier catalogue on the etched work was also published for the exhibition "Lucien Freud, The Complete Etchings 1946-1991" (London: Thomas Gibson Fine Art, 1991).

name: Freud, Lucian
item_t: Lucian Freud.
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of all 290 of Freud's paintings, drawings and graphic works, all illustrated in full page color plates.  The publication includes a list of public collections housing Freud's works and a list of statements by the artist.

name: Freundlich, Otto
item_t: Otto Freundlich : Cosmic Communism.
author: Friedrich, Julia
imprint: Cologne : Museum Ludwig ; Basel : Kunstmuseum Basel; Munich : Prestel, 2017.

name: Friedrich, Caspar David
item_t: Caspar David Friedrich : die Zeichnungen, das gesamte Werk.
author: Grummt, Christina
public_note: The catalogue entries cite number, title, date, medium and support, dimensions, pencil marks, information found on the verso, provenance, exhibition and bibliographic citations, and comments.

name: Frink, Elisabeth
item_t: Elisabeth Frink Sculpture : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: A catalogue of over 300 sculptures by the artist through 1984. The publication includes an introduction and dialogue by Bryan Robertson.

name: Frink, Elisabeth
item_t: Elisabeth Frink, Original Prints : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Wiseman, Caroline                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lucie-Smith, Edward (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jammet, Lin (preface)
public_note: A catalogue of Dame Frink's prints, organized by the dealer Caroline Wiseman.

name: Frink, Elisabeth
item_t: Elisabeth Frink : Catalogue Raisonné of Sculpture 1947-93.
author_s:
Ratuszniak, Annette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jammet, Lin (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Daly, Leo A. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Morpurgo, Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Spalding, Julian
imprint: Farnham, Surrey ; Burlington, VT : Lund Humphries in association with the Frink Estate and Beaux Arts, 2013.
public_note:
This new, one-volume edition of the catalogue coincides with two major exhibitions of the artist's work held at the Beaux Arts, London and at the Lightbox, Woking. 

The publication includes discussions of Frink's working methods, foundries and studios, and her "Recollections".  There is also a short story "Muck and Magic" written in memory of Frink by her friend Michael Morpurgo.

name: Frankenthaler, Helen
item_t: Frankenthaler, a Catalogue Raisonné : Prints, 1961-1994.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 235 editioned prints and over 70 documented proofs, all reproduced in color.  The publication also includes separate indices of names, publishers, printers, and titles.  The Appendix also lists offset editions and non-editioned proofs.

name: Fraser, James Earle
item_t: The Sculpture of James Earle Fraser.
author: Freundlich, August L.
public_note: In addition, there is a small list of lost works; inscriptions & casting marks, dimensions, location, references, and foundries.

name: Frank, Franz
item_t: Franz Frank Druckgraphik : Werkverzeichnis der Radierungen und Lithographien.
author: Zimmermann, Rainer
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's etchings, lithographs, and woodcuts.

name: Franco, Battista
item_t: Battista Franco (c. 1510-1561) : His Life and Work with a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Varick Lauder, Anne
public_note: This biography and catalogue raisonné of the artist's work was presented as the author's doctoral thesis at Cambridge University in 2004.

name: François, Guy

author_s:
Saunier, Bruno                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lavit, Oriane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonfait, Olivier (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Olivier, Luc (photo.)
public_note: Entries cite number, title, date, medium and support, dimensions, inscriptions, condition, provenance, exhibitions, references, and comments.

name: Francis, Sam
item_t: Sam Francis : Online Catalogue Raisonné Project - The Compilation of Unique Works on Paper and Expanded Version of Canvas and Panel Paintings.
cronology: The first installment lists 201 entries.  It was presented in 2018 and covers the period 1945-1949.  There is an interactive list of exhibitions and a bibliography  organized by year.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is searchable by title, catalogue number, date, inscriptions/signature/notations, Sam Francis Foundation archive number, and medium.  Works are illustrated (when available) with scalable images, mostly color.   There is also a separate section listing works whose whereabouts are unknown.

name: Francken, Frans, I
item_t: Frans Francken de Oude (ca. 1542-1616) : leven en werken van een Antwerps historieschilder.
author: Peeters, Natasja
public_note: Published in the series: "Treatises from the Royal Flemish Academy of Belgium for Sciences and Arts", New series, 26.

author: Härting, Ursula Alice
public_note: The collaborative works are grouped according to the contribution of the other artist (landscapes, flowers and animals, architectural painting).

name: Franck, Philipp
item_t: Philipp Franck (1860-1944) : Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
author_s:
Immenhausen, Wolfgang                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Meister, Sabine

public_note: Published in connection with an exhibition held at the Museum Giersch, Frankfurt am Main and the Bröhan-Museum, Berlin. The catalogue includes approximately 477 paintings by the artist.

name: Francis, Sam

author_s:
Lembark, Connie W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fine, Ruth E. (intro.)
public_note: Volume 1 includes the catalogue of the lithographs and the anima prints. Volume 2 contains the catalogue of the intaglio prints, screenprints, and posters. Individual entries provide information on printers, publishers, editions, proofs, the locations of signatures, and proofing and printing dates.

name: Francia, Francesco

author_s:
Negro, Emilio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Roio, Nicosetta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Giovannini, Carlo (appendix)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné contains separate catalogues of authentic paintings; lost works; attributed paintings; and works by Francia's workshop and circle.

name: Franciabigio
item_t: Franciabigio.
author: McKillop, Susan Regan
public_note:
Based on the author's dissertation for Harvard University, 1966.  In the series "California Studies in the History of Art."

The catalogue is divided into six sections, the first three of which cover authentic works including lost authentic works. The last section covers attributed paintings with unknown locations and lost attributed works.

name: Francis, Sam
item_t: Sam Francis : Catalogue Raisonné of Canvas and Panel Paintings, 1946-1994.
imprint: Berkeley : University of California Press ; Glendale, CA : Sam Francis Foundation, 2011.
public_note: The catalogue inclues an essay on Francis's art and life by William Agee, and a biographical timeline by Debra Burchett-Lere, who is the Director and Curator of the Sam Francis Foundation.  The Sam Francis Foundation will provide updates to the catalogue raisonné on their Website.

name: achen, Hans von
item_t: Hans von Aachen, 1552-1615.
author: Jacoby, Joachim W.
public_note: From the series "Monographien zur deutschen Barockmalerei". Catalogue of 103 paintings arranged by subject.

name: Francese, Franco
item_t: Franco Francese : 1920-1996.
public_note: The texts are bilingual.  In addition to the introductory texts and catalogue, the publication's appendices include a biography, filmography, critical anthology, a list of exhibitions, and a general bibliography.

name: Franceschini, Marc Antonio

imprint: Turin : Artema : Compagnia di belle arti, 2001.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné apparatus gives number, title, support, location, date, provenance, references, notes, and comparative drawings when available.

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré

author: Wildenstein, Georges
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of the etchings. Publication lists 35 prints, including some with questionable attributions.

name: Fracanzano, Cesare
item_t: Cesare Francanzano : opera completa.

name: Fox, Judy

Wally, Barbara (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
