                                                            Weiermair, Peter (essay)
imprint: Salzburg : Internationale Sommerakademie für Bildende Kunst, 2005.
public_note: Oeuvre catalogue published in conjunction with the catalogue of an exhibition at the Galerie im Traklhaus, Salzburg and the Thaddaeus Ropac Gallery, Paris.

name: Foujita, Tsugouharu
item_t: La vie et l'oeuvre de Léonard-Tsuguharu Foujita.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's oil paintings, watercolors, drawings, and engravings.  The catalogue is organized chronologically by medium, and all works are illustrated with b&w thumbnails.

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré
item_t: The Paintings of Fragonard, Complete Edition.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
imprint: London : Phaidon, Distributed in USA by Doubleday & Co., 1960.
illustrations: 350 ills., of which 16 are in color
public_note: Translated from the French. The catalogue includes a chronological list of documents from the artist's life.

name: Foster, Norman Robe
item_t: Norman Foster : Works.
author: Jenkins, David
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of landmarks, buildings, designs and furniture arranged chronologically. Individual entries contain cross sectional diagrams, models and plans. The project is planned to be completed in 6 volumes.

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré
item_t: L'oeuvre dessiné de Jean-Honoré Fragonard (1732-1806) : catalogue raisonné.
author: Ananoff, Alexandre
public_note: The four-volume catalogue is organized by sujbect. Volumes II, III and IV supplement the first volume. Volume IV includes addenda and index.

name: Fosse, Charles de la
item_t: Charles de La Fosse, 1636-1716.
public_note: The first volume includes a genealogical chart of the La Fosse family and supporting documents, such as receipts of payments to Charles de La Fosse. Volume 2 contains the catalogue raisonné of the paintings, drawings and engravings.

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré
item_t: L'opera completa di Fragonard.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 572 authentic paintings by Fragonard, including miniatures and paintings produced in collaboration with other artists. There is a separate section of works attributed to Fragonard. All works are illustrated with black & white thumbnail images.

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré
item_t: Jean-Honore Fragonard, vie et oeuvre : catalogue complet des peintures.
author: Cuzin, Jean Pierre
public_note:
A monograph and catalogue raisonné of the paintings. The catalogue contains 420 paintings as well as 212 lost works (17 illustrated from engravings).

An English translation was published by Abrams, 1988 (see entry in this database).

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré
item_t: Jean-Honoré Fragonard, Life and Work : Complete Catalogue of the Oil Paintings.
author: Cuzin, Jean Pierre
public_note: Translated from the original 1987 French edition, this English edition has corrigenda and two additional entries.

name: Fragonard, Jean-Honoré
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Fragonard.
author: Rosenberg, Pierre
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists 451 paintings by the artist.

name: Fossali, Gino
item_t: Gino Fossali : opere = oeuvres : 1958-2002.

name: Fortuny y Madrazo, Mariano
item_t: Fortuny, gravador : estudi crítici catàleg raonat.
author: Vives i Piqué, Rosa

name: Fortuny y Carbó, Mariano José María Bernardo
item_t: Mariano Fortuny Marsal, Mariano Fortuny Madrazo : grabados y dibujos.
author_s:
Piqué, Rosa Vives i                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            García, María Luisa Cuenca
imprint: Madrid : Ministerio de Cultura, Biblioteca Nacional : Electa, 1994.
public_note:
The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition organized by the Biblioteca Nacional, Madrid.  The catalogue raisonné of Mariano Fortuny Marsal's lithographs, etchings, and engravings was compiled by Rosa Vives i Piqué.  Her essay contains a discussion of the artist's techniques, materials, and marks; there is also an inventory of "trazos" or etching/pencil strokes found in his works.

María Luisa Cuenca García compiled the catalogue of Fortuny Madrazo's drawings and graphic works. Her essay includes an inventory of stamps and watermarks found on Fortuny Madrazo's prints, and reproduces examples of his signature.

name: Forain, Jean Lou
item_t: J.-L. Forain lithographe : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre lithographié de l'artiste.
author: Guérin, Marcel
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 89 of Forain's lithographs, his entire output up until the date of publication.

name: Forabosco, Girolamo
item_t: Girolamo Forabosco
author: Marin, Chiara
imprint: Venezia : Venezia barocca ; Sommacampagna, Verona : Cierre edizioni, 2015

name: Fontebasso, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Fontebasso, 1707-1769.
author: Magrini, Marina
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 244 authentic paintings. Contains separate catalogues of doubtful and erroneous attributions, and lost works.

name: Fontana, Lucio
item_t: Lucio Fontana.
author_s:
Crispolti, Enrico (essay & catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            van der Marck, Jan (essay)
public_note: This is the first edition of the catalogue raisonné of  paintings, sculpture and "spatial environments".  For later editions, see entries cited in this database.

name: Fontana, Lavinia
item_t: Lavinia Fontana, bolognese : "pittora singolare" 1552-1614.
author: Cantaro, Maria Teresa
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 105 authentic paintings (including lost paintings and engravings after lost works), and 8 drawings. The publication also contains separate catalogues of doubtful and rejected attributions.

name: Fontana, Baldassare
item_t: Baldasar Fontana, 1661-1733 : un berniniano ticinese in Moravia e Polonia.
author: Karpowicz, Mariusz
public_note: In Italian, but with summaries in English and German. Edited by Amleto Pedroli & Franco Gilardi.

name: Folmer, George
item_t: Georges Folmer (1895-1977) : catalogue raisonné des peintures et sculptures.
author: Florentin, Carine
imprint: Lille : A.N.R.T Université de Lille III.
public_note: This was the author's doctoral thesis presented at the Université de Paris IV: Paris, Sorbonne in 1996.  See also the 2015 catalogue by Lasfargues and Florentin (cited in this database).

name: Folmer, George
item_t: Georges Folmer, 1895-1977 : catalogue raisonné.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is organized by period in the artist's career. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, exhibition history, provenance, collection information, literature, and signature information.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Fontana, Lucio
item_t: Fontana : catalogo generale.
author: Crispolti, Enrico
public_note:
This is the second expanded edition of the catalogue raisonné of the paintings, scultpures and designs.  The catalogue raisonné is arranged by subject, and all works are illustrated with b&w thumbnails.

The publication also contains a section on false metalworks.

name: Fontana, Lucio
item_t: Lucio Fontana : catalogo ragionato di sculture, dipinti, ambientazioni.
author_s:
Crispolti, Enrico                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ardemagni Laurini, Nini                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ernesti, Valeria
public_note:
This is the third edition of the catalogue of the artist's paintings, sculptures, and environments, with new and updated iconographic apparatus, following closely on the two earlier editions (cited in this database). The same code for each work is used in all three editions. The classification is in chronological order, but subdivided into typographical cycles. 

The catalogue does not include ceramics created after 1949, which the authors classify as "ornament".

name: Folinsbee, John Fulton
item_t: The John F. Folinsbee Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Jensen, Kirsten M. (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            The John F. Folinsbee Art Trust
cronology: Catalogue entries include title, medium, dimensions, comments, provenance, inscriptions, labels, signature information, collection, and comments.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné covers the artist's works in all media, including oil paintings, prints, drawings, and other works on paper. The catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically, but can be searched by keyword, medium, subject, and type.  The catalogue is ongoing and the committee is still accepting works for possible inclusion.
public_note: check_needed

name: Fontana, Lucio
item_t: Lucio Fontana : catalogo ragionato delle opere su carta.
author_s:
Barbero, Luca Massimo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Laurini Ardemagni, Nini                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ardemagni, Silvia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Crispolti, Enrico
public_note:
The publication was produced in collaboration with the Fondazione Lucio Fontana. Texts are displayed with parallel English translations.

The chronological catalogue raisonné of the works on paper lists over 5,000 works, executed from 1928-1968.  The catalogue raisonné was compiled by Enrico Crispolti.

name: Forain, Jean Lou
item_t: J. L. Forain, acquafortiste : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé de l'artiste, avec une eau-forte originale.
author: Guérin, Marcel
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes 122 etchings and 3 monotypes created up to 1910. This 1912 edition was reprinted by Alan Wofsy, San Francisco, 1980 (ISBN 0915346389). See also A. Faxon's study of 1982 (cited in this database).

name: Flemming, Petra
item_t: Petra Flemming Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Schäfer, Siegfried B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Witteveen, Cecilia A.M.
cronology: The online catalogue includes 686 items.  Individual entries cite number, date, title, dimensions, signature and inscriptions, medium, and collection, literature, and exhibition information.  Entries of  also include color images of the verso and labels.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue covers drawings from c.1967 to 1988 the year of the artist's death, paintings from 1964 to 1988, and graphic works from 1957 to 1988.
public_note: Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Forain, Jean Lou
item_t: Jean-Louis Forain : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints.
author: Faxon, Alicia Craig
public_note:
Updates Guérin's publications of 1910 and 1912 (cited in this database). The catalogue of Forain's prints is arranged chronologically by medium: etchings, lithographs, posters, and monotypes.
There are notes, bibliographic references, major public collections, concordance, a title index and a general index.

name: Flanagan, Barry
item_t: Barry Flanagan Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Estate of Barry Flanagan
cronology: Catalogue entries include title, date, medium, dimensions, collections, exhibitions, works exhibited with selected work, edition information.  All works are illustrated with scalable color images.  Entries also contain links to relevant documents in the Archives Database.
ind_entr_cont: The website contains two separate but related databases: the Artworks and the Archives.

name: Fortuny y Madrazo, Mariano
item_t: Mariano Fortuny Marsal, Mariano Fortuny Madrazo : grabados y dibujos.
author_s:
Piqué, Rosa Vives i                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            García, María Luisa Cuenca
imprint: Madrid : Ministerio de Cultura, Biblioteca Nacional : Electa, 1994.
public_note:
The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition organized by the Biblioteca Nacional, Madrid.  The catalogue raisonné of Mariano Fortuny Marsal's lithographs, etchings, and engravings was compiled by Rosa Vives i Piqué.  Her essay contains a discussion of the artist's techniques, materials, and marks; there is also an inventory of "trazos" or etching/pencil strokes found in his works.

María Luisa Cuenca García compiled the catalogue of Fortuny Madrazo's drawings and graphic works. Her essay includes an inventory of stamps and watermarks found on Fortuny Madrazo's prints, and reproduces examples of his signature.

name: Floch, Joseph
item_t: Josef Floch : Leben und Werk 1894-1977.
author: Pallauf, Karl
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings, there is a biographical essay on the artist's career.  The publication also includes the artist's diary, which he kept from 1911-1974; excerpts from critical writings about the artist; and exhibition reviews from the artist's lifetime.

name: Floutier, Louis Benjamin
item_t: Catalogue raisonne´ de l'oeuvre de Louis Floutier, 1882-1936.
author: Prunet, Mary Anne
public_note: In addition to the print catalogue, there is an online database of works.  However, access to the web resource is restricted to those who have contributed to the catalogue.  Information can be found at www.floutier.com.

name: Flemal, Berthole
item_t: Bertholet Flémal : 1614-1675 : le "Raphaël des Pays-Bas" au carrefour de Liège et de Paris.
author: Kairis, Pierre-Yves
public_note: Early sections of this study outline the artist's career in Liège, Rome, Paris, and Brussels, followed by discussions of his style, patrons, students, followers, and artistic influence. The texts are followed by the catalogue raisonné.

name: Fitzgerald, James Edward
item_t: James Fitzgerald Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology: The catalogue can be searched by various rubrics: title, number, subject matter, subject location, collection, and medium.
ind_entr_cont: Entries may include: image, catalogue number, medium and dimensions, signature information, provenance, references, curatorial and historical notes, and related works.  Individual entries will provide exhibition and publication history at a future date.
public_note: Provenance; Comments

name: Florsheim, Richard A.
item_t: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Graphic Work of Richard Florsheim.
imprint: Syracuse, NY : Syracuse University Art Collection, in cooperation with the Richard A. Florsheim Art Fund, 1988.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 288 prints and portfolios by the artist.

name: Flavin, Dan
item_t: Dan Flavin : The Complete Lights, 1961-1996.
imprint: New York : DIA Foundation, in association with Yale University Press, 2004.
public_note:
Published in conjunction with a traveling exhibition held at the National Gallery of Art, Washington; the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth; and the Museum of Contemporary Art, Chicago.

The authors based their catalogue on Flavin's own records of what he made, sold and exhibited. Catalogue entries 1-697 are works the records indicate were created for the purpose of sale, exhibition or photography; Numbers A1-A78 are works of undetermined status.

name: Flegel, Georg
item_t: Georg Flegel, 1566-1638.
author: Ketelsen-Volkhardt, Anne-Dore
public_note: This is a monograph with an introduction to the artist's life and work, plus a catalogue raisonné of his 80 known paintings, organized by subject.

name: Flangini, Giuseppe
item_t: Giuseppe Flangini, 1898-1961.
imprint: Saronno (VA) : Associazione culturale Giuseppe e Gina Flangini ; Milan : Libreria Bocca, 2009.
public_note: This is the catalogue of the 2008 exhibition held at the Palazzo del Vittoriano in Rome, and it includes separate catalogue raisonnés of Flangini's paintings and drawings.

name: Fiume, Salvatore
item_t: Fiume : catalogo generale delle opere.
author: Fiume, Luciano
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers Fiume's paintings, drawings, sculptures, and ceramic works. The introduction to each decade of work includes comments and reflections by the artist.

name: Fish, Jane
item_t: The Prints of Janet Fish : A Catalogue Raisonné.

name: Fischer, Johann Michael
item_t: Johann Michael Fischer (1717-1801) : ein Barockbildhauer in Schwaben.

name: Finlay, Ian Hamilton
item_t: Ian Hamilton Finlay Prints, 1963-1997 : Druckgrafik.
author_s:
Pahlke, Rosemarie E. (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Simig, Pia Maria (editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lackner, Christina (foreword)
imprint: Ostfildern (Germany) : Cantz ;  New York, distributed  by DAP, 1997.
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Museum am Ostwall Dortmund (Germany); Stadsgalerij Heerlen (Netherlands); and Galerie Stadtpark Krems.

name: Finson, Lou
item_t: Louis Finson (Bruges, avant 1580- Amsterdam, 1617).
author: Bodart, Didier
public_note: Most works are not illustrated in the catalogue.

name: Finelli, Giuliano
item_t: Giuliano Finelli : Bildhauer zwischen Neapel und Rom.
author: Dombrowski, Damian
public_note:
The author's dissertation, Universität Münster, 1996, published within the series "Schriften zür bildenden Kunst".

Following introductory essays on the artist's career, the catalogue raisonné is organized into sections on authentic works, collaborative works, lost works, those not under the aegis of the artist, works in doubt, works of his circle and school, ascribed and attributed works, etc.

name: Fiedler, Arnold
item_t: Arnold Fiedler : der Maler 1900-1985.
author_s:
Schoop, Uta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weiss, Christina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Freie Akademie der Künste in Hamburg
public_note: This study presents an introduction, essay, biography, and a critical catalogue of the work. There is a bibliography of cited literature and catalogues with the artist's work; plus other apparatus including a list of solo and group exhibitions, and a short biography.

name: Figini, Luig
item_t: Luigi Figini, Gino Pollini : opera completa.
public_note: All material is based on records in the Figini and Pollini Archives, copies of which are on deposit since 1991 in the Museum of Modern and Contemporaery Art of Trento & Rovereto (Archivio del' 900, Fondo Figini e Pollini).

name: Feuchtmayer, Joseph Anton
item_t: Joseph Anton Feuchtmayer : 1696-1770.
public_note: There is a section on doubtful attributions, a concordance of the drawings, a catalogue of the printed work, and a list of the works in their present locations.  In addition, there is a geographical listing of the artist's activity by place, a bibliography, a list of exhibition catalogues, and place and name indices.

name: Fetti, Domenico
item_t: Fetti.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists 134 authentic paintings and 52 drawings. Each entry lists known copies after authentic paintings, as well as additional autograph versions. The publication also contains separate catalogues of doubtful or erroneous attributions, and lost works.

name: Festa, Tano
item_t: Tano Festa : catalogo generale.
author: Soligo, Francesco
public_note: Only the first volume has been published to date. After an introduction by C. Parisot, there are essays by various authors, a biographical note, and a chronological and thematic catalogue raisonné.

name: Ferretti, Giovanni Domenico
item_t: Giovanni Domenico Ferretti.
author: Baldassari, Francesca
public_note:
This is a catalogue raisonné of the paintings; all works are illustrated, and the catalogue is arranged chronologically. 

The Appendices also include documents, writings related to the artist's life and critical fortunes, a bibliography, and a name index.

name: Feuerbach, Anselm  Friedrich
item_t: Anselm Feuerbach : Leben und Werk : kritischer Katalog der Gemälde, Ölskizzen und Ölstudien.
author: Ecker, Jürgen
public_note: The texts and catalogue entries are in German, with an introduction in English, French and Italian.  The catalogue raisonné lists over 500 authentic works. The publication also contains separate catalogues of doubtful attributions and rejected works.

name: Ferrari, Luca
item_t: Luca Ferrari.
author_s:
Pirondini, Massimo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Monducci, Elio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ramponi, Barbara
public_note:
Introductory texts cover the artist's career by period and places of activity. The catalogue considers known works; those which have been lost, destroyed or are untraced; and doubtful attributions, workshop pieces, and copies. 

Additional apparatus includes a chronology, documents related to Ferrari's life, a genealogy of Ferrari's family, place and location indices, and a bibliography.

name: Ferrari, Agostino
item_t: Agostino Ferrari : catalogo generale.
author: Corgnati, Martina (ed.)

name: Fernhout, Edga
item_t: Fernhout : schilder = Painter.
author_s:
Berk, Aloys van den                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moerbeek, Jozien                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Steen, John
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is included in the catalogue of a retrospective exhibition held at the Stedelijk Museum, Amsterdam.

name: Fernhout, Edga
item_t: In het licht van Alassio : Edgar Fernhout Neo-realist.
author_s:
Rijnders, Mieke                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berk, Aloys van den
imprint: Amsterdam : Ludion ; Arnhem : Museum voor Moderne Kunst, 2002.
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Museum of Modern Art (Arnhem, Netherlands). The publication contains a catalogue raisonné of the paintings (1923-1946) compiled by Aloys van den Berk.

name: Feininger, Lyonel
item_t: Lyonel Feininger : The Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings by Achim Moeller.
author: Moeller, Achim
cronology: Individual entries include title, date, signature & inscription information, collection, and dimensions.
public_note: Full details on individual works (provenance, exhibition history, bibliography) are only available on request.

name: Fernandez, Lou
item_t: Luis Fernández : primera catalogación de la obra.
author: Mas Hernández, Ana

name: Fernandez, Lou
item_t: Luis Fernández : catalogo razonado de pinturas, dibujos, grabados y esculturas, 1900-1973.
author: Palacio Alvarez, Alfonso
imprint: Madrid : Fundación Azcona ; Oviedo : Museo de Bellas Artes de Asturias, 2010.
public_note: An English translation of the text is appended.

name: Feragutti Visconti, Adolfo
item_t: Aolfo Feragutti Visconti, 1850-1924.

name: Fenosa, Apele
item_t: Apel·les Fenosa : catalogue raisonné de l'œuvre sculpté.
author_s:
Fenosa, Nicole                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tillier, Bertrand                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Changeux, Jean-Pierre
public_note:
The catalogue lists 1,522 sculptures, organized chronologically and all illustrated with black and white thumbnail images.  Works that were destroyed, either by accident or intentionally by the artist, are included if their existence is supported by documentation.  

The catalogue raisonné is in French, but translations of all texts as well as comments within the catalogue section are provided at the back.  The publication also includes a brief essay on Fenosa's materials and techniques.

name: Felixmüller, Conrad
item_t: Conrad Felixmüller : das graphische Werk, 1912-1977.
author: Söhn, Gerhard

name: Feininger, Lyonel
item_t: Lyonel Feininger.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings lists 539 works, as well as 14 unfinished paintings.  The catalogue was compiled by Julia Feininger, the artist's wife.  

An English language edition also was published by Harry Abrams, New York [1961].

name: Feininger, Lyonel
item_t: Feininger : A Definitive Catalogue of His Graphic Work : Etchings, Lithographs, Woodcuts : Das graphisches Werk : Radierungen, Lithographien, Holzschnitte.
author_s:
Prasse, Leona E.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lee, Sherman E. (foreword)
imprint: Berlin : Gebr. Mann Verlag ; [Cleveland] : Cleveland Museum of Art, [1972].
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 65 etchings and drypoints, 20 lithographs, and 320 woodcuts. Supplements list doubtful prints; miscellaneous transfer lithographs and reproductive prints after Feininger's works.  There is also a section for works by Hinneck Scheper, formerly attributed to Feininger.

name: Federighi, Antonio
item_t: La scultura di Antonio Federighi.
author: Richter, Elinor M.

name: Favretto, Giacomo
item_t: Giacomo Favretto.
public_note: Within Allemandi's series "Archivi dell'Ottocento."  The catalogue raisonné lists 198 paintings and 81 drawings by the artist. A revised edition was published in 1999 by R. Trevisan (see entry cited in this database).

name: Feddersen, Hans Peter, the younge
item_t: Der Maler Hans Peter Feddersen : Leben, Briefe, Gemäldeverzeichnis.
author_s:
Martius, Lilli                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stubbe, Ethe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stubbe, Hans Peter
public_note: Volume 10 from the series "Studien zur schleswig-holsteinischen Kunstgeschichte". The catalogue lists 1,466 authentic paintings by Feddersen. Gregor von Bochmann's online catalogue raisonné updates and expands this publication (see entry cited in this database).

name: Feddersen, Hans Peter, the younge
item_t: Der Maler Hans Peter Feddersen.
author_s:
Bochmann, Gregor von                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Manitz, Bärbel (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stubbe, Ethe (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jensen, Jens Christian
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné of 1,543 oil paintings and watercolors is searchable chronologically or by subject. All works are illustrated, most in color.
public_note: check_needed

name: Fautrier, Jean
item_t: Jean Fautrier : pittura e materia.
public_note:
This monograph, a first effort to establish a catalogue of the artist's work, contains an illustrated checklist of 696 works (paintings, drawings, and sculpture), all illustrated.
Giorgio Galansino also prepared a dissertation at the University of Chicago, entitled "Jean Fautrier : A Chronology of his Early Paintings, 1921-1942", which is seen as a supplement to the above.

Further, a catalogue raisonné has long been cited in the literature as being in preparation by Marie-José Lefort and La Galerie Jeanne Castel, Paris (no additional information currently available).

name: Fattori, Giovann
item_t: L'opera completa di Fattori.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 740 authentic paintings, organized chronologically.  All works are illustrated with black and white thumbnail images. The publication also includes an anthology of critical writings about the artist, a biography and a documentary chronology of Fattori's life, and examples of his signature.

name: Feininger, T. Lux
item_t: T. Lux Feininger Catalogue Raisonné [online].
cronology: The online catalogue lists over 4,750 works.  Entries are bilingual, and describe the sources for the artwork, specifically Feininger's four work lists (for paintings, photographs, sculpture, and objects), along with other documentation.  Individual entries provide information on title, descriptions, signature, explanation & statements, technique and support, dimensions, date, documenation, provenance, exhibitions, and references.
ind_entr_cont: Searching can be filtered by artworks, media, and theme. Catalogue numbers have yet to be assigned to individual works, however.  The results list is organized chronologically, and includes destroyed and reworked objects.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Fattori, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Fattori : l'opera incisa.
public_note: Covers the prints and lithographs. See also the author's later study published in 1987 which is also cited in this database.

name: Fattori, Giovann
item_t: Le incisioni di Giovanni Fattori nella collezione Franconi : e catalogo generale dell'opera incisa Fattoriana.
author: Baboni, Andrea
public_note: See the author's earlier study on the artist's intaglios and lithographs, also cited in this database.

name: Fautrier, Jean
item_t: Jean Fautrier : oeuvre gravé, oeuvre sculpté : essai d'un catalogue raisonné.
author: Engelberts, Edwin
public_note: An illustrated exhibition catalogue and catalogue raisonné. See also Rainer Michael Mason's "Jean Fautrier: les estampes" (Geneva, 1986), cited in this database.

name: Fautrier, Jean
item_t: Jean Fautrier : les estampes : nouvel essai de catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Mason, Rainer Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Seibel, Castor (notes)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stalter, Marcel-André (notes)
imprint: Geneva : Musée d'art et d'histoire, Cabinet des estampes, 1986.
illustrations: ca. 286 b&w accompany the catalogue, plus some color
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition, the catalogue raisonné lists 286 prints plus monotypes and reproductions by the artist. A  German edition was also published: "Jean Fautrier: die Druckgraphik" (Stuttgart : Staatsgalerie, Graphische Sammlung, 1987).

name: Favretto, Giacomo
item_t: Giacomo Favretto (1849-1887).
author_s:
Trevisan, Renzo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Perocco, Guido                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pozzati, Sergio
public_note: A revised and expanded edition of the 1986 catalogue raisonné (Turin: U. Allemandi).  See entry cited in this database. The half title is "Giacomo Favretto : Venezia 11 aogsto 1849- 12 giugno 1887".

name: Fehrenbach, Gerson
item_t: Gerson Fehrenbach - Skulptur und Zeichnung : mit dem Werkverzeichnis der Skulpturen.
author_s:
Gabler, Josephine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Georg-Kolbe-Museum Berlin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fehrenbach, Gerson
public_note: This catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Georg-Kolbe Museum in Berlin August 26th to October 29th 2000.

name: Felixmüller, Conrad
item_t: Conrad Felixmüller : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 1,630 paintings by the artist, most reproduced in b&w thumbnail illustrations.

name: Fenosa, Apele
item_t: Apel·les Fenosa : catalogue raisonné de l'œuvre graphique.
public_note: The introductory essays have been translated, but catalogue entries are only in French.

name: Fanzago, Cosimo
item_t: Cosimo Fanzango scultore.
author: D'Agostino, Paola

name: Fantin-Latour, Hen
item_t: Catalogue de l'oeuvre complet (1849-1904) de Fantin Latour.
author: Fantin-Latour, Victoria (Dubourg)
imprint: Amsterdam : B. M. Israël ; New York : Da Capo Press, 1969.
public_note:
This is an unchanged reprint of the 1911 limited edition catalogue published by Henri Floury, Paris. The author, Victoria Dubourg Fantin-Latour, was the artist's wife and also a painter.  Another facsimile of the 1911 edition was published by Laurencin, Paris in 2000.  

The catalogue raisonné of paintings, drawings and lithographs is organized chronologically by medium. Also included are samples of the artist's signature.

name: Fantin-Latour, Hen
item_t: Fantin-Latour : Catalogue de l'oeuvre lithographique du maître.
imprint: Paris : Librarie de l'art ancien et moderne, 1906.
public_note: This catalogue documents 195 works and includes a bibliography for author Hédiard. See also the updated edition of this catalogue entitled "Fantin-Latour: lithographies" (cited in this database), published in conjunction with an exhibition held in Geneva, 1980-81.

name: Fabritius, Carel
item_t: Carel Fabritius : Complete Edition with a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Brown, Christopher
public_note: The Appendix contains manuscript references to Fabritius' life, work and critical fortunes until 1752.  The catalogue raisonné contains 8 accepted works, 3 attributed paintings and 25 rejected attributions.

name: Fabbri, Agenore
item_t: Agenore Fabbri : catalogo ragionato.
author: Feierabend, Volker
imprint: Frankfurt am Main : VAF Fondazione ; Cinisello Balsamo, Milan : Silvana, 2011.
illustrations: v. 1: 2,000 b&w, color; v. 2: 2,000 b&w, color

name: Fabre, François-Xavier, baron
item_t: François-Xavier Fabre, (1766-1837) : da Firenze a Montpellier.
author_s:
Pellicer, Laure                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hilaire, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Luciani, Paola (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lemeux-Fraitot, Sidonie (essay)
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Musée Fabre (Montpellier) and the Galleria d'Arte Moderna e Contemporanea (Turin), 2007-2008.

name: Fantin-Latour, Hen
item_t: Fantin-Latour : lithographies.
author_s:
Mason, Rainer Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Oederlin, Chantal                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sarto, Pietro                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bourel, Yves
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition organized by the Cabinet des estampes, Musée d'art et d'histoire, Geneva. This book reproduces the 1906 text by Hédiard and Bénédite and adds revisions and illustrations.

name: Eyck, Hubert van
item_t: Van Eyck : The Complete Works.
author: Simpson, Amanda

name: Eyck, Hubert van
item_t: The Complete Paintings of the Van Eycks.
public_note:
This is the English language edition of: "L'opera completa del van Eyck" (presentazione di Raffaello Briganti), Milan, Rizzoli, 1968, but with a new introduction by Robert Hughes.
The critical notes and catalogue in both editions are by Giorgio Faggin.

The catalogue includes excerpts from critical writings on the van Eycks from the 16th - 20th centuries.  There is a brief section dealing with attributed works and paintings known only from documents.

name: Fassbender, Josef
item_t: Joseph Fassbender, Malerei zwischen Figuration und Abstraktion.
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Kölnischer Kunstverein.  This is a catalogue of the artist's work in color. Following an introduction, biography and essays, there is an overview of Fassbender's colored paintings and graphic works.

name: Eyck, Jan van
item_t: Tutta la pittura di Jan van Eyck.
author: Denis, Valentin (ed.)
public_note: Published in the series: "Biblioteca d'arte Rizzoli", 15-16.  See also the 1962 publication by the same author cited in this database.

name: Fassbender, Josef
item_t: Das graphische Werk Joseph Fassbenders (1903-1974).
author: Trier-Franzen, Alice
imprint: Alfter : VDG, Verlag und Datenbank für Geisteswissenschaften, 1994.
public_note:
This was originally presented as the author's doctoral thesis at the Universität Bonn in 1993. The catalogue raisonné lists over 1,200 graphic works by the artist, organized chronologically.

The publication also includes an address given by Fassbender at the Universität Bonn.

name: Eyck, Jan van
item_t: All the Paintings of Jan van Eyck.
author: Denis, Valentin
public_note: Published in the series "Complete Library of World Art", v. 4. See also the 1954 publication by the same author cited in this database.

name: Farrell, Terry
item_t: Collage & Context : Terry Farrell, the Partnership's Complete Works 1981-1991.
public_note:
The publication includes a general monograph, as well as introductory texts by the architect.

The catalogue covers a seminal founding decade (1981-1991) of the architect's partnership, including Clifton Nurseries, Tvam Buildings, projects for British RR Stations and Lands: (Charing Cross,  King's Cross Lands), the M16 Building, among many  other building campaigns.

name: Eyck, Jan van
item_t: Van Eyck : The Complete Works.
author: Simpson, Amanda

name: Eyck, Jan van
item_t: The Complete Paintings of the Van Eycks.
public_note:
This is the English language edition of: "L'opera completa del van Eyck" (presentazione di Raffaello Briganti), Milan, Rizzoli, 1968, but with a new introduction by Robert Hughes.
The critical notes and catalogue in both editions are by Giorgio Faggin.

The catalogue includes excerpts from critical writings on the van Eycks from the 16th - 20th centuries.  There is a brief section dealing with attributed works and paintings known only from documents.

name: Everdingen, Allart van
item_t: Allart van Everdingen (1621-1675) : First Painter of Scandanavian Landscape.
author_s:
Davies, Alice I.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Duparc, Frederic J.
public_note: Within the series "Aetas aurea". Catalogue is arranged by subject: marine paintings, Scandanavian landscapes, and Netherlandish landscapes. Also catalogues "attributed" works (paintings not examined firsthand by the authors); rejected attributions; and lost works.

name: Everdingen, Allart van
item_t: The Drawings of Allart van Everdingen : A Complete Catalogue, Including the Studies for Reynard the Fox.
author: Davies, Alice I.
public_note: Catalogues 670 of the artist's watercolors, ink drawings, and oil sketches on paper.

name: Everdingen, Caesar van
item_t: Caesar van Everdingen (1616/17-1678).
author: Huys Janssen, Paul
public_note: Translated from the Dutch. Catalogue raisonné lists 61 paintings and 1 drawing the author accept as authentic, arranged chronologically. The publication also contains separate catalogues of lost or unidentified paintings, and rejected works.

name: Farny, Henry F.
item_t: Henry Farny.
author_s:
Carter, Denny                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rogers, Jr., Millard F (Foreword)
imprint: New York : Watson-Guptil Publications (in cooperation with Cincinnati Art Museum), 1978.
public_note: According to the author's statement, this study is not a complete catalogue raisonné, but it remains a useful monograph on the artist's work.

name: Everdingen, Allart van
item_t: Allart van Everdingen : catalogue raisonné de toutes les estampes qui forment son oeuvre gravé.
author: Drugulin, Wilhelm Eduard
public_note: The subtitle to this work is "Supplément au Peintre-graveur de Bartsch."

name: Estes, Richard
item_t: Richard Estes : The Complete Paintings, 1966-1985.
public_note: Includes an illustrated checklist of works, arranged chronologically.

name: Erté, (Romain De Tirtoff)
item_t: Erté (Romain de Tirtoff) : The Complete Graphic Works on CD.
author: Schachner, Sheila
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists 408 graphic works, all illustrated on a CD-ROM.

name: Ernst, Max

name: Ernst, Max

author: Spies, Werner

author: Buckle, Richard

name: Engelman, Martin

public_note: The present publication is a catalogue raisonné of the over 200 lithographs, woodcuts, etchings, and aquatints by the artist.

name: Ensor, Jame
item_t: James Ensor.
author: Elesh, James N.
public_note: Issued as volume 141 within the "Illustrated Bartsch" series.

name: Ensor, Jame
item_t: James Ensor.
public_note: An earlier catalogue of the artist's paintings, organized by subject.

name: Ensor, Jame
item_t: James Ensor : Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings.
author: Tricot, Xavier
public_note:
This edition was distributed in the U.S. by Rizzoli, 1992. Another edition, translated from the French, was published by Pandora, Antwerp, 1992.  
An updated and revised edition was published by Hatje Cantz in 2009 (see entry in this database).

name: Ensor, Jame
item_t: James Ensor : The Complete Paintings.
author: Tricot, Xavier
public_note: A German edition was published simultaneously. This is a revised edition of the author's 1992 publication (see entry cited in this database). The new edition contains a biography of the artist and expanded catalogue raisonné. The current publication lists authentic 856 works, arranged in chronological order and illustrated with color thumbnails.

name: Ensor, Jame
item_t: James Ensor : The Complete Prints.
author: Tricot, Xavier
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is organized by engravings and lithographs. Although this is a catalogue raisonné of a private collection, each entry is accompanied by a scholarly commentary. The catalogue has much supplementary information (newly established dates, major auctions) and includes previously unpublished material, plus a large selection of hand colored engravings.
public_note: Comments

name: Enzweiler, Jo

author_s:
Enzweiler, Jo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Maas, Claudia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gomringer, Eugen                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kraemer, Sandra
public_note: The publication includes several essays and a biography of the artist. The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's works from 1954 to 2014.

name: Epstein, Jacob
item_t: The Sculpture of Epstein, with a Complete Catalogue.
author: Silber, Evelyn
public_note: This catalogue raisonné is the most complete attempt thus far to trace the various casts of each work and to assign a chronology.

name: Erni, Han

author: Cailler, Pierre
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. The first volume catalogues 227 lithographs and engravings (executed up to 1957). Vol. 2 lists 228 works executed from 1958 to 1970.  Entries include title, date, edition size, dimensions, printmaker, and images.

name: Erni, Han
item_t: L'oeuvre graphique de Hans Erni : intégration de l'art et des techniques.

name: Erni, Han

public_note: All texts are in German, Italian, English, French, and Italian.  The catalogue raisonné lists 773 works (not including the book illustrations).

name: Erni, Han
item_t: Hans Erni : catalogue raisonné des livres illustrés.
author: Giroud, Jean-Charles
public_note:
The catalogue includes all 92 of the illustrated books, albums, or catalogues embellished with original engravings or lithographs by the artist.
The publication was issued in both French and German language editions.

name: Erni, Han

public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's entire oeuvre, including paintings, tapestries, sculptures, architecture, engravings, and drawings. In addition to the catalogue, the publication contains survey of Errard's career, a selection of the artist's correspondence and other archival documents, a bibliography, and name and place indices.

author: Lankheit, Klaus

The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with the catalogue of the exhibition "Herbert Ebersbach - anerkannt, verfemt, widerentdeckt" held at the Kunstmuseum Ahlen.  

The publication includes a discussion of the artist's life and artistic career. All works are illustrated with color thumbnail images.

name: Early, Tom

author: Kornhauser, Elizabeth Mankin

name: Dwight, Mabel

public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 111 lithographs by the artist. The publication includes two essays by Dwight: "Satire in Art" and "How I Make a Lithograph."

name: Eakins, Thoma
item_t: Thomas Eakins : His Life and Work.
author: Goodrich, Lloyd
public_note:
A first critical monograph on the artist's work, compiled by the author, with the help of the artist's widow. 
Some half century later, this work was updated by the publication of a major two volume catalogue published by Harvard University Press, for the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C., 1982.

name: Dürer, Albrech

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Dürer-Katalog, ein Handbuch über Albrecht Dürers Stiche, Radierungen, Holzschnitte, deren Zustände, Ausgaben und Wasserzeichen.
author: Meder, Joseph
public_note:
Catalogue contains 294 works, and each entry describes various print editions and states.  

A new edition was issued by Da Capo Press, New York, 1971, with a bibliography (ISBN: 0306717883). A two-volume English language edition titled "Dürer's Graphic Work : The Complete Engravings and Woodcuts" is currently in preparation by Alan Wofsy Fine Arts: San Francisco.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Die Zeichnungen Albrecht Dürers.
author: Winkler, Friedrich
public_note: The catalogue covers 949 drawings, organized chronologically. Illustrations are provided for all entries, but displayed separately.

name: Duysen, Vincent van

author_s:
Crawford, Ilse (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dubois, Marc (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Piovano, Alberto (photo essay)
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of Van Duysen's domestic and commercial architecture, furniture, and decorative designs. Over 30 separate projects from 1993-2010 are featured.

name: Durand, Asher B.
item_t: Asher B. Durand : A Documentary Catalogue of the Narrative and Landscape Paintings.
author: Lawall, David B.
public_note: Based on the author's dissertation, Princeton University, 1966.  The catalogue raisonné is arranged by genre, then chronologically.  Includes an appendix of 19th-century exhibitions and sales of Durand's studies from nature.

name: Dürer, Albrech

author_s:
Ottino della Chiesa, Angela                                                            ;&nbsp

public_note: Translated from the Italian. Within the series "Classics of the World's Great Art." Also published in French, as "Tout l'oeuvre peint  de Dürer," Paris, Flammarion, 1969.  Catalogue lists 187 authentic paintings and 14 questionable attributions.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Dürer.
author: Panofsky, Erwin
public_note:
Subsequent reprints under the title "The Life and Art of Albrecht Dürer" were issued with some addenda and corrections.  

Not intended as a critical catalogue, all works in the catalogue raisonné are arranged thematically, including works the author did not believe to be authentic.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Dürer : The Complete Engravings, Etchings and Woodcuts.
author: Knappe, Karl-Adolf
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 385 graphic works, chiefly illustrations.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Dürer, 1471 bis 1528, das gesamte graphische Werk.
public_note: This is a useful two volume reference work  which refers to Friedrich Winkler's 1936 study of the artist's drawings (see entry cited in this database). Catalogue entries give title, date, medium, dimensions, and collection information (with references to Winkler), but there are no comments.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Dürer ; das malerische Werk.
author: Anzelewsky, Fedja
public_note: The chronological catalogue raisonné cites number, title, medium, dimensions, signature information, collection, bibliographical references, and comments.

name: Durameau, Louis Jean Jacque
item_t: Louis-Jacques Durameau, 1733-1796.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers Durameau's paintings and drawings. The publication includes a lengthy biographical essay, and the documents section includes excerpts from Durameau's correspondence.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: The Complete Engravings, Etchings and Drypoints of Albrecht Dürer.
author: Strauss, Walter
public_note: The catalogue lists 105 works, with a separate catalogue of 7 prints formerly attributed to Dürer.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: The Complete Drawings of Albrecht Dürer.
author: Strauss, Walter L.
public_note:
The authoritative, comprehensive study assembling many previously unrecorded works. Many illustrations are reproduced to scale, and an appendix of watermarks is included.
See also Supplement: v.1-v.2, 1977, also cited in this database.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: The Intaglio Prints of Albrecht Dürer : Engravings, Etchings & Drypoints.
author: Strauss, Walter L. (ed.)
public_note: First published in 1975, this edition was issued in 1977. It is organized chronologically by medium (engravings, etchings, drypoints), with reference to the Winkler (1936-1939) numbers.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: The Illustrated Bartsch.
author_s:
Bartsch, Adam von et al.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Strauss, Walter L. (ed.)
public_note:
Projected in over 164 volumes, the late Walter Strauss began this landmark project in order to illustrate and update the classic, but unillustrated, study of European painter-printmakers by Adam von Bartsch. 
In addition to the  new illustrated volumes published in  "The Illustated Bartsch"  (called Picture Atlas volumes), new critical information, not in the original edition, is published in the Supplementary and Commentary volumes; not all projected additional commentary volumes have been published to date, authors vary. An essential reference tool, sets may be located in major institutional and art museum reference libraries. 
ARTstor also offers now some 50,000 images of the "Illustrated Bartsch Collection", via its subscription service on the Internet. These are available to the public through selected academic, reference, and museum libraries. Eventually, ARTstor intends to offer the accompanying texts as well.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: The Complete Drawings of Albrecht Dürer : Supplement [One & Two].
author: Strauss, Walter L.
public_note: This two-volume supplement accompanies the original six-volume set published in 1974 (see entry cited in this database).

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Albrecht Dürer : Woodcuts and Woodblocks.
author: Strauss, Walter L.

name: Dürer, Albrech
item_t: Sämtliche Holzschnitte / Albrecht Dürer.

public_note: Chiefly illustrations. The catalogue raisonné of the woodcuts was compiled by Monika Heffels.

name: Dürer, Albrech

author: Anzelewsky, Fedja
public_note: This is a new revised edition of the author's 1971 publication (see entry cited in this database).  In addition to the catalogue of paintings, the publication includes biography of the artist.

name: Dürer, Albrech

author: Printz, Wolfram

name: Dürer, Albrech

                                                            Scherbaum, Anna                                                            ;&nbsp

There are also notes to Joseph Meder's "Dürer-Katalog; ein Handbuch über Albrecht Dürers Stiche, Radierungen, Holzschnitte, deren Zustände, Ausgaben und Wasserzeichen" [1932, 1971].

name: Duncanson, Robert Seldon

author: Ketner, Joseph D.

The catalogue is organized chronologically, with undated works at the end.  The author states that the list is not intended to be a catalogue raisonné per se, but rather a prolegomenon to a further scholarship and connoisseurship on the artist.

name: Dupré, Jule

name: Dunand, Jean
item_t: Jean Dunand : His Life and Works.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 1236 paintings, ceramics, furniture, and mosaics by Jean Dunand. The publication also contains separate catalogues of the works of Dunand's sons, Bernard and Pierre.

name: Dufy, Jean
item_t: Jean Dufy : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists 800 authentic works, all illustrated. Works are organized by subject: La Mer; Paysages; Paris; Calèches et Cavaliers; Le Cirque; La Musique; Fleurs et Natures Mortes; Portraits et Nus; Voyages.

The publication also includes texts by Didier Decoin, Franck Maubert, Charles Melman, Pierre Michon and Michel Tournier.

name: Duck, Jacob
item_t: Jacob Duck, c. 1600-1667 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Rosen, Jochai
public_note: Individual entries include provenance, literature, exhibition history, materials, dimensions, information on copies and variants, signature and inscription information, prints, and comments.

name: Dubois-Pillet, Albe
item_t: Albert Dubois-Pillet Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Offenstadt, Patrick
cronology: The catalogue raisonné of the paintings lists 120 works organized by genre: landscapes, still-lifes & interiors, and portraits. This is followed by a catalogue of works on paper (items 121 to 153).
ind_entr_cont: Catalogue entries give number, title, medium and support, signature and date, exhibitions, comments, and references.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Dufy, Jean
item_t: Jean Dufy : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of 730 authentic paintings, watercolors and gouaches. The catalogue is arranged chronologically by subject: The Sea; Landscapes; Paris; Carriages and Riders; The Circus; Music; Flowers and Still Lifes; Portraits and Nudes; Voyages.

name: Dufy, Raoul
item_t: Raoul Dufy : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint. Supplément.
public_note: This is considered the fifth volume of the catalogue raisonné, and adds 254 paintings to Dufy's oeuvre. A second supplement is currently in preparation (see entry in this database).

name: Dufy, Raoul
item_t: Raoul Dufy : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Laffaille, Maurice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berre de Turique, Marcelle                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dorival, Bernard
public_note: A fifth volume was published as a supplement (see separate entry).

name: Dufy, Raoul
item_t: Raoul Dufy : catalogue raisonné des aquarelles, gouaches et pastels.
public_note: Texts are bilingual, but the catalogue is only in French. A supplement is currently in preparation (see entry cited in this database).

name: Dufy, Raoul
item_t: Raoul Dufy : catalogue raisonné des dessins.
author: Guillon-Laffaille, Fanny
imprint: Paris : Marval; Paris : Éditions Galerie Fanny Guillon-Laffaille, 1991-
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of 833 drawings is arranged by subject. Volume 1 of 4 projected. Volume 2 is currently in preparation (see entry cited in this database).

name: Duchamp, Marcel
item_t: The Complete Works of Marcel Duchamp.
author: Schwarz, Arturo
public_note: This is the first edition of the catalogue raisonné; a co-edition was published by Thames & Hudson, London in the same year.

name: Dubuffet, Jean
item_t: Catalogue des travaux de Jean Dubuffet : non-lieux (1984).
author: Dubuffet, Jean (introduction)

name: Drury, Paul
item_t: The Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints of Paul Drury, 1903-1987.
author: Garton, Robin

name: Dubbels, Hendrik Jacobsz.
item_t: Hendrik Jacobsz. Dubbels (1621-1707) : Gemälde und Zeichnungen, mit kritischem Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Middendorf, Ulrike
public_note: The author's doctoral dissertation, Wilhelms-Universität Münster, 1985. Catalogue raisonné is organized by subject and  lists 145 paintings and 10 drawings the author believes to be authentic. A separate catalogue lists 236 lost works and 17 rejected attributions.

name: Drouet Réveillaud, Suzanne
item_t: Elle signait Drouet Réveillaud.

name: Drewes, Werne
item_t: Werner Drewes : A Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints : das graphische Werk.
imprint: Munich and New York : Kunstgalerie Esslingen, 1984.
public_note: Texts are in English and German.

name: Drost, Willem
item_t: Willem Drost (1633-1659) : A Rembrandt Pupil in Amsterdam and Venice.
author: Bikker, Jonathan
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is organized thematically and lists separately the works executed in Amsterdam and Venice. The catalogue includes 38 authentic paintings, plus 35 works known only from documents or reproductions. The publication also contains a separate catalogue of 32 rejected works.

name: Draper, Herbert Jame
item_t: Herbert Draper, 1863-1920 : A Life Study.
author: Toll, Simon
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of Draper's paintings, drawings, illustrations, and decorative designs.  Following several chapters of artistic biography,  there is a catalogue raisonné, and index.

name: Downsbrough, Pete

author_s:
Downsbrough, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wool, Ira G.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kung, Moritz (ed.)
public_note: The first detailed catalogue of Peter Downsbrough's unusual "artist's books". Published on the occasion of a circulating exhibition held in Antwerp and Barcelona, 2011; the catalogue raisonné  surveys some 85 books published to date.

name: Dove, Arthu
item_t: Arthur Dove : Life and Work, with a Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Morgan, Ann Lee
imprint: Newark, DE : University of Delaware Press; London : Associated University Presses, 1984.
public_note: The catalogue lists all of the artist's known oil paintings, collages, and most pastels, but excludes the watercolors and drawings.   The publication contains a separate catalogue of works known only from documentary sources.

There is information on  exhibitions, bibliography, table of illustrations, an alphabetical index of the plates (updated from the 1967 edition)

The new edition includes all the notebook drawings for "Jeu de boules". Other updates include notes on technique, dating, and format of the works, and includes some discovered works.Bibliographic and exhibition information is provided, there is a list of illustrations, including an alphabetical list of the plates.

name: Duchamp, Marcel
item_t: The Complete Works of Marcel Duchamp.
author: Schwarz, Arturo
public_note: This is the 3rd. revised and expanded edition, first published in 1969 (see entries in this database).  A co-edition was also published in 1997 by Thames & Hudson, London.

name: Duccio, di Buoninsegna
item_t: Duccio : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Ragionieri, Giovanna
public_note: Oeuvre catalogue of 48 paintings by the artist.

name: Dubuffet, Jean
item_t: Jean Dubuffet : Petites statues de la vie précaire = Kleine Statuen des unsicheren Lebens.
author: Franzke, Andreas
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 73 works arranged chronologically. The publication contains the English translation of the German text in a pocket insert. Titles are given in English, German and French. Catalogue also reprints excerpts from various German and French contemporary critical reviews.

name: Dubuffet, Jean
item_t: L'oeuvre gravé et les livres illustrés par Jean Dubuffet : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: Catalogue of Dubuffet's engraved works and illustrated books.

name: Duchamp, Marcel
item_t: The Complete Works of Marcel Duchamp.
author: Schwarz, Arturo
public_note: This is the second revised edition of the 1969 publication (see entry in this database).

name: Duccio, di Buoninsegna
item_t: L'opera completa di Duccio.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 123 authentic paintings by Duccio, which includes individual panels of larger altarpieces. There is a separate section listing 23 works attributed to the artist.

name: Duchamp, Marcel
item_t: The Complete Works of Marcel Duchamp.
public_note: Revised and expanded paperback edition of the 1997 publication, which in turn had revised the earlier 1969 catalogue raisonné.

name: Duchamp, Marcel
item_t: Marcel Duchamp: catalogue raisonne.
author: Clair, Jean
imprint: Paris: Musée national d'art moderne, Centre national d'art et de culture Georges Pompidou, 1977.
illustrations: numerous b&w ills., 16 leaves b&w, color plates
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with a 1977 exhibition at the Pompidou Center. This is the second volume of a series of four related to Duchamp. The other volumes are a biography (v. 1), a critical study (v. 3) and an unfinished novel by Duchamp's friend, Henri-Pierre Roché (v. 4).

name: Doucet, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Doucet : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Doucet, Andrée                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ragon, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jaguer, Edouard
public_note: This study includes essays, a list of locations, bibliographic information, documentary photographs, and an index of works.  Catalogue raisonné entries give number, title, date, medium, support, dimensions, signature, collection, exhibition, and references.

name: Dossi, Battista
item_t: Dosso and Battista Dossi : Court Painters at Ferrara.
author: Gibbons, Felton

name: Dorival, Ge´o
item_t: Geo Dorival 1879-1968 : les affiches.
author: Giroud, Jean-Charles
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's approximately 110 poster designs, and is accompanied by critical essays. Color reproductions of Dorival's posters are organized thematically (travel and touristic, advertisements and public service announcements, World War I-related, etc.). An English language edition was published simultaneously by P. Cramer.

name: Dossi, Dosso
item_t: Dosso and Battista Dossi : Court Painters at Ferrara.
author: Gibbons, Felton

name: Dongen, Kees van
item_t: Kees van Dongen : The Graphic Work : Catalogue of the Prints, Books and Posters.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's lithographs, etchings, aquatints, pochoirs, posters and book illustrations. It also contains a section including invitations, menus, cards, and printers' proofs.  The second edition was published in 2010 in Dutch by A.W. Bruna Uitgevers, Utrecht (192 pages).

author: Leblanc, Henri
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the paintings, sculptures, drawings, and graphic works.

name: Donghi, Antonio

public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the artist's works follows the  introductory texts discussing the artist's life and work.

name: Donatello
item_t: The Sculpture of Donatello.
public_note:
Janson used the notes and photographs that had been left unpublished at the time of Lányi's death as the starting basis for his authoritative study. There have been later reprintings of this work, starting with a revised edition published in 1963. The publication includes a chapter on 14 rejected attributions.

Each entry cites the documentary sources pertaining to the work, and excerpts from contemporary literary references.

name: Donatello
item_t: Donatello : catalogo completo delle opere.
public_note: Volume 22 from the series "I Gigli dell'arte". Catalogue lists 83 sculptures by the artist, all illustrated.

name: Duccio, di Buoninsegna
item_t: Duccio.
author: Deuchler, Florens
public_note: A monograph that cites six complete autograph works by the artist. Publication contains a separate catalogue of nine paintings by members of Duccio's circle or workshop.

name: Dolci, Carlo
item_t: Carlo Dolci : Complete Catalogue of the Paintings.
author: Baldassari, Francesca
public_note: This is the revised and expanded edition of the author's 1995 catalogue raisonné (cited in this database).

name: Domenichino
item_t: Domenichino.
author: Spear, Richard E.
public_note: The author draws heavily upon the large corpus of extant drawings and previously unpublished documents to carefully document the works. The chronological catalogue raisonné includes  117works, all illustrated in the plates volume. There is a separate catalogue of untraced paintings listed by subject, and a list of doubtful and rejected works, arranged by location.

name: Dolci, Carlo

public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 1,000 watercolors and gouaches by the artist organized chronologically. An addendum (also edited by Suse Pfäffle ) was published in 2007, as part of the exhibition catalogue "Geisterbahn und Glanzrevue: Otto Dix : Aquarelle und Gouachen", issued under the aegis of the Bucerius Kunst Forum.

name: Di Montezemolo, Guido

name: Dix, Otto
item_t: Otto Dix : das graphische Werk.
public_note: Catalogue of 352 of the artist's graphic works.

name: Dinet, Etienne
item_t: La vie et l'oeuvre de Etienne Dinet.
public_note: N.B. works done after 1908 were rarely dated, and some were stampled with a "cachet" after the artist's death, .

name: Diller, Burgoyne
item_t: Burgoyne Diller- ein Pionier des Neoplastizismus in Amerika : Versuch einer Einordnung unter besonderer Berücksichtigung des zeichnerischen Werks.
author: Prinz, Ina
cronology: Individual entries include title, date, medium, provenance, bibliography, inventory number(s), comments, and where illustrated.
ind_entr_cont:
The catalogue raisonné was presented as the author's doctoral dissertation for the University of Bonn in 2004.  A digital copy of the entire dissertation can be downloaded in full or in parts as a pdf from the University of Bonn library.  In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes a discussion of the artist's life, works, and critical reception.  

The chronological catalogue raisonné lists approximately 2,500 paintings, drawings, sculptures, and other works on paper.
public_note: check_needed

name: Diziani, Gaspare
item_t: Gaspare Diziani.
author: Zugni-Tauro, Anna Paola
public_note: Introductory material includes a biography, a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes and other essays. The catalogue raisonné presents the works as either autograph, attributed to Diziani, by one of the artist's followers of interest to historians, and lost/unlocated. There are also appendices discusssing and cataloging  Diziani's two sons' works (classified as either accepted, attributed or lost).

name: Dickinson, Edwin Walte
item_t: Edwin Dickinson Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology:
The catalogue consists of 1,201 numbered items. The catalogue can be searched by title and catalogue number; there is also an advanced sesarch function with filters.  

The entries provide title, number, date, place, medium and support, dimensions, signature and inscriptions, critical or historical notes, provenance, and exhibition history.
ind_entr_cont:
Launched in 2013, this online catalogue raisonné has interactive links to its various sections: Catalogue, Chronology, Exhibitions, Bibliography (books, interviews, articles, catalogues, newspapers), Public Collections, and Three Statements (by the authors).

The authors note that changes and additions are welcomed and should be addressed to the persons listed in the contacts page.
public_note: check_needed

name: Dine, Jim
item_t: Jim Dine Prints, 1985-2000 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note:
Continues the 1986 catalogue covering Dine's prints up to 1985 (see entries cited in this database) published in conjunction with an exhibition curated by Elizabeth Carpenter at the Minneapolis Institute of Arts in 2002. 
A catalogue raisonné of 198 prints, 10 artist's books and 4 portfolios, including concordances with numbers assigned by the print publishers (Landfall Press, Pace Editions, etc.). Carpenter's essay addresses the artist's books, performance art and poetry; Ruzicka's essay discusses Dine's prints and iconography. Foreward by Evan Maurer and Richard Campbell. Also contains a glossary of printmaking terms.

name: Dietrich, Adolf
item_t: Adolf Dietrich, 1877-1957 : Oeuvrekatalog der Ölbilder und Aquarelle.
public_note: Volume 14 from the series "Oeuvrekataloge schweizer Künstler". Catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings in oil, watercolors and gouaches, arranged chronologically by medium.

author: Dickerson, Jennifer
public_note: This is a biography and catalogue raisonné written by the artist's third wife. A revised edition was published by Queen Street Fine Art Publishing in 2004.

name: Dine, Jim
item_t: Jim Dine : Sculpture, 1983 - Present.
author: Davidson, Sara (ed.)
cronology:
The catalogue can be searched chronologically, by title, and by theme. Entries contain information on individual casts within editions, scalable color images in multiple views, provenance, exhibitions, references, and related works. 

Supplementary material will be added with new content including notes, catalogue numbers, information on technique and medium, chronology, videos, additional photographs and further provenance information, as it becomes available.
ind_entr_cont:
The online catalogue raisonné is fee-based, but a free temporary login can be obtained at the Artifex Press website (listed above).

The catalogue raisonné lists over 300 free-standing sculptures created from 1983, when Dine began working with the Walla Walla Foundry, to the present. The final chapter, dealing with works from 2010-2019, is still in preparation. The catalogue eventually will be expanded to include earlier works as well as newly completed projects.

.
public_note: check_needed

name: Deshays, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Deshays : 1729-1765.
public_note:
The author refers to his study as a monograph, but it does contain a "catalogue de l'oeuvre", including authentic paintings as well as a large number of  rejected works.

The catalogue raisonné is divided into the following categories: accepted works; works cited in contemporary sources; those of uncertain attribution; examples by followers or members of the artist's circle; and rejected works.  The drawings are listed in chronological order when possible, otherwise they are arranged by theme.

The present catalogue is based on Georges de Lastic Saint Jal's 1969 thesis for the l’École du Louvre. The work was continued by Pierre Jacky after Lastic's death in 1998.
