name: De Chirico, Giorgio
item_t: Giorgio de Chirico : catalogo generale, opere dal 1910 al 1975.
author_s:
Benzi, Fabio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Picozza, Paolo (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fondazione Giorgio e Isa de Chirico
public_note: Volume 2 catalogues 478 authentic paintings and works on paper by the artist; there is a separate catalogue of fake paintings.  There are also sections dedicated to De Chirico's jewelry designs and miniatures.

name: De Chirico, Giorgio
item_t: Giorgio de Chirico : catalogo generale, opere dal 1912 al 1976.
author_s:
Strinati, Claudio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Picozza, Paolo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fondazione Giorgio e Isa de Chirico
public_note: Regarding chronology, the date beside the signature on the work has not always been reliable, so some dates have been established with information provided by the Foundation Giorgio de Chirico, plus a study of exhibitions of works of various periods of production. This has allowed the establishment of a year or period of execution for those works which are without precise dating (allowing back or post dating to be less of a problem).

name: De Chirico, Giorgio
item_t: Giorgio de Chirico : catalogo ragionato.  L'opera tardo romantica e la prima metafisica, ottobre 1908/febbraio 1912..
imprint: Turin : Allemandi : Milan : Archivio dell'arte metafisica, 2019.
public_note: The catalogue also includes approx. 70 reworkings, copies, variants of metaphysical subjects documented between 1922 and 1943.

name: De Ferrari, Gregorio
item_t: Gregorio de Ferrari.
author_s:
Newcome-Schleier, Mary                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gavazza, Ezia (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cottino, Alberto (catalogue ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            De Moro, Gianni
imprint: Turin : Artema, Compagnia di belle arti, 1998.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné reproduces all the known work, including late works that were transferred to canvas or fresco by the artist's son. There are also listings of lost and rejected works.

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Degas et son oeuvre : A Supplement.
author_s:
Brame, Philippe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reff, Theodore                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reff, Arlene
public_note: The supplement is a fifth volume published with a 1984 New York reprint of the four volumes of the original catalogue raisonné (Paris, 1946).  This volume was compiled by Philippe Brame and Theodore Reff, with the assistance of Arlene Reff. A further supplement is in preparation (see entry in this database).

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Edgar Degas : Digital Critical Catalogue.
author: Schulman, Michel
cronology: Individual catalogue entries include title, exhibitions, references, signature and inscription information, and provenance.  All works are illustrated with scalable color images.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné of the paintings and pastels is organized chronologically.  The catalogue currently lists works up until 1908, but will eventually include Degas' complete oeuvre up until his death in 1917.  The site will also incorporate advanced search features, and as well as additional supplemental photographs.

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Degas et son oeuvre.
author: Lemoisne, Paul André
imprint: Paris : P. Brame et C.M. de Hauke aux Arts et Metiers Graphiques, 1946-1949.
public_note: The 4 volume set was  reprinted by Garland in 1984, together with a supplementary fifth volume in English. A second supplement is in preparation (see entry in this database).

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Edgar Degas : The Painter as Printmaker.
author_s:
Reed, Sue Welsh                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Shapiro, Barbara Stern                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Perkinson, Roy L.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ackley, Clifford S.
public_note: Catalogue of a traveling exhibition held at the Museum of Fine Arts Boston and elsewhere, 1984-1985.

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Degas's Complete Sculpture : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Rewald, John
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1990.
public_note: This is a revision of the 1944 and 1956 editions with additional images. The text is in English, but titles of works are given in  French.

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Edgar Degas : Photographer.
author_s:
Daniel, Malcolm R.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reff, Theodore                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Parry, Eugenia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            de Montebello, Philippe (foreword)
imprint: New York : Metropolitan Museum of Art : distributed by H.N. Abrams, 1998-1999.
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at The Metropolitan Museum of Art, the J. Paul Getty Museum, and the Bibliothèque Nationale de France. Contains a catalogue raisonné of Degas's photographs and a census of all of the known prints. Also published in a French edition.

name: Degas, Edga
item_t: Degas Sculptures : Catalogue Raisonné of the Bronzes.
author_s:
Czestochowski, Joseph S.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pingeot, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barbour, Daphne et al.
imprint: Memphis : Torch Press and International Arts, 2002.
ind_entr_cont: Appendix contains an inventory of sculptures in Degas' studio at his death; selected exhibition records; and a reprint of the the Hébrard Edition Contract. The publication also includes examples of the artist's signatures and inscriptions.
public_note: Bibliog.

name: De Kooning, Willem
item_t: The Prints of Willem de Kooning : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1957-1971 = L'oeuvre gravé  de Willem De Kooning, catalogue raisonné, 1957-1971 = Das druckgraphische Werk von Willem De Kooning : Werkverzeichnis
author: Graham, Lanier
public_note:
This was originally announced as a projected two-part publication, however the second volume (covering early 1970s-1980s) was not published.  

The critical apparatus gives number, title, date, dimensions, printers, publisher, and edition size.  The texts are trilingual.

name: De Kooning, Willem
item_t: Willem de Kooning Sculpture.
author_s:
Forge, Andrew                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sylvester, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tucker, William
public_note: This is the catalogue of a 1996 exhibition at the Matthew Marks Gallery, which includes an illustrated checklist of de Kooning's 33 sculptures.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: L'opera pittorica completa di Delacroix.
author: Rossi Bortolatto, Luigina
public_note: Catalogue entries list number, title, medium, dimensions, date, notes. All works are illustrated with b&w thumbnail images.  Mention is made of late works recorded in the sources plus copies of works and addenda.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Delacroix.
public_note: From the series "Les Classiques de l'Art."  This is a translation from the original Italian edition: "Opera pittorica completa di Delacroix", Milan, 1972.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: The Paintings of Eugène Delacroix : A Critical Catalogue.
author: Johnson, Lee
public_note:
Supplements appear in v. 3 and v. 6. 

See also the entry for the fourth supplement (with reprint of the third supplement) cited in this database.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: The Paintings of Eugène Delacroix : A Critical Catalogue : Fourth Supplement and Reprint of  the Third Supplement.
author: Johnson, Lee
imprint: Oxford; New York : Oxford University Press, 2002.
public_note: Earlier supplements appeared in original editions of this catalogue raisonné. The fourth supplement contains numerous new works discovered after the 1993 publication of the third supplement.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: Dessins d'Eugène Delacroix, 1798-1863.
author_s:
Sérullaz, Maurice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sérullaz, Arlette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Prat, Louis-Antoine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ganeval, Claudine
public_note:
The first monographic volume to be issued within the series published by the Louvre's Drawing Department: "Inventaire général des dessins, École française." 

This publication catalogues all Delacroix's drawings in the Cabinet des Dessins, Musée du Louvre, the most important single holding of the artist's drawings in the world, including single sheets and 24 albums of sketches.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: Delacroix Pastels.
author: Johnson, Lee
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is arranged by subject: portraits, studies for paintings, literature and mythology, North Africa, Wild Animals, Religion, Landscape, and Still Life. There is a separate catalogue of pastels known only through documents.  All works are illustrated in color.

name: Delaroche, Paul
item_t: Oeuvre de Paul Delaroche reproduit en photographie.
author_s:
Bingham, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Delaborde, Henri                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Goddé, Jules
public_note: The full title is "Oeuvre de Paul Delaroche reproduit en photographie; accompagne d'une notice sur la vie et les ouvrages de Paul Delaroche et du catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre."  The catalogue raisonné of 86 paintings was compiled by J. Goddé.

name: Delacroix, Eugène
item_t: Delacroix, The Graphic Work : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The first edition of this catalogue was published in 1908, as part of vol. III, "Ingres & Delacroix" published within Delteil's 32-volume "Le Peintre-graveur illustré" (1902-1926).

name: Dawson-Watson
item_t: Dawson Dawson-Watson Catalogue Raisonné Project.
author: Dawson-Watson, Dawson
public_note: Clicking on the the image displays the critical apparatus, which includes title, medium and support, size, date, signature information, collection, and exhibition history.

name: Dawson, Manierre
item_t: Manierre Dawson (1887-1969) : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Ploog, Randy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baristow, Myra                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Boyajian, Ani (ed.)
imprint: Jacksonville, FL : The Three Graces : New York : in association with Hollis Taggart Galleries, 2011.
public_note:
Entries are catalogued by year of completion, and all items are illustrated.  

The authors state that the catalogue raisonné is not all-inclusive, and that a work's omission should not be taken as a statement regarding its authenticity.

name: Deas, Charle
item_t: Charles Deas and 1840s America.
author_s:
Clark, Carol                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hassrick, Peter (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sharp, Lewis (foreword)
public_note: This catalogue was published in conjunction with the Denver Art Museum to accompany an exhibition in 2010.  It is also volume 4 of the "Charles M. Russell Center Series on Art and Photography of the American West".

name: Davies, Arthur B.
item_t: Arthur B. Davies : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints.
author: Czestochowski, Joseph S.
imprint: Newark, DE : University of Delaware Press; London : Associated University Presses, 1987.
public_note: Catalogue includes 218 prints and lithographs. Individual entries contain information on printings, editions, and states.

name: David d'Angers, Pierre-Jean
item_t: The Portrait Medallions of David d'Angers : An Illustrated Catalogue of David's Contemporary and Retrospective Portraits in Bronze.
public_note: The catalogue includes information on foundries with images of founders' marks.  There are also excerpts from David d'Angers' reflections on the portrait medallions.

name: Davis, Stua
item_t: Stuart Davis : Graphic Work and Related Paintings, with a Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints.
author_s:
Kelder, Diane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Myers, Jane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cole, Sylvan
imprint: Fort Worth, TX : Amon Carter Museum, 1986.
public_note:
Each lithograph is reproduced with corresponding drawings and paintings in oil.  
An Appendix contains "Selections from Davis' Notebooks and Sketchbooks 1922-1938". There is a select bibliography and a general index.

name: Davis, Stua
item_t: Stuart Davis : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Boyajian, Ani                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rutkoski, Mark                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Agee, William C. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Karen Wilken (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Davis, Earl (preface)
imprint: New Haven : Yale University Art Gallery ; in association with Yale University Press, 2007.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 1,749 works, over 600 previously unillustrated. Volume 2 includes juvenalia, watercolors, cartoons and other works on paper. Volume 3 catalogues the oil paintings and murals.

name: David, Jacques-Lou
item_t: Documents complémentaires au catalogue de l'oeuvre de Louis David.
public_note: This publication contains a list of David's students and followers.  It also considers his genealogy and historical reviews of David's oeuvre. The full text of the catalogue is available on the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's website (See Full Text link on this page).

name: David, Jacques-Lou
item_t: Jacques-Louis David jugé par ses contemporains et par la postérité.
author: Verbraeken, René
public_note:
Subtitle: Suivi de la liste des tableaux dont l'authenticité est garantie par les écrits de l'artiste, des documents de son époque, ou par leur appartenance à ses descendants. Avec un bibliographie chronologique.

The catalogue includes both paintings and graphic works. Not all entries are illustrated.

name: David, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni David : pittore e incisore della famiglia Durazzo.
public_note: The catalogue entries give number, title, medium and support, dimensions, bibliographical references, inventory numbers, and notes.

name: David, Gerard
item_t: Gerard David.
author: Miegroet, Hans J. van
public_note: Mercator also published simultaneous English and French editions of this title in 1989.

name: David, Jacques-Lou
item_t: Jacques-Louis David, 1748-1825 : catalogue raisonné des dessins.
public_note: The catalogue includes over 1150 authentic drawings by David, divided into the following categories: original drawings, notebooks, and albums, all illustrated.  The publication also contains separate catalogues of rejected drawings, drawings known only through prints, and works known only through documents. Individual entries contain information on inscriptions, and list original sources when the drawing is after another work of art.

name: David, Jacques-Lou
item_t: Dessins de Jacques-Louis David, 1748-1825
author_s:
Musée du Louvre. Cabinet des dessins                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sérullaz, Arlette
public_note: This includes the holdings of David's drawings in the Musée du Louvre.  The publication was issued in the series "Inventaire général des dessins, école française."

name: Dauzats, Adrien
item_t: Adrien Dauzats, ou, la tentation de l'Orient : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Plessier, Ghislaine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Musée des Beaux-Arts de Bordeaux
imprint: Bordeaux : Musée des Beaux-Arts : W. Blake, 1990.
public_note:
The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Musée des Beaux-Arts in Bordeaux. 
The work is organized chronologically, and includes copies and collaborative works that either are dated or verified by documents and archives.  A second chapter deals with undated works, which (if authentic) are classified under country depicted.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre lithographié de Honoré Daumier.
public_note: A reprint edition was issued in 2001 by Martino Publishing, Mansfield Centre (CT).

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Honoré Daumier : Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings, Watercolors and Drawings.
author: Maison, K.E.
imprint: Greenwich, CT : New York Graphic Society, Ltd., 1968.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Daumier sculpteur, 1808-1879 : Avec un catalogue raisonné et illustré de l'oeuvre sculpté.
author: Gobin, Maurice
public_note: Vol. 27 from the series "Peintres et sculpteurs d'hier et d'aujourd'hui". Catalogue raisonné lists 65 sculptures by the artist, all works are illustrated.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Doctors and Medicine in the Works of Daumier.
author_s:
Mondor, Henri                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Adhémar, Jean (notes & catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heintzelman, Arthur W. (preface)
imprint: Boston : Boston Book & Art Shop; Paris : André Sauret, 1960.
public_note: Translated from the French; captions are in French and English. At least three editions of this book have been published.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Honoré Daumier, a Thematic Guide to the Oeuvre.
public_note: This book is not per se a catalogue raisonné, but rather a highly useful iconographic index for Delteil's seminal catalogue raisonné of 1904 (described in this database). Includes notes regarding the catalogues raisonnés for Daumier by Bouvy, Maison, Delteil, Fuchs, Gobin, Mandel & George. The preface and introduction appear in both French and English.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Daumier Register
cronology: Individual entries contain information on states and editions, medium, dimensions, locations, where published, provenance, and dates.  The "collection details" tab brings up a list of institutions holding numbered editions for prints and bronzes produced in series.
ind_entr_cont:
This is the first online catalogue raisonné of Daumier's entire oeuvre. The catalogue currently lists 550 oil paintings, 100 sculptures, 4,000 lithographs, 1,000 wood engravings, and 1,139 drawings.   The catalogue also lists 447 drawings after Daumier and 295 unconfirmed drawings.

 The catalogue raisonné can be searched chronologically, by collection, by medium, or by theme.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Daumier : l'oeuvre gravé du maître : The Complete Engravings.
author: Bouvy, Eugène
public_note: A reprint of Bouvy's original work, published in two volumes in 1933 by Maurice Le Garrec, Paris. The original introduction has been translated into English.

name: Daumier, Honoré
item_t: Honoré Daumier : The Early Lithographs ; Catalogue Raisonné ; L'oeuvre lithographié 1830-1837.
author: Delteil, Loys
public_note:
This revised edition of Delteil's 1925 illustrated catalogue includes essays by Delteil and Gordon Ray.  

The present catalogue also includes material from the original 1904 unillustrated catalogue (cited in this database).  Texts are in French, but the introduction, print titles and annotations are also given in English.

name: Davringhausen, Heinrich
item_t: Heinrich Maria Davringhausen 1894-1970 : Monographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Eimert, Dorothea
public_note: This catalogue was published in conjunction with a retrospective exhibition held at the Leopold-Hoesch-Museum Düren in 1995. The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's paintings, sculptures, graphic works and pictures on slate; all works are illustrated with black and white thumbnail images.  The Documents section includes excerpts from contemporary criticism and reproduces some archival material on the artist.

name: Dantan, Joseph Edouard
item_t: Edouard Dantan : L'esquisse de catalogue raisonné.
author: Musée des Avelines
cronology: The "Table" field gives thumbnail illustrations, date, technique and medium, location, and the artist's inventory citation and images (if available).
ind_entr_cont: Entries supply information on number, title, inventory number, date, collection, technique and media, ownership (and copyright) for supplied images, inscriptions and marks.
public_note: Comments

name: Daubigny, Charles-Franço
item_t: Daubigny.
author_s:
Fidell-Beaufort, Madeleine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bailly-Herzberg, Janine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Geoffroy-Dechaume, Adolphe Victor
public_note: Texts and catalogue are bilingual. The catalogue lists 208 paintings and drawings by the artist, and includes a genealogical table of Daubigny's family and short biographies of his friends.

name: Daubigny, Charles-Franço
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Daubigny, Charles-Franço
item_t: Charles-François Daubigny, 1817-1878.
author: Hellebranth, Robert
public_note: Includes excerpts from Daubigny's notebook. In French, with contributions in English by Richard Gregg and Charles Price.

name: Daubigny, Charles-Franço
item_t: Charles-François Daubigny 1817-1878 : Supplément au catalogue raisonné.
public_note: Supplement to Robert Hellebranth's 1976 catalogue raisonné. The supplement adds 224 paintings to the artist's oeuvre, all arranged by subject. A second supplement, by Anne Hellebranth, is currently in preparation.

name: Daniele, da Volterra
item_t: Daniele da Volterra : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Barolsky, Paul
public_note: This is based on author's dissertation presented at Harvard University, 1969.

name: Dannecker, Johann Heinrich von
item_t: Johann Heinrich Dannecker.
imprint: Stuttgart : Staatsgalerie Stuttgart ; Stuttgart-Bad Cannstatt : Edition Cantz, 1987.
public_note: This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Staatsgalerie Stuttgart. Christian von Holst compiled the catalogue of the paintings, and Ulrike Gauss prepared the catalogue raisonné of the drawings.

name: Dan, Calin
item_t: Subreal.
imprint: Bucharest : National Museum of Contemporary Art ; Vienna : Verlag für Moderne Kunst, 2015.
public_note: The catalogue was published following a 2012-2013 exhibition held at the Muzeul National de Arta Contemporana (Bucharest) and SALT Beyogl (Istanbul).

name: Dandini, Cesare
item_t: Cesare Dandini.
imprint: Turin : Artema : Compagnia di belle arti, 1996.
public_note: Catalogue of 235 paintings is divided into autograph works; collaborative works of uncertain attribution; works of his school; important copies after Dandini; and works known only through documentation. Some preparatory drawings are included with the associated paintings.

name: Dahmen, Karl Fred
item_t: K.F. Dahmen, Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik, 1956-1978.
public_note: The publication's English title is  "K.F. Dahmen, His Complete Graphic Work, 1956-1978."

name: Dana, Yve
item_t: Dana.
author_s:
Maggioni, Laura                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ben Jelloun, Tahar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Frehner, Matthias
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in the catalogue of an exhibition at the Espace Arlaud in Lausanne, Switzerland.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: Salvador Dalí : The Catalogue Raisonné of Prints II : Lithographs and Wood Engravings, 1956-1980.
author_s:
Löpsinger, Lutz W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Michler, Ralf                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Descharnes, Robert (foreword)
public_note: Catalogue of Dalí's lithographs, wood engravings, and silk screen prints. A German edition also exists.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: Salvador Dalí : The Catalogue Raisonné of Etchings and Mixed-Media Prints, 1924-1980.
author_s:
Löpsinger, Lutz W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Michler, Ralf                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Descharnes, Robert (foreword)
public_note: Subtitle: "Incorporating entries from Charles Sahli's "Salvador Dali, 257 éditions originales, 1964-1985," (J. P. Schneider, Paris, 1985).  A German edition also exists.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: Salvador Dalí, the Paintings, 1904-1989.
public_note: Not a traditional catalogue raisonné; images are dispersed throughout the text and there is little critical apparatus.  The two volumes were combined later into a single-volume edition (Taschen, Cologne and New York, 1997). Robert Descharnes was Dalí's long time friend and associate.

name: Dahmen, Karl Fred
item_t: K.F. Dahmen : Werkverzeichnis.
public_note: The first volume contains a foreword, essays,  and catalogue of works from 1946-1965, plus short literary citations.  The second volume catalogues the years 1966-1981.  It includes a biography, lists of exhibitions and collectors, plus a full bibliography covering books, exhibition catalogues, newspaper articles, and films.

name: Dahl, J. C. (Johan Christian)
item_t: Johan Christian Dahl, 1788-1857 : Life and Works.
author: Bang, Marie Lødrup
public_note: The first volume includes the introductory texts and a chronological essay on the artist's life.  The appendix contains excerpts from contemporary reviews of Dahl's art, as well as excerpts from Dahl's autographical notes, correspondence, and statements on art and nature.  There are also texts relating to the artist's relationship with Prince Christian Frederik, as well as the itineraries of Dahl's Norwegian journeys.

name: Dagnan-Bouveret, Pascal Adolphe Jean
item_t: Catalogue des oeuvres de M. Dagnan-Bouveret.
public_note: The publication includes a short biographical essay and a brief discussion of the artist's works.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: The Official Catalog of the Graphic Works of Salvador Dali.
imprint: Astoria [Queens], New York : Salvador Dalí Archives, 1996.
public_note: Includes "A guide to collecting Dali prints."   Self-published by the author, with the subtitle, "authorized by Dali."  The extent of Dali's own involvement in the production of prints bearing his name can be problematic.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: El primer Dali, 1918-1929: catalogo razonado.
author: Santos Torroella, Rafael.
imprint: Madrid: Publicaciones de la Residencia de Estudiantes; Valencia: Institut Valencia d'Art Modern, 2005.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: Salvador Dalí Catalogue Raisonné of Paintings. [online]
author_s:
Aguer, Montse                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pitxot, Antoni, et al.
cronology: The catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically, but also can be searched by catalogue number, keyword, title, or current location.
public_note: In 2004, the centenary of Dali's birth, the Fundació Gala-Salvador Dalí launched the first installment of the catalogue covering the period 1910-1930.  The next four installments: Part 2: (1931-1939), Part 3: (1940-1951), Part 4: (1952-1964), and Part 5: (1965-1983)  were published 2007- 2017.  In total, the online catalogue raisonné lists approximately 1,000 paintings.

name: Dalí, Salvado
item_t: Dalí Illustrator.
public_note: A complete, scholarly guide to the historic literary works of Salvador Dalí.  Several preliminary chapters discuss the enigma, art, amibition and psychology of the artist. There is compilation of texts, documents, and illustrations about Dali's illustrations, retrospective exhibitions, books by Dalí on Dalí, and personal remembrances of the artist by the author and others.

name: Dandini, Cesare
item_t: Cesare Dandini : addenda al catalogo dei dipinti.
author: Bellesi, Sandro
public_note: Supplement to Bellesi's 1996 catalogue raisonné published by Artema (see entry cited in this database).  The supplement includes an additional 51 paintings.

name: Dandini, Vincenzo
item_t: Vincenzo Dandini e la pittura a Firenze alla metà del Siecento.
author: Bellesi, Sandro
public_note: Introductory material includes biographical sources, and separate discussions of Dandini's critical fortunes, family details, Medici commissions, and central phases of the artist's career, etc. There are also lists of documents, a bibliography and index of names.

name: Danhauser, Josef
item_t: Der Maler Josef Danhauser : Biedermeierzeit im Bild : Monografie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Grabner, Sabine
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition titled "Josef Danhauser: Bilderzählungen" held at the Galerie Belvedere in Vienna. The catalogue is in German with an English summary.

name: Cuypers, Petrus Josephus Hubertu
item_t: P.J.H. Cuypers (1827-1921) : The Complete Works.
imprint: Rotterdam : Nai Publishers ; New York ; Available in North, South, Central America through D.A.P., 2007.
public_note: Published upon the completion of the inventory of the Cuypers archive at the Netherlands Architecture Institute (NAI).

name: Curry, John Steua
item_t: The Lithographs of John Steuart Curry : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: Mostly illustrations. The catalogue raisonné lists 41 lithographs made between 1927-1945, arranged chronologically.

name: Curtis, Philip C.
item_t: An Illustrated Catalog of the Works of Philip C. Curtis.
author_s:
Kitchell, Nancy (Editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Davis, Dan Farrell (Editor)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mehren, Lawrence L. (Editor)

name: Currin, John
item_t: John Currin.
author_s:
Gingeras, Alison M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Eggers, Dave                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vander Weg, Kara (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dergan, Rose                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bryson, Norman
imprint: New York : Gagosian Gallery, Distributed by Rizzoli International, 2006.
public_note: The publication includes all of Currin's paintings and drawings, approximately 400 works, up to the date of publication.

name: Currier, Nathaniel
item_t: Currier & Ives : A Catalogue Raisonné : A Comprehensive Catalogue of the Lithographs of Nathaniel Currier, James Merritt Ives and Charles Currier.
author_s:
Gale Research Company (catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reilly, Jr., Bernard F. (intro.)
public_note: Two-volume catalogue raisonné of over 7,500 lithographs by Nathaniel Currier, Charles Currier and James Merritt Ives. The publication includes ephemera associated with the firms, 1854-1907.

name: Curia, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Curia : l'opera completa.
author: Di Majo, Ippolita
public_note: This is the first comprehensive survey of the artist's work. Following the introductory texts, the publication includes separate catalogues of Curia's paintings and drawings.  There is an Appendix with documents, and a bibliography, as well as name, location and title indices.

name: Currier, Charle
item_t: Currier and Ives Prints : An Illustrated Checklist.
author_s:
Conningham, Frederic A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Searjeant, Robert L. (Foreward)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Conningham, Mary B.
public_note: New, updated edition of Frederick and Mary Conningham's 1930 publication. This checklist of over 5700 lithographs largely has been superceded by the 1984 catalogue raisonné by the Gale Research Company (see entry in this database).

name: Currier, Charle
item_t: Currier & Ives : A Catalogue Raisonné : A Comprehensive Catalogue of the Lithographs of Nathaniel Currier, James Merritt Ives and Charles Currier.
author_s:
Gale Research Company (catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Reilly, Jr., Bernard F. (intro.)
public_note: Two-volume catalogue raisonné of over 7,500 lithographs by Nathaniel Currier, Charles Currier and James Merritt Ives. The publication includes ephemera associated with the firms, 1854-1907.

name: Cumberland, Fred
item_t: Fred Cumberland : Building the Victorian Dream.
author: Simmins, Geoffrey
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné divided into three parts: Cumberland's life, a survey of his architectural career, and the catalogue raisonné of Cumberland's architectural designs.

name: Cruikshank, Isaac
item_t: Isaac Cruikshank : A Catalogue Raisonné with a Sketch of His Life and Work.
author: Krumbhaar, Edward B.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 1,400 signed, unsigned but accepted works, and some uncertain attributions, plus 147 doubtful works.

name: Cruikshank, George
item_t: George Cruikshank : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Work Executed during the Years 1806-1877.
author: Cohn, Albert M.

name: Crotti, Jean
item_t: Jean Crotti : l'oeuvre peint, 1900-1958 : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Bertoli, Jean Carlo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Naumann, Francis (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weck, Marine de (essay)
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists approximately 561 works by the artist, listed in chronological order, almost all are illustrated in color. Individual entries contain no comments.

name: Cross & Cro
item_t: New York Transformed : The Architecture of Cross & Cross.

name: Cross, John Walte
item_t: New York Transformed : The Architecture of Cross & Cross.

name: Cross, Elio
item_t: New York Transformed : The Architecture of Cross & Cross.

name: Cross, Henri Edmond
item_t: H.E. Cross.
public_note: This publication is referred to as "a first effort for a catalogue of the painted work"; it was issued in a numbered edition of 500 copies, plus 50 numbered A to L.

name: Crosato, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giambattista Crosato : pittore del rococò europeo.
author: Ton, Denis
imprint: Venice : Fondazione Giorgio Cini ; Verona : Scripta, 2012.
public_note:
Introductory essays cover the artist's career by period, with notes on his graphic work, critical fortunes, and chronology.  The catalogue raisonné of the painted works is divided into sections: autograph works, lost or untraceable paintings, and works of doubtful or inconclusive attribution.

The Appendix includes documents related to the artist's life. There are also indices of names, places, and subjects.

name: Crome, John
item_t: John Crome the Elder.
author: Goldberg, Norman L.
imprint: New York : New York University Press, 1978.
public_note: The first part of Volume 1 includes essays on the background, theory, style and development of the artist. It examines copies, considers Crome and the Norwich School, etc. The appendices include a biographical summary, works directly executed by the artist, the catalogue of his 1821 Memorial Exhibition, a chronology of chief events of the Norwich School, and other documents.

name: Croissant, Michael
item_t: Der Bildhauer Michael Croissant (1928-2002) : mit dem Werkverzeichnis der Skulpturen.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at multiple German venues. The publication includes short essay on technical considerations regarding Croissant's sculptures.  The authors state that it is not intended to be a critical catalogue  raisonné, but rather an overview of the artist's oeuvre.

name: Cropsey, Jaspe
item_t: Jasper Francis Cropsey : Catalogue Raisonné : Works in Oil, Volume One : 1842-1863.
author_s:
Speiser, Anthony M. (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Maddox, Kenneth W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Newington, Barbara (foreword)
public_note: Appendices include a chronology, a bibliography, a list of collectors, and exhibitions. It also includes indices of works by title and subject matter. There are also lists of collectors and of public collections housing the artist's paintings.

name: Crodel, Charle
item_t: Charles Crodel : das graphische Werk, 1919-1960.
author: Steckner, Cornelius
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 400 prints by the artist.

name: Crivelli,Carlo
item_t: L'opera completa del Crivelli.
author: Bovero, Anna
public_note: Volume 80 from the series "Classici dell'arte". Catalogue of 187 paintings by the artist.

name: Crivelli,Carlo
item_t: Carlo Crivelli.
author: Zampetti, Pietro
illustrations: numerous b&w ills., over 200 color plates
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists over one hundred paintings by Crivelli. The Appendix contains excerpts of documents from the artist's life.

name: Creti, Donato
item_t: Donato Creti : le opere su carta : catalogo ragionato.
public_note: The publication includes a list of autograph drawings, lost and unlocated drawings, and doubtful or rejected works.  There is also separate indices of names and places.

name: Cressent, Charle
item_t: Charles Cressent : Analyse und Katalog seines Werkes.
author: Zilken, Monika
public_note: Volume 57 from the series "Tuduv-Studien. Riehe Kunstgeschichte". Originally the author's doctoral thesis presented at the Universität Munich. The Getty Library has a typescript of an English translation by Janet Seligman.

name: Crippa, Roberto
item_t: Roberto Crippa : catalogo generale delle opere.

name: Crespi, Giuseppe Maria
item_t: Giuseppe Maria Crespi.
author: Merriman, Maria Pajes
public_note: This study is organized by subject matter, i.e. by depictions of Old and New Testament scenes, saints, historical or mytholocial subjects, portraits, and genre paintings, with an addenda section.

name: Crespi, Daniele
item_t: Daniele Crespi.
author: Neilson, Nancy Ward
public_note: From the series "Collana 'I cardini'". The catalogue raisonné lists 84 autograph works, arranged alphabetically by collection. It also contains separate catalogues of lost paintings, attributed works, and drawings for unknown or unrealized paintings.

name: Crespi, Giuseppe Maria
item_t: Giuseppe Maria Crespi, i disegni e le stampe : catalogo ragionato.
author: Riccòmini, Marco

name: Cremona, Tranquillo
item_t: Tranquillo Cremona : catalogo ragionato.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biographical record, a critical anthology, and indices.

name: Cremona, Italo
item_t: Catalogo generale dell'opera pittorica di Italo Cremona.

name: Cremer, Fritz
item_t: Fritz Cremer : Lithographien, 1955-1974.
author_s:
Gredig, Ruth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Josten, Gisela                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ludwig, Horst-Jorg (foreward)
imprint: Berlin : Akademie der Künste der Deutschen Demokratischen Republik, 1975.

name: Crayer, Gaspar de
item_t: Gaspar de Crayer, sa vie et ses oeuvres.
imprint: Brussels : Arcade, (in collaboration with the National Centrum voor de plastische kunsten van de XVIde en XVIIde eeuw), 1972.
public_note: The catalogue is divided into two groups; the first comprises authentic datable existing or unlocated works (277 paintings), the second contains non-datable authentic and unlocated works (118 paintings). The appendix includes a documentary chronology with excerpts of documents related to the artist's life.

name: Crawford, Ralston
item_t: Lithographs of Ralston Crawford.
author: Freeman, Richard B.
imprint: Lexington, KY : University of Kentucky Press, 1962.
public_note: Catalogue of 128 works from 1940 to 1959.

name: Cranach, Max Alwin Lucas von
item_t: Max Alwin Lucas von Cranach : ein Maler im zwanzigsten Jahrhundert : Biographie und Werkverzeichnis.
author: Cranach, Edzard Lucas von

name: Craesbeeck, Josse van
item_t: Joos van Craesbeeck (1605/06 - ca. 1660) : een brabants genreschilder.
author: Clippel, Karolien de
public_note: This monograph and catalogue raisonné is based on the author's doctoral thesis, presented at the Katholieke Universiteit te Leuven in 2002.  The catalogue raisonné lists the approximately 120 known paintings by the artist.

name: Cozzens, Frederic
item_t: Frederic Cozzens : Marine Painter.
author: Jacobsen, Anita
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes a chapter that discusses some of the artist's paintings and drawings and their provenance and exhibition history.

name: Cragg, Tony
item_t: Anthong Cragg. Volume III : Sculpture 1986-2000.
imprint: Cologne : Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther König, 2018.
public_note: Vol. 3 covers Cragg's transitional work from 1986 to 2000, presented in chronologial order. During this period Cragg moved from using found objects to making found materials themselves the subject and content of his sculpture.

name: Coypel, Noël Nicola
item_t: Noël-Nicolas Coypel (1690-1734).
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of paintings, drawings and engravings. The publication includes separate catalogues of disputed and rejected works.

name: Coypel, Antoine
item_t: Antoine Coypel (1661-1722).
author: Garnier-Pelle, Nicole
public_note: The publication includes a genealogy of the Coypel family.  The catalogue was published in conjunction with the Centre National des Lettres.  The catalogue lists over 700 paintings, drawings and prints by Antoine Coypel.

name: Coysevox, Antoine
item_t: Antoine Coysevox (1640-1720) : catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre.
author: Keller-Dorian, Georges
public_note: Volume 2 continues the catalogue of works.  The publication also includes a bibliography, a table of works, an index of artists' names cited in the text, and errata from Vols. 1&2.

name: Cragg, Tony
item_t: Anthony Cragg. Volume I : Works on Paper.
imprint: Cologne : Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther König, 2017.
illustrations: 1,743 b&w and color ills., 478 color plates
public_note: This volume of the catalogue raisonné catalogues approximately 1,800 of the artist's gouaches, watercolors and graphic works.

name: Coypel, Charles-Antoine
item_t: Charles Coypel : peintre du roi (1694-1752).
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 430 paintings, 182 drawings and 27 engravings.

name: Coysevox, Antoine
item_t: Antoine Coysevox (1640-1720) : catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre.
public_note: There is a short biography accompanied by documents essential to establishing the various stages of the artist's career, followed by a critical catalogue. The dated works in the largely illustrated catalogue are in chronological order. The catalogue includes works known only from documents and lost works.

name: Cranach, Lucas, the elde
item_t: The Paintings of Lucas Cranach.
public_note:
This is the revised English edition of  "Die Gemälde von Lucas Cranach" (Berlin: Deutscher Verein für Kunstwissenschaft, 1932).  

The authors state in the introduction that the catalogue does not include all of Cranach's paintings.  Although not a catalogue raisonné per se, the publication is one of the most thorough surveys of Cranach's work.

name: Cranach, Lucas, the elde
item_t: Cranach Digital Archive.
author_s:
Heydenreich, Gunner                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stahlmann, Jörg                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Smith, Helen                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Görres, Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Herrschaft, Jana
cronology: The catalogue raisonné can be accessed via the "Explore the Paintings" tab on the main page.  The catalogue can be searched in English and German, and according to a variety of rubrics (by collection, chronologically, by attribution, etc).
ind_entr_cont: Clicking on the resulting image will provide full information on the item, including, date, inscriptions, collection, medium, conservation reports, restauration information, etc.  Entries also include scalable high resolution photographs, related images, x-radiographs, infrared images, and technical reports, if any.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Cranach, Lucas, the elde
item_t: Die Gemälde von Lucas Cranach, herausgegeben von Max J. Friedländer und Jakob Rosenberg.
public_note: Published under the aegis: "Jahresgabe des Deutschen Vereins für Kunstwissenshaft, 1932".

name: Cournault, Etienne
item_t: Etienne Cournault, 1891-1948, peintre et graveur : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé.
author: Simon-Cournault, Marie-Antoinette
imprint: Paris : Bibliothèque des arts; Metz : Éditions Serpenoise, 1991.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné in French; introductory biography in French, English and German.

name: Cranach, Lucas, the elde
item_t: Cranach : die Zeichnungen.
author: Hofbauer, Michael
ind_entr_cont: Individual entries cite collection, dimensions, media, date, bibliography, and extensive comments. All works are illustrated in color.
public_note: Bibliog.; Comments

name: Coutaud, Lucien
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié de Lucien Coutaud.
public_note: This is volume 3 from the series "Catalogues d'oeuvres gravés et lithographiés."   It was issued in a limited edition of 300 copies.

name: Couse, E. Irving
item_t: E. Irving Couse : 1866-1936.
imprint: Santa Fe, NM : Santa Fe Village Art Museum, 1976.
public_note: Catalogue contains notes by K.W. Couse.

name: Cragg, Tony
item_t: Anthony Cragg. Volume II : Sculpture 1969-1985.
author_s:
Cragg, Tony                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cragg Foundation                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wood, Jon (intro.)
imprint: Cologne : Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther König, 2018.
public_note: Vols. 2-4 will document the artist's sculptural works in three consecutive periods.  Vol.II covers the years 1969 to 1985, in chronological order.

name: Counihan, Noel
item_t: Noel Counihan Prints, 1931-1981 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Smith, Robert
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 132 prints, all illustrated. Individual entries provide information on states, dimensions, and inscriptions.

name: Cottingham, Robe
item_t: Robert Cottingham, a Print Retrospective, 1972-1986.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of all 35 prints, listed in chronological order, created from 1972 until the date of publication. Published in conjunction with a 1987 traveling exhibition.

name: Cottet, Charle
item_t: Charles Cottet, 1863-1925 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé
author: Morane, Daniel
imprint: Pont-Aven : Musée de Pont-Aven ; Paris : Bibliothèque d'Art et d'Archéologie-Jacques Doucet, 2002.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Musée de Pont-Aven in 2003. The catalogue lists 71 prints by the artist.

name: Courbet, Gustave
item_t: La vie et l'oeuvre de Gustave Courbet : catalogue raisonné.
author: Fernier, Robert
imprint: Geneva : Fondation Wildenstein ; Lausanne : Bibliothèque des Arts, 1977-1978.
public_note: The chronological catalogue of the paintings is followed by a small catalogue of the sculptures. There is also a separate section dedicated to unidentified paintings and drawings.  Entries include provenance information, exhibitions, comments, and extracts from contemporary citations, when available.

name: Cotes, Franc
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Cosway, Richard
item_t: A Catalogue Raisonné of the Engraved Works of Richard Cosway, R.A.
author: Daniell, Frederick B.
public_note: The publication includes a memoir of Richard Cosway by Sir Philip Currie.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné of engravings after Cosway's original oil paintings, drawings and miniatures.

name: Costa, Giovann
item_t: Nino Costa (1826- 1903) : Transnational Exchange in European Landscape Painting.

name: Costa, Lorenzo di Ottavio
item_t: Lorenzo Costa : 1460-1535.
public_note: Introductory essays and the color plates are followed by a catalogue raisonné, arranged chronologically. Destroyed paintings that have known images have been incorporated with existing works. Lost and untraceable works are listed separately, arranged alphabetically in topographical order.

name: Cortona, Pietro da
item_t: Pietro da Cortona ; o, della pittura barocca.
author: Briganti, Giuliano
public_note: This is the revised and expanded edition of the original catalogue published in 1962.

name: Cort, Cornel
item_t: Cornelis Cort.
imprint: Rotterdam : Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabintet, Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam. 2000.
public_note: Published in the series: "New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish Etchings, Engravings and Woodcuts, 1450-1700".  This is the first publication to fully document and illustrate as many states as possible of the artist's oeuvre.  The current publication revises the earlier catalogue by Biernes de Haan.

name: Corona, Vittorio
item_t: Vittorio Corona : attraverso il futurismo : catalogo ragionato dei dipinti e delle opere su carta : 1919-1966
author: Crispolti, Enrico

name: Correa, Juan
item_t: Juan Correa : su vida y su obra.
author_s:
Vargas Lugo de Bosch, Elisa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Guadalupe Victoria, José                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Curiel, Gustavo
imprint: Mexico, D. F. : Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México, 1985-

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: L'oeuvre de Corot : catalogue raisonné et illustré.
public_note: Vols. 4 and 5 are bound in one. Volume 4 contains the catalogue of the drawings and graphic works. The publication lists approx. 660 drawings and book illustrations. Entries cite title, date, medium, dimensions, comments, and provenance. Not all works are illustrated.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Corot : Sixième  supplément à "L'oeuvre de Corot", par A. Robaut et E. Moreau-Nélaton.
public_note: The first new addition since 2002 to the catalogue raisonné of painted works.  It is available as a limited edition book (not reviewed), as well as in PDF and e-book formats.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: L'oeuvre de Corot : catalogue raisonné et illustré.
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, provenance, signatures & inscriptions, collection, dimensions, exhibitions, and comments.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: L'oeuvre de Corot : catalogue raisonné et illustré.
author: Robaut, Alfred
public_note: The second volume includes the first part of the catalogue raisonné. The catalogue organized chronologically, and lists 1,262 works.  Individual entries include title, date, dimensions, provenance, notes, and black and white thumbnail images.  Salons and other selected exhibitions are also listed.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: L'oeuvre de Corot : catalogue raisonné et illustré.
public_note: The first volume contains lengthy texts discussing Corot's life and artistic career.  The appendix includes a list of illustrations, additions and corrections to the text, and a transcript of Corot's birth certificate.

name: Cotes, Franc
item_t: Francis Cotes. Complete Edition ; with a Critical Essay and a Catalogue.
author: Johnson, Edward Mead
public_note:
Catalogue entries give number, medium and support, dimensions, inscriptions, signature information and date, provenance, exhibitions, and references.  
An appendix lists unverified attributions.

name: Cossa, Francesco
item_t: Francesco del Cossa.
author: Ruhmer, Eberhard
public_note: The publication has a brief introductory essay, followed by the chronological catalogue raisonné.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Correggio
item_t: The Paintings of Correggio.
author: Gould, Cecil Hilton Monk
public_note: In addition to lists of works, there are a large number of x-ray photographs.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Corot : Cinquième supplément à "L'oeuvre de Corot" par A. Robaut et E. Moreau-Nélaton.
author_s:
Dieterle, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dieterle, Martin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lebeau, Clair
public_note: A sixth supplement is currently in preparation by Martin Dieterle and Claire Lebeau (see in-process entry cited in this database).

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Corot : Quatrième supplément à "L'oeuvre de Corot" par A. Robaut et E. Moreau-Nélaton.

name: Corneille de Lyon
item_t: Corneille de La Haye, dit Corneille de Lyon.
author_s:
Dubois de Groër, Anne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Béguin, Sylvie (preface)
public_note: Published in association with the Fondation Singer-Polignac.  The introductory texts include a biography of the artist, a discussion of his technique and his critical fortunes.  The Appendix includes Corneille's personal correspondence and a genealogy of his family.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Corot : Deuxième supplément à "L'oeuvre de Corot" par A. Robaut et E. Moreau-Nélaton.
public_note: The second supplement adds 100 new works to the catalogue raisonné.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Corot : Troisième supplément à "L''oeuvre de Corot" par A. Robaut et E. Moreau-Nélaton.
author: Dieterle, Jean
public_note: The third supplement adds 50 new works to Corot's oeuvre.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: Corot : Premier supplément à "L' oeuvre de Corot" par A. Robaut et Moreau-Nélaton.
public_note: Adds 20 new works to the artist's oeuvre.  There are also subject and name indices.

name: Corot, Jean-Baptiste-Camille
item_t: L'oeuvre de Corot par Alfred Robaut : catalogue raisonné et illustré de l'histoire et des oeuvres par Etienne Moreau-Nélaton.
public_note:
Reprint of the 1905 edition, with addenda of new documents and material including "Souvenirs inédits de Corot" (Supplement to v.1). 
See also the Series "Corot : Supplements to Robaut" cited in this database.

name: Corpora, Antonio
item_t: Corpora : catalogo generale ragionato dei dipinti dal 1930 al 2001.
author: De Santi, Floriano
public_note: The third volume of the catalogue raisonné is currently in preparation.

name: Correggio
item_t: Correggio : i disegni.
author_s:
Di Giampaolo, Mario                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Muzzi, Andrea                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zeri, Frederico (intro.)
illustrations: all 99 cat. entries ill. in color
public_note: From the series "Archivi di storia dell'arte".

name: Correggio
item_t: Correggio : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
public_note: Volume 30 from the series "I Gigli dell'arte".  The publication contains a separate catalogue of disputed works.

name: Cossa, Francesco
item_t: L'opera completa di Cosmè Tura e i grandi pittori ferraresi del suo tempo: Francesco Cossa e Ercole de'Roberti.
author: Molajoli, Rosemarie
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of accepted works, the publication lists accepted and attributed works, and doubtful attributions.

name: Cortès, Edouard
item_t: Edouard Cortès : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Verdier, Nicole
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists over 700 autograph paintings, organized subject: landscapes, Parisian scenes, interiors, still lifes. 

The appendicies include a geneology of Cortès's family, an illustrated signature page, and an illustrated list of spurious signatures.

name: Corneille
item_t: Corneille : The Complete Graphic Works, 1948-1975.
author_s:
Donkersloot-van den Berghe, Patricia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baj, Enrico (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cassé, Michel (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Birtwistle, Graham (essay)
public_note: A Dutch language edition was also issued by the publisher in the same year.

name: Cordier, Charles-Henri-Joseph
item_t: Facing the Other : Charles Cordier (1827-1905) Ethnographic Sculptor.
author_s:
Margerie, Laure de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Papet, Édouard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barthe, Christine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vigli, Maria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Durand-Rivillon, Jeannine
public_note:
Catalogue of an exhibition held at the Musée d'Orsay, Paris; the Musée national des beaux-arts du Québec; and the Dahesh Museum of Art, NY. A French edition was issued simultaneously by the publisher. 

The publication includes a full catalogue raisonné of Cordier's sculptures by Laure de Margerie and Jeannine Durand-Rivillon. 

The publication also includes a list of works exhibited by Cordier between 1848 and 1906.

name: Corinth, Lov
item_t: Das graphische Werk von Lovis Corinth : The Graphic Work of Lovis Corinth .
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1985.
public_note: This publication is a reissue of the second German edition (Berlin: Gurlitt, 1922), but with some new states, corrections, and 535 additional illustrations. Contains English translations of texts and notes on the catalogue.  Catalogues 452 prints dating 1891 through 1920. See also Heinrich Müller: "Die späte Graphik von Lovis Corinth" (original edition Hamburg, Lichtwarkstiftung, 1960), reprinted and amended (San Francisco, Wofsy, 1994), which is cited in this database.

name: Corinth, Lov
item_t: Lovis Corinth : die Gemälde, Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Berend-Corinth, Charlotte                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hernad, Béatrice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Imiela, Hans-Jürgen (intro.)
public_note: Revised from the 1958 edition, also published by Bruckmann.

name: Corinth, Lov
item_t: Die späte Graphik von Lovis Corinth : The Late Graphic Work, 1913-1925.
author: Müller, Heinrich
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1994.
public_note: A reissue of Müller's earlier publication (Hamburg, Lichtwarkstiftung, 1960), with updated information on varying states and some posthumous prints.  Plates are numbered beginning with 453 to extend Karl Schwarz's earlier numbering system (see his "Das graphische Werk von Lovis Corinth," in this database), and ending with 918.

name: Cook, Nelson
item_t: Nelson Cook : American Portraitist (1808-1892).
cronology: The sections covering the artist's work in the US and Canada list over 150 works, giving title, date, dimensions, materials, current collection, and comments. Some entries also include information on inscriptions or signatures, condition, references, and auction information.
ind_entr_cont: Fifteen years in the making, this online catalogue raisonné is dedicated to the 19th-century American portrait painter, with "glimpses of the life" of his respective sitters.

name: Coorte, Adriaen

author: Buvelot, Quentin
imprint: The Hague : Royal Picture Gallery Mauritshuis ; Zwolle : Waanders, 2008
public_note:
This is an catalogue published on the occasion of an exhibition: "Ode to Coorte",  held at the Mauritshuis in 2008.  The catalogue includes an illustrated catalogue raisonné of all the known paintings (most of which were done on paper).   
A Dutch language edition was also published.

imprint: London : John Lane, the Bodley Head; New York : John Lane, 1914.
public_note: The publication provides a catalogue raisonné of Conder's lithographs and etchings.

name: Cook, Howard Norton
item_t: The Graphic Work of Howard Cook : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The publication includes an essay by Janet A. Flint.

name: Cooke, Edward William
item_t: Edward William Cooke, R.A., 1811-1880 : A Man of His Times.
imprint: Woodbridge, Suffolk, England : Antique Collectors' Club, 1996.
public_note: Appendices contain an unillustrated chronological catalogue of paintings (giving year, catalogue number, title, signature information, size/exhibition, collection information) and a small record of the watercolors. Much of the information was sourced from standard compilations of exhibitions and art sales in Great Britain, plus auction records, there is minimal critical apparatus for individual entries.

name: Copley, John Singleton
item_t: A Sketch of the Life and a List of Some of the Works of John Singleton Copley. Supplementary List of Paintings.
author: Perkins, Augustus Thorndike
public_note: This is a revised and expanded edition of the author's 1873 publication (see entry cited in this database).  There is a supplementary section listing works brought to the author's attention following publication of the earlier volume.  It also includes a separate section with corrections to the catalogue.

name: Copley, John Singleton
item_t: A Sketch of the Life and a List of Some of the Works of John Singleton Copley.
author: Perkins, Augustus Thorndike
public_note: This is an early attempt at a catalogue raisonné of Copley's paintings. The introductory texts include a lengthy memoir on the artist's life and career.

name: Copley, John Singleton
item_t: A Sketch of the Life and a List of Some of the Works of John Singleton Copley.
author: Bayley, Frank W.
imprint: Boston : The Garden Press, W.B. Libby, 1910.

name: Comerio, Filippo
item_t: Filippo Comerio : dipinti, disegni, majoliche.
author: Mangili, Renzo
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes essays on the artist's life, works and critical fortunes.

name: Conrad von Soe
item_t: Conrad von Soest : Painter Among Merchant Princes.
author: Corley, Brigitte
public_note: The texts include chapters on Conrad von Soest's life in Dortmund, his workshop and studio practices, iconography, and a discussion of his style. There are also essays on autograph and workshop productions and a chapter on the artist's legacy in Northern Germany and the Hanseatic League.

name: Copley, John Singleton
item_t: The Life and Works of John Singleton Copley : Founded on the Work of Augustus Thorndike Perkins.
author: Bayley, Frank W.
public_note: It includes a list of pictures exhibited at the Royal Academy between 1776 and 1812, plus items from the Lyndhurst Sale of 1864. There are also separate indices of works and owners of Copley's paintings.

name: Colson, Vaa
item_t: Vaast Colson 10/14.
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue of the artist's works from 2010-2014. Biographical information about the artist is also included.

name: Conti, Paolo
item_t: Paolo Conti : catalogo ragionato I. GALV 1969-1973.
public_note: The artist's work is subdivided in successive thematic cycles, this volume presents the cycle : "GALV" 1969-1973.  Texts are in Italian with parallel English translation.

name: Constable, John
item_t: The Later Paintings and Drawings of John Constable.
author: Reynolds, Graham
public_note: Published for the Paul Mellon Center for Studies in British Art.  The second part of the catalogue raisonné, the current publication catalogues all of the artist's works between 1817 and 1836.  The appendix includes 94 additional works not included in the catalogue.

name: Constable, John
item_t: The Early Paintings and Drawings of John Constable.
author: Reynolds, Graham
public_note: Catalogue of the known works of Constable between 1790 and 1816. Published for the Paul Mellon Center for Studies in British Art. Vol. 2 is unpaginated.

name: Copley, John Singleton
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Cooper, Thomas Sidney
item_t: Thomas Sidney Cooper : C.V.O., R.A. : His Life and Work.
author: Westwood, Kenneth, J.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné listing over 2,800 paintings, watercolors and drawings. There is also an essay on connoisseurship and a discussions of Cooper's signatures.

name: Copley, John Singleton
item_t: John Singleton Copley.
public_note: Published for the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C. Still authoritative for Copley, although more informative about his American paintings than his English ones. Appendices contain genealogical tables, a catalogue of the sale of Copley's print collection, the catalogues of Lord Lyndhurst's sales, and statistical data on 240 of Copley's sitters.

name: Colomer, Pep
item_t: Pep Colomer, 1907-1994 : Obra completa = obra completa = Complete Work.
imprint: Girona : Fundació Colormer-Sanz ; Lladó : Ursula Llibres, 2013.
public_note: The first volume includes a chronology and an essay on Colomer's life and career.  This is followed by the chronological catalogue of the paintings and drawings: 1907-1939; 1940-1980; and 1981-1994.  Volume 2 includes a text on Colomer's activities as an illustrator and decorator, followed by the catalogue of the designs.  There is a separate section dealing with the artist's ideas, and includes a text by the artist on his philosophy.  Finally, the publication includes a discussion of Colomer's art collection.

name: Colescott, Warrington W.
item_t: The Prints of Warrington Colescott : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1948-2008.
author: Weaver Chapin, Mary
imprint: Madison, WI : University of Wisconsin Press : In collaboration with Milwaukee Art Museum, 2010.
public_note: Published in conjunction with the 2010 exhibition "Out of Line- The Satirical Prints of Warrington Colescott" at the Milwaukee Art Museum. The catalogue raisonné lists 354 editioned prints.

One can also consult another catalogue published for a major exhibition "Jean Cocteau sur le fil du siècle", initially held at the Centre Pompidou in 2003-2004 (not cited in this database), as well as a number of published compendia of the artist's writings, films, etc.

Volume 1 is available in print form and online; however, the online version is accessible only to members of the association Les Amis de James Coignard.

name: Close, Chuck
item_t: Chuck Close Catalogue Raisonné : Paintings, 1967 to the Present.
author: Evangelista, Carina (ed.)
cronology:
The chronologically organized catalogue raisonné may be searched under a series of various groupings, allowing the reader to view works: by decade, subject, medium, style and format. The groupings are non-exclusive, so  works can appear under multiple headings. 

Each entry is illustrated and provides title, date, medium, dimensions, inscriptions and catalogue number. Below the image and captions further information is cited on history, notes, alternate titles, related works, provenance, exhibition and literary references, and museum accession numbers when known.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné is fee-based.
public_note: The catalogue will be periodically expanded and updated. At present some 133 paintings (& 1 film) have been indexed; it will eventually include other media such as drawings, photographs, and prints.

name: Chéret, Jule

author: Broido, Lucy
public_note: This is a revised and enlarged edition of the 1980 publication. The new edition adds 16 entries.  This publication updates Ernest Maindron's checklist of 882 items published in "Les Affiches Illustrées 1886-1895" (Paris, 1896). The catalogue raisonné lists 1083 works, arranged by category.

name: Chirino, Martin
item_t: Martín Chirino : esculturas : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Martín de Argila, María Luisa                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Flórez, Paloma                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rodríguez, Mafalda                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Maravall, Susana
imprint: Madrid : Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofia ; Fundación Azcona, 2006.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 542 original sculptures and 7 multiples, created between 1952-2006.

name: Chen Zhen
item_t: Chenzhen : Catalogue des Oeuvres/Catalogue of Works.
author: Association des Amis de Chen Zhen
cronology: Entries include title, date, materials, dimensions, collection, references, and exhibition history.
ind_entr_cont: An online catalogue of the works of Chen Zhen from 1983-2000.  The chronological catalogue includes the artist's works in all media, all illustrated in color.
public_note: A two-volume hard copy print monograph and catalogue raisonné by the Association des Amis de Chen Zhen was also published by Skira in 2018. (See entry in this database.)

name: Chéret, Jule
item_t: La Belle Epoque de Jules Chéret : de l'affiche au décor.
imprint: Paris : Arts décoratifs : Bibliothèque nationale de France, 2010.
public_note:
Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Arts décoratifs, Paris; the Villa Stuck in Munich; and the Musée Toulouse-Lautrec, Albi.
It is the first catalogue to produce Cheret's  entire poster production in full color.

name: Chen, Julie
item_t: Reading the Object : Three Decades of Books.
author_s:
Chen, Julie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Braun, Janice (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Walkup, Kathy                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kroupa, Sandra
imprint: Oakland : Mills College Center for the Book : Flying Fish Press, 2016.
public_note: Published on the occasion of the exhibitions "Reading the Object: A Decade (or so) of Books by Julie Chen" held at the F.W. Olin Library, Mills College, Oakland, CA., and "Every Moment of a Book: Three Decades of Work by Julie Chen", at the Allen Library, University of Washington, in Seattle.

name: Chauveau, Franço
item_t: François Chauveau : peintre, dessinateur et graveur : 1613-1676.
author: Larcena, Dominique
public_note:
Called a "study on the work" in the author's own words, the text discusses Chauveau's entire oeuvre but the catalogue raisonné only covers the drawings, comprised of approximately 250 works. 
This is mainly based on the material found in the "Inventaire du fonds français" by R. A Weigart (Paris, BN, 1951)
Other major drawings holdings are also inventoried. It also lists drawings attributed to other artists such as Le Brun, La Hyre, etc.

name: Chavaz, Albe
item_t: Albert Chavaz 1907-1990.
author_s:
Biffiger, Steffan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Riniker, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Aebischer, Yoki

name: Chase, William Me
item_t: William Merritt Chase : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Pisano, Ronald
public_note:
An earlier catalogue of the artist's work.
See also the later multi-volume edition published by Yale University Press, 2006-, based on Ron Pisano's work and completed by D. Frederick Baker (cited in this database).

name: Chase, William Me
item_t: William Merritt Chase : Portraits in Oil.
author_s:
Pisano, Ronald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baker, D. Frederick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lane, Carolyn K.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 600 portraits in oil.

name: Chase, William Me
item_t: William Merritt Chase : Still Lifes, Interiors, Figures, Copies of Old Masters, and Drawings.
author_s:
Pisano, Ronald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baker, D. Frederick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lane, Carolyn K.
public_note: Includes errata and addendum to vols. 1-3.

name: Chase, William Me

author_s:
Pisano, Ronald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baker, D. Frederick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lane, Carolyn K.

name: Chase, William Me
item_t: William Merritt Chase : The Paintings in Pastel, Monotypes, Painted Tiles and Ceramic Plates, Watercolors, and Prints.
author_s:
Pisano, Ronald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baker, D. Frederick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Shelley, Marjorie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lane, Carolyn K.
public_note: Includes an index of owners of Chase's works during the artist's lifetime.   It also contains a list of exhibitions 1870-1916, with works cited. Selected exhibitions after 1916 are also included, but authors only list works cited in those exhibitions that have unproblematic provenance.

name: Chassériau, Théodore
item_t: Théodore Chassériau, 1819-1856 : catalogue raisonné des peintures et estampes.
author: Sandoz, Marc
public_note: References the earlier Bénédite catalogue (cited in this database) and seminal exhibitions on the artist's work held ca. 1933.

name: Chassériau, Théodore
item_t: Théodore Chassériau : sa vie et son oeuvre.
illustrations: v. 1: 193 b&w, 6 color; v. 2: 344 b&w, 12 color
public_note: Derived from an original manuscript by Bénédite, published by André Deszarrois, also including transcripts of the artist's correspondence

name: Chauvin, Jean
item_t: Chauvin sculpteur.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes 176 works and 160 maquettes by the artist, arranged chronologically. All works are illustrated in full page plates.

name: Chassériau, Théodore
item_t: Dessins de Théodore Chassériau, 1819-1856.
author: Prat, Louis-Antoine
public_note: Catalogue of the drawings held by the Musée du Louvre, Paris. The cover title reads, "Dessins francais du Musée du Louvre, Théodore Chassériau."

name: Chevalier, Nichola
