item_t: Nicholas Chevalier : Australian Odyssey.
author: Gregg, Simon
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at Gippsland Art Gallery, Sale and at Geelong Gallery, Geelong. The present catalogue is based on a thesis by Mary Laurenson titled "N. Chevalier 1828-1902. A Catalogue Raisonné."

name: Christo
item_t: Christo, Complete Editions, 1964-1982 : Catalogue Raisonné and Introduction.
imprint: New York : New York University Press, 1982.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of graphic works, sculptures, photographs, collages and drawings, all made by the artist himself as "original works in series".

name: Christo
item_t: Christo Prints and Objects, 1963-1987 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Schellmann, Jörg (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Benecke, Joséphine (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Spies, Werner (intro.)
imprint: Munich ; New York : Edition Schellmann ; New York : Abbeville Press, 1988.

name: Christo
item_t: Christo and Jeanne-Claude : Prints and Objects, 1963-1995 : A Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Munich ; New York : Edition Schellmann;  Munich : Schirmer Mosel,  1995.
public_note: With the German title, "Christo und Jeanne Claude: Druckgraphik und Objekte, 1963-95, Werkverzeichnis." Text appears in English and German.

name: Chen Zhen
item_t: Chen Zhen : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Association des amis de Chen Zhen (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Renard, Isabelle (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Xu Min (intro.)
imprint: Milan : Skira ; Paris : ADAC, Association des amis de Chen Zhen, 2014-2018.

name: Christo
item_t: Christo and Jeanne-Claude : Prints and Objects : Catalogue Raisonné 1963-2013.
public_note: The original third edition in German was published by Hatje Cantz, Ostfildern in 2013.  The current publication expands and revises earlier editions and catalogues all of the artists' editioned works, including prints, collages and objects.  There is also a survey of themes and projects in the artists' oeuvre.

name: Charreton, Victo
item_t: Victor Charreton.
author_s:
Chatin, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chatin, Bertrand                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Charreton, Marcel (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Huss, Valerie
public_note: Volume 1 includes the first part of the catalogue of paintings (1-1,223) and provides a discussion of the chemical composition of Charreton's paint and other scientific analyses.

name: Chardin, Jean-Baptiste-Siméon
item_t: Chardin.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
public_note: Subtitled "Biographie et catalogue critique, l'oeuvre complet de l'artiste."  The full text digitized catalogue raisonné is available on the Wildenstein Plattner Institute's website.  Click on the Full Text link on this page.

name: Chaponnière, Jean-Etienne
item_t: Un romantisme mitigé : la vie et l'œuvre du sculpteur Chaponnière (1801-1835).
author: Rhodes, Luba
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné is divided into four parts. The first section is a "summary catalogue of prints", listing 125 unique designs, encompassing works in public and private collections, as well and a selection of works classified by subject. The summary catalogue includes prints cited in documents from the period. 

The second part deals with medals and medallions, the third is sculpture. The final section covers rejected works.

Appendices include pages from the artist's travel diary, containg notes and drawings from Italy. There is also a list and a description of documents relating to the artist, with the names of the institutions housing the documents.

name: Chang, Yu
item_t: Chang Yu you hua quan ji : di er ce / Yi Shufan = Sanyu : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Wong, Rita                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Yi, Shufan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chang, Yu
imprint: Taibei Shi : Li qing wen jiao ji jin hui, 2011.

name: Chardin, Jean-Baptiste-Siméon
item_t: Chardin.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, exhibition information, provenance, signature information, and references.

name: Chang, Yu
item_t: Chang Yu ban hua quan ji / Yi Shufan = Sanyu Catalogue Raisonné : Prints.
author_s:
Wong, Rita                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Li ching Cultural & Educational Foundation.
imprint: Taibei Shi : Li Qing wen jioa ji jin hui, 2017.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists and illustrates all of Sanyu's 42 known prints.

name: Chang, Yu
item_t: Sanyu : Catalogue Raisonné : Oil Paintings.
author: Wong, Rita
imprint: Xindian Shi : Gou ju ji jin hui in association with the University of Washington Press, Seattle, 2001.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue raisonné gives number, title, date, medium and support, dimensions, signatures, and some provenance and auction sale information. It also provides references to works reproduced in print and exhibition history when available, but there is no accompanying critical commentary.

name: Chang, Yu
item_t: Sanyu : Catalogue Raisonné : Drawings and Watercolors.
author: Wong, Rita
imprint: Taipei : Li Ching Cultural and Educational Foundation, 2015

name: Champaigne, Jean-Baptiste de
item_t: Trois maîtres du dessin. Philippe de Champaigne (1602-1674), Jean-Baptiste de Champaigne (1631-1681), Nicolas de Plattemontagne (1631-1706).
imprint: Paris : Éditions de la Réunion des musées nationaux, 2009.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Musée national de Port-Royal-des-Champes. The publication includes a list of rejected works.

name: Charchoune, Serge
item_t: Serge Charchoune, 1888-1975 : Annotated Catalogue. v.3 : 1931-1950.

name: Chadwick, Lynn
item_t: Lynn Chadwick, Sculptor, with a Complete Illustrated Catalogue, 1947-2005.
imprint: Aldershot, UK ; Burlington, VT : Lund Humphries, 2006.
public_note: This is the a third revised edition (covering works up to 2005) of "Lynn Chadwick, Sculptor, with a Complete Illustrated Catalogue, 1947-1996," published by Lypiatt Studio, 1997.

name: Chadwick, Helen
item_t: Helen Chadwick : A Critical Catalogue Raisonné.
author: O'Dwyer, Leonie
public_note: The catalogue was presented as the author's Ph.D. thesis for the University of Leeds.  The first volume includes case studies of the installations "Domestic Sanitation" (1973-1976) and "Ego Geometria Sum" (1982-1984) to illustrate the artist's creative process and extensive documentation of her work.  Volume 2 includes the  chronological catalogue raisonné.

name: Champaigne, Philippe de
item_t: Supplèment au catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre de Philippe de Champaigne.
author: Dorival, Bernard
imprint: Paris : Chez l'auteur : Distributeur, L. Laget, 1992.
public_note: Supplement to the catalogue raisonné listing 32 new authentic works, with information on copies and variants. Contains a separate catalogue of 64 inauthentic works .

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: The Lithographs of Chagall.
author_s:
Cain, Julien                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mourlot, Fernand                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sorlier, Charles                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chagall, Marc (Intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Passeron, Roger
imprint: Monte-Carlo : A. Sauret; New York : George Braziller; Boston : Boston Book and Art Shop, Crown Publishers Inc., 1960-1986.
public_note: The original reference catalogue in 6 volumes, was issued with original lithographs; the dust jackets were also original lithographs designed by the artist. This is the English language edition of "Chagall Lithographe." Authors and imprint vary somewhat from volume to volume.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Marc Chagall.
author: Meyer, Franz
public_note: This monograph, written by the artist's son-in-law, is a standard reference for the artist's work. The publication includes an illustrated checklist of Chagall's paintings.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Marc Chagall Monotypes.
illustrations: v.1: 167 b&w, 26 color plates tipped in; v.2: 286 b&w, 26 color
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 308 monotypes executed from 1961- 1975.

name: Cesetti, Giuseppe
item_t: Catalogo generale dei dipinti di Giuseppe Cesetti.

name: Césa
item_t: César : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The first volume of the catalogue raisonné was written with the cooperation and participation of the artist. The catalogue contains numerous excerpts from contemporary critical reviews of the artist's work. Only the first volume has appeared to date.

name: Cespedes, Pablo de
item_t: Pablo de Céspedes.
author: Tubino, Francisco Maria
public_note: Within the series "Memorias de la Academia de nobles artes de San Fernando."  A monograph and catalogue raisonné.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: The Drawings of Paul Cézanne : A Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: Greenwich, CT : New York Graphic Society, 1973.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: Cézanne, son art, son œuvre.
author: Venturi, Lionello
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists over 1,000 works by the artist, and contains 1,634 b&w illustrations.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Cézanne.
public_note:
The original edition of this was published in Italian by Rizzoli, Milan, 1970 (reissued 1979). Co-editions exist (with different authors providing prefaces), but the critical catalogue remains the same. 

English language editions were published in 1972 and 1985 respectively, the later printing has an appendix of additional works (n.839-864).

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: L'oeuvre gravé de Cézanne.
author_s:
Cherpin, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cherpin, Germaine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gachet, Paul (preface and letters)
imprint: Marseille : Arts et Livres de Provence, 1972.
public_note: "Arts et livres de Provence," Bulletin 82.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: Paul Cézanne : The Watercolors : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: In addition to the exhibition list, there are indices of "Topics and Authors Quoted" and "Owners", as well as a concordance to the original Venturi catalogue, Paris, 1936.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: Paul Cézanne : son art, son oeuvre.
author: Venturi, Lionello
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1989.
public_note: This is a reprint of Lionello Venturi's 2- volume 1936 catalogue (see entry in this database).  The reprinted edition includes indices of collectors and motifs.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: Imaging the Artist : Cézanne and the Rhetoric of the Self-Portrait : With a Catalogue Raisonnné of the Painted Self-Portaits and a Complete Inventory of the Drawn Self-Portraits.
author: Platzman, Steven

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: The Paintings, Watercolors and Drawings of Paul Cézanne [online]
author_s:
Feilchenfeldt, Walter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Warman, Jayne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nash, David
cronology: Catalogue is divided into three sections, covering paintings, watercolors and sketcbooks. Entries include scalable color illustrations, title, date, provenance, notes, exhibitions, references to citations in previous catalogues, alternate titles, related works, and technical information.  All works are illustrated in color whenever possible.
ind_entr_cont: First launched in 2014, the online catalogue raisonné was agumented in 2019 with the integration of Cézannne's watercolors and drawings.  The catalogue can be searched by theme (landscapes, portraits, genre, etc), by keyword, chronologically, by motif, and many numerous other filters.  It can also be searched by FWN, Rewald, Chappuis and Venturi numbers.

name: Cézanne, Paul
item_t: The Paintings of Paul Cézanne : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Rewald, John                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Feilchenfeldt, Walter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Warman, Jayne
public_note:
Following Venturi's work, this is the revised catalogue raisonné on Cézanne's oeuvre. Begun by John Rewald and worked on by him for almost fifty years, it was completed and published posthumously under the guidance of Walter Feilchenfeldt and Jayne Warman. 
The catalogue lists 954 paintings by the artist, arranged chronologically. Works cited in Ambroise Vollard's stockbooks are indicated.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Chagall's Posters : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Sorlier, Charles

name: Chabas, Maurice
item_t: Maurice Chabas : peintre et messager spirituel, 1862-1947.
author: Palma, Myriam de
imprint: Paris : Somogy ; Pont-Aven : Musée des beaux-arts de Pont-Aven ; Bourgoin-Jallieu : Musée de Bourgoin-Jallieu, 2009.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Musée des beaux-arts de Pont-Aven.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé [Chagall].
public_note: First volume of what was a projected three-volume catalogue raisonné of Chagall's engravings. However, only the first volume, copper and wood engravings 1922-1966, was published. The German language edition was issued  in 1970.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Chagall.
author: Passeron, Roger
public_note: Translated from the French. The cover title is "Meister der Graphik."

name: Chamberlain, John
item_t: John Chamberlain : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Sculpture, 1954-1985.
public_note: Published in association with the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles. The catalogue raisonné contains 800 of artist's sculptures to date of publication. It does not include the reliefs on painted paper, collages, nor the auto-lacquer and metal flake paintings of 1960-1963.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Marc Chagall, le livre des livres = Marc Chagall : The Illustrated Books.
author: Sorlier, Charles
imprint: Paris : André Sauret et M. Trinckvel, 1990.
public_note: This work is bilingual.

name: Chamberlain, John
item_t: John Chamberlain : The Foam Sculptures.
public_note:
This is the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Chinati Foundation. The publication includes 85 works, which constitutes an almost complete catalogue of Chamberlain's foam sculptures.  
There is also an essay on the conservation of the foam sculptures by Iris Winkelmeyer.

name: Chagall, Marc
item_t: Marc Chagall, the Illustrated Books : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Cramer, Patrick
public_note: Preface by Chagall's granddaughter, Meret Meyer.  Book descriptions were translated from the French by Christopher Snow.   In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes bibliographic references, a chronological list of the books, an alphabetical index, and an index of publishers and authors.

name: Champaigne, Philippe de
item_t: Trois maîtres du dessin. Philippe de Champaigne (1602-1674), Jean-Baptiste de Champaigne (1631-1681), Nicolas de Plattemontagne (1631-1706).
imprint: Paris : Éditions de la Réunion des musées nationaux, 2009.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Musée national de Port-Royal-des-Champes. The publication includes a list of rejected works.

name: Chanco
item_t: Chanco : catalogue raisonné : peintures, 1928-1998.
author: Cylver, Sandrine
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 1,700 paintings, all illustrated.

name: Champaigne, Philippe de
item_t: Philippe de Champaigne, 1602-1674 : la vie, l'oeuvre, et le catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
author: Dorival, Bernard
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists 243 authentic works arranged by subject. There is a separate catalogue of 1337 works known only through copies and documentary references. The publication lists an additional 465 works that the author considered to be inauthentic. 

Appendices include excerpts of documents relating to the artist's life, a list of works signed by the artist, and brief biographies of Champaigne's sitters.

A supplement was published in 1992 (see entry cited in this database).

name: Chang, Uk-chin
item_t: Chang Uk-chin catalogue raisonné yuhwa.
author: Chung Young-mok
public_note: Some texts are also in English.  The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 720 oil paintings by the artist.

name: Charchoune, Serge
item_t: Serge Charchoune, 1888-1975 : Annotated Catalogue. v.2 : 1925-1930.
public_note: Catalogue illustrated in b&w thumbnails.

name: Charchoune, Serge
item_t: Serge Charchoune, 1888-1975 : Annotated Catalogue. v.1 : 1912-1924.
public_note: All works illustrated with b&w thumbnails.

name: Chardin, Jean-Baptiste-Siméon
item_t: Chardin.
author: Roland Michel, Marianne
public_note: This critical study of Chardin  was first published in a French edition (Paris Hazan, 1994).  It carries on after the earlier Wildenstein  catalogues raisonnés (See entries cited in this database), and  is accompanied by an illustrated catalogue of engravings after Chardin's paintings.

name: Chapoval, Yula
item_t: Youla Chapoval : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Moisset, Évelyne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moisset, Marie-Laure                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Briend, Christian (preface)

name: Chardin, Jean-Baptiste-Siméon
item_t: Chardin.
public_note: This is the revised and enlarged edition by Daniel Wildenstein (An edition was also issued by the New York Graphic Society, Greenwich, CT, 1969).

name: Charlot, Jean
item_t: Jean Charlot's Prints : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Morse, Peter
imprint: Honolulu : University Press of Hawaii & The Jean Charlot Foundation, 1976.
public_note: The catalogue lists 714 prints, all illustrated.  There is a concordance to the small edition of prints done by Charlot in New York in 1936.

name: Chardin, Jean-Baptiste-Siméon
item_t: Chardin, suivi du catalogue des oeuvres.
public_note: From the series "Collection Grandes monographies". This continues on the author's earlier studies on the artist which included his major 1979 exhibition catalogue, and the summary catalogue raisonné "Tout l'oeuvre peint de Chardin," (Paris, Flammarion, 1983).

name: Charlamov, Aleksej Alekseevic
item_t: Alexei Harlamoff : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Sugrobova-Roth, Olga                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lingenauber, Eckart                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Karpova, Tatiana (preface)
public_note: Texts in English and Russian. An abbreviated version of the authors' catalogue raisonné is available online at www.harlamoff.org.

name: Charlot, Jean
item_t: Jean Charlot's Prints. Supplement.
author: Morse, Peter
public_note:
Supplement to Morse's 1976, "Jean Charlot's Prints : A Catalogue Raisonné".  See entry cited in this database. 

The supplement includes additions corrections to works cited in the previous volume, and adds 57 new prints (cat. nos. 715-772) executed between 1975-1978.

name: Cesari, Giuseppe
item_t: Il Cavalier Giuseppe Cesari d'Arpino : un grande pittore nello splendore della fama e nell'incostanza della fortuna.
author: Röttgen, Herwarth
public_note: Contains a catalogue of lost works mentioned in sources, prints after Cesari d'Arpino, and works produced by the artist's workshop.

name: Cesari, Giuseppe
item_t: Il cavalier Giuseppe Cesari d'Arpino : maestro del disegno : catalogo ragionato dell'opera grafica.
author: Bolzoni, Marco Simone
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a technical essay, a discussion of the function of drawings in Cesari's artistic practice, and an essay on his workshop.

There are bibliographic references, a list of auction sales, and analytical, name, and place indices.

name: Cesari, Giuseppe
item_t: Cavalier Giuseppe Cesari D'Arpino : die Zeichnungen - I disegni. Reife und Alter - Maturità e anzianità 1605-1640.
author: Röttgen, Herwarth
public_note: The final volume of the catalogue raisonné lists works from the artist's maturity and his old age (1605-1640)..

name: Cesari, Giuseppe
item_t: Cavalier Giuseppe Cesari D'Arpino : die Zeichnungen - I disegni. Die grossen Aufträge - Le grandi commissioni 1587/93-1605.
author: Röttgen, Herwarth
public_note: The second volume covers the artist's mature works (1857/93 - 1605), coinciding with his most important commissions.

name: Celan-Lestrange, Gise`le
item_t: Gisèle Celan-Lestrange (1927-1991) : Katalog der Werke …catalogue de l'oeuvre.
author_s:
Bruckinger, Ute                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bruckinger, Klaus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Celan, Eric                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Badiou, Bertrand
public_note: The publication contains bilingual parallel texts in German and French. This study has a foreword, several essays on the artist's work in different media (prints, watercolors, pastels, tempera and gouache). In addition, there is a detailed chronology of the artist's life, and several appendices, including lists of one-man and group exhibitions, and an extensive bibliography.

name: Cela, Raimundo
item_t: Raimundo Cela, 1890-1954.
author_s:
Perlingeiro, Max                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Perlingeiro, Camila                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Santos Peixoto, María Elizabete
public_note: The texts are in Portuguese with summaries in English.  The essays include a discussion of Cela's painting methods. The critical catalogue includes paintings, drawings and graphic works (without edition information).

name: Cesari, Giuseppe
item_t: Cavalier Giuseppe Cesari D'Arpino : die Zeichnungen - I disegni. Anfänge und frühe Meisterschaft - Inizi e maestria precoce, 1583-1592.
author: Röttgen, Herwarth
public_note:
The first volume covers the artist's early drawings (1583-1592).  There are essays on the artist's stylistic development, workshop, technique, and Cesari's own drawings collection.

The publication includes references, as well as name and place indices.

name: Cellini, Benvenuto
item_t: L'opera completa del Cellini.
public_note: From the series "Classici dell'arte," the publication includes an introduction; critical contemporary quotes on the artist; and analysis of the artist's works.  There is a documents section, as well as indices by title, theme, and location.

name: Cavedone, Giacomo
item_t: Giacomo Cavedone, 1577-1660.
author_s:
Negro, Emilio                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Roio, Nicosetta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Giovannini, Carlo (documents)
public_note: Includes an appendix with contemporary documents and letters by the artist.

name: Cavaliere, Alik
item_t: Alik Cavaliere : catalogo delle sculture.
author: Pontiggia, Elena
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the artist's sculpture is organized chronologically, by half decades. The publication includes a biography of the artist and an essay on his notebooks.

name: Cavalli, Massimo
item_t: Massimo Cavalli : catalogo ragionato dell'opera grafica.
author: Bianchi, Matteo
public_note:
This catalogue of Cavalli's graphic work includes 750 works created over the artist's lifetime.  The texts are bilingual, but the catalogue is in Italian.  The catalogue raisonné lists 766 copper engravings, lithographs and monotypes by the artist.

The Appendix contains a biography, documents, references, a discussion of original editions, solo and group exhibitions, and a discussion of the artists mural paintings and mosaics.

name: Cavarozzi, Bartolomeo
item_t: Bartolomeo Cavarozzi.
author: Papi, Gianni
public_note: Issued in the series "I Cardini".  In addition to the catalogue of the paintings, the publication has essays on the artist's career, and his relationship to Ribera and the Young Velázquez.

name: Cavallino, Bernardo
item_t: Grazia e tenerezza "in posa" : Bernardo Cavallino e il suo tempo.
public_note: Although the author states that this is not a complete oeuvre catalogue, he does publish every work considered autograph, with full commentary and critical apparatus.

name: Cattelan, Maurizio
item_t: Maurizio Cattelan : All.
author: Spector, Nancy

name: Cattelan, Maurizio
item_t: Maurizio Cattelan : All.
author: Spector, Nancy
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held in 2011-2012 at the Guggenheim Museum, New York; the retrospective survey was intended to be a catalogue raisonné of the artist's oeuvre.  Contributors to the catalogue include: Katherine Brinson, Diana Kamin,

name: Castillo y Saavedra, Antonio
item_t: Antonio del Castillo.
imprint: Madrid : Fundación de Apoyo a la Historia del Arte Hispánico, 2004.
public_note: The introductory material has a full chronology with biographical documents.

name: Castle, Wendell Keith
item_t: Wendell Castle : a catalogue raisonné, 1958-2012.
author_s:
Eedermans, Emily Evans                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Adamson, Glenn                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Adlin, Jane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barry, Dave
imprint: New York : The Artist Book Foundation, 2014
public_note: The first catalogue raisonné devoted to the work of this founder of the Studio Furniture movement.

name: Cavaglieri, Mario
item_t: Mario Cavaglieri : (1887-1969) : catalogo ragionato dei dipinti.
author: Vareilles, Viviane
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists over 1,170 paintings, and is divided between works executed in Italy and France. Entries cite number, title, date, medium and support, dimensions, signature and inscription information, public collections (private collections are not listed), exhibitions,  references, and comments.

The study considers some works on paper (graphics and drawings); it also includes a list of the paintings, a bibliography, various chronologies, and a genealogy.

name: Castillo y Saavedra, Antonio
item_t: Antonio del Castillo, 1616-1668 : dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Navarrete Prieto, Benito                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            García de la Torre, Fuensanta
public_note: Spanish text with in-depth chapters including an essay by Priscilla Muller, a section on documents, essays on drawings and the artist in the context of seventeenth- century Andalucia.  The essays have been translated into English.

name: Cathelin, Bernard
item_t: Cathelin, 1919-2004 : tapisseries : Atelier 3.
author: Biro, Adam
public_note: The publication brings together all the tapestries done by Atelier 3 "after" original paintings by the artist, as well those created by artist in the Atelier. Each woven model is reproduced.

name: Cathelin, Bernard
item_t: Cathelin : lithographe.
imprint: Monte-Carlo : Éditions André Sauret (v.1-v.2); Paris : Maisonneuve & Larose (v. 3), 1990-1998.
public_note: The frontispieces in vols.1&2 are original color lithographs; v.3 has imprint Paris: Maisonneuve & Larose and additional subtitle: "Oeuvre lithographie 1957-1998."

name: Cavanaugh, John
item_t: In Search of Motion : John Cavanaugh, Sculptor, 1921-1985.
author_s:
Stange, Maren                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Alt, Gordon J. (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thorson, Victoria

name: Castiglioni, Achille
item_t: Achille Castiglioni : 1918-2002.
author: Polano, Sergio
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes works executed from 1938-2002, organized chronologically by decade. The publication includes an historical atlas of the works, followed by writings by the artist, a biography, lists of awards and exhibitions, Castiglioni's collaborators, critical writings about Castiglioni, indices, collections, and a general bibliography.

name: Castiglioni, Achille
item_t: Achille Castiglioni.
author: Polano, Sergio
public_note:
The current publication revises earlier monographs cum catalogues raisonnés entitled "Achille Castiglioni: Complete Works" (2002) and "Achille Castiglioni: tutte le opere, 1938-2000" (2001), both published by Electa, Milan.
See also "Achille Castiglioni: 1918-2002," (2006) cited in this database.

name: Castello, Valerio
item_t: Valerio Castello.
author: Manzitti, Camillo
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of paintings, frescos, drawings and engravings by the artist. Contains separate catalogues of lost and unknown paintings, and paintings executed in collaboration with other artists. The catalogue is illustrated in black and white thumbnails.

name: Castello, Bernardo
item_t: Der Genueser Maler Bernardo Castello, 1557?-1629 : Leben und Ölgemälde.
author: Erbentraut, Regina
public_note:
This catalogue was originally presented as the author's dissertation at the Universität des Saarlandes in Saarbrücken, 1987. 
The unillustrated catalogue checklist covers extant, missing, and rejected works.

name: Castellani, Enrico
item_t: Enrico Castellani : catalogo ragionato.
public_note: The first volume presents the artist's life and work. Volume 2 contains the catalogue raisonné of the artist's works in all media, arranged chronologically.

name: Castañeda, Abdón
item_t: Ribalta y los ribaltescos : la evolución del estilo barroco en Valencia.
author: Kowal, David M.
public_note:
This is related to the author's 1981 doctoral thesis titled "Francisco Ribalta and his Followers," presented at the University of Michigan (also published in the Garland series "Outstanding Dissertations in the Fine Arts", New York, 1985)  

This revised Spanish version is an updated and greatly expanded edition of the catalogue raisonné.

name: Cassinari, Bruno
item_t: Cassinari : catalogo generale dei dipinti.
author: Rosci, Marco
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné includes all paintings created before 1998, based mainly on the artist's archives in Milan, other private and public archives, exhibition and auction catalogues, and museum holdings. The appendix also lists paintings known only from documents and unfinished works located in the artist's studio. 

Cassinari's works on paper, mosaics, sculptures and graphic works will be the subject of a separate catalogue (see in-process entry cited in this database).

name: Cassatt, Mary
item_t: The Graphic Work of Mary Cassatt : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Breeskin, Adele Dohme
public_note: The author published a revised and augmented edition of the catalogue in 1979 (See entry in this database).

name: Cassatt, Mary
item_t: Mary Cassatt : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Oils, Pastels, Watercolors, and Drawings.
author: Breeskin, Adelyn Dohme
public_note: Individual entries include title, descriptive comments, provenance, and exhibitions.  All works are illustrated in b&w.

name: Casorati, Felice
item_t: Felice Casorati : catalogo generale : i dipinti e le sculture (1904-1963).
illustrations: v.1-2: 1,723 b&w, 48 color plates; v.3: 171 b&w
public_note: Volumes 1 & 2 were originally published in 1995.

name: Cassatt, Mary
item_t: Mary Cassatt : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Graphic Work.
author: Breeskin, Adelyn Dohme
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, medium and technique, known states, and some limited comments.

name: Carroll, Lew
item_t: The Photographs of Lewis Carroll : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Wakeling, Edward

name: Carzou, Jean Marie
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié de Carzou.
public_note: This is volume 4 in the series "Catalogues d'oeuvres gravés et lithographiés."  The publication was issued in a limited edition of 725 copies.

name: Casado del Alisal, José María
item_t: Casado del Alisal, 1831-1886.
author: Portela Sandoval, Francisco J.
imprint: Palencia : Excma. Diputación Provincial de Palencia, 1986.
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist and a "provisional catalogue" of his work.  The catalogue raisonné is divided into: located paintings, unlocated works and paintings known only from documents, drawings and prints, and attributed works. The appendix includes excerpts from the artist's correspondence and other documents relating to his art.

name: Carzou, Jean Marie
item_t: Carzou, graveur et lithographe : catalogue raisonné et commenté de l'œuvre gravé et lithographié.
author_s:
Carzou, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Caillois, Roger                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brion, Marcel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mazars, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Furhange, Maguy
public_note: Volume 1 (1948-1962) has preface by Roger Caillois; Volume 2 (1963-1968) has prefaces by Marcel Brion and Pierre Mazars.

name: Carriera, Rosalba
item_t: Dictionary of Pastellists before 1800.
public_note: Individual catalogue entries can include title, date, comments, provenance, exhibitions, references, signatures & inscriptions, and related works.

name: Carrà, Carlo
item_t: Carrà : tutta l'opera pittorica.
author: Carrà, Massimo
imprint: Milan : Edizioni dell'Annunciata ; Edizioni della Conchiglia, 1967-68.

name: Carrà, Carlo
item_t: Carrà Disegni.

name: Carrà, Carlo
item_t: L'opera completa di Carrà. Dal futurismo alla metafisica e al realismo mitico. 1910-1930
public_note: This publication has a few notes and some collection information, but no bibiographical or provenance information.   As is typical of titles in the Rizzoli series of artists' complete works ("Opera completa"), coded symbols supply the information on  technique, support, signature information, etc.

name: Carriera, Rosalba
item_t: Rosalba Carriera : 1673-1757 : maestra del pastello nell'Europa ancien régime.
author: Sani, Bernardina
public_note: From the series "Archivi di arte antica". The catalogue raisonné of over 400 works by the artist.

name: Carrière, Eugène
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Carrière, Eugène
item_t: Eugène Carrière, 1849-1906 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Nora-Milin, Véronique                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lamarre, Alice                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rapetti, Rodolphe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonnet-Nora, Véronique
public_note:
Catalogue of 1,354 authentic works by the artist. 
Most entries are illustrated in b&w thumbnails.

name: Casas, Ramón
item_t: Ramon Casas, 1866-1932 : una vida dedicada al arte : catálogo razonado.
author: Coll i Mirabent, Isabel

name: Castagno, Andrea del
item_t: Andrea del Castagno. Complete Edition with a Critical Catalogue.
author: Horster, Marita
public_note:
The publication includes essays on Castagno's life and his artistic influence. The catalogue raisonné lists extant paintings; drawings, rejected drawings, and drawings by the artist's circle; lost paintings; and wrongly attributed paintings.

The appendix includes a list of painters in Castagno's circle with brief biographies. The documents section contains records of commissions and payments and other documents relating to the artist's work.

name: Carracci, Lodovico
item_t: Ludovico Carracci and the Art of Drawing.
author: Bohn, Babette
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of the drawings, the author fully examines the artist's historical context and his development in the cultural milieu of sixteenth-century Bologna.

name: Carracci, Lodovico
item_t: Ludovico Carracci (1555-1619).
author: Brogi, Alessandro
public_note: From the series "Pittori d'Italia". The catalogue raisonné lists 131 authentic paintings. There are also separate catalogues of works of uncertain attribution, rejected works, and lost paintings. All authentic works are illustrated in black and white in Volume 2.

name: Carpeaux, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Carracci, Annibale
item_t: Annibale Carracci : A Study in the Reform of Italian Painting Around 1590.
author: Posner, Donald
illustrations: numerous b&w, some color in vol. 2
public_note: The first volume thoroughly examines in several chapters the artist's career: the Bolognese period, stylistic influences; situation in the Central Italian artistic milieu; and career in Rome. Vol. 2 contains the catalogue raisonné of the artist's paintings, drawings, and prints.

name: Carpeaux, Jean-Baptiste
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Carpeaux, sculpteur : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre édité.

name: Carracci, Agostino
item_t: Prints and Related Drawings by the Carracci Family : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bohlin, Diane DeGrazia
imprint: Washington, D.C. : National Gallery of Art, 1979.
public_note: See also the revised and expanded Italian edition, "Le stampe dei Carracci con i disegni, le incisioni, le copie e i dipinti connessi, catalogo critico," by Antonio Boschetti (Bologna : Alfa, 1984), cited in this database.

name: Carpaccio, Vittore
item_t: Carpaccio : Paintings and Drawings. Complete Edition.
author: Lauts, Jan
imprint: Greenwich, CT : Phaidon Publishers, distributed by New York Graphic Society, 1962.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes 94 accepted paintings and 52 drawings. There are separate catalogues of lost works, workshop copies, and rejected attributions.

name: Carracci, Agostino
item_t: Le stampe dei Carracci con i disegni, le incisioni, le copie e i dipinti connessi : catalogo critico.
public_note: The revised and expanded Italian translation of the original English edition by Diane DeGrazia [Bohlin], "Prints and Related Drawings by the Carracci Family, a Catalogue Raisonné" (Washington, D.C.: National Gallery of Art, 1979), see entry in this database.

name: Carpaccio, Vittore
item_t: Carpaccio : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Humfrey, Peter
public_note: Italian translation from the English. From the series "Gigli dell'arte".

name: Carpaccio, Vittore
item_t: L'opera completa del Carpaccio.
public_note:
This study was published in the series: "Classici dell'arte". Following introductory sections concerning the artist's life, there is analysis of the works, excerpts of documents related to Carpaccio's life, and the catalogue raisonné. 

There are also bibliographical references and indices by theme, title, and location.

name: Carnovali, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Carnovali detto Il Piccio: catalogo ragionato.
public_note: Catalogue of approximately 400 works by the artist. Within the series "Cataloghi ragionati di artisti lombardi dell'Ottocento."

name: Carboni, Giovanni Bernardo
item_t: Giovanni Bernardo Carbone.
author: Sanguineti, Daniele

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio Studies.
author: Friedlaender, Walter F.
public_note: Friedlaender considered autograph only those works cited in early biographies of Caravaggio by Baglione, Bellori and Mancini.  This catalogue is divided into three parts: accepted works, paintings erroneously attributed to Caravaggio in the literary sources, and those paintings mentioned in the sources, but whose whereabout are not known.  There have been various subsequent reprints.

name: Caracciolo, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Battistello Caracciolo: l'opera completa.
author: Causa, Stefano.
ind_entr_cont: The work catalogue is divided in three sections designated: graphic works (G), autograph paintings (A), and lost works (P). Citations include  number, title, medium, dimensions, signatures, location, there are good notes, and bibliographical references.

name: Capogrossi, Giuseppe
item_t: Giuseppe Capogrossi : catalogo ragionato. Tomo Primo
public_note: The first volume lists all of Capogrossi's early artworks up until 1949, up until the debut of the artist's abstract "signs".  The catalogue lists approximately 600 early paintings, graphic works, and works on paper, arranged chronologically by medium.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio : Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio "pictor praestantissimus".
author: Marini, Maurizio
public_note: Subtitle: "La tragica esistenza, la raffinata cultura, il mondo sanguigno del primo Seicento, nell'iter pittorico completo di uno dei massimi rivoluzionari dell'arte di tutti i tempi."

name: Canuti, Domenico Maria
item_t: Domenico Maria Canuti, pittore (1626-1684) : catalogo generale.
author: Stagni, Simonetta
public_note: Bilingual, in Italian and English. Contains separate catalogues of etchings, lost and missing works, and works formerly attributed to Canuti.

name: Canova, Antonio
item_t: L'opera completa del Canova.
public_note: The catalogue covers 369 scupltures by Canova; 31 sculptures attributed to him; 100 authentic paintings; and 2 attributed paintings.

name: Capet, Marie Gabrielle
item_t: Gabrielle Capet.
author: Doria, Arnauld
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-Arts, Édition d'Études et de Documents, 1934.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné of the artist's works.  The publication includes biography of Capet as well as a documentary chronology of her life and career.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio, la vita e l'opera.
author: Cinotti, Mia
public_note: This is the revised edition of Cinotti's 1983 catalogue "Michelangelo Merisi detto il Caravaggio : tutte le opere" (Bergamo: Poligrafiche Bolis, 1983).

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio : The Complete Works.
public_note: German, French, and Italian editions were also published under the same imprint.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio.
author_s:
Spike, John T.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Spike, Michèle K.
public_note: A CD-ROM contains the catalogue raisonné. System requirements: Acrobat Reader 4.0.5 for Mac or Windows PC.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio : The Complete Works.
author: Vodret, Rossella
public_note: An Italian edition was published simultaneously.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio.
public_note: This is a second revised edition of the authors' 2001 publication.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio, o, Della Vulgata.
author: Radini Tedeschi, Daniele
public_note:
The publication includes essays on various "problems" related to paintings by Caravaggio and recently attributed works, with numerous references to preceding scholars in the field. 
There is a separate section with sources and documents, as well as a discussion of iconographical intrepretations.

name: Caravaggio, Michelangelo Merisi da
item_t: Caravaggio : catalogo ragionato delle opere autografe, attribuite e controverse : con un regesto completo delle repliche e delle copie.
author: Scaletti, Fabio
public_note: The catalogue includes all the known authentic paintings, as well as attributed works and rejected attributions.  The first volume includes a biography of the artist, with the catalogue and discussion of the authentic works.

name: Cardona, Segundo
item_t: Segundo Cardona.
author: Hermida-Espada, Teresa
imprint: Guaynabo, Puerto Rico : Desarrollos Arquitectónicos, Inc., 2008.

name: Carducho, Vicente
item_t: Vicente Carducho : dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author_s:
Pascual Chenel, Álvaro                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rodríguez Rebollo, Ángel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brown, Jonathan (foreword)
imprint: Madrid : Gobierno de España, Ministerio de Educación, Cultura y Deporte, Biblioteca Nacional de España : CEEH, Centro de Estudios Europa Hispánica : Intervenciones NF, 2015.
public_note: Thte catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Biblioteca Nacional de España in 2015.   In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is a section devoted to marks and collection seals on Carducho's drawings.  There is a bibliography as title and name indexes.

name: Carpaccio, Vittore
item_t: Carpaccio
author: Sgarbi, Vittorio
public_note: This monograph provides an overview of the artist's life and art, followed by an illustrated catalogue of the works. An Italian language edition also was issued in 1994 (Fabbri Editori, Milan).

name: Caro, Anthony
item_t: Anthony Caro : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Blume, Dieter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Blume, Elke                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Timpe, Eva-Maria
public_note: A variant title, "The Sculpture of Anthony Caro," appears on the spines. In English and German. Includes indices covering the years 1942-1996.

name: Canogar, Rafael Gomez
item_t: Rafael Canogar : catálogo razonado : 1948-2007.
author_s:
Esteban Leal, Paloma                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moliner Alonso, Rosario
cronology: There is an index of works in public and private collections, and a list of the artist's honors and awards.
ind_entr_cont: On-line catalogue raisonné of Canogar's paintings, works on paper, sculptures, and 'constructions', arranged chronologically. The catalogue does not include prints or other works produced in series. The titles of works created in the United States are given in English.
public_note: check_needed

name: Carracci, Annibale
item_t: Prints and Related Drawings by the Carracci Family : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bohlin, Diane DeGrazia
imprint: Washington, D.C. : National Gallery of Art, 1979.
public_note: See also the revised and expanded Italian edition, "Le stampe dei Carracci con i disegni, le incisioni, le copie e i dipinti connessi, catalogo critico," by Antonio Boschetti (Bologna : Alfa, 1984), cited in this database.

name: Carracci, Annibale
item_t: Le stampe dei Carracci con i disegni, le incisioni, le copie e i dipinti connessi : catalogo critico.
public_note: The revised and expanded Italian translation of the original English edition by Diane DeGrazia [Bohlin], "Prints and Related Drawings by the Carracci Family, a Catalogue Raisonné" (Washington, D.C.: National Gallery of Art, 1979), see entry in this database.

name: Carracci, Francesco
item_t: Prints and Related Drawings by the Carracci Family : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bohlin, Diane DeGrazia
imprint: Washington, D.C. : National Gallery of Art, 1979.
public_note: See also the revised and expanded Italian edition, "Le stampe dei Carracci con i disegni, le incisioni, le copie e i dipinti connessi, catalogo critico," by Antonio Boschetti (Bologna : Alfa, 1984), cited in this database.

name: Carracci, Francesco
item_t: Le stampe dei Carracci con i disegni, le incisioni, le copie e i dipinti connessi : catalogo critico.
public_note: The revised and expanded Italian translation of the original English edition by Diane DeGrazia [Bohlin], "Prints and Related Drawings by the Carracci Family, a Catalogue Raisonné" (Washington, D.C.: National Gallery of Art, 1979), see entry in this database.

name: Carracci, Annibale
item_t: L'opera completa di Annibale Carracci.

name: Canonica, Pietro
item_t: Canonica : scultore e musicista.
author_s:
Cardano, Nicoletta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Durbé, Dario (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Caraci, Maria
public_note:
Nicoletta Cardano catalogued the artist's sculpture; Maria Caraci catalogued his music.  

The catalogue raisonné lists 514 sculptures with a separate catalogue of lost works and sculptures known only through documents.

name: Cano, Alonso
item_t: Alonso Cano : Painter, Sculptor, Architect.
author: Wethey, Harold
public_note: A revised edition was published in Spanish under the title, "Alonso Cano, pintor, escultor y arquitecto" (Madrid : Alianza, 1983).

name: Caniaris, Vla
item_t: Vlassis Caniaris : konkreter Realismus, Skizze einer künstlerischen Strategie, Werkverzeichnis 1952 bis 1983.
author: Fehr, Michael
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Karl Ernst Osthaus-Museum and the Staatliche Kunsthalle Berlin.

name: Candid, Pete
item_t: Peter Candid (um 1548-1628) : Gemälde - Zeichnungen - Druckgraphik.
author: Volk-Knüttel, Brigitte
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue of the graphic works (which includes works by Sadeler after Candid's drawings) cites location, medium, dimensions, references, inscriptions, comments, cross-references to other works and copies.
public_note: Provenance; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Canaletto
item_t: The Etchings of Canaletto.
author: Kainen, Jacob
public_note: With descriptions and illustrations of all Canaletto's etchings.

name: Campin, Robe
item_t: Rogier van der Weyden : An Essay, with a Critical Catalogue of Paintings Assigned to Him and to Robert Campin.
author: Davies, Martin
ind_entr_cont: The publications contains catalogues for Weyden, Robert Campin, and Jacques Daret.

name: Cane, Lou
item_t: Louis Cane, catalogue raisonné : sculptures.
author_s:
Cane, Louis                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sollers, Philippe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sobelman, Isabelle
imprint: Beaubourg [Paris] : Editions de la Différence : Galerie Beaubourg, [1986-1991].
public_note: An illustrated checklist of 135 sculptures.

name: Campigli, Massimo
item_t: Campigli : catalogo ragionato dell'opera grafica (litografie e incisioni), 1930-1969.

name: Campi, Vincenzo
item_t: Vincenzo Campi.
public_note: The publication contains separate catalogues for autograph paintings and drawings, doubtful attributions, and lost or destroyed works.

name: Campigli, Massimo
item_t: Campigli : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Campigli, Nicola                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weiss, Eva                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weiss, Marcus
imprint: Cinisello Balsamo ; Silvana ; Saint Tropez : Archives Campigli ; Milan : TEGA, 2013.
public_note: The first volume includes texts by Pierre Schneider, Franco Russoli, Bruno Mantura, and others. The second volume contains a biography of the artist, as well as the catalogue of works, arranged chronologically from 1910-1971. There are also separate catalogues for mosaics, drawings for mosaics, and other sketches. Lost and unlocated artworks are also included.

name: Campin, Robe
item_t: Robert Campin : Le Maître de Flémalle : la fascination du quotidien.
author: Châtelet, Albert
public_note: In addition to catalogue raisonné of Campin's authentic works, the publication includes catalogues works produced by Campin's studio, copies produced after the artist's death.  There are also separate catalogues of the works of Jacques Daret until 1435, works by Rogier van der Weyden produced in Campin's workshop, and works by the Master of the Aix Annunciation. There is also a list of rejected attributions.

name: Canaletto
item_t: Catalogo completo delle incisioni di Giovanni Antonio Canal, detto il Canaletto.
author: Salamon, Harry
public_note: This edition of Canaletto's engravings was distributed in the U.S. with the title "Canaletto's Complete Etchings" (Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, San Francisco, 1971).

name: Campin, Robe
item_t: Robert Campin : A Monographic Study with Critical Catalogue.
author: Thürlemann, Felix
public_note: This publication relies on previously published transcriptions from Alexandre Pinchart (1867) and A. de la Grange and Louis Cloquet (1887/8).

name: Canaletto
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Canaletto.
public_note: Translation from the Italian "L'opera completa del Canaletto." From the series 'Classics of the World's Great Art.'

name: Canaletto
item_t: Canaletto : una Venezia immaginaria.
author: Corboz, André
public_note: The text is divided into four major sections and discusses the artist's working methods, as well as his iconography, sources, and influences, making this monograph and catalogue raisonné a rich interpretative study of the artist's oeuvre.

name: Canaletto
item_t: A Supplement to W. G. Constable's Canaletto : Giovanni Antonio Canal, 1697-1768.
author: Links, J.G.
public_note: This supplement updates the 1989 edition of W.G. Constable's catalogue raisonné on Canaletto, revised by J.G. Links. All new additions to the catalogue are illustrated.

name: Canaletto
item_t: Canaletto : Giovanni Antonio Canal, 1697-1768.
imprint: Oxford : Clarendon Press; New York : Oxford University Press, 1989.
public_note: Catalogue of the artist's paintings, drawings, etchings and sketchbooks. This reprint of the second, revised edition published in 1976, was reissued with a supplement and additional plates.  There are also several indices and a genealogical table.

name: Canaletto
item_t: Canaletto's Etchings : Revised and Enlarged Edition of the Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bromberg, Ruth
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1993.
public_note: Revised and enlarged edition of Bromberg's earlier study, "Canaletto's Etchings, a Catalogue and Study Illustrating and Describing the Known States, Including those Hitherto Unrecorded," published by Sotheby Parke Bernet (London and New York, 1974). The 1993 book is augmented with previously unrecorded states.

name: Cano, Alonso
item_t: Alonso Cano (1601-1667) dibujos : catálogo razonado.
author: Véliz, Zahira
public_note:
The author gives full acknowledgement to the earlier catalogues on the artist by Sánchez Cantón, Wethey, and Pérez Sánchez.

The catalogue contains several introductory essays on Cano's graphic sources and drawings by Cano in historical collections. English translations are provided for much of the introductory material in the back of the book. The appendices include inscriptions and signatures of the artist, and concordances.

name: Campendonk, Heinrich
item_t: Heinrich Campendonk, 1889-1957 : Leben und expressionistisches Werk : mit Werkkatalog des malerischen oeuvres.
author: Firmenich, Andrea

name: Campana, Humberto
item_t: The Campana Brothers : Complete Works (So Far).
author_s:
Campana, Fernando                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Campana, Humberto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Alfred, Darrin
public_note: The catalogue is divided into three sections: Section I contains the essays; Section II, written by Darrin Alfred, describes the artists' designs; and Section III contains the catalogue raisonné, arranged chronologically.

name: Campendonk, Heinrich
item_t: Heinrich Campendonk : die Hinterglasbilder : Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Geiger, Gisela (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bretz, Simone (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baumer, Ursula
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition of the artist's reverse glass paintings (verre églomisé) held at Museum Penzberg, Sammlung Campendonk, 2016.  The catalogue lists approximately 75 reverse glass paintings.  There are essays on Campendonk as a reverse glass painter, as well as technical discussions of reverse glass painting.

name: Campi, Antonia
item_t: Antonia Campi : creatività, forma e funzione : catalogo ragionato.
author_s:
Pansera, Anty                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Adriani, Antonella                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Chirico, Mariateresa
public_note: The catalogue raisonné includes Campi's unique art pieces as well as utilitarian designs for tiles and other decorative fixtures. The appendix includes a discussion of the artist's sketches and a bibliographical essay.

name: Camargo, Iberê
item_t: Iberê Camargo : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Zielinsky, Mônica
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the graphic work including the artist's monotypes, woodcuts, and engravings from 1940-1994. The publication includes a glossary of printmaking terms.

name: Cambiaso, Luca
item_t: Luca Cambiaso, la vita e le opere.

name: Cameron, Julia Margare
item_t: Julia Margaret Cameron : The Complete Photographs.
public_note: The catalogue is organized by subject. Individual entries contain information on photographic mountings, inscriptions, and other known prints.

name: Camoin, Charle
item_t: Camoin : sa vie, son oeuvre.
author: Giraudy, Danièle
public_note: Completed shortly after Camoin's death, this  monograph and catalogue raisonné was compiled with the assistance of his widow, who provided access to journals, correspondance, appointment books, family photos, etc.

name: Cain, Pete
item_t: Peter Cain Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology: Individual catalogue entries include title, date, dimensions, medium, inscriptions, related works, references, exhibitions, and color images.  All works are in private collections unless otherwise noted.
ind_entr_cont: The online catalogue raisonné lists all of Cain's paintings, drawings, photographs, collages, and sketchbook notes.

name: Cairo, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Cairo.
author: Frangi, Francesco
public_note: This study presents 229 known works, ca. 293 uncertain items, 299 copies of lost originals. There are also lists of lost and unidentified works. Not all items are illustrated in the plate section.

name: Cagnacci, Guido
item_t: Guido Cagnacci : pittore (1601-1663) : catalogo generale.
author_s:
Pasini, Pier Giorgio.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zannini, G. Ludovico Masetti (appendix).
public_note: This study includes a biography, a chronology with documentary citations, essays, the artist's critical fortunes, and proper name and title indices.

name: Calame, Alexandre
item_t: Alexandre Calame, vie et oeuvre : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Anker, Philippe (intro.)
public_note: In addition ot the catalogue of the paintings, the publication includes a list of Calame's students.

name: Calame, Alexandre
item_t: Alexandre Calame (1810-1864), dessins : catalogue raisonné.
author: Rosenberg, Pierre (preface)

name: Cage, John
item_t: John Cage : Ryoanji : Catalogue Raisonné of the Visual Artworks.
imprint: Munich : Schirmer/Mosel, in association with Pinakothek der Moderne, 2013.
public_note:
The first volume of the catalogue raisonné deals with Cage's Ryoanji cycle of pencil drawings, which were inspired by the stones in the Ryoan-ji Garden in Kyoto.  

The publication includes a pamphlet containing the German translation of the text.

name: Caillebotte, Gustave
item_t: Caillebotte, sa vie et son oeuvre : catalogue raisonné des peintures et pastels.
author: Berhaut, Marie
imprint: Paris : Fondation Wildenstein, La Bibliothèque des arts, 1978.
public_note: The first edition of Berhaut's catalogue raisonné for Caillebotte, listing 477 paintings.   A revised enlarged edition was published in 1994, with a slightly different title (See entry in this database).

name: Caillebotte, Gustave
item_t: Gustave Caillebotte : catalogue raisonné des peintures et pastels.
imprint: Paris : Wildenstein Institute, La Bibliothèque des arts, 1994.
public_note: Almost all entries are illustrated with b&w thumbnail images.

name: Calatrava Valls, Santiago
item_t: Santiago Calatrava : Complete Works.
public_note: The English translation of the "Santiago Calatrava, opera completa," from the series Electa Documenti di architettura. Catalogue raisonné documents Calatrava's building projects until 1996, up to the Soccer Stadium in Marseilles.

name: Calatrava Valls, Santiago
item_t: Santiago Calatrava : The Complete Works.
author: Tzonis, Alexander
public_note: This is the expanded edition of the author's 2004 catalogue raisonné (also issued by Rizzoli).  The 2007 edition contains Calatrava's more recent projects, including the Turning Torso tower in Malmö, Sweden and the Chicago Spire Tower.

name: Calatrava Valls, Santiago
item_t: Calatrava : Santiago Calatrava, Complete Works, 1979-2007.
author: Jodidio, Philip
imprint: Hong Kong ; Cologne ; Los Angeles : Taschen, 2007.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné of Calatrava's projects up to 2007. Calatrava collaborated on this project, and created a series of watercolor drawings for the publication.  An updated edition was published which lists Calatrava's projects up until 2015 (see entry in this database).

name: Calatrava Valls, Santiago
item_t: Calatrava : Santiago Calatrava : Complete Works 1979-Today.
author_s:
Jodidio, Philip                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Court, Christine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mühlendahl, Nora von
public_note: This is a revised and expanded new edition of the author's 2007 catalogue. (See entry in this database).

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Recherches sur la vie et les ouvrages de Jacques Callot.
author: Meaume, Édouard
public_note: The second volume continues the catalogue of the works from nos. 426-881, organized by theme. Volume 2 includes saints & devotional scenes, and secular themes. There are also separate sections on rejected works, engravings after Callot, and works by Callot's students and imitators.

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Recherches sur la vie et les ouvrages de Jacques Callot.
author: Meaume, Édouard
public_note: The first volume contains a biography, primary documents related to the artist's life (including letters and financial records), and a fold-out leaf showing the genealogy of the Callot family. Volume 1 includes Callot's Old and New Testament subjects.

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Callot, maître graveur (1593-1635).
author: Plan, Pierre Paul
imprint: Brussels ; Paris : G. van Oest & cie., 1911.
public_note: The catalogue lists 890 works by the artist.  Entries include title, dimensions, information on states and editions, inscriptions, and reference number in Meaume's 1860 catalogue (see entry in this database).

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Callot, maître graveur (1593-1635) suivi d'un catalogue chronologique.
author: Plan, Pierre Paul
public_note: This is the revised and condensed edition of Plan's 1911 2- volume catalogue (seen entry in this database).  The revised publication lists 890 etchings by the artist, but not all works are illustrated

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: L'art de Jacques Callot.
author: Ternois, Daniel
public_note: Although not a catalogue raisonné per se, the publication contains extensive appendices with a digest of documents, and a chronological list of dated engravings.

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Callot : catalogue complet de son oeuvre dessiné.
author: Ternois, Daniel
public_note: Ternois's "thèse complémentaire," Univ. Paris, on Callot's drawing.  His Supplement for the years 1962-1998 was published later (Paris, F. de Nobele, 1999) (See entry in this database).

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Callot : catalogue raisonné de l' oeuvre gravé.
author: Lieure, Jules
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1989.
public_note: Originally published in 5 volumes by Editions de la Gazette des Beaux Arts, Paris, 1924-27. Lieure was also reprinted by Collectors Editions, New York, 1969 in an 8-volume set. Wofsy's two-volume edition is the latest reprint.

name: Callot, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Callot : catalogue de son oeuvre dessiné. Supplément (1962-1998).
author: Ternois, Daniel
public_note: Supplement to D. Ternois, "Catalogue de son oeuvre dessiné," Paris, F. de Nobele, 1962 (See record in this database).

name: Calvaert, Deny
item_t: Catalogue critique des oeuvres du peintre Denis Calvart.
author: Bergmans, Simone
public_note: Published in the series : "Mémoires. Collection in-80 (Académie royales des sciences, des lettres ete des beaux-arts de Belgique. Classe des beaux-art)"; t. 3, fasc.2

name: Calvaert, Deny
item_t: Denis Calvart, peintre anversois, fondateur de l'école bolonaise.
author: Bergmans, Simone
public_note: Published in the series: "Mémoires de la Classe des beaux-arts. Collection in 4-to ; 2. sér., t.4, fasc.2"

name: Campana, Fernando
item_t: The Campana Brothers : Complete Works (So Far).
author_s:
Campana, Fernando                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Campana, Humberto                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Alfred, Darrin
public_note: The catalogue is divided into three sections: Section I contains the essays; Section II, written by Darrin Alfred, describes the artists' designs; and Section III contains the catalogue raisonné, arranged chronologically.

name: Caffi, Ippolito
item_t: Ippolito Caffi.
author: Peretti, Ferdinando

name: Cafferty, James H.
item_t: James Henry Cafferty, N.A. (1819-1869).
author_s:
Hull, David Stewart                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bell, James B. (pref.)
public_note: This was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at The New York Historical Society.  In addition to the preface and introduction, this small but useful catalogue has a critical essay on Cafferty's paintings, an exhibition catalogue, and a catalogue raisonné. The catalogue raisonné lists 48 pictures, 18 of which are in public institutions.

name: Cades, Giuseppe
item_t: Giuseppe Cades, 1750-1799 : et la Rome de son temps.
public_note: The preface is in French and Italian. The first part of the book considers the artist and the Rome of his times. Other sections cover rejected works, sources, bibliography, exhibition catalogues, and have indices of listed names and locations.

name: Caffè, Nino
item_t: Catalogo generale dell e opere di Nino Caffè.
public_note:
Each volume of the catalogue raisonné is organized chronologically by decade; however, one needs to consult all three volumes in order to review the works from the respective periods.  

Catalogue entries are not numbered. But they are included in a separate checklist of works (organized by decade) at the end of each volume.

name: Cadmus, Paul
item_t: The Drawings of Paul Cadmus.
author: Davenport, Guy
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of the drawings, 1924-1985. Chiefly illustrations.

name: Cadere, André
item_t: André Cadere : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Grasslin, Karola                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marcelis, Bernard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cadere, André                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kruas, Karola
public_note: The alternate title is "André Cadere, peinture sans fin."  The catalogue was published in conjunction with a 007-2008 travelling exhibition. The text is in German, English and French.

name: Byss, Johann Rudolf
item_t: Johann Rudolf Bys (1662-1738) : Studien zu Leben und Werk.
author: Mayer, Bernd M.
public_note: Part of the Betreige zür Kunstwissenschaft series.

name: Bürkel, Heinrich
item_t: Heinrich Bürkel : mit Werkverzeichnis der Gemälde.
illustrations: 97 color plates; 766 b&w and color ills. in catalogue
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 814 paintings by the artist.

name: Bustos, Hermenegildo
item_t: Heremegildo Bustos : pintor del pueblo.
author: Tibol, Raquel
public_note: This edition updates an earlier monograph with the same title that was published in 1981 and reprinted in 1992

name: Buttersworth, James Edward
item_t: J. E. Buttersworth : 19th-Century Marine Painter.
author: Schaefer, Rudolph J.
illustrations: numerous b&w, some color ills; 24 leaves of plates
public_note: A revised and expanded edition was published in 2009 (see entry in this database).   In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes biographical and contextual information, a genealogical table, and a chapter on the artist's signatures (not included in the second edition).  There is also a separate list of paintings held by public institutions.

name: Bustelli, Franz Anton
item_t: Franz Anton Bustelli : Nymphenburger Prozellanfiguren des Rokoko : das Gesamtwerk.
author_s:
Eikelmann, Renate                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hantschmann, Katharina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ziffer, Alfred                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bach, Utta                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Volk, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Seelig, Lorenz
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Bayerisches Nationalmuseum in Munich.

name: Buttersworth, James Edward
item_t: J.E. Buttersworth, 19th-Century Marine Painter.
author_s:
Schaefer, Rudolph J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            German, Andrew W.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schaefer, Janet U.
public_note: This is a revised and expanded edition of Schaefer's 1975 catalogue raisonné (see entry in this database).

name: Busti, Agostino
item_t: Bambaia : catalogo completo delle opere.
author: Fiorio, Maria Teresa
public_note: There is a biography of the artist, a topographical index, and a bibliography.

name: Buzzi, Tomaso
item_t: Fulvio Bianconi at Venini.
public_note: This is the fourth publication in a series on artists working with the Venini glassworks firm in Venice.  The catalogue of the complete works is contained in the catalogue of an exhibition held at "Le stanze del vetro", Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice.   In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes essays by various authors on Bianconi's work at the Venini Glassworks in the 1950s; his work as an illustrator; and the reception of Italian glass in America in the early 1950s.

name: Buzzi, Tomaso
item_t: Tomaso Buzzi at Venini.

name: Bury, Pol
item_t: Pol Bury Online Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology: The catalogue entries have small illustrations with catalogue number, title (or description), medium and support, dimensions, signatures & inscriptions, and collection information. Clicking on the catalogue image, will also provide  provenance, and exhibition information.
ind_entr_cont: The Advanced search feature allows sorting by period, style, form, keyword, title, dimensions, category, and collection
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist

name: Buzzi, Tomaso
item_t: Napoleone Martinuzzi : Venini, 1925-1931.

name: Buzzi, Tomaso
item_t: Carlo Scarpa : Venini, 1932-1947 : catalogo generale.
author: Barovier, Marino (ed.)
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at Le Stanze del vetro, Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice, Italy from August - January 2013.

name: Bury, Pol
item_t: Pol Bury : catalogue raisonné des fontaines.
author: Ameline, Jean-Paul
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of all 58 of Pol Bury's fountain-sculptures.  The catalogue is bilingual.

name: Bury, Pol
item_t: Pol Bury.
author: Pahlke, Rosemarie E.
public_note: Catalogue published on the occasion of exhibitions held in 1994 at the Museum am Ostwall, Dortmund and the Provinciaal Museum voor Moderne Kunst, Ostend.

name: Bury, Friedrich
item_t: Der Maler Friedrich Bury (1763-1823) : Goethes "zweiter Fritz".
author: Bott, Katharina
public_note: The catalogue was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Historischen Museum Hanau Schloss Philippsruhe and the Klassik Stiftung Weimar, Schiller-Museum.

name: Burra, Edward
item_t: Edward Burra : Complete Catalogue.
author: Causey, Andrew

name: Burri, Alberto
item_t: Burri : contributi al catalogo sistematico.
author: Fondazione Palazzo Albizzini
imprint: Città di Castello (Perugia) : Fondazione [Burri] Palazzo Albizzini, 1990.
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. Nemo Sarteanesi contributed a brief introduction. The catalogue contains information regarding approximately 2,000 works created from 1945-1990.

name: Buren, Daniel
item_t: Daniel Buren : catalogue raisonné chronologique. Tome III : 1967-1969 : Tome IV: 1970-1972.
author: Boisnard, Annick
cronology: Works are searchable by title, year, period and exhibition. Not all paintings are illustrated.
ind_entr_cont:
This has now been released in web format only, (www.catalogue.danielburen.com) in French, English, German and Spanish editions.

These volumes  include works from 1967-1969 (Tome III) and 1970-1972 (Tome IV).
public_note: check_needed

name: Burri, Alberto
item_t: Burri grafica : opera completa
imprint: Città di Castello : Fondazione Palazzo Albizzini, Collezione Burri, 2003.
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at Ex seccatoi del tabacco, Città di Castello, Oct. 2003- Jan. 2004.

name: Burri, Alberto
item_t: Burri : catalogo generale.
author: Corá, Bruno
imprint: Cittá de Castello : Fondazione Palazzo Albizzini Collezione Burri : Petruzzi, 2015.
public_note: The 6-volume catalogue raisonné was issued in a slipcased set.   The publication includes texts by Chiara Sarteanesi, Giuliano Serafini, Italo Tomassoni, Rita Olivieri-Godet, Carlo Pirovano, and Tiziano Sarteanesi.

name: Buren, Daniel
item_t: Daniel Buren : catalogue raisonné chronologique. Tome XIII : 1997-1999.
author_s:
Boisnard, Annick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buren, Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Blistène, Bernard (intro.)
imprint: Le Bourget : Éditions 11/28/48 ; Paris : Centre national d'art et culture Georges Pompidou, 2002.
public_note: This part of the Buren catalogue raisonné was published on the occasion of an exhibition entitled: "Le musée qui n'existait pas" at the Centre Pompidou, Paris, 2002. Catalogue raisonné lists 161 works produced between 1997-1999.

name: Buonconsiglio, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Bonconsiglio detto Marescalco : l'opera completa.
author_s:
Dal Pozzolo, Enrico Maria                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Puppi, Lionello
public_note: The introductory texts include a preface, a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes, and essays on  his career, and cultural influences.

name: Buhot, Félix-Hilaire
item_t: Félix Buhot : catalogue descriptif de son oeuvre gravé.
public_note: Reprint of the 1899 edition, augmented and revised by James Goodfriend, with a new introduction. The new edition adds one previously unknown print to the oeuvre, as well as numerous previously unrecorded states.

name: Buren, Daniel
item_t: Daniel Buren : catalogue raisonné chronologique. Tome II : 1964-1966.
author_s:
Boisnard, Annick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buren, Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Besson, Christian (intro.)
imprint: Le Bourget : Editions 11/28/48; Villeneuve d'Ascq : Musée d'art moderne Lille Métropole, 2000-2002.
public_note:
This part of the Buren catalogue raisonné was published on the occasion of an exhibition entitled: "Une traveresée, peintures, 1964-1966, at the Musée d'art moderne Lille Métropole.
Catalogue raisonné of 341 works.
