name: Bulatov, Erik
item_t: Erik Bulatov : Catalogue Raisonné in Two Volumes.
author_s:
Arndt, Matthias (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rieber, Kristin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barabanov, Yevgeny                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Becker, Kathrin
public_note: The second volume on the drawings is forthcoming.

name: Bunker, Dennis Mille
item_t: Dennis Miller Bunker : American Impressionist.
author_s:
Hirshler, Erica                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stebbins, Theodore (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Curry, David Park (essay)
public_note: A catalogue published in conjunction with a traveling exhibition held at the Boston Museum of Fine Arts, the Denver Art Museum and the Terra Museum of American Art.  Contents contain a long chronology, essays, and color plates.

name: Buren, Daniel
item_t: Daniel Buren : cabanes éclatées, 1975-2000.
public_note:
This title is from a projected series of the artist's works to be arranged thematically ("Catalogues raisonnés thématiques").
Vol. 2 (the only one published to date) catalogues 55 works created from 1975-2000, It was published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Institute d'art contemporain, Villeurbane.  The introduction is by Alex Alberro and Nora M. Alter.

name: Burckhardt, Carl Nathan
item_t: Carl Burckhardt 1878-1923 : un scultore tra Basilea, Roma e Ligornetto = Ein Bildhauer zwischen Basel, Rom und Ligornetto.
author_s:
Mina Zeni, Gianna A.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Suter, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wasmer, Hans-Joachim                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Lochman, Tomas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Suter, Rudolf
imprint: Basel : Christoph Merian Verlag ; Bern : Museo Vincenzo Vela, 2018.
public_note: Issued as a catalogue for the exhibition " Echi dell'antichità = Zeitlose Klassik", Museo Vincenzo Vela, Ligornetto, 2018 and Kunstmuseum Basel.  There are essays on Burkhardt's life, career and writings on art.

name: Burkhardt, Hans Gustav
item_t: Hans Burkhardt, the War Paintings : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all of Burkhardt's paintings relating to the Spanish Civil War, World War II, the Korean War, the Vietnam War, and the Lebanese conflict.

name: Busato, Gualtiero
item_t: Gualtiero Busato : catalogue raisonné des bronzes, 1954-2000.
public_note:
The essays are in French, Italian and English. The catalogue raisonné of Busato's juvenile works (1954-1971) is arranged chronologically; later works are organized by subject. 

The catalogue also reproduces examples of the artist's signature and various foundry marks.

name: Busch, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Busch als Maler : mit e. vollständigen Werkverzeichnis nach Vorarbeiten von Reinhold Behrens.

name: Busch, Wilhelm
item_t: Wilhelm Busch : Handzeichnungen nach der Natur : Werkverzeichnis.

name: Bugatti, Rembrand
item_t: Rembrandt Bugatti : catalogue raisonné.
author_s:
Des Cordes, Jacques-Chalom                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fromanger Des Cordes, Véronique
public_note: Catalogue written in collaboration with Robert Auclerc. The publication reproduces numerous examples of the artist's signature by year.

name: Bugatti, Rembrand
item_t: Rembrandt Bugatti sculpteur : répertoire monographique : une trajectoire foudroyante
author: Fromanger, Véronique
public_note: In 1987 the author published her first catalogue on Bugatti's works, this is much more complete new edition.

name: Bugiardini, Giuliano
item_t: Giuliano Bugiardini.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné follows the introductory material, which includes essays with biographical notes, a discussion of Bugiardini's artistic formation, and outlines of the artist's career. 

The catalogue raisonné is divided into three sections. The first part lists the authentic works, drawings, and restored works. The second part covers attributed works and drawings, the third section lists works that have been lost or are not traceable.

name: Buckland Wright, John
item_t: Sensuous Lines : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Intaglio Prints of John Buckland Wright.
author: Buckland Wright, Christoper
public_note:
This study includes all prints from metal plates (drypoint, copper engraving, and the intaglio process) from 1927 to the artist's death, plus those which appeared posthumously as book illustrations.

Consult the publication itself for further information on the respective "editions" published of this book (Editions A-B-C, etc, with varying contents).

name: Buffet, Bernard
item_t: Bernard Buffet, Lithographs, 1952-1966.
public_note: A French edition was published by A.C. Mazo, Paris, 1967.

name: Brüning, Pete
item_t: Peter Brüning : das zeichnerische Werk ; un dem Werkverzeichnis der Zeichnungen.
author_s:
Otten, Marie-Luise                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nobis, Norbert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Restany, Pierre
public_note: This is a catalogue raisonné of the artist's drawings and graphic works. Chiefly illustrations.

name: Buchheister, Carl
item_t: Carl Buchheister (1890-1964), Werkverzeichnis der abstrakten Arbeiten : Gemälde, Collagen, Materialbilder, Gouachen, Aquarelle, Zeichnungen, plastische Arbeiten, Druckgraphik, typographische Arbeiten, Teppichentwürfe/Teppiche.
author_s:

                                                            Kemp, Willi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buchheister, Elisabeth
public_note: Issued in the series, "Wissenschaftliche Beibände zum Anzeiger des Germanischen Nationalmuseums", Bd. 2,

name: Bryen, Camille
item_t: Camille Bryen : l'oeuvre peint.
author: Boutet-Loyer, Jacqueline
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné is organized chronologically, although the first paintings listed do not always reflect the actual order of creation. Not wanting to modify the system, the numbers were kept in original numerical order and the exact chronology is indicated in a general table.  

The publication also includes a filmography and an index of paintings in public collections.

name: Brüggemann, Han
item_t: Hans Brüggemann.
author: Richter, Jan Friedrich
public_note: Catalogue entries cite number, location, inventory number if present, title or description, place and date of work, provenance, size, material, construction, technique, program, references, etc.

name: Bruzzi, Stefano
item_t: Stefano Bruzzi : 1835-1911 : catalogo ragionato.

name: Bruyn, Nicolaes de
item_t: Nicolaes de Bruyn.
author_s:
Baines, Lorena A. (comp.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Orenstein, Nadine M. (ed.)
imprint: Ouderkerk aan den IJssel : Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum Amsterdam, 2014.
public_note: Issued as part of the series: "New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish Etchings, Engravings and Woodcuts, 1450-1700".

name: Brühlmann, Han
item_t: Hans Brühlmann.
author_s:
Kempter, Lothar                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Diggelmann, Hans Jakob                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Simmen, Jeannot
public_note: Number 12 from the series "Oeuvrekataloge Schweizer Künstler".  Kempter was the author of volume 1; Simmen and Diggelman compiled the catalogue raisonné.

name: Buchheister, Carl
item_t: Carl Buchheister, 1890-1964 : Werkverzeichnis der gegenständlichen Arbeiten, Gemälde, Aquarelle, Zeichnungen, typographische Arbeiten, Druckgrafik.
author_s:
Buchheister, Elisabeth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Kemp, Willi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pese, Claus (intro.)
public_note: This was published in the series: "Wisenschaftliche Beibände zum Anzeiger des Germanischen Nationalmuseum", and revises  the earlier catalogue raisonné issued in the same series (See entry cited in this database).

name: Buchheister, Carl
item_t: Carl Buchheister (1890-1964) : Werkverzeichnis der abstrakten Arbeiten.
author_s:
Kemp, Willi                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Böhm, Gottfried                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buchheister, Elisabeth
public_note: This is the revised and updated catalogue of the artist's work in various media, from 1923 until his death in 1964.  The catalogue includes his paintings, works on paper, graphic works and applied designs.

name: Buffet, Bernard
item_t: Bernard Buffet, Engravings, 1948-1967.
author: Reinz, Gerhard F.

name: Buffet, Bernard
item_t: Bernard Buffet lithographe.
author: Sorlier, Charles
public_note: Entries supply basic print information: title, date, medium, format, size, and edition information.

name: Buffet, Bernard
item_t: Bernard Buffet, graveur, 1948-1980.
author: Rheims, Maurice
public_note: Text in English, French & Japanese. The catalogue includes 367 entries.

name: Buffet, Bernard
item_t: Bernard Buffet.
author: Le Pichon, Yann
public_note:
A chronological and thematically arranged catalogue of the paintings.

The illustrations in each section are followed by brief legends that cite the catalogue number, title, medium and support, and dimensions; in this catalogue there is not much critical apparatus (historical, provenance, or collection information, etc.). However, many of the sections are preceeded by essays.

name: Brusaferro, Girolamo
item_t: Gerolamo Brusaferro : dipinti e disegni.
public_note: This publication is based on the author's doctoral thesis presented at the Università di Udine. Introductory essays cover the artist's life, critical fortunes, first work in collaboration with Antonio Marini, decorative frescoes, biblical and profane subjects, development and later work.

name: Bruyn, Bartholomaeus, the elde
item_t: Die Altarbilder des Älteren Bartholomäus Bruyn : mit einem kritischen Katalog.
author: Tümmers, Horst-Johs
public_note: Following introductory essays on the artist's work, there is a catalogue raisonné divided into four sections: (a) accepted works; (b) works attributed to the artist, but not seen in the original or mentioned only in print; (c) works not attributed to the artist; (d) works by a different painter.

name: Brunelleschi, Filippo
item_t: Filippo Brunelleschi : The Complete Work.
public_note: The current edition is a revised English translation of the author's 1976 Italian "Filippo Brunelleschi" (Milan: Electa).  The text of the current publication was revised by Battisti and Emily Lane.

name: Brugghen, Hendrick te
item_t: Hendrick Terbrugghen.
author: Benedict Nicholson
public_note:
Catalogue is arranged alphabetically by location. Works the author saw only in photographs are indicated with asterisks.  Individual entries also include information on studio copies and other versions after original works. 

The catalogue lists 77 authentic works.  There are separate catalogues of doubtful works; copies after lost originals; lost works; and rejected attributions. The catalogue illustrates a painting of St. Jerome that was discovered as the book went to press, and therefore not discussed in the catalogue.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the younge
item_t: Pieter Brueghel der Jüngere (1564-1637/38) : die Gemälde, mit kritischen Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Ertz, Klaus
public_note: This comprehensive catalogue of 1436 paintings by or attributed to the artist is organized by subject. Within each theme entries are classified with an E (authentic), F (questionable) or A (copy). Works that the author has viewed in person are marked with an asterisk.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Peter Bruegel l'ancien, son œuvre et son temps ; étude historique, suivie des catalogues raisonnés de son œuvre dessiné et gravé.
author_s:
Loo, Georges H. de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bastelaer, René van
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the drawings and engravings was compiled by Bastelaer; de Loo catalogued the painted works. The information is mostly biographical with plates described in detail.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the younge
item_t: Jan Brueghel der Jüngere (1601-1678) : die Gemälde, mit kritischem Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Ertz, Klaus
public_note: Catalogue entries in English. Includes excerpts from the artist's journal, as well as a genealogy for the Brueghel family.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the elde
item_t: Jan Brueghel der Ältere (1568-1625) : die Gemälde, mit kritischem Oeuvrekatalog.
author: Ertz, Klaus
public_note: Based on the author's 1974 dissertation presented at the Universität des Saarlandes. See the author's updated catalogue raisonné (Luca-Verlag, 2008) cited in this database.

name: Bruce, Patrick Henry
item_t: Patrick Henry Bruce, American Modernist : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Rose, Barbara (co-author)
imprint: New York : Museum of Modern Art, 1979.
public_note: This catalogue was published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art, New York and the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston.   In addition to the introduction, documentary photographs, and two critical essays by the organizing scholars, the publication includes a catalogue raisonné of the artist's works.

name: Broër, Hilde
item_t: Hilde Broër : Bildhauerin und Medailleurin : Leben und Werk.
author: Steguweit, Wolfgang
public_note:
This monograph and catalogue raisonné was published on the occasion of Broër's 100th birthday.

The catalogue raisonné lists over 600 sculptures, reliefs, and medals by the artist. The introductory essays discuss her career up to the end of her time in Berlin from 1927 to 1942, and then after 1943, in Bodensee. There is also an overview of her life's work, a short biography, name and location indices, and a comprehensive bibliography.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the elde
item_t: Jan Brueghel der Ältere (1568-1625) : kritischer Katalog der Gemälde. Bd. 4
public_note: This is the fourth and final volume of the series, containing catalogue numbers, plus. addenda (Kat. Add. 1-30), an appendix of listed sources, and a concordance with the author's earlier 1979 publication on the artist.

name: Brown, Mathe
item_t: Mather Brown, Early American Artist in England.
public_note:
Revised and expanded from Dorinda Evans's doctoral dissertation, the catalogue raisonné lists approximately 400 paintings, drawings, and prints by the artist.  The publication analyzes the artist's style and corrects previous attributions.   

In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes chapters on the biography of the artist and an analysis of his works.   Appendices include the artist's will and palette notes.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the elde
item_t: Jan Brueghel der Ältere (1568-1625) : kritischer Katalog der Gemälde. Bd. 3
public_note: Volume 3 covers flower paintings; allegories; Allegories of the Senses; history paintings; genre; and preparatory drawings. Catalogue of  works is organized by subject.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the elde
item_t: Jan Brueghel der Ältere (1568-1625) : kritischer Katalog der Gemälde. Bd. 2
public_note: Volume 2 covers landscapes with religious and mythological themes. Catalogue lists works  organized by subject-- Old Testament, New Testament, Mythology.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the elde
item_t: Jan Brueghel der Ältere (1568-1625) : kritischer Katalog der Gemälde. Bd.1
public_note:
Volume 1 deals with landscapes with secular themes. The catalogue lists 182 works organized by type of landscape (ie. marine, forest, townscape).
Publication also includes a geneology of the Brueghel family.

name: Bruegel, Jan, the elde
item_t: Jan Brueghel Online Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Honig, Elizabeth
cronology: The scholarly apparatus is comprehensive, one may check and compare works by several various criteria (location, collection, genre, tag, related works, etc).
ind_entr_cont: Entries provide full details, listing title, date, dimensions, medium and support, signature and references, exhibitions, current location or place last sold.  Commentaries can be viewed in the "Discusssion" area.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Pieter Brueghel the Elder and Lucas van Leyden : The Complete Engravings, Etchings, and Woodcuts.
author: Lavalleye, Jacques
public_note:
Other editions exist in German, French, Italian. The catalogue raisonné lists and illustrates 318 prints by van Leyden and 173 works by Pieter Brueghel the Elder. All engravings and woodcuts are reproduced in their exact dimensions, except those prints that are larger than the book itself. 
There is little critical apparatus with the illustrated catalogue of the individual prints, but there is a checklist of titles in the back.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Bruegels Gemälde.
author: Glück, Gustav
public_note: An important earlier 20th-century study of the artist's work.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Pieter Brueghel : Complete Edition of the Paintings.
author: Grossmann, Fritz
public_note:
The third revised edition. Previous editions were published under the title, "Bruegel: the Paintings." 

The catalogue rasionné lists all of Brueghel's authentic paintings as well as several doubtful attributions. The disputed paintings are discussed in the individual catalogue entries.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Tout l'oeuvre peint de Bruegel l'ancien.
author: Bianconi, Piero
public_note: Also published in English by Abrams, New York, 1970. From the series "Les Classiques de l'Art."

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Bruegel : les estampes, catalogue raisonné.
author: Lebeer, Louis
public_note: Revision of the 1969 edition. Contains a list of works erroneously attributed to Brueghel.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Bruegel, tout l'oeuvre peint et dessiné.
author: Marijnissen, Roger H.
imprint: Antwerp : Fonds Mercator ; Paris : A. Michel, 1988.
public_note: Translated from the Dutch. Also issued in English and German.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: The Prints of Peter Bruegel the Elder : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Van Bastelaer, René                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gilchrist, Susan Fargo
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1992.
public_note: Van Bastelaer was the author of  the first catalogue of Bruegel's prints and drawings. This is the first English edition, translated and revised by Susan Fargo Gilchrist.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Pieter Bruegel : die Zeichnungen.
author: Mielke, Hans
public_note: Volume 2 in the series "Pictura nova." The catalogue is divided separate sections: authentic works (67), problematic attributions (6), and misattributed works (48).

name: Brunelleschi, Filippo
item_t: Filippo Brunelleschi, the Buildings.
author: Saalman, Howard
public_note: This catalogue contains essays on the Hospital of the Innocents, Barbadori - Capponi Chapel, San Lorenzo, Pazzi Chapel, Palace of Parte Guelfa, Santo Spirito, Scolari Oratory in the Convent of Santa Maria degli Angeli, and Santa Maris del Fiore.  It also includes an appendix of documents regarding Brunelleschi.

name: Brown, Ford Madox
item_t: Ford Madox Brown : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bennett, Mary
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 2010.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of the artist's complete oeuvre, including paintings, drawings, sketchbooks, book illustrations, prints, cartoons, and furniture. The author is the former Keeper of British Art at the Walker Art Gallery, Liverpool.

name: Brossy & Associé
item_t: Brossy & Associés.
author: Pousse, Jean-François
public_note: Published in the series: "Visages de l'architecture".

name: Brooking, Charle
item_t: Charles Brooking, 1723-1759 : And the 18th Century British Marine Painters.
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné of Brooking's paintings, drawings and engravings. The publication includes a biography of the artist and his family, an essay on his artistic technique, and a discussion of works by Brooking's contemporaries.

name: Brossy, Vincen
item_t: Brossy & Associés.
author: Pousse, Jean-François
public_note: Published in the series: "Visages de l'architecture".

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Pieter Bruegel : The Complete Works.

name: Bronzino, Agnolo
item_t: L'opera completa del Bronzino.
author: Baccheschi, Edi
public_note: From the series Classici dell'arte.

name: Brugghen, Hendrick te
item_t: The Paintings of Henrick ter Brugghen, 1588-1629 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Slatkes, Leonard J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Franits, Wayne E.
public_note: The publication contains essays on Terbrugghen's life and artistic career, and on the  critical reception of his works in the seventeenth century.    The catalogue raisonné lists 89 authentic paintings; studio and workshop pieces; rejected and lost works; and some drawings related to the paintings.

name: Bril, Paul
item_t: Paul Bril, the Drawings. A Study of their Role in 17th Century European Landscape.
author: Ruby, Louisa Wood
public_note: Part of the "Pictura Nova Series, Studies in 16th- and 17th-century Flemish Painting and Drawing."  The publication also lists doubtful attributions and rejected works.

name: Broodthaers, Marcel
item_t: Marcel Broodthaers : Katalog der Editionen, Graphik, und Bücher : Catalogue of the Editions, Prints and Books : Catalogue des éditions, l'oeuvre graphique, et les livres.
author: Meyer, Werner
public_note: Trilingual exhibition catalogue published for the Sprengel Museum, Hannover, and the Städtische Galerie, Göppingen.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Bruegel : The Complete Paintings, Drawings and Prints.
author: Sellink, Manfred
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 40 paintings, 70 drawings, and 75 prints by the artist.   The publication contains separate catalogues of problematic attributions and prints after Brueghel's works.

name: Bruegel, Pieter, the elde
item_t: Pieter Bruegel.
author: Silver, Larry
public_note: A French edition was also published by Citadelles & Mazenod, Paris, 2011.

name: Bril, Paul
item_t: Paul Bril e la pittura di paesaggio a Roma, 1580-1630.
author: Cappelletti, Francesca
public_note: This is a monograph and catalogue raisonné of the easel paintings and frescoes.  There is a documentary appendix, a bibliography, a list of exhibitions, and indices.

name: Bréa, Lou
item_t: Louis Bréa, ca. 1450- ca. 1523.
public_note:
The catalogue lists accepted, doubtful, and rejected works, as well as works attributed to 
Antoine or Francois Bréa, or other contemporary artists.

name: Breu, Jörg, the younge
item_t: Jörg Breu the Elder and the Younger.
imprint: Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel : Sound and Vision Publishers, 2008.
public_note: Issued as part of the series "New Hollstein German Engravings, Etchings and Woodcuts, 1400-1700".

name: Breu, Jörg, the elde
item_t: Jörg Breu the Elder and the Younger.
imprint: Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel : Sound and Vision Publishers, 2008.
public_note: Issued as part of the series "New Hollstein German Engravings, Etchings and Woodcuts, 1400-1700".

name: Brianchon, Maurice
item_t: Maurice Brianchon : catalogue de l'oeuvre peint.
author_s:
Brianchon, Pierre-Antoine                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Daulte, Olivier                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dupertuis, Manuel
public_note: The Appendix includes a chronology with biographical notes, a list of exhibitions,  a bibliography, and an index of works.

name: Brindisi, Remo
item_t: Remo Brindisi : catalogo generale delle opere.
public_note: The catalogue lists works by decade.  An index of works provides catalogue number, title, and page references.

name: Brindisi, Remo
item_t: Remo Brindisi : catalogo generale delle opere.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue gives titles, year, medium and support, size, locations of signature, provenance, exhibition information and citations of reproductions found in the literature. Errata notices are also included for earlier volumes.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Comments

name: Brindisi, Remo
item_t: Remo Brindisi : catalogo generale delle opere.
public_note: The catalogue is scheduled to be completed in 4 volumes.  Several chapters are organized by period or activity, and critical biographical and bibliographical information is given within the main text.

name: Bronson,
item_t: General Idea : Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné : Multiples and Prints, 1967-1993.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 163 graphic works by General Idea.  The publication includes the author's interview with General Idea.

name: Bronson,
item_t: General Idea : Editions, 1967-1995.
author: Fischer, Barbara (ed.)
imprint: Mississauga, Ont. : Blackwood Gallery, University of Toronto at Mississauga, 2003.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of General Idea's editioned works from 1967-1995 was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at Blackwood Gallery at the University of Toronto Mississauga.

name: Brett, John
item_t: John Brett : Pre-Raphaelite Landscape Painter.
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 2010.
public_note: This is the catalogue raisonné of all the artist's known works, and is estimated to comprise 90 percent of his total output. The catalogue was compiled by his descendant Charles Brett, and also includes an essay on Brett's picture frames by Lynn Roberts.

name: Brekelenkam, Quiringh van
item_t: Quiringh van Brekelenkam.
author: Lasius, Angelika
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné of the paintings is arranged chronologically by theme. The catalogue lists 238 authentic paintings, not all illustrated. There also are separate catalogues of paintings with uncertain attribution, rejected paintings in museums, and rejected works in private collections and the art market. 

The publication contains lists of dated paintings, as well as undated paintings arranged in a proposed chronological order.

name: Breenbergh, Bartholomeu
item_t: Bartholomeus Breenbergh : The Paintings.
author: Roethlisberger, Marcel
public_note: The catalogue lists 125 paintings by the artist, and includes catalogues of lost and rejected works. The publication also contains a separate catalogue of works by artists from Breenbergh's circle: Carel de Hooch, Pieter Groenewegen, Jan Linsen, and Laurens Barata.

name: Breitz, Candice
item_t: The Scripted Life : Candice Breitz : Werkverzeichnis, Videoinstallationen, 1999-2010 = Catalogue Raisonné Video Installations, 1999-2010.
author: Sagmeister, Rudolf
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published on the occasion on an exhibition at the Kunsthaus Bregenz, Austria.

name: Bresslern-Roth, Norbertine von
item_t: Norbertine Bresslern-Roth, Tiermalerin.
imprint: Graz : Neue Galerie Graz, Universalmuseum Joanneum : Graz : Leykam, 2016.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition  "Norbertine Bresslern-Roth, Tiermalerin" at the Neue Galerie Graz, Universalmuseum Joanneum.

name: Bray, Jan de
item_t: Jan de Braij (1626-1697) : schilder en architect.
author: Giltaij, Jeroen
public_note: The publication contains a biography of the Bray family of painters, and a discussion of Jan de Bray's career as a painter, draughtsman and architect.  The catalogue raisonné covers de Bray's paintings, drawings and etchings.

name: Bravo, Claudio
item_t: Claudio Bravo : Paintings and Drawings.
author_s:
Bowles, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vargas Llosa, Mario                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Valcarce, Hugo
public_note: Monograph with a catalogue raisonné of the artist's works up until the date of publication. See also Bowles's 2005 revised catalogue rasionné cited in this database.

name: Brauer, Erich
item_t: Arik Brauer, Werkverzeichnis.
author: Brauer, Erick
public_note: Published in the series: "Bibliophilien Taschenbücher", The publisher also issued a numbered deluxe edition with original graphics.

name: Bravo, Claudio
item_t: Claudio Bravo : Paintings and Drawings (1964-2004).
author_s:
Bowles, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sullivan, Edward J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Calvo Serraller, Francisco
imprint: New York : Rizzoli ; Madrid : Lerner & Lerner, 2005.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is an illustrated checklist of the artist's work up to the date of publication. It updates and expands Bowles's 1997 monograph and catalogue raisonné (New York: Abbeville Press). See entry cited in this database.

name: Brätsch, Kerstin
item_t: KAYA.
author_s:
Birkenstock, Eva (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Eilers, Debo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brätsch, Kerstin

name: Brayer, Yve
item_t: Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié de Yves Brayer.
public_note: The catalogue is divided into three parts, engravings (77), lithographs, (95), and posters (34).

name: Brancusi, Constantin
item_t: Constantin Brâncusi.
author: Deac, Mircea

name: Brancusi, Constantin
item_t: Brancusi.
author_s:
Hultén, Karl Gunnar Pontus                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dumitresco, Natalia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Istrati, Alexandre
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 261 sculptures, all illustrated. The chronology contains excerpts of documents from the artist's life.

name: Brancusi, Constantin
item_t: Constantin Brancusi : Metamorphosen plastischer Form.
author: Bach, Friedrich Teja
imprint: Cologne : DuMont Literatur und Kunst Verlag, 2004.
public_note: Presented as the author's thesis at the Universität Aachen, 1983.  Catalogue of 284 of the artist's sculptures, all illustrated.  The publication includes a filmography, and a discussion of his biography and production.  A 1987 edition, published by DuMont, also exists.

name: Brancusi, Constantin
item_t: Constantin Brancusi.
author_s:
Istrati, Alexandre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dumitresco, Natalia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hultén, Karl Gunnar Pontus
public_note: This is the revised abridged edition of "Brancusi" (1986).  See entry cited in this database.

name: Bramante, Donato
item_t: L'opera completa di Bramantino e Bramante pittore.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of 11 paintings by Bramante. 

A separate catalogue lists 43 authentic paintings and 10 drawings by Bramantino. The publication also cites 14 works frequently attributed to Bramantino, and 9 works of doubtful attribution or works based on lost originals.

name: Bramantino
item_t: L'opera completa di Bramantino e Bramante pittore.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of 11 paintings by Bramante. 

A separate catalogue lists 43 authentic paintings and 10 drawings by Bramantino. The publication also cites 14 works frequently attributed to Bramantino, and 9 works of doubtful attribution or works based on lost originals.

name: Braekeleer, Henri de
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Bramke, Erdmu
item_t: Werkverzeichnis Erdmut Bramke.
author_s:
Gauss, Ulrike (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grötz, Susanne (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Jörg, Carolin (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heinlein, Stefan (contr.)
imprint: Stuttgart : Freunde der Staatsgalerie Stuttgart : (Felibach) : [Edition Axel Menges], 2016.
public_note: The publication was issued under the aegis of the Freunde der Staatsgalerie Stuttgart - Stuttgarter Galerieverein.  It includes essays by a number of critics on the artist's oeuvre.  These are followed by the catalogue raisonné, which considers the artist's works by period, format and location (which included several sojourns in Italy and France).

name: Brandi, Giacinto
item_t: Giacinto Brandi (1621-1691) : catalogo ragionato delle opere.
author: Serafinelli, Guendalina
public_note: The extensive introductory texts dicuss the artist's  career and major commissions. The catalogue raisonné is divided into separate sections: autograph works, uncertain attributions, problematic works, lost or destroyed works, and rejected attributions.

name: Brandl, Pe
item_t: Petr Brandl.
author_s:
Neumann, Jaromír                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Steckerová, Andrea (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ivanega, Jan (essay)

name: Brangwyn, Frank, S
item_t: The Water-Colours of Sir Frank Brangwyn, R.A., 1867-1956.
author: Bunt, Cyril Georg Edward
public_note: The catalogue does not include sketchbooks, the book of sketches of the Jointure Garden, Ditchling, or drawings for book projects.

name: Brangwyn, Frank, S
item_t: The Oils and Murals of Sir Frank Brangwyn, R.A., 1867-1956.
author: Galloway, Vincent

name: Brangwyn, Frank, S
item_t: The Drawings of Sir Frank Brangwyn, 1867-1956.

It also includes a list of public galleries and museums with works by the artist and a bibliography.

public_note:
The texts are in  French, with essays translated into English. The preface by Chieko Hasegawa is in French and Japanese. 

The catalogue raisonné lists each work with title, medium, collection, exhibitions (if known), lists of one man and group shows, bibliography, and index.
The monograph covers the years 1982-2002, and includes biographical information and documentation.

name: Braque, George

                                                            Laude, Jean (co-author, v.7)
public_note:
There is an exhibition list at the end of each volume.  The text of v. 7, which was published in a bound edition, is in English. 
The publisher states in the first volume that the unusal binder format for the original earlier volumes was chosen to enable easy regrouping of individual entries by the reader (either for thematic or other reasons of comparison) or when a new work appeared.

name: Braque, George

author: Mourlot, Fernand

English translation from the French ("Braque: l'oeuvre gravé, catalogue raisonné", Paris, Flammarion, 1982).

There have been a number of other catalogues published on the artist's printed work (frequently in connection with exhibitions). Among the authors are: L.G. Buchheim, P. Wember, E. Engelberts, J. Adhémar, W. Hoffman, H. Wuensche, R. Char. Also see: Fernand Mourlot's "Braque lithographe", cited in this database.

name: Braque, George
item_t: L'opera completa di Braque : dalla scomposizione cubista al recupero dell'oggetto, 1908-1929.

author: McManus, Irene
public_note: Each of the 226 works by this artist is illustrated in color. 61 works are illustrated in full-page color plates and described in detail. Both public and private collections holding her works are listed.

name: Böckstiegel, Peter Augu

public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Kunsthalle Bielefeld (Oct 19-Jan 4, 1998) and the Museum Schloss Mayland (Jan 25-Mar 8, 1998).

name: Bozatli, Sina

author: Ziwna, Sascha
cronology: The catalogue lists works from 1990 to the present.  Entries include title, medium and support, date, marks (signature, inscriptions, etc.), and exhibition information.  The catalogue can be searched by year or by medium (paintings on canvas, paintings on board, and works on paper).
ind_entr_cont: Issued under the aegis of Galerie Artziwna, Vienna (2016-2018).  The website includes sections on the artist's recent output, a discussion of the artist's life and work, and the catalogue raisonné.  There is also a chronological list of solo and group exhibitions and references.
public_note: check_needed

name: Böcklin, Arnold

The catalogue lists approximately 200 printed works from 1849-1859.

name: Böckstiegel, Peter Augu

The 2012 publication covers the years 1997 to 2011 and has an illustrated catalogue of objects and furnishings, listing title, date, description, material, size, manufacturer, location, and country. Not all texts are in English.

name: Bourdon, Sébastien
item_t: Sébastien Bourdon : des tableaux qui ont une longue histoire.
author: Cabane, Marie

name: Bourgeois, Louise
item_t: The Prints of Louise Bourgeois.
author_s:
Wye, Deborah                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Smith, Carol Hynning                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Castleman, Riva (preface)
imprint: New York : Museum of Modern Art, distributed by Harry N. Abrams, 1994.
public_note: Based on the archive Bourgeois donated to the Museum of Modern Art, NY as a complete record of her printmaking from the 1930s until the publication date (1994).  The publication includes an index of titles, printers and publishers, plus exhibition history and a chronology of the principal events in the artist's life.

name: Bourgeois, Louise
item_t: The Insomnia Drawings.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the artist's "Insomnia Drawings" was published in conjunction with the Tate exhibition of drawings, sketches and notes executed between November 1994 - June 1995.

name: Bourgeois, Louise
item_t: Louise Bourgeois : The Complete Prints and Books.
author: Wye, Deborah
cronology: Individual entries include: publisher & printer, edition information, states, support, inscriptions, comparative works, comments, and artist's remarks. Ownership information is noted if the work is in MoMA's collection and another public collection. No ownership information is provided for works in private collections.
ind_entr_cont:
The authors also include former catalogue numbers for prints created from 1938-1993 and included in "The Prints of Louise Bourgeois" (cited in this database).  

The catalogue's full extensive scholarly apparatus is outlined under the section "Guide to Entries: Cataloguing Documentation."
public_note: Bibliog.; Comments

name: Bouguereau, William Adolphe
item_t: William Bouguereau : His Life and Works, Catalogue Raisonné of the Painted Work.
imprint: New York : Antique Collectors' Club; Woodbridge, NJ : Art Renewal Center, 2010.
public_note: This study includes a comprehensive biography of the artist and a catalogue raisonné of his paintings. The catalogue's principal author, Damien Bartoli, died in 2009 before the publication was complete.

name: Bouguereau, William Adolphe
item_t: William Bouguereau.
imprint: New York : Antique Collectors' Club ; Woodbridge : Art Renewal Center, 2014.
public_note: This is a second edition of the previous 2010 publication (see entry in this database).  The first volume in this edition includes a new chapter entitled "William Bouguereau's Nymphs and Satyr" by Kara Lysandra Ross.  Both volumes contain bibliographical references, and v. 2 has an index; improved color illustrations are found throughout.

name: Boudin, Eugène
item_t: Eugène Boudin 1824-1898. Deuxième supplément.
public_note: Updates the original vols. 1-3 and also the first supplement. Catalogues 196 paintings and 433 sketches and studies included in Boudin's brother's bequest  to the Louvre. It also includes photographic documentation of exhibitions of Boudin's work from 1984-1993.

name: Botticelli, Sandro
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Botticelli.
public_note:
Notes and catalogue translated into English from the Italian, "L'opera completa di Botticelli" (Rizzoli, Milan, 1967). Within the series "Classics of the World's Great Art." Editions in other languages exist.

Catalogue raisonné of 154 authentic and attributed works. Contains a catalogue of 17 paintings formerly attributed to Botticelli, and a list of works only known through documents. Publication reproduces a selection of known drawings by the artist.

name: Botticelli, Sandro

author: Salvini, Roberto

This is followed by a catalogue of authentic portraits, portraits with dubious provenance, and rejected portraits.   There is also a bibliography and an index of names.

Published in the "Aetas Aurea" series.  The catalogue raisonné includes only works the author deemed authentic. The publication contains 122 independent sheets and 94 individual sketches in the artist's sketchbook from the British Museum, which is fully reproduced. 

Entries are grouped by medium, and then by size.  It also includes a bibliography (covering books, articles, exhibitions, and sales catalogues) and indices of collections and owners.

name: Bosch, Hieronymu

author: Spadoni, Claudio
imprint: Turin : Umberto Allemandi per Archivio & Centro studi Aldo Borgonzoni, 2017.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of the works, the publication includes a biography of the artist, a discussion of his writings, an anthology of his works, and a discussion of his art in context with his time.  The biography was compiled by Daniela Bellotti.

public_note: The catalogue includes a brief biography and a collection of critical writings about Borgianni.  The catalogue raisonné lists 52 autograph paintings, as well as attributed paintings, and paintings known only through documents; there are also brief notes on the graphic works.

The publication includes a biography of the artist and unpublished documents from the Archivio Borra.  There are three essays about the artist, as well as a chronology (in Italian only), photos of the artist, and an exhibition history.

name: Bosch, Hieronymu
item_t: The Complete Paintings of Bosch.
public_note: First published in 1967 in Italian as "L'opera completa di Bosch". The catalogue lists 72 accepted paintings and 146 paintings known only through documentary sources.

First published in Great Britain and the U.S. in 1973, it was reissued in the U.S. in 1974 in this second impression.

The catalogue numbers are taken from Charles de Tolnay's 1966 catalogue raisonné 'Hieronymus Bosch.' (London: Methuen & Co., Ltd.) (see entry cited in this database).

name: Bosch, Hieronymu
item_t: Hieronymous Bosch.
author: Larsen, Erik
public_note: The half-title is "The Complete Paintings by the Visionary Master". The book contains examples of drawings by Bosch, and paintings by the artist's workshop. Catalogue also cites two engravings formerly attributed to Bosch. An Italian edition was published in the same year by Octavo, Florence.

name: Bosch, Hieronymu
item_t: Hieronymous Bosch : The Complete Paintings and Drawings.
author_s:
Koldeweij, Jos                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vermet, Bernard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vandenbroeck, Paul
imprint: New York ; London : Harry N. Abrams, 2001.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Museum Boijmans van Beuningen, Rotterdam. The catalogue includes several essays on Bosch's art and biography. The catalogue raisonné inlcudes Bosch's entire painted oeuvre plus attributed drawings, most illustrated in black and white.

name: Bosch, Hieronymu
item_t: Hieronymous Bosch : The Complete Works.
public_note:
English translation from the Dutch:
"Hieronymous Bosch, het volledig oeuvre."  
In 2007, the publishers issued a revised and expanded edition in English (ISBN 9789061537786) with a supplement covering new research since 1987.

name: Bosch, Hieronymu
item_t: The Prints of Hieronymous Bosch.
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 2002.
public_note:
This publication includes an English translation from the French, and updates the chapter on prints in Paul Lafond's "Hieronymous Bosch, son art, son influence, ses disciples," Brussels and Paris, 1914.  Also updates the earlier cataloguings of prints attributed to Bosch by various authors, including Bartsch, Passavant, Wurzbach and Nagler, each in its original German or French. Gilchrist has added 12 prints to the list of prints set forth by Lafond in 1914, which form the core of her updated study. 
Since Bosch himself neither made nor designed any prints, the prints Lafond thought were "after" Bosch are now said to have been executed by Alart du Hameel and engravers working with Hieronymous Cock.
This book also appears with the title, "Hieronymous Bosch, Complete Prints."

name: Bosch, Hieronymu
item_t: Hieronymus Bosch : die Zeichnungen : Werkstatt und Nachfolge bis zum Ende des 16. Jahrhunderts.
author_s:
Koreny, Fritz                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pkorny, Erwin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bartz, Gabriele
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is divided into three categories: drawings by Bosch, works by members of Bosch's studio, and drawings by followers.  The catalogue also lists drawings formerly attributed to Bosch, but no longer considered authentic.

There are separate sections of studio paintings and paintings by followers. This is followed by the catalogue of the authentic drawings, questionable drawings, and drawings attributed to Bosch's studio.

Catalogue raisonné of 110 paintings and 127 drawings. Publication contains separate catalogues of workshop copies and variations, lost works, and wrongly attributed works.

The appendix contains a selection of documents (not translated) relating to the artist's life and works.

name: Borduas, Paul Emile
item_t: Paul-Émile Borduas Catalogue Raisonné.
cronology:
Though the catalogue entries are unillustrated,
at present the apparataus is quite complete. Each entry has a technical data sheet detailing medium, support, date, dimensions, signature, and inscriptions. There is extensive bibliographical information (mentioning where works have been illustrated), exhibition notes, and comments. When the catalogue is complete, entries will also include provenance information, when known.  

The online catalogue allows searching in several ways, by title, subject, year of production, and collection. Mention of a "T" classification mark refers to the Borduas Archives (available on microfiche at Concordia University), as well as the library of the National Gallery of Canada and two other locations. New information will be added to the database as it becomes available.
ind_entr_cont:
A work in progress, this is a web based catalogue raisonné of the artist's works in all media (drawings, watercolors, gouaches, photographs, oils, sculptures, etc), produced under the aegis of the Gail and Stephen A. Jarislowsky Institute for Studies in Candian Art of Concordia University (Montreal).   

Images of the works themselves are not available online, but the catalogue plans to include them in the future. There is a detailed chronology and bibliography.
public_note: check_needed

name: Boucher, Franço
item_t: L'opera completa di Boucher.

See also Supplements 1 & 2 (listed in this database) which reproduce additional works discovered since the original catalogue was issued (and reprint the original catalogue entries, unillustrated, for the first three volumes).

imprint: Madrid : Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofia, 2003.

name: Bordone, Pa
item_t: Paris Bordone : catalogo ragionato.

The bilingual introductory texts deal with the artist's biography, an overview of his career, and his critical fortunes.  

The catalogue raisonné includes 245 authentic paintings, 54 drawings, and 135 lost works. The catalogue is organized by theme: New Testament subjects, sacra conversazione, saints, portraits, allegorical landscapes, and mythology.

name: Borch, Gerard ter, the younge

author: Gudlaugsson, Sturla J.

The publication contains a genealogy of the artist's family. The first volume covers the artist's career in a series of chronological essays, it also has the illustrations for the catalogue raisonné.

The catalogue, which appears in the second volume, along with biographical material, cites number, title, medium, concordances, dimensions, provenance, exhibition information, some comments and comparative information, and considers copies.

name: Bonvin, Franço
item_t: Bonvin.
author: Weisberg, Gabriel P.
public_note:
The publication is divided into three parts; the first covers the artist's life, an illustrated catalogue listing 350 works, and an index. 
The author states that while he has spent considerable time in preparing the present catalogue, he feels that it is not fully complete and he hopes his study will bring further works to light.

author: Barbero, Luca Massimo
public_note: The texts and the catalogue are bilingual. The catalogue raisonné is organized by medium: reliefs and sculptures, paintings, miniatures, and works on pavatex.

name: Bonalumi, Agostino
item_t: Agostino Bonalumi : catalogo ragionato.
public_note: Published in the series "Archivi dell'arte".  The first volume is a monograph with bilingual essays dealing with the artist's place in the contemporary art scene, interviews, images, anthologies of writings by and on the artist, and sections on the works from 1950-2013.

name: Boltraffio, Giovanni Antonio
item_t: Giovanni Antonio Boltraffio : un pittore milanese nel lume di Leonardo.
author: Fiorio, Maria Teresa
public_note: The catalogue contains essays on Boltraffio's artistic development.  After introductory esssys, there is a catalogue of the paintings and drawings, followed by sections on uncertain attributions, rejected works, and lost or untraced works. There are documents, bibliography and indices of proper names and locations.

name: Boltanski, Christian
item_t: Christian Boltanski, Catalogue : Books, Printed Matter, Ephemera, 1966-1991.
imprint: Cologne : Verlag der Buchhandlung Walther König; Frankfurt am Main : Portikus, 1992.
public_note: This publication includes a basic catalogue of the works; the ephemera includes some hand-written correspondence.

name: Boldini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Boldini : catalogo generale dagli archivi Boldini.
author: Doria, Bianca
public_note:
The catalogue of the paintings was done in collaboration with Jean-Paul Goujon and Alessandra Doria. Volume 2 contains a preface by Vittorio Sgarbi.

This study is based on contemporary photographic archives and the artist's widow's 1931 MSS inventory of the studio, as well as material sent to her by collectors, dealers, and experts after 1931.

name: Boldini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Boldini : l'opera completa.
author: Panconi, Tiziano
public_note:
Monograph and catalogue raisonné on the artist.
(See also the three volume catalogue by Piero and Francesca Dini, also cited in this database)

name: Bol, Han
item_t: The New Hollstein : Dutch and Flemish Etchings, Engravings and Woodcuts, 1450-1700. Hans Bol
author_s:
Mielke, Ursula                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hautekeete, Stefaan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Luijten, Ger (ed.)
imprint: Roosendaal, The Netherlands : Koninklijke van Poll in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum Amsterdam,
public_note: The current publication is an updated and expanded catalogue of F.W.H. Hollstein's original 1951 Flemish catalogue of the engravings and etchings.

name: Boldini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Boldini, 1842-1931 : catalogo ragionato.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 1,300 oil paintings and pastels by the artist. The publication also contains separate catalogues of lost works and etchings. Volume 2 contains the full text of the artist's correspondence from 1866-1926. Several letters are illustrated with examples of the artist's signatuare.

name: Boltanski, Christian
item_t: Archives Christian Boltanski 01.
author: Calle, Robert
public_note: Entries give title and category, inventory number, date of execution (certain dates are those of conception and realization), dimensions, material and description, date and signature (rare).  The collection information includes only public sites, there is provenance and some auction information, exhibitions, bibliography, and a list of abbreviations.

name: Bonheur, Rosa
item_t: Atelier Rosa Bonheur.
author: Roger-Milès, Léon
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, medium, and descriptive comments.

name: Bonheur, Rosa
item_t: Rosa Bonheur : sa vie, son oeuvre.
author: Klumpke, Anna
public_note: Written by the artist Anna Elizabeth Klumpke, Rosa Bonheur's companion, the publication is primarily a biography and memoir, which includes a lengthy checklist of Bonheur's major works.

name: Bonington, Richard Parke
item_t: Bonington.
author: Shirley, Andrew
imprint: London : Kegan Paul, Trench Trubner & Co., 1940.
public_note:
This earlier study on the artist includes a biography of the artist; essays on his works; a list of lithographs; and a list of works sold and attributed to Bonington with price information.
See also the more recent catalogues on the artist's work by Patrick Noon, cited in this database.

name: Bonington, Richard Parke
item_t: Richard Parkes Bonington : The Complete Paintings.
author: Noon, Patrick
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of over 400 authentic paintings in oil and watercolor, arranged by medium and subject: Landscape Paintings in Oil; The Italian Journey; Figure Paintings in Watercolor; and Figure Paintings in Oil.

name: Bonington, Richard Parke
item_t: Richard Parkes Bonington : The Complete Drawings.
author: Noon, Patrick
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press ; London : Published for the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art, 2011.
public_note: Entries provide number, title, date, medium and support, inscription, provenance, exhibition information, and references.

name: Bonnard, Pierre
item_t: Bonnard : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
public_note: See also the revised reprint of the first volume, 1992, also listed in this database. The first volume includes the essays, while Volumes 2 & 3 illustrate Bonnard's signatures and workshop stamps, respectively.  Volume 4 contains a supplement to the first three volumes and errata.

name: Bonnard, Pierre
item_t: Bonnard, catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, révisé et augmenté, tome I, 1888-1905.

Dauberville, Jean                                                            ;&nbsp

                                                            Dauberville, Michel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dauberville, Guy-Patrice
public_note: The individual entries include materials, dimensions, signature information, exhibition history, collection information, bibliography, and where illustrated.

name: Bonnard, Pierre
item_t: Bonnard : The Complete Graphic Work.
public_note: This is the English translation of the French "Bonnard, l'oeuvre gravé," cataloguing Bonnard's lithographs and drypoints for illustrated books and posters.

name: Bonnard, Pierre
item_t: Pierre Bonnard Illustrator : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Terrasse, Antoine
public_note:
This a translation from the original French publication, "Bonnard Illustrateur" (Paris: A. Biro, 1988).  

The catalogue supplements Francois Bouvet, "Bonnard: The Complete Graphic Works",  New York, 1981 (cited in this database).

name: Bonnard, Pierre
item_t: Bonnard sculpteur : catalogue raisonné.
author: Pingeot, Anne
public_note: The catalogue lists 14 bronze sculptures by the artist. Individual catalogue entries list all known casts and their current locations.

author: Blankert, Albert
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, collection information, comments, provenance, inscriptions, and references.

author: Bochmann, Gregor von
ind_entr_cont: This online catalogue raisonné by the artist's great-grandson is still incomplete. Catalogue contains 970 entries, and can be searched by catalogue number, year of execution, materials, title and theme. Text is available in English, German, French and Estonian, but catalogue entries are only in German.
public_note: check_needed

name: Boix-Vives, Anselme
item_t: Anselme Boix-Vives. [1965-1969]. Biographie, catalogue raisonné = Biography 1965-1969].
public_note: This publication has not been found in North American library holdings, however it is listed in the catalogue of the Bibliothèque Sainte Geneviève, Paris.

name: Boezem, Marinu
item_t: Boezem : Catalogue Raisonné = oeuvre catalogue.

name: Boehle, Hilma
item_t: Hilmar Boehle : Skulpturen, Objekte und Performances von 1978 bis 2009.
public_note: This catalogue raisonné includes introductory essays on Boehle's artistic style and cultural impact of his work.  There is a full index of his sculptures, objects and performance art from 1978-2009.

imprint: Weimar : VDG (Verlag und Datenbank für Geisteswiss), 1998.

name: Boeckl, Herbe
item_t: Herbert Boeckl.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the paintings was compiled by Leonore Boeckl, and includes 370 works.

name: Boeckhorst, Jan
item_t: Johann Boeckhorst : Gemälde und Zeichnungen.
author: Galen, Maria
public_note: The publication includes a biography of the artist, a discussion on his stylistic development, and work as a draftsman.  The catalogue raisonné lists all of Boeckhorst's paintings, drawings, and oil sketches, with a separate catalogue for lost works and doubtful and rejected attributions.  The appendix includes a collection of documents related to the artist's life, a bibliography, and a list of exhibitions.

name: Boeckl, Herbe

author: Husslein-Arco, Agnes

name: Boix-Vives, Anselme

public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné. Volume 1 lists approximately 1170 authentic works, most illustrated in color.  The catalogue raisonné is chronological, then organized by thematic content, and title within each theme. Individual entries provide date, title, medium and support, dimensions, signature information, and some comments, collections, some have references to the lliterature, exhibitions, provenance, etc. There is an alphabetical listing of the works.

name: Bol, Ferdinand
item_t: Ferdinand Bol (1660-1680), Rembrandt's Pupil.
author: Blankert, Albert
public_note: Appendicies contain Bol's family tree, illustrations of Bol's signatures, and a selection of documents related to Bol's life.  These include the testaments and inventories of Bol's wife and his son, Elbert Bol.

name: Bloemaert, Frederick
item_t: Abraham Bloemaert and His Sons : Paintings and Prints.
public_note:
Vol. 11 from the series "Aetas aurea". Catalogue raisonné of Abraham Bloemaert's paintings, drawings and engravings. The publication also includes separate catalogues of lost works; works known only from contemporary documents; rejected paintings; and doubtful engravings. The publication also includes separate catalogues raisonné of the works the artist's four sons: Frederick, Cornelis, Hendrick and Adriaen Bloemaert.

The appendicies contain biographies of Abraham Bloemaert and his sons; a chronology with documentary references to the Bloemaert family and their works; a list of 29 pupils (excluding his four sons) of Abraham Bloemaert with brief biographies; and genealogical tables.

name: Bloemaert, Cornel

The catalogue is divided into categories: Early Works, landscape views by region: Ungarn, Bavaria, the North Sea, Southern Europe, Vienna, unknown locations, etc.  There is also a section of still lifes, portraits and figures.

                                                            Tongiorgi Tomasi, Lucia
public_note: Published in collaboration with the Soprintendenza ai beni artistici e storici per le province di Firenze e Pistoia.

name: Binns, Charles Fergu
item_t: Charles Fergus Binns, the Father of American Studio Ceramics.
author_s:
Carney, Margaret                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Evans, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Strong, Susan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Zakin, Richard
public_note: Catalogue of the 1998 exhibition organized by the International Museum of Ceramic Art, New York State College of Ceramics at Alfred University. The catalogue raisonné contains 192 works arranged chronologically.

name: Bingham, George Caleb
item_t: George Caleb Bingham : The Evolution of an Artist.
author: Bloch, E. Maurice
imprint: Berkeley, CA : University of California Press, 1967.
public_note: Entries cite number, title, medium, dimensions, exhibitions, references, and collection information.  The notes discuss depicted subjects and provide comparative comments.

name: Bierstadt, Albe
item_t: Albert Bierstadt : Painter of the American West.
author: Hendricks, Gordon
public_note:
Published in association with the Amon Carter Museum of Western Art, Fort Worth, TX. This is not a catalogue raisonné per se, but rather the author has an illustrated checklist of 280 works he has accepted as authentic. The catalogue only considers works held in American public collections.  

Paintings in public collections that the author considered inauthentic are omitted, but there is a list of the institutions holding such works.

name: Bier, Wolfgang
item_t: Wolfgang Bier.
author_s:
Bier, Wolfgang                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Weber, C. Sylvia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Brey, Norbert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fehle, Isabella
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is included in the catalogue of an exhibition held at the Museum Würth. The publication contains an essay by the artist's wife, Gabi Welters-Bier.

name: Bigari, Vittorio Maria
item_t: Vittorio Maria Bigari, affreschi, dipinti, disegni.
public_note: The introductory sections contain a preface by Renato Roli, a discussion of the artist's critical fortunes, and an biographical essay.  The second part of the book is divided into sections dealing with accepted works, those no longer extant, frescoes, and drawings.

name: Bijlert, Jan van
item_t: Jan van Bijlert, 1597/98-1671 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Huys Janssen, Paul
public_note: From the series "OCULI-Studies in the Arts of the Low Countries." Originally presented as the author's doctoral thesis (University of Utrecht, 1994).  The Appendices include documents, genealogical tables and a concordance.

name: Bilivert, Giovann
item_t: Bilivert : saggio di ricostruzione.
author: Contini, Roberto
public_note:
With full bibliography on this artist of Dutch descent who worked in Florence for the Medici ducal court. Contains separate section on lost or unknown works cited in contemporary sources.
Also contains an Appendix of documents.

name: Bianchi, Mosè di Giosuè
item_t: Mose Bianchi : catalogo ragionato.
author: Biscottini, Paolo
public_note: The publication contains a table of works, a critical anthology, and a biography of the artist.

name: Bianco, Remo
item_t: Remo Bianco : catalogo generale delle opere.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné covers the artist's paintings, collages, sculptural constructions, performance pieces and other works. The catalogue was compiled in collaboration with the artist's sister.

name: Béraud, Jean
item_t: Jean Béraud, 1849-1935 : The Belle Époque, a Dream of Times Gone By, Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Saurisse, Pierre                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bernier, Georges (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Castais, Nicole                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Offenstadt, Patrick
imprint: Paris : Wildenstein Institute ; Cologne : Benedikt Taschen, 1999.

name: Blake, William
item_t: The Complete Graphic Works of William Blake.
public_note: Chiefly illustrations. The catalogue raisonné lists 655 graphic works, including all of the prints designed by Blake, but which were not engraved by the artist himself. The publication omits nearly all of Blake's engravings after other artists.

name: Bewick, Thoma
item_t: The Complete Illustrative Works of Thomas Bewick.
author: Tattersfield, Nigel
imprint: London : the British Library : The Bibliographical Society : New Castle, DE : Oak Knoll Press, 2011.

name: Bianconi, Fulvio
item_t: Tomaso Buzzi at Venini.

name: Bianconi, Fulvio
item_t: Fulvio Bianconi at Venini.
public_note: This is the fourth publication in a series on artists working with the Venini glassworks firm in Venice.  The catalogue of the complete works is contained in the catalogue of an exhibition held at "Le stanze del vetro", Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice.   In addition to the catalogue, the publication includes essays by various authors on Bianconi's work at the Venini Glassworks in the 1950s; his work as an illustrator; and the reception of Italian glass in America in the early 1950s.

name: Bianconi, Fulvio
item_t: Napoleone Martinuzzi : Venini, 1925-1931.

name: Bianconi, Fulvio
item_t: Carlo Scarpa : Venini, 1932-1947 : catalogo generale.
author: Barovier, Marino (ed.)
public_note: Catalogue of an exhibition held at Le Stanze del vetro, Isola di San Giorgio Maggiore, Venice, Italy from August - January 2013.

name: Biazaci, Matteo
item_t: Tommaso e Matteo Biazaci da Busca.
public_note: The publication includes essays on the Biazacis' artistic technique, iconography and symbolism in the artists' works, and a discussion of the results of multispectral analysis on select works.

name: Biazaci, Tommaso
item_t: Tommaso e Matteo Biazaci da Busca.
public_note: The publication includes essays on the Biazacis' artistic technique, iconography and symbolism in the artists' works, and a discussion of the results of multispectral analysis on select works.

name: Biemann, Dominik
item_t: Dominik Biemann : böhmischer Glasgraveur des Biedermeier.
author: Pittrof, Kurt

name: Beuys, Joseph
item_t: Joseph Beuys, Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné, Multiples and Prints, 1965-80.
imprint: Munich : Schellman & Klüser (distributed by New York University Press), 1980.
public_note:
This is the bilingual version of the fifth revised German edition of "Joseph Beuys, multiplizierte Kunst" (Munich: Schellman & Klüser, 1980).  
An American version was also published by New York University Press, 1980, with translation by Caroline Tisdall  (described as a 5th rev. and updated edition). 
Numerous other editions exist; see, for example, the 8th edition, 1997 (cited in this database).

name: Biemann, Dominik
item_t: Glasgravuren des Biedermeier : Dominik Biemann und Zeitgenossen : Katalog raisonné.
author: Lichtenberg, Paul von.
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Landesmuseum Joanneum in Graz and the Museum Kunst Palast. The catalogue includes 111 works by Biemann and 83 works by his contemporaries.

name: Beuys, Joseph
item_t: Joseph Beuys, the Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné of Multiples and Prints.
author_s:
Schellmann, Jörg (Ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rothfuss, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nisbet, Peter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Klüser, Bernd
imprint: Cambridge, MA : Busch-Reisinger Museum, Harvard University Art Museums; Minneapolis, MN : Walker Art Center; Munich : Edition Schellmann, 1997.
public_note:
Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Walker Art Center, Minneapolis and six other institutions from 1997 to 2000. 
This is considered the 8th edition of the catalogue of Beuys' Multiples, and has a revised translation and new material (v. 5th edition, 1980, edited by Joerg Schellmann (also cited in this database).

name: Beuys, Joseph
item_t: Joseph Beuys Wasserfarben/Watercolours : 1936-1963.
author_s:
Bastian, Heiner (pref.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grinten, Franz Joseph van der                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Grinten, Hans van der
imprint: Frankfurt am Main ; Berlin ; Vienna : Propyläen, 1975.
public_note: Bilingual edition.  This is essentially a monograph with an illustrated checklist of works.

name: Beuys, Joseph
item_t: Joseph Beuys, Multiples : Werkverzeichnis Multiples und Druckgraphik, 1965-1985 = Joseph Beuys, Multiples : Catalogue Raisonné of Multiples and Prints, 1965-1985.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue of graphic works, the publication includes the text of an interview between Beuys and the authors.

name: Bertoni, Wande
item_t: Werkverzeichnis Wander Bertoni [online].
author: Ziwna, Sascha
cronology: The catalogue can be searched chronologically and by medium, but few works are currently listed.  Entries include catalogue number, title, date (beginning of project), dimensions, technique, references, edition information, signature, and edition number.  There is also some provenance and exhibition information provided.
ind_entr_cont: Issued under the aegis of Galerei Artziwna, Vienna.  The online catalogue raisonné remains a work in progress, and the artist's biography and the chronology are largely incomplete.
public_note: check_needed

name: Bertos, Francesco
item_t: The Triumph of Motion : Francesco Bertos (1678-1741) and the Art of Sculpture : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Avery, Charles
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of bronze, marble and terracotta sculptures by the artist, arranged by subject. There is a catalogue of doubtful and rejected attributions, with a catalogue of works by Bertos's follower, Agostino Fasolato.

name: Besnard, Paul Albe
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Bernhard, Franz
item_t: Franz Bernhard : Werkverzeichnis der Skulpturen, 1964 bis 1989.
author: Rothe, Wolfgang
public_note: Works are listed, however are no individual entries with critical apparatus..

name: Bernini, Gian Lorenzo
item_t: Bernini.
author: Borsi, Franco
public_note: The full title of the English edition is "Bernini; with a Catalogue Raisonné Including Previously Unpublished Documents by Francesco Quinterio."  The first edition was published as "Bernini architetto" by Electa in 1980. There have been subsequent reprintings.

name: Bertoldo di Giovann
item_t: Bertoldo di Giovanni, Sculptor of the Medici Household : Critical Reappraisal and Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Draper, James David
imprint: Columbia , MO : University of Missouri Press, 1992.
public_note: The texts include a biographical essay, a discussion of his stylistic development, and his artistic legacy.

name: Bert, Lore
item_t: Lore Bert : Opus Environment : Werkverzeichnis der raumbezogenen Arbeiten 1984-2001 = Catalogue Raisonné of the Installations 1984-2001.
author_s:
Koelen, Dorothea van der                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Correia, Ana Maria de Arez Romao e Brito
public_note: Texts are given in German and English. The catalogue raisonné includes installation plans, photographs, sketches, and documentary materials. Appendices include a biography, essays, works in public collections, and chronological & title indices.

name: Bernini, Gian Lorenzo
item_t: Gian Lorenzo Bernini : The Sculptor of the Roman Baroque.
author_s:
Wittkower, Rudolf                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hibbard, Howard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Martin, Thomas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wittkower, Margot
public_note: Third edition, edited and revised by Howard Hibbard, Thomas Martin, and Margot Wittkower. The first and second editions were published in 1955 and 1966, respectively.

name: Berlage, Hendrik Petru
item_t: Hendrik Petrus Berlage, Complete Works.
author_s:
Fanelli, Giovanni                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Heer, Jan de                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Rossem, Vincent van                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Polano, Sergio
public_note: This is the English translation of "Hendrik Petrus Berlage, opera completa" (Electa, 1987). The catalogue raisonné covers Berlage's architectural, urban planning and housing projects, and writings.

name: Bernini, Gian Lorenzo
item_t: Bernini pittore : dal disegno al "maraviglioso composto".
author: Petrucci, Francesco
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there are esssays on Bernini's life and works, critical fortunes.  The catalogue of the Bernini's accepted paintings is divided by subject: self-portraits, potraits, and other figures. There are also separate catalogues of doubtful attributions; rejected paintings, as well as lost works and paintings known only from documents.

name: Bert, Lore
item_t: Lore Bert : Werkverzeichnis : Kompositionen 2006-2009.
author: Koelen, Dorothea van der

name: Berlin Painte
item_t: The Berlin Painter and his World : Athenian Vase-Painting in the Early Fifth Century B.C.
author: Padgett, J. Michael (ed.)
public_note: The catalogue presents essays on the Berlin Painter's career; his Potters; Associates and Followers of the Berlin Painter; and the Connoisseurship of Greek Vases, among many other numerous scholarly contributions found in the catalogue. The publication also includes bibliographical references, an index and maps.

name: Bernard, Emile
item_t: Émile Bernard : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné lists over 1,550 paintings created from 1881-1941, arranged chronologically. 

All works are illustrated with black and white thumbnails images.

name: Bernard, Emile
item_t: Émile Bernard, 1868-1941 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre gravé.
author_s:
Morane, Daniel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Harscoët-Marie, Laure                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Puget, Catherine (Preface)
public_note: Published on occasion of an exhibition organized by the Musée de Pont-Aven (June 24-October 2, 2000) in collaboration with the Bibliothèque d'Art et d'Archéologie-Jacques Doucet.

name: Bernard, Emile
item_t: Émile Bernard, instigateur de l'école de Pont-Aven, précurseur de l'art moderne : sa vie, son oeuvre : catalogue raisonné.
public_note:
The first part of the publication includes essays on Bernard's life and career, his artistic technique, and his writings.  The second part includes the catalogue raisonné of the paintings. 
The append has genealogical tables.

name: Berdusán, Vicente
item_t: Vicente Berdusán (1632-1697) y Aragón.
author: Lozano López, Juan Carlos
imprint: Zaragoza : Caja de Ahorros de la Inmaculada de Aragón, 2006.
public_note: Based on the author's 2004 dissertation for the Universidad de Zaragoza. The publication contains no separate catalogue section. Rather, the book is divided into decades, and all works produced during each period are discussed within the text. The catalogue contains a separate chapter on rejected attributions. All works by Berdusán are illustrated in color.

name: Berges, Werne
item_t: Werner Berges : Druckgraphik der 1960er und 1970er Jahre.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Wilhelm-Hack-Museum, Ludwigshafen am Rhein, 2014.

name: Berksoy, Semiha
item_t: Semiha Berksoy : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the paintings, the publication includes essays by Robert Wilson, Ferit Edgu, Dieter Ronte, and the artist's daughter, Zeliha Bersksoy, among others.

name: Berghe, Frits van den
item_t: Frits van den Berghe, 1883-1939. Catalogue raisonné de son oeuvre peint.
author: Langui, Emile
imprint: Brussels : Édité par Laconti pour le Ministère de l'éducation nationale et de la culture, 1966.
public_note:
