The first part of this study includes an introduction, documents, a biography, a list of one-man and group exhibitions, plus a front section (mostly color illus.) of major works representative of main periods in the artist's career. Captions are in French and Dutch. 

There is also a chronology, but as the artist's works were rarely dated (at the end of his career not at all), the chronology is based on stylistic analysis and comparisons.

name: Bernardi, Giovanni Desiderio
item_t: L'opera di Giovanni Bernardi : da Castel Bolognese nel Rinascimento.
author: Donati, Valentino
public_note: Introductory essays include the artist's biography and accounts of his artistic activities. There is also a list of works and plates, a genealogy of the artist's family, and information on the workshop. In addition, there are separate lists of authentic pieces, attributed works, and workshop collaborations.

name: Bertin, Nicola
item_t: Nicolas Bertin (1668-1736) : peintre d'histoire.
author: Lefrançois, Thierry

name: Bertazzoni, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni di Matteo Bertazzoni : pittore Lucensis (Lugo 1805-1884) : catalogo generale.
public_note: The catalogue features essays on Bertazzoni's career and on the artistic culture of Lugo following the restoration of the Papal States in 1800.

name: Berthélemy, Jean-Simon
item_t: Jean-Simon Berthélemy : 1743-1811, peintre d'histoire.
author: Volle, Nathalie

name: Benton, Thomas Ha
item_t: The Lithographs of Thomas Hart Benton.
author: Fath, Creekmore
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 2001.
public_note: Reprint. This title was published on three occasions by the University of Texas Press, Austin: in 1969, 1979 (revised), and 1990 (revised).

name: Benoist, Marie Guilhelmine
item_t: Marie-Guilhelmine Benoist : Gestaltungsräume einer Künstlerin um 1800.
author: Reuter, Astrid
public_note: Originally presented as the author's dissertation at the Universität Freiburg im Breisgau. The publication contains excerpts from critical reviews that appeared between 1784-1812.

name: Benouville, François Léon
item_t: Léon Bénouville, 1821-1859 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
imprint: Paris : Association des amis de Léon Bénouville, 1981.
public_note: The first two parts of the catalogue raisonné list dated paintings and drawings in chronological order, the third section has unidentified drawings.

name: Benson, Frank Weston
item_t: Frank W. Benson's Etchings, Drypoints, and Lithographs : An Illustrated and Descriptive Catalogue.
author_s:
Paff, Adam E. M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            John T. Ordeman

name: Benaschi, Giovanni Battista
item_t: Giovan Battista Beinaschi : pittore barocco tra Rome e Napoli.
public_note: The publication includes essays on the artist's life, workshop, and critical fortunes. The appendix contains correspondence and other documents related to the artist's life and work.

name: Benedetto da Maiano
item_t: Benedetto da Maiano : A Florentine Sculptor at the Threshold of the High Renaissance.
author: Carl, Doris
public_note:
This is a licensed edition of German "Benedetto da Maiano: ein florentiner Bildhauer an der Schwelle zur Hochrenaissance" issued by Schnell und Steiner, Regensburg, 2006.

Essentially a monograph, the publication includes all of the artist's known works to date. There is no separate catalogue raisonné; all works are discussed in the text. The publication includes a documentary chronology of the artist's life, inventories of his estate, a genealogical tree, and other documents reproduced in their original language (some with English summaries).

name: Benouville, Jean Achille
item_t: Achille Benouville (1815-1891) : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
author: Aubrun, Marie-Madeleine
public_note: The revised edition includes prints, which were absent from the first edition (1981). The catalogue raisonné is generally limited to holdings in French collections.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Bellini e i belliniani.
author: Heinemann, Fritz
public_note: Translated from the German. This major source for Venetian painting not only catalogues paintings and drawings by Giovanni Bellini himself but also considers the biography and oeuvre of numerous artists within the "school" of Giovanni Bellini. Works falsely attributed to Giovanni Bellini are catalogued. Vol. 2 reproduces seven signatures on Giovanni Bellini's paintings. Indices of collectors and locations are included.

name: Bellini, Jacopo
item_t: The Genius of Jacopo Bellini : The Complete Paintings and Drawings.
author: Eisler, Colin
imprint: New York : Harry N. Abrams, in association with British Museum Publications, 1989.
public_note: This book is primarily criticism and interpretation, with a complete catalogue appended.

name: Bellotto, Bernardo
item_t: Bernardo Bellotto, genannt Canaletto.
author: Kozakiewicz, Stefan
illustrations: 1,168 b&w, a few color and some mani-folds
public_note: Individual catalogue entries contain references, exhibitions, provenance, extensive comments, and illustrations.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Bellini e i belliniani : supplemento e ampliamenti.
public_note: Translated from the German. This volume supplements and revises Heinemann's "Giovanni Bellini e i belliniani" (Venice: Neri Pozza, 1962), cited in this database.

name: Bellmer, Han
item_t: Hans Bellmer : oeuvre gravé.
author: Pieyre de Mandiargues, André (preface)
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists 132 prints, all reproduced with full-page black and white images.  The catalogue covers the artist's dry points, lithographs, engravings, etchings, mixed technique works.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Bellini.
author: Gronau, Georg
public_note: In the series "Klassiker der Kunst," 36.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: Tutta la pittura di Giovanni Bellini.
author: Bottari, Stefano
public_note:
The catalogue raisonné provides title, date, and collection information. Cross references to the separate plates are within the text. The brief catalogue commentary gives occasional provenance information, and some bibliographic references are found in the notes. There is a separate catalogue of lost works.  
A chronological bibliography appears at the end of the second volume.

name: Beleys, Colette
item_t: Colette Beleys : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, 1911-1994.

name: Belling, Rudolf
item_t: Rudolf Belling.
author: Hofmann, Helga D.
public_note: Addresses the sculptor's work in all media.

name: Bellini, Gentile
item_t: Gentile Bellini.
author: Meyer zur Capellen, Jürg
public_note: Catalogue raisonné lists 26 authentic paintings and 7 drawings by Bellini. The publication contains separate catalogues of lost works; copies; paintings and drawings by members of the artist's circle; and rejected attributions. It also contains selected documents related to the artist's life and work.

name: Behnisch, Günte
item_t: Behnisch & Partner Bauten 1952-1992.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition at the Galerie der Stadt Stuttgart.  The publication has contributions by 10 authors, each of whom focused on an individual project.

name: Bellini, Gentile
item_t: Gentile Bellini : A Monograph and Catalogue of Works.
author: Collins, Howard F.
public_note: Presented as the author's doctoral dissertation at the University of Pittsburg, 1970. Volume 2 contains the illustrations.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Bellini : catalogo completo dei dipinti.
author: Tempestini, Anchise
public_note: This publication is from the series "I gigli dell'arte," 24. The catalogue raisonné lists over 100 paintings and altarpieces by the artist.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: Giovanni Bellini.
author: Tempestini, Anchise
public_note: English language edition of the 1997 Italian publication (Milan: Fabbri).   A German language edition was published as "Giovanni Bellini: Leben und Werke" (Munich: Hirmer, 1998), and second Italian edition was published in 2000 (Milan: Electa).

name: Behnisch, Günte
item_t: Behnisch & Partner, Bauten und Entwürfe 1952-1974.
author: Behnisch, Günter
public_note: This is the second edition of the original 1975 publication.  For later works by Behnisch & Partner, see the 1992 edition, also listed in this database.

name: Bellini, Giovann
item_t: L'opera completa di Giovanni Bellini.
author: Pignatti, Terisio
public_note: Within the series "Classici dell'Arte," 28.

name: Bellows, George
item_t: George Bellows’ Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Peck, Glenn C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            H. V. Allison & Co.
cronology: The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 700 authentic paintings.  It includes references to paintings known only through entries in Bellows' record book, many of which were destroyed.
ind_entr_cont: Individual catalogue entries include title, date, provenance, exhibition history, collection, signature and inscriptions, references, and Bellows' record book number.  Most works are illustrated with scalable color images.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Bellmer, Han
item_t: Catalogue raisonné des estampes de Hans Bellmer 1938-1975.
author: Flahutez, Fabrice
public_note: This catalogue updates and expands the earlier 1969 catalogue (see entry in this database).  The publication also includes information on the posters and illustrated books.

name: Bellows, George
item_t: The Lithographs of George Bellows : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Mason, Lauris                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ludman, Joan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Morgan, Charles H. (foreword)
imprint: San Francisco : Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1992.
public_note: Revises and corrects the original edition published by KTO Press, New York, in 1977.

name: Bellotto, Bernardo
item_t: L'opera completa del Bellotto.
author: Camesasca, Ettore
public_note: Following an introductory essay, there are chronological and iconographical listings of all attributed paintings.

name: Begas, Reinhold
item_t: Begas : Monumente für das Kaiserreich : eine Ausstellung zum 100. Todestag von Reinhold Begas (1831-1911).
author_s:
Sünderhauf, Esther Sophia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cortjaens, Wolfgang                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Simpson, Jutta von (c.r.)
public_note: This catalogue was issued in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Deutsches Historisches Museum in Berlin. It includes a new catalogue raisonné by Jutta von Simson that is based on Alfred Gotthold Mayer's early 20th century monograph on the artist.

name: Beerbohm, Max
item_t: A Catalogue of the Caricatures of Max Beerbohm.
author: Hart-Davis, Rupert
public_note: Over 2,000 works are catalogued, representing  real people, imagined persons and allegorical subjects, however, the catalogue only includes cariactures intended to be framed or reproduced in books or prints. This study excludes juvenalia (excepting a few representative examples), marginalia, sketchbooks, letters and manuscripts.

name: Begas, Oska
item_t: Oscar Begas. 1828-1883 : ein Berliner Maler zwischen Hof und Bourgeoisie : Biografie und Catalogue Raisonné seiner Gemälde.
author: Cortjaens, Wolfgang
public_note: Issued in the series "Studien zur internationalen Architektur und Kunstgeschichte", n. 152.  The publication also includes the artist's own list of works for the years 1841-1848, as well as excerpts from Begas' diary and correspondence.

name: Beckmann, Max
item_t: Max Beckmann : Katalog der Gemälde.
public_note: This catalogue of Beckmann's paintings and illustrations is arranged chronologically. Volume I  includes studies of the artist's signatures and writings, as well as relevant exhibitions and private collections holding his works.

name: Beckmann, Max
item_t: Max Beckmann, die Druckgraphik : Radierungen, Lithographien, Holzschnittë.
author: Gallwitz, Klaus
public_note: This exhibition catalogue was also the first catalogue raisonné of Beckmann's graphic work, with 305 works described and illustrated.

name: Beck, Irmin
item_t: Irmin Beck : Bilder [1996-2007].
author_s:
Weber, Karin                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Beck, Rainer                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gebessler, Rentate
public_note:
This is a catalogue of all of the artist's work from 1996-2007.  The publication includes a brief essay by Karin Weber, with additional texts by Rainer Beck and Renate Gebessler.  

Volume 2 has the imprint (Verlag für moderne Kunst Nürnberg, 2007).

name: Beckmann, Max
item_t: Max Beckmann : Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints.
author: Hofmaier, James
public_note: A critical study of the prints, illustrated to scale when possible. The catalogue lists 373 works, and cites unknown and additional states. It also contains information regarding surviving plates and stones and reproduces the artist's signature. Titles are indexed in both English and German.

name: Beck, Gerlinde
item_t: Gerlinde Beck : Raum-Choreografien.
imprint: Ostfildern : Cantz ; [Marl] : Skulpturenmuseum Glaskasten Marl ; Hohentwiel : Kunstverein Singen ; [Witten] : Märkisches Museum der Stadt Witten, 1995.
public_note:
This study was published by Cantz, and under the aegis of three German institutions: Skulpturenmuseum Glaskasten Marl, Kunstverein Singen, and Märkisches Museum der Stadt Witten.

The monograph was written by Uwe Rüth and the catalogue raisonné of the sculptures was compiled by Wolfgang Zemter.

name: Bechtold, Erwin
item_t: Bechtold : Erwin Bechtold, Malerei zwischen Zufall und Ordnung.

name: Beckmann, Max
item_t: Max Beckmann : The Watercolors and Pastels : Catalogue Raisonné of the Works in Color on Paper.
author_s:
Beckmann, Mayen                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gohr, Siegfried                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hollein, Max (preface)
public_note: Appendix B lists works of dubious attribution. A separate Appendix F lists forgeries including copies intended to deceive, graphic works watercolored by another hand, and free forgeries. There is also an essay on forgeries by Mayen Beckmann, the artist's granddaughter.

name: Beaux, Cecilia
item_t: The Paintings and Drawings of Cecilia Beaux.
imprint: Philadelphia : Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, 1955.
public_note:
The author Henry S. Drinker was the artist's nephew, who wrote this in celebration of the artist's 100th birthday as well as the 150th anniversary of the Pennsylvania Academy, where Beaux studied and taught. 
Included is a transcript of Beaux's lecture on portraiture, delivered at Simmons College on May 14, 1907.

name: Beardsley, Aubrey Vincen
item_t: Aubrey Beardsley : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Zatlin, Linda Gertner
public_note: This monograph and catalogue raisonné lists approximately 1,100 works, as well as approximately 100 sketches that were included with Beardsley's correspondence and books.

name: Beaumont, Leonard
item_t: Leonard Beaumont : A Biography and Print Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Dickson, Timothy
public_note: This book was produced in association with a retrospective exhibition held at the Graves Gallery, Sheffield; it was the first major overview of the graphic designer and printmaker's life and work since the 1980s.

name: Bäckström, Johan
item_t: Johan Bäckström : folkkonstnär i Östergötland.
author: Mörkfors, Gunnel
public_note: Both the texts and the catalogue raisonné entries are only in Swedish. Introductory essays consider the situation of guild painters and artists, Bäcktröm's place in furniture history, his production, etc.

name: Beccafumi, Domenico
item_t: L'opera completa di Domenico Beccafumi.

name: Beal, Reynold
item_t: Reynolds Beal, Impressionist Landscapes and Seascapes.
author_s:
Bressler, Sidney                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berman, Ann E. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pisano, Ronald (essay)
imprint: Rutherford, NJ : Fairleigh Dickinson University Press ; Cranbury, NJ : Associated University Presses, 1989.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists over one thousand etchings, drawings, oil paintings, and watercolors by the artist. The author notes that much of the information regarding individual entries was obtained from responses to a questionnaire sent to all known owners of Beal's works. A copy of this questionnaire is included in the publication.

name: Beccafumi, Domenico
item_t: Beccafumi.
author_s:
Torriti, Piero                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Di Giampaolo, Mario et al.
public_note: Essays were contributed to this volume by many authors, among them Gabriele Fattorini, Paolo Giannattasio (on Beccafumi's drawings), Elisabetta Tenducci (on bozzetti and engravings), and Bruno Santi (on the pavement decoration in Siena Cathedral). Cecilia Alessi wrote catalogue entries.

name: Bäurle, Han
item_t: Hans Bäurle : Skulpturen 1983-2014 : Gross- und Kleinplasticken aus Kunstharz, Bronze, Silber emailliert und GFK Werkverzeichnis 1983-2014.
imprint: Stuttgart : VBKW Verband Bildender Künstler und Künstlerinnen Württenberg, 2016.
public_note: Issued in an edition of 300 copies.  The publication catalogues the artist's sculptures in plastic resin, silver enamel, bronze, and fiberglass.  Chiefly illustrations.

name: Becerra, Milton
item_t: Analisis de un proceso en el tiempo : obras de Milton Becerra.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné is arranged chronologically, and all works are illustrated in color. There are essays on Becerra's works by Santiago B. Olmo and Virginia Pérez-Ratton.

name: Beckmann, Max
item_t: Max Beckmann : die Skizzenbücher : The Sketchbooks.
public_note: Complete catalogue of the artist's 55 surviving sketchbooks, all illustrated (44 of which are in the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C.). The catalogue lists over 1,300 bound-in pages and approximately 100 separate sheets. Each sketchbook is introduced with a brief essay describing its theme and contents.

name: Bedel, Jacque
item_t: Jacques Bedel : aproximaciones.
public_note:
The catalogue was issued in connection with an exhibition at the Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes in Buenos Aires.  The publication includes a catalogue raisonné of Bedel's work from 1967-2008.

Introductory material includes chapters on the works of the period 2005-2008, a documentary section with a biography, list of prizes and commendations, solo and group exhibitions, and a bibliography.

name: Bazzani, Giuseppe
item_t: Giuseppe Bazzani e la linea d'ombra dell' arte lombarda.
author: Caroli, Flavio
public_note: Half-title is "Giuseppe Bazzani,  l'opera completa."

name: Bazille, Frédéric
item_t: Frédéric Bazille et les débuts de l'impressionisme : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint.
author: Daulte, François
public_note: Contains a separate catalogue of Bazille's copies after other artists.

name: Bellucci, Antonio
item_t: Antonio Bellucci : catalogo ragionato.
author: Magani, Fabrizio
illustrations: over 141 b&w ills., ca.42 color plates
public_note: The preliminary section of the monograph traces the career of the young soldier turned artist, his beginnings in Venice; his career in Austria, Dusseldorf and England, and his final return to Venice.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is a chronology, a bibliography, and indices of the works, names and locations.

name: Bayser-Gratry, Marguerite de
item_t: Marguerite de Bayser-Gratry (1881-1975), femme sculpteur.
author: Michel, Jessie
public_note: Primarily a monograph, this work contains a summary catalogue raisonné, arranged by subject.  Publication is based upon the author's MA thesis at the University of Lille III.

name: Bayeu y Subías, Francisco
item_t: Francisco Bayeu : vida y obra.
author: Morales y Marin, José Luis
public_note: Includes a catalogue of missing and destroyed works arranged by subject. Documental appendix contains excerpts from the artist's letters and 1796 inventory.

name: Bazille, Frédéric
item_t: Bazille : catalogue raisonné : supplément 2.
author: Schulman, Michel
public_note: The author has made the full text available on his website. See full text link on this page.

name: Bazille, Frédéric
item_t: Frédéric Bazille : supplément au catalogue raisonné.
author: Schulman, Michel
public_note: The supplement is available on the author's website. See full text link on this page.  Newly added works are illustrated in color.

name: Bayer, Herbe
item_t: Herbert Bayer : The Complete Work.
author: Cohen, Arthur A.
public_note: Bayer himself served as art director for this comprehensive volume, which also includes some of his selected writings and statements.  The publication is a monographic study that discusses Bayer's complete oeuvre, but not all works are illustrated.

name: Bayes, Gilbe
item_t: Gilbert Bayes : Sculptor, 1872-1953.
author_s:
Irvine, Louise (catalogue)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Atterbury, Paul                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Read, Benedict (intro)
public_note: The exhibition history is derived from the artist's notebooks. Catalogue also includes 17 works cited as by Bayes, but whose present whereabouts are unknown.

name: Baumgartner, Christiane
item_t: Christiane Baumgartner : White Noise.
author_s:
Rümelin, Christian                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Burg, Tobias                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Museum Kunstpalast                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Musée d'art et d'histoire
public_note: This publication offers the first catalogue raisonné of the artist's engraved work, established by Christian Rümelin with the artist's assistance.

name: Baur, Georg Ignatiu
item_t: Georg Ignatius Baur : kürfurstlicher Hofgoldschmied in Augsburg.
author_s:
Schommers, Annette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Frey, Hilde                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Seelig, Lorenz
public_note: This publication has introductory essays and a biography, followed by numerous sections organized by object type, including many liturgical articles (silver altars, crucifixes & candlesticks, monstrances, etc), plus other decorative works including lighting fixtures, and items for secular use.

name: Baur, Johann Wilhelm
item_t: Johann Wilhelm Baur (1607-1642) : ein Wegbereiter der barocken Kunst in Deutschland.
author: Bonnefoit, Regine
public_note: Revision of the author's dissertation, presented at the Universität Heidelberg, 1995.

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister : Werkverzeichnis der Zeichnungen, Gouachen und Collagen.
ind_entr_cont: An online supplement for the drawings was issued in 2017, v. listing in this database.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.; Comments

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister : Life and Work.
author: Grohmann, Will
public_note:
An early monograph, translated from the original 1963 German, frequently cited as a basic reference to the artist's work. It lists 1692 works, and contains an illustrated checklist of paintings plus illustrations of the artist's signature.

See also the more recently published 2002 catalogue raisonné (listing 2200 works) by Peter Beye and Felicitas Baumeister (cited in this database).

name: Baum, Paul
item_t: Paul Baum (1859-1932) : ein Leben als Landschaftsmaler.
author_s:
Hitzeroth, Wolfram                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hitzeroth, Carl                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schmidt, Ulrich

name: Baumann, Hans Theodo
item_t: Hans-Theo Baumann : Kunst & Design, 1950-2010 = Hans-Theo Baumann : Art & Design, 1950-2010.
public_note:
Following a brief biographical essay on the artist, the catalogue raisonné covers Baumann's designs for furniture, glass, interior designs, tableware, textiles, plastics, wood, and lighting. 

In the artist's preface to the catalogue, he notes mentions that the present catalogue raisonné is not complete.

name: Bauknecht, Philipp
item_t: Philipp Bauknecht 1884-1933 : Verzeichnis der Gemälde = Inventory of Paintings.
imprint: Davos : Galerie Iris Wazzau ; Künzelsau : Swiridoff Verlag, 2016.
public_note: The publication is bilingual in German and English.

name: Baumann, Gustave
item_t: In a Modern Rendering : The Color Woodcuts of Gustave Baumann.
author: Chamberlain, Gala
public_note: This is the first complete catalogue of  the artist's printed works, and includes essays by Nancy Green and Thomas Leech.  Preliminary texts include discussions of the artist's techniques and studio practices.

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister zum 100. Geburtstag : die Serigraphien.
author: Reinhardt, Brigitte
public_note:
This catalogue was issued on the occasion of an exhibition of the artist's screenprints held at the Galerie der Stadt Stuttgart (22 March-14 May 1989). Carola Nerbel, Dieter Scholz and Paul Sigel contributed to the publication.
See also the catalogue raisonné of the artist's printed work: "Willi Baumeister : Werkkatalog der Druckgraphik" (cited in this database).

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister : Werkkatalog der Gemälde.
public_note:
The present publication greatly expands, and has a concordance to, Willi Grohmann's 1963 monograph on the artist. The first volume contains a biography, a list of exhibitions, and the bibliography. The second volume contains the catalogue raisonné of paintings, listing 2,200 works with illustrations, plus 16 photographs of the artist's studio.

Entries give number, title, medium and support, dimensions, signature, collection, provenance, auctions when known, references, exhibition information, some commentary with annotations and discussion of thematic issues (with cross references to the catalogues by Spielmann and Ponert, cited in this database).

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister : Werkkatalog der Druckgraphik.
public_note: The catalogue contains lithographs, collotypes, serigraphs, etchings, linocuts, and posters. Also includes a catalogue of woodcuts by Hap Grieshaper after Baumeister.

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister. Werkverzeichnis der Zeichnungen & Nachträge [online]
author_s:
Gauss, Ulrike                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gutbrod, Krista Baumeister                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Baumeister, Felicitas
cronology: The "Werk Liste" gives access to the list, the series, and the supplement. Catalogue entries provide information on dimensions, support and medium, descriptions, current collection, provenance, remarks, and last update.  The authors note that many of the illustrations are from the Archiv Baumeister im Kunstmuseum Stuttgart, and are of varying quality.  Poor quality images will be replaced as new images become available.
ind_entr_cont: This is an online update to the previous 1988 publication on the artist's drawings, gouaches, collages, and watercolors (See entry listed in this database).  The online edition, complied under the aegis of the Willi Baumeister Stiftung, has added over 200 new drawings to the artist's oeuvre, which are listed with new catalogue numbers.
public_note: check_needed

name: Baumeister, Will
item_t: Willi Baumeister : Werkverzeichnis der Skizzenbücher = Catalogue Raisonné of the Sketchbooks.
public_note:
Issued under the series: "Schriften des Archiv Baumeister im Kunstmuseum Stuttgart, Bd. 2." 

47 sketchbooks containing 490 images are inventoried dating from 1913-1955. A chapter by Felicitas Baumeister provides important contextual references for her father's work.

name: Baxter, Iain
item_t: IAINBAXTER&raisonnE.
cronology: The IAINBAXTER&raissonnE is an electronic collection, virtual exhibition, and a research environment that documents the life work of the Canadian conceptual artist. It is developed with the artist and a team of interdisciplinary scholars
public_note: check_needed

name: Bazzaro, Leonardo
item_t: Leonardo Bazzaro : catalogo ragionato delle opere.
public_note:
Appendices include a list of exhibitions, a bibliography, plus name and work indices.  
There is a biographical essay by Elisabetta Chiodini.

name: Bazille, Frédéric
item_t: Frédéric Bazille, 1841-1870, catalogue raisonné : peintures, dessins, pastels, aquarelles; sa vie, son oeuvre, sa correspondance.
author: Schulman, Michel
imprint: Paris : Éditions de l'amateur and Éditions des catalogues raisonnés, 1995.
public_note: The publication includes a fully documented biography and a catalogue raisonné. The chronological catalogue lists drawings from Bazille's albums and extant sketchbooks, as well as the painted works. There are also listings of missing and unknown works, as well as erroneous attributions. There is a section of  selected correspondence (some 299 letters).

name: Bauchant, André
item_t: André Bauchant : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: Text in French and English.

name: Bauchant, André
item_t: André Bauchant : addenda du catalogue raisonné.
author: Vierny, Dina
public_note: This is a supplement to the original first edition of the catalogue raisonné listed also in this database.

name: Battaglia, Carlo
item_t: Carlo Battaglia : catalogo ragionato = Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The bilingual catalogue raisonné lists approximately 400 paintings on canvas and on paper.  There is a biography, a register of works, and interviews with the artist. There is also a separate section on Battaglia's writings.

name: Batoni, Pompeo
item_t: Pompeo Batoni : A Complete Catalogue of His Paintings.
author: Bowron, Edgar Peters

name: Batoni, Pompeo
item_t: Pompeo Batoni : A Complete Catalogue of His Works, with an Introductory Text.
author_s:
Clark, Anthony M.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bowron, Edgar Peters (editor)
imprint: New York : New York University Press, 1985.
public_note: This study includes lists of works wrongly attributed to the artist, as well as paintings that remain untraced. There is a separate catalogue of unverified paintings that are generally attributed to Batoni, but which the author was unable to examine personally.

name: Bastien-Lepage, Jule
item_t: Jules Bastien-Lepage, 1848-1884. Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre.
author: Aubrun, Marie-Madeleine
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists over 800 authentic works (370 paintings, 400 drawings, and 34 prints), arranged chronologically.  Undated works are listed in the appendix.

name: Bassano, Jacopo
item_t: Jacopo Bassano.
author: Ballarin, Alessandro
illustrations: More than 1,366 b&w, plus some color
public_note:
Within the series "Pittura del Rinascimento nell'Italia settentrionale," this catalogue was issued by the Dipartimento di Storia delle Arti visive e della Musica, Università di Padova. Volume 2 contains the catalogue raisonné.

Five volumes were projected in this series, of which only the first two have appeared to date 
(v.3 was intended to cover new research, v.4 was to cover the career of the Bassano family in Venice, v.5 was to cover painting in Venice 1527-1548).

name: Baskin, Leonard
item_t: The Complete Prints of Leonard Baskin : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1948-1983.
author_s:
Fern, Alan Maxwell                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            O'Sullivan, Judith                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hughes, Ted (intro.)
public_note: Includes addenda, biographical notes, honors and awards, solo exhibitions, public collections housing the artist's works, bibliography, and index.

name: Basquiat, Jean-Michel
item_t: Jean-Michel Basquiat.
author_s:
Pfeffer-Lévy, Géraldine (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schorr, Lenore                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marshall, Richard D.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Prat, Jean-Louis
public_note: The publishers reissued the 2000 edition (See entry in this database) with the addition of an Appendix, and presented it as a 3-volume slipcased set, with the same ISBN number.

name: Basquiat, Jean-Michel
item_t: Jean-Michel Basquiat.
author_s:
Schorr, Lenore                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marshall, Richard D.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Prat, Jean-Louis et al.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pfeffer-Lévy, Géraldine
public_note: An earlier edition was issued in Paris in 1996 by Galerie Enrico Navarra, with English/French texts. This edition (called the 3rd by the publishers) is enlarged and revised, with an introduction by Enrico Navarra.

name: Basquiat, Jean-Michel
item_t: Jean-Michel Basquiat : Works on Paper.
author_s:
Blistène, Bernard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Ochoa, Elena                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Thompson, Robert Farris                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marshall, Richard D.
public_note: This includes a preface by Enrico Navarra.  The text is a translation of the French "Oeuvres sur papier" (Galerie Enrico Navarra, 1999). The catalogue lists 148 authentic drawings and mixed media works on paper.

name: Bartscher, Philipp Ferdinand Ludwig
item_t: Feine Möbel aus Westfalen : die Manufaktur des Rietberger Hofmalers Philipp Ferdinand Ludwig Bartscher (1749 bis 1823).
public_note: Volume 22 from the series 'Schriften des Westfälisches Freilichtmuseums Detmold,  Landesmuseum für Volkskunde.'

name: Barye, Antoine-Lou
item_t: Le peintre-graveur illustré (XIXe et XXe siècles).
author: Delteil, Loys

name: Bartolo di Fred
item_t: The Sienese Trecento Painter Bartolo di Fredi.
author: Harpring, Patricia
imprint: Rutherford, NJ : Fairleigh Dickinson University Press ; London ; Cranbury, NJ : Associated University Presses, 1993.
public_note: This is a monograph with a separete checklist of autograph paintings. The catalogue lists 50 authentic works, numerous paintings executed by the artist's workshop, and rejected works. The catalogue also includes an illustrated list of tooling patterns found in Fredi's works.

name: Bartolo di Fred
item_t: Bartolo di Fredi Cini : ein Beitrag zür sienesischen Malerei des 14. Jahrhunderts.
public_note: Folded plates in inset pocket.

name: Bartolomeo Veneto
item_t: Bartolomeo Veneto : L'opera completa.
author: Pagnotta, Laura
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné listing over 50 autograph paintings by the artist. The catalogue also includes lost works and paintings known only through documentation.

name: Baselitz, Georg
item_t: Georg Baselitz : pastelle, 1985-1990.
author_s:
Waldman, Diane                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Maurer, Emil                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gohr, Siegfried

name: Bartolini, Lorenzo
item_t: Lorenzo Bartolini.
public_note: Part 2 of the series 'Artisti italiani dell'ottocento.' Volume 1 is a discussion of the artist's life and work. Volume 2 contains the catalogue raisonné as well as a separate catalogue for works of uncertain date.

name: Baruzzi, Cincinnato
item_t: Cincinnato Baruzzi (1796-1878).
author: Mampieri, Antonella
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of principal works, biography, appendices listing extant works, and an index of names.

name: Baselitz, Georg
item_t: Georg Baselitz : Skulpturen.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with the exhibition "Georg Baselitz. 30 Jahre Skulptur" held at the Staatliche Kunsthalle Baden-Baden and the Museum Frieder Burda. The catalogue documents all 58 sculptures created between 1979 and 2008. Along with a biography, this catalogue includes an interview with Baselitz and texts written by the artist.

name: Baselitz, Georg
item_t: Baselitz : peintre-graveur : Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik.
author: Jahn, Fred
illustrations: v.1: 184 b&w, 7 color; v.2: 428 b&w, 9 color

name: Bartholomé, Albe
item_t: Albert Bartholomé : 1848-1928.
author_s:
Burollet, Thérèse                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Gourand, Nicolas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            de Caso, Jacques (preface)
public_note: The catalogue also has several appendices including: portraits of the artist, signatures, texts by Bartholomé, a section on his collection and library, poems about the author and his work, exhibitions from 1879 to 1937, and a list of works found in museums and public collections.  There is also a genealogy of the artist's family, a list of archives in France and abroad, and a repertory of letters.

name: Baselitz, Georg
item_t: Georg Baselitz : peintre-graveur - Werkverzeichnis der Druckgraphik Band III. 1983-1989.
imprint: Munich : Galerie Sabine Knust ; Cologne : Snoeck Verlagsgesellschaft.
ind_entr_cont: The individual entries include title, materials, dimensions, edition information, references, and collection.  Many works are illustrated in color.
public_note: Comments

name: Barye, Antoine-Lou
item_t: The Barye Bronzes : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Pivar, Stuart
public_note:
The catalogue was originally published in 1974; reprinted in 1981 and 1990. The 1990 edition includes new illustrations and additional information, including notes on a handful of uncatalogued pieces.  

The catalogue was compiled based on sales catalogues used at Barye's various workshops, particularly the Catalogue Quai des Celestins, 4, which is included as an appendix.

name: Barye, Antoine-Lou
item_t: Les aquarelles de Barye, étude critique et catalogue raisonné.
author: Zieseniss, Charles Otto
imprint: Paris : Librairie Centrale des Beaux-Arts, C. Massin, 1954.
public_note: This catalogue of Barye's  watercolors includes extensive critical commentary on the artist and his work. Essays on style and technique precede the catalogue.

name: Barye, Antoine-Lou
item_t: Barye.
author: Mannoni, Edith
public_note: This catalogue raisonné compiles not only Barye's bronzes, but also his watercolors and drawings.

name: Barye, Antoine-Lou
item_t: Barye : catalogue raisonné des sculptures.
public_note: The Appendices contain Barye's post-mortem inventory, a list of bronzes sold by Émile Martin (1850-1857), as well as examples of signatures and stamps found in Barye's works.

name: Barthélemy, Camille
item_t: Camille Barthélemy, 1890-1961 : catalogue raisonné de l'œuvre peint et dessiné.
author: Martin, André
imprint: Virton, Belgium : Editions du Musée gaumais, 2002.
public_note:
The catalogue is organized as follows: Undated juvenile and Academy works; Dated works (oils, works on paper, monotypes, etc) arranged by year; Undated works classified by subject; and Undated drawings.  

There is also a section on "Uncatalogued works" which includes artworks known only from pre-WWII sources.  The author states that, if found, these works will be included in a supplement.

name: Barragán, Lu
item_t: Barragán : The Complete Works.
author_s:
Rispa, Raúl (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barragán, Luis                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Buendía, José María (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fernández, Antonio Toca (essay)
public_note:
This was originally published in Spain by Tanais Arquitetura on the occasion of the circulating exhibition organized by the Spanish Ministry of Public Works, Transport, and Environment and the Mexico City College of Architects: Madrid, Lisbon, Mexico City, and elsewhere. 
English language editions had varying imprints; a "revised edition" was also published by Princeton Architectural Press, New York, 2003.

name: Barraud, Maurice
item_t: Catalogue illustré de l'oeuvre gravé et lithographié de Maurice Barraud.

name: Barns-Graham, Wilhelmina
item_t: The Prints of Wilhelmina Barns-Graham : A Complete Catalogue.
author: Gunn, Ann V.
public_note: Catalogue of the artist's etchings, linocuts, lithographs, screen-printings and monotypes. Entries contain information on editions and print states.

name: Barooshian, Martin
item_t: Martin Barooshian : A Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints : 1948-1970.
author_s:
Russo, Michael J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Faxon, Susan (foreword)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Barooshian, Martin
imprint: Stoneham, MA : SPAAH, Society for the Preservation of American Artistic Heritage, 2019.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné lists all of the artist's etchings, engravings and woodcuts up to 1970.

name: Barnet, Will
item_t: Will Barnet : Catalogue Raisonné, 1931-2005, Etchings, Lithographs, Woodcuts, Serigraphs.
public_note:
The publication includes 223 works, including 70 works not cited in Sylvan Cole's catalogue of the graphic works (see entry cited in this database).   

There are alphabetical and chronological indices of the prints.

name: Barnet, Will
item_t: Will Barnet : Etchings, Lithographs, Woodcuts, Serigraphs, 1932-1972; Catalogue Raisonné.
imprint: New York : Associated American Artists Gallery, 1972.
public_note: The catalogue is published in conjunction with a retrospective exhbition held at the Associated American Artists Gallery.  It includes a supplement to the catalogue raisonné in the cover pocket.

name: Barlach, Ern
item_t: Ernst Barlach : Werkverzeichnis : Werkkatalog der Zeichnungen.
author: Schult, Friedrich
public_note: Individual entries include title, date, collection, signature information, exhibitions, references, and some notes.

name: Barker, Clive
item_t: Clive Barker : Sculpture : Catalogue Raisonné 1958-2000.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 440 sculptures. The catalogue was compiled with the assistance of the artist.

name: Barlach, Ern
item_t: Ernst Barlach : Werkverzeichnis : Das graphische Werk.
author: Schult, Friedrich
public_note: The appendix contains variants and related works, and lists examples of Barlach's signatures.  There is also a chronology, bibliography, and a name index.

name: Barendsz, Dirck
item_t: Dirck Barendsz, 1534-1592.
author: Judson, J. Richard
imprint: Amsterdam : Van Gendt; New York : distributed by Abner Schram, 1970.
public_note: Includes a transcription and English translation of Carl van Mander's (Schilder-Boek, 1603-4) entry on Barendsz. The catalogue also lists works previously attributed to Barendsz that are no longer accepted.

name: Balthu
item_t: Balthus : Catalogue Raisonné of the Complete Works.
imprint: Paris : Éditions Gallimard ; New York : distributed by Harry N. Abrams, 1999.
public_note: Authorized by the artist, the publication contains translations from the French language edition (ISBN 2070114619). The catalogue raisonné includes paintings, drawings (about 1000), sketchbooks, book illustrations and literary texts, theater designs, doodles and caricatures, and sculpture.  The publication also reproduces examples of the artist's signature.

name: Barbari, Jacopo de'
item_t: Jacopo de' Barbari and Northern Art of the Early Sixteenth Century.
author: Levenson, Jay
public_note: Originally presented as the author's dissertation presented at New York University in 1978.  In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes essays on the artist's life, historiography, stylistic development, and artistic influence.

name: Ban, Shigeru
item_t: Shigeru Ban : Complete Works, 1985-2010.
illustrations: b&w & color ills., some color plates, plans
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was compiled in cooperation with the artist. The publication includes all of the architect's built works until 2010.  The introductory texts are in English, German and French.

name: Barbari, Jacopo de'
item_t: Jacopo de' Barbari : Künstlerschaft und Hofkultur um 1500.
author: Böckem, Beate
public_note: Published in the series : "Studien zur Kunst", 32.

name: Balen, Hendrik van, I
item_t: Hendrick van Balen (1575-1632). Ein Antwerpener Kabinettbildmaler der Rubenszeit.
author: Werche, Bettina
public_note: Within the series "Pictura Nova, VII. Studies in 16th- and 17th-century Flemish Painting and Drawing." The current publication is a revision of the author's dissertation, presented at Friedrich-Wilhelms University, 1992.

name: Balkenhol, Stephan
item_t: Stephan Balkenhol : Werkverzeichnis der Bronze-Editionen 1992-2014.
author_s:
Balkenhol, Stephan                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Franzke, Andreas                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wolff, Ulrich
imprint: Mönchengladbach : Galerie Löhrl : B. Kuhlen Verlag, 2014.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the artist's bronze editions was published on the occasion of an exhibiton at Galerie Löhrl, Mönchengladbach.

name: Balla, Giacomo
item_t: Balla.
author: Lista, Giovanni
public_note: Exhaustively illustrated.

name: Balkenhol, Stephan
item_t: Stephan Balkenhol Druckgraphik und Photo-Editionen : Werkverzeichnis (1987-2015).
author_s:
Dobke, Dirk                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Priess, Holger                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Eger, Dietmar

name: Baratta, Giovanni di Isidoro
item_t: Giovanni Baratta, 1670-1747 : scultura e industria del marmo tra la Toscana et le corti d'Europa.
author: Freddolini, Francesco
public_note: Published as part of the series "LermArte"; n.10.  The publication includes a discussion of the artist's career and the early 18th-century market for sculpture.  This is followed by the catalogue raisonné.

name: Barlach, Ern
item_t: Ernst Barlach : Werkverzeichnis : Das plastische Werk.
author: Schult, Friedrich
public_note:
This new edition is an unrevised offprint of the original 1960 edition.  The catalogue lists 493 sculptures by the artist, all illustrated with black and white plates.   

There is an index of names, an alphabetical list of titles, and a list of collections housing Barlach's works. There are also excerpts from documents relating to the artist's life and work.

name: Barlach, Ern
item_t: Katalog der Zeichnungen / Katalog der Taschenbücher und Skizzenhefte.
author_s:
Laur, Elisabeth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wittboldt, Annette                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Probste, Volker (ed.)
public_note: The second part lists all known paperbacks and sketchbooks from 1888 to the early 1930s, covering over 11,000 sketches.

name: Barlach, Ern
item_t: Das plastische Werk.
author_s:
Laur, Elisabeth                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Probst, Volker                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bubrowski, Ulrich
public_note: For some entries, information is also provided regarding plasters, stuccos, further versions, related works, notes, and casts.

name: Barocci, Federico
item_t: Federico Barocci : Urbino, 1535-1612.
author: Emiliani, Andrea
imprint: Ancona : Il lavoro editoriale : Ars Books, 2008.
public_note: This revised and expanded catalogue raisonné lists approximately 120 works by the artist, arranged chronologically.

name: Barlach, Ern
item_t: Die Druckgraphik.
public_note: There is an alphabetical title index and a concordance with Schult's 1958 catalogue raisonné (cited in this database).

name: Barocci, Federico
item_t: Federico Barocci (Urbino, 1535-1612).
author: Emiliani, Andrea
public_note:
Monograph with a catalogue raisonné of 65 paintings. Catalogue entries discuss and illustrate drawings and other preparatory studies for the paintings. A checklist at the end of vol. 2 provides the bibliographic information for individual entries. The publication also lists several lost works, as well as paintings executed by Barocci's studio and other followers.

A revised and expanded edition was published by Ars Books in 2008 (see entry cited in this database).

name: Barra, Didie
item_t: François De Nomé e Didier Barra : l'enigma Monsù Desiderio.
author: Nappi, Maria Rosaria
public_note: Individual entries contain: provenance, bibliog. and comments

name: Baldung,  Han
item_t: Die Gemälde de Hans Baldung Grien.
author: Terey, Gabor von
public_note: The edition was originally issued as unbound plates contained in two portfolios.

name: Baldung,  Han
item_t: Verzeichniss der Gemälde des Hans Baldung Gen. Grien.
author: Terey, Gabriel von
public_note: A second edition was issued in 1896–1899 in two volumes, with unbound plates contained in two portfolios. The catalogue is organized by present location.

name: Baldung,  Han
item_t: Hans Baldung Grien, das graphische Werk : vollständiger Bildkatalog der Einzelholzschnitte, Buchillustrationen und Kupferstiche.
imprint: Unterschneidheim, Germany : Verlag Dr. Alfons Uhl, 1978.
public_note: This is a catalogue of the woodcuts, book illustrations and engravings. The preface is by Eric Ganzenmüller. Issued under the aegis of Stadtgeschichtlichen Museen Nürnberg, Kulturministerium Baden-Württemberg, and Stadt Schwäbisch Gmünd.

name: Baldung,  Han
item_t: Die Zeichnungen Hans Baldung Grien.
author: Koch, Carl
public_note: The artist's 252 works are illustrated in chronological order (beginning with Nuremburg, 1503-1508/9); also 31 copies and false attributions are illustrated.  The publication includes several concordances, including one for the Karlsruhe Sketchbook. Works are indexed by location.

name: Balassi, Mario
item_t: Mario Balassi, 1604-1667 : catalogo completo dei dipinti e dei disegni.

name: Baldessari, R.M. (Roberto Marcello)
item_t: R. M. Baldessari, opere futuriste.
public_note:
A chronological listing of the artist's futurist works (1916-1937), including a section on the engraved works.  
Known works are illustrated in color in the first part of the book, these are repeated with full entry information in the catalogue raisonné section, along with illustrations of works known only from period photographs.

name: Balande, Gaston
item_t: Gaston Balande, 1880-1971 : sa vie, son oeuvre, catalogue raisonné = His Life, His Work, Descriptive Catalogue.
author: Association des amis de Gaston Balande
illustrations: 640 in c.r.; 90 ills. in text (mostly color)
public_note: The first volume of the catalogue lists 640 authentic paintings on canvas.

name: Bak, Schmuel
item_t: Samuel Bak Catalogue Raisonné [online].
cronology: The catalogue raisonné includes over 8,000 works (paintings, drawings, collages, graphic works, sculpture, and studies).  It can be searched chronologically, by medium and by subject.  There is a separate tab for destroyed works. There is also a bibliography, a list of collections housing the artist's works, a chronology, and an exhibition list.
ind_entr_cont: The entries give title, description and signature, literature, exhibition information, date, provenance, technique and support, and dimensions.  Most works are illustrated with scalable color images.  Catalogue raisonné numbers have not yet been assigned for the listed works.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Balden, Theo
item_t: Theo Balden, 1904-1995 : Skulpturen.
public_note:
This was published in conjunction with the exhibition "Theo Balden - Facetten eines Lebenswerkes. Skulpturen und Zeichnungen" held at the Kunsthalle Erfurt.

The introductory materials include a foreword, essays on Balden's works, the artist's relationship with nature, and a brief biography of his life, with information on his life as an émigré from Germany during WWII.

name: Bak, Schmuel
item_t: Return to Vilna : In the Art of Samuel Bak.
author_s:
Langer, Lawrence L.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bak, Samuel                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pucker, Bernard H. (afterward)
imprint: Boston : Pucker Art Publications ; Syracuse, NY : Distributed by Syracuse University Press, 2007.
public_note: The current publication was produced in response to a 2001 retrospective exhibition of Bak's work held at the National Museum of Lithuania in Vilnius, the artist's birthplace.

name: Baldessari, John
item_t: John Baldessari : A Catalogue Raisonné of Prints and Multiples, 1971-2007.
imprint: Manchester, VT : Hudson Hills Press : Distributed in the United States and Canada by National Book Network, Inc., 2009.

name: Baird, Edward
item_t: Portrait of a Young Scotsman : A Life of Edward Baird, 1904-1949.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Fleming Collection, London.

The appendix includes a personal memoir of Edward Baird based on a 1981 lecture given by the artist James McIntosh Patrick.

name: Badiali, Carla
item_t: Carla Badiali : catalogo generale.
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné of approximately 500 works, the publication includes a biography and a discussion of the artist's work.

name: Badmin, Stanley Roy
item_t: S.R. Badmin RWS : Paintings, Drawings & Prints.
author_s:
Beeetles, Chris                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Nickerson, Fiona                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Wootton, David
public_note: The catalogue also includes lists of works by the artist in Royal Society Exhibitions, and a list of his illustrated books.

name: Bachelier, Jean Jacque
item_t: Jean-Jacques Bachelier (1724-1806) : peintre du roi et de Madame de Pompadour.
public_note: Published on the occasion of an exhibition held at the Musée Lambinet de Versailles. The catalogue raisonné lists approximately 180 authentic paintings and drawings; not all are illustrated. There are separate catalogues of doubtful and rejected works.

name: Bacon, Franc
item_t: Francis Bacon.
public_note: The catalogue covers only the artist's works up to 1963, listed for the most part in chronological order (See also the 2016 catalogue raisonné issued under the aegis of the Francis Bacon Estate, cited in this database).

name: Bacon, Franc
item_t: Francis Bacon : oeuvre graphique = The Graphic Work : Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of 36 engravings, posthumous aquatints, lithographs, and offset reproductions. 

The publication is bilingual and all works are reproduced in color.  In addition to important texts, it includes previously unpublished photographs and a biography.

name: Bacon, Franc
item_t: Francis Bacon : Catalogue Raisonné.

name: Badalocchio, Sisto
item_t: Sisto Badalocchio.
author_s:
Pirondini, Massimo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Berti, Giuseppe                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Monducci, Elio
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, there is a biographical essay on Badalocchi and a documentary chronology of the artist's life.

name: Bagnoli, Marco
item_t: Marco Bagnoli.
author: Celant, Germano
public_note: Although this is not a traditional catalogue raisonné, the  monograph assembles a large number of installations from throughout the artist's career. These are arranged in chronological order, and,as such, provides an in depth representation of his oeuvre from the mid 1970s to the date of publication.

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Enrico Baj dal 1996 al 2003.
author_s:
Crispolti, Enrico                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Marconcini, Paolo                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cerini, Roberta
public_note: This is a continuation of the earlier two volumes on the complete works of Enrico Baj, issued with the collaboration of Enrico Crispolti and published in 1973 and 1997 respectively (v. database).

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Baj : catalogue de l'oeuvre graphique et des multiples = Catalogue of the Graphic Work and Multiples.
author: Petit, Jean

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Catalogo generale delle opere di Enrico Baj dal 1972 al 1996.
author_s:
Crispolti, Enrico                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Corgnati, Martina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cerini, Roberta et al.
public_note: This continues the catalogue raisonné of the complete works of Baj, the first volume edited by Crispolti, is also listed in this database (Bolaffi , Turin, 1973)..

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Baj : catalogo generale delle stampe originali.
author: Petit, Jean (ed.)
public_note: A catalogue raisonné of the original prints, from 1952 to 1986.

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Enrico Baj Dada Impressionist.
author_s:
Lust, Herbert C.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Crispolti, Enrico (ed. cat. rais.)
public_note: Descriptions are in Italian, titles are given in English and Italian.

name: Barocci, Federico
item_t: Federico Barocci.
author: Olsen, Harald
public_note:
This is a second revised edition of the author's original study, first published in 1955. The catalogue raisonné is chronological, and includes paintings and etchings, plus a few comparative drawings; it lists authenticated works, studies, plus drawings not related to known compositions, lost paintings, and erroneous attributions. 
The unknown works are those listed by Bellori or contemporary sources (later attributions appear in another part of the catalogue,) replicas and copies are mentioned.

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Baj : Disegni.
author: Cameron, Dan
public_note: Though lacking the critical apparatus of a catalogue raisonné, this monograph nonetheless presents a comprehensive overview of the artist's drawing oeuvre from 1947 to 1988.  Texts are bilingual, and it includes an essay by the artist.

name: Baldessari, John
item_t: John Baldessari Catalogue Raisonné. Volume Five : 2005-2010.
author_s:
Salle, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dean, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Higgins, Hannah B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pardo, Patrick
public_note: There is also a conversation between Baldessari and the artist David Salle, as well as a critical essay by Hannah B. Higgins.

name: Baj, Enrico
item_t: Baj : libri d'artista /aggiornamento illustrato e elenco generale.
public_note:
This catalogue updates an previous study of the illustrated books by Massimo Mussini ("I libri di Baj", Reggio Emilia, Electa, 1990); it lists all books found in the preceeding work, but only illustrates entries 38-52.
This also contains a concordance to earlier compilations by Jean Petit of the artist's graphic work including the illustrated books (v. database "Catalogue de l'oeuvre graphique et des multiples…", Geneva, 1970-)

name: Baldessari, John
item_t: John Baldessari Catalogue Raisonné. Volume Four : 1994-2004.
author_s:
Pardo, Patrick (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dean, Robert (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Storr, Robert (essay)
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue is chronologically organized. The individual entries include materials, dimensions, exhibition history, literature, and provenance.
public_note: Provenance; Exhib. Hist; Bibliog.

name: Baldessari, John
item_t: John Baldessari Catalogue Raisonné. Volume Three : 1987-1993.
author_s:
Dean, Robert                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Pardo, Patrick                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Fer, Briony (essay)
public_note: Other apparatus includes credit lines as given by current owners, provenance, inscriptions, notes, exhibition information, and abbreviated references.  For complete bibliographic citations, as well as artist's statements, see Backmatter.

name: Baldessari, John
item_t: John Baldessari Catalogue Raisonné. Volume Two : 1975-1986.
public_note: This volume catalogues over 400 works executed between 1975 and 1986, incorporating Baldessari's photo-based works. The publication includes an essay by Hal Foster.  It also includes an exhibition list, chronology, index, and bibliography.

name: Baldessari, John
item_t: John Baldessari Catalogue Raisonné. Volume One : 1956-1974.
public_note: The publication includes an essay by Yve-Alain Bois and an interview with the artist by Christopher Knight. The catalogue raisonné lists approx. 500 works by the artist executed between 1956-1974, which covers entries for the landmark Cremation Project (1970).

name: Baldung,  Han
item_t: Hans Baldung Grien : Gemälde und Dokumente.
author: Osten, Gert von der
public_note: Published in the series: Jahresgabe des Deutschen Vereins für Kunstwissenschaft ; 1981/1982.

name: Bach, Johann Sebastian
item_t: Zwischen Empfindsamkeit und Klassizismus : der Zeichner und Landschaftsmaler Johann Sebastian Bach d.J. (1748-1778) : Oeurvre-Katalog.
public_note:
Grandson of the famous composer of the same name, the catalogue raisonné of the younger Johann Sebastian Bach, presents the artist's complete drawings, prints, and one painting, as well as a register of works known only from documentation.

In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biographical study of the artist. The appendix contains sources, bibliographical references, a name index, and a list of collections housing Bach's works.

name: Baburen, Dirck van
item_t: The Paintings of Dirck van Baburen, ca. 1592/93 - 1624 : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Franits, Wayne
public_note:
From the series "Oculi, Studies in the Arts of the Low Countries". 

The catalogue raisonné lists 42 authentic paintings, 29 works painted in collaboration with other artists, and 5 drawings. The catalogue also includes 14 lost works, 152 rejected attributions, and 10 paintings upon which there is no definitive judgment. It also includes extensive biographical material, a concordance, and a list of authentic paintings by subject. 

In addition an index of paintings, there are also indices of present and previous owners.

name: yón, Belk
item_t: Nkame : Belkis Ayón.
author_s:
Ayón, Katia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vives, Cristina                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mateo, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Menéndez, Lázara
imprint: Madrid : Ediciones Turner ; New York ; Distributed by D.A.P., 2010.

name: Baburen, Dirck van
item_t: Dirck van Baburen (c. 1595- 1624) ; a Dutch Painter in Utrecht and Rome.
author: Slatkes, Leonard J.
public_note:
From the series "Orbis artium; Utrechtse kunsthistorische Studiën."  The publication is expanded from the author's 1962 doctoral thesis.  

The author's article, "Additions to Dirck van Baburen," published in "Album amicorum J. G. van Gelder" (The Hague: 1973): pp. 267-73, supplements the catalogue raisonné.

name: Bacchiacca
item_t: Bachiacca : Artist of the Medici Court.
author: La France, Robert
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of Bachiacca's entire oeuvre, including oil paintings, frescoes, tapestry designs, and drawings. The works have been divided into catagories: those by his hand or done under Bachiacca's supervision; works by followers or members of his family; and works designed by the family before or after Bachiacca's death.

name: Bacchiacca
item_t: Francesco Ubertini Called Il Bacchiacca.
author: Nikolenko, Lada
imprint: Locust Valley, NY : J. J. Augustin, 1966.
public_note:
In addition to the catalogue raisonné of the authentic paintings, there are separate catalogues of paintings attributed to the artist, false attributions, lost paintings, and copies after Bacchiacca.  

Almost all of the approximately 80 authentic paintings are illustrated.

name: vercamp, Hendrick
item_t: Hendrick Avercamp, 1585-1634 : bijgenaamd "De Stomme van Campen" :  en Barent Avercamp 1612-1679, "Schilders tot Campen."
author: Welcker, Clara J.
imprint: Zwolle : De erven J.J. Tijl n.v., 1933.
public_note: A monograph and catalogue raisonné of the two Dutch painters, Hendrick Avercamp and his nephew Barent.  A revised and updated edition was published in 1979 (Doornspijk: Davaco). See entry cited in this database.

name: vercamp, Hendrick
item_t: Hendrick Avercamp, 1585-1634 : bijenaamd "De Stomme Van Campen" : en Barent Avercamp 1612-1679, "Schilders tot Campen".
author_s:
Welcker, Clara J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hensbroek-van der Poel, D.J. (catalogue)
public_note: A revised and expanded edition of the 1933 catalogue raisonné (See entry cited in this database).

name: very, Milton
item_t: Milton Avery : Prints, 1933-1955.
author: Lunn, Harry H., Jr.
public_note: There is an Introduction by Frank Getlein.  The catalogue raisonné lists 60 works by the artist, all illustrated.

name: vati, Mario
item_t: Mario Avati : l'oeuvre gravé.
author_s:
Passeron, Roger                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hoving, Thomas (preface)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Strachan, W.J. (preface)
public_note:
Catalogue raisonné of engravings, etchings and aquatints by the artist. W.J. Strachan wrote the preface to Volume 6.

The catalogue raisonné provides catalogue entry number, title, date, medium, dimensions, edition information (with colors and states mentioned), signature information, and indicates if the plates or stones were cancelled after printing. There is some collection information, but no bibliographical references.

name: utissier, Louis-Marie
item_t: Autissier, miniaturiste, 1772-1830.
author: Lemaire, Lucien
public_note: Subtitle reads, "Avec le portrait du peintre par lui-même et un autographe."  Preface by the Duchesse de Rohan.  A 93-page edition by the same publisher also exists.

name: uriol, George
item_t: George Auriol.
author_s:
Fields, Armond                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Leroy-Crèvecoeur, Marie                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cate, Phillip Dennis (forward)
public_note:
This productive "Japoniste" artist was also a writer and typographical designer. Among other publications, he wrote for, edited and illustrated the journal of the "Chat Noir." (1883-1893).
Catalogue organized chronologically of all works including prints, theater programs, sheet music, book & magazine covers, and Christmas cards.

name: ved, Jacques-André-Joseph
item_t: Le peintre Aved, sa vie et son oeuvre 1702-1766.
author: Wildenstein, Georges
imprint: Paris : Les Beaux-Arts-Éditions d'Études et de Documents, 1922.
public_note: Individual entries include title, dimensions, medium, brief biographical notes on sitters, where the image is reproduced, and related works.

name: uerbach, Frank Helmuth
item_t: Frank Auerbach : The Complete Etchings, 1954-1990.
author: Podro, Michael (intro.)
public_note: The publication includes statements by the artist regarding his life and art.  There is also a chronology of the artist's career.

name: uerbach, Frank Helmuth
item_t: Frank Auerbach.
author: Feaver, William
public_note: Considered the most "comprehensive publication" on the artist to date (book jacket), it contains a catalogue raisonné of all of Auerbach's paintings (excluding those smaller than 22 x 30"), but is without critical apparatus. All the works are illustrated with thumbnail photographs. The publication includes the transcript of the author's interview with the artist, lists of exhibitions and writings, and commentaries by the artist.

name: uer, Hildegard
item_t: Hildegard Auer : A Yearning for Art
author: Heller, Reinhold

name: udubon, John Jame
item_t: The Original Water-color Paintings by John James Audubon for The Birds of America, Reproduced for the First Time in Color from the Collection at the New-York Historical Society.
author_s:
Davidson, Marshall B. (intro.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Audubon, John James
imprint: New York : American Heritage, dist. By Houghton_Mifflin Co, Boston, 1966.
public_note: Entries include plate number, title, descriptions, notes, and references to the Havell edition numbers.

name: udubon, John Jame
item_t: Audubon's Animals : The Quadrupeds of North America.
author: Ford, Alice (ed.)
imprint: New York : Studio Publications, in assc. with Crowell, 1951.
public_note: The illustrations consist of: Figures 1-150  from the Imperial Folio (1845-1848) and Figures 151-156 from the Octavo Edition (1849-1854).

name: ustin, Robe
item_t: Drawings and Prints by Robert Austin : With a Complete Catalogue of His Prints.
author: Cooke, Gordon (essay)
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Fine Art Society in 2001.

name: udubon, John Jame
item_t: The Watercolors for The Birds of America.
author_s:
Blaugrund, Annette B.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Slatkin, Carole Anne (c.r.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Stebbins, Theodore E. (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hotchner, Holly
imprint: New York : Villard Books : New York Historical Society, 1993.
public_note: Entries give title, date, Havell edition plate numbers, size, accession numbers, commentaries and other notes.

name: ugustin, Jean Baptiste Jacque
item_t: Jean-Baptiste Jacques Augustin : 1759-1832 : une nouvelle excellence dans l'art du portrait en miniature
author: Pappe, Bernd
public_note: In addition to the catalogue raisonné, the publication includes a biography of the artist, a discussion of his painting techniques.

name: vercamp, Baren
item_t: Hendrick Avercamp, 1585-1634 : bijgenaamd "De Stomme van Campen" :  en Barent Avercamp 1612-1679, "Schilders tot Campen."
author: Welcker, Clara J.
imprint: Zwolle : De erven J.J. Tijl n.v., 1933.
public_note: A monograph and catalogue raisonné of the two Dutch painters, Hendrick Avercamp and his nephew Barent.  A revised and updated edition was published in 1979 (Doornspijk: Davaco). See entry cited in this database.

name: vercamp, Baren
item_t: Hendrick Avercamp, 1585-1634 : bijenaamd "De Stomme Van Campen" : en Barent Avercamp 1612-1679, "Schilders tot Campen".
author_s:
Welcker, Clara J.                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Hensbroek-van der Poel, D.J. (catalogue)
public_note: A revised and expanded edition of the 1933 catalogue raisonné (See entry cited in this database).

name: xell, Evelyne
item_t: Evelyne Axell : From Pop Art to Paradise = le pop art jusq'au paradis
author: Axell, Evelyn
imprint: Paris : Somogy; Namur : Musée provincial Felicien-Rops, 2004

name: ersee, Christian Ludwig
item_t: Attersee : Werkverzeichnis 1963-1994 und ein monographischer Essay.
author: Gorsen, Peter
public_note: Includes a compact disc entitled "Atterseemusik, Lieder von Wetter und Liebe".

name: lan, Jean-Michel
item_t: Atlan : Catalogue Raisonné of the Complete Works.
author_s:
Polieri, Jacques                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            White, Kenneth (essay)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bonfand, Alain (preface)
public_note: Translation from the French. The catalogue is divided chronologically into the Early Period (1940-1954) and the Classical Period (1955-1960).  There is also a biographical essay by Kenneth White.  The catalogue raisonné of Atlan's complete oeuvre was compiled by Denise Atlan, Camille Atlan and Jacques Polieri.

name: uberjonois, René Victo
item_t: René Auberjonois : l'oeuvre peint = Das gemalte Werk : catalogue des huiles, pastels et peintures sous verre.
author: Wagner, Hugo
imprint: Zurich : Institut suisse pour l'étude de l'art, 1987.

public_note: The catalogue was based on archival documents held at the Stiftung Arp. The present publication, which provides information on editions, forgeries and casting rights for all of Arp's sculptures, is intended as a preliminary catalogue raisonné of the artist's complete works.

This is a catalogue raisonné of the drawings Léonce Angrand's made during his travels through Peru, Chile and Bolivia.  

The publication also includes Angrand's "Carta Sobre los Jardines de Lima" ('Letter Concerning the Gardens of Lima') and the "Cantares Populares" (Popular Songs) compiled by Angrand while in Peru.

There is no separate bibliography; references are cited in the notes.

Die Gemälde 1883-1919" under the auspices of the Schweizerisches Institut für Kunstwissenschaft (see entry in this database).  The texts and catalogue entries are in German, but other information on the site can be viewed in English.

name: mor, Rick
item_t: Rick Amor : An Online Catalogue Raisonné of the Prints.
author: Zdanowicz, Irena
cronology: Catalogue entries feature a central image with thumbnails of all known states below (not all states are illustrated).  Entries provide catalogue number, dates, series, where made, medium, support, dimensions, artist's record no., printers and workshops, exhibition and bibliographic references, collection, commentary, hyperlinks, and edition information.
ind_entr_cont: This is the first launch in an ongoing catalogue of the artist's complete graphic works from 1968-present.  The catalogue currently covers the intaglio prints; the relief prints and lithographs will be added in the future.  The catalogue lists 177 prints and intaglios, plus 900+ states.
