                                                            Kovacek, Michael                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Sternath, Marie Luise
public_note: The present catalogue covers Alt's paintings in oil, and was published in conjunction with Kinsky Kunst Editionen in Vienna.  The publication includes a chronology of Alt's life, bibliography, index, and examples of his signature.

name: ltomonte, Martino
item_t: Martino Altomonte. Mit einem Beitrag "Martino Altomonte als Zeichner und Graphiker."
author_s:
Aurenhammer, Hans                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Aurenhammer, Gertrude (essay on drawings and prints)
public_note: A publication of the Österreichische Galerie, Vienna.

name: loïse
item_t: Aloïse Corbaz (1886–1964). Catalogue raisonné électronique.
cronology:
The online catalogue lists over 1,900 works, all illustrated with scalable color images. The catalogue is organized chronologically, but can also be searched by title, keyword and date. 

Entries include title, date, inscriptions, dimensions, provenance, collection, exhibitions, materials, technique, references, and brief comments.
ind_entr_cont: This catalogue raisonné database was launched in conjunction with the Fondation Aloïse and the Swiss Institute for Art Research (SIK-ISEA).  The database includes a biographical essay; exhibition list, and a selection of sketches, letters and other documents, including critical writings about the artist.
public_note: check_needed

name: lma-Tadema, Sir Lawrence
item_t: The Biography and Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings of Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema.
author: Swanson, Vern G.
imprint: London : Garton & Company, in association with Scolar Press, 1990.
public_note: The publication includes chapters addressing Alma-Tadema's early life, his experiences in Antwerp, Brussels and London, his "integration into English society", and "Italian influences".

name: llston, Washington
item_t: Washington Allston : A Study of the Romantic Artist in America.
author_s:
Richardson, Edgar Preston                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Dana, Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
public_note: The catalogue features essays about the artist's life, artistic development, and theoretical approach.

name: llori, Alessandro
item_t: Alessandro Allori.
author: Lecchini Giovannoni, Simona
public_note: This catalogue raisonné of Raphael's paintings, frescoes, and tapestry series is organized chronologically, and includes lost works. Portraits are treated in a separate section at the end of the catalogue.

name: llar, André Joseph
item_t: Vie et oeuvre du sculpteur André Allar, 1845-1926 : catalogue raisonné.
author: Noet, Laurent
public_note: Monograph and catalogue raisonné.

name: llston, Washington
item_t: The Drawings of Washington Allston : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Bolton, Kenyon Castle

name: lix, Yve
item_t: Yves Alix, 1890-1969 : catalogue de l'oeuvre gravé.
author: Lefèvre, Sophie

name: ligny, Théodore Caruelle d'
item_t: Théodore Caruelle d'Aligny, 1798-1871 : catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre peint, dessiné, gravé.
author: Aubrun, Marie-Madeleine
public_note: Extensive catalogue of Caruelle d'Aligny's paintings, drawings, prints. Dated works are mostly catalogued in chronological order with undated material organized iconographically. Auction records are included, as well as photographs of key documents pertinent to the artist's biography.

name: lgardi, Alessandro
item_t: Alessandro Algardi.
author: Montagu, Jennifer
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, in association with the J. Paul Getty Trust, 1985.
public_note:
Catalogue of the artist's sculpture and other projects, organized by subject. The catalogue includes all works the author belives to be authentic and includes lost works, sculptures known only through the documentation, and ephemeral works. There is a separate catalogue of 59 rejected sculptures.

The publication includes checklists of accepted and rejected drawings. Vol. 2 includes a transcription of Algardi's will and inventory.

name: lix, Yve
item_t: L'oeuvre peint de Yves Alix (1890-1969) : peintre-graveur : les peintures à l'huile : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné of the oil paintings is organized by subject.

name: llen, Harry Epworth
item_t: Harry Epworth Allen (1894-1958) : Catalogue of His Works.
author_s:
Basford, John                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Naylor, David                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Earnshaw, Steve
public_note: The publication is limited to 500 copies.  In addition ot the catalogue, there is a biography of the artist, sections dealing with scrapbooks, documents and signatures, and a bibliography.

name: lfieri, Attilio
item_t: Attilio Alfieri : Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Sansone, Luigi
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue features essays about the artist's life and career.

name: lfaro, Andreu
item_t: Andreu Alfaro : catálogo razonado.
author: Jarque, Vicente
public_note: The second volume is dedicated to public sculptures realized in the last fifteen years. The catalogue is accompanied by extracts of conversations between Alfaro and the author discussing specific themes which distinguish the artist's work.

name: lechinsky, Pierre
item_t: Pierre Alechinsky : les estampes de 1946 à 1972.
author: Rivière, Yves
public_note: The catalogue comprised solely of images.

name: lbertinelli, Mariotto
item_t: The Works of Mariotto Albertinelli.
author: Borgo, Ludovico
public_note: The book is based on the author's dissertation, presented at Harvard University in 1968.  The catalogue raisonné includes paintings produced in partnership with Fra Bartolomeo and rejected attributions. Appendicies contain transcriptions of documents related to the artist's life and work, in Italian and Latin.

name: kers, Benjamin Paul
item_t: A New Review of the Career of Paul Akers, 1825-1861.
author: Miller, William B.
imprint: Colby Library Quarterly, Series 7, No. 7, March 1966.
public_note: Miller's article is not a catalogue raisonné per se, but provides a complete listing of works known as of the date of publication.  In addition to a brief biography of the artist, the article includes an unillustrated checklist of Aker's works (including unrealized works) in all media (plasters, medallions and marble).  There is also a list of works the author calls  "Copywork".

name: lechinsky, Pierre
item_t: Alechinsky, les affliches : catalogue raisonné.
public_note: Catalogue raisonné of 165 posters, all illustrated. All works are reproduced with dimensions, materials, information regarding editions, and publishers.

name: lberti, Leon Battista
item_t: Leon Battista Alberti : The Complete Works.
author: Borsi, Franco
public_note: There have been previous publications of this title, an Italian edition was issued by Electa in 1975; English language editions were subsequently published  by Phaidon Press (London) and Harper & Row (New York)  respectively in 1977.

name: lbrizzi, Enrico
item_t: Enrico Albrici.
author: Baroncelli, Marie Adelaide
public_note: "Estratto da 'I pittori bergamaschi', Il Settecento, Volume III".   This study includes a biography, a register of works, excerpts from critical reviews, a bibliography, and a list of color plates.

name: eppli, Eva
item_t: Eva Aeppli, Werkverzeichnis.
author_s:
Gyger, Susanne                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Schweizerisches Institut für Kunstwissenschaft (SIK-ISEA)
cronology: The catalogue can be searched by title, date and keyword. Individual entries include title, date, medium, signature information, exhibition history, provenance, bibliography, edition information, and comments.
ind_entr_cont:
This is a chronological online catalogue raisonné of the artist's total output, covering paintings, bronzes, textile figure sculptures, works on paper, and graphic works. Almost all works are illustrated.  Lost and destroyed works are included; works not viewed by the author in person are indicated.

The catalogue is published under the aegis of the SIK-ISEA and was compiled in cooperation with the artist.

The catalogue includes a brief biography of the artist, and a documents section with archival photographs and selected examples of the artist's correspondence.
public_note: check_needed

name: lbers, Ann
item_t: The Prints of Anni Albers : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1963-1984.
author_s:
Weber, Nicholas Fox                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Danilowitz, Brenda                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Albers, Anni
imprint: Mexico City : Editorial RM ; Bethany, CT : Josef and Anni Albers Foundation, 2009.
public_note:
The introductory essay is by Nicholas Fox Weber, and the catalogue raisonné was compiled by Brenda Danilowitz. The catalogue of 102 works includes the artist's lithographs, screenprints, etchings, offset impressions, and inkless embossings.

The information comes from the works themselves, the artist's files in the archives, and published sources. The authors claim that this is the definitive reference on Albers' prints, and the numbering supercedes any previous catalogues. There are cross references to the Josef & Anni Albers Foundation, plus accession and workshop numbers from the various studios where the artist worked (Tamarind, Tyler, Gemini, etc.).

name: lbers, Josef
item_t: The Prints of Josef Albers : A Catalogue Raisonné, 1915-1976.
imprint: New York : Hudson Hills Press, in association with the Josef and Anni Albers Foundation, 2001.
public_note: A revised edition containing 13 additional prints, an introductory essay with new scholarly information, an updated bibliography and exhibition listing was published by Hudson Hills in 2009.

name: chison, Craigie
item_t: Craigie Aitchison : Prints : A Catalogue Raisonné.
public_note: The publication includes an introductory essay by the Aitchison's friend, the art critic Andrew Lambirth.  Louise Peck compiled the catalogue raisonné.

name: lbani, Francesco
item_t: Francesco Albani.
author: Puglisi, Catherine R.
imprint: New Haven, CT : Yale University Press, 1999.
public_note: The introductory texts review Albani's career and critical fortunes. The catalogue of authentic works is divided into three sections: Early Bolognese Works (1595-1601), Roman Period (1602-1617), and Second Bolognese Period (1617-1660). There also is a checklist of Albani's drawings, a list of 161 lost works, and a separate catalogue of rejected attributions.

name: ken, Doug
item_t: Doug Aitken : Sculptures 2001-2015.
author_s:
Aitken, Doug (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Bovier, Lionel (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Erickson, Steve
public_note: The catalogue is designed as an overview of the artist's three-dimensional works, and includes a text by the novelist Steve Erickson.  The publication is designed as a graphic novel, but complete information on pieces listed in the index is provided.

name: fro
item_t: Afro, tutta l'opera grafica.
author: Crispolti, Enrico
public_note: Published in conjunction with an exhibition at the Galleria d'arte moderna di Udine.

name: ertsen, Piete
item_t: The Paintings of Pieter Aertsen.
author: Buchan, Mary Braman
public_note:
Presented as the author's dissertation at New York University in 1975. The catalogue raisonné is divided into 5 categories: authentic works; works that cannot be definitively attributed to Aertsen; paintings executed with extensive studio assistance; works known through copies; and rejected attributions. 

Paintings in the first 4 categories are arranged in chronological order; false attributions are listed by location.

name: fro
item_t: Catalogo generale ragionato : dai documenti dell"Archivio Afro.

name: hrens, Carl
item_t: Carl Ahrens as Printmaker : A Catalogue Raisonné.
author: Watson, Jennifer C.
imprint: Kitchener, Ontario : The Kitchener-Waterloo Art Gallery, 1984.
public_note: Catalogueraisonné of 25 prints, published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the Kitchener-Waterloo Art Gallery.

name: dler, Karl-Heinz
item_t: Karl-Heinz Adler : Werke 1942-2018.
public_note: This is the second volume  in the series "Werkverzeichnis/ Karl-Heinz" ; Teil 2.

name: drian, Marc
item_t: Marc Adrian : Film/ Kunst/ Medien : Monografie & Werkverzeichnis = Film / Arts / Media : Monograph & Catalogue Raisonné.
author_s:
Bogner, Dieter                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Cabuk, Cornelia                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Krejci, Harald                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Moeller, Olaf                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Husslein-Arco, Agnes
imprint: Vienna : Belvedere ; Klagenfurt : Ritter Verlag, Distributor, 2016.
public_note: The catalogue lists 894 works in all media.  Each entry contains: medium, location, provenance, and comments, as well as applicable bibliographic references in a separate index.

name: dler, Karl-Heinz
item_t: Karl-Heinz Adler : Werke 1942-2010.
author_s:
Adler, Ingrid (ed.)                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Mössinger, Ingrid                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Tauscher, Sabine
public_note: Issued under the aegis of the Hochshule für bildende Künste Dresden, as #10 in the series "Phantasos".

name: dler, David A.
item_t: The Country Houses of David Adler.
public_note: Publication also includes a catalogue raisonné of the interior designs of Frances Adler Elkins.

name: dler, Jankel
item_t: Jankel Adler (1895-1949).
author: Heibel, Annemarie
imprint: Munster : Verlagshaus Monsenstein und Vannerdat OHG, 2016.
public_note: Each entry contains: title, date, subject, provenance, and comments

name: dler, Dankma
item_t: The Complete Architecture of Adler & Sullivan.
author_s:
Nickel, Richard                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Siskind, Aaron                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Vinci, John                                                            ;&nbsp
                                                            Miller, Ward
imprint: Chicago : Richard Nickel Committee : Distributed by the University of Chicago Press, 2010.
ind_entr_cont: The catalogue includes collaborative and solo projects.

name: dams, Robe
item_t: The Sculpture of Robert Adams.
author: Grieve, Alastair Ian
imprint: London : Lund Humphries in Association with the Henry Moore Foundation, 1992.
public_note: The publication includes a monographic survey of Adams' life and artistic career.  This is followed by the catalogue of sculptures, an exhibition list, and a chronology of the artist's life.

name: dams, Mark
item_t: Mark Adams : Catalogue Raisonné of Tapestries.
imprint: Palo Alto : Stanford University Libraries ; Oakland : in association with Oakland Museum of California ; Racine : Racine Art Museum; San Jose : San Jose Museum of Quilts & Textiles, 2012.
public_note: The catalogue raisonné was published in conjunction with an exhibition held at the San Jose Museum of Quilts & Textiles.  Essays focus on the artist's life and work as well as on workshops and weavers he was associated with, and insignia used on his tapestries.
